text: Family xmas dinner was spoilt by the terrible meal we had Suppose you get what you pay for but come on people I ve had better ready meals  pre fabricated food  serving staff friendly enough but a very miserable barman  cheer up fella I m giving you my hard earned money  my first time here and will be my last

Booked this place for our office Xmas lunch Prices were 16 95 for 2 courses 21 95 for 3 courses What wasn t evident when we booked is that a 10 service charge is added as well so everyone had to fork out more money than first thought I ordered the salmon for my main course and although this was tasty it came with 5 slices of chorizo and a handful baby hand size of broccoli tips Nothing else so the meal looked like a starter on the plate Other mains included a dish of fresh vegetables Based on this I wouldn t go back again as being charged almost 22 for a starter and another starter masquerading as a main course isn t something I m prepared to pay for Think this place needs to look at the menu again and offer customers a decent plate of food especially at the prices they charge Most of our group agreed that the people who had the salmon got short changed for their money Definately won t be recommending this place and won t be going back

Thought we d give it a try whilst out shopping Service was poor I ordered a ploughman s which consisted of a plate of lettuce pork pie 3 pickled onions and grated cheese No slab of local cheese no sliced ham I would suggest trying one of the other local cafes that put some effort and pride into their work

Have to say we couldn t fault the service we weren t kept waiting at all But the food was truly awful Processed chicken poor quality pasta which was sent back as there was hardly a mushroom or piece of bacon in sight and a burger and chips that must have been bought in from Tesco value range At 55 with drinks not value for money Also very noisy and every ten minutes it seemed it was someone s birthday so you get the obligatory birthday song followed by Congratulations by Cliff Cringeworthy Good place for teenagers only

Having hear many good things about this restaurant and seen good reviews on Trip Advisor I visited with colleagues Jesmond branch   We hadn t booked but were quickly seated  and then completely ignored Staff were wandering back and forth including the waiter who had seated us but nothing No attempt to see if we wanted drinks or anything  After 15 minutes we put our coats on and walked out past several members of staff who all ignored us again and went for a curry just around the corner where we had drinks in seconds and poppadoms in less than 2 minutes  Another guest at the hotel we were staying at went in as we were leaving and was served as normal though he is a regular  so it must have been us that they objected to

Went here with my wife Food was ok but only ok What really stunned us was how the management spoke to and treated their young staff They work so hard and are so friendly but the so called management seem to talk to and treat them like dirt Very uncomfortable   Needs a change in that area as so much potential

Been longing to try this restaurant for lunch for ages Welcome at reception poor Not offered drink in the bar first Taken straight table Temperature cool Warmer in the rest rooms Three tables only occupied Zero atmosphere Tiny overpriced portions of tasteless food Everything needed chilli sauce to get some kind of flavour Sommelier poor Wine bucket kept a mile away from our table Had to keep hailing Sommelier to refill our glasses Bill outrageous for what we had  225 for two people at lunchtime Left restaurant hungry and feeling ripped right off Will not return

We were looking forward to eating there The pub is great with lots of beers on offer However the menu was pretty limited and what was on the board quite expensive so we chose the burgers There were 4 of us and all agreed the quality was below par and overcooked The presentation was good But at 11 I felt ripped of I will go there again for the beers and the atmosphere but will give the food a miss

What can I say Waited 15 mins in queue to place order then waited 40 mins for food  Turned up cold Burger with two pieces lettice Chips not cooked and cold Complete waste of money Sent stinker email to Greenking You can guess no reply 40 spent on four  Will never ever return Crap food for your money Better at the Globe  And thats saying something

We had a friendly and helpful waitress however the food was of a very low quality I had the Saltimbocca Chicken which was very dry The vegetables looked and tasted like microwaved leftovers We had to give the onion rings back I am not a fussy eater so to leave anything behind is rare for me
We visited this pub earlier this evening Not impressed at all Slow service over cooked food in a cold environment Nothing more to say other than we won t be visiting this place again

Nothing  Called in at the Cool River Cafe yesterday for a breakfast Arrived at 11 10am and placed our order for a full English for 2 people  At 11 45 we asked when the food would be delivered to our table and 5 minutes later we were told that the order hadn t made it to the kitchen and that the chef was now refusing to cook breakfasts We decided to then order something from the lunch menu  Thinking that having already been made to wait 35 minutes the cafe would make an effort to get our second order to us quickly we finally gave up at 12 10pm when there was no sign of our food arriving  We did have a coffee and it was OK not breathtakingly good or bad The cafe seems to be ok at serving cakes and drinks but hot food seems to be an issue In our hour sat there we saw other people get up to leave having either not been served or having waited too long for their order  I m not sure if it was a bad day for the establishment but I won t be going back to find out if it was  Very disappointing
I popped in on way back home after work There place had no redeeming features The food and staff were slightly below average Sorry

On holiday with family and asked a local in our hotel where was a good place to go for a cheapish basic meal He recommended The Bowling Green  wish I d checked TripAdvisor like I normally do before deciding to go anywhere - I d say the recent reviews are probably accurate When we arrived things didnt look good lots of tables uncleared one table full of dirty glasses that staff hadnt got round to sorting customers including me waiting at the counter to be served I ordered our drinks and then asked for 2 carverys time was 18 30 i was told there was no meat remaining the only food available to us was battered fish shepherds pie or a balti pie It was past my 15 month old daughters tea time and since she was getting upset felt we couldn t now go elsewhere Both pies were on the carvery counter they looked dried up I should have refused them and asked for my money back the vegetables from the carvery section also were dried up or practically gone I had the last chips with people behind me with fish now needing chips but none for them There were a number of people complaining formally and informally I have to say the food was a bad as it looked   only paid 12 for the food and drinks but it wasn t even worth that Our soft drinks in pint glasses were even about 20mm from full I wouldn t return here for a free meal one of the worst meals I ve ever had

Rude Waitresses that don t know food or wine  Chefs that cannot cook How can you ruin a steak they can  Ludicrous west end like prices  A bit like Fawlty Towers in Honor Oak Go along and watch the shambles

The restaurant at the hotel advertises lunch etc  so we took our family there over Easter Monday we were told to be out of the place by 5 because they had a big party however the waitress was soon explaining that lots of food had run out and more amazing was that they had no bottle beer the service was bad slow and always forgetting items so much so that they took 30 off the bill we waiting some 1 and half hours for the first course and spent some 2 hours more eating or waiting a great pity since the location is great but the service and supply of essentials is miserably lacking

We were attending an event in Walsall and noticed Table Table was only a mile from our hotel We downloaded a menu and it looked quite exciting We arrived and ordered and our excitement went rapidly downhill The chicken ham and mushroom pie looked impressive but was literally full of hot air very little filling and don t order mash with it you will only get a sliver The lasagne looked nice and tasted good but was only about half an inch thick Our fourth member ordered salmon but it was very dry The meal wasn t cheap 55 for 4 including a drink each but it was the portions which was surprising and I don t think it was just me it looked pretty quiet for a Saturday evening

Upon first entering the venue I should known straight away this wasn t going to be the experience I hoped for in a picturesque place of Lacock As we looked for a table we were greeted  I mean shouted at by a man who I assume from other reviews is the manager of the pub He informed us that as we were a party of 3 2 adults and a 3 year old  we could not sit at a square table out the front for 4 people Never have I heard this before  and therefore we would have to go out to the back on a small round table where flies were abundant Personally I do think they want children to be in the venue even though they offer a children s menu  Anyway after taking up his generous offer of the table out the back little one was very hungry  we ordered food after a mere 50 minute wait we were bought over some average food but to be honest we were so hungry we didn t care  Personally I don t think they can handle busy periods and multiple food order  Finally to tick all the boxes they got our bill incorrect and added another tables food order to our order  Sigh   To be honest this is the first negative review i have made on trip-advisor however we were appalled at this man s customer service skills  Not just to us but to anyone coming into the venue  short answers refusal to serve food due to number of people in the party along with his tone of voice  However I must confirm that the waitresses who work at the venue are very pleasant Overall the upshot is terrible place and will never return which is a shame as it could be a lovely place
Christmas Day lunch Taken to table 35mins after booking time Previous party s mess under table Food was very poor  How do you eat sorbet with a fork No staff What a waste of money

We came to Bella Italia needing a late lunch and we had been a few years back and it had been acceptable The menu looked so good My chose a spaghetti with prawns and a pot of mint tea and she said it was OK and the portion of prawns was generous But we asked for some breads to go with our meal with an Olive Oil Balsamic vinegar bowl and this turned up at once rather than with our main courses To our horror the Olive oil and Balsamico would not combine - all we got was the taste of Olive Oil For my meal I chose a Lamb dish with pasta choosing to have a spiralised vegetable serving which they offered instead of having the pasta It was disgusting The vegetable combination was fine but it was served in a thin sauce and there were no pieces of lamb at all only a few tiny shred of minced lamb To make matters worse I had ordered a glass of the house wine and would you believe it they told me that they were sold out at only 2 30pm  of the house wine From my wife s perspective it was just Ok but from mine it was awful - I don t understand how this place remains in business it used to be very acceptable

This used to be a well managed operation with good food and service     I would recommend NOT going to this restaurant unless you don t mind paying high prices receiving at best Luke warm average food together with service that is pretty much non existent  It takes a lot for me to write and complain but this place needs completely new management

Lovely friendly waitress willing to help with accessabilty problems Food ordered was delivered incorrect tried a second time food arrived wrong again and skewers were cold Toilets were dirty Customers were packed in like sardines Give this place a miss

Have been on a diet and was looking forward to my cheat day after a 50mile bike ride but the reality between what I was hoping for and what we received was so far apart   We went for the sharing tray at 40 there was no onion rings clearly they buy them in frozen as how there is many supermarket around to buy more instead we could have some extra fries there was more fries than meat  The pulled pork was cold dry and very poor The beef brisket was the only thing that was good the ribs were dry overlooked and Luke warm and the chicken was so dry couldn t eat it The mac n cheese was nice and hot  But I went to grill stock for some bbq meats and was sadly left disappointed  I would never return and never recommend with the grill stock festival I Bristol this weekend maybe they should pay more attention to the food they actually serve in the restaurants that are living off the name

Late night stop for a coffee soya cappuccino and a regular cappuccino and whilst being served by Brice who was really nice we asked if there was anything to eat which was wheat and gluten free as my wife hadn t eaten and has coeliac disease I ve unable to eat wheat or gluten containing foods Over the shoulder of Brice the gentleman who was preparing the coffee said that wheat and gluten free are not our core customers thereby immediately excluding my wife as a customer and certainly showing a very interesting form of disrespect and prejudice against her condition As it was we then declined whatever foods were on offer and took the coffee with the gentleman barista exclaiming it must be my English you didn t understand     heck no we understood perfectly and I was of a mind to ditch your coffee too and go to Starbucks opposite Time for the fast food outlets to realise they have multiple sources of customer and I for one will now be advising people to choose other than Pret A Manger I am disappointed and disgusted at this lack of interest in a section of the community I shall be contacting Clive Schlee the CEO when I have the opportunity on Monday The coffee was OK no great shakes and the service by Brice was perfect and very friendly   his colleague the barista gentleman was a total waste of space Last chance Pret A Manger and you lost

Popped in a short while ago with friends we often do being very local and very regular Today there was ten of us and we had with us our cocker spaniel also a frequent visitor to the pub He s with us for drinks and he s with us when we order food one of the family  So I was very disappointed when I was told upon arrival that we couldn t have the dog on the carpeted area this being most of the bar So our daughter returned home with our dog who incidentally is a highly trained and extremely obedient gun dog  Imagine our disgust when not five minutes later a party was shown to their table with a dog Seated at their table on the carpeted area  What s going on White Horse One rule for the regulars that have spent many hundreds of pounds with you held functions and parties there and one rule for the others Shame really we ve put up with the increasing prices and diminishing service poor quality frozen re-heats and the reductions in portion sizes  But this for us was the final straw the friendship of Derek and some staff can now no longer outweigh all the failings  Thanks and goodbye

The staff are in serious need of customer service course the food needs to be cooked properly and the tables cleaned a little more often  It took 50mins for them to serve up a burger a gammon steak and two pies At one point the waitress brought the dessert menus over cos she thought we d already had our food  It wasn t like they were rushed off their feet   This place badly lets down a chain of restaurants that is usually very good  Normally I would have complained but - I just couldn t be bothered Just paid up and left In fact I suspect that if we had just got up and walked out without paying we d have been twenty minutes down the road before anyone noticed  Seriously - don t

I am trying again tonight  I have had to leave on 4 previous visits due to non-availability  I am trying to make a go of this with a family that support the harvester on a weekly event supporting the North London branch  have found it may come to an end  I have a 17 month old child and Wife that have been even offered by the manager let s call her Mrs C for protection of her rights has promised us that we will be fast tracked on our next visit due to the past inconvenienced visits so I will give them a try tonight at 6 30 hoping they will be free I have been told I will get a seat as they don t normally reserve seats Except on Mon  Thur So let s get the inspection report out and let you all know what the outcome is
The last 4 reviews can t be wrong and they re not It s so tacky in this place and the food is offensively average Avoid

I visited the Cunning Man with 6 members of my family to celebrate my daughter s birthday She booked a table for 5 30 pm as we had 2 young grandsons with us and did not leave the restaurant until after 8 00 pm Far too long for a 2 course meal with 1 round of drinks Twice our son-in-law had to take his 4 year old for a walk as he was getting restless We were kept waiting when we arrived before being shown to our table we had to wait to place our drinks order which then took some time to arrive We were then approached by a waiter who said he was looking after us we placed our food order and then informed there would be a 30 minute wait this was probably more like 40 minutes The food to be fair was not too bad although the vegetables could have been warmer The waiter asked if we wanted to see the dessert menu but in such a way that he did not really want us to we had already decided that we would forego a starter in favour of a dessert so we did order It probably took another 30 minutes for our desserts to arrive and when they did the custard on 3 of them was cold with a thick skin on top The staff did not appear to be enjoying their work and some were quite rude The manager was going around in a panic trying to pacify what appeared to be quite a few disgruntled customers I actually overheard him say to one couple as he sat them down not to judge the Cunning Man on tonight as there was a new menu which meant everything had to be cooked from fresh and they were struggling to keep up I can only judge from my experience on the night and will not be returning By the time we left people were leaving due to the number of items unavailable To top everything off the waiter tried to overcharge me on my debit card when I pointed out that the amount was different to that shown on the bill he apologised and said he must have input the wrong number

This pub has got another TripAdvisor page as Branocs Tree This review is just a copy of the one I left under Branocs  Just been to new Branocs Hungry Horse  What a disaster Food took almost an hour to arrive we were told maximum 40 minutes wait when we ordered at the bar When we got our food chips were cold roast potatoes cold my dad s steak was supposed to be medium and was so well done he couldn t cut it We complained and was waiting another 15 minutes for replacement Bar prices very steep have been to few hungry horses is Essex and Braintree was so expensive - more than 50p per pint of lager Apart from one in Rochford we were there last summer and found staff rude we always love visiting hungry horses we always eat in Laindon and sometimes in Harlow food is always within 30 minutes on Sundays and staff are so nice and helpful Don t expect it in Branocs We were sitting next to the kitchen on the booth and all we could hear was staff complaining about each other and manager Geoff Apparently another manager Lee is on holidays and Geoff guy cannot run pub at all without the other one Apparently staff cannot believe that Geoff still have a job because all he does when he works is stand in kitchen and is afraid of serving customers That s not something that you want to hear from staff when u waiting for your food Found whole visit very poor The only good point was lovely decor of the pub we wish our local in Laindon looked like that
Very very expensive For quality of food Potato skins tasteless Oven chips says it all Pudding Tesco do better

This pub should be the busiest pub in Bexley it s in a gorgeous old building in a park full of families but no The staff are rude and lok like they haven t changed in a week none of the 3 real ales were available and half of the lagers and the Guinness were out too and they only had 1 available wine choice on a Saturday afternoon in addition to that the amount of people sending their food back for being wrong or inedible was shocking and I chose not to order the place is a disgrace to the chain that owns it
meal for 1 quarter of pizza had topping stone cold and staff said it happens sometimes Will never return to this sub standard hut

Seems all ok from outside but do not be deceived Food cold food old food is simply poison You will I repeat want will get food poisoned Drinks well overpriced Staff pretend to be nice until you don t want to pay for the rubbish you have eaten Please stay away if you love the people you are with

To start off with the good reviews must be from those drinking in the working and club down the street as you would have to be drunk to eat at Red luck It s never been the best looking place and the food is so discussing over cooked burnt really heated ribs very bland food As for to separate things and they put them together I ve lived in the area for 10 yrs and I ve never seen or had a bad discus tic Chinese than I and my family have had from Red Luck

The below info was submitted via there contact details on there website  Although I did specify I don t expect a reply  they really didn t reply Is this arrogance or just ignorance I certainly will not be visiting here again and such a shame as this place used to be terrific and the village is brilliant  Lack lustre is what I would regard my experience today And my mother in laws birthday experience at the spotted cow can what only be described as cringeworthy  Waiting time to be seated AFTER time booked was 30 mins Soft drinks flat and poured from a plastic bottle Drink served in various odd types of an array of glasses More fat than meat on the carvers selection My meal from from the menu arrived 40mins AFTER my family had eaten My meal was under cooked and very very sub standard No check backs No cutlery provided and had to ask twice once food had arrived We were told deserts would be ten minutes when we had to order our own from the bar because we were sick and tired of waiting 30 minutes later deserts came undercooked cold and apples were hard with no pastry Once we returned them the second lot came out of replacement but again no cutlery provided No check backs AGAIN Toilets were a disgrace and I dont even expect a nightclub to be in that kind of order let alone a family pub Serious health and safety risk here No children changing area at all apart from a seat and when we informed with some feedback of this all we got was  ok  You had four children all of around 1-3 years old in the pub whilst our visit No real figure s of authority and seemed very disorganised through out the whole area  I m sorry that it has come to an email like this and I m not expecting any kind of response but me and my wife family have eaten at the spotted cow on numerous occasions and its been generally ok especially for me being a vegetarian However today was nothing but lack lustre and was such a shame We simply were given the back seat treatment  It looks like the spotted cow needs some love and attention with a dash of passion of service to the consumer and to the pub itself  I hope your able to take my feedback with an open mind and through the eyes of the consumer as I really don t expect the above at somewhere like your pub and I wouldn t anywhere even a Toby carvery which you would probably find
the food is nothing like that served by the original Wetherby Whaler  In Whetherby surprisingly  It was so bad we left the food

In preparation for a concert at the Echo Arena on Saturday 10th December we booked a table at 10 00am online for 4 people at 6 00pm the same day The booking app worked perfectly and we received a confirmation number in seconds  We arrived at the restaurant at 5 25 35 mins AHEAD of table reservation  checked in with the front desk and were directed towards the very small bar area  The restaurant was very busy and also had a ridiculously and intrusively loud wedding in their upstairs function area You couldn t hear yourself think it was so loud  At 5 55 I went to the front desk and they gave me one of those flashing bleepers that alerts you that your table is ready  At 6 10pm I asked the front desk if my bleeper was functioning or not I was told that it was and 2 minutes and your table is ready  At 6 20pm I reapproached the same front desk and asked the same question and was given the same answer  At 6 30 I handed the bleeper back to the front desk and stated that we were disappointed and that we had to leave as we had a concert to attend and no longer had sufficient time to enjoy a restaurant meal  The managaress kindly offered us complimentary drinks at the bar after your concert  We could only reply that we really wanted eastZeast food not complimentary drinks at the bar  You d think that having booked a table and had it acknowledged & confirmed 6 hours in advance AND having turned up 35 mins in advance AND having attended the front desk ahead of time due that we would have had the chance to eat but not so hence the headline utter shambles  Cannot judge the food Only wish we could

We arrived around 4pm pub was relatively quiet and initial service pleasant and efficient We ordered two beef and one chicken roast dinners plus one risotto  which I have to say was ok  Food was served within a reasonable time however the beef on both dinners was really tough chicken was edible but the accompanying roast potatoes on all the plates were overcooked mash was lumpy and vegetables tasteless We were just about to complain about the beef when one of the staff came over to ask if everything was fine He was informed about the beef to which he said he would go and speak to the chef We assume he did but never came back to report anything to us By this time our three roast dinners were somewhat cold and very unappetising and most of the food was left on the plates and when the waitress came to clear she asked if we were satisfied Same story NO beef tough and inedible will tell chef no feedback from her  We decided not to have a sweet or any further drinks At the counter we asked for the bill and whether there would be any reduction for the poor quality of the beef The member of staff who took the first complaint was called and a discussion followed again I will ask the chef the answer was no chef had said that the beef was perfectly edible We paid the bill left our email address and phone number asked that the manager call us to register our complaint and left very unhappy  Tuesday 29th November I received a call from a person stating to be the manager I explained what had happened following which the person said that she would need to investigate with the staff members concerned and that she would call me back the following day I AM STILL AWAITING THAT CALL  Sadly we did not check trip advisor prior to going to the Cross Keys if we had we probable would not have gone It is difficult to judge reviews as everyone can have differing expectations of food quality I would have to say having experienced the poor quality of food lack of customer service and a manager who cannot manage a chef who seemingly is incapable of delivering basic dishes warm and edible that TERRIBLE is the only review I can give this establishment You have been warned

Went to this buffet with my girlfriend on the jubilee weekend thinking it might be a nice place to go having looked on their website I was wrong The food was awful and boardering unedable All of it was luke warm dry and completely tasteless with very little variety of dishes thaty didnt even go together There was loud dance music blasting your ear drums out which made it like trying to eat in a night club The waitresses were young but pleasant but the older woman behind the bar the manager i assume was abrupt and quite rude Overall this was by far the worst food i have ever had from a restuarant and would never even contemplate going back Where some of these people who have left good reviews have been eating i dont know but it couldnt of been here Given the luke warm temperatures of the food and questionable cleanliness of the venue i would have to say food poisoning is certainly possible If you eat here good luck

Waitresses we re friendly food was pretty bad Portions are not as described and prices are more than double what is expect to pay for the quality and portion sizes Two starters two mains 3 cokes 61 Got 50 off food as we were unhappy still 40 Had better food at pubs
If you want to taste poor food and service in an intimidating environment then this is the place for you

Tried to enjoy the annual Black Bull FREE music festival again this year but the only choice of real beer on tap was Hobgoblin 4 5 ABV  served in a Greene King IPA glass and even that had run out by the time I returned at 9 00pm OK I KNOW this wasn t a beer festival but come on is this a pub or what Even before I bought a drink I was asked to contribute my hard-earned as a donation to the acts I hadn t even seen yet - go figure

Well where to start To be honest I wouldn t bother visiting for dinner Table for 15 and we were placed in two tables not a great start as the upstairs restaurant was hardly busy Staff were nonchalant not really on task and this was reflected by drinks and courses arriving 15mins difference between our two tables This is a modern restaurant yet it was smokey from the kitchen yet it had ventilation system in place necessitating the windows to be opened to clear and then subjecting us to cold winds  Starters were acceptable Main courses were poor and very poor well done venison was bleeding blue fish was cold steaks were cold Fortunately we couldn t comment on the desserts they did appear quite appetising but as we left after the main choice then that is for some else to review

Waited half an hour for a table which we didn t mind We ordered our food and unfortunately we were sat by the service area where the food was prepared We waited for over an hour and no main course appeared we ended up leaving which i was glad we did as we had the misfortune as to see them plate the food No gloves used when plating the food
Staff were arrogant food was disgusting watery sauce and not cheap the food was tasteless and cold I would never eat here again

Have been eating out in and around SE London for quite some time There used to be a number of good Indian restaurants in Greenwich however now there is only the Mogul left in the centre  We ve been here a few times over the years and has only got worse  Downstairs is quite nice as a cellar restaurant good atmosphere The food is ok good however their chefs can t cook anything that isn t on the menu Most places can and often encourage it here it s a straight no That isn t a huge issue  However since we last went some months ago they ve put their prices up Again not by a lot and not a big issue  At the end of the meal we was given the bill when asked However we d noticed that there were no hot towels When asked the waiter said the owner had got rid of them to save money So the prices have gone up and now a small thing such as towels are removed To wash up after your meal you have to climb three sets of stairs to get to the WC Not ideal  With the bill also was served a few murray mints when we jokingly said where are the chocolates have they been cut too the waiter could only shrug  I don t mind prices going up and the menu being strict However when they cut other things that you d come to expect to save a few pennies per meal it really is a joke  We ve said we wouldn t go back last time we went there but some how managed to end up back there This time its a definite will never go back
Arrogant waiters who were completely disinterested in our table of 6 The Food was cold and tasteless

I assume that the Brasserie Blanc is part of a chain of restaurants so will be inevitably be restricted by blanket unmovable policies I had an awful meal at this restaurant and my five other friends said that it was only just passable I am a vegetarian and the choice of food was limited The waitress said that it was not possible to alter the meals in any way nor have a mix and match combination She declined my request to speak to a Manager to discuss my options on the grounds that they were far too busy So in the interests of politeness I just shut up and said no more My food was simply awful and I had no redress at all I would never set foot in a Raymond Blanc establishment again under any circumstances The carnivores in out group had a slightly better selection but none of us would go back   Clearly training for staff in good customer relations should be a priority for this restaurant  but then I would urge anyone who wants a special meal to look elsewhere in Cheltenham for a better culinary experience

Fantastic location good premises this should be the best pub in the area Visited recently after long absence and unfortunately it is being let down by bad or non existent management bar staff try hard enough but are slow and can t remember who s turn is next food orders taken but long waits real ale all tasted like brown bath water  it looked like every glass and plate used that day was still on the tables with food & mess everywhere Things not helped by agressive and offensive punters by the door scaring off normal folks One day someone will turn this place round and make a fortune but don t hold yer breath

I visited Young s for a takeaway after having pleasant meals from there in the past  Unfortunately the standard has dropped dramatically My wife ordered what was her favourite BBQ spare ribs and chips whilst i ordered jumbo battered sausage and chips  The spare ribs were laughable Extremely overcooked whatever little meat was on them my wife had one rib and decided that it was pointless to even try to eat the rest  My evening was then spent throwing up being sick from the sausage It was either out of date or undercooked  Very disappointing as this place used to be very good We will be ordering from another Chinese in future  If i could give this zero stars i would

Went to Hussains again after a very bad curry years ago Still the same had chicken tikka balti only had four very small pieces of chicken bland taste and very expensive for what you get if you want a proper balti spark hill is the only place I will never eat in Hussains again going to the toilet also an experience

There are two Beehive Pubs in the city-centre of Liverpool This one in Paradise Street and the other one on Mount Pleasant I can t help thinking that some many of the reviews on here are mistaken for the other establishment especially the more positive submissions Before the Liverpool One shopping complex was built this pub served mainly the local-regulars Scousers  Since L1 arrived things changed considerably Prices sky-rocketed and the quality of the beer descended The pint of lager I had in there recently was probably one of the most expensive served in a Liverpool pub and of the poorest quality It is obvious that most customers are now not of the area are tourists and this is the client-base that the pub now seemingly wishes to exploit  I was dumbfounded to see they had a kitchenette serving food  but with toilets that were in an extremely poor state sodden and dirty - surely there must be a hygiene certification issue here

we went for our firms christmas do so over crowded over booked we was seated in the extention area which was freezing cold  the food was poor quailty and badly cooked served on all odds and sods of crockery and cutlery the music was so loud you could not hear the person sitting next to you  All in all a terrible evening avoid at all costs if you want a pleasant evening unless your a youngster that likes head banging noise all night

Despite a cheerful waitress who managed to seat us the experience lacked any credible value for most of the food It was well overpriced by far and represented very poor value for the cost such as 11 95 for the roast  6 50 for a one piece of toast pate The fish platter was reasonable at 10 95 but 6 chips in a cup at 3 50 was also a rip-off Apart from being overcharged by a spurious 1 40 the Sunday wait of more than an hour between starter and main course was a poor do Laycock needs to offer acceptable standards of value against cost Other establishments in poorer parts of the country do far better so it can be done It s unfortunate that such an experience always catches the tourist in this case would not return

Went to bills on Monday for the first time after hearing many good things We were told as we approached the table that there was no fish at all as the delivery wasn t turning up until the afternoon With a tescos right next door I would have thought an emergency shop would have been plausible- especially as the lack of fish left the set menu with only chicken skewers or a veg option unless you were happy to pay a 5 supplement for a steak  Service was very rushed- the girl tries to run off when serving drinks despite us wanting to order we had to ask her to come back The food we had was good which was just as well as no-one came to ask how it was The experience was topped off with a 10 service charge added onto the bill- for what service We also thought it was strange that there no Xmas decorations December 1st  although the decor itself is nice

My lunch last Saturday in The Gardeners Arms - Ardingly was terrible We both ordered the Steak and Ale pie and when it arrived it was pretty obvious that the pastry was overcooked It made a sound like an over-tightened drum when I tapped it with fork After several attempts I eventually penetrated the pastry which reminded me of chiselled pieces of sandstone I did try a small piece of pie which nearly broke my tooth  The replacement chicken salad consisted of six small pieces of processed chicken divided between the two plates Everything mostly lettuce leaves was drowning in mayo Never again

Visited this bar last night after a nice meal in Chelsea I have to be honest I have never experienced such rudeness & bad service Ordered two drinks at bar with female bar member not rocket science JD & coke vodka soda & slice of lime Instead of soda we got lemonade no big deal you would think Took drink back to bar to get changed only to be met with refusal to change drink and the comment if you had asked for soda I would have served soda bar staff turned her back on me & refused to acknowledge me At this point I had to speak to a further two members of staff to speak to the manager when he had time looked at me in disgust tasted the drink changed it but did not say one word to me - talk about great service Avoid at all costs

We are totally disgusted with our Christmas dinner and we will not be going back ever again My mother who is now 76 years old was so much looking forward to the meal However the whole experience was diabolical  Below are our complaints  Not given the table we requested when ordering in September Instead the five of us were squeezed onto two small tables pushed together  Everything tasted bland Vegetables not cooked and were hard Food was barely warm No difference between boiled and roast potatoes Some roast potatoes were the size of a nut burnt to a crisp Turkey was watery Gravy was watery Christmas pudding was the size of a desert spoon and cooked in the microwave Not enough portions small amount of custard was used instead of brandy sauce Coffee was half filled in cups Waiting 20 minutes between meals  It wasn t only the food that was very bad but the whole festive atmosphere was non existent with two distracting TVs hardly any decorations and we couldn t see a Christmas tree Before going we envisaged a lovely atmosphere with carols in the background We all left behind Christmas cards with free offers to entice us back again We wouldn t go back if it was free This cost us 250 and it was nothing but a ruined heart breaking Christmas day
Tried to order home delivery twice and had order declined both times Delivery is advertised in my area 0 out of 10 for customer service Will not be using again

Have been to Bills in both Worcester and Leamington Spa - and that is the last time I shall use them  Visited the Leamington Spa branch a few months ago and there were issues - a medium steak sent back because it was very rare nothing worse than eating your re-served dinner when everyone else has finished - and the toilets absolutely stank Must admit that they did take the cost of the steak of the bill Have just revisited Bills in Leam Spa expecting the toilet smell to be resolved - but it wasn t  Also whilst the food service and d€÷cor were very good what I failed to notice until this morning whilst checking my receipts was that a 10 service charge was added to my bill I honestly never check my bill - something I will not fail to do so in the future - but I would expect to be informed of this and not just by the small print on the bill  To make it worse I also leave a tip when I get good service as found here  Just checked the menu etc on their website and there is no mention of this service charge  To summarise - don t go to Bills because the toilets stink and there is an underhand 10 service charge

First of all the guy on the till taking the orders Kelly according to the receipt needs to learn how to crack a smile Service can only be described as slow A couple of burgers and a jacket potato shouldn t take 35 minutes to arrive And you shouldn t have to chase up your cutlery and when they deliver it they need to learn how to count  They managed to mess up the burgers putting both ordered extras on one of them instead of one on each The waitress did sort that out effectively though  Burger was Angus beef Nice flavour but dry and chewy At a guess I d say the cow had just walked all the way from Aberdeen come to think of it that may explain the delay in it arriving too  Coleslaw was dry and tasteless  The missus did enjoy her jacket potato so not a total disaster but a cafe at a popular tourist attraction like this needs to be able to do better than baking an ok potato

Had a chicken curry and fried rice Curry was very bland and fairly tasteless with a stodgy rice expected something better for the money I paid to be honest If I hadn t had so far to walk I would have taken it back

Although there were plenty of available tables we were told to sit in the corridor as a previous reviewer also stated  Miraculously when we challenged them a table was instantly found  The bar staff were nice enough However the famous carvery was atrocious What appeared to be bought in pre-carved meat was cold The limited vegetables were dry and tasteless The gravy was like dishwater The roast potatoes were over cooked and no mash We have eaten the length and breadth of the country but by far this was our worst culinary experience Maybe we should have inspected the food before ordering our carvery This is the first poor review I ve been compelled to write The Ship looks great from the outside but we will not be returning

Bland food Sausage and mash-sausage seemed meat free just seemed to be cereal based Mash tasted like Smash When I complained they said the sausages are bog standard  mmm nice why sell em then and we re having problems finding a good butcher -really Lots of them around They also claimed that the mash was made with butter and cream Well could have been Smash made with butter and cream to disguise the Smash My wife s quiche was ok but the salad was puny and undressed We only ate the meals because we were hungry  The guest beer was ok but we won t be back

A terrible place to eat but this seems to apply to all Pizza Hut resaurants lately The pizzas are truly bad and not worth the money the service is verging on the non-existant on two seperate visits at least one person in our party didn t get any food at all Steer well clear

Every now and again even the reliable let you down Yo Sushi is pretty much a given for quality and cleanliness no matter where you find one the cuisine may be an acquired taste for some but my partner and I always find it the near perfect stop off for lunches So on finding one very far below what can be expected from this chain restaurant makes the disappointment even harder to take On a lovely Sunday trip to the beautiful city of Oxford we had planned to meet a friend in Yo Sushi for lunch and after an early start to the day we arrived as planned at midday Shown our table swiftly and by a smiling staff member all at first seemed well it did not last Problem one a strange smell throughout the restaurant and not the pleasant aromas of food either It was not a cleaning material smell nor was it a toilet smell but it was very unpleasant and always in the background We chatted and decided on our hot orders and helped ourselves to a couple of dishes from the belt and fairly soon my first and then my second hot dish arrived not till had finished mine and for some time after did my partner s arrive then she had finished hrs long before our friends arrived There is nothing worse than going out to dinner with friends and all eating alone Then came another disappointment the food was bland bordering on tasteless I adore the Beef an Garlic Teriyaki at least I did no slight crunch t the bite and no hint of spice and it was the same for all our dishes nothing it seemed was up to the normal Yo Sushi standard And all the time we ate chefs appeared alongside our table and yelled orders at the tops of their voices annoying to say the least hard to hold a conversation and totally spoiling what little atmosphere there was in this store We had only been there half and hour or so and yet when I went to the gents there was no toilet paper similar was reported by my partner when she returned from a visit to the ladies where she discovered only a couple of squares left  The biggest shock though was the disgusting sink alongside where we sat this is where they cleared the dishes to after customers had eaten and at times dirty bowls were piled high I was then glad I had not ordered wine as I watched in horror as our waitress picked u a J-Cloth from the back of the sink and used it to wipe out four wine glasses I thought maybe that she was just going to wipe out there residue from used glasses before transferring them to the wash-up area But then she poured wine into them after being wiped with the dish rag in an area right alongside the sink full of cleared bowls Those wines were then delivered to unsuspecting customers Disgusting does not even come close to describing this practice Enough was enough and we pressed the button to call a staff member so we could pay our bill we waited stood put on our coats cleared it and pressed the button two more times Staff looked as if they were heading to us but then put more bowls in the sink and ignored us Seven times we pressed the button it took longer to get our bill than it di to get our food and we had to wait for that to be served I was very close to walking out without paying I became so fed up with waiting On complaining to the manager I was told  It s Sunday We are busy  It was as if they had opened unprepared for a busy day of service on a weekend This did nothing to relieve my disappointment but he did knock our tap water off the bill very generous Yo Sushi Oxford sort yourselves out

Ordered a delivery when it arrived order was wrong the girl on the phone was just pure rude also ordered a chicken shish and salad and I bet there was not even a full chicken brest and that was 6 rip off

We had just been to the science museum and decided to walk down to South Kensington to get a drink we were lured in by the best bar awards plastered all over the outside of this pub Don t be fooled I do not know how these awards were achieved For 11 a cocktail you would expect fresh fruit and actually be able to taste the alcohol even at that it would be expensive I m pretty sure the bar man poured a fruit shoot into my thimble sized glass   horrible and sickly Will not be returning

Went here for some food after the pictures and how sorry we were Greeted by staff who just didn t want to be there at all We waited about 40 minutes for food that when it came I wish they had turned the dial on the microwave down just one notch  I could see the chef in the kitchen ripping open the packets of the food to serve up to people Tasted awful Only saving grace was that I found a voucher online whilst sitting WAITING for my food which knocked 2 3 off the bill

Cheap - yes cheerful - not really quality - nope  This place is awful which is probably why you have to pay in cash before you see their offerings Whilst I ve been to cheap buffet all-you-can-eat style Chinese restaurants in the past they tend to offer something that will pass as food  Tepid dishwater soup that looks like it has been there for a week tasteless watered down sauces and battered thingies with more batter than thingy This has been done as cheap as possible compromising at every opportunity  I can only imagine that this place stays open through footfall from the train station rather than repeat custom as I can t believe anyone would return

Hadn t tried this restaurant before so went there today for lunch Arrived at 1215 to find outer door locked Went in via hotel reception only to be told that the restaurant was closed due to a heavy morning and people coming in late for breakfast  That is really not an acceptable excuse for an hotel We did not have time to wait around so went elsewhere

Food was very slow to come out when it did it was awful the mushrooms were swimming in juice but somehow were really chewy Sausages cremated the Bacon was extremely salty we were thirsty for hours  plates dirty a lady in front of me had to sort through 10 plates before finding one close enough to clean and had to use a napkin to clean it further  so as not to give a totally negative review the Yorkshire pudding was nice and crispy as advertised and the staff were polite and helpful

We were not allowed in to this establishment on a Wednesday evening because we were a party of 8 They were not full We had been for an excellent meal at Dejavu in Kendal and wanted a drink before setting off home We ended up in Ruskins bar where we had an excellent time They had an open mic night and the performers sang Happy Birthday and then improvised a personal song for our Birthday girl  Subsequently found out that my son and his wife and child had not been allowed in on a previous occasion Seems to be a very limited demographic Paloma s are after

As a family of 4 we decided to have a long walk around the stunning Woburn grounds and then head for some tea and cake afterwards We walked into this small and dated tea room and were placed in a corner table We had no menus and had to rummage around to find some There were electronic service buttons on the tables but they were obviously broken as we pressed them during our long wait for someone to come and serve us After about 10 mins a group of people came in and had the same unfriendly welcome that we had At this point we decided to move on What really annoyed me was the opening text in the menu that talked about the amazing atmosphere What a load of rubbish Woburn needs a normally priced tea room but this is not it

I went here with my girlfriend for tea and coffee As I stood at the bar I could see people getting alcohol to my left and hot drinks to the right I chose the que the the right The Irishman making the drinks had his back to me for 15 minuets He then turned round and shouted 4 cappuccinos to which I asked if I could place my order He replied I don t take the orders you need to go to the bar and join the line behind this lot With an attitude like this I m amazed Weatherspoons let this man loose with hot water because he is incapable of working a till or customer services Get rid of him

My wife and I popped in here last for a quick pizza for lunch but were sorry we did there were only an handful of people eating there so I would have expected a good service but we didn t get it The waiter appeared to be in a hurry and gave the impression that he was annoyed when we didn t order a starter We waited a while before our pizzas arrived and when they did they were burnt We didn t even bother to complain mostly because the waiter did his best to avoid us and also because we didn t have time to wait another 15 20 mins for another pizza Surely the person making the pizza should check them before they are served - not a difficult thing to do This is the first time I have left a restaurant without leaving a tip I have eaten here before when it was full without any issue

one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to The meat from the kebab is so fatty I ended up throwing it away Even the condiments added with it were disgusting Ended up going to woodys grill in acton instead and threw this rubbish away Oily and raw at the same time I kept on hearing a microwave ping sound and the staff were arguing
Ordered fish chips and peas Peas came in a thimble size container Fish portion not very big or nice chips were good but very few Not value for money
Dirty Rundown Poor Expensive Food Don t go ever it was so bad Greasy Burnt Poor Quality Food Bread was older than the wine it really was so stale it was unedable

1 We ordered a set meal for 3 but received the same food as the table next to us who had a set meal for 2 - effectively we gave 13 for nothing 2 The waiters was literally taking our plates away as we finished - he later told us we had to leave we were only there for just over 30 minutes  3 He later insisted on a 6 service charge and again ordered us to leave The bill was non itemised so some people may ending up tipping twice The food was good and the manager agreed eventually to give us our service charge back We still paid 45+ for a very disappointing experience

I loved the 1980 s and last night I revisited it by eating at this place It s been many years since I ve eaten Indian food that s so bad To name just a few things NO TANDORI NO MIXED GRILL NO BOMBAY POTATO NO EGG FRIED RICE NO SHASHLICK NO CLAY OVEN NO KEEMA RICE OR NAAN NO DRAUGHT BEERS in fact I don t believe this was a real restaurant All food served on mismatched plates no service ware or skillets not even a plate for the naan s Just served together so we didn t know which was which on an old dirty straw mat covered with a towel someone call health and safety lol I could go on but in fairness it was so awful we actually had a good time we ended up laughing so much at how awful it was it made the night quite a experience So in all not sure where all there gleeming reviews come from Maybe themselves But if your enjoy authentic Indian cuisine this is not the place to go As one positive the service staff were very nice

I took a client there for a bite to eat at lunch time waited 10 minutes in single file at the bar & eventually ordered burgers with salad Waited another 45 minutes no food asked at the bar and was told it was just being plated up  Food turned up minutes later still The burgers were cold & stiff and looked as if they had been cooked the day before Late back to work Go somewhere else

The food was truly awful and while the waiting staff were concerned the manager didn t care at all The pizza was cold the prawns and mussels were tiny frozen and tasteless The linguini was very average Avoid this place Complete waste of money

From the claims made for it on its website I was expecting a good dining experience at Brasserie 103 but came away really disappointed The place lacks the sophistication claimed for it it noisy to the extent that conversation is nigh impossible and the service is desperately poor We waited 45 minutes for the starters and another 50 minutes for the main courses and the serving staff showed no interest in us or as to whether we enjoyed our meal or apologised for the delays The food is dreadfully mediocre and in no way matches the claims the Brasserie makes for itself and the prices are way out of line with the quality of the ingredients or the cooking  16 90 for a very poor dry Chicken Katsu Curry was pretty disgraceful

Awful food experience My wife had a steak pit that was dried up like it had been under a hot plate all day I order a Cumberland sausage with chump potatoes veg and Yorkshire pudding What arrived was a very average sausage chips and burnt Yorkshire pudding Refund was so instant it had a feeling of regularity about it Avoid Went to the Boot Inn the following night which was lovely

We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the restaurant with family I advised the restaurant what the occasion was prior to the evening We arrived and sat at the table at the rear of the restaurant where a screen shields the kitchen and toilets but also restricts movement around the seats against the wall We were not offered a drink on arrival or indeed for 20 minutes  even after I had to rush to request a glass of water because my wife began choking on a breadstick We were eventually offered drinks which arrived but were incorrect We were then handed a menu   well 4 menu s between 9 people  We then asked for butter because our children wanted to eat this with the bread that arrived The butter came on a side plate along with just 3 side plates between 9 people Due to the occasion I reined in my initial concern and didn t mention anything The main courses arrived after we had to remind the staff that our glasses were all empty Due to the position of the table the staff couldn t circulate the table Thus most of the plates were passed over the heads of guests One plate arrived with a long blond hair hanging from a plate of pasta and was immediately sent back One meal didn t arrive at all until I complained The final meal was then passed across the heads of guests to my 11 year old daughter who had it placed in the palm of her hand The bottom of the plate was hot due to hot food being on it This resulted in her jerking to get the plate on to the table and knocking over her drink  something our young lady waitress thought was highly amusing  At this point I admit I lost it  As did my wife as the young waitress couldn t understand what the problem was and 2 senior staff attempted to placate me as I ranted about the disastrous evening What made matters worse was that the staff then tried to excuse the events by stating how am I supposed to get the plate to her then and sorry but the owner went on holiday yesterday  Eventually they apologised and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and reduced the final bill but I have to say that I will never go back Neither will my family This was an occasion that we will only do once and I m afraid they ruined it
Will keep this brief food was terrible and the landlady was very rude and in your face never again

I am not one to usually write reviews feedback however my experience food wise was so poor that i was prompted to do so This review was meant for the Tastecard website as i am a member however unfortunately they proof read all reviews to ensure they are only positive Therefore not giving a true and honest reflection of an establishment and are only to serve themselves and it s members but that s business hey Moving swiftly on Hardly anything from this establishment was authentic American food from what i had sampled between a few people attending with me Put simply this is a poor attempt at American food from Greek owners which feel the need to add a Greek twist to food which should not be tampered with Pretty much all the food was bland and flavourless that included the jalape€¤os which was a first for me  I personally believe that is due to poor quality of ingredients across the menu as well a lack of knowledge for something as simple as American food What ever you do stay away from the chilli dog you have been warned  I had the frankfurter and it was a throw back to school dinners and when food standards were at a very low It consisted of mechanically separated meat with some kind of Mediterranean meat mixture which i refuse to call chilli as it was far from No heat no flavour all sitting on an over cooked hot dog bun not pleasant in the slightest The inferno chicken wings was in fact just chicken wings tossed in sweet chilli sauce A lot of false advertisement When highlighted to the waitress she was clueless not sure if that was just for the issue of the wings or something more general to her persona  On the up side the ribs were not to bad and the service was just about acceptable then again it was pretty much empty Had it not been for hunger pains and my stomach having an aggressive conversation with me i would had ditched my meal after the first bite and in hindsight should had yes i live a life of regrets this was definitely one of them  One of the main from the many questions i left with from this place was why on earth is everything garnished with coriander That truly is a riddle for me maybe it is a new American thing i do not know about As i have never seen that in all my years Probably that Greek twist i mentioned previously there should be rules in fact laws against such acts Summing up if you are after real American food hit one of the well known chains i e TGI s or even Mc Donald s or Burger King yes  they even do it better even from that lower end  or just anywhere with half decent food this place is not even worth it with 50 off with Tastecard Well and truly Avoid Don t just take my word everyone else on here has got it spot on Just goes to show anyone thinking about opening up a restaurant should have faith and this place should be their Mecca that you can make it If these guys can open and somehow remain opened surely anyone one Thought I d leave on a positive note for all you budding entrepreneurs

Every Monday myself and my Fiancee eat out usually but not always at Nandos This week as a perk my company gave me a free trial of Tastecard which gives amazing discounts at restaurants Looking at the list of participating restaurants I noticed that Tarrantinos gave a 50 discount to cardholders so I booked  When we arrived only 2 other tables were taken which should have rang alarm bells For Starters we ordered Sardines and Ribs respectively Both were ok if nothing special although the ribs were absolutely smothered in barbecue sauce By this time we were the only diners left  The problem came in the shape of our main course 2 lasagnes  Both were burnt a little on top which I could have forgiven but the pasta and cheese were like rubber and shockingly for a supposed authentic Italian restaurant the taste was totally bland we ended up leaving most of it and even now several hours later I m still feeling bloated My fianc€÷e swears that these were leftover from lunchtime or even yesterday and unfortunately I think she could be right Thankfully the Tastcard discount of 18 reduced our bill to 24 because if I begrudged paying 24 I would have thrown my toys out of the pram big time if I had got a bill for 42  I won t be going back to Tarrantinos anytime soon

What s the world coming to when the humble burger can command such ridiculous prices Fans of this place must have been raised on Pot Noodles and Monster Munch if they think this is good food What a joke

Went here with a group of friends on our lunch break with limited time the service was very slow and we had to try get someone s attention more than once for the bill The menu is very limited the salads that we ordered we very very plain as was the fish pie tasteless and bland If your after lunch I would to any of the other great places in soho
What a dump Not clean not tidy no menus on tables not much choice 30 minute wait for food There wasn t a single good thing about this place

i had booked a meal here for family we were meeting sunday night by chance we called in on thursday night for a cocktail so glad i did not a place to sit down and talk at a meal dim lights loud awful music and brash staff overprice drinks with a 12 5 service charge stay well clear shocked this was part of the hilton

If you are planning to attend a performance at Nottingham Playhouse for goodness sake don t eat in their Cast restaurant beforehand We were a party of 24 and all the booking arrangements and menu choices had been notified in advance Most of us arrived at 6 00 pm as requested one small group being perhaps five minutes late When the starters had not arrived 50 minutes later I spoke to the Duty Manager and insisted that these should be served They did then arrive but there was no sign of our main courses until we had made a further protest These were served at 7 20 80 minutes after our arrival and because the performance time was fast approaching we had to rush our food and did not have time to enjoy it properly Indeed several of our party had to leave their portions unfinished in order to move into the theatre before curtain up We had no time to use the conveniences or purchase a programme and the enjoyment of the evening was significantly diminished Eventually we were served our puddings in the interval at 9 15  The Duty Manager could not seem to offer any excuse or explanation and it was not as if many other customers were in the restaurant hardly surprising  I have pointed out to the Playhouse that our society makes an annual theatre visit and that the income from the group would have been nearly 1000 One would have thought that the theatre would have been glad of this revenue and would seek to ensure that we returned in a future year This will certainly not be the case

Arrived at 7 45pm by 10 10pm only the starter had arrived Chicken Jalfrezi was like chicken in tomato sauce Drink service was slow and even though we had pre ordered the food we had to order twice more before it eventually arrived We won t be going there again On the positive side the Elvis singer was a good laugh and he made the night more bearable

Been visiting this place for many years Just come back from the worst meal either of us have ever had Both had the roast - which we seem to think was this frozen sliced stuff Potatoes also frozen and vegetables hard and cold Portions much smaller than usual No staff around to mention anything to - when we left three of them were stood around the bar and not even so much as a goodbye or thank you Tables next to us were also left with plates on with large amounts of food on Won t be back despite their e-mails regarding your wonderful new menu Very very disappointed

We have been going to this restaurant for years but there has been a recent gap of about 18 months - what a decline in food quality - service is still OK though We ordered a bottle of wine which they did not have - a mid price red - next step up was almost 10 more is this a ploy to make you spend more to get a decent red over 12 ABV I ordered a sirloin with peppercorn sauce which used to be excellent - 15 mins later advised no sirloin but they did have fillet  is there a theme developing here  My wife ordered the avocado dish as a starter - it was top of the specials board 20 mins later advised they had run out What is going on I had the smoked fish platter - they used to do a very similar platter which was excellent This had an odour of dirty damp carpets was tasteless and served with what might once have been tartare sauce and what I think was a Marie rose sauce - it had gone pale brown and turned in to a gloopy jelly like substance The pizza was OK - the medium rare filet steak was almost well done - the potatoes that came with it were hard and very much undercooked We did not stay for desert The staff knew it was a car crash and took 20 of the bill without being asked - so they clearly know how bad the food was The chef sits on the bottom of the stairs to the toilet and smokes inside the building This used to be such a great good value restaurant in the heart of London and could be again with a bit of attention and some basic discipline - We won t be going back to see if it improves

My partner and I decided to try Chianti having heard a good review from family and thought we would give it a go   On arrival on a dark Sunday afternoon we drove round to the rear of the restaurant to park the car There were no lights on the car park and the restaurant is not in one of the better areas of Bolton shall we say On leaving the car the lights were on obviously in the eatery and all looked rather promising  Having not booked we expected to be offered a table when one came available - the place was less than half full and tables were emptying as we entered - but we were not even offered to be able to wait The time was around 5 30PM and we were asked to come back at 8PM for a table Now call me old fashioned but businesses - especially new ones -should always welcome new customers not turn them away  We turned around and went over the hill into Horwich to one of our regular late Sunday afternoon restaurants that made us instantly welcome even though they had fewer tables available  Not a very good way to treatment customers and as I and my family are the type as many are last minute people we will not be trying this place out in the near future  Go over the hill to Horwich for good food great service and welcoming staff

We went to Musa for afternoon tea The service was appalling The staff at the counter could have not be more rude and inefficient We had to wait almost half an hour despite being one of only two tables there Then ten more minutes for a fork and napkin which should have been given to us when serving cakes All the tables around us were cluttered with dirty crockery whilst a waiter and waitress were chatting by the coffee machine We shall not stop at the cafe next time we visit Firstsite It s an insult to such a beautiful gallery

First impression from staff greeting us was that it was a bit of an imposition for us to ask for a table as we had not pre-booked A filthy sticky table was found facing a wall not conducive to a pleasant dining experience Other tables were available throughout perhaps we should have been less British and demanded a better table The food arrived overcooked The Medium rare steak arrived well done this was only the second time I have ever sent food back the replacement steak should have perhaps been the third but hunger overtook We were asked for our dessert order but asked for a couple of minutes more which was our mistake as despite waiting a further 15 - 20 minutes and the trying to catch the waiters eye we eventually gave up settled our bill at the bar and went to McDonalds for dessert instead speaks for itself really  Not all of the staff were dreadful there was one exception a lady who we took to be the manageress She was very polite seemed to care about the customers offered a free dessert or a pint as compensation for the poorly cooked steak Unfortunately 1 good apple doesn t make up for the remainder of the staff and the experience

Where does one start My first visit here On arrival a large queue for drinks most delayed by cocktail making far too few bar staff no idea of surge capacity - perhaps a shock to have several customers on a Thursday at 1900 When I did reach the front customers arriving later were offered bar service first even though it was obvious I had been waiting some time and there was no apology or recognition of a delay The staff could hardly be described as welcoming Either I was temporarily invisible or the bar staff found it more convenient to serve someone else Certainly these comments are not one-off  as recent reviewers have also reported Turning to the food this was over half an hour late from the booking time warm at best Did not consider it worth a further wait to ask for it to be heated again and one would suspect the reason for the delay is a commercial one - so that more money can be spent at the bar I ate one main course - I was hungry by his time but after this still needed food at home later The salad was very much weighted for cheap ingredients apart from a few too few pieces of Avocado on top The turkey tasted like it had been reconstituted with a striped grill effect not at all appetising This establishment appears to have taken at best a short-term view of customer service and has no concept of effective time management I would not recommend this for anything other than the two for one cocktails which did appear to offer value for money although in the interests of time I did not partake I would not recommend the food A Michelin star is a long way away not that this would be their target and as other correspondents have reported there are far more establishments offering better overall value for money nearby Several of my co-diners also found it difficult to digest their entire plate of food as for example burgers were less than hot  Finally reflecting the title of this summary what on earth is the incentive to return

The bar staff are only interested in one thing here and that`s looking busy or just standing around making excuses not to serve you  I am busy  when they are clearly not appears to be the In  statement I could add a lot more to this like food served on cold plates people ordering coffee being more of a priority but there is no point as I have decided never to visit there again I shall go elsewhere and get treated like a customer and not just an interuption

Not sure what was going on at this place - we stopped by when staying at Dunsandles and were not impressed It has been recommended by the owners and well we were sorry to have listened to his advice The food was as if it was out of tins or a microwave

My elderly parents went to the New Brighton La Tasca tonight to celebrate my mothers 68th birthday they are both in bad health and do not get out much After waiting 20 minutes for any service my mother went to find a member of staff so they could order a drink A spanish waiter arrived and told them that they only had one type of beer on and when they asked if there was no other lager they were told to go somewhere else This upset my mother so much she had to come home and it has thoroughly spoilt her whole birthday At her age she will not have many birthdays left and this one was ruined by a very rude member of staff I could appreciate that they were busy and could be excused for the delay in table service but not for the lack of customer service or for the rude attitude I have taught licensing law for the past 15 years so i understand the trade and the pressure of a busy service but this behaviour is unacceptable please could something be done so that somebody else s celebration will not be ruined by rude staff

WE went to the Argosy with our son and daughter in law for a meal and a catch up which should have been an enjoyable experience My son and I ordered a half a chicken with barbecue sauce which came with chips and coleslaw - when the chicken arrived it looked like roadkill - almost like a pancake and certainly unrecognisable as half a chicken in any way shape or form I suppose the barbeque sauce was o k  but the meagre portion of chips was a disgrace My wife had a vegetarian curry this appeared to be nearly all hard cauliflower and was served in an oblong white enamel dish although the poppadums were nice and crispy - the bhagees were practically tiny scraps Even one of the servers dropped one of the meals on the floor which meant we had to let our meals go cold whils a fresh meal was prepared to replace the dropped one I certainly would not advise anyone to eat there if they wanted a decent quality meal I certainly will not step across their door again  Only one word for the experience disgusting

Arrived on Saturday around 18 30 with only 7 other cars in the car park plenty of space for us to park as all other pubs nearby on that main road seemed to be with busy car parks Maybe that should have told us something No one was stood at the bar but us the barman just looked at us and did nt speak we asked a young waitress for a table for two she said they was fully booked The place was not even quarter full Not all tables had reserved on them This is just a place who only want locals in and we noticed when passing earlier in the day they appeared to be of the retirement generation in suits and ties Be careful when leaving the car park its a bit of a blind spot diificult to see on-coming fast traffic from both directions

After complaining about Sea Food platter I was delighted NOT to receive a 46 service charge for a meal for 6 Food rating poor  Toilets upstairs in need of cleaning and modernising Didn t pay service charge and will never eat there again

Having known and visited this restaurant for more than 20 years mostly enjoying our meals it has now become very unreliable The last few visits have each been worse than the previous culminating in this evenings terrible dinner  Lobster their speciality not freshly cooked as it arrived within 10 minutes of ordering and was dry and flavourless  Fries were cold and had to be replaced Salad limp and without proper dressing Beer was their own brew and instantly made me feel ill  All in all a rotten experience and after literally dozens of visits I m not ever going back Shame as this was one of the best and was in my opinion an iconic restaurant serving the best ribs and sea food New owner maybe
