I am always confused when you arrive at a restaurant that is about 5 full to be told there are no tables because they are all reserved At best this means the duty manager hasn t a clue about how to run a profitable shift at worst it implies you should go somewhere else The message tonight carried both those meanings and I wish we had heeded the warning signs Alas we sat at the unwiped tables in the bar canteen area and ate poorly presented average meals that make the offer at your local Wetherspoon simply astonishing by comparison Albeit the children s meal deals represent reasonable value As for the food the steak was cooked to spec but let down by overcooked chips soggy onion rings and the decision to serve it in a pasta bowl steak must always be served on a plate large enough for it to sit properly  The chicken burger bun was a breakfast bap and the cos lettuce plain wrong  Other than the lack of welcome from the host duty manager the staff were friendly The barman was accommodating when I asked him to remove the sparkler from the ale the selection Greene King IPA and a rebadged version of the same was as poor as ever at these types of GK owned places   With a destination diner the welcome is everything and when that is poor then the shortcomings in the food quality and cleanliness can be as stark as the lighting in the bar area  Unsurprisingly about 95 of the tables remained as empty when we left as they were when we arrived and the statement that all tables were reserved is not something I suspect to be the case at this disappointing pub in future  Not worth stopping off for go into Stratford would not go back or recommend at all

First time we ve eaten here and was sadly disappointed Nice location sat outside enjoying the rare sunshine I ordered the calamari to start with a mushroom risotto as a main and my wife a straightforward spicy pizza Unfortunately my calamari basically tasted of flour and the risotto was undercooked to the point I couldn t eat it after few mouthfuls They took it back and offered a different choice but we decided to instead share the pizza This turned out to be very doughy and lacking in flavour They took the risotto off the bill which was fair enough but personally I rather pay and eat decent food Not sure we ll try the place again

This is the second review for this place and was hoping to give a better one  we got a cheese panini - what we actually got was a crunchy bread very very crunchy not enjoyable at all with tomato and a splash of cheese    i know its cheap but i found it cold and inadequate  you complain and get sorry no customer service and miserable faces   breakfasts are good but dinners not so

We decided to book the Plough and Harrow for a family meal on a Sunday evening When we arrived i was quite surprised to see a big banner with the word Passion written on it we passed the kitchen door and looked in to see a tray of chips on the floor Our table was ready and we ordered drinks and also our food What a disappointment The food was terrible I had garlic bread which tasted of mould and my pasta had no sauce Chips were in short supply with adults receiving between 4 and 8 chips We were told we had to leave at 9 p m as they had a rule that it was adults only after that but did not tell us this when we booked the table so two people had to leave without finishing their meals or drinks As we were the only people in the pub it seems quite unlikely they were expecting a last minute rush We would never return

I recently went to the Kitchen and Pantry for a quick lunch during a Portobello Rd shopping trip we choose this place because it looked nice enough and the prices seemed ok  But even considering the reasonable prices for food drinks are expensive the quality was really disappointing We both had jacket potatoes and my girlfriend s mixed veg and cheese looked worse than an 90 s school dinner The veg in particular seemed to have been dumped straight out of a mixed frozen veg pack and microwaved for a good hour to make sure all the nutrients and flavor had been exterminated Unfortunately the veg must have taken up all the mircowave space because my chilli con carne version was stone cold and pretty much tasteless even when returned hot  Service was slow and while some of the staff were lovely others looked less than pleased to be interacting with customers  Even ordering at the front desk felt like a military operation - In particular when I asked for sweet potato jackets I was told they had just run out but when my girlfriend s lunch arrived a normal potato I was told they had just run out of normal potatoes so would I mind having a sweet potato  So we took it in turns to eat lunch because of the delay to my meal  Portobello Rd has loads of cafes and street food stalls I d recommend trying any of them before this place

Went for lunch - looked really good nice menu Had to sit inside due to the amount of people smoking outside  Found a table we liked then had to search for a menu Chose our meal went to the bar to order it and was totally ignored for 10 minutes With several people serving we thought it should be quick Wrong Others came came in got served ordered there food and left  I can only imagine that this a general way of treating people and that their food is a similar low standard

Stayed at the Red Dragon for 2 nights Room was small basic but adequate No shower & no curtain on the bathroom window which was not frosted glass so it was open viewing to the building opposite across the narrow street Decided to use the communal bath shower room but shower did not work & no curtain on that window either We decided to have our evening meal here on the 1st night as the bar area looked very nice & oldey worldy We ordered the Cock & Bull The presentation was not very good when it arrived meat was tough & had little taste so when asked how our meal was we said that it was not satisfactory & so had a refund on only one of the meals  At the end of our stay & when paying the final bill we noticed we had been charged for 4 breakfasts for the 2 nights we stayed even though we did not request them and on their sales card it stated that without breakfast the bill would be reduced by 5 per person for each nights stay We were not asked about this during our stay and things were not made clear to us I got the impression it was because we complained about the previous evenings meal

I would strongly not recommend this place to eat with friends family or business associates  The service is pitiful staff unobservant and there are a plethora of other places that are better We were handed menus over the bar having asked if we could eat even though e had booked a table The service was slow and the pub was not even busy In addition to this we had to continually get up and ask the staff to stop talking as we were needing service - we were then told that there was an issue with the rota and that this is very important - i suppose this was more important than paying customers Please if nothing else take heed of the advice of not eating here - there are as I say numerous other establishments where you will receive a warm welcome and better service

We ate here as a family group of 11 and we BOOKED for Sunday roast Firstly I can t really comment on the service as we hardly had any we constantly had to keep going to the bar to ask for the next course sauces and cutlery The food was disgusting cold gravy no roast potatoes roast parsnips cooked so hard they were tasteless and unedable vegtables either uncooked over cooked or cold Excuses included none left but we booked  all gone but we cooked  we mixed the roasties in with the other veg why And I only started here today  the cook  Total joke except the price basically I would certainly never go again and I can see why other reviewers arn t happy
This is quite possibly the worst service I have ever received in a restaurant The food was not at all Indian and the wait staff rude

really not for the faint hearted The food is dreadful and the kitchen looks suspect There must be more e factors in their sauces plus sugar and salt that are really really bad for you Shame the village needs a good chinese

I had been a longtime customer at this takeaway but since the owner has taken charge recently the quality and service has taken a dive  I used to rave about this place for its quality and service and visit twice a week but since the owner has returned and brought a new cook  not chef and let the experienced staff go it has fallen flat  I have tried it twice in two months and it is disgusting The customer service has fallen the quality has gone and it tastes like a water based curry made with cheep curry powder not fresh spices and ingredients  The prices have gone up and everything else has gone down Sadly another case of a greedy owner trying to sell poor quality products at premium prices  I shall never return again and strongly advise you not to go either as you will be disappointed

Started well got seated then ordered 2 course Sunday Lunch 1st course took an hour to arrive Patte come with bread should be toast but hey ho Next course arrived in 30 mins yorkshire pudding still frozen at the bottom Food luke warm Plate freezing cold Tried to get the attention of staff but no one to be seen afte 15 mins gave up Nibbled at the veg Then waited and waited and waited and waited to pay so we walked to the desk range the bell after 5 min a human being Amazing then to be told we do not take card payments It 2016 not 1900 s So paid cash can we have a receipt Well what a palaver we do not have a receipts and he dissapeared 5 mins later a bit of paper with a vat number on Not very 20th Century Unbelievable Safe to say we wont be back again

the price of drink in this bar is OTT mixers are flat and very over price like the drink staff not very nice or helpfully food over price and not good very limited also not clean wc or bar i have email my office not to us this bar

My first and last visit From start to finish the service was awful We arrived promptly for 3pm on Mothers Day and were left waiting for ages to be shown to our pre- booked table We ordered our mail meal at 3 10 which arrived just before 4pm I had the roast beef dinner I needed a magnifying glass to find the roast potatoes In fairness the unfriendly waitress did get me some more The roast beef was just awful and cold A number of drinks were put on our meal which we didn t have and to top it all we were asked to pay 30 service charge We were then invited to leave at 5 15pm as the table was booked for another family Try this establishment if you wish but nothing would entice me to go back there again

Me and my girlfriend came to Stratford Upon Avon for the afternoon Having been here to the Pen and Parchment before we thought why not This score is no way a reflection on the waitresses who served us They were friendly It was everything else that helped in scoring this establishment so low It took about 30 minutes to receive our meals Whilst my girlfriend was ok with her meal and her words tastes a bit better than Wetherspoons  I received a fish an chips that looked like it was a reject from a previous customer a couple of days ago The batter was more of a dark brown with a slight greyish tint to it and the fish looked quite shrivelled Whilst ordering our food we also ordered a dessert each We was told that they would bring them out as soon as we ve finished our meals 20 minutes after finishing our meals and numerous waitresses walking past I went and enquired about the desserts To my delight I had Mr Grumpy telling me that it s been a busy afternoon lots of people have been in and it will be a 6 minute wait  A further 20 minutes had passed from that point This time my girlfriend enquired about the desserts to which we were told that it should be out shortly Having waited a further 5 minutes a waitress came out and asked what desserts we ordered as they had lost our ticket At this point which I can t believe we waited so long for what probably would have been below mediocre fudge cake we decided to leave it and get the money back for the desserts I understand at busy times it may be a bit longer to get food but a business should always be ready On a side note we decided to sit outside due to the indoors being quite crowded Half of the tables had parasols and the other half were left to face the sun We ended up with a table that didn t help the shrivelled fish Either every table has a parasol or no table does Make up your mind The slow service and the mis-management of staff who were running around without a clue and the poor quality of food or lack of food in one case especially for the price we paid is in my opinion the scoring of one star is totally justified  Take our advice and avoid

The sign says when entering please wait to be seated so we waited and waited despite three members of staff chatting away in the kitchen doing nothing  Most tables were taken so it was as if they did not want us there So we left and went across the road to Trinity House Coffee Shop who were excellent This was our first visit to Axminster and will not bother with River Cottage if we ever pass through again
12 5  discretional service fees will be charged cannot be deleted The manager said Don t come if you don t want to pay the service fees

A very disappointing Sunday lunch with ten members of our family to celebrate a birthday The so called roast was abysmal and to use deep fried potatoes and call them roasties was a laugh There was a 40 minute gap between starters and main courses It will be a long time or even never before our families visit the Crewe Arms at Hinton in Hedges again PS don t take the children because there was no children s menu

I came here for breakfast with uni friends but we were left disappointed  Very cramped and food tasted cheap  I ordered breakfast which came with chips which tasted as though it was refried  Sausages were nice though  My tea was so weak and far too milky but I guess I m a picky when it comes to tea

Me and my girlfriend have been here twice Our first time was really nice with delicious food and we advised people to check it out My last visit sadly left me visiting the hospital with a severe case of food poisoning The food did not taste quite as good as the first time and the waitresses were just wandering around like head-less chickens After having our starters taken away we was asked if we would like desserts I don t know what they are doing wrong but suggest staying away until it is sorted

For years this has been our local pub What on earth has happened to it Tonight we visited as usual only to find blaring jarring music from several karaoke singers who couldn t sing We could not hold a conversation and left We had to hoped to have a meal Who is the management catering for here The toilets were disgusting In the women s according to our friend one toilet was full to the brim another had a missing toilet seat and the other had no toilet paper In the gents the tap unit is almost off the wall Greene King need to wake-up because this used to be a very nice pub until recently

I have visited this coffee house on two occasions now and although the food has been decent albeit over priced  the service has been utterly dreadful Both times the waitresses have looked disinterested and been rude to us when we acquired about our food Which incidentally is nothing special and not worth the wait   Needless to say I shall not be visiting again

Plus points no real wait for a table Staff pleasant Service quick Minus points cold doughy pancakes Waited 15 minutes with nothing on any plates or in any glasses to pay our bill Then had to run to our gate
Waiting nearly five minutes for a couple of cups of coffee is not what you expect from Costa and with dirty tables just about capped a very dissappointing visit We will never go back

I went inside to look at the takeaway menu as there is nothing outside and decided not to buy I had not engaged with staff so when I heard  Hope you have a nice day as I walked out the door with my back to all service staff said with clear sarcastic undertones I was absolutely gobsmacked  This place is now on my blacklist

I had a spaghetti boll-anise which tasked more of salt than anything else it seemed more salty than the sea My wife had a sea-food meal which was only slightly saltier than she expected  Conversation was not possible as the interior is all highly reflective surfaces with lots of metal which leads to a very high noise level - it increased a lot whilst we were eating  I did not complain at the time as I just needed to get out of the place before my hearing went completely  And I admit to having some tinnitus at all times  To be fair to the restaurant some of my friends have eaten there and found it acceptable not something special

Went here on 6 5 to celebrate my 50th birthday with four work colleagues Despite booking and a sign warning 30 minutes wait for lunch or food arrived 75 minutes an hour an a 1 4 after we placed the order  And were had to chase it up to get it at that time The food was okay but my colleagues burger was dried up and crusty and our drinks were all warm and tepid after over an hour s wait for our food It was supposed to be a short lunch trip but we arrived at 12 44 and left at 14 47  In fact we were so late leaving I had to call my wife up and get her out of her bed she was sick to collect our children from school at 15 00 hrs as I was so late We vowed we will never return We have visited numerous local pubs for lunch over three past year and always managed an hour out of the office  This was 3 hours   To top it all off nicely I arrive home today after a business trip to find a parking fine from PPS for 100 for parking my car in the pub car park   Apparently there are several signs for pay and display but none of us saw them but to be fair you don t except to pay to park in a pub car park when you are dining there I called the pub to check this wasn t a scam It isn t They confirmed my booking and visit but said they couldn t help with the fine  So an average lunch with a horrendous wait and a bill of over 150    Happy 50th birthday

Had lunch today at Stags Leap today both meals were absolutely revolting The meals had to be returned to be warmed up as they were cold in the middle especially the gammon which wasn t even cooked the second time around as it was very pale and watery The pie wasn t much better the pasty was very doughy and it was cold We requested 2 eggs with the gammon instead of the egg and pineapple it arrived without the pineapple and only one egg The chips just tasted of burnt fat We certainly wont be returning or recommending the Stags Leap to anyone

I booked a night with my family when we arrived we was told that we never booked we asked to speak to the person in charge and a lady named Jackie came over and told us we would have to come back another time as they never had a record of us booking it was my dads 71st birthday we had to eat at the red loin down the road I was very upset by the way we was spoke to and delt with

What a shame  Skipped dessert and rushed here as it was closing at 11 Got there at 10 30 but was told we couldnt sit in as it closed at 11 I dont understand why we couldnt eat in even when we assured her we would finish by 11 Wednesday night

I m not normally one to make a fuss but my brunch experience this morning takes the probably inedible biscuit  I visited the Exeter St bakery in Finsbury park for the third and likely final time  Don t get me wrong they have good coffee and have brilliant bread now being stocked in local waitrose stores - but running a successful brunch venue is about more than bread and coffee  I m writing this safe in the knowledge that my struggle was the epitome of a first world problem but I think it s a funny story - so here we go  We were greeted warmly when we walked in to join our friends who were already a flat white ahead of us  Since they d already chosen their food we quickly reviewed the menu so that we could order our food together I drink lots of water so I ask the waiter if a can have a large jug to accompany our coffees  When the coffees arrive and the water doesn t I decide to give it a couple of minutes as they re often brought separately When the water doesn t come back I remind him and he promptly brings me a small glass to sate my admittedly unreasonable appetite for water  Meh It s just water I ll get over it No biggie  We get chatting about our food choices It s on the expensive end of reasonable but the Italian-inspired menu modern interior design and exposed kitchen give you the confidence that it s going to be worth it  It isn t  I notice two things when my Eggs Benedict with extra mushrooms arrives The first is that I ve actually ordered Egg Benedict with a solitary sad-looking under-poached thing staring up at me My second observation is that the watery curdled brown liquid covering my plate is supposed to be Hollandaise sauce  I mention this to the nearest waitress who struggles to understand the problem After a couple of attempts to explain she disappears leaving the plate to go and speak to someone else A man appears who again asks what the problem is  Sorry to be a pain I say  But the sauce seems to have split  I m met with a deeply confused response by the handsome looking italian waiter Perhaps he didn t hear me correctly   I don t think the sauce should be like this I say  it s curdled  His facial expression evolves from confusion to misunderstanding followed swiftly by mild panic and finally settling on light fear  He runs away to get someone else  My friend gets her phone out to google Hollandaise sauce - realising that a picture of what it looks like may help to resolve the problem  Luckily it didn t come to that a slightly older woman approaches the table with her two underlings in tow and quickly identifies the issue  Your sauce isn t right she spots  let me get you another one  Great Problem solved Except it isn t  She returns 60 seconds later to tell me that it will be another 20 mins before the chef can make another batch of sauce Would I like something else I decide against it as my friends are already most of the way through their meals  Their choices whilst a bit smaller than you d hope for looked reasonably tasty Up until this point however I d clearly been too wrapped up in my sauce debacle to understand the reality  One friend ordered avocado and vine tomatoes on toast but had also fallen foul pun intended of the singular plural oval issue with his side order of one Eggs  Another had an under-poached and broken egg s  My third friend had ordered the delicious-looking vegetarian full Italian breakfast but looks as we all know can be deceiving  You ve heard the phase Mutton dressed as lamb  well she had salt dressed as spinach  I tried a small forkful and it caused the right hand side of my face to figuratively turn inside itself  Anyway they finished the edible bits of their meals and we ask for the bill  Whilst the first bill was wrong a second corrected one was quickly produced  My friends try to pay at the table however the wireless card machine stops working so we have to all get up and pay at the main till  My first friend tells the till server twice the portion of the bill she d like to pay she is confused when she is presented the card machine displaying the full bill amount Another mistake that s quickly corrected again  Then something happens that I ve never seen before  The surprise icing on the cake  You know how it feels You re waiting diligently at the till ready to type in your PIN whilst a staff member dutifully enters the amount due into the chip and pin machine Imagine my friend s surprise then when rather being passed the machine the server proceeds in a staggering display of stupidity to TYPE IN HIS OWN PIN  We walk out in stunned silence trying to decide whether or not we ve just been the subjects of a bizarre new hidden camera show  Whilst I ve quite enjoyed looking back on our experience and writing this I do feel quite strongly that Exeter St Bakery is a shining beacon of what is wrong with coffee shop culture  A menu that is misleading to customers a shop that s successful only by virtue of a great location and a management who have clearly invested so much money on their website and on modern furniture that there is nothing left over for any semblance of cooking or customer service training  I d urge Finsbury Park locals to vote with their feet and avoid this disaster

This morning 4 of us went for breakfast at The Turf toby carvery  It was the worst breakfast any of us had ever had  The scrambled egg was just a mouthful of powder the sausage wasn t at all good and the beans were empty so we asked for the new jug that was behind and there was a crust on the top of them where they had been kept warm obviously for some time  The lady that was serving really didn t want to be there should have got her name  The only thing most of us ate was the toast and bacon What a waste of money  Don t usually bother with reviews but this was that bad I felt that I had to

I was provided with a specials menu and placed an order 10 minutes later I was advised that i had been provided with the wrong menu and that what I had ordered was not available  I eventually order a medium steak Chips and NO peas However I was served a well-done steak chips AND PEAS  I provided feedback via the chain website as requested and opted for someone o contact me about the poor service I m still waiting on the call now

Visited Taj Lounge on our last day in Nottingham and what a let down We were greeted and seated and left with the menus definitely had a wide choice with some new dishes but the waiting staff did have very good knowledge of the menu as they were unable to recommend anything The chicken was tough and the lamb was gristly and the thing i hate most is when the toilets are not clean overall this was a huge disappointment as it looks nice from the outside

We went here on the 04 07 2015 Firstly greeted by that there is a 45 min wait for a table not prompting anything else available  We mentioned about the outside meeting area to be informed that was available immediately 2 parties sitting at the same table ordered at the same time to then only one half of the order to turn up because they were confused on the similar orders As it was the initial order came out a hour and a half later from when ordered No apology or notice was given about the delay the toilets were absolutely disgusting and the staff are most certainly inexperienced to not even knowingness table numbers Will not be going again

So having just been let down massively by the Sawley Arms we continued our hunt for a more imaginative vegetarian option for the better half  Maybe we should have realised when the vegetarian menu was separate to the main but we took our seats and asked  Again the menu for the meat eaters like me looked good but the vegetarian was lacking Why oh why do people think all veggies eat is mushrooms The mushroom stroganoff didn t inspire neither did the other options of pasta or veg curry Surely there are enough local farms nearby to get fresh veg and how hard can it be to bake a nice veg tart or similar Anyway excuses were made and away we went back home to make our own tea

Sammie and Ben have turned the place around however they were not there today and it was a shambles Waited 15 minutes for our orders to be taken and after a further 25 minutes food and drink had not arrived Others coming in after us got their drinks before us Very poor excuses and duty management  I suggest phone ahead to see if Sammie and Ben are in

The fish and chips have gotten smaller definitely not worth the money Also ordered a faggot wanted to see how theirs were  well they were absolutely disgusting if I hadn t already taken them home I would have taken them back I definitely wont be back Will stick to Francines in future

ventured here to receive awful service had to wait a while to order only to go outside and see all the staff stood round the back smoking The place itself is very unclean sat down for 5 mins untill we noticed ants on the tables and floors moved to other side of the restaurant only to find more ants crawling around left over bits of food on the floor complained but could see it went in one ear and out the other in the end we ate in our cars avoid at all costs

Visited Sunday evening at 1945 before bank holiday Monday Place appeared busy but not packed Waited to be seen by member of staff was then informed that waiting time for food would be around a hour even though there were empty tables It seems that Ask have a serious problem with staffing levels and being a bank holiday would have allowed for this

We used to love it here and come regularly But we hadnt been for a while as our last visit disappointed us with quality of food and price so expensive  We had friends in town so decided to return as we d seen it had been refurbished so was interested to see what had changed  The places looks gaudy and my wife compared it to something you d see on Desperate Scousewives or TOWIE Sparkly shiny but no class Where has the Thai-ness gone The food was presented well but quality ingredients were not there - no thai eggplant but frozen peas  The food was tasteless and just lacking in so many departments Bad quality meat frozen and smaller portions than they used to  The service is one of the main reasons we used to love it here But it has gone Rushing to get you in and out of the restaurant Our food appeared so quickly and we were almost sat on the same table as the people besides us We skipped dessert as we felt we were being forced out  Im so sorry Chaophraya as we loved you but not anymore There s too many better Thai options out there now

Nipped in today around 11 30 The pub was empty so didn t want to risk the overnight pint I was charged 2 20 for a half When I asked the cost of a pint I was told 3 90 So - a premium of 25p for a half Disgraceful

This place must have a reputation for poor service  As we were looking at the menu outside a local lady came over and mentioned to us not to bother Slightly bemused by this we continued upstairs thinking we would give it a go Mostly because this was the only place with empty seats in busy Padstow  We now know why  We were greeted by a very hostile unfriendly waitress who questioned us relentlessly on what we were planning to order bizarre as we hadn t even sat down to look at a menu properly  Maybe she wanted to work out how much we were planning on spending We said that we wanted some lunch and maybe some hot drinks as it was a particularly rainy day to which she made a very obvious eye-roll She then told us Well you can sit at the bar but it s not very nice  The ENTIRE place was empty Maybe they had a large booking in we don t know as no reason was given as to why this was our only option but the tables were not laid out as such and even so there was plenty of room It wasn t even peak time We reluctantly agreed knowing this was really the only option as everywhere else was so busy We even politely suggested that we would be happy to just have drinks if they were due to be busy  Then to our amazement as we stepped forward to take our seats she stood in front of us blocking the way and said If you want hot drinks then go somewhere else We looked at each other in total disbelief and decided to leave  We have never experienced anything like it It s like they don t want customers   The staff need some serious training in customer service Rude beyond belief  Ps Dear management we would be great full for a response apology as to why we were treated so appallingly rather than requesting our review gets deleted  We have seen many other similar reviews disappear  which is therefore giving a false representation

What a disgusting event dining at Ruby Blue  We arrived the manager said hello then turned his back on us looking flustered and got a waiter to seat us  After 15 minutes the manager came over to take out order only after being asked to He asked what we would like then turned his back on us again and thrust a new meme bet of staff at us She was delightful yet obviously untrained  Our food was slow and burnt and tasteless  Our drinks took an age to arrive  The flustered manager was running around the restaurant so much so he nearly knocked drinks from our table twice  When talking to him at the end his explanation was well it s busy what do you expect The venue was at half capacity at any time  What a disgusting experience poor management and overall a never to return venue

Our family visited the Hare & Hounds in June for Sunday Lunch - The board outside was advertising the lunch at a set price when we sat down we were told rather bluntly that the lamb cutlets was 1 50 extra  The tables were sticky and there were no tablecloths we had to ask for the basics - salt & pepper  The waitress landlady really didnt want to be there - she was miserable and unresponsive when we tried to engage in light conversation an hello would have been nice The food was adequate with a very limited menu When we were presented with the desert menu we we told what NOT was available from it as opposed to what was on it My husband ordered a Crumble - it would have served all four of us it was so big it was stodgey and there was far too much When the Landlord appeared with the bill he was a bit more sociable he asked if we would mind placing a review on tripadvisor - apparantly they dont get many reviews - I wander why   WE WILL NOT BE RETURNING

I m afraid I was unable to review the restaurant s menu but that was because my wife and I were turned away from the eaterie when it first opened Having booked the previous day ensuring the staff repeated our booking time and having provided our telephone number we were shown the door without an apology or staff showing a care in the world and not the least bit interested by the fact we had booked We weren t the only prospective diners either Two other couples who had also booked found they didn t have a table too I live in Great Baddow and happily welcome any new eaterie but with this sort of customer care I won t be setting foot in the establishment again I suggest you head for the Yasmin in Baddow Road where you re always welcomed with a smile and always seated regardless of how busy they are

4 of us dined at Gilgamesh - the food was very good and the restaurant had a real buzz about it However there was a major service issue The bill was over 800 00 When asked if we wanted white or pink champagne at the start of the night a colleague of mine chose the pink It was not pointed out to us that the pink champagne was in fact 250 more than the white champagne until it came to ordering the second bottle we then chose the white The price difference should have been highlighted as both champagnes were the same brand and the same year Despite trying to resolve the issue and despite following up to management on several occasions - we refused to tip and will not take our clients or friends to this restaurant again It s a shame because it s in a good location if you are in North London and would have been somewhere I would have booked again on numerous occasions

Staff are top the manager is really polite and good at his job but the Chef needs sacking I have been to this chain in York and they are worlds apart you wouldn t think it was the same pub I got a xxl burger first it was burnt so i complained then the second one was so wet and soggy it fell apart third time i got my money back This was the place to be for food as little as a year ago how its got so bad i dont know

Probably one of the worst places I ve ever had the misfortune of visiting The facilities were disgraceful the food was cold and over 30 minutes late and one waitress in particular was exceptionally rude to me and constantly abusing me even refusing to serve me alcohol for no reason whatsoever even with valid ID  Avoid this place at all costs especially the waitress

I have to admit I am somewhat partial to a traditional steak and ale pie and It s usually my first choice from a menu rather than anything else Looking at The Lock Keeper menu the description given to their shortcrust pie tempted me to give it a taste I wish I hadn t bothered  Described as being deep filled Oh dear no I had to search for any of the so called tender beef chunks of meat and found none Shortcrust It was in fact nothing more than an overpoweringly soggy and squelchy mess The vegetables fared no better If I had closed my eyes I wouldn t have known what I was eating other than to say the items on my fork were lukewarm and tasteless It really was that bad  Not wishing to embarrass or annoy anyone in our party I said very little about the meal On this occasion however as things were so bad I would have made an appropriate comment if given the opportunity to do so Sadly no member of The Lock Keeper staff showed any interest in myself or my colleagues which was yet another disappointment Would I go there again No

I never like to write bad reviews but this had to be said I came here for Christmas lunch along with other family members as it got us out of the routine of doing the same old traditional thing each year and thought that it might be different  Well   it was different but not in a good way  Even though most of the reviews seem quite generous based on TURKISH food that they do serve I had a differing view on food that is relatively simple  We arrived here around 12 30pm on Christmas Day - the place was half full - if that The first thing I noticed was that there were only 2 waiting staff plus a barman looking after the whole restaurant - a young gentleman and a lady who both judging by their mannerisms looked very inexperienced and not even sure of themselves You could tell immediately that this was a recipe for disaster and that something was going to go wrong  We were given menus by the waitress who prompted us to order food straight away without even asking us for drinks When someone told her we wanted drinks first she obliged and went to order them We then found ourselves talking amongst each other whilst the restaurant filled up more and more after about a 20 minute wait we received our drinks - on the menu it said it was draught beer however i could blatantly see the barman opening cans from behind the bar and filling up a pint glass It was also completely flat and tasteless obviously a knock off out of date can from the corner shop next door  Another half an hour went by and they got round to ordering our food and it was at this time that the table next to us was just seated - around the same amount of people as us We were just sat there waiting for prawn cocktails for another half an hour - understandably the restaurant floor would be slow but not the kitchen too  Lo and behold they arrived - only to be put down on the table next to us who where being seated when we had just ordered They apologized to us but it wasn t their fault They where also not happy as they had their own situation as well they had been complaining about making a reservation to the guy who didn t have a clue what they meant he just started moving tables around to accommodate them  Surely they must have the tables ready before  Someone from my family who works in a restaurant did go and see what was going on and peeked her head around into the kitchen She said it looked like chaos with plates and food everywhere all over the floor the staff just seemed to have been not prepared for this sort of thing and very short staffed I put this down to bad management as we could not see a manager in sight i mean i know its Christmas day and all but if you can t cope then why open Especially if there is only 2 of them We then decided enough was enough and just got up and left with no apology from any of the staff We managed to see the humorous side of it soon after - but on their part it was ridiculous and pitiful  Well it was a memorable Christmas but unfortunately one that won t be remembered for the right reasons
We arrived as a party of 6 We re told sit were you like Food was very good But the service was diabolical and will never eat here again

A visit back in time a well appointed clean American Diner At the time of visit the diner was nearly full all tables were in use and the staff which consisted of 2 waitresses and a chef we re at full stretch The menu was varied and most dishes were available The downside for me was as a party of 6 3 of the dishes came without an item of food as per the menu and another item was of poor quality on 2 of the dishes Due to the number of diners and only 2 waitresses the service was below the standard I would have expected On this showing I could not recommend this diner however I intend to check it out again in the future and hope things will have changed for the better

I have not had tough lamb covered in an indistinguishable sauce for years The lamb was tough and cold I think they just poured a hot sauce over it It was a sunday night however and maybe the chef was off

I ask is it me because this is the second review I ve done where I have walked out of a restaurant without actually eating the food Whilst I don t think I was out of order doing so it still makes me wonder if I m being overly harsh I ll let you be the judge  So preamble I am a Big Easy fan The Kings Road branch was a favourite so when I heard they were opening one in Covent Garden I was pretty chufffed I despise generic marketing spiel but I signed up for the soft launch and generic marketing from the firm as I was a fan of the brand  So my girlfriend and I went along after reading that the Big Easy had an extensive area for walk in diners As it was a Saturday we went with the knowledge that it was down to the luck of the draw and upon arrival we were told there were no tables and we could wait to get a space in the walk in area which I will call the counter The concierge told us this be saying You can try and get onto the counter  My internal monologue was  Try    Try Hmmmmm what does that mean I should probably ask   whoa look at all of the booze they have    I know I got distracted by the collection of spirits and I let it slide  School boy error  We were told that access to the counter was first come first served And after seeing a few people nearing the ends of their meals we though we would get on pretty swiftly This is where things went awry  It s not actually first come first serve but is more if you see a space you fight to get it  Seriously  So whilst we were at the bar knocking back some cocktails  the single star in basically because the barman was decent 4 people got into the walk-in area before us  This is idiotic  I m more than happy to say that we could have been more vigilant but essentially I don t really expect to have to battle to get one of the maybe 10-14 seats they have available If we are first in take our names and get us onto the counter area when someone leaves We shouldn t really have to be competing with others to get fed Perhaps I m not down with the kids and this is the way things work now heck I admit I struggled with Meat Liquors no reservation policy but this is a bit much  Also as we entered one waitress actually took a couple over to the counter to sit down Is it every man for themselves or are waitresses meant to take people over to the area  Anyway being the more ahem militant of my party I was ready to leave after the second couple got on ahead of us this was around the 30 minute mark However it took one of the waitresses shoving my girlfriend for us to decide to leave  Obviously as soon as we made it known that we were leaving everyone was extremely helpful with a table only moments away but by that point I d had enough If they can t even get something as basic as queuing correct how can you trust them with your food  There was a happy ending - we ended up going to Hawksmoor Great service great staff and no waiting around like lemons

took my granddaughter for lunch so disappointed place was so cold sat we with coats on people still working on the place 8 pound for a burger 3 for fries 11 pound all told and don t serve tea or coffee you are having a laugh

I see Dive advertised everywhere all over social media and blogger sites So i thought i would finally give it a go It was only a quick trip on a Thursday evening but it was long enough to see how poor this place is We knew it was cheap but come on  We arrived and it was very quiet just around 4 people in there it is a confusing place no clear indication for the dining area and no attentive staff to greet you it s all about first impressions We were seated by a lady she looked like a manager by what she was wearing she sat us down 10 minutes later she had not been over to us for drinks considering she was about 6 ft away from us at the pass she was too busy chatting to the chef never even glanced at us I had to go over and do the old do we order at the table or the bar routine just for a bit of service  She sat me back down and we ordered i ordered chicken wings with the suicidal sauce which lived up to the name inedible it was so hot bit extreme compared to most other places hot sauces the wings were so poor quality they made me feel sick to eat but we were in a rush and man gotta eat so dry and grey i have honestly had better at a Wetherspoons They must have been microwaved or going out of date  We were so disappointed by the whole place attitude of the staff was i don t wanna be here and slow and the food was just abysmal They also say this place is a sports bar from looking around i wouldn t recommend small screens and awkwardly laid out  Maybe they should put more effort and money into the quality of training service and food quality than the marketing side of things  One of the poorest bars in Manchester Aptly named Dive

to many crying children food cheep for people who are on a very tight budget would not go back steak was over cooked and chewy and not big portions for what you pay thank god you got a mint with the bill

Went on Saturday evening 7 Dec 2013 Having had lunch here a couple of weeks ago we thought we would try it out for an evening meal Bad move The new landlord is arrogant rude and aggressive I have complained to the brewery It took 20 mins for our order to be taken restaurant  was empty Food was ok chips the best bit Girlfriends steak had lot of fat through it Peas not cooked I provided polite feedback to the waitress who passed on to the landlord We overheard the conversation in the kitchen to the effect if   if they want to complain tell then not to comeback Sole to landlord who was rude and aggressive even accused us of booking and knowing he had 7 other diners in   threatened with court action if I refused to pay the bill and would take car registration We will not be going back and I am looking forward to discuss the matter with Everards

Visited here before seeing Michael Palin at Queen Elizabeth Hall Found the whole experience very disappointing  Service was poor I had to repeatedly ask for the set menu I had seen they offered whilst browsing their website earlier in the day as the staff either did not know this existed or more likely my opinion didn t want me to have it as they can make more money €˜ la carte  As for the food itself the fried chicken starter tasted burnt and the main courses were average at best I have the distinct feeling chips I was served had been sitting around for quite a while before they ever got to me The restaurant also looks very shabby and tired in desperate need of money spending on it It is a shame they don t seem very interested in their customers I guess they rely on just tourist trade  I ate in canteen on Baker Street several years ago found it to be a fantastic experience I cannot believe just how much the chain has gone downhill  it is certainly not restaurant I will visit again

You can call it anything but I am sorry this is not authentic Italian food In fact this has nothing to do with Italian food Our salmon was not well cooked let alone fresh The spaghetti were so badly cooked they became offensive to anyone who remotely understands Italian food I would like this restaurant s manager to tell me what they mean exactly by authentic Italian  Perhaps they are referring to their soggy over cooked chopped off spaghetti or perhaps the frozen fish soaked in a sickly looking whitish sauce It is not surprising that they can t even manage to grill a perfectly British steak after all that should not be too foreign for them Please do not call this Italian

the food was ok but the service was awful 20 minutes before the starters arrived an hour before the mains the excuse a large takeaway order one waitress and one chef walked out without paying for the drinks   and the waitress finally moved to demand payment and we negotiated 15 of the food bill because the whole experience was so crap rubbish rubbish rubbish won t go there again
Painfully slow on two separate visits  Completely ruins the experience as you sit waiting for food and then sit waiting for the bill  One hour before food came out

we have had a busy weekend and didnt have any food in so we decided to go to the very good thai in eastwood but because it was closed we ended up at the farmhouse i wish we had just gone home my sons are 13 and 15 and although we often eat out its years since they have been to an indian im really sad that they are saying that they never want to eat indian food again they had a chicken korma and a chicken tikka masala and i have to say that after trying it i dont know how they stomached it there were no other diners in and not once did the waiter ask if our food was alright otherwise i would have told him that 2 of the dishes were inedible instead we just paid the bill and wont be going back

I popped to this drive through in my lunch hour I arrived at 13 15 to find a queue normal which I joined Once you join the queue at a drive through you re pretty committed as you can t get out usually After 30 mins of waiting I ended up second in the queue at the order booth 10 mins later the bloke in front still hadn t had his order taken I walked to the window and explained that a number of us had now been stuck in the queue for over 40 mins I asked if any freebies would be given as a good will gesture and the reply was  We only have two staff on and there s nothing I can do   I got back into my car and managed to cut over a high kerb over the pavement and out of there and straight down the road to the nearest McDonald s where I received very quick and efficient service as usual from staff who are properly trained to deal with customers

We have visited the Talbot a number of times and really like the location Most times it s good and lots of our friends eat there but have recently said it was going down hill a bit Unpreterb we thought we would call in and eat MISTAKE food took ages to come my chicken was dry and cold almost like it had been microwaved shame as it used to be so good

This establishment resembles what i would imagine to be a shelter for the down and outs low quality food at knock down prices served by low pay staff who show little interest in the customer  If you enjoy your pint surrounded by plates of partly uneaten food topped by poor service this is the place for you

I took my parents to Aldeburgh as it was my dad s birthday we got fish and chips from next door and were looking forward to eating with a pint from the White Hart pub we were sitting on a bench when the heavens opened and the rain was very heavy We couldn t find shelter so thought we could stand inside the pub until the rain eased However we were turfed out of the pub very abruptly and back into the rain I could understand that we were not allowed to eat inside the pub but even when I asked to not eat the food I was told to get out  It wasn t a particularly nice way to be spoken to perhaps the member of staff was having a bad day

i work in the restaurant trade and supply equipment into restaurants but the meal i had at the mogal was stocking  I had heard bad things about this place before but as its shown on the Sharwoods TV advert i though things must of changed  The were mole on my food on a pepper and when i pointed this out the waiter told me it was how peppers go in a curry i think not he took it away but i told him that my partner and i were going as that was discusting but he told me i had to pay as i went to walk out he said if i didnt pay he would call the police  I m still waiting for a police officer to get me for this massive crime  HONESTLY NEVER GO NEAR THIS RESTAURANT
Smoked Mac and cheese was ordered  Penne pasta with a garlic and cheese sauce was what I received Service is also poor Less focus on being trendy is required

I think you could train a monkey with 1 arm to cook breakfast better than the chef who made ours service was sub standard and staff looked really unhappy I would as well though if they had to keep bringing food out that looked and tasted like the rubbish we were given  going to wetherspoons next time

They send you the wrong meals if you order a take away It arrives spilled the order is wrong and has hair in it And then they tell you not to come back to them when you complain and ask for a change Never ever going back

This was booked as a cheap but cheerful night out but what a disappointment The food was slightly less than average for the price but the service was uneven Drinks arrived fairly quickly but the wine bottle was left on table minus cork and untested Main course arrived fairly quickly but was slightly wrong A medium steak was well done but edible Then            nothing Mrs D  same blood line as Mother Theresa wearing her outdoor coat due to the cold trotted off to find the dessert menus Only three tables occupied in restaurant but you could have died of malnutrition waiting I only wanted cheese and biscuits but no they were off How difficult is it to keep cheese and biscuits for Gods sake It is a personal annoyance of mine to be given a menu where you only find out when you order that they don t have the goods advertised We left went to Sainsburys just down the High street and purchased desserts and cheese and crackers It was wonderful  My God this place is hopeless

After having toured the wonderful Lion Witch and the Wardrobe Christmas decorations our party of 7 NT members stopped by here late morning Despite being first in line after a wait of almost 10 minutes we were told in quite a brusque manner that we were too big a group to be accommodated - despite the restaurant being empty on one side and with more than enough seats on the other No effort was made by the senior staff member who spoke with us and it left us with a bad impression Clearly there is a need for staff training - or at least a transfer of the enthusiasm shown by the volunteers in the house let alone the lost revenue

Tried to make a group booking for my daughters christening Spoke to the manager who was unhelpful and rude and suggested she may be busy then due to Christmas Unhelpful terse and wholly disinterested Went elsewhere where they were accommodating and polite
I had high espectations about this restaurant but i was left very disappointed Food was nothing exceptional and not worth the money Service unfriendly and far from professional Avoid

Had a Bakewell pud about 12 years ago and it was fabulous so when travelling back from Bridlington we decided to take a long detour and renew the memory Wish I had saved the petrol  When we arrived home [Cornwall] we made coffee and cut the pudding only to find that the filling was all but non existent All the more annoying as the one on the counter cut into small try me pieces was just as it should be A total waste of time and money

Ive been visiting the fleece for a long time as i live in the area With that in mind i have seen the steady fall in service to the point of just feeling like my presence being a strain on staff to move or help in any sence of the way Its a shame really as the food quality is good but just not worth the hassle anymore   james

Absolutely terrible this used to be the place to go to now this is now the place to avoid overpriced rubbish So they used to be known for their ribs you get better for under a 5 in Aldi Waitrose taking place before we finished Then somebody with the vacuum cleaner hoovering around our feet while we were still eating Avoid the soft drinks as they come at a premium rate

Family of 4 Left waiting to be served in a virtually empty room whilst other people got served well they missed out on at least 20 We were asked to be seated and would be served another group came in obviously friends of the staff and got server straight away  Will not be going back in a hurry try the pub a little further down as they dont ignore customers

As I had eaten at Prezzos several times and always been satisfied I felt confident to try this new branch in Dereham What a mistake The service was atrocious from the moment we arrived We were completely ignored by staff as we awaited a table This set the scene for what was to follow When the food eventually arrived the waitress passed dishes across the table in front of me to those seated opposite without any excuse me  She was clearly too lazy to walk round the table to serve in the correct manner As we were a small group we wanted to split the bill but was told this was not possible The final straw came with the serving of sorbets in a small glass dish We were provided with desert spoons which were almost too large to enter the bowl Turning to the food this was served lukewarm so lacked the usual appeal Value for money  given the above was poor One word of caution the bill arrived with a service charge automatically included A new bill had to be obtained when we refused to pay for Service  The test for any restaurant is whether one would return but in this case never again
Extremely slow and rude bar staff made this far less enjoyable than it should have been I would recommend avoiding there are better places near by

Visited Pizza Hut Halifax recently with a friend Place was not very busy was shown to a table and told order would be taken shortly 20 mins later after 2 requests to give an order we finally ordered 2 pizzas and 2 portions of chips and a bottle of wine 5 mins later came back with news they didn t have the wine we ordered and to choose an alternative shortly afterwards 2 pizzas arrived in there pans no plates were offered no portions of chips either after apologising 2 plates arrived 5 mins later chips arrived but only 1 portion Food was actually okay we finished our meal and drink and asked for our bill this arrived to our table and on inspection found 2 extra drinks we didn t have were included when queried this was corrected  Overall conclusion Food reasonably good service absolutely horrendous

2nd visit and we were totally shocked We had only just sat down when a woman that turned out to be the landlady argued with an elderly lady who complained about a dirty glass she then banned her Then a chap was accused of making a complaint to environmental health about being served cheap vodka and was asked to leave also although she actually stood and blatantly said it was her partner that served the cheap vodka and sometimes served none as he did not like the customer We had already ordered so sat tight but then did notice that our glasses were very dirty  we dare not complain  The food came and was much poorer than the previous visit We will not be going again as the atmosphere is very loud with sport on TV s and the thought that if your not liked by owners or staff things may happen to your order has seriously put us off made it seem like a backstreet pub from the archives not suitable for kids with the language widely used

New restaurant so thought should be ok Staff on arriving were friendly But disappointed to find they didn t serve draft soft drinks only small expensive bottles While waiting for food noticed that the floor was generally messy with bits of food saw no one attempt to sweep in hour we were there  Also kitchens are on the wrong side of the restaurant and all waste has to be taken through the dinning area to the back exit and unfortunately we were sat on that route When food arrived looked ok but noticed that the burger seemed a bit juicier than expected On bitting into it the burger it actually turned out to be uncooked and raw in the centre   They quickly changed it for another which was ok but in the mean time chips etc went cold waiting for replacement Staff not that bothered that they were serving raw meat and when it came to paying the bill they charged full price and when asked by the waitress sorry server  if every thing was ok I repainted out that I was served raw meat and she just laughed and said oh sorry and walked away   Overall not the best experience I have had poor customer service and unhygienic food First and last visit Would have been better off going to McDonald s or Burger King

I walked into to the pub got a nice welcome from the staff and was shown to my table quickly After we sat down there s where it went wrong The staff never smiled once and may of seen the manager having a go at a member of staff for talking to customers We had to wait 15 minutes before they would take our drinks order and a further 20 minutes for food order The food was substandard and very expensive for the quailty I believe that part of my vegatable were under cooked and didn t enjoy After we finished our low quailty meal we ordered some deserts and the ice-cream had already melted before it reach our table We spoke to the manger and he gave us a responce which was invailed and not help full We would never eat here again after our experience and i recommended thinking twice before coming to the Deddington Arms for dinner

We visited for a friends birthday dinner 23 11 2015 Staff were surely that was the French bit the menu was saved because a large proportion of it was Italian food  and it was all presented as tapas style yet they presented themselves as outr€÷ French so in summary very confused for a restaurant The sommelier immediately tried to palm us off with a 180 bottle of Italian white we asked for a French suggestion we were in a Je suis Paris mood and the bread one slice arrived after much hand waving The ma€¸tre d a lady needs a lesson in client facing She had a face like thunder and announced there is no fish tonight Not I am sorry but   When asked why only one plate came out of the kitchen in 20 minutes - we were told that is how it works It would be helpful to explain this to guests at the start So we all ate a different times had to keep asking for bread  water  wine The escargot were just that The Veal chop was very good but at that price it better be Overall I would not recommend this restaurant It relies on the fact that it is in Mayfair and caters to the wealthy Well looking at the type of clientele whilst wealthy I think an educated guess is that they wouldn t know their burrata from the beurre and prefer to drink mint tea rather than wine But such restaurants don t get away with it in my book- If you are going to be that expensive get your s***t together and teach your staff some basic manners In time it will close I am sure For London does have options Oh yes I forgot  there are ripe tomatoes on the table with a lemon and some olive oil- the idea is you cut it up and make yourself a tomato salad while you wait for ever Next time there won t be I ll bring my own pots and cook myself a decent Italian meal at La Petite Maison

Was about to go into wetherspoons accross the road from here for generic vegetarian breakfast but then thought to myself i should support a local business and try something else Paying 7 80 for my Lemon Jelly vegetarian breakfast i was hoping for something a little bit special but what I got was a real let down Nuked hash browns tasted of tainted deep fat fryer fried potatoes blitzed just the same with no seasoning one manky egg tinned tomatoes ridiculously large amount of cheap beans one disgusting dry veggie sausage they forgot the mushrooms and when i asked for these they came out still bubbling having been zapped in the microwave and were clearly straight out of a tin and dripping in oil Absolutely disgusting me and totally not what my hangover was needing i pushed it round the plate for a bit then set off to find some gum to get the taste out of my mouth  This place is full of bohemian trinkets and makes out like its some artisan speakeasy when the reality is its an un-clean thrird rate hovel knocking out ultra budget careless meals at rip off prices

Very poor  Went in on a whim  Should have spent a bit more and visited Gourmet Burger Kitchen down the road Still you live and learn  Seated ok and ordered the double BBQ Texan burger fries and coke Service quick however things started to go rapidly downhill from there  Food arrived and a quick nibble of the fries found them to be cooked ok but cold I opened the very dry bun to view unmelted cheese on a couple of very over cooked burgers  I attempted to put ketchup in the burger however the plastic tomato shaped bottle had a broken top and when squeezed the top fell off ketchup poured out uncontrollably The top would not screw back in properly  Once I had removed copious amounts of ketchup from my burger and hands looked like I had just committed some sort of gruesome murder I took a bite of the burger The bun was very poor quality and broke apart after the first bite The meat was so overdone it was a chore getting through it and the Coke tasted like water if you re going to water the drinks down please don t make it too obvious   I ate it as I was hungry but it wasn t an enjoyable experience I advised the waiter that the the ketchup bottle was broken He just said  oh I m sorry about that  but didn t take it away from the table just left it there for the next poor victim  As someone else stated this joint is aimed at the 16-21 demographic who don t know any better  That was 45 minutes and a tenner I ll never get back Honestly spend a bit more and go to Gourmet Burger Kitchen for a quality burger experience

I was a guest at a corporate dinner so not really able to complain The main course was a lamb chop which was almost raw OK - I know that s fashionable for some unaccountable reason and so tough it was practically inedible The rest was mediocre at best Service was OK reception good - but that didn t compensate I ve been to numerous celebrity chef restaurants in London - happily always at someone else s expensive and this is definitely the worst dining experience I ve had
Not a bad wine bar  food good  shame about the manager and staff  and the 2 large glass s of Chablis  26 00
Very nasty low grade stuff called food Was it cooked Hard to call it that Was it served with care No way A pleasant meal - no way AVOID

Visited the harvest moon tonight and was hugely disappointed I went for the safe option of fish and chips which almost every pub manages to do well and was presented with a miserable piece of flat chewy fish encased in a thin bland batter A handful of pale chips and lukewarm mushy peas was the perfect accompaniment A waste of money

Although there are a number of different elements to a cooked breakfast none of the individual components are particularly complicated  I popped into the Yenton this morning for a breakfast I was the only one in there and nobody else showed up during the time of my stay I wonder if the locals know something I don t I ordered the sizzling breakfast This is served on a bed of potato and onion hash My error here because in my minds eye I had pictured mash potato mixed with onion something similar to perhaps a corned beef hash what arrived was diced potato and sliced onions swimming on a bed of oil- which creates the sizzling effect the pub chain is infamous for Never for one minute did I imagine that my breakfast would arrive sizzling like one of their steaks but it did Moreover the hash content accounts for approximately 50 of the breakfast  I waited for the sizzling to die down before tipping the baked beans out of their jug Immediately they began to fry in the oil and I had to wait a little longer for them to settle down  But what of the rest of the breakfast It was all well cooked The bacon tasted of onion The sausages tasted of onion The eggs tasted of onion The tomato tasted of onion The mushrooms tasted of onion and the baked beans  they tasted of onion I never did try the hash  The service was prompt although I did get the feeling they weren t expecting me or anyone else  Nobody took the slightest interest in asking if the meal was okay nor did they question anything when they took away a plate of food that wasn t much less than what was served  It s a real pity as the pub itself is spacious and comfortable Their problem is that there must be at least a dozen other places in the locality that serve breakfast and having tried most of them I conclude this is the worst breakfast in the Erdington Wylde Green Boldmere area

I live close to Hampstead and have been coming to Maison Blanc to buy my bread and pastries for the last 20 years and occasionally for tea I remember the time when the staff was mostly French students and the service very good The quality of the bread remains good  the prices have gone up excessively and the service has become absolutely SUBSTANDARD It is already a challenge to get served if you want to buy at the counter If you sit down you are lucky if you are aknowledged after 25 minutes and served within one hour Last Sunday we waited 45 minutes after placing our order and repeatedly enquiring about it and then we walked away It appears to be a combination of understaffing and non-existant staff training Do not give your custom and money to this establishment but to somebody else and there are many that deserves it

Terrible place As others have said pretentious food  terrible atmosphere You know you have stumbled into the wrong place when it has security which looks like the Hells Angels dressed in black This is a restaurant in Hertfordshire why on earth would it need security - let alone so much Soon found out The establishment have very rude arrogant staff In particular the door men During our visit  I witnessed one of the door men being rude and arrogant towards a customer  and then at the end of the night actually punch the customer in the back of the head Yes- this actually happened I have not ever been to a restaurant club bar where the security actually strike the customers Maybe the customer complained about the staff Needless to say I won t be going back Avoid at all costs
The food was cold and salty and the service was good the Yorkshire puddings were soggy and the mash was lumpy and we had to wait 5 minutes for the chef to carve the meat

Over half an hour wait for 5 rather simple meals soup 2 x chicken wraps bacon roll and a cheese toastie The chicken was dry My tea was stone cold when my radio active soup arrived We were outside when it started to drizzle the manageress just looked on whilst chatting away when we attempted to put the brolly up Someone did come out to help But needed a handle the manageress was still chatting away inside Poor service not just for us the poor chap behind us faired worse as they d lost his order completely My advice a packed lunch would be a better plan

I can safely sat that I had the worst meal ever in Olives restaurant Colchester Was out with a friend and we both had the Greek fave Stiffado We were presented with a red looking soup with near to raw onions and 4 bits of meat We both wanted veg but they didn t have any so opted for chips The chips had been part cooked and were dry and shrivelled The worst part is that the Chef thought it was ok to serve up as a 13 main and when I quizzed him what on earth he thought this dish was he found it amusing and only had one dish left so split it into two   nice touch then added a load of water to it  Run this fool out of town

I was left starving after finishing my pathetic starter sized portion of veggie Quesadilla which annoyingly cost just as much as my friends giant meat options Also the menu left a lot to be desired as far as vegetarian options were concerned

Where do I start The finger sandwiches were dry scantly filled with the thinnest cheese I had ever seen They were also triangles not fingers but that pails to insignificance to the lack of taste to the sandwiches the lack of strength to the coffee The cakes were ok but they had run out of one of our choices  In short very over priced for what it was and clearly playing on the Austen name There are many other places to get tea in Bath I wish I had paid to go to the pump rooms than eat this debacle

Went there for food and drinks stood at the lounge bar and the barmaid ignored us four times server others who had just walked after us so I would not recommend this place and won t be going back there again

My partner and I ate at the swan for the first time on the evening of sat 14 June and i can honestly say that I will never return In short the pub is tatty and threadbare and the food was terrible and expensive My partner order the stroganoff and I had the lamb casserole Whilst the food was brought to us quickly the quality was appalling The stroganoff had a woman s long hair in it and was glutinous and tasteless The casserole was a tasteless mash of cheap mechanically recoverd lamb flesh and potatoes accompanied by reheated vegitables Truly the worst meal ever  The pub itself is in desperarate need of being refurbished The carpet in the lounge bar was threadbare and frayed The tables and chairs were old and worn The tables had not been cleaned when we arrived and we had to use the paper napkins to wipe the tables down as the staff did not seem to see presentation and cleanliness as part of service from a pub  All on all a terrible pub and best avoided

I live locally to this pub and have visited it often over the years In the last month I have visited the pub twice with friends and family for meals  The service is was poor on the first visit and some items on the quite limited menu were not available  On the second visit the service was even worse The personnel at this pub don t seem to have basic manners and have never heard of please and thank you Again there were choices on the menu which were not available Only half the order arrived and help was ultimately found in the kitchen as no serving staff could be found to assist One of the dishes was inedible  I spoke to the manager but he has not heard of customer service and certainly has no understanding of the concept of apology  It seems to me that the pub is very poorly managed by people with little or no experience of hospitaliy and even less knowledge of customer service  If you just want a pint I m sure it will be fine but if you are intending to eat avoid this pub until further notice

Had a poor lunch experience with my work colleague Not many customers in the restaurant and the service was still poor The food was average and very little presentation  Lunchtime special advertised but no menu provided inside very confusing  Hygienically the toilets are not cleaned like most places you can tell how clean a restaurant is by the toilets This place could do well but requires more attention at the correct times

Harvester loves to advertise their unlimited breakfast 7 days a week so I figured I d check it out I arrived a few minutes after opening time only to be told that they were all out of hot food followed by a bunch of excuses why nobody had gone for more before opening time Pretty much the most pitiful thing that can happen in an establishment whose business model is to sell food never mind at the start of the day Not impressed thanks for wasting my time

Starters were very nice to begin with but it all went down hill from there onwards Extremely slow for mains and the staff were more bothered about playing on there phones I then decided to go to the toilet but instead walked into a little asain family tucked up in bed which was very unexpected The curry was watery and rice was very dry which was vulgar  I ordered a drink which came in a dirty glass i found this very unhygienic would advise against this restaurant I m sure they are very hardworking but the quality an standard off the restaurant just isn t there I recommend Indian Flava or Ahmeds which are located on the same road
My boss took me and the guys out for lunch and whilst I enjoyed it going down I didn t enjoy it coming out Like my Chinese but sorry wont recommend this place but guess other s may enjoy it

Do not go here took them long enough to take our order let alone serve our food Took well over an hour for our food to arrive with no warning or apology One of our party left because it was taking that long and they refused to let me leave until i paid for his food blocking me from leaving the restaurant for ten minutes whilst they ignored the rest of their grumpy customers When the food arrived it was poor quality incredibly mild despite asking for medium hot and lacking any real flavour I love Indian food and living in London often go to tooting which is the hidden home of curry I can only recommend that you try everywhere to get a table before heading here

Dont bother trying to get in if your male It seems to be optional to them to let men in  We werent drunk or dressed like yobs I d suggest to steer well clear  Absolutely disgusting   being on call lane and not letting men in can only make you wonder if the management are homophobic

Well what can I say After perusing all available restaurants in the area we were staying we plumped for this place The website looked promising But overall  not a good choice The service  most attentive The beer  good The food  I had to check my shoes to see if they have used the soles for the steak dish dreadful hard overcooked and tasteless The fish was certainly cooked  from frozen  tuna should never be associated with this eatery and neither should the replacement salmon Both were very dry overcooked and looked so forlorn on the plate The dish of vegetables  minus serving spoons  was plonked-cold-in the middle of the table We felt so deflated The wine helped to wash this fresh food down but I would never contemplate going to this restaurant again Caveat emptor
Overpriced vulgar food rude staff and extremely unclean   Avoid avoid avoid  Have no suggestions for improvement needs to be closed down and start again

We visited last year and were appalled at how poorly this business was run there was a wedding tent in the field so all the drinks pumps were in there and you could not get a drink unless you wanted a cider in a bottle We ordered a meal and my father in law s steak was 50 50 fat and meat I ordered a steak with pepper sauce which was all the female chef could make in sauces my steak arrived without the sauce so I asked is my sauce coming  the reply I got from the so called chef was it s pointless now you ll have eaten yer steak by the time yer sauce is ready  Our friends went for a hog roast sandwich party the next evening and got cold pork sandwiches which had most probably been left over from the wedding hog roast the evening before BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE
