Two friends and I visited The Encore on Monday 3rd June 2013 at 17 35 prior to seeing a show at The Mayflower Although the bar was crowded there were several empty tables I managed to order our food at 17 49 and the bar staff didn t say that there would be a delay before the food arrived The other tables soon filled up Two of our meals arrived 55 minutes after we d ordered However the third meal a steak didn t arrive until 18 57 This last meal should have included mushrooms - but it didn t I was going to complain at this stage but the bar was then extremely crowded and there seemed to be very few bar staff The people at the next table actually received their food before we did although they had ordered after us There didn t seem any logical reason why other tables were also receiving their meals before we did On finishing our food two of us went to the loo and whilst we were there the people on the next table complained to the manageress and were given a refund Unfortunately there wasn t time for us to complain as we then had to rush to the theatre If you are going to to eat at The Encore I would suggest you should allow at least 2 hours The last time we visited this pub was in 2012 when the food also took far too long to be served We won t be going there again William Dawson

I ve been to this place to order a pizza and was served for a very grumpy middle aged bald man who clearly had no customer services skills whatsoever Of course you wouldn t expect a 5 star service in a mediocre place like this however the gentleman not sure if I should call him that didn t even thank me and made me feel that I was getting the pizza for free Horrible service

Decided to give koyla a try last Sunday never again The venue is massive probably one of the biggest in Leicester however wasnt busy at all when we visited Ordered burger meals for the kids each had to open the bun as no filling was visible tiny chicken fillet with bun three times the size Ordered mixed grill lamb chops weren t lamb it was mutton kebab was also mutton no wings tandoori chicken on a mixed grill Most of the items on the mixed grill hadn t been grilled tiny portions of each and tasteless Chicken karahi had little or no chicken in it just tasteless curry sauce Chicken steak was tiny portion with tasteless mushroom sauce Cheesy chips covered in cheap wholesale cheese which wasn t cheesy at all Kids didn t find burger meal filling so ordered a further two kids meals chicken pieces with chips was expecting chicken strips however we got tiny chicken pieces deep fried 25 chicken 75 batter kids hated both their meals I am trying to be positive but food quality wise there is nothing good about Koyla they are awful you will find better food at local takeaways For all my trouble the bill came to 55 00 wow crap food at expensive prices with tiny portions  don t waste time and money going to Koyla

We booked this place for a staff do as it seemed the menu catered for everyone but they neglected to say - 70 of your food will be deep fried and you ll have to guess which is which oh and the rest is chips   Vegetarians beware Actually anyone with taste buds beware - even Scott said it was awful and he s a gannet We had a great time because the booze was cheap and the group dynamic worked We could have had 14 square pizza EACH for the same price down the road with change for a pint Never been a fan of Wethers  s and this trip didn t change my mind

Reception was frosty at best White guy with the bald head if management are reading or care Had to wait for 5 minutes for our table while others walked in without delay but hey they re busy I understand  Sat down to be told you understand how this works  well no we ve never been before but the waiter reiterated his mantra a few times Fortunately we ve been to buffet style places like this before so yes  we know how this works  ie Get your own sides salad and then wait for the meat to be bought round   We visited the sides bar which was generally good although waiting for the meat was horrendous Considering we paid ~ 26 a head minus drinks  the amount of times the meat guys came round was awful and when they did they shaved off very small portions Towards the end of the meal I felt like they were avoiding us perhaps because they wanted the table back we d been an hour at this point  In fact I m being polite they WERE avoiding us I actually had to shout after the waiters for the meat as they served all of the tables around us yes our green paddles were up  At one point my wife had to leave her seat as a waitresses with the dessert tray wanted to get through  That same waitress when ordering a drink told us that there was no way you could order a rioja from the bar by the glass despite getting one 15 minutes ago We settled for a couple of glasses of malbec which of course turned out to be rioja when they turned up -P In terms of the main attraction the meat  well the portions were small and tough In summary this place is very middle of the road with sub par food and service that leaves our local Hungry Horse look amazing Pretty awful

Looking forward to a superb christmas lunch we were very dissapointed The Turkey if indeed if it was Turkey appeared to be from a preformed meat roll which tasted more of pork than anything Potatoes were cold and burnt sausage raw Need we say more Worst Christmas lunch we have had

Very poor service as the first customer I was rewarded with sitting right next to a pile of tables  Food is awful desert is just Mr Kipling slices and the chocolate cake is next door in Iceland for 1  Service was shocking we were guided in like cattle and all squashed together despite there being lots of free space in the restaurant  I was only allowed to have the drinks menu for about 5 minutes before it was stolen by the staff for another table I think there was only 1 in the whole place  Drinks are limited and you have to go to the bar yourself there is no drinks to table service  Cash payments only  Food was poorly cooked unseasoned bland dry just uninteresting 1 star

Our appetizers came with many flaws too many to list but as an example the chilli that garnished the plate had mold in it We told the manager and we have this impression that its not the first time he heard about this before at the restaurant possibly due the quality of the food maybe Nevertheless he listened and even invited us to the drinks we had ordered and were going to pay for We decided not to stay any longer to find out how the second course is going to be and move to the pub up the road

Do not waste your time with this appalling venue  The food is horrendous  The customer service is despicable  The management clearly do not know what they are doing  I came here with some friends a while back for some food and drink and the food was late cold uncooked and quite honestly a joke  I won t be coming here again and I suggest that you don t too

ordered 2 x fish suppers to eat in waited 20 minutes both fish were very small in portion and breaded coating huge to disguise fish size chips all covered in grease and mostly small chips as if left overs were being served including tea for two 20 complained to management and paid for one meal only guess what will definitely not be back

We were told by the man on the till that there would be a 20 minute wait Not a good start Went to the cutlery and there were three knives left two of which were not just dirty they still had food attached Within minutes of sitting down with one knife between us it became clear that something was seriously wrong The lady behind us had been waiting almost ONE HOUR for food and there was no food exiting the kitchen in fact it appeared there was no cook She challenged the man on the till and demanded to see a manager Without her fortitude we may still be waiting now but thankfully our meals arrived just over 45 minutes later The food was good - considering - and the waiter apologised to everyone but too little too late I m afraid Never again
The meal was massively salty pizza very black and burnt waitress said  will mention it to the chef  - that was it

Went to try the newest bar in Norton and very disappointed  Do you have any Magners - No Do you have any Blue WKD - No Well I will have a pint and a half of draught cider then - That ll be 6 60 Drunk up and went to Wetherspoons and Magners 2 09 a bottle I will never visit again
i dont think the lady wanted to be working only two customers and you can see why lady was unfriendly food was okay but to much for what you get i wouldnt go back for food
Overpriced Inedible meatballs Long wait  Wouldn t recommend to know one they only get away with because of the location

Long wait to place order long wait then for food Food had actually been cremated  So called manager flippant about the food complaint behind the customers back No wonder this chain are in trouble NEVER AGAIN

We booked this restaurant for a table for four on a Saturday night all well and good We arrived and asked the staff about our booking and they replied with oh we already have a table taken in that name she asked me my phone number which I left when we booked the table she said yes that s you but someone has your table The waitress then went and asked the party that had stolen my table to leave but they refused so we were left without a table there were 2 tables spare which they didn t offer to push together although it may have been a bit awkward They just told us we could return later by which time it would have been around 10 so we declined and had a delicious meal at the Ghurka restaurant over the road

Food was lukewarm and bland  A party of four     Sheek kebab starter was almost tasteless only saved by the fact we had kept the pickle tray and were thus able to make it palatable  Main courses somewhat insipid - one of the chicken dishes was like chewing leather and the Lamb Rogan Josh was almost bereft of meat which was dry and chewy  The worst part was that one of our party ordered a chicken main course    on cutting a piece of the meat it was discovered she had been served lamb my friend only eats chicken fish  We called over a waitress who merely said OH  and walked away A waiter arrived and asked what the problem was    without speaking further he turned and walked away    then another waiter arrived and said it was their mistake surprise surprise we knew what we ordered and it would take some time to cook the correct dish as the restaurant was busy We told him we couldn t wait as we had an appointment to make So his response was I ll leave the lamb with you otherwise I ll just take it away and bin it And as a parting remark he added I won t charge you for it  No offer to provide an alternative no offer of a drink on the house    my friend was left without a main course  So if you love bland food poor customer service and a couldn t care less attitude this is the place you have been looking for

Visited the Maynard Arms this week with my family thought we would try lunch Tables were very sticky obviously wiped with an old beer cloth Asked for lunch menu was told to wait while they printed us 4 from upstairs In the meantime we ordered 4 coffees which were luke warm When the menus arrived we found the prices to be quite expensive so we asked if they did a lunch menu we were told they have sandwiches Beef and horseradish @ 7 each    mmmmm 28 for 4 sandwiches I think not  Needless to say we left and will not be returning Maynard Arms - maybe ok for evening drinking sessions but forget the food  unless you want to eat overpriced sandwiches on sticky tables An absolute shower
Service was shocking one waiter kept shouting over tables took forever to get the food never offered more drinks When food came it was rank and now my toilet is paying the price

I ordered online despite the expensive prices compared to others and the delivery charge on top I was quoted a 45 minute wait on the website and got a confirmation on the website but no email After 1 1 2 hours I called to see where my food was and was put on hold for 5-10 mins only to be told that they could not find my order They offered to cook it for me at the top of the queue and deliver it but that it would be more than 30 mins I told them not to bother as I would use a local St Albans takeaway instead That food arrived before the expedited Paya order would have arrived

One problem with this place is that they refuse to take bookings which if you like dining later in the evening leaves you very little option if you are turned away For some strange reason it is very popular but when we finally did manage to get a table we found the menu slightly more adventurous than most however portions were not generous and I believe overpriced The worst thing about this gastro-pub is the rude and obnoxious landlord who seems to think he s doing you a great favour by allowing you to cross his threshold With so many other places to eat in the area we certainly won t be returning

Sadly nowadays Browns smacks of a complacent understaffed overpriced and ultimately way below par chain For a proven chain by the river hop over Eton bridge to Cote Brassiere If you re looking for anything else there are endless superior options up the high street  The 14 Sunday roast was cold and all the vegetables seemed like they d been sitting around for hours Paid an extra 1 50 for pigs in blankets  and received one sausage see photo  If Browns want to charge these prices they seriously need to up their game and fast Local independents like The Alma and Sebastian s Italian walk over their current offering with far better quality and value

There s a burger bar in a lay-by very close to the pub View just as good food much better As many others have said the management don t seem to care that the place is filthy The food was poor and the sorry about that comment from the waitress was as tired as the year-old fish on my plate

Visited for a quiet drink and a meal  I m sure its great if you are a local but not very welcoming and despite what the website states don t expect food after 2030 because that s what time the kitchen shuts - allegedly  Website states 2100 on a Friday and we got there at 2040 to be told kitchen shut even though one local was half way through a meal and another had a plate of hot food brought out to them at 2045  We definitely wont be going back

I m afraid we didn t read any reviews before purchasing Cod n chips twice Not sure about the Cod bit it was not white or flakey  The Cod was oozing oil when we ate it there was so much oil the fish had turned translucent the fish fillet was very skinny By contrast the chips amazingly were dry - some achievement that   I am not a master fryer that makes two of us  but I suspect that the oil was not hot enough it took a very long while to arrive This may be the cause of the greasiness  Considering that this place has been around for years I would have thought the proprietors would have perfected this frying game by now - it seems NOT

we witnessed a fight when we arrived around 6ish on a Saturday and the victim narrowly missed our table as he was sent reeling across the bar with a punch then a bit later on we were threatened by a pair of aggressive drunk meat-heads so we left Staff were lovely pub looks lovely but the drinks are ridiculously over-priced and the customers look like something out of TOWIE but more drunk and more likely to lash out  Never again

THERE IS A CAR PARKING SCAM OPERATING HERE  100 FINE IF YOU DECIDE NOT TO MAKE A PURCHASE I m a regular user of the A303 but have been hit with a 100 automated parking fine for stopping at the Micheldever Services To make things worse I ve been away and the penalty has become overdue meaning that there is no early payment discount and I assume I cant now contest it  Please note that this diner is Signposted as a Service area but it seems use of the services is dependant on you actually buying something I parked up walked in  didn t see any supposidly prominent signage used the facilities didn t fancy the food and drove away In all I was parked for 5 minutes  I don t see how the system can tell if purchases are made and can only assume the management note any customer that doesn t decide to eat there and earmarks his registration for the fine So there is no means of checking the menu without the 100 fine   Looking at earlier posts it seems the manager has rudely accosted potential customers in the car park if they don t spend money with him Now he has found a more lucrative way of penalising those that decide not to eat there  I will give the local police station a call as Im sure they will know all about it by now It seems that this kind of parking system may not be enforcable by law and we may be able to simply ignore it  this is the case with a lot of town centre supermarkets that try to protect their parking spaces in this way The fine supposedly goes up to 150 if I do so but it might be worth the risk for those that follow  I will report back with another review I have not reviewed the food but have commented on value for money service and atmosphere as they are directly associated to the dreadful management  I m on the A303 on Tuesday so will park up at the happy eater over the road avoiding another 100 fine and photograph the Prominent signs if I can find them Ill also ask for the manager and see what he or she has to say about their parking scene  Will report back with another review of course Next step will be to send this Tripadviser page to our friends at BBC watchdog They will love to send a camera crew down to have a look  IN THE MEANTIME I URGE YOU TO DRIVE PAST THIS MEAN SPIRITED ESTABLISHMENT
Had a Caesar Salad for lunch The souroundingss are good but the food did not taste very fresh and I felt unwell for a few days after I would not go back

Im loathed to givevthis place one star we called in last nightbfor a take away the place was very quiet anyway we ordered got home found that we had not been given the correct meal we were minus a satay   we dished out found the shumai not cooked infact the pork was raw   the rice was okay although the special rice dish was very poor  Overall we will not be back here ever

Visited with work for a quick lunch A lot was sold out so we opted for a fried chicken special it was awful truly had I know they are students but still   When we said how poor the food was we were told it was because it was a special so hadn t been cooked before  We were still expected to pay if it wasn t a college and they were students there s no way we would have Not going back

Ordered a carvery but it was the worst experience I have ever had The meat portions are a joke and the woman scowls at you if you have to do an interpretation of Oliver Twist and dare to ask for some more The vegetables looked very tired and had been there for some time Overall a very bad experience and we will not be returning until someone else with Restaurant experience is running the place

On Saturday 6th April I took my wife Son Daughter and Son Inlaw to the living room to celebrate my wifes 60th birthday When we arrived the doors were held open by two men on the door who at first made us feel very welcome but then I noticed that they had stopped my 29 year old son and were looking in his bag They then refused to let him in because of his footwear They said they were trainers but the were black pumps not trainers I told them they were being ridiculous We left and went next door into Browns where we were made very welcome I spent 85 in drinks alone in Browns if the Livingroom does not need the money they are going the right way about it as none of us will be going back there

Having been before the service was ok until we returned on our visit to London on 26th December the food was not the same and a member of staff had cleared the table before even asking and would not answer when i asked why she had cleared out table and drinks we had not finished she was rude and found the staff was not that friendly at all would not go back again

A friend and I saw a Groupon deal of 25 off the total bill so we decided to give it ago When we were seated we showed the deal they refused to accept it saying the code wasn t working so I gave them another code from the same app on my phone and they still wouldn t except it After placing our order to the rudest staff I ve experienced in a restaurant we waited for almost an hour to bring the warm slop they call food to the table Once that was kept down some how we asked for the bill the service charge isn t optional good job them as no one would tip I then PAID I gave the money to the waiter and then went to walk out the waitress shouted across the restaurant YOU HAVEN T PAID  With the restaurant looking at us I pointed to the waiter I gave the money too and she turned her back to us and walked off This place is the worst Restaurant  if you can call it that I have ever eaten in Save your money and go to any other place its Brighton there are plenty of restaurants to choose from

Came here for dinner in the evening and definitely won t be returning Not for food anyway Had a decent pint and the place seems to have a good atmosphere for somewhere to go for a drink but the food is rubbish  I had steak and chips and the chips were pretty much inedible Steak wasn t great had lots of fatty bits and not the tastiest steak I ve ever had Badly presented too My fianc€÷e had the gourmet burger There was nothing gourmet about it It looked pretty awful and didn t taste much better than it looked There were some of the listed ingredients missing too  We left most of the food and had to have toast when we got home to make up for it  Rubbish Should have known when we had to peel open the menu which had obviously had many a drink spilt on it in the past

Thought we d give it a go despite some mediocre reviews - sorry we did  General shambolic service and mediocre food sums it up Took ages to take our order starter plates left for 15mins + and mains arrived whilst plates still on table We heard the chef ring the bell at least 5 times whilst our pizzas were sitting waiting to be served  And lo and behold when the days pizzas arrived they were cold and of course 1 was wrong  Surly manager dealt with it in stroppy way as he did with another table who complained about cold food  When correct pizza arrived was pretty void of any taste  Asked for bill twice and it took ages Have feedback to manager who clearly shouldn t be in hospitality and obv this wasn t well received  Other tables around us had similar issues  A truly dreadful place that is not cheap and needs a serious rethink overhaul
Horrible little pub Went there for a cup of tea and was met with a dirty depressing room Coffee was awful Staff unbelievably sour and rude Avoid this place at all costs would give it 0 if I could

My husband and I visited this restaurant on the 17th Oct We was very disappointed the atmosphere here is totally wrong The staff do not seem bothered if you have to wait to be served as we saw 4 staff members standing around the bar talking There was not a lot to choose from on the menu and the food we did have was a let down I had the marguerita pizza which cost 7 95 and it was dry and chewy The spaghetti Bolognese for 9 45 was filling but had hardly any meat and the meat it did have was under all the spaghetti We had 3 scoops of ice cream for dessert each and that took forever to arrive and then cost 9 50 I wouldn t recommend this restaurant and we will not being going back

First visit and last visit to the Sukhothai restaurant whilst eating the spicy prawn crackers discovered a long dark hair in my mouth on telling the waitress a cursory apology was offered should have left then  but decided to order big mistake prawn tom yum soup was mainly flavoured with hard raw pieces of ginger chosen curry was no better ginger once again with the addition of whole raw chillies probably one of the worst meals I have ever had

Thought I would try this place but was surprised that when I ordered an apple juice I got a Child s portion and then had to wait over 20 minutes for a burger fries and slaw To be honest the burger meat tasted like it came from a can Over 13 was a BIG price I would suggest BK or Mickey D s next time you fancy a burger save time money and get a better burger

I have been to San Carlo a few times and despite this being one of Manchester s most highly regarded places to eat i will never ever go back again  The food isn t all that bad I suppose though when asked to put Palma ham on a pizza we were given the sort of wet packet ham one would expect in a Tesco caf€÷  The real problem with this place is the service It is truly terrible I am sure if Ryan Giggs Shrek or any of the rest of there friends ate at San Carlo and judging from the tacky photographs on the wall they often do you would be treated like a king However if you are lucky enough to be a mere mortal and don t go to work wearing red or blue strip you re a nobody and are treated at best as minor incontinence  So unless you have just been signed by Sir Alex or have the misfortune to resemble Shrek don t bother with San Carlo as all you will served with is a healthy dose of contempt

We arrived at the restaurant around 5 00pm in the afternoon on an evening in which we had planned a date night Upon arrival the staff were friendly and keen to seat us We were promptly served drinks and were given time to place our order and was very happy with the service so far  Around ten minutes after ordering our food it was delivered to us in a efficient manner with no omissions However we had only received our starters and around half way through eating them our mains were given to us without prior question as to whether we had finished our starters and were ready for our mains This was something that really put us off wanting to eat the main as we hadn t finished the first course One meal that was ordered was the Steak and Rib Combo - upon starting to eat and cut into the steak I discovered that it was in fact cooked medium to rare instead of being cooked medium to well after asking specifically for my steak to be cooked more on the well done side than medium  I pointed this out to another server and they apologised and quickly took my meal away to be re-cooked I received my replacement meal around 5-8 minutes afterwards and I checked my steak and this was cooked how it had been asked - which I was pleased about - HOWEVER upon finishing the steak I moved onto the ribs to find that these were under cooked and tasted bland and fatty I was really disappointed with this as I have had it many times before in other Harvester restaurants and this one in particular and have never been disappointed with a meal  I understand that there can be some changes in taste and cooking between Harvester restaurants but I did not think the quality could drop so drastically across the board  When having left 3 4 of the meal ribs chips and peas - only eating the steak the server came to collect our plates and asked if things were all right in which I responded with my disappointment I was also unhappy that nobody had done a check back with my replacement meal in which this situation could have been avoided  According to the server who is called Leanne there was nothing she could do about my meal as I had eaten a part of it which was acceptable and left that which was not - in which her response included the words You have eaten your meal so I cant do anything about that or give you a refund   With working in this industry - I understand the necessary protocols involved in dealing with an unhappy customer and I recognise that this was not one of them I did not get offered anything for free such as a drink or dessert and had to complain again before Leanne stated that the only thing she could do was take 20 off my meal on the bill  I accepted this reluctantly as my partner and I had other things planned for our date night so we then asked for the bill Upon receiving the bill - we then waited a whole 21 minutes for anyone to even realise or respond to our call about the money we were paying with and this made us extremely late for our other engagements as we did not simply want to walk out and not pay at all  We are extremely disappointed in the service and food - from Leanne in particular and we shall be reluctant to visit this Harvest again anytime soon  As a side note - it is notable that the standard of food and service slips when you are not busy as at this time the restaurant had 3 tables in when we arrived and they had all being fed  Very very very disappointed
Tried to call in after a long walk on Tuesday 29 July at 1430 hours No sign of life despite hours advertised on door stating that it was open until 1500 hrs Annoying

I attended with a party of 28 for a lunch at this lovely looking public house in the picturesque village of Littlebourne Kent  That is as far as the favourable comments can extend On Tuesday 8th January 2013 I had pre-orders sausages eggs and chips followed by apple pie and custard  My main course arrived with two eggs which were not well cooked at all and which I sent back The plate came back with the eggs now cooked more thoroughly but from the length of time I would guess that the original two had simply been removed from my plate put in the fryer and then put back Unfortunately a lot of grease ended up on the plate with them so much so that the chips became soggy and inedible  Whilst this was taking place a member of the party at my table had still not been served his scampi and chips and didn t actually get it until some time after I had finished my first course  There were no apologies for either of these issues from either of the two waitresses who appeared very young inexperienced and to be perfectly honest clueless  The desert eventually arrived but I was told that they had run out of custard Then the custard magically arrived The pie was clearly a store or frozen food company product with that typical taste of processed filling as well as soggy pastry on the bottom Obviously not heated correctly In addition to that the clueless waitresses provided us all with a soup spoon for the desert and still didnt understand what wrong they had done when it was pointed out to them A soup spoon is fine for soup and for custard but not for an apple pie as well After the lunch I went to pay The landlord was behind the bar smiling expectantly and then asked what I thought of the apple pie I was not over enthusiastic about giving the feedback but he invited comment and I told him I wish I hadn t because at the merest hint of a criticism he went off into a big explanation about how cheap the meal was and that he had provided a meal for 28 people which was not usual for a lunch time I can understand why it is not usual to serve that many covers because the food and service are dire to say the least  My answer to this and any landlord or manager of any food outlet is that if you don t want feedback don t ask and if you do and get honest feedback please act on it so if that manager is reading this please do something about your dining facilities all round As for anyone reading this you go at your own risk as far as I am concerned

Visited London 24th April 2013 from Suffolk as a special treat for my wife & myself Attracted to enter Wolf s restaurant after reading outside menu offering fixed lunch for 10 95 Asked what we wanted to drink ordered wine for my wife Then given menu On perusal lunch menu was 18 50 Requested fixed menu on arrival of drink Informed fixed menu not on due to business booked lunches Complained to manageress on leaving immediately who by her demeanour could not have cared less about our predicament Outside menu was not changed DO NOT VISIT unless you have an expense account

On thing to say about Rare is that it looks bloody good The decoration is everything you would want from a Steak House naked brick walls wood everywhere a gaudy metal Bull and low lighting You feel like you re about to have a fantastic experience You aren t  The restaurant is fairly popular among locals and students of nearby Keele University and this is possibly more out of having nowhere else to go rather than actually enjoying the experience I feel therefore that now the restaurant has realised there isn t anywhere else for patrons to go that there is no reason to try and get customers to return The food is average at best the steaks are cooked to order  but somehow medium rare  medium and Rare all come out the same  No condiments were offered and with a young child at the table Ketchup was greatly missed However the cardinal sin of the Steak house was how much fat there was on one of our party s T-bone steak It was inedible and was sent back The other two steaks at the table were of good quality but unfortunately amateurly cooked More over they had not been left to rest and came swimming in juices causing everything else to be sodden It is however the service that is the real cause for concern Having to wave down a waitress like a taxi service in London every time a drink order was needed was simply unacceptable and one girl seemed determined to not have to engage with our table at all when at one point she did take our order her monosylabbic hosting was straight from the School of Basil Fawlty  The waitresses just seemed uninterested in serving and more interested in socialising with friends that were drinking at the bar Just when I thought it couldn t get much worse a couple were seated at the table next to us and had to ask for the table to be cleaned This in itself was horrendous but when Basil Fawlty appeared with a squirter and promptly squirted their table whilst they were sat in distance of spray back myself and the woman at the table shared a look of not knowing whether to laugh or leave It was unbelievable a damp cloth would have sufficed or perhaps a move to a more sanitary table in the almost empty restaurant but to literally moisten your guests is beyond reproach  As can be expected a tip was not left and I can only think that they must be on an extraordinary hourly wage as no effort was made whatsoever  For 3 adults starter and main with no alcohol one under 5 chicken nuggets and ice cream the bill came in at 98 which for what it was was inexplicably expensive New staff are needed I m afraid or massive retraining it felt like we had walked in to amateur hour and expected Gordon Ramsay to be sat in the corner shaking his head to appear at any moment There s so much potential for this restaurant but until the Steak house can find a chef that can cook a steak properly and some waitresses that are capable of waiting it will stay at the low level eatery it is I can t stress how much I want this restaurant to be good but it just isn t and the management would do well to read the reviews they are getting and act on them not try and continue what they are doing as it does not work

We were really looking forward to the jazz evening at Stanmer House It started well - a friendly greeting by nicely dressed polite staff and a drink in the bar When we were shown to our table it started to fall apart though  dim lighting made it difficult to read the menu the lack of soft furnishings like curtains meant there is nothing to soak up the sound so we were having to shout over the noise we had to share a long table with maybe 30 other people - that wasn t mentioned when we booked it We ended up moving to another room where we couldn t hear the music but at least we could hear each other Food Mushrooms on toast - a personal favourite - mushrooms were dirty gritty cold and tasteless so very disappointing I couldn t eat it The waiter was informed and he reported back from the chef that it was down to the preparation Steak - really nicely cooked and very tender It would have been better hot though Potato - lukewarm and it tasted reheated Kale greens - again stone cold Sticky toffee pudding - no complaints here - loved it Service - very polite and friendly but not enough of them so we were often waiting a long time to be dealt with Earphones also make the staff look like bouncers Overall we were very disappointed and we had a lousy evening We re not the sort of people to complain normally but this was a terrible evening the food was disappointing and the experience unpleasant We can t recommend the Stanmer House Jazz evening at all AVOID

Went to the labour in vain tonight with high hopes as we had heard that it had been turned around and was serving lovely food With all the positive reviews I had previously read we were looking forward to an enjoyable evening Both my partner and I were left highly disappointed due to slow service and poor quality food I myself am I chef - maybe not a michelen star chef but I am aware of value for food and good service To begin with we were greeted by a member of staff who did not seem to know where our reserved table was After he had eventually found it and we were seated we waited at least 10 minutes for the waiter to present us with the menu As he passed us the menu he informed us that service would possibly be a bit slower than usual as they also had a party of 20 to attend to on another table This was fine as he had informed us beforehand so we agreed to order He then took a further 15 minutes at least before coming back to us to take our order My partner chose the chicken ballentine and was thoroughly looking forward to it Unfortunately she had to choose an alternative after the waitress informed her that there was no chicken left Eventually she opted for the sirloin steak with a side of diane sauce After a long wait our meals finally arrived however my partner was told her sauce would take another few minutes to arrive - this was apparently due to the pot washer throwing away the sauce as he had assumed the pan was dirty Either the waitress made this up to cover the chef who may have forgotten it or the sauce really looked that bad the pot washer thought it needed throwing away When the so called diane sauce finally came it seemed to be more of a gravy-like consistency with a few added chopped mushrooms and pepper Her meal itself had gone cold as the sauce had taken so long to arrive and I had almost finished just as she was starting Her steak was fatty and most definitely not worth the price stated The only positive aspect was that it was cooked as she had asked and it was tender enough to eat I ordered the duo of pork which was edible but very dry and in need of a sauce Again not up to standards for the price we paid Once we had finished our meals the waiter came to the table and asked if it was ok to take our plates  he never once asked if we has enjoyed our meals Another 10 minutes or so later after a few glares from the staff the waitress came to offer dessert and more drinks To this we refused and requested the bill As we were about to pay she finally decided to ask if we had enjoyed our meals After explaining the issue with the steak she apologised and deducted 10 from the bill  Just a few pointers for staff to consider in the future - Saturday nights are one of the most busy nights of the week it is common sense to ensure a reasonable amount of staff are available - especially when you have a party of 20 in that particular night Secondly ensure the chef is able to handle the pressure of a busy demanding restaurant Aside from the party of 20 the restaurant was otherwise fairly quiet If tonight s service is anything to go by I dread to think what it would be like in busier times  All in all very disappointed customers A real let down after reading all the positive reviews beforehand Poor quality of food and slow unprofessional service Would not recommend

My previous reviews on 15th June 2014 and 20th June 2015 extolled the virtues of the Met New owners took charge earlier this year My last review on 7th July 2016 expressed concerns about the food  Having again visited the Met twice in late August I can only concur with the ever-growing Tripadvisor reviews that express dissatisfaction with a place that only recently was still enjoying its reputation as one of the go to dining venues on the island  How it has slumped in recent times The menu is now so restricted Why  The staff do not seem to be anywhere near as interested or friendly as the old guard Why  The quality of the food is patently in decline Why So disillusioned are we that we don t intend to spend another minute in the place until the current management wake up and sort out its obvious shortcomings Why is the Met slip sliding away like this I am not a competitor to the Met I am just a holidaymaker and they should be very concerned by these unflattering Tripadvisor reviews What does the management feel about these reviews Do they feel they are not genuine Do they intend to address or ignore their customers complaints  Tip for the management - get the old staff back to start with They were the embodiment of the place and made me want to come back again and again On one two-week holiday we dined at the Met 12 evenings out of 14 That s how good they were  I bear no malice to the new owners I just want the old Met back Please get a grip before the place is reduced to an empty shell The location of the Met on the sea front is wonderful but that alone is not sufficient The deficiencies need to sorted and quick We are genuinely concerned

We visited this restaurant with a kgb voucher with a face value of 51 for two people In spite of terms to the contrary within the voucher they insisted that we were only allowed to use a limited cheap budget Set Menu at approx  12 per head which we naturally declined  We do not like to use restaurants that appear to lack integrity and honesty

We will not be visiting this place again and would not recommend to anyone the owner Brenda behaved appallingly towards us We visited it to celebrate my sister in laws 50th birthday the meal was but not worth anything like what they charge the worse part was after our meal  My 11 year old daughter had just learned to play her first piece of music on piano and she offered to play this piece to her birthday girl aunt we asked the waitresses if this was ok and they were more than happy to allow and helped set a nearby piano up my daughter was playing her piece beautifully with her aunt at her side enjoying it when Brenda strolled up and put a stop to the music half way through it saying that use of the piano was not allowed We told her that her staff had agreed to us using it but this seemed to cut no ice whatever and she simply said they must not be aware of the ban on its use This is her problem not ours of course my daughter was mortified and embarrassed and my sister in law incandescent with rage we explained to Brenda that she was out of order as we had been given clear approval to play the piano and the waitresses could see it was for a very genuine and sweet reason by my daughter  if this is how Brenda sees fit to treat returning customers how had paid a lot of money for their night out then i believe all trip advisor users should know and should boycott this pub and teach these people that they cannot get away with treating customers in such a shabby way

Went last Sunday for the carvary wasn t very good the Turkey was reformed meat the Yorkshire pudding was soggy and flat hardly any veg will not be going again and for the price there s much better pubs just down the road caister castle to name one

Awful service - waitress miss-ordered several times and then spilt the red wine all over the table and then no one cleared it up When the wine finally made it to the glass it was off so I sent it back and called the manager Mario over to try to halt the catalogue of errors and change waitress  Mario s response was to pick a fight He told me the wine was perfectly OK  it was vinegar  I told him that if he attitude continued I would happily share my experience on-line you don t threaten me Mr was his delightful response  The food was very bad Chicken schnitzel stringy over-cooked and dry fish cake was tiny  Mario did apologise in the end Not before he ruined our evening response

Went here because my children wanted to  Maybe it s because this restaurant is new but I don t want to be your guinea pig  Arrived without a booking and were seated straight away  The decor is faux American  Took drinks orders and they took 20 minutes to arrive Then we ordered two children s meals and I order steak and frites with a blue cheese sauce  After around a further 30 minutes the food turned up and the sauce was clearly mushroom Questioned it and was told it was mushroom with blue cheese No It was mushroom I know mushroom sauce with zero cheese in it when I see it and taste it  There were only two sets on knives and forks on the table Despite there being three of us No more cutlery was forthcoming  The steak was cooked medium rare as requested But it was the cheapest fat ridden inedible steak I think I have ever tasted For 16 I don t expect Cafe de Paris but I do expect not to have to take take a pneumatic drill to it It was truly awful  Nobody came over to ask if our meal was OK  My daughter s Mac n Cheese was plastered in pepper and we ran out of drinks without anyone making any sort of eye contact  We had to ask someone to clear our table and I mentioned again that the virtually untouched sauce was clearly mushroom They went to the kitchen and again came back to tell me that the sauce was blue cheese and mushroom  When a third member of staff came over we were asked if we would like the bill Regardless of the fact that dessert came with the children s meal and we hadn t actually asked for the bill  Ordered two portions of ice cream  They took 30 minutes to come and arrived without spoons  We had to ask for spoons from the I m too cool to serve you girl behind reception  Ice cream finished it was then another 15 minutes before I had to go find someone to clear the table and give us the bill  The bill arrived and mushroom sauce was on it It wasn t what I ordered but hey they wanted their 1 95  I m fairly easy to please but this was arguably the worst restaurant I have ever been in The food was bland inedible the service was atrocious and prices did not reflect the poor quality on show  Oh And when the bill turned up apparently I had ordered mushroom sauce  Avoid  Avoid at all costs  Get a meal deal from Tesco a few doors down  Utterly utterly dreadful 1 out of 5 is being polite

Apologies for the lengthy review Not the norm from me but a lot to cover unfortunately Asked what draught beer they had and hearing Cobra said yes please I m sure I heard the bottle being opened out of sight because there were no pumps front of house We settled on Onion Bhaji and Sheek Kebab starters Rarely had either arrive without Yoghurt mint sauce before so asked for it The guy went 10 feet looked at his phone for a couple of minutes and forgot - Reminded when we caught his eye and he brought some Onion Bhaji s to be fair were OK Sheek Kebab not good As they had Vindaloo and Naga curries on the menu yes I like hot  asked which was hotter as both said Very Hot on menu Didn t seem too sure so I went for the Naga which was pretty hot but really just didn t taste nice flavour not heat  The Pilau rice was weird as well - just not like I m used to at other Indian restaurants and I eat at many nationwide Wife went for Chicken Tikka which again anywhere else arrives to the table sizzling and smelling fantastic Not here I m afraid and it didn t even look particularly appetising Pretty standard elsewhere it comes with Yoghurt mint sauce but had to ask again As you can imagine neither of us cleaned our plates  Just about to ask for the bill when 2 dishes of Ice Cream appeared We looked at each other and smiled At least they can t get that wrong I said  Some of it tasted it like vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce on but neither of us got half way through it as there was a strange texture to it that didn t taste of anything - My wife said get the bill quick before they bring anything else Bill arrived and was completely wrong as we were on a Groupon Same waiter had taken the printed details when we arrived and before we ordered even explaining what we could have as standard and or pay extra for if we wanted Seemed he forgot as they were obviously so busy Sarcasm as there was already another table of two when we arrived and another table of two arrived while we were eating  With the bill came several chunks of some form of chocolate It was quite obviously segments that had been broken off a whole bar of chocolate by hand Absolutely bizarre and neither of us touched it despite my wife s deep rooted passion for the stuff Got the revised and correct bill paid and left literally laughing most of the way back to the car Such a shame as they were really nice guys I see they have mixed reviews from other people and some very good but baffled how on this visit Just to add insult to injury something was bleeping every few seconds and by the end was driving me nuts  Smoke alarm needing a new battery maybe

Can t express how disappointed I was with this place Read a great preview on Leeds list but the whole experience was abysmal 1 Drinks took 20mins to arrive 2 Food took 45 minutes to arrive 3 When it arrived it was appalling If overcooked pasta floating in a milky cheese less soup is what they class as mac and cheese then I give up Tried the fried chicken with waffles   dry chicken overcooked dry waffles Burnt and overly fishy crab cakes   We sent our food back and went somewhere else  This place needs to sort out their entire set up and quickly Confused menu with spelling mistakes poor chefs slow service At this rate it ll be closed within 6 months If the owners are reading this then please consider it a wake up call and turn it around
We waited over an hour before we rang asking where our delivery was Two hours later still no food and still no answer The phone is either engaged or just keeps ringing  Terrible

I had lamb chops but they hardly any meat on them It was a very disappointing  Considering Yee Rah is owned by the same people as chaophraya a very nice thai the other side of the grass I was expecting something a bit nicer  I wouldn t recommend

My wife and I decided to visit here for lunch as she and our son had an excellent lunch about a year ago Having arrived we found a table and I went to get a drink There was one barman who was serving the entire bar as well as taking food orders The place was not very busy but I had to wait 10 minutes to be served while he served two other couples Once served my wife and I chose our lunchtime fare - baked potato for her and a bacon and Brie baguette with cranberry sauce for me Very simple food After twenty more minutes the barman arrived to say that there was no cranberry sauce and did I wish to continue with my order As we had already been there for three quarters of an hour I suspected a change would take for ages and so elected to do without the cranberry About 10 minutes later and over 35 minutes after we had ordered our food it finally arrived  Comment Very poor service from an understaffed pub Barman and waitress were pleasant but no-one should wait nearly an hour for a simple lunch Food when we got it was reasonable quality

Looked on their website the food looked amazing like a really nice gastro pub How wrong could I be got there and it was nothing like the pictures on the website The chips were under cooked and was pretty much a mess on a plate not like the beautifully presented food on the gallery on the website Should be made to take the pictures off the website So disappointed spent money to stay near by thinking we would be treated to a night of good food The only good thing the waitress was brilliant

Very busy on the evening we called in without a booking We were seated at the bar area which wasn t a problem at all Decor was good happy with choice to come here initially  We and other couples around us were sat for a very long time without being attended no no one had drinks had to go to bar Only did I get to ask to order when the waitress came to drop my beer off after changing the barrel  Someone kept shouting 900 quite a lot from behind the bar Strange He was the only one there too and seemed pretty peeved I asked him if it was always like this and he said yes but some staff have cried off sick and others stand around doing nothing  Not once did someone attend to the tables in our area One couple walked out after waiting around 45 mins and still had not had their order taken It was as if it was no ones job and the staff did not know they were working in customer service they clearly haven t been trained so  We saw one table where the children were served their food and it wasn t until around 15 mins later the adults were served theirs  I had to go to the bar again as still no staff around then came back and food had finally landed My girlfriends was thrown down in front of her sorry we have non of the hangers left for the hanging chicken kebab  We left Poor poor service in what at first impression looked a nice place The food although we didn t hang around to try it looked insufficient I ordered the short rib which was short on anything other than bone  This place had the ilk of opening night at a TGI Fridays but without the chirpy staff 0 10

I was lured to the Golden Dragon by its attractive interior design and ordered Stirr Fried Duck with Pickled Ginger and Pinapple No 221  It came fast but was about 35 fat and 35 gristle I tried to chew some meat off two pieces but mainly got blubber Disgusted I sent it back after a few minutes but got charged the full amount When I queried the manager he said that they have served it like that for 15 years and full price applies Here you have a quality guarantee of some sort If you like fat and gristle - go for it
We ordered the nachos with chilli on top The chilli was disgusting cold and blatenly warmed up out of a tin packet There was minimal mince and was like a brown slop

Visited today for lunch Only one other person at till and I waited patiently Then two ladies were seen to I waited patiently Then more customers arrived and they were addressed I imediately asked if I was invisible only to be told that the queue was from the other end but when I arrived there had not been a queue and even if I had entered from the correct end I would now be the next in line Needless to say I left I will not be treated that way Staff training is urgently required

Been here twice now and although the food is very reasonably priced and pretty tasty the rude service has put me off for good Had a pork lo mein and which was fine not the best nor worst I have ever had The staff are surly and practically glare at you Will not be back
A novelty idea that wears off half way through your bowl of cereal There are other places for snacks on Brick Lane that are a bit more filling affordable and tastier

Having been here many times when the last managers were in place we decided to give it a look now it s under new management I wish we hadn t bothered The first thing you notice is the Cash only signs on the bar My beer was average at best and when my partner asked for a coffee she might as well have been from Mars from the look she received Once outside the ashtrays we could see were full to overflowing there were empty beer cans and bottles strewn about and the whole place had a whiff of desperation The people running could be seen but not spoken to sitting in the now-defunct restaurant enjoying a drink Absolutely awful

1st up I like this pub However on this visit I came in with some colleagues for food after a late running meeting It s burger day so beer & a burger for  X XX We ordered our food together & all got different deals  the bar staff clearly don t know their menu or what they were allowed to sell The manager tonight whilst knowing the products had no clue as to the staff s actions All of our food arrived separately My colleagues had finished their mralx before mine hsd arrived & I had finnished my beer My meal had token salad garnish & no bowl for the chips If I wasn t mega hungry I would have taken it back Didn t receive a check back or would have complained at the time  Finnished our food & have waited over 10 mins to have our table cleared in fact the staff are clearing the food menu s off tables before sorting out empties & dirty plates Sorry not a good experience today Also both gents are out of toilet roll

Tried this restaurant on spec Terrible decision  The mixed kebab starter arrived 2 minutes after the order was taken Either a lightning fast chef or a microwave in use party of four The chicken tikka looked and tasted like reformed chicken The onion bhaji were very crispy Reheated  The main meals were generous in portion size but lacked any finesse The peshwari naan was raw and the coloured dedicated coconut filling fell out when the naan was ripped open  We left the majority of the meal and made our exit An evening of disturbed sleep being our reward  Perhaps we chose a bad night

Went to celebrate my wife s exam results  worst meal I have ever had  Ordered and Bing food arrived after 5 mins and claimed it was freshly cooked what a joke  Mash was smash at best and the sausages looked like they were a week old  chicken skewer terrible had 2 pieces of chicken and watery mushrooms  Worst meal I have ever been served and for the price it s a joke  Went to Pizza Hut after and it was 100 times better

I had just rang to enquire about a table for 10 for the weekend and when I asked if they had space I was greeted with an abrupt NO When I said that was to the point I just got a sarcastic sorry and then they put the phone down Not the way to run a business and if that is customer service I dread to think what the meal would of been like

I went to this place for my birthday with my 2 children and wife we arrived at 9pm paid the money only to find there was no carvery left when we asked for it we were told it was to late and to get meat off the grill bar sent emails to Customer Service 3 in fact no reply in short there custermer service is as good as Taybarns rubbish keep away or go to a curry house service will be better

8 of us went there for new year at first we were seated at a table which we paid a lot for and it was completely bare no xmas decorations we reserved it about a month before and when it came to order they completely forgot we d reserved and said they had lost the reservations book  so we had 2 remember what we d ordered  the starter which took about half an hour to come was terrible carrot and coriander soup it tasted like curry powder and was cold the drinks were late and they were short staffed There was only a couple more people there and yet it took ages and the food tasted dodgy would not recommend used to be good but gone downhill

The reviews of this small well positioned restaurant could be a gem and splits reviews Following our experience today I am firmly in the avoid camp  The set menu looks tempting and competitively priced however very let down by the service and the quality of the food  Before we even sat down the bread arrived certainly not a precedent for the rest of the service  We chose the fixed menu my starter of tomato and mozzarella - OK but little flavour or dressing my wife prawn and melon - large potion probably half a melon  Then the wait 40 minutes at least for the second course the table next to us arrived ordered ate and departed before it arrived We chased and the waitress did not seem to understand the question Just as we were about to get up and leave after threatening to do this - the veal scallops sic in a lemon sauce arrive for both of us It looked dire the lemon sauce had a skin on it the mashed potato looked somewhat lumpy wet dollop The veal was tuff  Clearly the management knew we were not happy but made no comment as immediately we finished we walked to the till and asked to pay our bill but did they offer apologies or even ask what was wrong - NO  I would strongly advise people not to visit this establishment - it s the worst I have been to ANYWHERE

I visited Beech Street last week and was very disappointed with the quality of the food for the prices charged  Myself and my boyfriend both had steak which was extremely fatty tasteless and dry The proper chips as they call them were soggy and greasy I also enquired whether the steak came with vegetables and was told there would be a garnish which resembled a weed There were no options on the menu to add any vegetables  I also overheard a conversation with a couple who had booked a table for that evening to be told that there had been an error and their booking had been made for the Monday and there were no tables left 10 minutes later two locals walk in and hadnt booked but were seated and served Very unprofessional

you know when a pub is struggling when they have to resort to putting bands on a saturday night a night when it should be easy to fill a restaurant 2 for 1 kids eat free free bottle of wine its not rocket science to get your restaurant full get a good chef who cooks food and not opens packets and boxes reasonable prices and dont rip people off for drinks and extras

Four of us visited for lunch The place wasn t busy however we had to wait 30 minutes for our sandwiches When they arrived they bread was stale and the salad inside old and dried They replaced the sandwiches after another long wait saying they had put the sandwiches under the hot lights New sandwiches came with soft bread but with similar old dried salad in the middle No apologies from the manageress who was there and still charged us the full 33 The Boardwalk Bar & Dining does not do the beautiful setting justice Would certainly not recommend

After long day in Cornwall we decided to finish with some fish and chips  Unfortunately we regret our decision Spending more than 35 for family of 4 on poor quality food we get the rest of the evening with stomach-ache and sickness

Apparently this restaurant has recently been taken over and is now being run as a family business This restaurant had a high pedigree for the foodies of Yorkshire & beyond it used to be a flagship consistently winning rave reviews from Cockcroft & Manby in the Yorkshire Post and not just accolades but awards too Run and owned by William it was reknown I frequented it many times hyperbole was not lost on this premier eaterie But it was more than that  a lot more it was an institution a way of life  it was de rigeur Sadly it was then destroyed by someone who shall remain nameless The mass alienation of its customer base followed I could say a lot  but the removal of the Brandy Chocolate Fudge was enough for me So when I noted with relish that it was under new ownership I thought let s try it call for a table so I did to be met with an answer machine  leave a message and we will call you back No they don t call you back So you decide to go down and ask why and you expect a sorry perhaps What you don t expect is  oh we were too busy  to bother the inference being we could not care a less and she was a waitress and owner Clueless and hopeless and totally unprofessional The antithesis of the Drum which is now in the hands of idiots and the arrogance quite unbelievable Jokingly i said well its 9 50 can you give us a table No we have turned everything off and we are too busy anyway What she should have said is listen we couldn t care a less go  A restauranteur of repute would have apologised and said have a drink at the bar Well William would I have lost count of the amount of the times I used to go down to the Drum at ten and catch Williams eye and get a table I go almost misty eyed when I think of how that place was run Now its in the hands of morons and I would never think for a minute of patronising it In any event I would only be disappointed

Situated in a 1960s office block No attempt made to hide that The 1st floor looks like a floor put in on the cheap Furniture heavily marked and tatty reused menus Film memorabilia poor in quality and behind scratched plastic screens A huge come down from Planet Hollywood of old Now just trading off its name Such a shame Food is okay Avoid

Booked a table  ordered the sea food platter 24hrs before hand from the huge sign inside the pub When we arrived for the platter there were no clams or oysters as the notice board stated when we asked the waiter where they were he went to the kitchen came back and said or instructed to say we reserve the right to change fish etc on the menu due to seasonal reason so you have extra mussels instead but we don t eat mussels I informed him and in any case they were not on the platter menu if they were we would have had them removed or not ordered the platter Anyway told him we ordered from the sign inside the pub and it certainly didn t say anything there about the restaurant reserve the right to change fish Oh sorry was his reply When the platter arrived a big bowl the tiger Prawns were little more than slightly large shrimps the crab so small and zero imagination on presentation mind you it may have tasted slightly better had they have taken it out of the fridge freezer earlier and has for the half lobster well if that was fresh it must have had a very long slow walk up from the beach it was dry and still frozen in certain parts Asked to see the chief owner again the waiter disappeared came back the chief owner totally refused to come out and it certainly couldn t be because they were busy as there were only 2 other people in the restaurant We were offered a free dessert as compensation me I was prepared only to pay for what I thought the meal was worth but my partner just wanted out of there So my advice if you want good sea food good customer relationship Don t under any circumstance eat at the sea food platter mind you the side salad was edable
Tried to make a booking was told the restaurant had closed down due to staffing problems Very sad this was the best Chinese in the area

do not go here - food service surroundings all awful very expensive for very bland food service was terrible - got our food wrong - didn t even offer anything in return - wanted us to tell them what to do - do not go here - its not Italian as it says on the outside

Three off us had Sunday lunch tasteless roast beef dinner and bland turkey The jus for the beef was like water and the meal was only warm The burger when we last dined there was good but it was tasteless today They served coffee promptly which is possibly why they forgot the puds - which were luke warm just like the service I suppose one could say in a way the service was snooty - who knows why The Manager made recompense and offered everything to make things right

Nice food nice bar staff but incredibly backward policy regarding children We were told we were only allowed in one small part of the pub and shown a laminated page saying No Children or Animals Beyond This Point  When I complained I was told that they didn t understand why I would bring a child to a pub - pubs are for adults  Wow It s like stepping back in time

How can you get a simple pasta dish so wrong The pasta was too hard the ingredients seemed cheap ie cheap olives black brine olives and capers and hardly any tuna was included I could this up at home much cheaper and nicer

Went there with some friends for a drink one evening We were told not advised that we could not sit at the vacant tables unless we were eating Fair enough However we were also told that we could only sit in designated areas if we wanted to drink These designated areas were completely full I asked if we could sit in another area and jobsworth staff reigned  The staff were not only unfriendly they were verging on rude They all seemed to have a personality bypass   no warmth welcome or customer-focus I would never return for a meal in the light of my experience as a drinking customer My friends and I left after one drink and found a more welcoming hostelry  Avoid like the plague sadly

A complete let down after visiting with family for Sunday Lunch The food was awful cold limp veg and rock hard potatoes Attitude from extremely rude and miserable staff the waitress was so cold and miserable it spoilt the atmosphere The Beef that I had requested medium came out over well done along with a pathetic amount of vegetables After speaking with the Manager he kindly didnt charge us and tried to rectify with a slice of medium beef that was cooked perfectly We were not looking for a free meal just a really nice Sunday lunch  Have to say this place has gone down hill massively We are from the local Village there are much better options out there

The room was good and food was good Staff treible service was Terible would not stay here again There is no parking on site its 10 minute walk away When i stayed it was full of contractorsand they were short staffed
Probably one of the worst restaurants in Milton Keynes Awful food  steak that was like rubber dirty menus dirty loos Just terrible

This restaurant has reasonable reviews on Trip Advisor which lead us to try it before a trip to the Theatre that evening Do not be fooled however this was quite simply one of the worst meals I ve ever had Clearly this is an Italian restaurant being run by people who don t have that Italian passion running through their veins as the bland and tasteless meals don t line up with the usual vibrant Italian cuisine Our Crab and Mango salad was completely covered in Marie Rose sauce ketchup and mayo  and the calamari were rubbery and overcooked obviously frozen Our pasta dishes were covered in greasy cheap cheese and swimming in a watery sauce that resembled more of a veloute Admittedly it wasn t helped by the fact that their Pizza oven was busted but an Italian restaurant needs to be able to serve up decent pasta It may only be a matter of time before Ramsay goes marching in

Would give zero rating if possible Took a work party there with over a weeks notice so they could prepare and be ready for us took an hour and a half for the first plate to arrive then a massive gap to next courses no bread or olives on offer had to eat a colleagues birthday cake to keep us going while waiting on food Manager clearly not coping and the whole evening was a disaster Just appaling an no words can describe how bad this was
No Ice no lime cordial no Children s menu and almost no customers Miserable barman no atmosphere no wonder the place was empty on a Sat in July

I visited the Eastgate restaurant on Saturday night before a trip to the Pictures at The Light the service was ok and starters quite good but a little small and the Riata sauce to accompany them did not arrive until we had nearly finished them The Two main courses both of which were chicken looked like cat food as the chicken was all small pellet shaped and probably reconstituted The curry sauce of the Karahi Chicken was very oily and my partners dish was so bland it was hardly a curry and totally lacked taste The Nan bread was ok but became cold very quickly due to the hanger which it is served on The drinks are quite expensive at 3 25 for a small bottle of Kingfisher I wont be going back

Surbiton has a good selection of restaurants but unfortunatly Joy is not one of them Over priced for small portions and bad good quality food full of oil and no flavour Tough and chewy mutton which hand t been cooked properly WAIST OF MONEY

I went in to the drewe arms on January 4th for a couple quite drinks with 7 friends The landlord then came in and said it was time to leave so we started finishing our drinks and taking our empty glasses back  not our job and there was a pint of cider thatchers original which tasted like rats piss When all the empty glass had gone I past the full glass of thatchers back and said it tasted horrible  The landlords response was GET OUT MY PUB I said sorry just letting you know it tastes horrid With in seconds he was around the bar and he grabbed me by the jumper the dragged me out through the bar and littrially threw me ou the door  I went in the bar and apologised for saying it was horrid the next morning and he told me to get out and stay out and he would never want to see me again

No question the food is good here But the restaurant charged us twice once at reservation once at exit  They promised a fast refund but despite chasing nothing happened for over two weeks Had to get refunded through our bank eventually who then took it up with them Last time we ll go Chef can cook but not great on customer and business management

Having eaten here several years ago and looking for somewhere different to treat the kids I thought  Damon s I knew it was expensive but what I didn t know was the service and the food are now  POOR And that s being kind We booked the kids were excited all dressed up and off we went Very busy which was nice - as was the smell of cooking Despite checking in 20 minutes early we were forgotten by the staff and consistently overlooked When we reminded them we were waiting we were eventually shown to our table where we were rushed through our ordering eating and paying in less than 30 minutes Not a very special experience The waitress although friendly enough spent all of her time listening to us and watching us so she could pounce immediately we placed our cutlery back on the table I couldn t wait to leave  140 for a pitiful quantity of very average fries and ribs available in Asda for 1 made me realise just what service we get and what value our local Two for One pub is We enjoyed the night in spite of the food and service not because of it We won t be returning My advice  drive down the by-pass to The Pride of Lincoln Have three nights out for the same price Why on earth this place is so popular I do not know

I went to the Brambles Tea Rooms with my mother as a treat before Xmas It was recommended by a friend of mother The waiteress was very rude could not care less about customer service Asked for something which was on menue but told in a very aggresive manner that it was not available not a problem Chose something else The meat in the steak and ale pie was like rubber very tough to eat chips were very undercooked Pot of tea was like dish water Would certanilly stay away from the establishment

~WHY YOU SHOULD NOT VISIT THIS CAFE~ 1 Cheeses are harder than Rossetta Stone 2 Burnt milk in coffee 3 No fresh salads you can see different color tone as changes day by day from green to brownish it s like a chameleon 4 Flies on cakes 5 Food preheated in microwave 6 Uncomfortable chairs and stools if you eat by the window you can feel like a Hobbit 7 Strange meteorites floating in bowls of olives 8 Rude owner doesn t respect employees and customers she is like the exorcist  9 Nasty atmosphere 10 Stressful place

Having read some of the other reviews on Tripadvisor we must have come across the pub on a bad day - however there was is no excuse for the incompetence of the kitchen  Having been recommended the pub as the place for a Sunday Roast I have never been so let down  Seated quickly we were asked for our drinks and they arrived promptly We reviewed the menu with my knowing that I was going to have the Sunday Roast My girlfriend as a pescatarian had little choice on the menu but settled for stuffed roast pepper - a mistake to soon be realised   Our food arrived within a timely manner however both dishes were minus basic items that were supposed to have been included such as on my dish roast potatoes and yorkshire pudding What is a roast if it does not have those The second dish also arrived with items missing Waiting for the items to be brought to the table we cut into the stuffed pepper only to find it almost frozen solid inside - a basic mistake for even a junior in a kitchen  For the pub supposedly to be the place to eat a roast it leaves a lot to be desired  Have I ever had a worse restaurant experience - NO Will I go back - NOT A CHANCE Pop across the road to the Cricketers who rescued my Sunday Lunch and you will not be disappointed

Have been here a few times before but not for a year or so It has significantly deteriorated and the staff attitude is very poor 3 were stood about doing little whilst I waited It took a manager of some description to ask the bar staff to serve me I ordered drinks and they are short measures the lager is deliberately frothed up as the last bit is pulled and when I asked for it topped up the barman grumpily added a tiny bit more The coke was the same  1 80 for a half of coke in an over-sized class full of ice Food was then ordered except the order was not recorded properly so one meal did not arrive with the others Puddings ordered later 2 kids and 2 adults and they duly arrived over 5 minutes apart The food was passable but over priced for what it is One to avoid

We visited Lands End on Tuesday with 3 others and a dog The weather was quite nice during arrival so we decided to eat outside We found a nice area outside of the LE restaurant and decided to order 20 minutes or so after placing our order it began to rain and people moved inside We decided follow suit as there is absolutely no sheltered tables outside the LE restaurant We have a Cocker Spaniel who is well trained and never barks and didn t think there would be a problem with sitting at the table by the door whilst it was raining and we ate our food We had already paid as you have to pay before the meal We placed our dog right in the corner behind our table The waitress saw us and walked off into the kitchen after a few moments she was back with another worker He told us that dogs are not allowed and that we had to take her outside We explained that we ordered when it was not raining and he just kept repeating the same sentence sorry dogs are not allowed  So I asked him what we were supposed to do can we get a refund or are you saying we must eat outside He simply shook his head repeated himself again before walking off with the waitress I couldn t believe how we were being treated and neither could the two gentlemen sat on the table beside us Myself and my girlfriend decided we would eat outside with the dog whilst her mum and brother ate inside 20 minutes later my girlfriends meal arrived to our table outside but there was no sign of my order The rain was gradually getting heavier as I sat watching rain splash into my girlfriends drink She finished her meal and there was still no sign of my LE burger  Just when we thought things couldn t get any worse the waitress who had made us exit the restaurant appeared at the main entrance She didn t have my food but instead shut the double doors on us as we sat on a bench in the pouring rain We couldn t believe it all I could do was laugh as the two men who were sat next to us inside looked toward us with shocked faces This was the final straw and my girlfriends brother and mother went to ask for a refund of my meal only They refused to issue a refund as apparently the meal was on its way it had been 20 minutes since my girlfriend had finished her meal When my meal finally arrived half an hour later I was able to sit inside as the rest of my party had finished so they went outside to seek shelter somewhere with the dog as I ate on my own The food was very average and I wouldn t recommend it to anyone I ve never been treated in such a cruel and unprofessional manner in my life We would have been in and out within half an hour and certainly wouldn t have ordered knowing the weather change and the restaurants anti-dog policy Yet I did notice there is a large paving slab resting near the
