restaurants entrance which reads  welcome to all our four legged friends My Spaniel certainly didn t feel welcomed A small compromise for our circumstances could have been made but instead we were treated in such a cruel manner Definitely won t be returning in my lifetime

We went here because of the great reviews The food was tasteless gruel Evidently the people who rated this place have insensitive taste buds and noses or maybe they know no better Or perhaps after 6 pints nobody cares what they eat  Its a nice spit and saw dust pub to hang out with mates but the food sucks I wouldn t take a lady either

My daughters rave about this place so we decided to give it a try The chicken was so spiced you could not taste the flesh and the chicken livers tasted like they has been dipped in petrol They we inedible Badly cooked food made worse by heavy use of spices and chilis

Ever since the refurb of the cafe the customer service has gone down the pan Rude waiters and waitresses could hear shouting from the back or kitchen and costs waaayy to much just for a simple tasteless coffee and muffin good views but sadly this is not enough to win back my custom I would rather sit on the dunes with a flask of tea

Went to eat at the Egerton Arms yesterday evening but unfortunately our trip was very quickly cut short The car park is chargeable 24 hours a day and only takes coins I enquired at the bar if I was either able to get cash back or pay for my parking there but was unfortunately told not Even though the parking charge is refunded on your first order if you don t have the correct change to pay for parking in the first place then don t bother Bar staffs attitude was pretty much that I should have had change in the first place and offered no resolution other than to find somewhere else to eat - We did

I try not to give negative remarks and for people who have followed my reviews I hope they will see I try to be fair and honest when giving my opinion  so when we went the the new Chiquito s at the kingston centre we did have hopes of a nice evening with good food and good service unfortunately we didnt get as far as the food I am not sure if there was no management on site or any supervisors as we didnt see anyone other than a greeter who was obviously very new and a few waitress s There is not a lot that upsets me but basics like being seated taking an order for drinks and being served would be high on my priority and I would hope a large chain like Chiquito s this would be a basic for them I do understand that when a place opens it takes some time to settle staff and when we visited it 4 weeks earlier the service wasnt perfect but i told the duty manager and she put it right straight away the food was good and we had a pleasant family evening I also understand that on a Monday evening and it was packed you have to move your expectations this Monday there was barely a quarter full the girl behind the bar was gazing out the window and i could see half of my drink order on the bar yet after sitting for more than 20 minutes the party on the table next to us who came in 10 minutes after us and was enjoying there drinks i called it a night No one to complain to no one other that our waitress who looked shocked when i said we were leaving as we didn t want to wait any longer We went to wagamamas and had an excellent meal I don t expect to be returning to chiquitos again

I ve never written a review about a restaurant ever I m not a food critic I m a normal diner but I felt compelled to write something about my experience tonight  My wife and I along with our 2 young children decided to treat ourselves to a meal out on a Sunday evening We had seen this new Chiquito along with a few others over at Kingston and decided to go there  I had perhaps slightly higher hopes than normal as the place has been open a while now and being fairly new you d think that they were going to impress How wrong I was  Upon entering the place it looked very good Clearly the designers know what to do However we stood at the front desk for about 10 minutes with members of staff clearly making eye contact with me Eventually a young girl approached the desk but was looking for something my wife asked if we could have a table for 4 with 2 high chairs and she looked perplexed She didn t even say hello or welcome to Chiquito or any kind of greeting My first thought was she clearly was in the middle of something and was hoping someone else would man the front of house After standing there and staring into the restaurant for about a minute she just mumbled and walked towards what we assumed was our table We followed and she went to get 2 high chairs leaving us standing at our table while others around were eating I might be wrong but if it was me I would have told the people to wait at the desk and prepare a table for the customer  She gave us the high chairs and mumbled something I couldn t help but think   « She didn t like working there  « She had been out all night drinking with little or no sleep the night before  « It was near the end of her shift and she was thinking about home  « Chiquito staff training at this restaurant is rubbish  « All of the above  I later saw her with her coat on chatting with someone at the tills and then she left so she must have been at the end of her shift  So after she mumbled she didn t offer us a drink or any children s packs for the 2 small children we had with us  About 30 seconds after she left a polite waitress brought some popcorn in a dish which was actually very nice and was a good distraction for the children She then took our drinks order of a Pepsi diet Pepsi and water  A few minutes later a young lad brought over 2 drinks the Pepsi and the water We asked where the diet Pepsi was and the guy said he d go and check He never came back nor did our drink ever arrive  After seeing a good 10 or more staff walking past us we decided to stop someone and ask if we can order our food as nobody seemed to see us with our menus shut for 10 minutes which I thought was international code for I want food now   The guy took our order on his computer complaining it was very slow this is a shock as you would think a new restaurant would have a decent IT infrastructure  After taking our order he left On a positive note the food arrived quickly from someone who seemed to be the manager as he wasn t wearing the usual uniform He put the food down for the kids but kindly mentioned that our table was quite small and was worried that the sizzling dish I had ordered could result in one of the kids burning themselves He immediately suggested a much bigger table and started to move our food with the help of the polite waitress This was the single positive thing from the whole experience  So once we sat on our new table which we suddenly realised was so much better than the tiny table we originally sat on which the original young girl should have realised we began to eat our food  The children s food was nice and basic which is what you want to a 1 and 2 year old My wife s burger was very nice she said however my fajita dish wasn t really that great I ordered chicken and BBQ pulled pork the dish arrived with the chicken and pork on top of a hot plate covered in onions and peppers The meat had clearly not been cooked with the onions and peppers and tasted extremely bland It actually tasted like the char grill was only used to warm it up rather than cook it from scratch  So I then looked at my fajita kit with all the sauces etc There were no spoons or serving implements for the sour cream guacamole or salsa Which I have seen in other places I opened my little packet of wraps which all ripped apart and were stuck to the wrapping it came in This meant my wraps had holes in them and became very messy to eat The only real taste was not the meat but actually the sauces which were nice but then I can buy them from a supermarket Nobody came to check on us to see if our food was ok so we decided to eat up and get ready to go Had I wanted to get someone s attention I doubt I would have had new wraps in time before my food went cold  We asked for the bill and paid up just over 40 00 I think what hurts the most is the fact that I could have bought everything from a supermarket kits and jars included for half the price and had 10 times the service at home I understand new restaurants have teething issues and young staff on low wages are not going to set the world on fire with customer service but this place had made me write a review for the first time I would actually get a better service in McDonalds  Whoever is running this restaurant needs to pay attention to staff training and watch what they are doing as some real basics have been missed If I find myself complaining on here and bear in mind this is the first time ever for me then other people will clearly be spreading negative comments around Milton Keynes  Chiquito you need to have a word

Me and a few friends decided to take on the 12 best beers in Liverpool pub crawl on the 14th March This pub came up on the list and was our 4th stop following a couple of fun experiences in other places most notibly the Dovey on Penny Lane For a moment I would like to just give a shout out to that place The barkeeper found out it was my birthday and gave me a jaegerbomb but instead of jaeger put sambuca in and instead of red bull put jager in Lovely start to a long day  Back to the Baltic Fleet I would love to take time to say the beer was decent and so was the pub but the manager was one of the worst people I have ever met in a customer service role so I will focus on him I mean COME ON It isn t hard we were in there at about 1pm hardly like it was rammed He still couldn t manage it  To begin with  10 of us were doing the pub crawl Still quite sober only pub 4  so there was not yet any roudiness We entered the pub ordered drinks at the bar and stood around by it The bar was quite long so plenty of room for people to get served and we were nt in anyone s way Then Captain Crummy came over and advised us that we weren t allowed to stand in the room where we were and to go find seats in the back So we did  We found nice seats and were happy Then Larry Letdown came back in after noticing we were having fun and enjoying our pints He must not be an advocate of this as it was the second time in about 10 minutes he decided to butt in We were told we could not sit where we were because it was in the way In the way of what his ego When we protested he was having none of it So we moved then when we did they moved all of the tables and chairs we were sat on so they pretty much piled on top of each other What a waste of seating basically just cleared them out of the way for a laugh  Following that the only place we could go that wasn t sitting down or near the bar was by some doors Which as expected we were constantly reminded to remain out of the way of for the 3 people that during out stay wanted to get past  Also worth mentioining the toilets were a horrible mess Maybe this is why the manager was in such a bad mood because he was just thinking about having to go up there and clean them which to be fair I wouldn t want to do  Beer was fine and prices were too All other staff = fine and dandy

We were visiting Tunbridge Wells for the afternoon with our daughter who is at Brighton University and we do not live in the UK I called in to this hotel as we wanted to treat her to a meal I enquired in the restaurant if it was open to non-residents and if I could look at a menu A very grim looking young lady who was not English seemed annoyed that I had asked to see the menu The foyer and restaurant were so dimly lit that I could not read it However I did notice that it would be quite expensive to eat there As other reviews have stated the tables were very close together and as the young ladies manner had been so unwelcoming and offputting I chose not eat there The owners need to do some in-house customer service training

We booked a table for six at the monthly Bistro evening to celebrate two of the parties 60th birthdays We were given a time of 7 45 and arrived 5 minutes early We were not advised there were any problems We received the starter an hour and a half later at 9 15 and were just getting up to leave when the main course was served at 9 50 Both courses were lukewarm and only just OK for quality The menu here is a three course set meal but we didn t bother with dessert As we left we were told some staff hadn t turned in had we been told on arrival it would have been our decision to stay or go All in all one to forget If you re thinking of coming here I would certainly give it a miss unless you re prepared to watch your life ebbing away whilst you wait

Including today s visit I ve been to Tenji four times And today s visit has been the absolute worst of the lot which has convinced me to seriously think twice about revisiting again  We reached in the afternoon - a little after 1pm expecting a spread like the previous times we ve been before  First off - no sashimi at all None When asked about it the waiter spiky-haired with a permanent frown on his face looking like the whole world owes him a living nonchalantly said they were out of stock  which was flat-out ridiculous A japanese buffet restaurant running out of sashimi Come on you can do better than that Only after being questioned multiple times by frustrated patrons did they bring out rather reluctantly a platter of salmon nigiri If you re gonna cut down your budget and exclude sashimi in the afternoon kindly put a disclaimer on your website saying telling prospective patrons there s none in the afternoon because not doing that is false advertising plain and simple People making their way down expecting some of that stuff are going to be sorely disappointed worse off being told by some impatient unruly waiter that it s out of stock is ludicrous  Secondly the sushi counter took ages to refill despite having been cleaned out for a good half and hour or so Even if business is slow in the afternoon aren t your customers paying the same price for their meal  Thirdly notwithstanding the fact that their Haagen Dazs Ice cream as proudly advertised on their website is some alternative brand that none of us have heard of before Buckleberry if memory serves  they stockpiled the entire freezer with the lousiest flavours available Liquorice & Blackcurrant and Raspberry which everyone knows are the least popular ones None of the usuals like chocolate strawberry and even the most flavour of vanilla was available among the rows and rows of ice cream in the freezer Yet another case of we-don t-really-care-cos-it s-a-weekday-afternoon-and-there s-only-ten-odd-of-you-around-and-it-aint-worth-my-while  The first time I m writing such a scathing review on a place I thought I actually liked but I ve tried to keep objective as best as I can All in all poor variety and an absolute lack of effort coupled with poor service from a particular male waiter Definitely no longer what it used to be and I suggest you think twice about making your way down

Eaten here before and love it   visited Sunday night for my sons 18th Birthday and turned into Fawlty Towers   after starters 3 out of our 4 mains appeared   one we had to wait on as not cheffy enough but no salad and all 4 fries came out  3 of which were wrong  they got took back and we waited Upto 5 minutes for them to return but fortunately we could sit and watch our steaks and baby chicken all go cold   manager come over to apologise in such a condescending way he would of been better off not coming over at all   after all what is wrong with cold food in a posh restaurant  Anyway the not cheffy enough dish came out in time for the new fries so daughter had a hot meal while we all got to have piping hot fries with cold steak and cold chicken Fortunately the salad and ketchup arrived for the end of our meals   Have complained and been offered a free complimentary meal which I politely turned down as we won t be going back So an honest review to help and guide people s choices     other businesses wouldn t get away with that service   oh it wasn t a full restaurant so that s not the excuse

I was unable to attend a party of 12 and my associates had to pay full price for my non attendance which I have refunded to them I have never experienced this anywhere before and advise you to consider the thinking behind this establishment before visiting

We visited here in August and was disappointed but we put it down to the wedding reception that was going on Our friends were running 10 minutes late asked if we would like a drink we said we would wait till our friends arrived I watched the lady who seemed to be in charge of the restaurant send 3 different people over to us to ask us if we would like a drink  NO didn t seem to be in their vocabulary Our friends ordered the ham & eggs and at 14 00 I didn t think it was worth 1 2 that price I had a small beer battered fish & chips @ 8 50 I couldn t taste any beer in the batter the peas & tartar sauce came in quite large ramekins all in a soup dish leaving little room for the fish & chips in fact the fish which was a little smaller than a 5 note had to be put on top of about a dozen chips The menu s are just A4 pieces of paper no sleeves or covering on them no effort made at all to make them look presentable and when they advertise rat & warthog it puts you off ordering anything at all I think this will be my last visit

I used the Just Eat online ordering system to get a couple of pizzas from this place after seeing good reviews on this site Sadly when my order was over an hour late I called to see what was going on and was received by a very unpleasant guy who said that the delivery driver had sat outside my flat for ten minutes yeah helps if you press the bell I subsequently re-ordered only to find that the place was now shut and I cannot cancel the new order which will be arriving tonight at half five when I no longer want it not to mention that I m now 17 out of pocket because of the un-delivered order Avoid this place at all costs

Visited a Friday evening with 10 work friends waited over an hour for the main course people didn t get there naans until nearly the end Felt terrible the next day have doubts the lamb was cooked properly Many other curry houses in the area never again

Appaling food Pie delivered with BURNED inside contents and like a manhole cover Ages taken to serve Pie microwaved into something inedible with the qualities of concrete in terms of attempted opening with cutlery Awful experience Will never go there again Warning learn from my ghastly experience at the Pickerel

this is a hard review to write there are some good points but the feedback is such as they need to get their act together otherwise they will loose all credibility Quality control is the nature of my work and in my blood I aim to be constructive  First point to make is that the customer is always right they are the ones paying your wages rent profit and without them you are nothing  Secondly you have a web presence it would be useful if we could find the physical location you may joke that you are remote and hard to find but after driving around took two hours a brilliant way of getting the customer hot under the collar by the way the drive back only took 25 minutes go figure room for improvement postcode is not enough on many satnavs so need street name and or gps co-ordinates we should not have to rely on google maps to find you especially when there is no phone coverage  On arrival we were greeted by stressed out staff you can t be at your best in these circumstances it doesn t matter what the root cause was it is definitely not the potential customers problem not in their power nor inclination to resolve issues unless it was advertised as some team building activity  As for food we were told there would be a 45 minute wait in a manner that put me off which from calculation of other request to delivery times proved to be greatly in excess of this and I was glad I didn t order  Menu wise there was too much emphasis on posh nosh does the chef have an ego greater than their talents this I can not comment on  Good food needs to be what the customer wants remember we tend to be in groups with a verity of tastes needs to look good but we can not taste it if it takes too long to be delivered  Personally I was looking forward to have something from the menu but others were hoping for something less glamorous  So in conclusion from the observations and comments made on the night this could have been better planned with the staff asking the right questions when they knew of the event which to my knowledge was requested about two or three months ago an indication of numbers could have been obtained and resources arranged so from what would have been an enjoyable evening with friends    wasn t   I am giving feedback as I want small businesses to succeed there are too many tasteless chains Please do better others will read this and look for the improvements mentioned in my suggestions  My views are though the eyes of an observant customer

After 40 plus years of eating at Curry Houses all over the UK we decided through laziness to try this one which was effectively on our doorstep  One reviewer enthisastically stated that it was the best restaurant this side of the Ganges and had used it exclusively for 15 years He must have been a heavy smoker or constantly had flue to find this garbage acceptable  This same guy has obviously never tried anywhere else  as Bowburn Tandoori Centre takes bland food and tardy service to an entirely new level SPECTACULARLY AVERAGE  Waiting an hour to have this junk prepared was not a good experience  If you are local get in your car and drive to South Shields where any of the Restaurants will provide a sit down 3 course meal for around 7 per head and it will be delicious owing to the competition on Ocean Road  I am not a professional complainer but if you are looking for a tasty spicy meal why not buy a Pot Noodle as undoubtedly it can not be worse than this  RUBBISH

Visited The Bear last week as a group of 4 for lunch We were told there were no tables available and there would be a 20 minute wait which initially we were ok about However on looking in the restaurant there were several empty tables that hadn t been cleaned and reset When we pointed this out to the young man who appeared to be in charge he immediately went over and cleaned a table and reset it for us to use The food was average for pub food but the place seemed to be understaffed and chaotic with several tables left uncleaned throughout our time there The standards of this once beautiful pub and restaurant have dropped greatly over the years and it now one of a chain serving average food with poor service and general hygiene standards Will not be returning

This restaurant is in a great spot on the river with good views and a lively atmosphere but that s where the pleasure ends The food is dodgy thai and one that I wouldn t recommend Overpriced and no seamless flavours coming through on the small portions

The four of us captured within terminal 5 had not eaten since 0500 hrs Lunch time Huxley s was the only appealing menu within the many other places but the truth is there was NO queue Seated pleasant enough and ordered  Orders came immediately saw oven chips  a toasted bun burger and nothing else  The waiter ran away   called him back stated  where is the cheese and bacon  Oh did you order it Ran off again to check  I must have been lying My sons was the same After he had checked he asked did we still want the cheese and bacon I give you a guess as to what I said  Well it did come  cooked upon a saucer If we had not been hungry we should have walked out  But being within a security controlled environment did not wish to miss the plane  14 for the very average dish was total rip off Its terminal for us meaning we will never go back  Biggest tip of all time  avoid and take sarnies  terminal 5 is also terrible

Many years ago I lived in North Devon One day we visited a steak restaurant in Barnstaple High Street The food was nothing short of appalling The reason given when we summoned the waitress was that the Chef hadn t turned up so the staff were having a go  That may or may not be the reason for the horrendous meal I had at the Indian Paradise restaurant in Boscombe Bournemouth - a misnomer if ever there was one However I think that congratulations are in order here It really takes some effort to be that bad  The outside of the restaurant is pretty shabby but that doesn t always mean a bad meal The welcome was good but the restaurant was empty never a good sign However we soldiered on The decor is really really tired and the whole place needs refurbishing  The menu was pretty standard and orders were placed The food that appeared though bore no resemblance to any dish of its kind I have eaten anywhere in the world The Chicken Tikka Jalfrezi was almost entirely devoid of tomatoes or colour and looked dull and uninviting The Lamb Jalfrezi was - apart from looking like a limpid Korma - almost entirely devoid of lamb And flavour The bowl that was supposed to contain Matar Paneer contained something not entirely dissimilar to dog vomit Indeed it tasted as rank as I imagine dog vomit would actually taste The explanation for this was that they make their own Paneer cheese in house My advice Don t  Why on earth do they bother They are two doors away from a much better restaurant sadly closed on the night we visited and there is simply no comparison If you are in competition guys you need to up your game substantially To be honest you re probably better off giving up entirely  Truly this was one of the worst meals I have ever eaten and am still paying for it as I write this some 18 hours later In their favour they removed the Matar Paneer from the bill but my recommendation is that you steer clear of this restaurant unless they refurbish and get a new Chef  Oh no Here we go again

Poor range of pretentious dinner offering at London prices and not worth the money poor service from untrained staff and aren t I the best attitude from owner no personality at all This could be a gem in new ownership with someone who has customer skills and the right attttude Visited for lunch once just OK apart from the prices but dinner was a business embarassment poor choice of food and dreadful service would not go back awful all round
Visited this place with clients in August Service was very unfriendly and food was served on dirty plates The coffee cups were likewise stained one with lipstick

we decided that we would go into morecambe for a drink and a meal i went to the bar as my other half wanted a lager but was told lager off they had run out of gas so had to buy an overpriced warm budwieser i asked for a green king ipa from the pump which tasted so foul it was undrinkable we decided that if was bar servive heaven help what the meal would be so we left in disgust if this is the standard of this place then its no wonder morecambe getting a bad name

You may want to take this review with a pinch of salt as I should have wrote it closer to the time I went with work colleagues for the Christmas team meal last december Out of approx 16 -20 of us I think only half enjoyed the food I personally thought the food was awful I had veal for my main and it was one of the worst things I ve ever ate I will never go back

Food not up to much hardly no meat in the spagetti Bolognese Chicken on the pizza really dry almost inedible The service was even worse English spoken poorly the waiter was rude and arrogant and bad at his job and will not be back ever

I went to Fresh Basil for lunch with my boyfriend The place was full so we had to walk around the town and wait which wasn t a problem My boyfriend always has the breakfast which is usually good This time I decided to try the prawn Caesar salad which turned out to be NOTHING like a salad - small poor quality prawns TWO small pieces of lettuce a bunch of tomatoes some olives wrapped with anchovies and bread All skimpily served individually on a wooden board making it unpleasant to eat Overall the only part I enjoyed was the bread with butter I was surprised to see that my boyfriend got more lettuce as a garnish with his breakfast than there was in my salad   Stuff should also consider cleaning more Even if the food would have been nice it s impossible to enjoy a meal with dirty tables and sticky cutlery  The coffee is also poor

Noisy busy but chaotic banging doors untidy smelly loos poor service unexperienced silly staff No leadership Food OK once it arrived  Table booked for 6pm - as soon we arrived told we had to vacate by 7 15 Sat next to doors to loos - bangs loudly everytime someone goes through Ordered at 6 15 latest - food arrived 6 55  Table of 9 food arrived within 20 mins Ladies filthy smelled of urine hadn t been cleaned or tidied since lunchtime Unacceptable Will upload awful photos I took of the state of the loos if I still get no reply to my email

One of the most impressive buildings I have ever visited spoilt by such a rubbish pub Chimneys need to be sorted out you could see the smoke from the open fires in the main rooms Cheap wood veranda erected outside with screw ends showing Please donate the building to someone who knows what they are doing and provide a pub with some atmosphere

we stopped here after driving from Italy we ordered two beers and two steaks the beers arrived promptly  although they weren t busy the food still hadn t arrived after 45 mins the waitress came and apologised they hadn t started with our order  we could see the kitchen staff who just seemed to be larking around with nothing to do we watched them for another 10 mins after one started picking his nose we had had enough paid for our beers and left wit no explanation as to why this had happened

We bought a take away one Saturday night and the food was absolutely terrible with chicken of various colours when cut open Clearly some looked fresh and other somewhat out of eat by date in our opinion We do know our curries and have travelled and eaten it in Indian on numerous occasions Don t risk eating food from this place we d never do so again

If you are a family with children then notenthis resturant doesnt allow children after 7pm Or so they say as we were spoken to about this whikt other tables were not Steer clear unless you are a local

Had table booked for group of 15 people for my birthday for 7pm week before due to go told had to be out by 8 30pm  Which if their service is as slow as reviews say would have been mad rush Too late to find replacement venue so thanks
Nothing to like about a place like this Treat staff like dirt What do I like about the place  Close it down thats good

Honestly seriously really i never ever thought i would wright a review on trip advisor but now i see what all the fuss is about sometimes you need to share your experiences good and bad im just disappointed in myself that the first thing that could drive me over the edge was bad But very bad very very bad the atmosphere in the pub was nice the decor is good cosy but not cluttered plus one star unfortunately this is where it ended i used to frequent the restaurant regularly during the past year since it reopened to begin with it was fantastic and i should have written a 4 star review at the time the barbecues the outdoor paellas were truly a breath of fresh air in a stale standardized restaurant environment and for this i salute you  again im sorry i did not review this disappointed in myself  however in the last 4 months are so its gotten worse floor staff the same and all ok maybe a little more stressed than usual but what do you expect at the festive period i get it but the food the food  i have been 4 times in the last 4 months and each time it has been progressively worse i can only assume that what was an enthusiastic Chef in the reopening at the Pullman has since lost the will to live and their cooking has deteriorated alongside this  the burgers for instance were phenomenal in the past full of flavor just cooked pink to perfection as i always ask it to be now i ask for pink i am greeted with a short sharp NO it cant be done    i dont argue maybe the food inspectors did not like it   at lest those familiar burgers will still be packed with all that flavor wrong again bland dry and a little sour i can now assume that the burger can no longer be cooked pink as the meat is no longer as fresh as it used to be  The fish  that too used to be a pleasure the specials board was a wash with such variety now your lucky to get one special a week for the record the fish and chips that s already on your menu is not also a special im so so sorry i never reviewed you when you where good Pullman but please get good again and i swear to god i will wright back in see you next month

Arrived and greeted by surly owner Although a couple we ordered enough food for 4 as we wanted to try it all We had to have a sandwich when we got home - that s how small the portions are Annoyed that although not licenced they still charge corkage for drinks we bring Green curry with chicken was mostly cauliflower and the chicken would comfortably fit in a tablespoon Added to the fact that we were repeatedly ignored by the waiter whilst he was overly friendly to other tables and the bill was the most we ve ever paid for a Thai meal and we won t be going back I could go on and on I m so annoyed Avoid at all costs

Food good but the drivers dictate their customers had to meals delivered and very pleased but on trying to order for special occasion for Mothers Day was told they were happy to take the order but the drivers felt we were to far away to deliver Who runs the company the restaurant or the drivers Would be a good takeaway if it wasn t unreliable

Very disappointing over all I ordered mussels and waited about 20mins to be told the mussels wasn t good by a member of management ordered mushrooms thay came without any bread  Then had the gammon witch was ok but half our party had there main coarse about 10mins be fore if came the the bill came and there was a how har over that very disappointing will not be returning to this pub ever

The staff are ignorant and rude a real couldn t be bothered attitude waiting for chips to cook not that they would tell you that they just stand around sulking and scratching Pretty poor so far but not as poor as the produce - chips were stale tasting and dry yesterday s  Sausage as I see someone else has said earlier tasted funny Chucked the lot in the bin  Pick up or pack up you are a embarrassment to Shrewsbury jow you are still in business is a real mystery Oh and clean the shop before you leave it s filthy and smells as such

My friend and myself decided to lunch in victoria circus wimpy bar what a mistake the service was slow and when the bill arrived they had charged 40p for a coffee shot we hadnt had when we queried the bill the manager said it was because we asked for 2 teabags Unbelievable

My wife and i were visiting friends in the local area and we all decided to go out for dinner We all had pizza and frankly it was not even of the poor quality you get from a budget 79 pence pizza you get from a supermarket How you actually make a vile pizza i do not know but they managed it Poor service and the toilets were filthy I feel if they cannot be bothered to clean the toilets then i hate to think what state the kitchen is in I would rather go hungry than eat there again

It was my birthday and 11 friends were celebrating with me I have been to Viva many times and as far as i am aware I have never paid an optional service charge On this occasion there was one added to the bill 10 of the 505 bill Because I was not told of the service charge I paid the bill and tipped the staff an 35 extra  What made it worse is they did not serve all the meats and my friends who had never been felt disappointed Food was OK and staff were friendly but the hidden service charge was dishonest and deceitful  When I called to complain Viva management didn t call me back

I went to this place last Monday with friends the food I received was cold and the eggs looked like rubber  To top it off you could hear one older woman quite short with glasses from the kitchen in particular with vile language towards members of her own team if this is how staff are treated on a regular basis I can t say I m surprised the food came out disgusting I wouldn t want to work with that either

we visited the millers arms on Saturday 8th November at 6pm my first reaction was how cold the dinning area was the food we had was also cold the gammon steak my friend had did not have the 3 4 of a inch rind cut of the steaks my wife and friend had were tough and the food service was shocking we were all going to have a sweet but the waitress was nowhere to be found I had to walk through to the bar to get my bill I even to tell the chef that we were going and the bill and the money was left on the table again we could not find the waitress we will not be back

Waited a long time to be served and the people behind us arrived after us and we re served before us When I pointed this out to the waitress she was quite rude The food was expensive and nothing special Won t use again

We visited Perios after seeing the owner on Dragons Den We found the menu to be very limited with not enough choice I decided to have a burger which i didn t think tasted very good Certainly won t be visiting again

Although the food is ok it is far too expensive The portions are tiny and cost about 10 each and you need to order at least 3 or 4 per person You end up paying a lot of money for rather simple food and a lot of bread with olive oil The place would be ok if prices were half of what it costs now and the sizes double

Upon entering Mayas the restaurant interior looked impressive compared with other buffets such as East and Aroma After being seated and ordering our drinks me and my partner went and got our first plate of food  I myself went to the sushi and after eating the first piece was unpleasantly surprised with the lack of flavour However as it was the first dish I decided to soldier on and try the Mexican stand After creating my beef burrito I returned to the table and took a large bite into the wrap only to find a large unexpected crunch that couldn t have been the onions Spitting out the mouthful I was greeted with a large lump of bone and gristle that had found its way into my dinner This wasn t just a little bit of bone either this thing was about the size of my knuckle it was large and solid enough to cause damage to a tooth i consider myself luck  After being put off of the mexican food we decide to try something different and went for the Crispy Duck  Never have I eaten duck with the consistency of what I imagine bathroom sealant to collate too This wasn t just me being picky and I understand that they need to serve a large quantity of people but that is no excuse to use low grade poor quality meats from god knows what animal  It wasn t just the lack of flavour and quality either but also the little things that all add up such as walking past the buffet counter and getting a glimpse of a large bucket of what looked like chicken just sitting there The spoons not being able to fit into the dessert glasses and the ice cream machine advertising frozen yogurt that unsurprisingly by this point was in fact ice cream  The staff were hardly in sight the whole time and after bitting into my low grade meat burrito I was desperate for something to wash down the gristle taste left in my mouth This led me to have to wave an arm at a waitress Then when it came to the bill we had already paid with groupon costing 15 between us The drinks bill came over which to our surprise was 14 43 which didn t add up Reading through the bill there was an added charge of 2 90 After the meal I had just experienced I was in know way prepared to be milked out of as much money as the owners could grab After contesting the added miscellaneous charge apparently you have to pay in order to use a coupon which in all of the groupon meals I have attended have never been required to pay for something I have already paid for  To summarise I would have rather gone to a fast food chain than have to endure Mayas again The food was of the lowest quality the service was of the lowest quality and overall this has gained its place as the worst restaurant I have eaten in Stick to East and Aroma whilst avoiding this place like the Plague

Arrived 8 15pm approx Large crowd of people in foyer with dogs drinking and very raucous Drinks order taken but did nt arrive until 20 minutes later after two reminders Food order taken prior to this but nothing arrived untll 9 45pm after being told the kitchen had lost the original order Should have walked at this point but felt sorry for young man doing his best and everything on his own Food arrived but was very medicore my battered fish was served upside down on a pile of very pallid chips Free coffees did not fully compensate for the disappointment

ive been to this restaurant many times in the past and i has always been nice food and service but the last few times it has steadily got worse I was early to meet my friend so thought i would go in and have a drink at the bar seated area i asked a waitress if that was ok and she said not really  then she asked if i was eating there and i explained that i was waiting for a friend and we would be eating with a pained expression on her face shesaid i suppose so but you will have to wait  there was no niceness about her manner and ten minutes later a glass of wine was plonked in front of me My friend turned up and we were seated by another waiter who was equally unfriendly and waited ten minutes for someone to take our drink order All through the meal we felt like we were being ignored andthe restaurant wasnt busy so it wasnt cause they didnt have enough staff etc The house wine was like vinegar and we paid the bill and on our way out we were stopped by a waiter who said that we had paid too little and they had got the bill wrong and we owed ten pound more the waiters had been huddled together and we felt like we were being talked about and felt uncomfortable in front of the other diners I have worked in restaurants for years and only write things like this when i feel the service has been particularily bad Its such a shame because its a beautiful restaurant and the food has always been nice but i wont be returning
Everything was awful never will I return  No one seems to know what they are doing the food was god awful the chefs need a good lesson in cooking and managers need to pull their weight

Not what we have come to expect from Harry Ramsdens it used to be big chunky chips with lovely battered fish and cooked to perfection Recent trip to Bournemouth with the expectation of a great meal to finish the day What a big disappointment skinny frozen chips and soggy batter and poor quality fish So have they franchised it off not Ramsdens fare at all WILL NOT BE RETURNING

Ripped off just been to Food Court in Saltaire and charged restaurant prices instead of what is advertised on their website Argued with manager who refused to honour advertised prices even when confronted with website on iPhone Beware check your bills
Saltiest food I have ever eaten Waiters spoke to us as if we were doing them a favour in being there and we certainly will not return

Having been told by several people that this is the best fish and chip shop in Wokingham I gave it a try First time closed for holiday and the same a few months later On both those occasions went to the chip shop in barrett crescent which was very good and they do rock salmon which is not always available now days and it was extremely good Finally went here and they were open last week Terrible chips all dry with no golden colour soggy with no crisp and the centres just pappy potato Miserable staff just probably filling in time tile their next holiday Barrett crescent for me The Queens head on the terrace does the best fish and chips in Wokingham as a charity night from time to time shame it is not a regular thing but what a treat when it is on

Got there and managed to get seated but was told table was reserved for later in the evening decided to have the carvery but the service was very slow and whilst I was waiting heard them say to a lady all the burgers had gone and only beef left on the Carvery When it was my turn the guy informed me there was only four portions of Beef left which we had two and looking at it being carved it was very fatty When trying to eat it  it wasn t fit to feed the dog so it was left on side of plate with this I asked to see the Manager and he explained they d been having trouble with the Beef supplied of late I asked for a refund which was given and I can honestly say the meal was Sh-t
nothing good to say about this pub the staff turnover is high the quality of staff and food is low cleanliness is slow to bad

It is 3 times now that we have eaten at the tree cups would we eat there again no Why would that be on Sunday 17th May I took my wife there for Lunch we had Roast Pork with Yorkshire pudding the plates arrived COLD the GRAVY WAS ALSO COLD This went back to the kitchen when it arrived the GRAVY WAS STILL NOT WARM AND THE PLATES WERE COLD THE YORKSHIRE PUDDING WAS RAW INSIDE ROAST POTATOES WERE HARD AND SO WERE THE VEGTABLES THESE WERE NOT COOKED  When it came to pay there was no reduction in the cost for a meal which we considered over priced   did we have a pudding not likely   For a basic Sunday Roast Dinner STAY AT HOME do not go to the Three cups at Stockbridge Hampshire

After being recommended for the past three or four years ago from my two Sub-Continent friends telling me - for the price - this was the best Indian in town  I had been looking forward to this experience for years   The three main things which left me feeling disappointed are the following  1 Once seated the service was extremely poor I almost felt as if I was bothering the waiters whilst ordering my food  2 The glasses on the table were dirty old oil marks when you don t wash the dishes with hot water  3 On every table there were a couple small bowels of sauces mango chutney  uncovered and not changed from customer to customer certainly whilst we were there so would be surprised if it left on table the whole day AT LEAST  This is not what would be regarded as standard hygienic practice Other than that the food was tasty and well priced If they could sort these three things this place would be a gem

Unfortunately we decided to have lunch here together with friends colleagues today We have been waiting 20 minutes to get our orders and 50 more minutes for the food Pricey meal for what we got badly cooked and poorly presented 13 spent on any fast food meal would have been a big win compared to this Negative note an English pub without burgers on the menu Positive note we got the service out of the bill  Three words never ever again

I came to the hotel for a work related meeting in the evening we all met up in the bar area I stood at the bar trying to buy a drink for about 15 minutes while people all around me were arriving at the bar and being served while I was ignored I eventually gave up and went into my meeting thirsty  I couldn t comment on the rest of the facilities but if they re anything like the bar I d give it a miss

Called at the Cafe during a long coast walk The cafe was due to close at 17 00 but refused any food or drinks at 16 45 as The till had been cashed up  Disgusting service as the cafe was quite full of customers wanting to buy food and drink and there was still 15 minutes to closing time I will never go then again

Went to Strada looking for a nice meal but got the opposite three of us had different meals two were passable but the third was  well tasted and looked like it had been made by a 5 year old it was disgusting supposed to be canaloni  it was all munched up and the tomato sauce was a tin of tomatoes thrown over the top as you can imagine it went back the new one wasn t any better with less of the same so called sauce  it had been made cold and and reheated back up under the grill when it arrived we couldn t believe what we were seeing first the dish was red hot and the tomato juice had splattered all over the plate and was cold in the middle it was returned after speaking with manager it was taken off the bill so my friend had nothing to eat even worse is that this place is not disabled friendly in fact it is breaking all disability laws the disabled person has to go outside the restaurant to get into a lift which is too small for a wheelchair and when they reach the top they have to get guest s to move tables a chairs to be able to pass to get to the disable toilet which is locked if the person using the toilet didn t have a radar key the they would have to go back down stairs for the key shocking when we complained the manager agreed that this facility was not up to standard but also put the blame on the owner s of Gun Warf Quay so how did this get passed by the council planning department the manager apologised and took the price of a bottle of wine off the bill he did say the place was getting an up grade soon but she is soon would not recommend this particular restaurant to anyone
Very friendly staff quick service but food was horrible Wet soggy burger buns with luke warm over cooked meat With london prices I expected a bit more quality

I arrived & waited almost 10mins to be seated in a restaurant that wasn t full Having ordered my meal I sat reading - & read for almost an hour When I queried the lack of food a waitress said my meal was being plated up  Must ve been some plate because 10mins passed & nothing arrived I must ve been lied to Ggrrr I took my frustration to the manager Rob Guess what I had to wait for him to arrive too  He apologised & said its not normally like this  yeah right A restaurant with management that will say customer service is very important but fail to walk the walk by providing enough staff Cost of extra staff for acceptable service - 20 an hour each over about 10 covers It s nothing unless the greed to profit over-rides customer service that is

My wife and I have been visiting this restaurant pub for many years and we even went there when it was a small local pub We visited earlier this week with my sister and her two friends on their annual visit and we always have a walk and then a meal at The Cricket The restaurant is light airy and attractive and the food has generally been OK although the real ales have been pretty poor This year was a total shock The St Austell Tribute was virtually undrinkable and when I returned it the guy at the bar looked at it and shrugged no apology There were no English bottled beers just the standard tasteless stuff As a member of Camra I do know my beers and accept that it is taste and not look that determines quality in this case both were awful  We then came to choose our food and found that basic fish and chips was 13 50 and then an extra 80p for peas We ordered the fish and chips and fish pie as there was very little else that was value for money The fish batter was greasy and unappetising and the fish pie had very little fish An expensive poor quality meal Value for money zero out of ten We mentioned the pricing to two members of staff only to receive the ubiquitous shrug of the shoulders exactly the same reaction I had to my comment about the beer  At our seat near to the door to the kitchen we were told to sit there because we had a dog we were subjected to noisy staff taking orders and discussing bookings and again when we mentioned it the response was yes you ve guessed it the shoulder shrug We were also subjected to the horrendous noise of the kitchen door squeaking After about 15 minutes they did prop the door open but nobody offered us an alternative table although the restaurant was far from full A gentleman of ample proportions who I assume was the owner or manager pushed a piece of paper across to me giving me the name and address of the pub co Heavitree who presumably own the Cricket and he suggested I write to them and complain about the squeaking door Shades of Fawlty Towers  This was a very bad experience and this establishment is going downhill and exhibits all the signs of greed and complacency that often accompany a hitherto successful venture We will not be returning and I will advise my friends to stay away

I ve been back here frequently for convenience since my earlier review despite my doubts Service has not improved And today when I put some cash into the cup for tips by the till a member of staff asked if I was pinching money from it Not going back there again

rude bar staff  over priced poor quality drinks that you can buy from any DOWN MARKET pub but with premium prices food was luke warm Went to this pub few years ago before current owners and had a fab time now we wont go back till mangement change

Having visited the place before the fire and found it to be lacking in customer service we thought that we would give it another try yesterday after shopping in Nottingham To say that it is far worse is an understatement We were greeted well enough with the lady on reception informing us that it was a little busy so the wait would be around 35-40 minutes this we understood with the amount of cars in the car park She gave us a buzzer that would flash to tell us when the table would be ready then advised us to purchase a drink from the bar while we wait that s when the problem started We waited and waited but the staff only seemed to be interested in either chatting to each other or just serving and chatting to what were obviously regulars 15 minutes we waited to be overlooked time and time again the man stood next to me even told them we had been waiting a while and STILL they overlooked us I hope the management actually read these and realise just how damaging they can be Still as long as the regulars are looked after eh The Goose up the road was very nice  just a thought

Visited this pub left very quickly Don t know whether it was the landlady but she was incredibly unfriendly and rude Not much left to say was looking forward to trying their food but won t be back Also looks really bad when members of staff are hiding behind the pub having a cigarette - understand that smokers need to entertain their habit but it looks plain messy

Absolutely disgusted Pulled up for a drive through and ordered a cheeseburger and strawberry milkshake only to be told the milk shake machine was not working so I couldn t have one Obviously I cancelled the whole order and drove off What s the point of having a bloody McDonald s without the ability to make a milk shake Why are there not maintenance engineering deployed into every McDonalds on 24 hour shifts to keep these essential machines serviceable Absolutely disgusted by the incompetence displayed and I will not be returning ever

Worst KFC I have ever been in we waited ages and the state of the tables chips all over the tray in kitchen area and chips being reheated so we walked out before getting served No comment on the food because we didn t eat there and wont be going back either

Too early to go anywhere else I went to the Lit for breakfast It took forever to come I had drunk my cold coffee by then and the breakfast was one of the worst ever The bacon was cheapo crap and shrivelled to nothing it was all just awful Don t go there for breakfast Tell your friends not to go there for breakfast Join every travel and tourism guide on the net and advise people not to go there for breakfast tell your family too

So I have been here before and 90 of the food was okay Went last night with my misses for a quick bite to eat My girlfriend has sweet and sour we shared a fried rice and I had Chicken with black bean sauce     Sweet and sour fine  chicken bits that taste have the texture of chicken and nothing to complain about  blackbean chicken sliced rubbery factory bought  tasteless and like I said it is likle rubber you can get this type of chicken at the Chinese food warehouse in middleton or Manchester it is NOT cooked fresh daily as I can order this from my local Chinese with 1* rating   So I was not rude I asked quietly for this to be taken off the bill as I did not eat it and I put the bits Id taken bites from back on the plate  Waiter said yes he will do so 5 mins later the owner comes up to me and says  I have tried the chicken on your plate and its fine  I say this is ok as it is opinion from owner and my opinion the customer   she again says it is fine   she has cooked chicken all night long and many people love it   its fine    I say AGAIN its my opinion and I do not like the sliced chicken you have it is processed shop bought that is bland in flavour   She then goes again I have tried the chicken you sent back  wish was the piece I spat out  & she told me it was fine and made me feel like it was me the problem    DO NOT COME UP TO ME ONCE I HAVE COMPLAINED AND TELL ME IT WAS FINE 50 TIMES OVER   I AM THE CUSTOMER NOT YOU   IF I DO NOT LIKE IT THAT IS IT BOTTOM LINE TAKE IT OFF MY BILL SAY YOU ARE SORRY AND THAT IS IT    NOT HAVE A ROW WITH ME IN YOUR SHOP BECAUSE I WILL DO WHAT I DID AND THROW YOU 20 POUNDS AND WALK OUT AND EXPLAIN TO ALL ON HERE THAT THE SLICED CHICKEN IS NOT GOOD  MY OPINION  FACTORY BOUGHT NOT COOKED FRESH DAILY  AND YOU CAN GET THIS FOOD FROM YOUR LOCAL CHINESE DONT BOTHER MAKING THE JOURNEY FOR 10 DISHES YOU CAN GET FOR 4 AT HOME   REALLY ANNOYED ME THAT SHE WAS TRYING TO ARGUE WITH ME FOR 15 MINS IN HER SHOP   MANNERS DISGUSTING RUDE AND NOT ACCEPTABLE IN THIS TRADE      WILL NOT BE BACK AGAIN

To start off within 10 minutes of us arriving our waiter who looked like he was wearing a kids t-shirt managed to smash two glasses near to our table He was generally a nice waiter but was not attentive to the table or to many other tables I had noticed as he spent most of his time making desserts at a counter which really should be made in the kitchen or at least by someone who is wearing chef whites The food was nice enough but they are too shy on their topping and if I am paying 10 pounds for a pizza I expect it to be fully topped not with half the tomato sauce showing through the burnt cheese I personally ordered a pizza named Pollo ad Astra Leggera which consisted of dry thin bits of chicken 2 pieces of pepperdew peppers which attracted me to the dish in the first place and were rather disappointing  Cajun spices which I hadn t even noticed were on the pizza until I just looked up their menu garlic oil terribly lacking as the pizza was very dry and red onions which consisted of massive chunks of red onion that were unevenly cut and dry This would have all been tolerant but its was a pizza that had a huge hole in the middle which I quote is now filled with delicious rocket  rocket is simple and easy so I shouldn t expect anything to come from it but the fact is I am paying full price to have half of my pizza removed and then stuffed with unnecessary moneymaking rocket I also had a 3 95 pound garlic bread with mozzarella which was the size of a pita bread and had solid garlic butter on top with a layers of melted cheese which should never been on the menu at 3 95 as it costs them at the most 30p to make it I then finished off my meal by treating myself to a banoffee pie with mascarpone which I have to admit was nice mascarpone and had clearly been scoped out of a big tub the banoffee pie on the other hand was almost falling over as it reached my table you can imagine how thin it was and was certainly not 4 95 worth as I could have used 4 95 to make my own banoffee pie that big and then have enough money left over to buy a big pot of mascarpone Overall I found that it was expensive the had small portions and that they should really rename themselves to express because they certainly didn t justify the pizza part and the whole place is more like a fast food chain that should be situated in a busy shopping centre food court

Went a couple of times it was loud and noisy people stare at you constantly very poor atmosphere and when you look at the glasses when the light shines upon them they are dirty to say the least - is anyone bothered - a boys drinking parlour - that s all

First impression count and sadly it was a very bad one  Being a party of 7 we struggle for a establishment to fit us all in so when we walked in and saw a near empty cafe we thought we struck lucky however it being empty should have given us a warning  The first experience was staff members talking saying what time do we shut on a Sunday the response was 4 o clock thank goodness can t wait  I am sure you ll agree not the most welcoming greetings  There was a small range of rolls on display we asked politely if any more were available to which there was an abrupt response of No  And then the final straw my son again politely asked what the patsy s were bearing in mind there was no label to which he had a very sarcastic  rude response well the same as you normally get that was the final straw so I loudly announced my annoyance and said excuse me that was very rude and that we were leaving which did not seem to bother her at all  Totally let s down Wells avoid at All costs  With staff like that I m surprised they stay in business

Was gutted with spending 32 pound in here 2 Large Budweiser original Czech type = 11 Two burgers and chips 21 Staff were messing around the service was shockingly poor and as per previous reviewers it was not clean Floors tables and chairs all covered in food

we went to pasqualinos for my wifes birthday we decided to taste what this restaurant had to offer the arranchini was too cheesy due to too much parmesan duck leg did not taste like duck  believe it or not i am one hundered percent sure that it was not fresh i eat duck alot and i know that this duck was frozen on many occasions and used again  for dessert my wife had truffels and madeleines and beignets  i understand that they are homemade but for a fine dining restaurant to serve rubbish like that it is unnecessary as our 9 year old daughter can make better fairy cakes anyways overall this was a dissapointing meal and would not recommend it to anyone specially with the staff not wearing proper uniforms and looking rather shabby

Absolute disaster service was terrible We was a party of 6x adults What can I say Table was set from night before had to ask for table to be cleaned Table booked for window seat was sat miles from window on arrival and after asking twice for booked window seat that was requested was told that was only table available  Had to wait Ages for starter which was a Pate and was looking very dry sat on a plate Main meal came very late and had to wait long time for cutlery to eat it with and then was thrown on table with no napkins  Turkey was dryer out I had a ribeye steak which was so burned that they had to cover it with thick black gravy to hide it absolutely disgusting The desert we had to wait for even longer for was so low quality that most of it went in the waste bin We did not even wait for the coffee and biscuits as we wanted to get home and try and rescue Christmas Day  Will not ever again go through the doors of the Rushley while I am alive

I recently went to the Sportsman with friends for some lunch It was a Saturday afternoon and the pub was very quiet We waited  And waited  And waited for our food but 1 hour 15 minutes later it still hadn t arrived Went to the bar to complain and the girl said it wouldn t be much longer The staff were too busy blowing up balloons for a private party and couldn t be bothered with their customers It eventually came out and half of it was cold We asked to speak to the manager and she was ever so rude Her excuse for it being cold  It s got salad in it Salad isn t hot  She did offer us drinks on the house which we gave to two elderly ladies who had also been waiting what seemed like a lifetime for their lunch but the damage was already done  Long waiting time cold food and a very rude manager Will never go back
Just received the takeaway meals and every thing was cold greasy and undercooked last 27 they will get from me

On entering the restaurant no staff in evidence Finally given a table order taken by a friendly waitress The meal served looked nice on the plate cutting into the steak was impossible complained to the waitress who offered something else off the menu After completing the meal paid the bill No apologies were offered consequently loss of future custom

i recently visited your restaurant with my partner and was appauled with the service that was given by the staff espcially the so called manager that couldnt have been more rude if they tried the food i thought was going to be of good quality looking at the menu and i went for the scallops to start i was disappointed as the scallops seemed over cooked for my liking on to the main course which came out a good thirty minutes later i had the pheasant which again is something that i thought would be a good choice as i love game how wrong i was as the phesant had quite be well and truely over cooked when i mentioned this to one of the members of staff all i got was a very rude and abrupt response all in all i will never visit pea porridge again and i urge people not to go there in a hurry as there are many other places in bury to eat that have a lot better food and staff that are actually friendly

My wife and Inwent on a Saturday night for the first time to have an Indian meal at Curry Mahal and it was terrible the popadums were greasy and dry we asked for a new serving and they came back greasy and dry as well  the potatoe in the saag aloo was not cooked the service was terrible

Right next door to Nando s and boy do I wish I had swerved to the left instead of the right In Gloucester for one night and wasted it on this Lazy lazy lazy I can cook better ribs at home and the blue cheese sauce for the wings was I swear salad cream with something horrible added Warm colslaw - eeuuugh  Staff perfectly pleasant let down by food they probably have no control

We visited just after the restaurant opened as a group of friends There were clearly some staffing  management issues as we waited over an hour for food We got no attention at all and had to ask for everything drinks can we order etc When the food eventually did arrive it was of a reasonable standard but by then our minds had been made up Let down by service

Went with the mrs and my 2 mates 3 of us ordered the mozzarella rice balls when they come all 3 orders were stone cold This was taken of the bill and we got some piping hot ones thrown down onto the plate with a handful of greens it looked awful  Main course came out my friend asked for cheese waitress then dropped it all over him then started with black pepper before he said he wanted any Chicken lasagne was awful tasted microwaved and old  Do not go Bella italia you can easily pick up a ready meal wack it in the microwave save some pennies and not have there crap good and terrible service  On the plus side we all wet ourselves laughing with how bad it was
Very poor service it takes far too long for the food to arrive The place lacks atmosphere and is living on past glories Don t bother going if you are hungry We will not go there again

As I write this we re coming to the end of our second hour waiting for our food rediculous service all while being told it will be ready in two minutes Do not come here  Update food has arrived but half of the order has somehow been forgotten between waiter and kitchen sitting here with cold rice and no main

I cant believe this place  went in for two large or medium cod and chips easy you might think BUT  only got one small cod if you want to wait we can cook another SMALL cod we have run out of fish    As I was hungry I bought the Pie  only one there didn t bother to ask what it was  It was I admit late  8 35 pm One lot of chips was twice as big as the other  The Cod was described as regular at 3 95 but it was the smallest one I have ever bought My bill came to 10 20 the fish was OK but nothing special chips were OK but would not bother again and the meat in the pie which turned out to be meat was tough  Have stopped before and was not impressed WONT bother again not even if they gave it away

Absolutely dreadful the food was appalling over priced bland and the fish was not even cooked through properly The descriptions on the menu were inaccurate and did not reflect the food served Mr Oliver should visit in disguise and see what utter rubbish he is putting his name to

Visited with another couple last night Noisy party dominated restaurant and most waiting staff looked inexperienced and didn t seem to have a clue what they were doing Service was very slow from getting a drink through to mains Food ranged from poor to OK with exception of the egg fried rice which was superb All in all a bit of a disaster which was a shame as I have eaten there before and the food was good

I celebrated my 40th birthday in this rubbish restaurant I m blaming myself why did I chose this rubbish restaurant I brought 18 friends including my family I wanted to have a good day but this staff called kumar I think he is a manager and he said  you have to leave now and pay your bill  I was totally embarrassed and humiliated to all the people around me I will spread the news of what you ve done for me to all my colleague at hospital and to all my friends Don t go in this kind of restaurant No consideration We went there to have a peaceful and relaxing meal but it turned out to be the most rubbish restaurant I ve ever been I been to a different country like Australia Canada Rome Paris Amsterdam America but I never experienced anything like this in my entire life RUBBISH RESTAURANT NOT WORTH GOING FOOD IS RUBBISH AS WELL

Me and a group of friends headed over to smokeys hoping for a nice indulgent meal Upon walking in we were asked if we d booked which was quite surprising considering the restaurant had about 4 tables occupied out of about 25 So we said no we haven t expecting to just be seated Instead we were told that we d have to book for another night as there was only 1chef working and they d had a delivery In all my years of eating out I ve never had this happen I can understand if the restaurant is full and very popular which his place isn t  So we were left a bit bemused and wondering how on earth this place makes money I m sure he owner wouldn t be too happy if he knew this was happening The waitress told us don t take it personally although we were very calm and simply querying why we couldn t get some food  Ten minutes later we decided to call and book a table the booking was accepted  We didn t return of course as we were quite offended that we were turned away only to be able to book a table ten minutes later Strange I ll never go back and will tell my friends of this story as well Good luck smokeys

So sad to see this restaurant in a prime position in Fowey in such a terrible dilapidated condition A real eyesore Just hope that new owners will make something special of this place and it doesn t just become the same as many others - fish and chips and pasties Nothing wrong with this but Fowey needs something different and more upmarket Rick and Nathan where are you

What a disappointment I booked this place based on time Outs critics  choice for Manchester Now I will never trust another review from Time Out as this wasn t just bad it was terrible How did it ever get critics  choice in Time out Did they pay for the review Ok to start the decor not sure what it s trying to be a heavy nautical them but nowhere near the sea The music very very loud and not very pleasant OK if you want to go clubbing but I booked restaurant to eat not to dance on the table The food cold and tasteless and very expensive  Starters didn t turn up at same time no taste to any of them and i really do mean no taste it all taste of nothing Main courses all cold When manager asked me how it was i requested he go away as he would only spoil what was already an unpleasant experience Thinking i was the only on not happy he said to one of my party oh well you can t please everyone to which my friend replied but mine was awful too and cold At that point they offered 2 deserts to compensate Couldn t muck these up as did not need cooking I seriously felt ripped off by this place and embarrassed as I had chosen it to meet friends i had not seen for quite some time The only good point our waiter was very good and tried his very best but i would suggest he get a job in a place with decent food Go if you like tasteless and pretentious and don t mind being ripped off for it otherwise avoid like the tasteless plague it is

Been a few sunday afternoons now seems to slowley going down the pan this sunday terrible service stone cold food slat on the table asked for malt vinegar said not sure what that was  I have every time we go  sign on door no longer taking cards Heres the worst bit prawns full of the sh  lines not washed disgusting Spare ribs all bits of bone nothing really on them  3 for the smallest bottle of budwiser made the table next to us ordered a sizzler dish it arrived didnt sizzle told then to take back  they were the only other people in and us nobody at the counter bothering about us or the other table just chatting away with them selves and the small children running around making noises its a shame used to be just average but now total rubbish in every way I even told the waitress when she asked was everything ok  with most of the food left and all the dirty prawns on the table They are disgusting she asked me what was up with them   I said tell your so called chef to eat them iv got work tomorrow  Will never set foot in the dump ever again take heed go somewhere else I don t even think they ar bothered any more DUMP DUMP

Tried to go here today with my wife and 3 children after we had the boat trip Sign outside stating dress code  no tracksuit bottoms  Damn  i was wearing tracksuit bottoms Asked why this was and was just told go home and change by a lovely young girl Erm  no i won t go home which is 40 miles away to change to spend my money in your establishment You aren t the only place to eat in chester Never have i heard or seen a dress code at a restaurant at 2pm in an area that is for families Stupid dress code stupid manager power hungry woman In the end  we went up in the town and spent 80ish in Nandos Well done

My wife and I went in the one at St Davids Railway Station Wife ordered breakfast sandwiches and two coffees Staff could not understand English and mostly ignored her or did not speak Place to avoid if possible

Makes Big Luke s and Taybarn s look like 5* establishments Food was cold very little choice Crispy Duck tasted so sweet it is hard to believe it is not left over helpings of Duck dishes Would explain why it was the size of sawdust Staff rude and very slow to clear tables despite the fact the place was near empty The new Mr Lau s is the place to go in Newcastle

We visited on our recent trip to manchester after hearing about the place from friends  The decor inside was very mismatched tired and not that tidy or clean  We were seated at the table and given a menu we then had an incredibly long wait for our order to be taken When the tea and china aas eventually brought out the waiter just plonked it onto the table without any care we then had another long wait until the cakes and sandwiches arrived  We had the Queens tea for two The sandwiches were just ok not much flavour to them though The scone was ok but fairly dry and got stuck in your throat The cake was a roughly cut up piece of flavourless dry cake with a splodge of purple icing on top There was a lemon tart that didn t taste of lemon and was topped with the most sticky and tastless meringue i ve ever come across The meal was finished off with what was supposed to be some sort of cheesecake in a glass it just tasted sweet and nothing else  The service was awful there where lots of young waiters around but they just stood and chatted rather than attending the tables  At the end of our meal we waited for ages once we requested the bill we also mentioned to our waiter that it was very disappointing but he just seemed to ignore it  Overall it was definitely not worth the visit Overpriced and tasteless food combined with awful service meant we didn t enjoy what was supposed to be a nice romantic afternoon tea We will definitely not be visiting again and would not recommend the tea room to anyone else

Went to this branch of Prezzo on 26th April We were a large group and they seemed incapable of catering for a group of 10 Funnily enough the same issue arose at another branch  The food itself was ok though the bolognese was such a small portion - it could ve come from the kids menu  They also told us we weren t allowed a jug of tap water we had also ordered several alcoholic and soft drinks but they said we could each have a glass of tap water This just seemed quite pointless and it took over an hour just to get the glass of water Crazy  When the pizzas arrived they weren t cut and there were no pizza wheels provided which made it quite difficult with the very blunt standard knife  Overall quite a negative experience and not worth the price Avoid  won t be returning to this branch but there is a Prezzo just nearby other side of Trafalgar Square towards Leicester Square that was much better

Sadly this review is the worst I have written on Trip Advisor and I have commented on hotels in Ethiopia We finished off a terrific family weekend by booking Sunday lunch at Draycote Hotel for 24 guests When we arrived we were initially surprised that we were not to have the Carvery meal we had be told to expect when we booked and confirmed nor a separate room away from the rest of the restaurant  However the restaurant was set out pleasantly and after being seated with drinks food orders were taken It then went rapidly downhill or slowly depending upon your point of view   The starters were clearly an indication of the obvious traumas that were happening in the kitchen The prawn cocktail for example consisted of a number of unshelled pawns completely covered in sauce that had to be extracted and pealed before they could be eaten When the main courses arrived over an extended period the food was served on cold plates and was cold I waited for a further 10 minutes before the first vegetables arrived which was better than some who still had nothing after a further 30 minutes What food that did sporadically arrive was clearly not cooked by a hotel chef or one that had pride in his her art  On discussion with the duty manager it was agreed that we would cut our losses and leave without the need to pay for what some had already partly consumed out of desperation Clearly the Draycote Hotel could not cope with a party so large on that Sunday which is surprising as they advertise as a wedding venue  In all this I pay tribute to the young waitresses and receptionist who were clearly distressed and embarrassed about the situation with which they were faced and who did their best to resolve an impossible situation However our wonderful weekend ended rather disappointingly in the car park as we said our goodbyes and started our long journeys home To be fair to the Hotel the Hotel Manager did contact us the next day to profusely apologise in person
