and explain the problem we faced In order to move on we have accepted  The Hotel website states We are passionate about offering our guests an excellent dining experience  Was our experience just a  bad day at the office

Popped in for a take-away on a Monday evening Was going to leave immediately as queue was so long Helpful girl on reception asked us not to to leave as she would serve us straight away She did this it was slightly uncomfortable as others were still waiting Anyway I went ahead When the whole queue had cleared I was still waiting for my order It eventually arrived but it was clear it wasn t all there A fairly offhand Nando person went through it and confirmed bits were missing and some were wrong I was told only a couple of minutes to sort it This of course turned into an interminable wait again Eventually I got it home not before the original helpful girl winked at me instead of asking why I now appeared to be living in the restaurant to find that I had things like mashed potato in a box instead of what I d actually ordered

Just sat at my table with a breakfast platter that was already send back for being nearly cold  only to get another equally luke warm plate If been here over 45 minutes waiting so I ve managed to eat only half before giving up How can you mess up a simple full breakfast Waiting staff good but the cook needs a sharp poke with a stick

This place was a joke from start to finish My family came to visit for the theatre and have a meal and we picked the living room because it looked nice from the outside We then informed the staff we had an hour to eat before we had to leave before the show  No problem they replied may I add that only one other table was taken  The food turned up late so we left half way through not to miss the show The staff walked past several times never checked on us spilt food on my mother I had to go and ask to order more drinks  The the final straw was then the waiter claimed it wasn t his fault as he d only just started when he actually took our order I asked to speak to the manager she was to busy changing a barrel in the bar  I replied no problem I ll wait staff reply again from the manager was she will still be busy why are you been like this for what is your problem  The bar is empty she has time to speak to me we are always quiet was the final remark and I can see why  I tried to call head office but no one has got back to me This is the first ever negative review I have ever give anywhere But my family and I think it was well earned  Living Room retrain you rude staff and get your manager to care about the few customers you have

I ordered a take away from the Shiplu because we hadn t been for about a year and used to visit a lot between 2005 - 2010 I genuinely wish I hadn t bothered  The standards are shocking and when constructive feedback was given I was met with an obnoxious owner who insisted I was mistaken I tried to redeem an offer and was informed that it wasn t valid it was and the owner couldn t possibly be wrong because he has a degree  I have never been treated as badly before and if you re considering spending money here on sub standard food and even worse service I suggest you seek other quality alternatives because there are plenty  Very sad to see a quality building with no substance

Having decided on this restaurant in Camden over many others around this turned out to be one of the biggest eating out mistakes I and my friend have ever made We were pestered to order drinks even before opening the menu we then ordered an antipasto to share and a beer and ordered our mains a pizza and a ravioli Halfway through the antipasto a waitress was headed our way with a pizza and pasta dish realising the mistake she turned on her heels back to the kitchen were they were put on hold by the oven I presume Some time later when we have finished out starter this was taken away and a dried out pizza and pasta dish were served utterly tasteless and ruined When the waiter was told all we got was a shrug of the shoulders the plates which were still half full taken away and a bill for 40  Never again there are so many restaurants close by I wouldn t recommend this place to anyone In a word Vile

We asked to set up a tab The man behind the bar asked what table were we sitting on We said sorry we could nt find a number on our table He said follow me  We went to our table and he could nt find a number on our table or any of the other tables He did not apologise He had a go at another member of staff for not putting the table numbers out The resturant was quiet at the time with very few people Our party of five paid for our drinks and left the resturant We had a nice meal with friendly service at a resturant just up the road August 2013
Good restaurant ruined by new owners why change something that worked so well Disappointed ex customer
Terrible service rude staff got it wrong and didn t care Rubbish burger Someone s clearly taken their eye off the ball Avoid

Whatever happened to this establishment in the space of a few weeks Sunday lunch here used to be a warm inviting environment with great food and cool live jazz Today however it was chilly service poor and food bland to say the least What ` pity

I have been to black and blue a couple of times before and on both occasions had a nice meal and some decent if unspectacular service  The first time I had to tell the bartender exactly what I meant when I requested a wet Gin Martini with a twist but she seemed new and was eager to listen and please me as the customer  So when I was heading for a late showing in the cinema I had no hesitation in taking my girlfriend in for some late drinks before the movie  We got in around 22 20 and were welcomed by the door man and I informed him we just wanted to get drinks He was more than happy and pointed us to the bar  What happened next left me very embarrassed and let down as I had been telling my girlfriend what a nice place it was  We got to the bar and started looking at the cocktails menus and waited for about 3 minutes for someone to come to the bar A bartender came over and just said NO MORE COCKTAILS GUYS and with that picked up the boston tins and put them in the glass wash behind him He then promptly left the bar again He didn t greet us or welcome us at all and after telling us no more cocktails  he didn t offer us any alternatives  Suffice to say we just walked straight out and got some cocktails at another bar

Decided to have a family lunch at the Willow Tree Firstly tried to order drinks at bar Well pathetic The barman should be sacked and the manager replaced  Then later I joined the queue to order food Same barman Got to the front of the queue and he disappeared off to serve a lady who appeared at the end of the bar I questioned it but he refused to serve me before her despite there being ageing people in the long queue behind me We left and had food in town  Don t go there    Paul

RIP OFF RIP OFF RIP OFF  A recent visit to this restaurant was from our point of view an absolute disaster as far as value for money is concerned  THERE WAS NO A LA CARTE MENU AVAILABLE AND THE SET MENUS WERE NOT VALUE FOR MONEY  All the food for the three of us for the whole meal could have been put on to one normal size dinner plate and still left plenty of room  The service was good and what little food there was was well cooked but this place can surely not afford to continue in business unless they up their game  A well known very successful businessman once told me that it was much easier and important to retain existing customers than get new ones How right he is  The Black Swan has just lost three possible regular customers  Terrible value for money and a big mistake not to have an al a carte menu available at all times  RIP OFF RIP OFF RIP OFF

In fairness the prices at Foundation are good once you finally get served Having been called by a sales rep offering a table for my birthday I rallied some people together for a evening of drinks Received a call in the morning to say the table was given to a someone who paid to book so I now have 12 people and nowhere to sit  thanks Despite this we still went along finally managed to get the free drinks that we d been promised but not without talking to three members of particularly unhelpful staff Service at the bar was VERY slow Every table was reserved so absolutely nowhere to set your drink down or to put food anywhere We were all really disappointed This venue was considerably better when it was The Langley I m afraid to say there are many more venues with better energy and better management in Coventry Garden

After recent change in management I phoned to check dogs were still welcome in the bar as we were planning on visiting for a meal as we d done many times before On the phone I was told yes they re still welcome so as we walked in the door I asked if there was anywhere we couldn t sit The answer was you can sit anywhere except on the carpeted area which left 2 tables one of which was beside the pool table which would be fine if I wanted a pool cue in my ear The other seat was virtually out the door and the seat itself was rotten We were invited to sit outside as well which was good of them   Needless to say we walked out and went elsewhere Customer service not present here and despite what we were told dogs are no longer welcome

I decided to visit the Bellflower  although I was aware of it s mixed reviews  on a Monday lunchtime That was my first mistake Myself my partner my son and grandson waited 20 minutes for soft drinks half an hour plus for food it took a rollicking by the manager to even get our food out of the kitchen The food was very poor quality when as I say it eventualy arrived and YES it may be cheap & cheerful but that s all Don t question how it s cooked - Don t even think where it s come from and as to it s purity least said the better Never ever again  I want to remain alive

My wife booked for afternoon tea at 2 30 pm Sunday 15th November We arrived a liitle early Place looked noce not very busy We were shown to our table We were then informed that chef couldn t do afternoon tea as he had run out of ingredienrts This was done with a very matter of fact attitude and a cursory apology Sorry can t do it The waiter then tried to blame us for not specifyning afternoon tea when booking - but they force you to use an automated telephone booking system that doesn t allow the type of booking to be specoified The unsympathetic waiter then proceeded to take my wife to his desk to show her the booking screen to prove it wasn t his fault OUTRAGEOUS We were not even offered a menu to choose an alternative lunch As we left my wife thanked the man for ruining her birthday treat he said it wasn t his fault I suppose it wasn t personally his fault but he was the noly representative of this shameful organisation that we had contact with There is a sign outside advertising afternoon tea 12-5 pm every day They are liers and charlatans And rude ones at that Stay Away

On the way back from Whitby on new years day we decided to call at the Fox and Rabbit but due to traffic arrived too late to have lunch so decided to call anyway and have a drink whilst our daughter fed our fifteen month old granddaughter As we got the baby out of the car my wife went into the pub and explained the situation only to be told that the consumption of your own food was not permitted Now for us to have walked in asked for a glass of water to share and then begun to eat our own sandwiches I d say fair play but to deprive a toddler of her lunch when we were willing to purchase drinks seems harsh to say the least

Took a trip here today mainly due to the cheap prices on the menu  Staff were very friendly and offered us the latest deals and asked if we had been here before I ordered the mixed grill and my partner order the rack of ribs I can honestly say it was the worst mixed grill I had eaten the meat literally tasted like it had been cooked last week it was so dry The rack of ribs should have been renamed to fat of ribs as there was no meat  I would not advise anyone to eat here the food is below the low price tag I would not of paid half the price for my meal  If you want to be chewing your food until your next meal out then this is the place

No Turkey I am afraid but this has been replaced by chicken No problem I love chicken so much that I have chicken 4 times a week as a main meal Asked for chicken only and then went on to select my vegetables Great no roast potatoes The roasted potatoes were brung out five minutes later Back to the table and took one bite out of the chicken This was removed from my mouth immediately This was cold and not fresh chicken breast This was like the cheap frozen chicken breasts that you buy in bulk from Iceland Absolutely disgusting dried out cold rubbish Vegetables were cold Potatoes were nice and freshly cooked The lady came up to clear the table and my plate was full of meat If she bothered to ask if everything was OK I would have said no Anyway she never bothered but hey none of the staff could actually be bothered from start to finish anyway Not a smile between them Place is a bit run down and the red seat that we were sitting on was all worn and peeling away Not worth the money Plenty of places to visit around the same area for something to eat

Well was expecting something perhaps a little special after the refit and the publicity hype  unfortunately was not to be and very poor  Staff not really interested almost blase to point of being rude  Set menu limited and when I requested an option to what they had run out of  nothing offered other than the other choices which were not really what I had in mind  Main course battered cod asked for a change from chips to some kind of potato and that after some pushing required an ok from the kitchen  that never the case before Sounds like a budget gone wrong  Went for the prawn and crab linguine  which arrived swimming in some kind of balsamic sauce but was unable to locate the crab as it was disguised as a chorizo or something similar  Linguine soup Plate felt grubby on the underside  Yuk  Overall LESS than average on all fronts Over priced - poor service - food sub standard  First and Last Time for me which is a shame as I had previously eaten there on quite a few occasions but sadly no more as there are much better choices else where for sure

Visited to celebrate sons A level achievements Gold club members Table booked not available when we turned up Gabriela Genz manager needs some serious customer relations training Would no longer recommend however Carluccios around the corner far better on every level Returning JAMIE OLIVER so called gold club cards simply not feeling the love for loyalty

I was appalled with the service at the Royal Oak The bar wasn t particularly busy and yet we were still left waiting for 20 minutes at the bar to order a drink When it eventually became our turn to be served one of the two bar staff walked off to clear tables before serving us and the other member of staff a blonde male decided to argue with myself when I questioned him regarding his colleague walking off  Needless to say I wont be visiting the Royal Oak again with my colleagues The service is slow and the staff are rude

Tonight we had a takeaway from this restaurant delivered to our home they got it wrong ordered a cheesy garlic Nan but got a Keema Nan when I phoned to complain the manager was aggressive arrogant and very rude needless to say they won t be getting my money again
Very poor service The beer was off and the management refused to exchange Please check the date on any bottle purchased from this establishment

Went here on Tuesday and had a typical Wetherspoons grill no problems cheap and cheerful so went back on Thursday with the family and the place was heaving The kitchen couldn t cope the bar was short staffed and the rest of the staff were surly and unhelpful The table had been used by a young family and looked like a car crash Despite repeated requests it took half an hour to get it cleared and the spillages were just wiped around the table with a dry cloth When the food did arrive half the meals were cold Unheated chicken on the chicken and ribs same with the bombay potatoes naan breads served straight out of the packet and smeared with garlic butter to produce a garlic naan but not even warmed under the grill Then there were samosas and onion bajis that had bern in the oven for hours and couldnt be broken up without a hammer and chisel While trying to eat we were treated to the sound of tables and chairs being slammed down around us as staff tried to straighten the pub up admirable but the way they were thrown around it was obvious that tempers were frayed Ok I appreciate that if you pay 8 for a pint and a curry you get a pint and a 5 curry not a Veraswamy quality dish but at least get the basics right Hot food good service Love Wetherspoons Just not this one
Absolutely atrocious overpriced fast food dive No customer service whatsoever disinterested kids serving and revolting looking food We walked out it was that bad

I mean my title by saying it in French and being French Although it was delicious food I totally disagree with this kind of cuisine It is a very expensive type of tapas where you are advised to take more as very light why not telling the client that you will be hungry after the meal as we were 4 of us  We added cheese but although called the Dairy no cheese board except a plate with 4 fines slices of cheese and 1 slice of bread So if anyone expects to be fed no Just a taste  Eat before or after rush to your fridge once you have paid around 260 for 4  2 bottles of wines and previous drink  Staff was nice but does not engage too much and you seat on a stool for that price No return for us for sure

Came to Shrewsbury as a mid-point for family to meet and have lunch- booked here as it looked very nice with excellent reviews  Unfortunately it is probably the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant On arrival we ordered drinks and waited 10 minutes before the waiter came to take our food order and advised the drinks are just coming- these did not come for another 10 minutes after the order We then waited 45 minutes without any notice of our food and had to ask a waitress if there was a problem with our order She advised she would go and check She did not return with an update although I could see there was an issue from the 10 minute discussion between the staff that followed The food then arrived after 55 minutes- the roast beef and pork arrived either tough or near-raw with two anaemic roast potatoes watery gravy and some uncooked veg on the side The veg tart was tasteless and the steak burger was a non-descript grey lump with some uncooked chips on the side We didn t receive an apology for the hour wait on the food

We used to go to the Fox and Hounds but stopped going about six months ago after the portions got smaller and the standard of cooking deteriorated  We heard that it had new management so decided to give it another chance I checked their website and saw that they had a offer on main courses on Wednesdays so I booked a table for four people for Wedneday 26th We ordered chicken supreme pork loin salmon fillet and a Classic beefburger When the meals arrived we were disappointed by the size of them For example my meal consisted of a small tepid slightly undercooked salmon fillet sat on a potato rosti the diameter of a beermat and about the thickness of three beermats surrounded by a clear salsa sauce and with four small pieces of broccoli artfully arranged on the plate It was as if nouvelle cuisine had returned with its pretentious undersized portions but without its quality My partner said her pork loin would have been ideal as a starter The burger looked like something from a low cost supermarket s value range The chicken did not have the expected rich white supreme sauce  We consoled ourselves with the thought that because of the we were effectively paying half price for half size meals We were wrong  When the bill arrived we were charged the full price for all four meals When we queried this with the waiter we were told that the pub was under new management and the offer had been stopped When we said it was still advertised on the pub s website the waiter apologised and said the website needed updating but we would still have to pay the full price  We left still hungry feeling doubly cheated first by the meanness of the meals and secondly by the pub reneging on its advertised deal  We will be voting with our feet and will not be returning
wow where do we start over on business in london decided to go to the chiltern firehouse  nothing too say but just f=dreadful   why do people go  are they paid

Didn t like this place been twice and been disappointed twice Arena chutney Tandori up the road is better and Balti Spice just down the same road is 10 times nicer the service in both is also better Fairly priced but the service was a bit rushed and impersonal the food was nothing special as mentioned to balti spice best in St Helens in my opinion is far better shame as the restaurant is decorated nicely and its a comfortable place to eat just not for me

Welcome was was quite cold The USP of the pub is that you can sit outside on the canal side Outside however all of the tables had not been cleaned or cleared Even when another customer asked for a table to be wiped over the waiter went inside came out with a rag cleaned the one table and walked by all of the other tables on his way back in This was not because of short staffing as there were three members of staff gassing at the bar There was no time given to digest the stater before the main course came The main course itself was pretty poor The Watermill has a great location and beautiful building it would be interesting to know what influence the adjacent Travelodge has

Visited on a Monday afternoon The waitress was completely obnoxious with a terrible attitude It took 30 minutes to have our table cleaned then a further 15 minutes to take our drinks order We all ordered Carvery when we went up to get it all of the meat looked dry and all the veg were brown and looked totally un-appetising and for 8 50 totally not worth the money We asked the chef if any fresh veg would be brought out she said they might bring some in 15 minutes  So we decided to pay for our drinks and leave I would advise anyone planning to go here for a meal to go somewhere else as this was a totally awful experience

A real let down Been using Beefeater restaurants for 40 plus years and tonight s meal was poor The fillet steak was under weight and was half the size it is normally Asked for side orders and they never arrived Waitress never came back to ask how our food was Had to get another waiter to get our bill Wish i hadn t bothered going as i was hungry when i left and my wallet 37 lighter

probably the worst meal I ve ever eaten out   ordered chicken pie  got a chicken pie which was drier than an old leather sole from a pair of my old boots chips were at best warm and the peas were cold  Both mine and my wife s drinks glasses were washed previously in the bottom of a river bed  at the very best

The cheap takeaway in West Drayton high street has far tastier food at 1 3 the price 9 95 for crappy seafood dish of mussles and beef lo mein  each that is  Nice posh place to dine in though  Probably why it costs so much  Do not waste your time or dough here

Fooled by the lovely outside appearance and welcoming signs we dived in on the way home from business in Liverpool for a satisfying carvery I think the title of this review says it all but maybe I should back up such a statement We pulled up on an empty car park and entered Warm welcome yes a tad early we waited 10 minutes for our prepaid carvery Voucher in hand we approached the serving area Ok first up for the 12 noon carvery and no one else waiting In front of us a few bowls of vegs a bowl of roast tats and a mixing bowl of weak looking gravy The main attraction if you will excuse the pun was a small long rib of beef a joint of pork and joint of gammon My partner first asked for the beef as soon as sliced I knew the rare appearance would not suit her but it was not just the chefs choice of cooking but the joint itself that destroyed it Running with veins of fat that may have dissolved if cooked over a long enough term but I doubt it  The pork was cooked and served Nothing more Yes it was cooked through with its 1 4 inch of soggy fat on the outside and veins of fat running through it Perhaps if the chef had been challenged enough to cut the fat off half way through and turn it into crackling we may have had a half hearted attempt at presenting pork The gammon joint was thrown in the oven again nothing more The idea of removing an outer layer of fat or scoring its outside over seen Maybe a temperature or weight check prior to cooking may have supplied the correct times for serving Ohh did I mention vegs  Undercooked carrots leeks prepared to last the duration of service and cabbage BUT oositive if you like well cooked roast potatoes that aren t crispy your in luck Bottom line awful The waiter came to collect the plates smiling and graceful and asked with all sincerity How was your meal I answered with equal sincerity  Probably the worst carvery I have every had  After a lovely and successful weekend away the last thing on my mind was to take on a manager who had the the lack of respect to try and pass this as a quality carvery On visiting TripAdvisor my decision was correct any manager who can ignore or dismiss this public show of poor reviews would be better served stacking shelves in a back street shop not running a pub I do note a positive review from a local who enjoys the scampi and burger I am glad they can at least they cook this simple meal I feel sorry for those who fall into the same honey trap as we did A good exterior appearance does not say anything for the food the empty car park should have said it all This is one true example that the TripAdvisor reviews say it all Travel a few miles further on and you will find a far better meal Unfortunately for us we paid twice and sat twice to get a good sunday lunch The Fish Pool Inn our savour Old English Inns you should be ashamed

While on a business trip felt like having some good Turkish food judging from the reviews for dinner I was on my own and there were a few 4 seat tables available but none single ones The waiter host had a look around the place and hesitantly said that they don t have any tables for a single person Obviously decided I m not going to be a good business offered me only takeaway When I said that I would like to eat in he thought that it would be actually a better idea to tell me that the available tables are actually booked which clearly was not the case Even if their food is supposed to be good attitude is as essential part of the experience so Would Not Recommend

Restaurant looks nice when you first go in but it ends there Menu is your usual italian menu with one diffrence its not cheap and actually alot worse than any other restaurant in walking distance not fresh and no flavour service is no better than the food save your money go elsewhere

The Folly Isle of Wight  60 for Christmas lunch = WASTE OF TIME & MONEY What a waste of money The Folly charging 60 per person for plated food on Christmas day  living up to it s name kids running around bar areas sticky tables and dirty cutlery  Unkempt staff serving slowly with about as much personality as an upturned boat on the shoreline The venue had no seasonal ambience at all people were crammed in like a Christmas turkey farm  This is nothing more than a spit and sawdust pub for yachts people not a dining experience worth 60 a head   There are far nicer places to have a Christmas lunch on the Island at a fraction of the price Dont waste your time and money here on seasonal special events  Not forgetting the terrible condtions of the road pot holes on an unkept road making it a risk to your exhaust and suspension if you take anything else other than a 4wheel drive Really this was a hidious experience

Went to Bradford to visit family members living there so thought I d take some food for them so l placed a order for thirteen starters And two faloodas as I love them the waitress told me twenty minutes so l told her not to rush the order so that mistakes aren t made and I d call back 30 to 40 minutes later  Went back after forty minutes and picked up the order at that time I asked if they had checked the order oh yes everything is there Came home and discovered straight away discovered that my faloodas were missing on closer inspection found two small tubs of raw onion in place of thirteen tubs of salad which should accompany the starters and should at the very least have tomato cucumber lemon and lettuce

Service not pleasant I complained in writing and they never replied 2 it is a worrying fact that the Food Standards Agency last inspection states a score of just 2 improvement necessary It should be a 5 I do not recommend this restaurant I never complete reviews but it was necessary to write this one

Had a table booked with views of the broards in the bar When we arrived our table was reserved for friends of the manager so ended up with views of the car park We were then told we have to order our own food at the bar  and when we did the friends were getting table service  We ordered 4 meals  after 15 mins 2 meals came out and they said the other 2 are on there way 10 mins of waiting still no meals for theother 2 So we went to the bar and they said that they had lost the order and would have to start again and would take our food away to reheat iit  So in the end we asked for a full refund and left  And made our way to the jolly farmers in ormesby Which was amazing food So i wouldn t recommend the boathouse unless you want to just have a drink to look at the views Very poor and i would say considering they spent a lot of money doing it they should have proper menus not paper ones

Having read great reviews we booked in for Sunday lunch as the midpoint of a 6 mile walk A somewhat frosty reception although a nice bar area We had to ask where the restaurant was and waited an age for menus Radiator was on full blast on a sunny day so the room was very warm we asked if the door next to us and the patio area could be opened nothing happened Bread arrived with the starters The onion soup was insipid although the other starters weren t bad The Sunday roasts arrived with vegetables on the plate unfortunately covered in a very salty gravy  The broccoli was overcooked limp and khaki  The mustard and butter were in sachets On a hot day the pleasant bottle of Muscadet wasn t in a wine cooler The sea trout was covered in a thick pesto with little flavour and a lot of pinenuts  Our farewell included the comment  you didn t eat all your vegetables  As a generalisation Sunday lunches can often be a poor reflection of a restaurant but we would still be reluctant to try the Carpenters Arms again

A meal out for 8 of us I opted for the 2 italian burgers which were nearly 12 When they came out it was like looking at 2 mini doughnuts Very expensive and over rated It is so noisy in there not a place for a quality meal It wont be long before it closes and ends up a charity shop to go with all the others in the high street Again its an example of London prices for food and drink on the IOW When are these business s going to realise people get paid nothing over here The winter months will be the tell tail sign when all the tourists go home
Very economical 3663 ping ping food need to change cooking oil more frequently as old oil causes bad guts Friendly staff and all round atmosphere

After hearing rave reviews we arrived after booking a table to be greeted by a very abrubt and rude tout outside We were then taken to the restaurant next door in the basement which transpires is the sister restaurant to Aladin  A couple were disrupted during their meal with the tout taking the chaps personal items from the table next to them and placing them on their table without even asking - we were then ushered to sit uncomfortably close next to them which we declined  We then went to the other side of the restaurant then only to be sat next to another couple who were also moved after they complained  Only soft drinks offered - you have to go down the off licence down the road if you want alcohol - something I had to do after ordering the main course  Tables very small food great - but everything else about this place lets the food down which is a shame  Very rude staff - defo one to avoid on a first date  in fact avoid it

This place used to be a pub I popped in for a pint while waiting for a take away from next door When I said that I only wanted a drink I was told that the had a 4 pint rule Apparently if you want a fourth pint they don t want you it is a restaurant not a pub I won t be going back
Aweful experience food was inedible looked good on entry did not live up to expectations Would not go again

ordered a king prawn came with no prawns on complaining the waiter told me they were in the sours I think that if the menu says King prawn then you should be able to tell that its King prawn will not be retuning there The restaurant was clean and the waiter was polite

Came here with a group of friends sat by the door Knew we d made a mistake when we arrived - it smelt of urine and stale smoke - but hoped that the empty seats were indicative of the nice day outside They weren t Scones were terrible and although menu says they were homemade the manager eventually conceded they were bought elsewhere We ordered three pots of tea and they decided to combine all three together into one relatively small pot Menu was unclear and it wasn t clear that they charged 2 00 for adding clotted cream to a small slice of Treacle Tart taking the price to 5 60 when you can get a lovely Treacle Tart from Rick Stein s for 3  Service was terrible rude unpleasant and argumentative when we queried the added 2 00 Worst place in the otherwise lovely Padstow Probably Definitely avoid

This used to be a fantastic curry house but sadly no more  We ordered three different curries and all of them were rammed with onion - I think in an attempt to bulk up the dishes Now I know that onion is a stock curry ingredient but it was almost as if the chef had made the curry and then chopped up an additional onion into each serving  I d much rather pay a little extra and get my curry as it should be instead of the restaurant cutting corners to keep their prices attractive  The service was efficient but rather abrupt We ll be avoiding this place until we hear that it has been improved

Lat summer tried this pub and it was FANTASTIC Arrived this month kept waiting 45 mins for service NO wasnt busy was at the end of service very little activity from the kitchen  Given two menus which one the real one ordered mains my smoked pork dry sweet very smoked really horrid another plate was some seafood nasty taste as well Wifes chicken choriso pie dry uneviting The two with me went for the pudding my wifes merangue nasty and sisters chocolate thing like something from a transport cafe Wasnt asked if all ok even waited over 1 2 hr for pudding Service very poor food dreadful After last year when I actually gave a brilliant write up wouldnt recommend it again What a dreadful shame as we live up the road and it s nice to have somewhere descent

Tried the fish and chips after reading the great reviews      Boy how wrong they were I am a great fish and chip lover and would travel miles for the right package the fish batter was more white than brown soggy in fact the chips also white and the so called mushy peas  I should have known when I seen him boil the kettle as they turned out to be green boiled water I really don t like to write anything bad about anyone or place but you have to be honest and a spade is a spade where I come from so its a big FAT give it a miss if you are a fish and chip lover I mean a real fish and chip lover with the golden brown batter and lovely brown chips with no sharp edges One other point the plastic fork I asked for cut my lip as the edges are very sharp not blaming the owner for this But one to watch out for the kids you don t want to spoil the visit to the seaside sitting in A&E I just cant rate it at all

I decided to treat the wife and I to a fish lunch and we thought we-d try this place after such good reviews Unfortunately when we drew up the shutters were down and there was a for sale notice attached to the building Shame we didn t try this place earlier

We have been to this restaurant happily many times before This time though the service was lacking and we had a wait to be seated a wait to order drinks and then another for food orders As for the wait for food to be brought to the table 40 mins for a steak is just unacceptable  especially when it arrives half ash and half raw The staff were then very rude and laughed about what had happened as it was funny  Unsurprisingly I did not pay and will not be returning

I live in London and really wanted to like this place  but quite frankly it smells like a sewage Maybe if you sit outside you can t smell the nastiness but inside is gross It smells like it has been there for 50 years and never been clean but it is a newer place Placing us next to the toilet without any choice doesn t help  Some of the staff looked cracked out and are very disrespectful they like to pull a face as well as have an attitude It looks like something you d find in a seedy part of the city like Hackney or Peckham I will avoid this place in the future There are plenty of other places in the area to have a better experience  Judging by reviews this was not a one off A shame because it s a really nice setting but the place is obviously run by a bunch of amateurs who have just left college and the chef should be ashamed of what he or she is sending out of the kitchen Steer well clear

It s a real shame with this one I Love KFC but this particular one is a disgrace  The staff are less than helpful the store is almost always messy and floor is dirty But to top it off the wait to even get served is usually around 15 mins That s not counting the time it takes to get your food  This KFC just never has any food ready you usually have to wait another 10-15 mins for the food once you ve ordered  I ve even had an argument with one of the staff both me and another customer were served Pepsi that was just soda and tasted horrible we had both told the staff separately to then be told that obviously we were wrong and it couldn t be the drink  If you want KFC go to one in Gorleston or Great Yarmouth both of them are great KFCs

Worst experience in my life  Waited 1 hours for the drink to be served  Never got serve the mains dish had to ask for the bill  the drink were horrible Had to pop to nandos for a decent meal Staff was not even apologetic

On Saturday 16th July a friend and I decided to have a trip out to Twickenham for a leisurely lunch  Not knowing Twickenham very well we decided to just randomly pick the look of a place we liked The place was Bellissimo Ristorante Firstly on arrival we were greeted by a very sullenly looking waiter However I thought I would not take it personally as sometimes people have bad days We were then asked if we had booked a table I replied no is that a problem The waiter replied well all these tables are booked  I would like to state at this point That it was about 4 30 in the afternoon and the restaurant was practically empty barring three tables that were occupied The waiter then said well you can sit here walking over to a table situated by the toilets   Or he said you can sit outside Hmmmmmm As you can imagine that did not boad well with us being as I said the restaurant was not busy at this point I suspect noting the look on our faces the waiter then said well you could sit upstairs then as we were about to agree to that a reserved table miraculously became available Who knows maybe someone called and cancelled as we were standing there So we are now seated and looking forward to our fabulous lunch and pleasant service Sadly this was not to be I will make this part of my review very brief As I have used up a lot of your reading time setting the seen for you all The sullen waiter returned His mood had not improved The waiter was unattentive however the food was served promptly  The food dare I call it that We both had a pastabake dish which were baked to within an inch of their life  To our surprise We had thin pesto pizza for a starter As it was not clear on the menu that it was an actual pizza but nevertheless I will say it tasted nice I had apple crumble for dessert  I can only say that it was like eating melted brown sugar with stewed apples  It was horrifyingly sweet and I have a sweet tooth It made me feel like I needed a trip to my dentist the next day I m going to sum up by saying The customer service was beyond poor We were made to feel most unwelcome and the food was not of any high restaurant quality that I am used to  Our experience at this restaurant was disappointing to say the least and one that we shall never repeat For this unpleasant experience we were charged 65 00 It s sad that establishments think it s okay to treat customers this way and then further insult you by charging you for it Not a pleasant experience

After many many visits to Cicchetti over the years almost always for breakfast today counted as amongst both the worse breakfasts and worst eating experiences I have ever had The place was substantially empty on arrival and we were shown to what was simply the nearest table When I asked to move the request was granted in a graceless manner to another table  Orders placed two drinks two breakfasts one the traditional breakfast one Eggs Benedict Drinks arrived separately 5 minutes apart Cold food arrived after another 20 minutes or so on two cold plates The Benedict was tasteless and inadequate The muffins whilst toasted were cold and not buttered Inexplicably there was rocket on the plate but no wedge of lemon The eggs were pale and if they were free range I will eat hay with a donkey  The cooked breakfast had amongst its treasures a tablespoon- worth of cheap baked beans make your own San Carlo  which were stone cold as was the toast The waitress disagreed with me as to the warmth of the plate but then whipped the whole thing away Another 20 minutes later a red hot plate reappeared with a pair of pale bone dry half- eggs though I was fortunate to have half of someone else s broken yolk mixed in  Mushrooms were slimy and overcooked The was a burnt half garden tomato and a dried hash- brown of the type that Farmfoods sell I did not even attempt to eat it especially as my friend s breakfast had been eaten an age before mine reappeared Oh and they forgot the toast again and when that arrived it was pale cold and underdone  Manager did not arrive so after 5 minutes went to find him chatting up a table of ladies At no point did he look at my plate Or ask what he could do to put it right Instead  2 80 representing a cup of tea was knocked off the bill Eventually the breakfast I didn t eat was knocked off but still the bill was over 20 for a truly dismal experience  Where is the potato blini the marjoram- seasoned beef tomato and home- made rosti of old I m no restaurateur but I d get a chef who cares and can keep food hot  some new staff and please please stop cutting costs Until then the poor reviews will keep coming and the loyal customers won t

A pub on the edge of Borough Market We visited for a drink and the bar staff seemed to think they were doing us a favour by serving us That and they didn t even know what beers they were serving we had to point out which pumps they should use  Then I dared to take a photo of us in the pub Oooops - the big burly bouncer came over and told me I wasn t allowed to use my camera His manner was very aggressive but I had to point out that they had CCTV which was taking everyones photo Wrong move - he went into some tirade about security issues and god knows what so we drank up and left  There is no shortage of nice bars nearby so don t bother going to this pretentious and precious place

This place should be one of the areas busiest pubs attractions a great position fantastic views set in a beautiful area from there it goes down hill Locals give the place a very wide birth as it s reputation preceeds it The staff and management are so un professional and service is so slow if your lucky to eventually get served What should be the brewery crown jewel it s a complete farce It s so sad to see something with much potential being run down and wasted the food is also very poor Do yourself a favour give it a wide birth better places nearby

Yesterday evening me and my 2 children went to the Chinese Buffet It didn t appear that busy We asked for a table for 3 upon entry We were asked to sit and wait in the seating area by the bar At least 3 more parties of people arrived after us and they all were asked to wait for a table unfortunately all the other parties were then taken to various tables before me and my children when I asked the man who appeared to be sorting the tables out why we appeared to be invisible he offered no explanation I then left the Restaurant and when round the corner to  Nandos were the service and food were excellent

I am actually sat in this establishment as I type There are dirty glasses and plates piled high both behind an actually on the bar the place is littered through out with empty plates of food and glasses  some plates at our bench table have been there for 45 minutes  there are unwiped tables throughout some of which are heavily soiled Service was also pathetically slow 10 minutes to order a bottle of wine and two glasses  my ordering was twice interrupted whilst the bartender took calls AVOID

We went with friends having heard some good reports The Inn is very attractive but for us that s where it stopped It took an hour and a half for our food to arrive and when it did it could only rate as OK and nothing special We dared not risk ordering a dessert But what made it worse was the lack of management which at best was patronising there was no explanation or apology and when we asked we were told it will be 5 or 15 minutes but in fact was very much longer We were only given some complimentary bread and olives when we started to complain and eventually a complimentary bottle of wine By now it was too late to go anywhere else and we were hungry otherwise we would have left Let s hope this was an exception but it s unlikely we ll go again or recommend it

Did not enjoy the food atmosphere whole experience was poor this place is going the same way as the one in the town centre same owners I recall food was not hot and of a average standard at best bit like a school canteen miserable staff so overall will not go again

The place could do with some t l c and a good scrub the managers never seem to stay long enough to get to know and the floor is uneven so take care if not steady on your feet the toilets are smelly and the tables are dirty knot sure if food is sold but it does give advertisements to say they do all though I have not seen anyone eating here

We went to Oblix for a Sunday lunch and were left waiting on the side while the hostess seated everyone behind us first The stampede that came out of the elevator had varied lunch time reservations some of which were 45 mins after ours but she still dealt with them first We were then seated far from any view and the service was even worse than I had heard it would be The starters were fine but the tenderloin was tough and not worth it s price Very expensive and extremely noisy Impossible to hear anyone talk I WILL NEVER GO BACK

An extremely unhelpful staff My local Weatherspoons Elk in Poulton staff have a completely different mind set I was with a large group of friends who thought the same In fact I m still waiting on my breakfast which never arrived

Im a level 3 in travel and tourism and I orderd a chicken tikka dhansak when it came I had one bight and spat it back out The chicken korma was also the same All the other family members liked theres but was not happy when they tried both the chicken dishes The staff looked like they was is a rush and was very pushy There was not even an apology from staff and only knocked the korma off the bill I eat currys all the time and this was by far the worst but i got told from a family member that the lamb was the best they had All the starters were great but who serves raw food Would richard branson be happy

Looks good from the outside that s it Half empty containers 4 small pieces of chicken in my dish but the icing on the cake was when I pulled a piece of naan from the bag only to chew on hair I took it back and upon examination by the owner I was was told it was a ladies hair  and it didn t come from them no apology no offer of any form  not that I would have accepted should have bought a tesco take away that says it all

Arrived on New Years Eve afternoon with 5 friends and my 5 year old son Walked Into main area where there were lots of large EMPTY tables The host ordered us to move to the family area as we had a child  I really don t like this area it s dirty dark and grotty at the best of times but we went to find a table  Immediately we found no tables free so we walked though to the QUIET area and found a table  The very rude and sharp waitress barked  no kids allowed you need to move to the family area no kids in this side allowed  We told her this was full so she told us either to wait 30 mins no idea where as no kids allowed  We were astounded that as there were lots of free tables they were happy to loose our custom Apparently it s company policy not to allow children in any area other than the family side  SHOCK  This is astonishing in a time where everywhere in the media it is becoming more apparent that discrimination actually exists in 2017 we found ourselves being discriminated as we had a child present in our group Why on earth should I be made to wait 30 mins or have to leave just because this is the ONLY place we are allowed to sit when there was plenty of vacant tables available I am genuinely appalled at this Subsequently they have now lost custom from 6 people who will discuss this in every friendship and family group to ensure the message gets around asap  Letter is on its was to HQ about this disgraceful policy and the arrogant lady who was very happy to see us leave through the door passing at least 5 empty tables  Regardless whether you are a parent of a child under 12 or not no one should be discriminated against in this day and age We would not ever chose to sit in the horrible children s area so why be made to or have the only option to leave  My family had visited here a number of times and on our last occasion we had 5 children with us and we all sat on the out of bounds area  so your process is inconstant  Never returning - you should be ashamed of yourselves Disgraced

Travelled to this chippy due to good reviews I have to say they were awful Batter on the fish was not cooked properly thick yellow slop inside on the fish Fish not filleted properly bones in my fish I understand that s the suppliers fault though chips some cooked some raw with green bits and eyes on still My dinner went in the bin And so my hunt for a decent chippy in Huddersfield starts again

Don t bring your sandwiches here It s certainly no picnic visiting Lord Sandwich s stately pile at Mapperton His ancestor may have liked to bring his own grub but don t you try it No picnic places and if you try to eat at the outdoor÷ having bought a drink a lady comes out and shouts at you  get out leave now I ll give you your money back for the drinks and get out now After that welcome remember not to feed the birds and don t go using his lordship s croquet set either unless you have permission The garden is pretty enough except for the two foul sticking old swimming pools full of green brackish water- perhaps that s where you are thrown if you use the croquet set without permission We would have liked afternoon tea but when m lord and lady nip into the Ritz they can pay with their credit card but not here So off to Bridport for some fresh air in more senses than one

We have given them 3 chances awful rib sauce on one the worse salt beef sandwich on two and just plain arrogant and poor service from management on three Opening a restaurant doesn t mean you know how to run one

I don t usually post poor reviews but I think in this case I must we are staying at the premier inn and booked breakfast as we usually do as in the pasted we have had nothing but good food and service but this one was totally rubbish the young lad who was cooking the food was out of his depth as it was very busy and he was on his own this meant he cooked the sausage and bacon but ran out of eggs and tomatoes by the time these were cooked he had run out of bacon and sausage again this became an unending cycle for the poor lad we complained to the duty manager who s attitude was if you have a problem tell the premier inn which we did and to their plays gave us a complete refund This is the first time we have had a problem so won t stop us using these establishments but won t be having breakfast at this one again

Went to Owd Nells on Sunday for lunch and have been before on many occasions The reservation system in place is diabolical and quite frankly not customer friendly My partner and I walked around the place looking for a table without reservations put upon them but alas this could not be found Eventually a girl strolled up which we took to imply she was in charge of the reservations and the 3 parties behind us got seen to before us and seated immediately they hadn t already made a reservation  When we enquired about a table for two we were told there would be at least a 10 minute wait which I was fairly surprised at considering the amount of tables that were empty and the reservation list containing a small amount of names I can t seem to find a reason why she would make it up or what would motivate her to resist seating us but something was definitely off I decided that I wasn t waiting around pointlessly and it was clear she didn t want our custom so we went elsewhere I will repeat that I m not sure what the motivation was or the reason behind the girls decision but I didn t appreciate it in the slightest and this needs looking at We will not return to Owd Nells which is a real shame as we have been around once a week for the last 15 years that s a lot by the way  and this is the first time we have felt this way Fortunately for Owd Nells they will always continue to be busy and will not need two peoples custom to exist I just felt I had to write this review to convey my dismay and disappointment in Owd Nells even though not a blind bit if notice will be taken by them Oh well Preston and surrounding areas better start improving their eateries now this place is off the radar

Today we waited an hour then yuk the breakfast tasted awful bacon looked & tasted raw offered us a free coffee which was nearly full of frothy milk that needed spooning out the last half We ve been here several times in the past & cant remember it being like this as it been taken over

My family and I visited for my daughters birthday  My son in law were the only members of the party to choose steak and we were both violently ill with food poisoning for two days afterwards  This meal was the only common denominator and I don t believe in coincidence  Dine there at your peril

We called in for lunch 3 tables had customers sitting at them so we chose a window seat We ordered our drinks whilst waiting for a table to be cleared 25 minutes later they had not cleared a single table  The member of staff that bought our drinks even pushed the dirty plates across one of the tables in order to put the tray down to serve our order from the whole time we were there not one table was cleared of left over food or drinks  There reply to the table issue was they were very busy LOL The place is cluttered with to much stuff it would not be so bad if they move it and cleaned and removed the cobwebs there are a lot nicer placeS to frequent in street with better service

I would have loved to review this restaurant however they claimed not to have a booking in our name I found the staff unhelpful and obviously rushed off their feet during the short time that we were there In a way I was glad that we had to go elsewhere as this restaurant appeared cramped an claustrophobic I have no doubt that the service would have been as poor as described by other reviewers in the end we went to the Wall Heath Tandoori and had a great time I shan t be bothering with Zendis again

Before I start I realise that it s not the Ritz  but the food has to be a certain standard Family meal surroundings are great pub is great Food shocking  ordered Sea bass fillet with asparagus peas and buttered new potatoes Fish was cold and like rubber peas mixed with asparagus stalks clearly frozen mixed veg  microwaved grey potatoes with no butter YUK Daughter had chicken Kiev burnt with no muddle father had burnt chicken Breast Seriously poor Hadn t been here for 3 years because food was bad however it s worse than ever premier inn please take notice and sort it out

I attended here for a quiet drink after work and the toliets were dirty and they stunk The tables are sticky and grubby Their attitudes towards customers is horrendus and the service was awful instead of them saying hello how may i help you They just asked what do you want  Was accused of having too much to drink even though they could understand what i was saying not being rude or lary or paraletic which was not possible because i just finished work  probarly because they wanted to close early  probarly the most rude and depressing place i been to and the food is not great either will not be setting foot in that place again and i will not be reccomending this place to others either

The service was very slow meal very disappointing small and over microwaved vegetables were cold We waited to order a desert but were not asked if we wanted one so paid bill and left No excuse as the place was virtually empty This is the second bad experience at lunch time although a visit in the evening was much better Food overpriced for what you get We will not be visiting again for some time

Yes that s right I think you would be better off going across the road and using the vending machine in the visitor centre A vending machine would give better levels of customer service than at the Gatehouse The food would also be nicer Oh and it would be cheaper too  Needless to say I m not a big fan of this place The service food and prices are all terrible I would recommend either of the Vesper Gate or more preferably the West End House You will get a much better meal or drinks there  Oh the building is gorgeous mind you

Waited at please wait here sign to be seated no staff to be seen restaurant and bar only had small amount of customers after ten minutes we seated ourselves at table after about ten more minutes member of staff took our orders only about four couples in restaurant at time thia curry was nice then waited at less another ten minutes after finishing dinner for dessert menu and order the at less a good hour after for dessert to arrive manager look clueless spent time walking up and down with laptop in hand  Recommend they employ more staff even heard chef shout service four times for staff to take food to tables first and last time going to this place

Landlord is a nutter and the place is a hovel Even before we got in the pub the Landlord kicked off in the car park Tried to scam us saying we hit a customers car Turns out the beaten up shed of a car belonged to the so called chef We nearly had to call the police Beware

I had been here for dimsum before and it was pretty decent So I thought I would come here with my girlfriend for dinner one night Oh my god what a mistake The black pepper beef we ordered was slathered in some non-descript brown sauce like the stuff you get with a 5 quid steak at the pub  the steamed greens we ordered were overcooked to a mushy consistency and the aubergine with pork claypot was so flavourless that we had to ask for some soy sauce and vinegar just to bring it up to a palatable state To add insult to injury The bill - each dish averaged over 10 quid which would have been wholly justified if it was a decent meal But it wasn t My verdict stick with the dimsum and avoid the main courses at all cost

Tried to phone and book a table for my wife s birthday I tried phoning for 4 days and no one answered so I drove to the restaurant and found that the place is in darkness Shame because the food was good

Really looking forward to a nice Sunday lunch decided to go to the star in Leighton buzzard big mistake kept waiting from the off landlady very unwelcoming waiter very stressed starters were fine got one starter which were for another table so waited 5 mins for other starters to arrive when the mains arrived 3 x roasts with no Yorkies when asked the server said they were busy and no more were made I fancied a nice steak and ale pie homemade was just a pie mix with a puff pastry lid so clearly not homemade bland dry and cooked in bisto waited 40mins for mains they pride themselves on home made roasts being a chef I ve never ever tasted anything like it shockng complained to the waiter and he said that if we have a problem take it up with the owner very bad also swore at our table under his breath For me this is the worst pub to eat in Leighton buzzard shocking  when we asked to speak to the manager she said im busy and clearly didn t want to speak to me -

Had to visit Reigate on business and checked to see which restaurants close by would be worthy of a visit for lunch According to the Gey Rhino website they re open for lunch We arrived to see the menu displayed externally and confirmation of opening hours We entered the front door but at the top of the staircase the door to the restaurant was locked OK maybe closed due to some emergency these things happen But we phoned to check and we were told they re only open in the evening Some people are in business in spite of themselves Luckily Reigate has plenty of eateries who can be bothered to open for lunch in accordance with published times

Having traveled all over the country i can honestly say this chip shop wins FIRST PRIZE for the worst food we have ever eaten The fish must have been caught by captain noah in the good ship ark The chips were just as bad and the mushy peas just a green glowing lump that struggled to slide out of he pot The 4 meals we purchased were totally uneatable The price was so expensive to at close to 30 00 The person behind the counter got part of the order wrong which is hard to do when we said fish chips and peas x4 please The whole place was dirty and dated I would rather starve than visit again With the right people and a lick of paint this could be a credit to the good people of mundsley

Second time at this place first wasn t marvelous so gave it a second chance as it was late Tandoori chicken flavourless not been marinated very long and was bland Next was a biryani greasy and again lacking any depth of spice The curry sauce that came with icing be described as a sauce more like big chunks I ve vegetable all dente coated in a bland sauce  Won t be going back for a third attempt very disappointing it s probably the worse indian meal I have had ever Just makes you angry

Just normal coffee which is overpriced when taken with biscuits or cake   Always a long wait to get served in all Costa s not just Bridgnorth Staff always overworked Think they should have more staff on

Starters Tuna Carpaccio - tasteless A carpaccio means thinly sliced these were medallions Wild Mushroom - tasteless How do you remove the flavour We could only speculate how the flavour had gone missing Main Course Fish Grill - we sent this back as the fish was not cooked which they accepted Calves Liver - overcooked and soggy vegetables We order a desert but cancelled it We lost patience when we ordered sweet wine and it was delivered in 50ml glasses The standard serving for sweet wine is 125ml or 150ml and they argued We live in a big city Milton Keynes and eat our regularly here and in London We gave allowance that this is a tiny town of just 3 000 people with its own dining microclimate but we were left with the feeling that these guys simply did not know what they were doing They were completely out of their depth charging top prices for a menu they do not have the competence deliver on  Looking back we should have seen the signs The whole place is run down untidy amateurish and full of half finished DIY jobs The waiters were shambolic untrained monosyllabic scruffy with no €÷lan or polish  The next evening we ate Antonio s Trattoria round the corner and were delighted

Awful food and awful service Waited an hour for a takeaway  The food was really bland and boring The Singapore Vermicelli was the worst part It was gloopy flavourless and tasted artificial Don t waste your time or your money here

I had read some reviews about the service but thought I would try it the food was nice once we got it but the service was very poor After arriving we waited 20 mins and know one came to order drinks so had to find a member of staff  eventually they came  then waited a long time until they took order again had to find a member of staff and again for another round of drinks  then hot plates came out to our table but food followed 15 mins later so the plates were cold  Not enough staff and will not be returning

Hot sticky smelly and staff need retraining they give the impression of being grossly under staffed or running on a tight budget and could not care less whether the customer is taken care of or not take it or leave it attitude

Firstly let me say the staff are excellent and always friendly so no complaint there That s the good news The bad news is that being owned by Marstons but leased from Scottish and Newcastle or what ever they are called now means that it is in a permanent state of disrepair the toilets are out of the dark ages always smelly with wet floors and a permanent yellow warning sign soap dispensers with no soap and in the wrong place In the summer there are never enough staff when the garden gets busy and for reasons only known to themselves they claim it is price but don t believe that for a minute they seem to stock all the wrong real ales with none of the favourites Doombar London Pride Good Old Boy etc and a load of mediocre ones instead With a bit of investment and good management this could be a great pub with a brilliant location near houses the canal the railway station and industrial units but till they do it is at best mediocre at worst a missed opportunity by its owners

I love Groupon because it allows you to discover places that you ve never heard of or been to Sometimes you discover little gems to which I d happily advertise to friends and family But then there are other times when you find a shocker like Chi bar  It was bad from the word go My girlfriend and I walked in nothing to say please wait to be seated  So we waited and waited some more No staff to greet us So we wondered to the back where the bar was and asked to be seated It was a while before we were given any menus to look at You get a glass of prosecco or a soft drink alternative with this groupon the waiter brought prosecco to us without even asking if we wanted soft drink or prosecco I was driving so I couldn t drink The waiter was awful didn t say a word just plonked the glasses in front of us  The waitress was new so we could forgive her for being a little slow taking the orders I had asked her to double check the groupon details to check what was included  The starters arrived quite quickly to be fair I had chicken wings which were a little greasy but my girlfriend s onion bahjee was good The mains took a while to arrive and tasted average The naan was a little burnt and the chips a bit soggy But still permissible - see how lenient I am The waiter did not impress though Not professional at all black shirt with shiny black jeans and trainers He barely spoke to us only asking us who had what when delivering the food He didn t ask if we had finished our meal just took glasses and plates away without a word  No sooner had we finished the manager asked if we wanted the bill and if we didn t mind  could we pay quickly and leave  I can understand they re busy but how utterly rude to take your water away before you ve finished  I have no problem paying for what I owe but when I asked the waitress what was included in the groupon she d said a starter main and side each The bill charged us for drinks as expected and sides I enquired about the sides and the manager immediately took it as a personal attack All I was after was that the manager made sure his staff knew the terms and conditions of what offer they were running instead he initiated an argument at the table He tried to blame me for not reading the groupon properly - I knew what was included but wanted to make sure because with past groupons the restaurant may add to the offer But all this restaurant had to add was rudeness and poor service  I can safely say I ll never be eating drinking or even mentioning this place again unless it is a warning to stay away

Had take away from there and food was terrible Lamb tikka was gristle poppadom was not crisp and the curry was griany in texture with very little meat with far too much salt Had severe stomach cramps after and would have been sent back if given that in restaurant

+ good shami kebab starter + great lassi - cramped - noisy - bad curry - terrible service Had to order everything twice as it didn t arrive first time twice  Night ended in argument with waiter manager

Landlady I presume as an employee wouldn t be so rude couldn t have cared less that we waited 40 mins for food There were onl a couple of tables eating before us so I don t understand it No apology no I m sorry let me see how long it will be  Just it s nearly ready and you will have to pay if you leave  We had to go paid for drinks and had to leave Still no apology

The waitress brought a 4 bottle of water instead of the tab water we ordered At the end of the dinner she didn t give us the full change back keeping 3   All this on the top of a 20 service fee that was non-advertised on the menu 30 for 2 basic vegetarian pizza and a bottle of water we never ordered  Way too expensive for very ordinary food  I ll never go there again

I don t know what it s like to eat here but a number of times I have gone in for a pint because it s so pretty and in such a nice spot - and every time until now I have forgotten how TERRIBLE it is  Normal service = 5 people behind the bar and only 1 of them serving Not unusual to have a 15 minute wait to be served when there are only a few customers Staff rarely seem to know what they are doing and always seem in a flap The beer is horribly overpriced and the atmosphere is awful  AVOID AT ALL COSTS  If you want a great pub in the area go to the Parcel Yard in KX Station instead
Was served dry tasteless donuts that were at least a couple of days old and when complained received the worst customer service ever

This wetherspoons has gone seriously downhill recently There appears to be new management and with it has come a severe drop in quality and service  We visited as a party of 10 for a birthday celebration Upon first attempting to order we found that most of the meals were unavailable at 6 00 on a thursday night The pub was out of mixed grills most curries beef burgers and chicken burgers Disappointed we changed most of the orders and waited another 10 mins to be served again We were then told that there was no hot dogs which most of our orders had been changed to We ultimately gave up and ordered whatever was available  The staff member serving us was rude and appeared to have no idea what she was doing She couldn t operate the machine properly appeared grumpy when we ordered 9 meals and asked us what the hell is that when we ordered a specific drink She also gave us no receipt when requested and gave us diet coke when we asked for full fat By the time we had successfully ordered one member of our party had to leave due to other commitments because it had taken 1 and a half hours for the pub to sort out our orders Honestly the service was appalling  The food arrived relatively quickly but wasn t ideal quality The orders arrived over around 15 minutes so we were unable to eat together and some of the food such as the gammon was cold Most of the food was good value though and the servings were large  However when ordering ice cream sundaes for dessert we were again told they had none and we basically just gave up and left The pub appeared to have stock of virtually nothing which never used to be an issue in the past  A birthday meal was ruined by the poor quality If you eat here don t expect to get your first order option they probably won t have it It s also worth pointing out that there was broken glass under our table which had clearly been left and surely was a safety hazard Don t eat here go to Staindrop Lodge instead the food is significantly better and not significantly more expensive

I used to be a regular customer at Royal China however a sharp decline in the quality of the food and an apparent increase in prices mean I will be going elsewhere from now on  Over my past couple of visits a number of dishes have been very disappointing In the case of the Chinese broccoli and the crispy beef the food has actually been inedible In the case of the former it was covered in a disgusting cold gelatinous gloop In the case of the latter it was cloyingly sweet  Further disappointments have included the quarter crispy duck The amount of meat you get has been steadily decreasing to the extent that the last time I was there we managed to get a meagre four rolls out of the quantity served The quality of the meat in the sweet and sour pork has really declined too and it is hit and miss as to whether you are going to get a mouthful of meat or cartilage  Being creatures of habit my partner and I often order the same dishes at Royal China Over the last couple of months the bill has steadily increased from around 80 pounds for two to 106 on our latest visit We ordered less beer than usual too And only ate around 50 of the food as the rest was horrible  Royal China used to be one of our favourite London restaurants but we will not be returning

I ve just been to the Lister arms with a few of my family We were sat in the beautiful beer garden when all of a sudden Bang The back kitchen door swings open and a vile spew of words fell out of this chefs mouth He then went over to some other customers and accused them of giggling at him Which they weren t to which more swear words were shouted at the customers by him Needless to say we swiftly left with a sour taste in all our mouths Needless to say that will be the very last time I go

Confronted by barmaid in aggressive manner stating kids can inky come in if they have a full main meal which we fully intended to do Fairly full so asked if there were other seats Dismissive answer led to us leaving and going to the lowther next door which is fantastic

Driving to London on the 22nd December we had the misfortune to stop at the Roadchef Taunton Deane services on the M5 northbound I should have been alerted by the fact that the restaurant was almost completely de stocked and desolate I would not have been surprised to see tumbleweed rolling down the aisles  I ordered ham egg and chips and when it arrived the eggs were off Pure sulphurous stink bombs how the cook didn t notice is beyond credence  Whilst I was insisting on my money back another gentleman arrived returning his fish and chips  In the pantheon of lousy motorway service areas of which there are many the Roadchef Taunton Deane really is close to the bottom the pits  It just shows if you have a captive market you can get away with murder With real competition this place would have been out of business long ago

Me and my other half have been here 3 times and 2 out of the 3 it has been terrible The first time was lovely great service nice food The Second time - we arrived there on a hot day in March not very busy but the upstairs terrace was open We was seated and left ten minuted without an order being taken after waveing someone over we ordered our drinks my other half ordered vodka and coke Weak and i ordered the cider My drink had arrived and i was given the BEER i questioned the waitress stating it was not cider and she looked at it and said this is the house cider i asked to change it for coke and she came out with a cider I tried to explain what had happened to the supervisor and he didnt seem to understand what i was talking about took ages for a payment and food We could hear and see plenty of people complaining  The third time - We arrived late afternoon the resteraunt was not busy at all We was seated and had to wait again to even get menus we had a loyalty card to get a free starter but this was added on the bill I ordered the stromboli calzone and was given the wrong one my other halfs lasagne didnt look to great either I tried to call someone over but the supervisor was seen socializing with the staff on many occassions and noone seemed that interested in the customers really  I would try a different Zizzi resteraunt but avoid this one at all costs

Bad service Out for a friend s birthday Relatively quiet had one non alcoholic cocktail driving  which was ok Went back for another I ordered one drink waiter then took another persons order just after mine then he got mixing 10 minutes later of him shaking and pouring with me stood by myself at the bar and he hadn t even started making mine He looked a bit sheepish when I asked where it was and said he was about to start it  I told him not bother and walked out Not coming back

Ate at Sir dukes with a work colleague earlier this week Ordered the Ribs to start which were full of Grissle and tastless followed by the chicken Burger which was undercooked Don t bother wasting your time or money

A pub I have often frequented but today was my first time eating here I went in for lunch and I can safely that this is the worst food I have eaten in Norwich and I have eaten out in Norwich a lot  I had a roast dinner which was poorly cooked and tasteless Just really really bad Great place to go for a drink but avoid if you are hungry
