My wife and I visited Caf€÷ Rouge Mail Box Birmingham in January and had an excellent meal with excellent service  Whilst in Leamington we decided to eat in Caf€÷ Rouge with our daughter and grand daughter aged 4 It was to be a meal for my birthday Arrived about 11 55 am Drink order taken by a very polite gentleman Drinks arrived about 15 minutes later No problem so far About 12 30pm I had to ask for someone to take our food order and the same gentleman apologised and took the order WE waited and waited and waited I asked about our food order about 13 05 and was told it would be about 5 more minutes 13 20 it still hadn t arrived so I asked to pay for the drinks and left The food in Leamington Not a clue except diners arriving much later than us received their food The service Appalling It is the first time in my life I have ever walked out of a restaurant because of the lack of service or any other reason

This is a takeaway cafe style restaurant in the newly revamped Birmingham new street station I visited on 7 10 15 and ordered the chicken burrito at 6 79 This is the worst fast food I have had in the UK in 20 years The burrito was full of undercooked rice and tasteless chicken It did not taste fresh and I am quite worried that it will make me ill I wouldn t even recommend this above a microwave bacon sandwich if you are hungry Get a chocolate bar instead Avoid this place Do not support these crap chain establishments who think it is OK to charge huge mark ups for food which is far below par It is not expensive to make a tasty burrito
Very overpriced got a takeaway for a corporate event and feel we were overcharged food was not that good

Its such a shame to see what was once a great take away produce such a poor meal I went there on a Wednesday evening and ordered sesame prawn toast crispy duck butterfly prawns ginger beef chicken with cashews noodles and rice Really hungry I went home opened the boxes and was treated to a mass of uninviting brown tasteless food soaked in oil It was quite possibly the worst takeaway I have even had the misfortune to have
Cant comment on food after waiting nearly 2 hours gave up and went home Very disappointed as went for new year meal

I recently stopped by this astonishing-located restaurant while hiking Me and my girlfriend sat outside to enjoy the views and ordered a coffee and a tea The service was quick but on arrival we noticed that the mug for the tea was dirty Not a bit dirty it was filthy One would expect certain levels of cleanliness from a place like this specially at that price Without making too much fuss we asked one of the waitresses if we could get a new mug to which she replied  you can go to the bar  We did after queing to get a new mug  an even filthier mug was given to us by a bar tender that looked as if I was insulting him by asking for a clean mug  As we wanted to get on with the walk we started having our drinks only to find that the milk jug had bits of what looked like parsley or some other herbs floating and stuck to it In summary a very low standard for such a great located place

We had a table booked for 11 people and two babies which I would have thought would warrent some special attention given a such a large group but we were squeezed into a booth which would accommodate 6 people only so we ate with elbows in Ignored in terms of menu provision They offered Sunday lunch but when we ordered at 13 30 there was no beef left Poor food quality and portion size one sprig of broccoli  Took an age to come Didn t offer deserts and when we ordered coffee they told us they had run out of beans  A great little drinking pub or light snacks for sure but don t go expecing a decent Sunday lunch with a large group  Oh and the toilets are disgusting even my two-year-old boy said it smelled like piggies

After waiting for so long for the shop to open after it was closed with no explanation plus putting up with poor service once it was open I can now report a new low As I was walking into the shop tonight notice the time of this post and I have returned home since the lights were turned off I told them all I wanted was a lamb wrap I was basically told to feck off as the shop was closed I WILL NOW DEVOTE MY LIFE TO TELLING EVERY ONE ABOUT THIS ABSOLUTELY DESPICABLE ACT Bens you suck

Ordered here after a week away thinking I could have a nice evening with a bottle of wine with my partner some shredded duck and a glorious mixed hors d oeuvers for 2 After receiving an email to say it would be delayed I assumed the best they must be busy I was very wrong   The food turned up barely warm and upon inspection the duck was not freshly shredded but carved from what I can only describe as a neatly sliced microwave meal It was most certainly not a quarter duck  When I called to complain something which I hate to do they asked if I would like a discount off my next order when I explained I didn t want to order again they said they would resend the order but it would take 30 - 45 minutes and that the driver found our house very difficult to find   something a taxi driver never has GPS is a wonderous new device and I am still awaiting the resend - hopefully not before I decide to go to bed Honestly I am sure this is a wonderful Chinese if you live close and expect a cheap variant to what most class as a normal takeaway I won t be ordering again best of luck to those that do and hopefully this is a one off as the reviews did seem good hence my order initially

So we three all arrived with great anticipation at the nicely presented pub clean and with a pleasant atmosphere we perused the menu and salivated over the good choice of dishes to be had We had starters my nachos were plentiful and very nicely presented at over 5 they should be eh potato skins were the preferred choice of another nicely presented but two smallish specimens had been cut in half to give four small strips again about 5 next was crab-cakes I can feel you drooling already but just two about the diameter of a 50p piece and about an inch thick tasted like fish-cake not crab-cake at nearly 6 how could they serve just two All very colourful but very very poor value for money We had our mains to come great as the half spit-roast peri-peri chicken 10 95 had leapt out at me from the menu that was for me slurp It arrived in all it s glory very nicely presented and with a colourful salad garnish it looked good But wait what s this any half chicken I d ever encountered before had one leg one wing one breast one of just about everything I guess Not this poor creature it had no breast it was a quarter chicken not a half as advertised on the menu and with hardly any edible meat on it the poor creature had obviously died of starvation I complained but was fobbed off no sign of boss or chef The ham egg and chip was 7 95 two eggs 1 bit of ham and a handful of chips the carbonara about 9 had this gloopy uncooked egg-white stuff floating about in it Chef obviously carves out every penny of profit to be had with no thought given to value for money and repeat business I felt as if I had just been mugged I said I didn t expect to pay for the chicken but was told I had to Had I been on my own I would have refused and waited for the chicken police to arrive but with company didn t want to make more of a scene I suggest you do not waste your hard earned cash here go to a Harvester or Beefeater instead I will never eat here again and highly recommend that you don t either This my first ever bad review given for a pub restaurant

Travel all the way into Norwich for a York Tavern roast dinner only to be told that due to some sub-par music being played in the garden it s BBQ only today  7 for a cheeseburger is just ridiculous and to be told that the main menu isn t being served today is just a joke  What a huge disappointment they couldn t even provide ketchup with the burger and surprise surprise nobody is buying food today   Why    Because you re ripping people off  Shame on you We won t be coming back ever

The food was very poor and the staff extremely rude On the other hand they were rushing us to eat quickly after 15min seating on the table just to free up the table The worst of it is that the food and drinks were quite quite expensive Honestly not recommend

I booked a romentic Valentines meal nice and early on 18th January which isn t like me I needed t amend te time so called on 13th February only t be told they d lost my booking and they were now full  I am only glad needed t change the time now I can eat in a more professional restaurant

We have had fish and chips from here in the past but I have to say this year we were very disappointed we phoned order through as there were 8 of us but food was poor quality and cold Need to get back to usual standard
Waited an hour for dreadful food the vegetation option my wife and I ordered was inedible Toilets filthily

This place has high aspirations but fails completely because the service is so incredibly inept and rude We had a group of nine people in for which we had pre-booked  and when we arrived the place was empty So you d think they d be falling all over themselves to treat us well Instead we were treated with poorly concealed contempt clearly we were too much bother  Such a shame because the food was quite good But we won t EVER go back When asked at the end of the night what we thought our response was clearly not taken on board But we were happy to hear a voice behind us say that they agreed about the service We are not alone in thinking they need to learn a lot about customer service as I ve read several other reviews that offer the same feedback There are MANY other places to go in Forest Hill and we ll definitely be taking our business elsewhere They are a complete embarassment to the area

This has to be the worst restaurant in Gravesend Food was bland drinks overpriced and to top it all off they have just been given a ZERO Food Hygiene Rating   Makes me feel sick just thinking about how dirty and unhygienic this place must be
The food here is very average however the wait for the food was appalling and the beer was overpriced and warm Would not recommend

Nice little place but unfortunatley the food could not live up to its surroundings I opted for a burger which was served in a bap that had been either over microved to defrost quickly or had been in the freezer too long and become freezer burnt As for my wifes meal well she chose a mackeral dish that was served on new potatoes swimming in oil We mentioned this to the waitress and she spoke to the chef he came back with Mackeral is an oily fish Brilliant Better excuses needed your guest are not that poorly educated On a slighty more positive note we did have 2 free coffees and the waitress was very pleasent Its a real shame because the venue is well located and gets quite busy

I ve never previously had cause to write a review albeit good or bad on here or other sites but the experience of this establishment has prompted me to do so  I m totally astounded by some of the earlier rave reviews - can only assume that they are locals   regulars as the service myself and friends received was dire  I can see from a couple of reviews yesterday that another out of town party parties received similar treatment so I m wondering if the staff have a problem with outsiders   The Barman & the waitress were both incredibly offhand unfriendly and inefficient right from the off  The cost of the drinks were incredibly high but even though we were a tad shocked by the total we still opted to eat in as there didn t appear to be many alternatives nearby  Although the restaurant was empty we were not allowed to sit where we wanted no idea why as no tables were booked and querying it we were just met with stony silence from the waitress  The menu was sparse and a tad pricey Alas most of my friends and I made the huge error of ordering sandwiches which when they arrived were little more than x2 pieces of dry stale bread with barely any filling - not even margarine or butter For these they were charging between 5 - 6 Incredible  Some of the other options appeared better quality  value for money so have no idea why the sandwich options are quite so poor

Step inside turn look at the dirty filthy door mat Speaks volumes Something not quite right here Delayed service Bread ordinary days old and frozen instead of fresh crusty  Soggy batter cold plates dishes dried out under hot cold plates Waited over an hour for dish which takes less than 5 minutes to cook Then to cap it all spoken too as if you are an imbecile So sad as I am a supporter of loch fine Another example of the british don t give a dam attitude - serve them owt who cares Thanks for a very bad expensive experience

I went there on Sunday lunch we were 4 of us and we wait the first 10 minutes to order some water Then they explain the different cut of meat and took other 15 minutes  Two waiter and one manager obesely they were short of staff so I been quiet   We order the wine and this as well took like 20 minutes   Then I saw the waiter always close to one table of 8 people and the reception told us that they pay the service charge so she must to give the best time   That s shocking  I tip good and then this is the company policy to don t look after the guest because they don t pay the service I don t mind to pay service and tip as well   In the end we order petit fours and the manager forgot to order   So another manager to apologies send us two plates that we didn t eat in the end    Manager talking and waiter struggling to take order and reset the table    Hope someone will get back to me

After being shown to the coldest table in the restaurant being told that was the only table for 2 avalible whilst tables for 4 remain empty We ordered a coffee and half a pint of beer whilst we looked at the menue my wifes coffee was terrible which we returned and my half pint turned into a pint We placed our order only to notice that a couple who came in after us were shown a Lunch Time menu on checking this menu we found that we could have had 3 coarses for the price of our 1 coarse When our food arrived it was very poor in both quality and quantity and not value for money and we felt both meals fell short of the menu desciptions Needless to say we wont be returning ever again

I didn t get as far as eating here The restaurant was not busy yet they left me sitting for 20mins after I ordered I asked where my drink was and they came back to say sorry but my order was not even in the system How long would they have left me sitting there I wonder I walked out Staff more interested in chatting to each other than looking after customers or clearing tables Very very poor Not attentive at all Watched numerous other customers ask for bills and wait up to 10 mins No excuses

As far as first impressions go this was up there with the worst We were greeted by the rudest host who really could not care less We asked to sit outside and were told to wait there upon her return we were pointed in the direction of a table in direct sunlight We asked if we could sit somewhere else the response we received was no that s for four people and reserved   After a 20 minute wait we were asked for our order after another 10 minutes we received our bottle of wine but no glasses or even a straw Our starters arrived in good time and to be fair were the highlight of our visit Another 10 minutes passed after we finished and our table was cleared The main course was bland and not much to rave about We asked for the bill which was brought over promptly We stood inside for another considerable amount of time  Outside was an advertisement for 2 courses for 10 95 - I enquired as to why this was not reflected in our bill to be told it is only mon-thurs when our waitress informed the manager she replied with oh f*** and changed the sign with no explanation as to why it did not stipulate the times of the offer  In all a very poor dining experience and will definitely not be returning

We met up with friends for some coffee I have to say the coffee was quite good and the cakes was very lovely Bill came to around 25 for 3 coffees and two cakes which is reasonable for good quality food We gave a friend some snacks from our travel and friend took it out to take a bite but was told off by staff This is just humiliating because it isn t that we just sat there with water and munch down on outside food Then we were told to leave the premise because they wanted the table to start set up for dinner at 5pm while the other tables were not even set up yet and are all empty It is such a shame that the kitchen staff worked so hard to make great food to let the front room waiters ruin it with their inconsiderate insulting attention to humiliate customers attitude I was so shame to be there and also to have invited people there Whoever wants to dine there will just have to watch up to be insulted before and after enjoying their good food

Terrible service the man behind the bar refused to serve us despite our producing ID only later would he sell us alcohol then refused our friend being allowed on site on the grounds that we were drinking and that we may give him some as he forgot his ID even though we gave no indication of this and it was before 9pm so he had no legal right nor reason to do this other than personal reasons At no stage had we raised our voices yet he kept being aggressive even more so when we produced the actual law that said our friend is allowed on site as long as he is accompanied by an adult which we proved ourselves to be with our IDs and went on to threaten to ban us all from the pub to which my friend then said he would leave because it wasn t worth the hassle Truly poor service and we felt deeply insulted wouldn t recommend

I was here last night for a joint 50th-60th there was about 50 of us approx firstly we was so packed in if u was sitting on the inside table u had to crawl under rather than disturb everyone else so very bad seating I understand there was some sort of dbl booking the menu looked pretty good On our table there was a mixture of orders  after our waiter barked at us to pay attention my Indian platter starter was ok a bit sparse my chicken bhuna main was absolutely crap no spice at all really salty and just about warm there was a large plate of rice dumped in the middle which again was warmish again there was a cereal bowl of what I assume was aloo ghobi my uncle opposite had steak chips paper thin hard steak about s worth and them thin cheap as u can buy French fries 50p a large frozen bag in asdas  There was also a duck dish on our table that was ok but looked really unappetising So In general rubbish food as cheap as they can make seemed to b the general feel Service was pretty poor too as we couldn t get out to the bar regular visits by the more than unfriendly waiter would have helped Drink charges were ridiculous me and my wife had a pint of carling and a small diet coke  poured from a large bottle  6 60  After that she just asked for water which begrudgingly gets served without ice or lemon and is room temp lol nice 1 We still had great time though but that s more to do with having a dance floor and the ppl your with rather than any effort by staff Can t see this place lasting long if that s the normal standard of food that s gonna b on offer but hey might just have caught them on a rough night  And at 26 a head that we paid up front they are certainly laughing all the way to the bank

My wife and I called in last night for a pre film meal Having not booked I asked the young lady behind the bar if they had a free table for two She directed us to a table and I returned to the bar to order drinks Incidentally I noticed that the foursome that arrived just after us were offered table service for drinks our waitress had not seen to do likewise  After returning to the table with drinks we perused the menu and a few minutes later were approached by another waitress who asked if we were the couple who had booked the table for 7 30 I confirmed that we were not After a pause the waitress then said that the table was booked so we d have to move We asked if they had another table and she went off to look She then returned to say there was another table just over there behind the pillar she did not however actually show us where We went in the direction she had gestured but found another reserved table so on catching her attention the waitress then said she would show us She took us to a tiny table right by the door which was completely unsuitable as we would not have been able to get two plates on the table and would have been extremely draughty and cold due to being right by the door We decided we were going to leave but seeing us donning out coats the waitress returned and we explained we were not happy and were not willing to stay She asked if we wished to speak with the manager which we said we did  To his credit the manager immediately told us that we could have the original table as it had not been our fault we had been shown to a booked table  We returned and after a couple of minutes the waitress who had been seeing us returned again to take our order Due to being moved from pillar to post we asked for a couple more minutes at which point she said that as she might not notice when we were ready we should go to the bar to order  Needless to say that was the final straw I paid for our drinks and we left  There seems to be a great need for some serious customer service training at the Brewhouse & Kitchen as it is simply not good enough at present
everything wsa terrible the service oh w0w we had to wait half an hour to get seated and there were only three other couples in the restaraunt it was so so terrible    never going back

We have had good meals here and bad meals It is a nice pub with separate dinning and bar area  I have ahead a great steak followed by one that was so tough it was inedible  We keep giving them another chance but have now said enough is enough and stop going  It is a popular pub so we must be unlucky
I do not like carvery at the best of times but this all depends on when you arrive it can be dried up and poor value staff just want bums on seats and don t really care

Unfortunately the food is of poor quality with many items repeated albeit with different sauces Most of the items appeared over cooked or dried out For example the sesame prawn toast was so dry and brittle it shatters when attacked with a fork The cubed pork was dry and quite indelible Sweet & sour dished have a bright fluorescent orange glow I ordered a Chinese tea which came as loose tea in a very large mug with coffee written on it The staff force you to sit where THEY want you to sit and almost and almost rugby tackle you to the floor should you approach the door to leave Apparently this is so they can check you have paid extremely disconcerting and rude Evening meals Sunday to Thursday 9 99 per person It is what it is If you want filling up then this is the place to go If however you are looking for quality food then I strongly suggest you look elsewhere  Ambience - there isn t any brightly lit with industrial lighting and visible industrial air vents on the ceiling Tables and chairs are tired looking

This was the worst meal we have ever had Supposed to be a Sunday roast However that meet was processed and only tasted of salt Yorkshire puddings had been microwaved and like rubber The vegetables were cold and pitifully small amounts On the good side we refuse to pay they accepted this and we were charged with the drink s
Pizza was tasteless and greasy Must have thought drinkers at 1 00am don t count Only went here because it was one of a very few left open a that time Mistake learnt

Unfortunate experience for a chain that has two brunches within 5 min walk Understand why they are looking for s chef All dishes we had were lacking seasoning Paid 25 for a peace of meat that was clearly frozen and no one even check if it was any better after sending it back  Terrible service Extremely rude hostess who had attitude and manager who didn t make a point when we complained We were offered desserts on the house but we didn t not complain to get anything on the house We were just disappointed and will never come back  This place seriously needs to be avoided

Firstly the service was terrible and the pub was clearly understaffed The drinks prices are truly extortionate the pub area was not clean and there were lots of empty glasses everywhere To top the experience of the food was mediocre at best

It was a warm spring day when I entered Whelans fish and chip restaurant on recommendations of a former work colleague I had met for a catch up meeting It s a place I have visited some time ago so we went to enjoy our lunch  How disappointed I was  There is no available wifi or Internet connection at Whelans and as I was expecting an important call I spent 10 minutes outside in the street trying to obtain a connection  I decided to try the lunch time haddock special I wish I had avoided the place altogether  Having experienced language barrier difficulty with one of the many foreign staff employees Whelans employ my customary included in price bread and butter arrived with cup of tea in advance of my meal  I had to immediately return the bread and butter as it was clear it was neither fresh nor edible The bread was hard as though it had not been freshly prepared for consumption The replacement was a little better but certainly not freshly prepared as you would expect Even if the bread and butter is prepared in advance there is a way of storing food so that it does not become exposed to heat and atmospheric deterioration Whelans appear not to understand this simple method of storage  Whilst waiting for my meal I looked around the seating area to check the cleanliness of the place I was shocked to see on the floor adjacent to me pieces of a last customers food droppings still on the floor  See photographs   There was also a fork on the floor sticking out under my table support which leads me to believe little attention is paid to cleaning or health and safety aspects during the day s activities  When my meal eventually arrived I was surprised at the tiny piece of fish on the plate  See photograph  This does not compare with other photographs advertising Whelans  It was evident the fish had not been cooked for a sufficiently long enough time as the batter was soggy next to the fish The chips were certainly not fresh in an establishment with the rapid turnover of customers The mushy peas were barely warm I can say I did not enjoy what little I consumed  I made a specific point of speaking to the waiter who served me who in turn appeared to mention this to a supervisor There was no offer from the supervisor for me to return to Whelans at their expense at at a later date to see if things had improved just a mere I m sorry  Even the card pay terminal had problems with connection and there was even a mumbling my card might be declined as it was taking a long time to authorise  Whether my comments are heard and acted upon by Whelans remain for others to judge I would not want to return to Whelans in a hurry  A thoroughly disappointing experience I would not recommend Whelans

You are greeted at the doorway by a queue of people waiting for a table It is possible to book but there are a very limited number of tables available for booking Once you are shown to your table you then have to stand up and go and join another queue to order your food The people distinerested students behind the ordering bar get your order wrong repeatedly When your food eventually turns up it s been loving dumped from a height onto a plastic tray  plates haven t hit this part of Wycombe yet You then have to tell the waitress to actually come back with your full order  The food itself is utterly substandard Imagine a menu developed by a person who has been told about the greatest US BBQ restaraunts but doesn t understand the principle at all Items that should have had hours of slow raoting in a smoker are quite clearly just shoved in the oven The pulled pork tastes low quality the ribs are dry and tiny the brisket is dry and uninspiring   you get the idea I suspect there isn t even a proper smoker on the premises and everything seems to be done with dry rubs  or worse supplied to the place already seasoned  Once you ve finished your drink you re forced to abandon your meal mid course to go and queue up again just for a second drink Get used to queuing  In our case as our food was being served a waiter they dn t do any waiting so what do you call them  a server asked us how our meal had been  that we hadn t had  The toilets look like a primary schools but with zany buckets instead of sinks  which were dirty  The amazing thing is that this place is still open and still seems to do a good trade It s almost like there is no decent restaurants in Wycombe to compare this against  You could vaguely say that the portions are decently sized if you can actually stomach the food - My undiscerning friend ate all of his but he eats almost anything and only judges things based on portion size  You d be better off walking up the hill to TGI Fridays their ribs are about 20 times better That s shameful

Living in Lambourn we have passed the Cafe in the High Street many times and regularly commented on how nice it looks and that we must try it out Occasion presented itself this weekend when we had overnight guests following a dinner party so the five of us four adults and an child popped in for a breakfast On arrival we stood by the counter and waited to be greeted despite the cafe being well staffed and quiet rather than being greeted I had to ask if we could take a seat and pull up an extra chair I was told that that would be ok so we sat down and chose from the menu We were not aware that there was no table service so waited for one of the three unoccupied counter waiting staff to come over and take our order  Having decided we waited patiently for about ten minutes by which time I realised that no one was coming without prompt so asked if someone could take our order or if we needed to come to the counter I was told that we had to come up to place our order so got up and placed it One of our number a pescatarian and asked if he could have a breakfast with a bean burger in stead of sausage and bacon his request was denied and he was told that the bean burger was not available before noon no explanation or alternate vegetarian option was proffered  Although the initial wait of twenty minutes for two items one of the omelets and a panini was not excessive the standard breakfast omelet + hash brown and child s sausage + hash brown were not delivered to the table for a further fifteen minutes which meant we were not able to eat together this occurred without comment or apology Omelets and panini were very nice but standard breakfast  which came out with the second omelet was a massive miss it came out missing toast with sausage egg and bacon all over cooked and cold hash browns were a bit grey + under cooked and barely warm inedible so sent back with the child s see * below  and beans a mixture of hard and properly cooked but again sadly cold which my wife just left  There was a further wait of five minutes for my son s sausage and hash brown sausage was freshly cooked and fine but * hash brown was as above As our guests were the first to be served and were now waiting for us we decided to leave the cafe without making further comment This may be coincidental but my son and I were the only two to have the hash browns and both have an unsettled stomach  As an aside the vacant  engaged sign on the toilet shows vacant when actually engaged I thought the door was stuck when trying to take my boy to the loo and was on my way to the counter to report the issue when a staff member came out I told her about the occupancy indicator and was surprised by her dismissive reply of oh yea that s fine  from over her shoulder not even bothering to engage me  Having read a few of the other posted reviews I can only conclude that we were unlucky to have visited when management were not present as our experience although following a thiem seems far from typical

We have used this takeaway in Helsby for the last 5 years and to begin with we were impressed However in the last few visits over the last 12 months things have gone steadily down hill  Went and got a takeaway last night it was the worst meal I ve had from there and will not bother ever returning     I had initially tried to arrange home delivery 3 miles away but was told that they had no delivery driver available and this was 7pm so I ordered over the phone and went to collect I paid an Indian women wearing a hijab at the front desk and waited for my order only to watch the same women 5 minutes later carry a cardboard box full of cooked food out to her car and go on a home delivery    The food we ordered consisted of Onion Bhaji starter x 2 Seikh Kebab starter Nawabi Chicken main course x 2 & Garlic& Butter Chapatti x 3 instead of rice total 22 90  The Onion Bhajis were greasy and tasteless the Seikh Kebab was stone cold & a very small portion The main courses were mediocre & lacking taste considering their own menu states that this is the most complex of all curries made using 21 separate ingredients it was a complete let-down The Garlic & Butter Chapattis were bland greasy & tasteless with no Garlic or Butter  Having spent most of this morning since 4am dashing to the toilet with an upset stomach I can only suggest going elsewhere as there is far better food to be had

I had been to eat in richmond fish works before and had a wonderful experience I went in today again at lunch time to get fish and chips but I m very disappointed the experience was not the same We went in to get takeaway fish and chips The supervisor the man who greeted us in wearing a pink shirt I am guessing it was the manager was not very welcoming and as we asked for the fish and chips he asked where we wanted to seat We sat down had our meal which was fine The rest of the staff was very good and helpful but the supervisor unfortunately not so much When we asked for the bill it was our surprise the fish and chips cost of 13 95 when on the board outside it said 7 95 I mentioned it to one of the staff we were not expecting that and she then called the supervisor which instead of apologising was rather rude in the way he spoke to us When we sat down he did not tell us each dish would be an extra 6 for eating in but he said he pointed to the menu I think there was probably miscommunication between both parts but was very disappointed with the way he addressed the situation

Went on friday evening About 7pm There were 5 others in the restaurant eating My brother and I had the 10 95 buffet Neither of us were impressed Food was bland  Not much taste Although the chicken on sticks were nice Will not being going back and would not reccomend

Shame on you Mark Hix This bar has been set up to part tourists from their cash Some of us live and work in London and expect to be treated better Bar snacks must be ordered as we have a restaurant licence is utter nonsense No other similar establishment in the area has the same policy Not stocking premium spirits so that you can palm off inferior ones and pocket the difference We were not born yesterday And wont be returning

I never complain in restaurants because I have never really had to but last night the experience fell a mile short of a good night out  This is the second time I have been to Made in Italy on the Kings Rd and the second time I have left furious The first time was on my birthday nearly 18 months ago and people came from all over London for it and that was abysmal no choice of pizza very overpriced and shocking service There were 20 of us there and cost per head was similar to last night at 47 each When a friend suggested we go to yours again I was already apprehensive  The starters and the platters of meat etc were good very good in fact But the pizzas are just not up to much it is like you really don t care either they had very little cheese on them so were almost exclusively tomato or they were over flowing with cheese Generally you brought out a selection of very boring pizzas why don t you ask people what they want The only pizza anyone actually wanted was the Pepperoni pizza  We then ordered a second lot of pizzas so at least we might get some choice of what we could have I asked the waiter for pizza with pepperoni cheese and some olives A pretty standard meat pizza  and that is literally what we got pizza base entirely cheese but peppers the vegetable no pepperoni and a few olives I couldn t have been more specific  Then when the pudding came the waiter gave us no choice just coffee Tiramisu To make things worse it was clear that half had been either left out in a warm kitchen and the others had been in the fridge It didn t taste great and was basically very soggy Again it s like you just don t care  The service was shocking too the staff really couldn t care if we were there or not and clearly their English is not good enough either If your staff can t be bothered get rid of them its London there are thousands of people looking for work They ignored us they weren t friendly they didn t smile etc What really annoyed me and I think most of us was the price Firstly 12 5 is excessive and a European service charge rate  47 for that evening was just far too much even if it had been perfect we basically got  of a bottle each starters thee pieces of pizza and a pudding I can only imagine that people paid it because they were too worried about offending the birthday girl  Its really embarrassing taking people out and then having so many people disappointed what s the point The manager I spoke to afterwards tried to give us more Limoncello but it was too little too late  What you have at Made in Italy is a great concept the starters are excellent the idea of the metres of pizza is great but that s about it Your pizzas are so basic in ingredients that it becomes a chore eating them It s not supposed to be Pizza hut thank God it isn t but if you compare yourself to Pizza Express they would beat you hands down They have plenty of tomato plenty of cheese   herbs meat etc you can t just rely on the fact that you use Pizza ovens for your uniqueness  The manager said he had been there for two weeks and that things were going to improve They really need to Whats more they dont reply to complaints hence me on here they were given at least two weeks to return reply to my complaint

It was raining We were wet - the four of us oldies - all in our sixties and touring Yorkshire Zilli s is nicely placed and brightly lit perhaps overbrightly on a corner of Trinity Square Two or three tables were busy out of maybe twenty First problem - nowhere to hang our coats and umbrellas dripping over the nice wooden floor No big problem - the waitress brought a bucket out of the kitchen and we put our umbrella in that and hung our coats over chairs on empty tables Not exactly smart but hey this place calls itself as a caf€÷ The waitress asked for our voucher Apparently no-one but no-one goes to Zilli s in Hull without a discount voucher We said uh  sat down and picked up a voucher left on the table The offer didn t interest us Nice light Italian menu - looked OK Indeed the food whenever and however it came wasn t too bad at all We ordered  Forty minutes later and after two other tables which filled after we came in were served we were still NOT served We checked with the waitress yes just the ONE waitress for the whole restaurant  She checked with the chef - yes just the ONE chef and his one assistant  She told us 7 minutes - the time it takes we later discovered to cook a thin crust pizza 12 minutes later some of our order arrived Two thin crust pizzas with the WRONG topping A Caesar salad with chicken also came but we had ordered plain She took all this back and said it would be another 7 minutes the time it takes she said  to cook a thin crust pizza Well better serve our friends we said before their dishes get cold One a pasta served with rather too much sauce was fine The other another pizza wrongly topped but acceptable Our 2 friends of course had finished by the time the first lot of wrong pizzas and Caesar had been replaced 12 minutes later Even the replacement pizzas were incorrect - topped with rocket and parmesan cheese it said on the menu No rocket No parmesan Three minutes later a bowl of rocket and parmesan turns up As I said the food itself wasn t too bad - though cooked on hot stone was a bit of an overclaim for the thin crust pastry - or the stone just wasn t hot enough as the bottoms were still soft and the pastry not even scorched But the service was quite the most atrocious I have ever experienced And without apology Apparently - get this - the TILL was to blame Three people - one waitress and two kitchen staff - and they blamed the TILL for lack of communication By the time we had finished our marathon several other tables had filled and by the sound of it wrong orders were going out left right and centre We complained when the bill was presented - over 60 - to He who seemed to be most senior  I would have said in charge but that would be to overstate his competence a sallow yoof with massive earlobe plugs who hung around behind the bar We pointed out that we had been quite upset by the service as we were showing our friends from Sweden how good Hull was these days We said the sort of service we had experienced would have been totally unacceptable in London from where we had just come His response - but I come from Hull  you re having a go at me  it s the till s fault  Not a single word of apology passed his or anyone else s lips We offered him 50 and left We SHOULD have offered 10  Do NOT go here

I visited your Bluewater outlet on Saturday 15th August with a friend and was seated at a table that was not covered by the walk way above and while eating our meal someone decided to pour what appeared to be a white granules maybe salt off the top floor of the shopping center that covered both of us all our food and drinks I appreciate this is not some thing that is directly a fault of your staff  other than poor table placement but we then got up and moved tables and explained to a member of staff that just said ok and walked off I expected a manager etc to come over and see us and ask if there was anything they could do but nothing when we decided to get up and leave someone came to clear the table and ask if everything was ok with our meals i started to explain i couldn t finish the meals due to what had happened and he then started to laugh and cheekily say we should not order so much in future I explained the full extent of what had happened and that I feel that the customer service was sub standard and if we had not had to pay for our meal up front then staff would have been much more eager to deal with the issue in case we decided we would not pay the bill  This has been a very disappointing experience considering I had heard good things about your restaurants in the past and the food was reasonable until i was unable to eat it

The location of Bill s is convenient as it s in close proximity to the station and Lyric Theatre As a family we have visited Bill s many times at Covent Garden and were very happy with the food and service However we decided to try out the Hammersmith branch as a change but were very disappointed  The ambience and decor of the place is lacklustre and dull in comparison to the other resturant The service from the staff was average and unenthusiastic We didn t like how they offered us to sit on tables close by to other people eating when there were many other tables available in the restaurant It s fortunate we refused to sit at where was offered because while waiting for our main course we saw our food fall from the ceiling through the staircase from the seating area on the floor above onto the table we were previously offered to sit at As one of the waiters had dropped a large tray of food which contained our main meals this then lead to our meal arriving late and it was clearly rushed onto the plate Two of the main courses were left uneaten The special of the crab sandwich didn t contain any crab which is false advertisement on the menu Then the fish finger sandwich was really greasy and wasn t the usual fish fingers that are used in other Bill s restaurants They appeared more like a fish thumb than a fish finger The taste of the fish was very unpleasant and the bread was stale  A very disappointing meal as we have purchased this meal many times previously and it has always been enjoyed We feel that staff shouldn t have to walk up and down stairs to deliver food there is no novelty or quirkiness to delivering food by coming downstairs Not only is it an inconvenience but it most likely comes to the table cold The restaurant needs a dumb-waiter to save on time and man power then perhaps the staff can be more attentive and enthusiastic  However we were given free drinks to make up for the long wait for our dropped main courses and the cost of the crab sandwich was removed from the bill Nevertheless two of our party left the restaurant hungry and staved off the hunger by visiting the Pret a Manger nearby Certainly was cheaper and more edible  Not to mention the glasses on the table were dirty and the cloudy apple juice was warm and not cloudy at all So free drinks as compensation was definitely necessary

I concur with other writers that the staff were rude having witnessed their interaction with other customers particularly a party who had made reservations which the caf€÷ had lost The food was adequate but overpriced for what it was The service was dreadful - my drink was only served after I had finished my lunch

We ate here for my birthday meal last Saturday night Having looked at the website we was really excited about eating here as it looked very nice I cant fault the building it looks nice and it really is sadly that s the only positive thing we can say about it we booked a table three months in advance when we arrive we was told our table wasn t ready however after 15 mins we was seated Our drinks order was taken my wife ordered a cocktail from their menu of 4 different cocktails and I ordered a bottle of red wine Some ten minutes later the waitress told us they couldn t do the cocktail so my wife chose another one 5 Minutes later we was told they couldn t do that one either so my wife chose something completely different We ordered our starters my wife opted for garlic bread and the fishcake for me 40 mins later the waitress arrived and plonked the garlic bread on the table minus my starters  I asked where the drinks were as we had been there now for an hour and still hadn t had a drink and was told they were on there way the waitress then come back to the table to ask what wine I had ordered 5 mins later they brought the wrong bottle to the table Finally they brought my wife s drink and the bottle of wine to the table we had finished our starters by now  unscrewed the cap of the bottle and left the bottle and cap on the table next to the glass For main course I had the 8oz Devon sirloin medium cooked it arrived cremated on the outside and raw enough inside a vet could of saved it At this point the barman arrived at the table with a very large glass of wine for my wife and apologised for the poor service we was receiving we hadn t complained at this point so they was fully aware of the issues with service Desert I had the sticky toffee pudding in a butterscotch sauce which I have to say was very good indeed Its a real shame the rest of the food was not to the same standard Two of the waitress both apologised at the end of the meal when we received the bill and both told us there had only been there a couple of days We didn t complain but was thoroughly disappointed with overall experience and will not be returning to eat here which is a shame because the pub itself really is beautiful Overall time in the restaurant for three courses 3 hours and 10 minutes

My wife and I visited the restuarant on Saturday evening with high hopes but were severly disappointed by the terrible service The Hostess seemed far too busy to pop over the where we stood waiting and then once sat it took 25 minutes before our order was taken with the comment its manic in the kitchen  just what you want to hear before you order   The food itself was just ok but my Calamari doused in balsamic vinegar was a first  fresh lemon yes but balsamic vinegar   Paying was interesting as I had to walk over the the Hostess who again was busy doing everyting but paying attention to ask for the bill only to have to go again 15 mins later as it hadnt arrived  Sadly a very disappointing visit all in all

Everything was great until I casually asked when paying the bill if the service charge was distributed to staff I was told that it was not This is outrageous not just from a worker s point of view but deceit of the public This should not be listed as  service  rather 12 5 added to your bill by the proprietor DON T PAY IT
Carpet was filthy wine glasses disgusting unwashed Food was so poor for god sake if you get a combo for two it will only feed a child Will not be going back P

Would not send my dog here to eat bad food bad service and bad attitude was part of a party of 8 booked in for Christmas dinner that was a joke  Reception unmanned on arrival took an eternity to find anyone party was left sitting at table like stuffed lemons staff made no attempt to serve starters until we asked after sitting at table for 20 minutes then had to locate staff again Starters were not great salmon missing lemon wedges and garnish on 2 out of 3 pre-ordered Main meals served cold and not took kindly when asked if something could be done about this Puddings served cold by staff that did not care Tables around us and one other remaining table still trying to eat while the staff that did exist then decided to start clearing tables - stripped them and through rubbish in black bin bags Just dam right rude No wine drinks menu was offered - told get it yourself from the bar Mince pies and coffee not even offered Whole point of going out for Christmas dinner was lost and spoilt by bad food bad service and staff with a bad attitude asked to speak to the manager - told they were off Will be writing to head office with regards to this shambolic effort and would recommend YOU BOOK ELSEWHERE FOR YOUR 2014 CHRISTMAS DINNER in fact FULL STOP

booked a week early to avoid disappointment got there on time was offered the worst table possible turned it down was offered another table which i accepted sat down for fifteen minutes was not even acknowledged so walked out absolutely bobbins restaurant

Called in at lunchtime 3 of us ordered off the set tapas menu Every dish was cold and not even tasty The waiter who served us was not bothered at all The only plus side was the manager who took control of the situation offered us any meal of the main menu we did not bother and gave his apologies If lunch is not thier thing dont open then

Visited R&C early Friday evening to start with we were the only couple in the restaurant and service was slow We ordered ok bread and oil to start although this never arrived then my wife s starter of fried garlic mushrooms were soggy and full of water  eventually after another 20 minutes our main courses arrived My wife ordered fried brie which was still cold solid in the middle even the waitress committed that s not good  when her main course came back  I had finished my main course as it would of got cold and they never offered to take that back to the kitchen while we waited for the brie  the brie was a fresh piece but had the same issue cold and hard in the middle  So then my wife asked to see the manager  who agreed with the complaints so offered to comp the brie s My wife said that he can t comp something that she hadn t had  He asked if I wanted another mains to which my wife replied no thank you as I had already finished The manager did comp us the mushrooms and my main   We won t be back for a long time

We visited on Easter Saturday at 4 30pm A party of nine Assisted by a helpful waitress but that was the only positive thing about our visit Given it was Easter weekend we were told certain items were already not available How does a restaurant manage this Alternatives were offered but when the main courses arrived food was cold or reheated Seven of the nine main courses were sent back and the waitress did tell us everyone was complaining and there were only about five other couples families eating at the time Can only imagine problems in the kitchen Everyone was apologetic and all main courses bar one were removed from the bill but the visit overall was disastrous Thank God for the nearby Tesco so we could buy pizza for supper I doubt we will ever return and I dread to think how a busy Easter was managed Poor Poor Poor by any standard

This place genuinely is filthy You wipe your feet on the way out you can t wear a decent pair of trousers jeans as the chairs are all filthy stained and sticky The beers including lager cider and ales have an oh-so-funny taste - usually results in a headache and I suspect this is down to dirty lines and or nozzles - it s not cheap either and you spend ages waiting for bar staff who don t know who s next

Had the misfortune to have lunch here on saterday for the first time  Never again Miserable staff and avery bad management waited an age for the food to arrive and then was told off by the old barman for the asking for our bill   We unfortunately went and stood by the till as we couldnt find a member of staff to ask the manager was talking to other people about his holiday in turky and left the custmer to get they drink as he stood do nathing than talking if you want to get adrink from the bar you have to wait about 10 mint untill the barman haveing his lunch will never back again

Having a great evening entertaining clients and my good lady Starters all good  Mains turn up steaks all good my king prawn and rice and runner beans as the owner pointed out  gone in two minutes My client game me a third of his steak which was embarrassing  - pointed out my issue to the staff who were polite I explained that I was with clients and did not want to make anything of it but didn t want to pay for my meal 14 on 169 - happy to pay for the service which was great  just not for that meal They gave me 4 00 off - just with my business head on write that rubbish meal off and move on  Would I go back NEVER if the owner chef had sorted me out there and then no issue  Unbelievable

Frankly the worst and rudest service we have ever had Arrived at around 8 00 in the evening wanting a couple of coffees and a muffin There were three staff on one a young lad with a top knot walked past us and the barrista commented  Where s he off to and looked angry It took a while for her to acknowledge us and my wife who was ordering Eventually she did but half way through my wife asking what she wanted the girl just walked off leaving the other girl behind who clearly didn t know what to do My wife asked if the manager was around but they were not We just put down what we were going to buy and walked out and went to another place in the service centre Utterly appalling service the worst we have ever had an impressive feat in such a short space of time Well done   Either proper training and management or sacking for the staff there is required

Went to the Jinnah in Flaxton for my birthday dinner with my partner and some friends and the manager proceeded to ask if my partner was my mum to the dismay of all my party just to set an awful atmosphere for the rest of the evening Several orders were forgotten and the manager didnt even have the decency to apologise for any of the mistakes not least to mention the hair that was in the Korma in the Buffet Disgraceful never going again and would certainly not recommend it

I recently went to Kazan restaurant but was very disappointed The quality of the food was average and the staff were generall very unfriendly It certainly was not good value for money I do not recommend this restaurant The Turkish restaurants in Harringay are of a much better standard and both the food and service there is much better

Came here last Christmas time the restaurant wast busy only about 5 tables with people on a Friday night the food was revolting The currys me and my partner ordered korma and butter chicken were tasteless i could have made a better one at home using a pataks bottled sauce It was also expensive and I m pretty sure we were overcharged i would advise people with any sense of taste to not even bother with this place

I very rarely write negative reviews I always tend to find reason not to however for this Afternoon Tea I wanted to point out how terrible it was    I ve wanted to try this for years my friend and I booked for a joint birthday celebration last week with the 4 cocktails      thankfully the cocktails were lovely because the rest was absolutely terrible you would get better service and food in McDonald s and probably enjoy it more We were sat next to two women who also complained each table was given 25 off and told we didn t have to pay service charge of 20  we had absolutely no service apart from receiving the tier even had to ask for plates 3 times  Sadly I wouldn t recommend this in fact I would go as far to tell people not to attend it was an absolute let down

After deciding on this place for lunch since is seemingly looked the best in the area i was suddenly proved very wrong Although the food was actually quite nice I would never ever go back due to horrendous customer service The assistant behind the counter was incredibly unhappy to be at work never mind dealing with customers and had more interest in watching the TV which is clearly for the customers benefit given the amount of time you had to wait Why any boss or owner of a company would give their staff a chance to indulge in watch TV whilst at work is either an idiot or someone with far too much money to care The assistant had no interest in taking my order never mind making sure I was given the correct drink after at least a half an hour wait for two portions of fish and chips And what kind of fish and chip shop doesn t sell tomato sauce for gods sake   And another fault I found why are the assistants given the oppurtunity to salt and vinegar my meal if i want salt and vinegar why cant i do that myself The food was actually very nice but in terms of basic customer service due to bloody awful and shocking and miserable customer service I would never ever set food in this establishment ever again    Literally no words to describe the level of horrendous service I received

This was not my choice of restaurant I checked the reviews posted by others before I went to this restaurant last night I paid particular attention to the negative reviews and would say that the restaurant proprietors have not taken heed We were a party of 9 and had booked a table for 7 30 p m Two of the starters were delivered after repeated requests and by the time they had arrived the other members of the party had finished We didn t get our main courses until 9 50 p m Guests at other tables who arrived after us were served ahead of us Some of the mains were lukewarm although mine was hot and tasty We had to scrutinise the handwritten bill to ensure that the charge for one of the mains was deducted as the wrong dish had been served up and apparently was not up to standard The waiter who told us that the charge would be deducted had failed to follow this through The final bill was presented and although we could identify the food items listed the charge for drinks was not itemised and so it was shown as one amount We estimated the cost of it all and were satisfied that it appeared to be in the region of what we would have expected The waiters were non-attentive Having complained about the inadequacies the manager did present us with a complementary bottle of red wine We paid the bill and did not leave any tip I will need a lot of persuading before I dine there again

Staff were so rude blond hair tall waitress The food is just ok not much better then any pub half the price Very slow service it took about 35 minutes to get my Pimms Completely overpriced and disappointing I would never go back to this place again

We met up as a family to celebrate my daughters 24th Birthday  There was 9 of us and a baby and table booked for 7 30pm on Saturday 26th April We waited an hour for our Drinks to arrive  We waited almost an hour and a half for our Starters  The Prawn Cocktail was in a liquid  4 Prawns in Total More Drinks were ordered and again half an hour for these to arrive The mains arrived  only when they did we had to wait for cutlery which took 15 mins  by which time mains were getting cold Non of the Management appeared to be interested neither did the waiting staff The Management and Staff need re-training in Customer Service how to meet and exceed their customers expectations I would not rush back to this restaurant at all  It s about time Head Office took notice of its customer comments and acted accordingly
Food was mediocre at best Appalling service Rude staff Couple on table next to us told us a similar story about one of the other Webbe restaurants Won t try any of them again

Very poor service  the food was not tasty when we got our food it was the wrong order the waitress didn t know the difference between a ribeye steak and sirloin steak Greasy cold and tasteless prawns Never go there again

8 30 Saturday night bar and restaurant both half empty the kitchen which is on view staff just hanging around Try to order food at the bar told 30 minute wait Said that s ok tried to tell him what I wanted only to be told the would not take my order for 30 minutes so I have now got to wait till 9 o clock to order food and they are unable to tell me till then how long before I get it they told me they could not go to the kitchen to find out how long it would take When I said that I not therefore get my food till gone ten I was told quite possible While this conversation took place the manager just stood there  think he was on some YTS placement from the 80s The place does deserve your custom staff do deserve jobs

Came here for my 27th birthday table of 8 After sitting it was an hour before we got our starters 30 mins for mains after my nans meal came 15 mins after we all had ours our drinks order was wrong the second time round They just seemed understaffed for the big tables and Christmas season Won t be back
The quality of the food was very poor for the price paid The staff were very inexperienced and not at all polite as you should expect in this type of hotel and restaurant

I went to this restaurant last night and left feeling extremely dissatisfied  We arrived at 9pm and the restaurant wasn t that busy  We ordered a starter however it never came and instead we received the main course When we pointed it out to the waiter he made some pathetic excuse about the meet still tenderising and that this had caused the delay Why he couldn t have been honest and said he d forgotten I don t know but it was nice being lied too So our starter was served as we were readying ourselves to leave  We ordered Sag Aloo and were given Sag Poneer which they didn t take off the bill   A large group seated in front of us left as we arrived and we had to look at a very messy table throughout the whole evening They weren t that busy so i m not sure why they didn t clear it up and make the place look a bit more presentable  In fairness they did apologise for their mistakes and offer us a free drink but we d reached a point where we just wanted to leave I asked for the bill but the waiter forgot to bring it so I had to remind him  Overall the quality of the food was not great and the portions sizes were small If you are looking for a curry in the area the Shaahi a short walk away is much better Hove Tandoori is also worth a visit as is Chilli Pickle if you fancy a modern twist  I won t be going back on the basis that the food is average and the service incompetent

Asked for a table for 2 Was asked to wait at the bar for 15mins by the manager and they would have a table Had a drink at the bar upon checking for our table we were given a bar table right by the front door that we could have had at the start and was told to order food at the bar Tired to order at the bar at which point we were told they were out of burgers and all roasts  We could have been told this at the start instead of wasting our time total incompentant manager who just did not care about his customers  not at all warm and actually a very cold experince from the manager Bar staff were nice tho  There are many other options in the area that are fair better than this Thoroughly worth avoiding

Booked in on Saturday time for a Stag party of 18 only to be told on the door that NO entrance will be granted this was after waiting 10 mins outside in the snow We had a copy of the email sent to us with proof and on this it offered us 2 pool tables for free And what a surprise the lady who booked this wasn t available  We ended up in another bar locally who welcomed all our business  Joke com
If your looking for poor quality over cooked food that has been deep fried to within an inch of its life then this is the place for you Its only saving grace is that its cheap
Ask for a Cappuccino and everything comes to a halt This was he same experience as the invested site in Doncaster centre

Went for Dinner on arrival was told to read a notice to find only half the menu was available but we decided to stay We waited over 15 minutes to be asked for our drinks order  the place was no where near full we then ordered our food and waited a further 20 minutes to have one shared starter to arrive Another long wait for our main course which arrive over cooked and not edible which was only chicken and chips done fancy Spoke to the Manager to complain about the time and quality of the food served which he apologized for the food but said the time delay was what he expected in an Harvester Restaurant He did give a refund for the main course s but we won t be going back

I m not entirely sure if the place was understaffed 9crazy for the xmas party season  or if orders were just plain slow in coming to pass but to wait 15-20mins for drinks and over an hour for starters is pushing it Plus the continual buckets of taco chips and pork scratchings being put on the table is over-exploitation of the oldest trick in the book i e loads of salty chips crisps on the table makes the diner buy more drinks AHence there was a severe shortage of guacaole and salsa to go with this flood of taco chips The service was friendly enough and you could see that the staff were trying but they were drowning in the crowded melee almost as much as our food was in a bowl overladled withg chipotle sauce I assume it was chipotle Whatever it was it wasn t good and for some reason was slathered over everything that was brough tto the table making it indistinguishable to decipher different ingredients and taste sensations one of the nicer aspects of usual Mexican dining expereinces  Anyway from a set xmas menu pulled pork starter was mediocre yet better than the veggie option of  wait for it  brussels sprouts in a tapas bowl with - you ve guessed it chipotle sauce cascading over them like a lava field from a volcano   oh the irony Main course was duck enchiladas or mushroom and tacos stack both of which came wearing the same slick of chipotle sauce  enchiladas were the girth of a ring finger and perhaps twice as long little duck mainly filled with bean paste - it was an appalling shame given what could have been done with an xmas menu for Mexican flavour angle I left before the churros were delivered but felt very let down given the previously high ranking pedigree of this chain of restaurants  Good Mexican food is a fiesta of flavours on the palate - this was nothing of the sort Finally no xmas decoration in the restaurant that we could see made the immediate surroundinbgs feel like an East German cold war style dining room - nowhere near what it s probably like in Guadalajara at this time of year

Popped in today with family What food that was out was dry and looked like it was leftovers from the night before The rice was not cooked I didn t even see any deserts And considering there was few customers in at the time the place looked dirty with wallpaper hanging off in places which would suggest why the lighting wasn t on in that area where they sat us

I am afraid I cannot recommend this establishment Stopped here for my lunch last week the service was slow and the food was not very nice very greasy within an hour of eating here I started suffering the worst Diarrhea I have ever experienced It was so bad that I could not carry on with my deliveries and had to return home to be near the toilet loosing me an afternoons pay If you were thinking of eating here please don t there are far better places to eat along the south coast road that are cheaper and wont poison you you have been warned

Terrible food - no flavour badly cooked - did my best to eat but truly it was awful Waiting staff very obliging and enthusiastic However the experience reminded me to avoid theme multiple chains where kitchen staff are assembling pre-configured prepared food by pictures  as enjoyable a dinning experience as dot-to-dot is viewing fine art

Unfortunately I visited this place with my family while staying away from home this was as my wife states one of the worst meals of my life  The food was appalling and we hardly ate any of it the desert was great but then again it was ice cream so you can t mess that up much would never return And to think we drove past the Toby Carvery to get there

Stay away from this place me and my wife ate there and fell ill for the rest of our get away the Bronco Chicken didn t taste right and felt it was microwaved  Avoid this place like the plague Ruined holiday

Entering the pub at 13 00hrs we was the ONLY people in their  We was puzzled as to why but ordered our drinks anyway We also ordered our food then we was escorted upstairs to the seating area  We sat alone no other customers our food arrived which was microwaved but then told our daughters meal wouldn t be ready for another 5 mins  15 mins later her meal turned up  Salad was old Jacket spud was dry No atmosphere in the place Waitress was polite and friendly We left the food as it was awful Upon leaving as we walked thru the bar the barman then decided to tell us he d forgot to charge us for an item we d orderd  I d rather eat a cold pasty from Greggs on a rainy day than eat here  It was shocking They thought we was tourists but little do they know we are local and we could have become regulars
The name fits the food minging  went straight in the bin as it was inedible You would need to have very low standards to enjoy chinese from here

I had the Bill s breakfast which had poor quality bacon fried eggs which were hard and were clearly old stock from the fridge soggy mushrooms and two small sausages all served on dry toast I still feel ill 10 hours later The child s pancake dish was excellent as was the service but did not mitigate for my appalling fare

We visited the Harvester pub restaurant at the start of the New Year a week day evening just before 8pm  We waited inside the door way for an age to be seated so long in fact I went to the gents On finally been seated we found that there was bits of food on the chairs and the area under the table and surrounding the table was frankly poor with food and condiment bottles  Strangely once we had been seated we weren t asked what we would like to drink and had to wait until another waitress came over to take our food order  When our food arrived we found the chips to be so over done that they had dried out to nothing and my Fiancee ordered a soft drinks refill and when she went up to fill her glass found that the pepsi max was empty She asked the waitress if her glass could be filled from the bar but was told that the drinks station was been sorted At the time the restaurant had quietened down considerably we tend to find it is quieter after 7 30pm for example  I feel and have done for sometime that this branch of Harvester struggles to maintain good customer service and food quality We have used other local branches previously and have found that the one in Bromsgrove The Forrest  has always had consistent customer service perhaps the one in Redditch should invest more time in staff training

Have been regular customers at this pub for a meal im very sorry to say that over the last few weeks the standard of thd meals has gone down new chef and the meals are Even worse my wife left hers last w eek and my friends woifes chicken was still pink and raw definitely be giving it a miss from now on

I ordered the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich at 13 95 6 small pieces of beef thumb size in a sauce on a burger bun with some mushrooms I expected a sandwich that I could hardly hold and would leave me nice full but I finished it quickly and started to pick at the kids meals  To charge 14 quid for that is shameful I have been to TGI Fridays several times and always leave content  good food pleanty of it and good service Will not be going back to Frankie and Benny s

Unpleasant experience  The staff was friendly to start with when I entered the place with another friend We ordered several starters and some mains to share  Whe one of the fish dish arrived supposedly a freshwater fish from India Pakistan  we just could not eat it as the fish was bad When this was brought to the waiter s attention he asked either the manager proprieter to our table who then became hostile and declared to us that it was never mentioned in the menu the fish was fresh We explained that the fish was bad and he just would not have it In the end we just accepted that we will pay for the food if they would take the dish away and voila the smiles came back again  The whole experience just goes to show how superficial these poeple and one has to wonder about the quality of the food that they produce even if some reviewers like the food  Working nearby in Headington this would have been a regular place for me but after this experience I have warned everyone at work in Headington to stay away lest they received similar treatment  This visit was back in 2010 but it was such a bad experience and coming across this restaurant in tripadviser as one of the top recommended place in Oxford I feel I need to share my experience with everyone  Therefore the marked box of Jan 2012 below is done as it does not allow any review before this date

From the moment we walked through the door to leaving this was a bad experience  We arrived and we were half greeted by a passing waitress who I felt we were interrupting She asked us to look at her list of bookings for a name we recognised as we were meeting friends and didn t know what name the booking was None the wiser I suggested could we order some drinks to which she pointed to some chairs and walked off after 10 minutes and no offer of a drinks order our friends arrived  We were escorted to a table with a wet table cloth we requested to move and were greeted by yet more wet table linen However on the plus side we had now gone from paper napkins to linen We didn t get to sit down we waited while another table was set this time with a paper table cloth and linen napkins  these were later removed and replaced with a stack of small triangular cheap paper napkins on the corner of the table  Next a 15 minute wait for drinks order and 10 minute wait for them to be brought with small pathetic looking wine glasses covered in finger prints  The banquet was chosen by all Soup was best described as bovril at best  Mixed starters the spring rolls were small in length thin like pencils and due to this the filling was barely tastable The pawn toast was thick and probably the best item on the plate The ribs were plenty big enough in size but had enough meat on for a small mouthful  The duck and pancakes came and the duck was taken halfway across the Resturant to be shredded giving the cold pancakes enough time to reach room temperature so they went back and 5 minutes later returned when the duck had cooled enough to spark yet further annoyance  Main course came and the sizzling streak nicely splattered the entire table without much warning  the prawns I don t eat so can t comment the steak was delicious at last some positive The satay dish was quite possibly the worst tasting satay I ve ever had and I like satay dishes the look was not great and the texture slimey The rice wasn t much to be desired either it was very stodgy didn t come across as being freshly made  Quite an effort to get anyone s attention to ask for the bill and then at this stage I just wanted to leave I stood up and paid on my way out  They don t do Amax even though they think they do  [sigh]  they can t even get that right with telling me incorrect information

afternoon tea what a shame what was meant to be a birthday treat for my 8 year old granddaughter was an expensive mistake Never again Staff rude no customer service and they were not even busy only 3 other customers Sandwiches dry and crisp as though they had been made all day  given a warm glass for a cold drink staff who constantly wiped their noses on the back of their hands  who trains these people give this place a wide birth they don t deserve customers

You need to serve the people that arrive first at the drive-thru first Rather than have me pull up sit there with my window open getting wet for a minute then have someone pull up at the other order point and have someone take their order straight away You ve lost my custom on three occasions now Fast food means fast food not wait there like a numpty to get jumped in the queue

i visited the restaurant after seeing the advert in the Bromley News Shopper Not contemporary not fine dining Cold food some not cooked or presented as it should be Waiters unattentive Portion size leaves a lot to be desired if you want a true fine dining experience try Shampan Bromley few doors away you will not be disappointed

We have dinned at other Ask restaurants and have enjoyed them but this one left a lot to be desired We were holidaying in the area and went there for an evening meal it was the hottest week of the year  We were seated quickly but that was it The heat was unbearable there appeared to be some of air conditioning but if it was it was not working The staff seemed more interested in clearing the tables than taking our order we finally ordered starters and main course which took quite a while to come and my wife had a direct view of the pass and our main course was the waiting for well over 10 minutes before it was served Our online comments went un-answered  Don t think we had the same waiter twice A few week later we went to Ask in Beverley but what a difference
