Me and my friend were looking for somewhere to eat on Sunday night so thought we would try the ming cottage in Whitley bay as it looked a nice place from outside  On entering the staff were very friendly and we went to out table and began to order food service was very quick and food tasted ok but that was about as good as it gets  I orderd house special curry with fried rice and prawn crackers with a bottle of Chinese larger My friend orderd lemon chicken with chips and a half glass orange juice  First thing was wow how small the portions were  Then the rice was deliverd in one metal pan which we thought was a bit of a con as the portion of rice was about the size of one portion you would get if you ordered it for one person from a take away  So basicly we both played for rice with our meals and expected a bowl of rice each but got one pan of rice between two disgrace full   Then if that wasn t bad enough after eating our meal we then went to pay and omg  For these two basic meals and with one pan of rice between two came to just under 40  I think personally for tiny piece of lemon chicken  hand full of chips small bowl of curry few prawn crackers and bottle of cheap larger with one portion of rice between two is definetly not a cheap meal at 40   We could of went into Newcastle town center and got all you can eat for half that price lol And as for the meal itself it wasn t nothing spectacular I ve tasted just as good for a lot less   Would definetly not recommend unless you like spending a lot for very little  Will never return which is a shame because it seemed a lovely restaurant and staff were very polite but I m not surprised at these prices

Faulty Towers meet Bollywood I wish I had listened to the last reviewer when they walked out as we also waited 1 5 hours for our meal which I feel was Uncle Beans curry sauce which the waiter nipped to the Co-Op to get whilst we waited We were still expected to pay the bill in full despite the lonnnnnnng wait

We have been to this restaurant a couple of times and have always enjoyed it Nice pizza good atmosphere but unfortunately this opinion changed when we ordered a takeaway when a few friends visited We promised the best pizza around but unfortunately when we got them back they were wet cold and floppy Basically inedible When my wife phoned to let the restaurant know about this unfortunate experience she was told in no uncertain terms that it was out fault for ordering takeaway and we should have expected it to be cold and wet as we had ordered mozzarella and then hung up Wow

Having already eaten at the restaurant last year my wife and I decided to stop off for drinks before moving on to an Italian we had already booked The seating outside the main Restaurant is both centrally located and comfortable with a pleasant view the drinks are comparable with other cocktail bars although expensive What takes the biscuit though is the policy on glasses or should I say plastic ones having ordered a glass of both gin and tonic and prosseco I was staggered to be given a plastic beaker for the gin and tonic and certainly not drinks they charge premium prices for at 7 50 a shot The muppet who introduced this policy needs to justify why he serves beer in a glass along with wine and other drinks and yet introduces a policy even his own staff cannot justify for other drinks to be served in plastic containers I could understand it if glass breakages were an issue but the floor was an artificial cushioned grass and the policy is as I ve said not a blanket one its just not joined up thinking

The staff are polite enough they re just lazy and walk around with their eyes closed We ordered our drinks after we were seated but they sat on the bar for a good 20 minutes before we decided to just get them ourselves Bit of self service - like nandos but with awful chicken I had the spicy chicken for starters which wasn t spicy and was served with glossy mayonnaise The chicken was weirdly gooey too The gourmet burger was just a less than average beef burger sandwiched inbetween a dried out brioche bun Very disappointing

My family have ordered takeaways and dined in at this places lots of times and have always been treated great  So Have we  However we all ordered a takeaway on the 17th September when I came it was all wrong and wasent what we had ordered  My wife s mum having coeliacs disease couldn t eat what they brought  So we fined up to complain and the guy on the fone accused us of lying and said it wasent wrong  I asked if I could speak to the person in charge and apparently that person wasent there  The person on the fone wasent helpfully at all  I only have one thing to say THINK BEFORE YOU ORDER

Just dreadful expensive and tasteless Like a modern take on the old Wimpy restaurant  Staff quite sweet but not enough to make me want to waste 30 again Toilets disgusting  Photo an 11 chicken burger the size of a squashed meatball

Have used this restaurant on numerous occasions over the last decade and have seen it go through various ups and downs so was really pleased to see it looking like it was back on a roll The setting is lovely but the food was awful - go and have a drink on a nice day but don t waste your time or money on the food
Stopped there the way to London Big mistake Terrible service Warm Cokes Horribly expensive food  Don t stop Drive to the next service stop

We eat here as a family and with friends on a frequent basis always had a pleasant time and no problems This will be the last time we eat here  Having joined friends and their children after parents evening at school nearby we had hoped for the usually good service and food however this has to be the absolute worst evening here or anywhere else for as long as I can remember Once we joined our friends the usual process of choosing food and ordering drinks took place So far so good There were no complicated requests and everything was directly as offered on the menu bar the exchange or mash for fries on one of the children s meals children s meals requested to come with the adults starters  The starters arrived in a reasonable time although considering there were only four other tables occupied it was hardly whisked out At this point it began to go down hill rapidly Starters we cleared then we waited  and waited  and waited The children we starting to become agitated and even more hungry We asked once  twice  three and finally on the fourth occasion they came down 40 minutes after the starters they should have arrived with The request for the fries instead of mash had been ignored and so once child sat and waited whilst the other began to eat thankfully there was some sharing to stave off the hunger  Another 10 minutes the second child s meal is produced - sausages fries and two yes two measly carrot batons see photo - are you kidding me This is a go to meal so we knew what to expect At this point we were also wondering where our main courses were We waited a little longer  and longer  and longer After a further 29 minutes the main courses began to arrive Two adults had their main courses delivered and eventually 10 minutes later PART of the other two main meals When we pointed out we were still waiting for two further dishes part of the main course we waited  and waited and eventually they came The first two main courses had been finished and the two adults trying to entertain tired children that had waited over an hour to eat and then had to wait even longer because the food for the adults had not come out properly either Eventually the final dishes arrived everyone was way over it and just wanted to leave The finally injustice sticking point and rude snub was yet to come   To make matters worse and what can only be described as incompetent cowardice from the manager he didn t approach our table throughout the whole ordeal not even to offer the pitiful gesture of goodwill in reducing the bill by less than 5 to start with of approximately 150  He had left the task to his waiting staff all of whom we apologetic if not a little unaware  Once this was declined a further amount was reduced but by no means a fair compensation for what we had endured but how many times can you keep going back Disgraceful We paid left and sadly will not return

Came here on Saturday so the kids could play for a while and then have a nice meal afterwards never been before so we checked both the website and Facebook but struggled to even find an opening time We arrived and then we re turned away as it s a private party on weekends Apparently every weekend am is a private party So why is it Not on the website or Facebook that this is the case  Were were given some contact details by a very nice lady member of staff who was helpful But then we were approached by a completely obnoxious moron member of staff who started arrogantly saying well it s on the website  When I challenged his knowledge he soon backed down saying well I don t know    If you don t know why include yourself in a grown up conversation    Really Definitely a place we shall avoid in future and let everyone we know of our experience  Very poor
We thought we would try this one for a change never again no taste to anything will never use again there are far better Take away places in Horley

i had the large mixed grill the meat was disgusting dried up microwaved chicken dried up rock hard pork tasted crap the plus side the chips were ok the wife had chips fish the batter was soggy and the fish had been run over with a steam roller worst meal i have ever had
Food is Aweful no care in cooking the food Burger was dry and steak under cooked  served it to me raw Breakfast not that great either on a positive side they do have costa coffee

After waiting an age for our food we had both ordered burger and chips but with different toppings my partners came out stone cold and my chips were so scalding one burnt my mouth Partner and were both ill afterwards To top it all the side salad was made with raw cabbage instead of lettuce We won t be going there again

Had our meal refunded tonight Truly awful  After ordering starters and getting them fairly quickly Although when it took 15 minutes to bring some barbecue sauce for the starters I should have suspected something was amiss When the waitress did bring the sauce our starters had been eaten and we got the platitude  oh well it ll save me bring some for your mains  Talking about the main courses I had to chase the staff and they arrived 40 minutes later  When they did arrive my medium rare steak was charcoal and my wife s salmon wasn t even recognisable it was that brown  that s right brown No sign of anything pink and it was so dry  Asked for a refund and the waitress went to get the manager who must be so used to refunding on cr@p food that she couldn t even be bothered to come across and apologise just sent the young waitress back with a refund on the main courses  No offer of a full refund for an evening out ruined just the bits we didn t eat or drink  We ate here a week ago and the meal was lovely but tonight it was so far off the mark I was amazed  We used to eat here weekly before but we won t be returning and can t recommend this place

The caf€÷ was filthy but not busy The floor was littered with food scraps and used tissues as well as a liberal sprinkling of sand which on a lino floor is a major slip hazard Staff were attentive during our purchase but their attitude changed when they had our money I had to clear an overflowing tray of crockery to be able to sit at a table I took the tray to the counter only to be told trays go on the racks  when I said it is not even my stuff I was ignored There were no tissues available Much of the washed cutlery was speckled with dirt I took several minutes to find a half clean couple of forks which I had to further clean with my own tissues Not very impressive for such a beautiful location

Came here tonight 08 02 2014 and the service was terrible I have a food allergy as well as other people in the party of 16 and they brought food out with the food in it I was told what I can and can t have with my meal I had steak and ask for a plain naan and was told I can t have that food came cold we were told to be quiet when they were bringing the food out The food that did come out hot was nice but the serive is terrible All of the party have vowed never to come back

Amigos offers what it seems more like Indian food I went with my friends and had various dishes All were the same chicken filling similar to Chicken Tikka covered with beans and cheese The food was very bad nothing like Mexican food  The service can also be improved I will never go back to this Restaurant a waste of time and money  From a Mexican
Owner rushed us We felt like our custom wasent required and the owner kept making passes at my husband

We had a meal at Prezzo s in Tring on the 28th of August 2016 celebrating my daughters birthday We have always enjoyed and excellent experience in the past but must admit was left very disappointed yesterday evening I felt the portion sizes were insulting to say the least for the money we paid I mentioned this the waitress who was very sympathetic and offered us free deserts after I said I am not sure if we would ever come back She said it was because it was very busy which is an awful excuse because if you do not have the ingredients or staff to cater for a busy Sunday evening don t take so many bookings Like I said the waitress was lovely with her empathy and I do not blame her at all as she was lovely however I am not sure if I will return as it did leave a sour taste in our mouth and all we talked about on the way home was how poor the portions were and the excuse given instead of what a lovely meal we had

We had tried this place for the 2 previous years we had a bad meal in 2009 and throught we won t go there again However our Guest house owners said it had improved and we gave it a second chance in 2010 Same again bad service My daughter dropped her fork on the floor the Waiter picked it up and gave it back without cleaning one of many bad service calls  we waited forever for the food and when it came it was cold In fact someone did a runner not in our group because they were so dissatisfied We won t be going back again Anthony

Shocking food and shocking service Don t care how cheap it is not worth a penny Food is wouldn t feed to my dog Rubber and burnt Even my kids said no to the food They missed 2 items from our order and made a mistake that could have caused a trip to hospital

Went to the Fieldhead for a family roast today Sunday    it was awful  the menu stated perfect Sunday Roast how wrong could they have been  the meat was tough and tasted disgusting the veg was warm but not cooked at all the mashed potato was basically out a packet and the gravy had solid lumps in it   we had the manager over to complain to which he replied I can get you replacement meals but they will be no better they offered me and my brother turkey and chips  not quite the Sunday roast we went out for The Manager thought that 18 chips and two slices of turkey was good value for money as a direct replacement for our meal   which was 9 99  This hotel pub is an absolute disgrace The manager openly admitted that none of the food is prepared on site but is all prepared and bought in by an external company and then Fieldhead just warm it up in their kitchen so basically ping food people be aware this place is awful
I hand my family have never tasted vile food before in our life Went at Xmas and staff no better than 5 rate Never  never again JACK WALMSLEY

Let me start by saying I love John Lewis Time and time again when I visit any of their stores I m reminded how I wish every shop had such attention to detail and great customer service Oh John Lewis why not the same with your cafe The cake tasted like an Iceland frozen gateaux and the latte was the weakest coffee I ve ever tasted  Please sort yourself out we know you can do better as the flagship store of Birmingham Grand Central
Greasy stodgy and overall felling ripped off

I took a group of ~34 people to Lebaneat for our end of year rowing meal We booked in advance and confirmed on the day exact numbers of people and details - such as vegetarians We were told that everyone would be receiving the same starters of a platter of mixed starters We were then told that meat-eaters would each be getting meat platters chips rice and salad Vegetarians would get to choose their own dish off the menu - all 15 each Sounded fine All confirmed  We turned up and realised quickly that we d only been given 29 seats When I told the manager he told me I was wrong upon counting together he realised HE was wrong He promised to get us more seats ASAP Even after much pressure we still didn t have any new seats 2 hours later when we left  As to the food We were given 6 for a group of 34 medium sized platters with both the starters and the mains on them that not one person in the group thought were worth 15 Moreover to being small they were not at all what we ordered But even worse they had put the vegetarian starters on the same dish as the meat dishes and couldn t understand why this was not acceptable When the vegetarians finally received their food after much discussion the manager wanted us to apologise and thank him for the service of getting it  I could have accepted all of this But I cannot accept our treatment The manager shouted at both me and my friends even though he was at fault The manager got aggressively in my face at one point I genuinely felt worried he would hit me - I was not being aggressive back In fact the kitchen staff who were polite actually had to virtually drag him away at one point as did the other manager on another occasion They never apologised for this appalling treatment either the only explanation was given by one waitress who joked that it was just Arabic temper  I do not think shouting at paying customers is a joke Especially when you are in the wrong The whole group agreed that they wanted to leave ASAP We did eventually manage to convince them down to a reduced price of 10 per head which many still thought was too much  The real punchline of the evening they made a fuss when I asked them to remove the 40+ service charge  I can t comment on the food as I never got to taste more than rice and cucumber but I will never ever return here And as a side note my friend and his mum went the next day as a 2 told me the service was poor and impolite and the food was at best average Clearly I believe this restaurant has a very serious customer service problem

I went here with my fiancee last night From the outside it looks like a nice tidy well-kept pub We went in Most of the drinkers were clustered around the bar and at our entrance every pair of eyes swiveled to see who d come in - it was like intruding on personal space  My fiancee took a seat and I waited at the bar to be served Eventually a well dressed lady came up behind the bar Instead of asking me for my order she focused on the guy I was standing beside evidently a regular His glass was empty and she demanded to know what he wanted it refilled with He took some considerable time thinking about it - in fact it appeared that he didn t really want a refill at all Frankly had I been on my own I d have walked out at that point After a couple of minutes she turned to me and snapped  yes   We d intended to have a couple of drinks and a meal whilst we were there but I simply wasn t going to part with any more of my hard-earned cash in such an undeserving business We finished up our drinks left and went to the Angel a couple of miles up the road I ve posted a review of our visit there - a stark contrast to this place  My conclusion - if you re not a local give this place a wide berth It looks very nice from the outside appearances can be very deceptive at times

I admit I only came here for a takeaway The outside looks really fancy  Like some 80s vision of China The flagstones though are sprouting grass and the place looks neglected in closer inspection I don t suppose that really matters though  Inside it s the same Really over the top 1980 far eastern meets England The seats in the waiting area are like a shiny red plastic cover and the seats and tables in the restaurant look like your mums wedding dress  The most important thing is the food though and maybe the buffet which seemed popular was OK The takeaway though was awful A big red mess of jelly and chicken  Aware of making unproven allegations let s just say one of the ingredients did not agree with me my fault I m sure  and my stomach has not been the same for a few days  The waitress that took my order needed to know the numbers of the menu of the meal  She didn t actually know the menu  It brought to mind Dell Boy yelling menu item numbers at some poor Chinese waiter in the 70 s  I m sorry it was so bad Again maybe the buffet is better

as my title suggests the starters were great Kimchi selection sashimi beef seafood omelette All good and I wish we had left then  One main was ok - kimchi tofu and rice Simple ok but portion so tiny could have been a starter for an anorexic  The seafood bibimba smelled so bad I could not bear to even taste it so I can t really tell you how horrible it was A cross between an open sewer and tinned squid My fellow diners tried to share it but even though we have all eaten Asian street food and in Korean eateries for years this pile of muck defeated us  Friend had beef rib bibimba and now we know where Shergar has gone A cross between a flip flop and a bone my dog would reject Tiny amount of meat tinier portion of vegetables and 90 oily water  Vile horrible food and now we know why it was empty in the middle of soho on a Saturday night   Fingers crossed they have a short lease and that a decent Korean chef will take over soon

I went to the New York Cut on a works doo and it was one of if not the worst meals I ve ever had there were 14 of us in the party when we turned up we were the only people in the place other than one unlucky couple We the proceeded to wait 1hour to be seated in an all but empty restaurant  Once seated and at this point fairly hungry everyone picked there main off what seemed to be a nice menu we ordered a variety of the steaks on offer Two of the party specifically asked for the steaks to be well done as they really didn t like blood in there steaks We then proceeded to wait another hour and a half at which point the steaks started coming out in drubs and drabs I was first which I was happy with as at this point after 2 and a half hours of waiting I was incredibly hungry as you can imagine I started eating my steak which I asked for medium however got blue it might aswell have not been cooked and for a 28 day mature rib eye had a lot of sinew in it and was incredibly chewy By the time I d forced the steak and 3 chips down which I couldn t leave as I was that hungry or send back as God knows when I d see it again there were still members of the party that hadn t even been served yet Oh and the two members who had specifically asked for there steak well done and no blood were almost as rare as mine AVOID THIS RESTAURANT LIKE THE PLAGUE
Opened a few minutes late food not ready coffee machine not heated having only just been turned on porridge cold I could keep going   Maybe a bad day but not up to Premier Inn usual standards

We went on 20th December at 8pm We had book weeks in advance as it was our department xmas dinner  When we arrived we were shown to a long thin tressle table this was cramped and because of the narrowness of the table and the noise did not allow for conversation with anyone apart from your immediate neighbour There was a large office party at the tables next to us They were shouting accross stamping and clapping all night which fankly left me with a headache  The starters were fine The mains arrived at the table lukewarm There was a small dish of carrot mash and sprouts between each four people I know it s french infulenced but it certainly wasn t adequate for the money  When dessert was served those people who had been served Christmas pudding they found it was stone cold A number of them had tried the pudding The waiter took them away and returned after 10 minutes We assumed that they were cooking fresh When they came back to the table we started eating them when a colleague shouted stop  he realised that someone had been eating the Christmas pudding that had be given to him The waiter admitted that they had microwaved the puddings to heat them but he couldn t tell whose was whose and therefore we were eating something that somebody else had been eating   When we complained they said there was nothing they could do We suggest that we shouldn t be charged for the desserts and the waiter laughed and said it s part of the set menu so there is nothing we can do  We had selected the 39 95 set menu - with their exorbitant service charge this came to 51 per head plus wine  I certainly won t be going here again and would recommend that everyone else stays away

Arrived Monday evening around 830 looking for a table for two Restaurant was about half full and after a couple of minutes at the door were greeted and offered a cramped table of two in between 2 other couples I asked if it would be possible to sit to the right as it was far quieter and was told no it s a table for 4  After asking again and mentioning how quiet they were she went to ask her manager who said it was ok  We were seated with menus and told she d be back shortly The waitress spent a great amount of time tidying several tables and ignoring us  After 25 minutes 9pm  end of shift maybe the waitress was nowhere to be seen so we called over a waiter and asked to place an order for drinks as well as our food order We explained we d be sat for some time to which we received no apology other than a what would you like  Food arrived in reasonable time and I must say was very good for money we googled a 25 off food voucher and was hot and tasty No complaints  During our meal another couple stood some time at the door and after not being seen to sat themselves down on the next table to us After several minutes they asked for menus and after another 10 or so they had to call someone over to take a drinks order After they again mentioned the wait they were told rudely if you sat yourself down that s the reason why nobody s been over and after explaining they had waited and nobody had seated them presumed you sat yourself  After catching the waiter to grab the bill the first thing he asked was how was the service in a very sarcastic tone  Hugely disappointed with the attitude and level of service we received whilst eating at Prezzo  Luckily my partner persuaded me not to complain and for fact I think it would have fallen on deaf ears we left full but wished we had eaten elsewhere  Not good

On a night out with 15 people over 1 hour and a half for the food to turn up absolutely ridiculous Its not like we turned up unexpected we d actually booked for 15 people turn up and the wait time was ridiculous would not recommend coming here at all

Friday evening 630pm restaurant about 1 3 full looking forward to Harrys famous fish and chips Waitress seated us in a window position let us with the menus and we awaited her return to order drinks at least 5 minutes go by 10 minutes then 15 still no attention from the table staff despite trying to make eye cintact with several waiters and waitresses Finally we got up and walked out not very impressive considering the place was less than half full Had a much better experience in Weatherspoons a few doors further on

Well we were hoping for a nice meal We ordered starters 15mins later the waitress apologies saying they didn t have what we ordered so we change our order In the mean time we could hear the waitress apologising to other customers about the wait 30mins still waiting more apologies 1hr 10mins later still no starters and the waitress comes over to say they didn t have any of our main meals left More apologising to other customers When we left the management didn t seem bothered The only good thing is they gave us our drinks on the house I think the new owners of this pub will not be in business for long at this rate I for one will not be going back

I came for a meal a month ago the food was amazing so we visited again I revisted on the 31 March 2014 the food was terrible I ve had baby food taste better The bar man was really helpful and adviced us on our drinks and the lady on food greeted us nicely and served us in a polite manner The manager returned later that night and we could smell alchol on his breath when being served  please invest in a toothbrush  He left a young bar man unattended whilst drinking at the other end of the bar He was unprofessional and we will not be returning again We were disappointed and recommend people don t go there We would give it no stars but that can t be done

This establishment has been closed for a couple of months as they have gone out of business  This must be 6 different owners possibly in the same family since it went from being the White House pub  You would think that a new owner would want to try and different food style anything other than Indian but not fish chips

Went to Leon with the family having always fancied it but never got the chance We went as we had a voucher code but were told they could not accept it as it was for dinner and they don t serve dinner on Sunday It seemed cheap so we opted to stay It really was a sub-sub-Nandos experience The chicken served was greasy and brown - no breast The chicken soup showed no discernible evidence of having met a chicken at all Salads were robust and healthy but mostly seemed to consist of raw broccoli Waffle fries were very greasy The whole meal was served at room temperature apart from the soup which was microwave hot - almost dangerously so when my son had a taste and luckily for him could taste nothing else for the rest of the meal The kids protested and we had to get a bag of chips on the way home  Their slogan is The future of fast food  I fear not

Visited with my wife and sister recently I chose fish and chips my wife chose steak and was asked if she wanted thick cut chips when the meals were served it was obvious my fish and chips had been frozen and the mushy peas were dry my wife though asked did she want thick cut chips also had been given oven chips my meal cost 7 95 for convenience food I could have cooked at home in fifteen minutes so if you like overpriced convenience food this is the place to visit but I certainly will never return

Living local and a kind of regular I decided to pop in there on a monday night after getting off a plane from Spain Being used to manana manana I had to wait an eternity for a simple burger When it eventually arrived it was so burnt that it was actually black on both sides and the bun itself was rock hard I told the waiter he must be joking and was told I was being rude I insisted on speaking to the manger and instead got an immature assistant manageress who told me that she did not like my attitude Actually I had 3 staff members ganging up trying to downgrade myself  I was even told that I was not a regular and have never been seen even though myself and family have been going to this pub for many years All I can say is support the real local pubs that are not owned by big corporations and run by staff who think they can take your money and answer you back I thought the customer had rights not in this pub Funny I ask for a complaints form and instead got a survey to fill in How can anything change when they are there just to take your money Good luck

The food was ok at best The service by the staff was ok at best The attitude of the boss was disinterested at best  Thankfully our evening did not hinge on our meal here If it had we would have been very disappointed At best

Dirty establishment with rude staff and vile food  The liquor is tasteless the pies aren t even mince they re more like dog food  Like the rest of the market shops it s ridiculously over priced  Avoid
Stopped by for a quick bite Quick - no way 50 minute wait for a cheese toastie and a ploughmans Stroppy answer when complained about the wait Not a pleasant experience

Eating out in Doncaster as always been bad but this places raises the bar of utter rubbish Bad service felt the waiters were rushing us my niece had not finished but still tried to take her plate away then stood and watched till she had finished and the prices they must be in cloud cuckoo land 5 95 for a few mushrooms in garlic and cream the same for chewy squid the main course was alright but for 15 95 was not at all worth it Was it a bad night on their part I do not think so just people of Doncaster have not a clue about good dining and this place knows it sees you coming serves you utter garbage then robs you blind for the privilege

I was asked to leave this venue last night I was told I was drunk I d has two pints and my friend who was standing next to me told the guard this I was then told the manager wanted me out I asked why because I was genuinely surprised The guard said a guy in a green t-shirt was causing trouble I pointed out the fact that I was wearing a black and white button down shirt The guard didn t care and maintained it was me He just said his manager wanted me to leave I wasn t too bothered really but I just found this to be very odd treatment Anyways I won t be going back
not a very welcoming place to visit shop resembles a 1960 s establishment some staff seem to be miserable and a cant be bothered attitude

We went on a saturday night and was busy So as is quite normal were handed a buzzer and pointed to wait in the bar area  We then proceeded to stand there for 10 minutes plus  which seemed more like 30  whilst 1 waitress did table orders and the other served ONE single person She took an eternity to served one couple just 2 drinks and then took a card payment which took an eternity When she came back she rudely shouted whos next and served some guy who was blatantly stood 2 yards back from the bar and was clearly not next I said he was not next and she looked at me to say you should have spoke up   They really should not advise people to wait in a bar and then not be able to even serve them a drink whilst they wait And a bar tender who cannot keep track of who is next is pretty poor  Very poor especially considering also my heavily pregnant wife could not be given some sort of seat or table service for the drink anyway Having an 8 month pregnant lady to stand at a busy bar for over 10 mins is a bit of a crap night out  To boot there was TWO managers stood idle at the front desk greeting people which is not even a full time task You should surely come help on the bar and pop back to the desk as and when   why would you give preference to new customers not yet in the venue instead of those already stood waiting

I was sitting at a table outside with some friends who work in a pub across the road A guy i knew walked past stopped said hello i asked if he was coming in the pub and he said he couldn t as he was barred he then says bye and walks off A minute later the person i now know is the landlady comes out and say i have to leave I ask why and am refused a reason stating she doesn t have to give a reason My friends say thats unfair and i should least be told a reason but again she refuses then says if i don t leave she will bar the table I raise this with the company who have zero interest whatsoever despite cameras clearly showing nothing occurred except my friend walking past I have never before or since been barred from anywhere and this was the 2nd time i had ever visited this pub I have now heard that she will do this to anyone who is associated with a barred person

Went in got our drinks then ordered me and my partner got a mixed grill it s was like a child s portion plus we didn t get tomato or onion rings when we brought this up the lady said they don t serve mixed grill with them anymore and walked away telling us if could have ordered them as an extra but if you look on the menu it does say mix grill comes with steak chicken sausage gammon chips mushrooms and grilled TOMATO and ONION RINGS

After reading all the reviews praising Barnys restaurant did we pick the wrong night we were really looking forward to a good meal of haddock and chips After ordering we waited quite a while before it came to the table On trying to cut through the batter to get to the fish it was like a rock and had obviouslybeen cooked before and put back in the fryer making the batter solid When we finally got into the fish there was just a miniscule piece of fish The chips were no better stodgy and uneatable My wife complained to the young waitress and got our money back Any way next night we went to Jons takeaway round the corner from Lidles best fish and chips we had for a long time allf freshly cooked in front of you

Went in for cake and coffee  however it was apparent straight away that we d skip cakes after the immediate rudeness of the waiting staff during the drinks order My mother was laughed at for ordering iced tea which they actually did have and when she asked for ice for all of our water they bought two cubes in a glass for the four of us to share Myself and my dad ordered breakfast tea I asked for sweetener for his the waiter said of course we don t have sweetener this is a coffee shop Use the brown sugar  Don t sell tea if you re not prepared to supply white sugar or sweetener For some reason he then took the sugar away before my dad used and we had to go to the counter ask someone less abrasive for more We were treated appallingly like we were a massive inconvenience

Five blokes five meals and all the extras     ALL COLD Took an age to get it too and it wasn t that busy we complained but they either weren t bothered or didn t understand We won t be going back pity it used to be ok

tried out buffalo for the first time last weekend we had high expectations but were very dissapointed Went with my son and partner she is oriental and me english the only reason i mention this is because perhaps the staff dont like mixed race relationships firstly i ve never beofre walked into a restauraunt and been ignored by the waiting staff when we got our table and plates were put down i had to tell the waiter that one of the plates was dirty i understand these things happen from time to time and a simple apology would have been fine but no nothing just swapped the plate without a word the food is mediocra at best the worst came when i found a long hair in my food i mentionded it to the staff only to be told very abruptly well none of us have long hair never in all my years have i come across such a bad attitude towards a customer i wasnt after a free meal or even a discount just an apology would have surficed on leaving the restaurant not one staff member said thanks or bye or opened the door for us which in an indian restaurant is the norm ive chatted to a few friends who have all have bad experiences there with the staff and all vow never to return if you want a restaurant aimed prodominantly at muslim non english people then why on earth open it here in the most english part of Luton

Called here today for lunch It was just after 12noon There were two ladies waiting to be seated ahead of us Well they waited and we waited and eventually I went to seek out a member of staff She said she would be right with us Sadly she wasn t and eventually we left I should add the restaurant was very far from busy Instead we went further up Bridge Street to Urbano32 where we were very well received

I don t understand at all how people can think this is good Mexican The only possible solution to that conundrum is that it s mostly British people or others who haven t actually tasted good Mexican that think that the gaudy and unauthentic sombreros they give you are fun  Please if you ve ever tried real Mexican food or real Tex-Mex whether in America or Mexico DO NOT GO HERE This place is fake inauthentic and the food is bad bad bad  It s greasy it s oily it s made with low-quality produce and every bite just tastes like they looked it up on Jamie Oliver s website or something  Throw in the ridiculous sombreros the totally un-Mexican staff and this whole place comes together to be a totally fake and unpleasant surprise to anyone looking for genuine Mexican food in London  The only people that can like this place are those that haven t had real Mexican food so please if you know and like Mexican food don t go here  PS It s overpriced too
Truly bad - the only good thing about it was that the portions were tiny It has really gone down this year compared to last year You can do so much better at 40 per person

We went here hoping that Gourmet meant what it said but it only applied to the prices Queuing at the counter to order and pay in advance was a bore When the food arrived it was most disappointing The burger was small and burnt the salad was drowned in creamy salad dressing and indigestion seemed imminent so I left the soggy bun untouched The atmosphere was nothing special at all Basically just another mediocre fast-food joint that thinks that it is special It isn t

There s not really much to say We were booked for 7 30 but didn t eat any food until gone 9pm Had to walk over to the bar to get drinks as asked waiter and even the manager for wine three times but to no avail The staff seem clueless A guy used a tray to carry a bowl of olives all the way across the restaurant then went back and got the bread  they have conversations in Italian whilst they re serving the food  They got my main course wrong Whilst they did offer to knock it off the bill I would have preferred what I ordered but the waiter said the kitchen was very busy and it would probably be about half an hour  to do pasta   I spoke with the manager who was apologetic but to be frank she was running around doing very little  She was one of the people I d asked for the wine  but had forgotten or not chased up the bar  My partner s starter was great mine asparagus was stone cold Main course was ok but nothing special  Overall very disappointing I think you d get better service in pizza express  It s part of a large group of companies and I think they re just running the places into the ground Bank Birmingham which used to be really good is also going the same way with food quality although the service there is still pretty good  I won t be going back It s a shame Beautiful restaurant great atmosphere -but just totally clueless management I have worked in the hospitality industry and I can tell you that decay starts at the top When management aren t giving staff direction and aren t picking up on what is being done wrong then things go downhill The entire service was in a mess -I clocked it as soon as I walked in and just wish I d walked out again Most tables were waiting for ages  Poor

How can something so right go so wrong   Well this placed USED to be the very best Indian restaurant for miles around For 3 years I visited regularly and never had a bad meal The food was exquisite even though the snarling front of house manager clearly had a preference for fellow community members and something akin to disdain for seating non Indian members in his domain The poor waiters are rushed off their feet and hoardes of people frequent the establishment day in day out This had led to complacency coupled with an unwillingness to admit that the chef has changed  That is the only explanation I can think of - a change of chef for the last 3 visits have been nothing short of pitiful Once - an off day fair enough  twice - maybe we were unlucky but 3 straight visits for cold food along with cold service means that my party will in future vote with our feet - there are plenty of other excellent newer alternatives in the area where the manager doesn t need to undergo plastic surgery in order to manage a smile  Last night the signature lamb chops were once again somehow burnt and cold at the same time and our off the bone meat nearly choked my friend who got a bone stuck in his throat An apology - NO A suggestion to remove the items from the bill - UNTHINKABLE Upon replacing the lamb chops I complained that the rest of the food was now cold and I would not be paying for the lamb so instead of an apology or an offer to re-make the food we are regulars after all  they simply took the dishes away to prove to the chef that the food was not up to standard and reluctantly brought us the bill  All in all a poor experience - the 3rd time in a row - one that could easily have been rectified with a smile and an apology Unfortunately complacency has set in long ago and according to fellow diners if you re looking for somewhere to go on the slide this is a good alternative to the park

After being hounded by the owner to write a review I thought I would as he said they where the best restaurant in wigan Cheap Nasty tastng food More like an overpriced cafe and thats an understatement Service poor Wedged into a corner listening to the RADIO   I asked for some mint for my lamb and was handed a pot of tesco mint sauce with a teaspoon in it  Some Fine restaurant this is does not know the meaning of the word Stay at home and cook yourself egg chips and peas its cheaper and will definatly mush better I had to put a 1 star as there is nothing less

My wife and I ate here for the first time on a Saturday night I was surprised that during a festival they still had tables but I was hungry The restaurant is filthy the service is painfully slow and as for the food it is vile I cook myself a lot and that food was microwaved the squid was reheated the sauce on the ribs tasted like it was out of a jar and the scallops were as hard as bullets At the end of the meal we were virtually shooed out of the place by a new waitress who did not speak English so we could not complain Do not ever eat here

It s pretty on the outside but there s nothing else really Maybe it s all the cuts to the local council or maybe there really isn t anything to begin with but there are no facilities or tour guides or things I just expected to see more there
I m getting bored of giving this place another and yet another chance to prove that it can produce some sort of consistency All I can say is - I m out
The food was not good not was the service the starter arrived after the main meals One of the kids meals arrived before everyone else s and the well done steak was still bleeding

Lovely setting next to the cathedral but the service was poor The person behind the till was rude and demanding there wasn t an understanding of what vegetarian might mean and the scones are ridiculous If your idea of fun is to spoon thick cream into a thimble sized plastic cup which is balanced on a bending plastic tray with a meagre and over priced scone all resting on a sliver of a shelf while being judged by a crass and inflexible service crammed behind the till  then this is the place for you Unnecessary to be unable to be served unless you give a table number when every table is actually empty and we just hadn t chosen where to sit yet Not very welcoming in such a prime place for visitors to Salisbury

Ive had better at a service station at half the price dont be fooled by the brand its crap Food looks great until you taste it and after 20 pound for what could pass as a value tesco meal you feel like you have been cheated And what ever you do dont complain as your looked down on as a common person give it a miss and save your cash
Now closed  ceased trading shame  no doubt to be changed to something else might want to delete from site

This used to be a decent stop off years ago As many others have commented the place feels like a time warp and it s got a 70 s 80 s charm to it  Upon entering and seeing a hygiene rating of 3 out of a possible 5 alarmed me somewhat And also just one couple and a child seated in the massive restaurant should have made us do a runner Again our order was taken and we were subject to the issuing 2 tickets debarcle just give it up you have no customers anyway two breakfasts arrived literally swimming in grease the presentation was non existent and what bit was edible was extremely bland  Here comes the best bit though my dad ordered tomatoes on toast most foodies would know what to expect Plum tomatoes on toast  what did he get One whole tomato cut into slices that was apparently Grilled but it it barely had been shown the pan Unhappy he returned to the pay point and explained that was not what he was expecting and reiterated what he required He duly paid the 50p they required without an apology of what had actually arrived at our table Minutes later another sliced tomato appeared looking very much like the first time  He explained to the waitress chef if you could actually call her that what he required and instead she argued the point he should have asked for tinned tomatoes  Again isn t this supposed to be a farm shop  When his order was finally fulfilled the above person came to our table and slammed the new tomatoes down next to him and stormed off back to the kitchen  Very poor attitude   So as this used to be a popular haunt for people they have obviously voted with their feet and rightly so  Keep heading east there is a McDonalds at the Wisbech turnoff

They claim to provide gluten free products but put what little they have with products that are not gluten free They offered soup but did not know what thickeners were in it and refused to allow us to ask the chef They do not understand cross contamination Ignorance is no excuse where customers health is at stake They had nothing to offer a person that can not tolerate gluten for health reasons rather than dietary choice

Come here for an 80th birthday they re was 19 of us we all had bad food we love hungry horse but this is the worst place I ve ever eaten and that s saying something we ve all complained and gotten different money back

Popped in a few months ago - they had a new chef but weren t serving food at the time - had a look around and thought yes we will look forward to going back Went in this evening car park was busy - good sign thought lets get a drink and decide on our plans Shocked is the only way I can describe the outrageous price we were then charged for drinks  1 70 for a soda and lime You don t even get charged that in the West End  If you have a venue that generally requires guests to have a driver in the party it is unfortunate that you can not get the revenue from expensive drinks - I can understand that but charging such an astronomical amount for lime cordial cost price about 0 05 and water free  is pathetic

We booked a table for 9pm I had a heard good things about this restaurant from a friend We skipped the starters due to the time and ordered 1 Sticky Rice 1 Pad Thai K Prawn A mixed seafood hot plate & their signature dish Large Tiger Prawns After 50 minutes we watched 1 customer storm out over the quality of the food and service at this point we were thinking about leaving boy we wish we did The rice came out in one LUMP  The SIGNATURE DISH Tiger Prawns were burnt on the outside and raw in the middle the rest of very average After a bite of the slimy Tiger Prawns our stomachs started to turn which were 14 95 by the way We made our complaints known and were refunded the Tiger prawns & rice and the manager then explained that she was having trouble with the microwave heating the rice up If you value your health avoid  We were charged 30 Never again
Rushed service at one point the waiter clicked his fingers to pass the finished starter Never again better places in chester one to avoid

Rubbish service rubbish food Everything about this place is rubbish I even found a hair in my food Countless glares from staffmembers Wrong orders brought to the table Customer service is appalling The worst experience ever

Turned up with 9 friends for my birthday meal and they had lost my booking  They were over booked and could not accomodate us Offered little appology but I booked it 2 weeks before Restaurant looked like queing canteen Went to differerent venue Lost my custom and many others forever

Went there for a take away last week as I have always used them and has always been good food I have to say this is the first time I ve been since the new ownership and shall not be returning I got the order home to find out that they had got it wrong I couldn t be bothered to go all the way back into kidlington as I was hungry so I decided to eat what I was given  I really wished I had not  the food was bland very tasteless and only Luke warm the next 2 days I suffered from stomachs pains I will not recommend this place to any one again

while passing I decided to stop for the fixed price breakfast which included tea & bread & butter  I was charged more than what it said on the notice outside but sat & waited for it to arrive after 20 mins I was brought a mug of tea & 2 slices of toast I said I didn t want toast just bread & butter & was told I could have the toast anyway & I would get bread & butter with my breakfast  when my breakfast arrived I asked for the bread & butter & 10 mins later I received another 2 slices of toast  I said I don t want the toast can I have bread & butter  I was looked at as if I was mad then the waitress walked away went back to the kitchen with the toast came back empty handed & stood behind the bar   still no bread & butter  breakfast wasn t all that either

The food took over 40 minutes to arrive and the so called hot tapas were already cold before they reached the table The first dish which was supposed to be chicken looked like it had been stuck together from other people s left-overs and would not have looked out of place with the vile offerings served up in the celebrities in the jungle programme The lamb steak came already ripped apart so that it wasn t recognisable as steak and was drowned in something resembling a sauce but which stunk to high heaven and tasted twice as bad Unfortunately the manager became very aggressive following our complaint and we left after leaving cash on the table to cover most of the bill

This place has it all Dirty cutlery horrible Luke warm food poor service & the ambiance of an oil rig canteen  Value for money When I got the bill I didn t know wether to laugh or cry as I was walking away from the place I felt like I had been mugged

We went to Sawadee on a 15 groupon deal for two starter and main  My wife and I selected the same starter about 6 each and our main course came to about 10 each After taking our order and accepting the offer we were told that it would be 3 50 extra for each main course since we were having duck Then when the bill came another 3 50 had been added because our starter was more expensive than other starters  She even said she was giving us a deal by only charging one extra 3 50 charge  So rather than being a good deal it proved to be only a minor discount and created stress for myself and my wife on what should have been a nice evening out  The service was slow even though there were only six other people in there and very little effort had been put into making it a nice Thai atmosphere Some strange English music was playing the walls were empty the menus were falling apart and the pile of candles sat unlit on a side table  Since the food is good I d say most of the problem is down to bad management If we hadn t felt ripped off I would probably have given it 2 5 5

Came in on a Saturday It was quiet Clean lovely atmosphere Ordered a pot of tea and a double espresso Pot of tea had 1 teabag in Very weak tea Coffee cup had dried coffee drip stains down the side and along the rim from a previous drink Coffee tasted like water I suspect it was coffee that had been used twice Took the coffee back offered no apology

I had the misfortune of eating at La Rue on Saturday night The starters went OK but then they brought out only 4 of our 5 meals - about 6 or 7 minutes later the 5th meal arrived but none of our vegetables had arrived We asked for them and got no response from the staff We asked again and everyone ate their meals without vegetables even though we d ordered them We spoke to the staff and said you have only brought out half the meal we d ordered make sure we re not charged for the side order of vegetables We then after 20 mins or so had to ask twice to see the dessert menu They brought us 6 coffess and lookede confused when we were a group of 5 4 of the coffees were fine but one was completely cold and we insisted it was changed for a hot one We were very unhappy at this point and the whole evening had been spolit by unbelieveably poor service We asked for the bill 20 minutes went by and we still hadn t got the bill We asked again irately and they brought the bill On the bill was the side order of vegetables that we hadn t had as they couldn t be bothered to bring them We told them to remove these items from the bill They did this and we paid and left  I couldn t recommend this restaurant to anyone - the whole experience was shambolic and disappointing My advice would be to go somewhere else and have a better time

After a painfully slow delivery service the barely warm meal arrived what can I say the chicken madras ordered tasted exactly like a tikka massala hold on that s because it was After a short heated discussion with the telephone staff they agreed to send the originally ordered dish Although it did arrive within 15 minutes it would ve taken The Deadliest Catch team to trawl the bottom of the ghee coated gravy slop to recover a single tasty chicken morsel  You wouldn t need a seasoned asian pallet to know this is not a scratch on what Beckenham restaurants have to offer do yourself a favour try something different elsewhere   The Dining Experience  An experienced to be missed

Arrived 1pm  15 min queue at bar to order 45 min wait for starter 1 hr wait for main - grossly understaffed My chicken mushroom pie was inedible-soggy pastry hardly any chicken content- much better quality at local chippy chips must have been cooked 3x previously- fatty and cold Seasonal vegetables consisted of limp raw cabbage dried up carrots and parsnip Other meals no better fillet steak tasted slightly off chicken breast totally dried out all chips virtually inedible I cannot state enough how disappointed we all were with the meal  Sirloin steaks were fine though there was total confusion over the order For a Sunday Lunch the level of staffing and service was totally unacceptable We will never return there and will recommend friends and colleagues to seek elsewhere to dine  I am aware that meals have to be prepared to a price but nevertheless basics such chips and vegetables should be prepared and presented to an acceptable standard whatever the price Children had to wait nearly 2 hours for service-what should have been a family celebration became a challenging ordeal

I m a man of few words but unusually this Boozer brings out the need in me to express my findings in great detail Brilliant location nice enough country pub but no way is it anything special decor-wise  its deffo not a trendy gadtro-pub & the prices are mid to high which isn t on given what we experienced was nothing more than reheated deep fried processed frozen food None if this could be overlooked as the service was below parr the welcome from the Landlord was luke-warm & generally we felt as though they couldn t care if we were there or not despite us giving them our business We deffo won t refer Friends & Family & we deffo won t return

The start wasn t great  this place is in a horrible block of buildings  the kind of place I would expect to order a bacon sandwich No bars or night life nearby to speak off at all  unless you fancy a take away pizza which you might  I arrived to what I thought looked like a cafe  not many in and generally a bit lack lustre I was invited to sit down in an empty restaurant for a drink before the meal I declined that kind offer and asked for a beer  they only serve one btw  warm peroni in a bottle   I shouldn t need to tell them It was warm but I had to I even had to ask that they put 3 4 in the freezer so That I wouldn t have another warm beer  In fairness the girl on her own seemingly worked extremely hard and was very attentive  The food Very good in general as my expectations from the location where not high Small portions where delivered without any explanation of what was in front of you  which wasn t always clear But the quality of the cooking was very good I won t be back and unless you fancy a place with no atmosphere  choice of beers and very little food I wouldn t either  They are however an independent and am sure work tirelessly for their passion they are missing the basics  atmosphere  choice  and a decent drinks menu
I know we are not in France but if it says steak Frite at least get frites eh when asked the server had no idea at all will not be eating here again

I ve been to Damons quite a lot and enjoyed it in the past its good for kids foods good and on most occasions the staff have been nice and the wait for food isn t too bad either but won t ever return and the reason is the following  In a big open restaurant with several tables free they sat us right on top of another family which more than likely annoyed them just as much as us so I decided to move a couple of tables down as the restaurant was fairly quiet to give each other space we ordered are food and sat back  in the meantime other tables around me were being taken up with people ordering food after a while I noticed that people who had arrived after me were all getting their food before me after waiting over 40 mins and seeing several people being served before me I asked the girl why my food had not arrived only to be told it s cause you moved seats and ballsed the seating arrangements up  They were actually prepared for me to sit there indefinately waiting for food that wasn t going to arrive because I dared move seats I like picking seats when I go for a meal and not frogmarched to one and told to sit there I had young children with me and they were preapred to take the mik out of me and my family just because I moved seats what type of idiots are these people In the end I had cross words with them insults were exchanged and I left and won t ever go back again which is a shame because I used to go their often

Saturday afternoon visit Wife + 15 year old Especially picked out this pub due to its history and trying to get some into pub going for when he s old enough Pub was busy inside and also spilled out the front Made it to the bar only to be greeted by rude bar staff shouting across room that kids are not welcome inside Had ordered my pint so we went outside only suggestion made by bar staff as to where we could go no mention of any other inside room for children then outside we were approached every 5 minutes by beggars wanting change will not go back

Awfull service terribly cooked food and very cramped decor The place has gone massively downhill  Worse than even Weatherspoons The only whing good is the balcony over the harbour not great for January though

This was one of my worst experiences in a restaurant ever the place had no atmosphere the staff not one of them had a smile at all the food was dumped in front of us and tasteless compared to some good kebab houses around keema nan had some kind of powder not recognisable as keema - what topped it off was there was an extra rice and drink on the receipt - how cheeky the guy who took my order looked me in the eye and conned me - daylight robbery albeit 4 50 but if they did this for 100 tables a week it adds up - nice policy but NEVER AGAIN

First time I ve ever been refused entrance to a restaurant and it was not even half full The excuse given was we were part of a large group So once again a venue turns down business but judging by some of the other reviews we had a lucky escape We progressed to another venue who were only too happy to have our custom

I arrived at 11am with my girlfriend to find Acanteen 85 full with people seemingly enjoying their food We found a table sat down and browsed the menu before I went to join the substantial queue at the ordering area  I queued for a total of 15 minutes before I got to the front to be told that the kitchen was being closed as we are busy  I found this beyond belief that a restaurant below full capacity could not cope If the restaurant are ill-prepared they should look to downsize If Acanteen wants to maintain a certain level of respectability they will address this matter After all it was profits and money through the till that was walking out of the door as we had a milkshake each and then left to a nearby establishment which was capable of housing us and many more  On a sidenote the milkshakes were okay

I wish I had checked on here first Thought you couldn t go wrong with this type of food but how wrong I was Tasteless rubbish avoid this restaurant and hopefully it will go out of business for someone to open a proper food outlet

We have passed the Trevor Arms many times en route to Glyndebourne and na€Œvely imagined that the local pub of a village adjacent to such an illustrious opera house would be superb in every way Certainly the online menu and food images suggested a feast in store but the reality was quite another matter Having pre-booked for lunch we accessed the building through the back door adjacent to the pub s car park and were immediately struck by an overpowering smell of lavatories Endeavouring to remain positive however we climbed the unwelcoming stairs to the bar to be greeted by a sight of such shabbiness that for one moment we thought we had entered the wrong building But no this was indeed the Trevor Arms  an establishment in truly desperate need of a major decorative overhaul bereft of any vestiges of charm or cosiness In fact given that the pub had already been open for over half an hour when we arrived on an icy November day there was a distinct chill in the bar and the radiators were stone cold When we and an American customer asked whether some heating could be provided the barman lit a single wood-burner which the 3 of us huddled around at adjacent tables but it gave off very little heat despite some additional coaxing We had carrot and ginger soup as a starter  quite the most tasteless concoction we have ever encountered akin to eating a bowl of bland unseasoned pur€÷ed carrots submersed in flavourless hot water We struggled through in hopeful anticipation of a better culinary experience with the main course but our choice of wild mushroom risotto proved an unmitigated disaster the only discernible flavour being saltiness in the extreme After morosely poking this gelatinous gunge for a couple of minutes we returned our plates to the bar in disgust pronounced the risotto to be completely inedible paid for what we had consumed and left Readers of our reviews will know that we generally find something positive to say about the majority of eateries we visit but we can find not one redeeming feature in the Trevor Arms that would persuade us to return to this establishment ever again It was truly awful

the afternoon tea was very poor if you are Gluten free I rang up and spoke to the manager about my wife allergies and they said they can do us afternoon tea we were greeted with a couple salad sandwiches and a side bowl of roasted vegetable for her no cakes etc I don t have any allergies so mine was ok not great came out in bits and pieces and I alerted the manager owner I had no jam or cream they came back with jam and cream cheese  I spread it and had a bite out of the scone to my horrible taste it was cream cheese and I then told the owner about it his response was thanks for letting me know he didn t apologise or anything and then return with some cream I found the owner rude and customer service wasn t at all anywhere good enough for the money it cost I then wrote to the restaurant and they said they would respond in 24 hours and its now 3 weeks later with no respond

We were a party of five who visited the tollgate for Sunday lunch today and were very dissapointed with the food Four of us had the Sunday roast two having pork and two choosing the beef My roast beef dinner consisted of three slices of pre roasted beef that had been reheated in gravy which was served on top of a dollop of mashed potato the vegetables were virtally non existant a couple of broccolli florets three or four small pieces of carrot and one yes one only small roast potato the size of a small brussel sprout and to add insult to injury everything was barely lukewarm one of our party had pork which actually was still pink inside that may be acceptable for beef but definately not for pork After complaining to managment who gave the impression that our complaints werent justified he did knock 10 percent from the bill I am a regular visitor to Bury St Edmunds visiting family and always dine out but the tollgate will be avoided in the future

It s not often you can say a carvery is massively overpriced at 10 but a plate of dry veg with a tiny piece of meat should never cost this much The restaurant as a whole was poorly managed I came close to walking out Unfortunately this restaurant relies on passing trade so if you re reading this it s probably too late to avoid but be sure to tell others heading to York

Really looking forward to the meal this evening first time at Nandos and heard that it is very popular After a forty minute wait where we were told that we could not have drinks other than water we were seated at the table I took the written list of our order and engaged in a conversation with the guy behind the till only for him to answer the phone and walk off Um excuse me I m here and actually talking to you I find this extremely rude and would have walked out at this point but I had guests with me which stopped me from doing so So I finally placed my order specifically asking for a plain butterfly chicken in a Portuageese roll This seemed to be more arduous than the ninth task of Herculese being told that the menu is difficult for first timers I want to order dinner not study for a PhD  We were then permitted to help ourselves to drinks The starter was fantastically overpriced for four slices of garlic bread When the main arrived it was with courteousy however the plain butterfly chicken was doused with mayonnaise So even after having it written down the order placed before a phone call re-placed after the interruption and then reiterated then confirmed by the waiter and reconfirmed by myself it was still wrong when delivered to the table The minuscule ramakin of chips that cost a staggering 2 50 were not cooked properly but consumed hungrily during the yet further wait for another overpriced piece of chicken in a bun to be delivered This came with an apology but no salad so a further scuttle back and forth produced a solitary green leaf and a disk of tomato The food was of no great standard what with the undercooked frozen chips the so called Portugeese roll or bun for short and lacklustre salad The desert was ordered only for a waitress to return to deliver the news that the order could not be fulfilled due to lack of necessary rations Alternatives were chosen and these came promptly The majority of the staff had left for their own evening meal by the time we were leaving and we were hailed across the hot and noisy resteraunt with a goodby see you again  Yeah goodbye but no not see you again  That was my first and last time in a Nandos  A pathetic starter a simple chicken in a bun not delivered as ordered an expensive and minimal portion of undercooked frozen chips and a desert that had to be re-ordered  I was really looking forward to eating here but left frustrated disappointed and with the moths in my wallet with only a solitary tenner to chomp on But at least it s what they ordered and they are happy enough Just not good enough by far

Chose cheese and chutney baguettes   no baguettes  Settled for sandwiches Charged us 9 80 for 2 sandwiches made with supermarket bread and cheap cheese We tend to put quality before price and thought that for a fiver a piece the sandwiches would be decent quality Should have gone to the supermarket opposite and bought a couple of their sandwiches We won t be going to Coffee etc again suggest you don t either if you expect value for money

I have been to the Puss In Boots on numerous occasions both to eat and sometimes just for a drink I have always found the staff really friendly and nothing seems to be to much for them to do for you Which is why I was really upset earlier this week The lovely smiley blond girl in a black top who is always friendly was admonished I d rather use a much ruder word in front of the customers by the tall smart bloke with curly hair  I think he is one of the owners  You could see she was really upset and virtually in tears I find it totally appalling when this happens in public surely it could have been dealt with at another time If this is an example of the Almond Family way of working I shall not be going to any of their pubs again It was disgusting behaviour reducing someone to tears in front of customers I have sent Robinsons a copy of this review From an ex customer
Over priced poor service and awful tapas This place really can t do Spanish Tapas visited here on a couple of occasions and left disappointed portions small and over priced

We went for evening meal on a Thursday Overall the food was good but expensive The cheapest main was 13 50 for the veggie option  The real issue was the service and arrogance of the place Firstly we were not shown to our tables and instead just told were to find it by the landlord I then asked a question about if a particular meal came with potatoes and was greeted with a response of they come with what it says on the menu having not eaten there I was trying to understand if I needed to order extra but after further questioning still got a very unfriendly response  The food tasted good but was overpriced by 2-3 per dish they also needed extras which would again increase the cost Scampi was 15    When we had finished our meals they took the plates with out so much as a pleasantry and then when I paid the landlord hardly said a word and I felt like it was a transaction to him He then left a card asking for a trip advisor review as if he was very confident that they were an amazing experience  Customer Service was shocking decor was 15 years past it s sell by the food was good but overpriced and I have eaten better at 2 3rds the price

Very slow service Staff did not care and despite delays were disinterested  Had to leave to top up meter because of time waiting Prices up  Service down nice decor but a poor experience Bring back cafe plaza would not recommend this restaurant

11 us us went as it was my sisters 56 Birthday  we waited and waited for are food to arrive when it did they shoudent have botherd the chips were unedable as were the soggy onion rings non of us finished the meal we will never set foot in The Astoria again

After driving up high street late one night decided to try Bennys  The family had eaten so was just feeding myself I love fish and chips but the quality of the food here was not great at all Chips were greasy and all stuck to bag I liken it to eating mashed potato The batter on the fish was not cooked really soggy and not the white flakes of fish I would expect Staff were pleasant enough but did take a while for them to acknowledge me really annoys me  Definitely better chippy s in town just a shame my regular one chippy s was closed

It was a lovely day so we sat outside unfortunately my pint of becks was spoiled by a dirty beer glass We then ordered food my partner a salad and me a steak sandwich with chips The food came promptly and the waiter offered salt and pepper but no sauces or vinegar My steak was full of gristle which meant taking pieces out of my mouth after each bite of the sandwich Of course if it was on the plate I could have seen which parts to remove but if you make a steak sandwich then it should be gristle free since you have to eat it blind Moving on to the chips these were hard and oil crisp - overcooked and tasteless hence I had to go and find some vinegar I would no go back here
Don t go here  the worst service and thing I ve ever eaten The rating i ve given is generous  i d rather starve  crap
I quite often pop in here for my lunch great staff nice food and reasonably priced The take away counter is also very efficiently run and service is speedy

Pizza is ok but the service experience was terrible I kept waiting over 20 minutes for my take-away order When I asked it was clear that they messed up the order And then I kept waiting another 8 minutes And when I was asking again they didn t apologise Instead they were amused and laughing at me And then one guy made inappropriate comments in Italian accent about the fact that I ordered 2 Pizzas just for me alone and was commenting in profane language on my weight I have some overweight  I asked to cancel the order and to get my money back but they rejected my request Eventually after over 35 minutes I got my 2 Pizzas In the meantime also other customers had been paying attention to my case They were very amused and some of them also were making disrespectful comments about my overweight And the people from the staff were also openly mocking me and laughing This was a very humiliating experience I went home with my Pizzas but had no joy in eating them Never ever again I will enter this horrible place where they did something so bad to me

I dont want to harp on with a long report  Food in edible  we left without paying  family in front of us did the same and two behind us also left  perhaps a bad day  Food pre prepared from  bookers  3663 or brake brothers  just rubbish  Staff un interested  manager wouldn t even come out of the kitchen to speak to us  left phone number  no one called It was never going to be cordon blu but to be avoided even my kids sussed it was rubbish

Took family here for lunch as it was good weather after reading on web site Sat drown about 1pm went to bar to order food and was told there would be 1 hr wait to be served I said are you sure and I was told yes I go to a lot of places with family and have never had to wait more than 15 min for food 1 hr was just a joke so left next time here in shielded I will not be coming here  too long

I usually eat here once a week but after today never again  New owner has taken over and hes really unhygenic and useless  Ordered an egg sandwich and a panini it took 20 minutes after he said it would be 10 Between preparing my food he was cooking other customers egg and bacon using his hands to touch the meat and never once washed his hands the whole time I was there Panini was ready after 10 minutes but was left in the panini maker for a further 10 minutes until he cooked the egg 10 minutes to prepare an egg sandwich   After touching my food with his dirty hands and 20 minutes later he served me a rock hard and squashed overcooked panini and an egg on the wrong bread and to top his awful customer service off didint offer me a bag to take them away Avoid unless you want possible food poisioning
