We were passing by and thought it might be nice to sit on the terrace and have something to eat and drink even though the prices were on the high side compared to the other places nearby When our food arrived it wasn t very warm I ate about half of mine but it had started to get too cold to enjoy I took it back to the manager who was serving behind the bar  he questioned me about how long I had waited for it to be served then said he would refund me half the price of the meal There was no apology and I got the feelling that he wasn t bothered about any customer satisfaction this was my first time at this establishment and it will be the last There are a lot better places to eat in Bridlington and i recommend that you avoid this place

My wife and I visited Real China in Camberley last week I never normally go to buffet type restaurants and truly wish I hadn t bothered breaking from my belief that most of these type of restaurants serve poor quality cheap food The dishes we tried were tasteless and unappealing Sauces were thin and watery without any substance for instance the satay sauce I tried was nothing more than a tasteless khaki fluid The starter type dishes were either oily dried out or both  To sum up my wife and I ate almost nothing drank our drinks paid 35 and left This is the worst eatery I have ever had the displeasure to eat in

The food here was very poor indeed I had a Lamb Vindaloo - the sauce lacked flavour the meat was gristly and was swimming in grease The sides were no better dry rice and an overcooked naan only added to the disappointment  The d€÷cor surroundings were forgettable and the service was neither good nor bad - nothing here to drag the rating up

I visited Scoffers on June 8th 2012 I got a walm welcome although a little over powering  I ordered a steak  I do suspect it was frozen I did eat it as I was very hungry but really it was only fit for my dog I told my waitress that I thought it had been frozen  with a big smile she stated that all their meat was fresh  no way it was awful and at 24 with a glass of wine a rip off  so if you want to eat like a dog Scoffers is for you     Roger

Wow this place really is horrific From idiotic doormen kicking around rubbish outside to a vile and nasty staff member actively heckling customers in the lifts - a truly terrible experience  I had made a reservation for Sushi Samba a few months ago and was rather looking forward to the evening However despite my reservation we were placed in the darkest deepest corner of the restaurant with blinds pulled down blocking any natural light  I thought I was meant to be 39 floors in the sky not 39 floors in the ground  When I requested to move I was told that the other tables - which were empty - had been reserved   strange given the fact I had made a reservation for a window table  Indeed the staff member proceeded to put his arm around me and offer an even worse alternative Please get your hands off me I am not your friend and don t want you to touch me  Enough was enough we had to walk out 5 minutes into our visit  I honestly can t believe how atrocious this place is Not only were the staff in all sections of the venue odious and ignorant but the venue resembles a teenage pool party in Ibiza  In future train your staff appropriately and add a bit of class to the venue Terrible   PS One star is far too generous wish I could give this mockery of a restaurant zero stars  A response and apology from senior management would be the least that you could do
Got fish and chips prety sure that the fish was pangasius watery with two fish to make up a potion it was bloody awful Dont bother

This place has a food and hygiene 0 rating people read the reviews and think that we either had a bad time and pick a place and slate it this place is awful the staff are in helpful moody the food is awful it needs new people in this did used to be a lovely place but hey things change the peeking house just around the corner is owned by the same people but the food there is OK so how can they get it so wrong in the evening palace

We went as group of 4 last night just for the dining experience since the dining room pride itself with the Michellin 1 star quality food However I have to say that our surprise tasting dinner menu turns out to be a complete surprise to us as it is indeed the worst meal I have had in my life starting from the appalling service to the inadequate quality quantity and variety of food served  The reception drinks and canapes were a good start of our evening and probably the only good bit of the evening A relaxing atmosphere in the recption when we walked in seating areas was nicely decorated and comfortable Attandences come around pretty quickly to take our order and serve giving us a good start before it all went down hill  We have all ordered the surprise tasting menu  85 without drinks as we thought it will give us what it s best of the menu The first is an appetiser which is a celery cream soup served in a double espresso cup I have had a few tasting menu myself in my life and a small cup of soup really cannot be called an appetiser not even on a normal menu The taste of the soup itself was bad as well as about half of it is cream so all we can taste is the sweetness of the cream Decorated with a very sour strip of pickled celery that makes our eye watered when we put it in our mouth The combination was badly thought through and started to give us the impression that the chef hasn t tasted what he she cooked  The the starter comes two strips of foie gras which tasted like strict from the can or the chef has overblended it so much with air and cream leaving no texture and taste of normal foie gras The sad thin piece of smoked duck breast was added onto the plate for no good reason at all as it adds nothing to teh plate If two strips of foie gras and one piece of duck breast are what they are attempting to achieve for the variety that should appear on a tasting menu plate they failed completely  What s more  there are raspberry redcution and one and a half pieces of fresh raspberry to complement the dish Where s my other half of the raspberry The dog got to it  With our disappointment we then moved onto the fish course  lobster and tomato salad    two pieces of pouched lobster and tomato three way sliced tomatoes of three variety tomato foams and tomato jelly  I would really love for the chef to explain what makes tomatos and lobster go so well together that he she think nothing else is needed on the plate Seriously not even acceptable as a normal salad in a normal menu  And definitely not passable as the fish course  really tomato adn lobster salad on a non-chilled plate  Main course was one of the more normal dish thanks goodness  Deep fried lamd chop with stewed veal plated together which tasted nice but together being less than the size of my palm The lack of quantity on the plate throughout the entire meal is best demonstrated here really we had to pay for this as a main course If they are trying to pass this sad demonstration as the tasting menu main course please note that simply by putting pieces of well cooked meats on a plate really doesn t warrant the title  I guess you can tell that if we are not at all impressed by this point especially topped with the terrible service that we have been recieving throughout the eveing eg one of the staffs doesn t even know where the bloody toilet is   but more of that later We are all hoping that the sweet courses might lift our mood up a little bit  Well not sure    The pre-dessert was a piece of concentrated passion fruit curd with chilled vanilla cream and nothing else  Really curd with cream that can be finished in four spoonful is our pre-dessert  The dessert itself is the only course that resemble what should appear on a tasting menu  A combination of coffee creme caramel brownie and white chocolate ganache which all tasted quite nice The variety of taste and quantity meet the standard unfortunately not the quantity  My creme caramel looks like it had tripped adn failed down the stairs before landing onto my plate and the brownie looks more crumbs that had been left on the plate by mistake I don t know at which restaurant is this accpetable but when I order dessert I expect a complete dessert not half not a quarter and certainly not crumbs      Finally we thought coffee and petit four cannot go wrong and we will at least have a good finish that can hopefully erase most of the bad memory We are once again nastily surprised  I have ordered a lady grey tea which I know is uncommon but please ask and find out if you don t know it They had gone away form the table thinking it is a variety of coffee and the manager had to come back to clarify The coffee themselves tasted like from the nespresso machine  Seriously Even my 3 starbuck coffee are freshly grounded  And I pay 85 for this dish water I am not going to elaborate on the taste  as dish water really summed it up maybe the machine mal-function that day too  With the petit four the chef once again demonstrated his her lack of knowledge in food If you are unsure about what the name of dish means please at least google or wikipedia it because it will quickly tells you that petit four literally means small oven and had three varities glazed baked or salty Ours fitted into none  Two pieces each of Super-sour lemon marshmellow chocolate truffle tiny bit of pineapple cake brownie again  and store-bought cut-up piece of quince I am not going to waste time on telling you how bad they tasted but what are we suppose to do with two pieces of different sweet between the four of us Cut it up with a knife like one of the waiters suggested Yes they had the nerve to offer us a knife to cut up the sweets when we ask what are we supposed to do with the pitiful plate                This is just glimse of the terrible service we had been having through our entire evening  Our drinks order was not taken at all and bottled water magically being poured without asking The lack of knowledge is demonstrated with the location of the toilet   with the coffee selection  well the normal coffee   espresso   you know   and they seems geniuely surprised and out of their depth when I ask what is on our plate Yes I had to ask instead of being offered to explain what we are eating in our surprise menu Then there are the usual smugs on the china spilling of water by them of course and the general unfriendliness of the serving staff What s worst is when I reflect all these comment on service to the managing staff while trying to contain my anger I was told that the staffs are all new and in training    so we are your practice dummies and we suppose to eat up this terrible excuse along with the rest of the terrible food They then go on explaining that the michellin 1 star is for the quality of their food instead of the service adn experience as a whole  I gave up They take off all the drinks from the bill which was a nice gesture but I really emplore everyone including the affs after reading this post if this experience warrant the 85 I paid I personally think NOT

My wife & I were desperate for a quick snack after touring Cornwall so called in to Walkers in Padstow at about 5 30 one midweek afternoon in April 2013 I asked for a cheese & onion pastie but was told that they were sold out so chose a traditional one with chips My wife had the same They must have been in the warmer for hours because the chips were lukewarm dry & limp The pasties were the same & very poor quality with gristly meat We both left half of our meals which is unheard of The ambiance was very drab with metal chairs & plastic tablecloths The coffee was OK but the memory of the food still makes me shudder
Food not good as well as being over priced Male toilets dirty that involved a walk through food storage area  Fresh food stored outdoors and staff rude Need I say more

Such a disappointment The food here is great and reasonably priced but the service lets it down A group of six of us arrived at 12 45 on Sunday It was dead there were two other tables at the time We were seated no problem drinks were ordered and arrived within 5mins Great It all went down hill from here Our order was not taken until 30mins later after asking if our order could be taken 45mins passed and still no sign of food We politely asked one of the staff to check our food order and he went to check in the kitchen he returned 5mins later stating the reason for the delay was because we were a big group 6 people is big and because two members of our party were ordering Dim Sum as a main This would have been okay if we were informed of this when our order was taken Also just to note Dim Sum is STEAMED food it does not take 45mins  The food finally arrived 10mins later and it tasted great After the meal we waited a further 25mins before 3 of our plates were cleared the other plates were left on the table we were never asked at any stage if a we wanted more drinks b if everything was okay and c if there was anything else they could get for us ie deserts  Not to mention there was also no apology at any stage  It was not busy There were more than enough staff to accommodate Staff seemed disinterested in every task they undertook Safe to say we will think twice about returning here

Booked about 3 weeks prior for 7 adults and 2 children for lunch on a Saturday we had a warm welcome from the young man who directed us to our table The service is not the best though the staff are polite its slow and you have to ask for more drinks The food is overpriced and not the best quality the chips look like they have freezer burn and the vegetables are cooked within an inch of life The childrens menu selection is as expected nuggets and chips etc but to charge 7 95 is ridiculous and 2 20 for a fruit shoot The worst thing about the whole visit in heavy wind and rain was the fact that no one at booking stage i left my mobile number or on arrival informed us that the toilets where in a portacabin outside i understand that refurbishments need to be completed but the very least you could do is inform customers spending good money  Never again i would suggest looking for an alternative place to eat

Nice new decor - very bright and airy Staff still pleasant but the food - hungry when I left  The starters were good and the salad cart was - well salad  Mains were not so good Ignoring the fact we got the wrong extras and the onion rings were a bowl of stone cold fatty batter the meat was so bad neither of us ate it My mixed grill had some horrible white meat I think possibly chicken and I resorted to entertaining myself experimenting to see if the beef would actually bounce nearly if you are interested  It was supposed to be medium but instead I got a piece of rock hard dry dry dry dark brown stuff - maybe the hoof We were experimenting to see if the refit had helped any with one of our local fast food joints Fraid not It seems they are still serving up road kill A shame given the venue and the staff

I come here most lunchs for a guiness with friends and often eat a deli deal Usually mediocre these meals are great for the price  Today however my experience was disastrous My chicken wrap had stale hard bread on the edges and the chips were so hard I could have hammered nails in with them I was half tempted to take the chips away for scientific tests as they may have been useful for bullet proof vests The waiter who saw these came with a fresh plate of chips for me as my appetite had gone a refund would have been preferable but nevertheless a great gesture on his part

So everyone knows this pub is closed down & dining has been shut for 4 months  This would be misleading if it were to stay up misinforming people who travel to country locations just to fond its closed

I had lunch at an outside table today with a business colleague  We ordered fish and chips and steak frites  The fish was deep fried in batter and was clearly bought in frozen and ready battered The chips were soggy and not fresh The fillet steak was grisly and accompanied with frites from a frozen bag It was laughable that the garnish was half a small grilled tomato  Drinks consisted of a bottle of Thatchers cider and a bottle of water The bill came to 66 pounds including a 12 5 service charge added to the bill I paid by debit card and the waiter wanted additional service His manner was insulting when I refused Avoid this place at all costs

We had a groupon voucher to use at no 29 for two people with Panini coffee and cake Very small place with only about five tables and four stools by window so shouldn t take long to take an order Well WRONG  ------After our order was finally taken we waited for our coffee for around ten minutes then after it arrived we drank our coffee and waited and waited then after 20 minutes a table that arrived after us had their food delivered still waiting 10 minutes after that we told them we would have to take or food out as only had 1 hr on car meter waited another ten minutes after that to get food with no apology from staff  This place is a joke and the staff terrible with customer service

This is one restaurant were we never actually got to taste the food as everything had run out  that wasn t the main problem it was how we were treated because of that  Arrival at the restaurant did start off too good either firstly no one was there to greet us secondly we were met with a look of disgust from one of the diners sat with her husband We were a party of nine however we were a group of professionals out for a team dinner  not a stag hen party  Once we finally got sat down there was no pleasantries or welcomes just a polite waitress who had the hard job of telling us what wasn t available on the menu so it s begins  Only one fillet steak no lamb no posh burger only 2 fish of the day  ok so we thought lets try the other alternative The final straw came when we all ordered and then were told they only had 5 crab starters left so two people will have to change  It was an easy decision we decided to leave The embarrassing point is that not one manager or senior member of staff bothered to come over and stop us ask us what was the matter or offer any alternative The question we wanted to know was why on a race weekend with the knowledge they had a party of nine in they didn t plan in advance Secondly the restaurant was not full and those that were in were couples who maybe didn t like the look of us  All was not lost we ended up finding a fantastic restaurant near the Minster called Bennetts who will be getting a 5 star rating So it s the Ivy s loss and their gain  The Ivy is one place I will not be going back to to try the limited menu

I ordered a BBQ Chicken and Bacon sandwich which took a while to come When it came I was appalled by the standard of food The sandwich came on what I think was value bread and was cut unevenly There was enough BBQ sauce on the sandwich to supply the whole of the pub which was just soaking into the already rubbish bread I would expect to make this sandwich myself not have it provided for me from a chain of pubs Awful and terrible experience

Decided to go here during gay pride this weekend as there was a sandwich board outside advertising an ostrich or kangaroo burger with chips for 5 Thought this was great value and would be a nice change form the burger vans on the streets It was an absolute con though They were no chips served with the burger at all despite the manager saying there was when we went in and asked about it No burger bun which I was fine with as it is a mongolian restaurant after all but in the end all we had was a burger chopped up in a bowl with some onions  not exactly the great bargain we had expected The false advertising and poor quality food was not the worst thing though I have to say the service and attitude from the manager on duty was the worst I have ever experience We politely requested a discount because there were no chips with the burger which was advertised on the boards outside yet he was rude and acted like we should have nothing to complain about as we had vegetables with the burger I reminded him that we the onions I got with my burger I also would ve got if I had got my burger from one of the vans outside He did eventually agree to a discount on the burgers but then when we asked for the bill all he did was told us the total and there was no written bill which for some reason he couldn t wouldn t produce so we weren t even sure if he was fiddling the drinks prices to make up for the discount he gave us on food We left the money in the middle of the table for at least 10 minutes but he never even bothered to collect it then as we got up to leave he grabbed my arm firmly as if stopping me to leave and said in a rude voice Where s the money  Then there wasn t even an apology when I pointed to it lying on the table Don t go here Worst service I have EVER encountered

The phone lines were down- therefore cash only  We arrived by taxi  13 to discover this The staff initially ignored us one more or less stomped about sulkily When we were eventually spoke to and explained our situation there was a grunt disguised as an apology I challenged the staff about contacting us as we d made a reservation and one staff member lied saying a colleague tried to contact everyone  His face faltered throughout the lie and he looked away avoiding eye-contact  There wasn t even an attempt to make it up to us E g A free drink We ordered another taxi and left  26 later we arrived back at the airport hotel furious  Never again

After getting many recommendations from earlier in the year we decided to visit here yesterday for a family birthday 12th July 2012 and I have to be honest everything was mediocre at best   The service was slow and quite detached  no real passion   The food was pricey but having heard good reviews from lots of other people we decided to ignore the prices and just order what we wanted the meat platter starter was slung together with no real attention and the mains were just bland and tasteless  Not at all what we expected The glasses and napkins were quite dirty and when this was mentioned to the waiting staff they simply stared at us as if to say well what do you want me to do about it  The bill was quite high but as I said previously we wouldn t have minded if the food was as good as it s been advertised word of mouth etc to be  I shall not be going here again NOR buying into the Jamie Oliver brand any more

Tried the restaurant as been past many times and thought it looked nice Went on a Monday evening and there were a few folks drinking smoking outside but only 2 tables occupied inside and one of those were on desserts so we didn t think we d have to wait too long Unfortunately we were wrong  As others have said there are no starters available so we ordered mains both off the specials board Unfortunately these took over 50 minutes to arrive which if they had been fresh cooked & piping hot we could have overlooked however they were only luke warm and the home made chips were clearly bought in from a chip shop and microwaved My main course was supposed to be chicken in a mushroom and mustard sauce however there were no mushrooms which when I managed to find a waiter to question I was told after a 15 minute wait that the chef had forgot to put them in  That was it No apologies just a shrug of the shoulders and off he went After taking this up with another member of staff and eventually the landlady we got the same response just shrugged shoulders On our way out we commented that we d sat there for another 30 minutes after our meal and not been asked if we wanted dessert again just blank looks So although I can excuse a mistake I can t excuse the fact that no one at the Queens Head actually cared one little bit No apology no offer of recompense just nothing So paying over the odds almost 10 per main for pub grub which was reheated and incorrectly made that no one could care less about isn t for me

I have recently had a meal at The Norton Tavern to celebrate a member of staff getting a new job Although the place itself is very inviting due to its refurbishment the meal was shocking The food was cold throughout the worst being the mash which there was very little of anyway I certainly will never be returning and would never recommend this place to anyone

My girlfriend and I went here on the 26th september as we had seen an offer of 50 off the total food bill which sounded like an excellent deal  It s a nice location minutes from the racecourse so not hard to find  When shown our table we ordered drinks which came promptly The menu looked like it had a nice selection of food and there was a special board too My girlfriend went with the ribs to start followed by the wall burger at 15 I went with the cheesy garlic bread and the BBQ plank from the specials board which was priced just short of 20 As it was 50 off we both thought it was a bargain  The starters arrived and I have to say the garlic bread was one of the best i ve ever had it was delicious My girlfriend on the other hand struggled with the tough and overcooked ribs If you compare the ribs to that of Hickories even the dog would ve struggled with them Luckily  I had the joy of sampling them as they were part of my main course  The mains arrived and to say they were poor was an understatement The BBQ plank consists of  -pulled brisket - which was overcooked and lathered in the sweetest of bbq sauce -chips - not even seasoned  -Chicken wings - with soggy skin -A sausage - quite nice but most probably bought in -BBQ beans - highlight of the dish if there ever were one -pork belly - no crackling due to not being rendered down in the slightest overcooked and bland I presume the crackling was so spongy it must have soaked up the flavour of the whole dish  see pic as to how spongy  In all fairness The Wall burger didn t look to bad but had we been charged full price we would ve felt hard done by  The waitress came to clear the plates and asked the obligitory question how was your meal I pointed out the spongey pork belly to which she said Is it not your thing At that point we both knew the chef was unlikely to receive any feedback although I did leave feedback on the card provided with the bill  We both agreed it was the worst meal we d ever had out in Chester and that we d decline the dessert menu make a swift exit and look elsewhere  All in all I d only go back if I had the garlic bread for all 3 courses the food was that poor

We ordered our food at the bar and 3 items on the menu we ordered were unavailable including a curry on curry night  Nevertheless we ordered our food and sat down with some drinks we waited 40 minutes for our food at this point we approached staff at the bar and they said or order hadn t been sent through to the kitchen despite a waitress telling us it would take 5 minutes 15 minutes later our food came out unsurprisingly our orders were wrong We were offered a free round of drinks and complimentary desserts for the cock up funnily enough the desserts took 30 minutes to come as we were getting up to leave they brought them out so we had them The waiter said I believe there was an issue with one of the desserts we were not made aware of this so we were left with 3 desserts Overall a horrendous evening will not be returning but would recommend the Lea Gate Hungry Horse other side of Preston on the A road definitely a much better HH

This place is without doubt the worst in store coffee shop cafe I have ever visited I was with my wife and her mother shopping and my Father in law and I thought we would have a cup of tea whilst we waited for the ladies   What a mistake The whole concept of quality and customer service is not present at this place Don t get me wrong please it s not that we set our sights too high I mean what s difficult about a coffee and a sandwich I ll list the two main problems    « poor rude staff  chatting between themselves and appeared uninterested   « poor quality drinks and food stale If this passable retail store don t want to drown in this departments disgraceful performance they need to close and rebrand the facility and relaunch it Come to think of it however I try I can t find one good point

Bought vouchers from Groupon for the Taster Menu  which was not as we expected We were sat a our table for 25 mins having arrived on time with not even a drink to keep us happy The surroundings were less than appealing Sat in a conservatory with slippery tiled floors and placed at a table adjacent to the toilets The service was appalling Left with the wrong menu then asked  white red or rose  When finally presented with the Taster menu having been criticised for not stating this we found the menu to be limited with only a choice of 2 starters one of which had a 3 supplement and 2 mains - again one of which had a 7 supplement - how can this be classed as a Taster  We left before we had placed a food order and I m sure were not the first to walk out of this establishment Very disappointing We eat out in Southport regularly but wil not be visiting this restaurant again

Went here with a large group of about 9 family members although there was only 4 variations of meals as many of us had the same meal as others in the group We then queued for ages to just order our food and get drinks We were told bluntly that we would be waiting AN HOUR for our food Naturally we would have gone then but as we were in large group we decided to wait it out other places we had been generally over estimate waiting time An hour and a quarter later we went up to complain as food hadn t arrived and we were not alone The queue behind us were all disgruntled customers some people waiting between an hour and an hour and 3 quarters We were told it would be 5 more minutes it was 10 at least And what s more there was no apology from on the till or the waitresses who eventually brought the average food along Don t go there for food you ll be waiting half your life

Just been to the Blundell arms with the Mrs for a Sunday roast All I can say is that I m disappointed to say the least Now when I think of a roast I think a decent amount of meat a generous serving of veg a Yorkshire pudding some proper roasties and maybe even some mash all topped off with a generous smothering of gravy When I think of a roast I think of the ones my Mrs makes  On arriving at the Blundell we were seated relatively quickly On sitting at the table we were given 2 very presentable menus one being the normal menu and the other being the menu for the roast dinners We went to the Blundell for a roast so quickly went about reading the roast menu We were greeted with the idea of promising food For example it stated that we would get goose fat roasted potatoes an exceptional Yorkshire pudding  something along these lines  and buttery seasonal veg You then moved on to your meats and your tempted with the choice of roast beef turkey and pork or a trio of roast A TRIO OF ROAST  Who doesn t want a trio of roast There were also other options such as slow cooked pork belly lamb or beef If that doesn t get the mouth watering I m not sure what will  That is unfortunately where the good stops We were asked if we were ready to order and we both asked for a trio of roasts and were told that they didn t have any left This is fair enough I understand restaurants run out of certain things from time to time So we went for the roast beef we love a bit of roast beef We didn t have to wait too long before the disappointment came to the table I can only describe what was on the plate as pitiful Please note my earlier comments about what I think when I think of a roast I don t really expect to see too much of the plate before I start eating  Well what was wrong with it your probably asking Well I ll tell you I m not sure who they have in the kitchen but i think they need to go out one Sunday to another pub and learn the definition of a roast  or just read this  There were 2 slices of beef a piece of unbuttery cauliflower a small handful of unbuttery carrots a bog standard Yorkshire pudding and 3 roast potatoes which being honest weren t any better than aunt Bessie s This was a complete come down from reading the menu to the point were I was compelled to sign up to trip advisor just to share my experience I am a man who loves a good roast and I was looking forward to this so much The wife s was no better in fact she had two and a half roasties  I was shocked to the point that I honestly thought it was a joke and thought the rest of the veg would be coming separately but that didn t happen I set to eating the misery on the plate in front of me and was finished in 5 minutes I wish I had taken a picture because I don t think this review would honestly make you fully appreciate how poor the serving was I was still hungry I was eyeing up other people s food around me thinking what would happen if I d just leant across and just pinched a bit of food  Both me and the wife couldn t wait to get out the waiter asked if he could tempt us with a dessert but in all honestly I don t think I could have coped with any more disappointment I think it would have been my breaking point On the way home I could feel myself getting angry the more I thought about it I wouldn t have minded if the food that was on the plate was exceptional but it wasn t it was just alright On a positive note the horseradish sauce was nice  Being honest the pub itself is nice It s got a great interior and a nice chilled atmosphere Unfortunately this wasn t enough to save the experience With better food this place would be great but as it stands at the moment we won t be returning and certainly won t be recommending it for people who want something to eat  I really do hope the Blundell arms reads this and takes something on board it has the potential to be a great pub

we went to Alec s restaurant when it first opened the food was nice but not sure was worth the expense waiting staff we very good but they seemed scared stiff of making a mistake did not like the idea of not having wine bottle in sight kept topping glass up so you had no idea of when bottle was running low I have not gone back since and very unlikely to as heard staff are not treated very well

My last visit was a disaster They ran out of fries  it can happen but for a restaurant which specialises in belgian food  Anyway They offered us an alternative to fries bread Mussels and bread It gets better when after exchanging a couple of emails with their director and manager I realised that bread comes for free with any meal We asked to get croquettes instead of fries but it wasn t an option and the best offer they had was mashed potatoes instead of fries Still not ideal with mussels but it goes with flemish carbonades I just didn t know that I would get 3 carbonades I m not even joking I searched on the internet for pictures of that dish and surprisingly 3 pieces of meat doesn t seem to be the norm If only the food wasn t the only issue waitress telling us that only 3 beers are available from the menu when manager tells me in his email that it actually was 3 beers missing from the menu no one telling us that the kitchen was closing so when asking to order something else it was too late and a manager who replies to my email and forgot to place a sorry somewhere in it but don t forget to tell me that he s got 20 years of experience so his restaurant must be perfect and I must be a liar  From now on it will be Belgo Central It s always packed but there s a good reason why

as a local to Bakewell I am disgusted how poor the quality of the take out food is generally but just ordered large cod & chips wed evening around 6 30 the chips & not many of them for a so called and charged for portion on a 6in plastic tray with a very soggy greasy bit of batter that contained a pathetic excuse of a portion of fish  you can tell they cater for tourists because if they had to rely on repeat business they would be closed in a week Next time I will drive to Darley Dale as the chip shop there is excellent

Visited on Saturday of the August bank holiday We only really went in as everywhere was busy and the kids were hungry after travelling  23 for two Nutella crepes two coffees and a piece of carrot cake  a tad expensive even for Cambridge but we did know the prices before ordering When the food arrived one set was overcooked and one under The crepes were rock solid and couldn t be cut by me let alone the kids Whereas the carrot cake whilst a big piece was still raw in the middle Very disappointing After wandering around later for an hour or so we came across much better and more reasonably priced places A little local knowledge goes a long way Indeed on the Sunday we got three crepes from the Cambridge crepe van near the market for only slightly more than one from Benet s and much tastier

I visited with initially high hopes that we would find some decent quality British gastro type food The decor of the place is really cool and sophisticated however its a shame that the food and service do not match Me and my partner ordered steak burgers which were lukewarm accompanied by cold chips The bacon on both burgers was so fatty and poor quality that it was inedible The burger itself tasted okay if you like your beef cold but ultimately I have had far far nicer burgers for less money elsewhere There is much made of the highly vaunted hub-slaw on the menu however I couldn t see why as it didn t really taste of anything to me I have had nicer tasting coleslaw from M & S The chips are also badged as proper chips however they were tasteless and bland  The service also left a lot to be desired The waitress was disinterested and did not ask if our meals were okay or if we wanted anything else including drinks  The table was also dirty and my sleeve kept sticking to it - nice  Overall I might have overlooked some of these things if the prices were cheaper but at 10 each for a burger and chips I was expecting something really tasty and I was left bitterly disappointed

took my mother there is no provision for disabled people to go to the toilet the food was a complete let down hardly any meat such a shame as I am new to Frodsham and will not be going there ever again the service is friendly enough if you complain they say its a new chef what a laugh who do you think you are kidding this was the same lame excuse last time i went thought it may of improved
We made a planned visit to this eatery  Boy did we wait for our food Service was poor food was average Will we come again No

I had corn fritters they were disgusting Very garlicky and I think I found a chick pea in one The avocado was tainted black obviously not fresh I had to wait 35 mins for one of the worst breakfast experiences of my life Others had black dry bacon eggs that were charred underneath and raw on top I was embarrassed to bring my friends here and will certainly not come again

Ridiculously overpriced food  3 95 for water  14 95 for a crap burger served in a dirty cellar by indifferent waiters  The seven-year-olds enjoyed the animatronic elephants but they weren t paying the bill Buy some nice food and eat it in a park - this place is just a dreadful tourist trap

Starters very basic main meal steak again bland with one king prawn and a few mussels Glass of wine was very weak n below serving line The restaurant itself had a dirty unclean smell the tables were too close together which meant we were sitting on top of others Thankfully we visited the toilet after our meal and they were disgusting no toilet roll at 1 30pm toilets had not been cleaned and the soap dispenser seemed like it had been filled with water We are now at home and my husband is complaining of stomach cramps
sunday roast 25 05 2014 terrible burnt Yorkshire hard roast potatoes terrible quishe lost on plate small portion enough for a rabbit lol overpriced beware
Go every week as kids love it and its there treat Always miss something or have to take something back as cold or in one case half eaten
WOWWWW how rude is the staff in here  specially the cloakroom lady never ever 15 GBP for entrance is definitely not worth it

I tottaly regret purchasing a group on voucher for this poor establishment I should of guessed cos its on group on I don t think I ll ever buy anything from group on again I can t believe the poor quality food you serve because I ve got a group on voucher or is that to normal customers too The waiter was kind of confused when our order I asked him twice about rice & naan do we get one of each he said yes Then we was charged a total Rip Off AVOID AVOID THIS RESTAURANT

Our usual Indian Restaurant in Teddington has recently closed down which has left us a little at a loss when it comes to going out for curry Everybody had been recommending Moidul s to us since we moved here but somehow we had never ended up there Bereft of our old tandoori we decided to give them a try on the assurances of our acquaintances and from the award notices outside  Best Indian Restaurant in South-West London 2012   Unfortunately what we experienced was a rather bitter let down  When we arrived we were seated quickly It was a Sunday and they were fairly busy so we ordered drinks while we perused the menu - the Mango Lassi was off so I instead went for a pineapple juice We opted for their banquet option chose our food and waited to be served After about fifteen minutes the waiter came and took our meal - he wasn t especially friendly bordering on surly but we eagerly anticipated our food as we saw the diners around us being served  After about forty minutes of craning my neck to look for our starter it finally arrived - I had a chicken lollipop which was genuinely delicious with a flavorful tamarind sauce while my wife had samosa We were now full of anticipation of the main course Anticipation started to turn to impatience though as we waited  and we waited  and we waited The food eventually turned up lukewarm except for strangely the rice which was hotter than the sun I had a tasty Lamb Pathia Balti but from the temperature it had spent a good chunk of the time we d waited sat on the side My wife had ordered a Bhuna Balti - when the waiter put them down he told us they were both Pathia Baltis When I mentioned that we had ordered different food he replied that one was the Bhuna Balti and one the Pathia I tasted both and they were identical  Hmm   Once we d finished we were still reasonably happy and eager for a coffee but again we were left waiting for about half an hour My wife had also ordered a glass of water which never arrived so she finally went off to the bar to order one When the waiter bought it she mentioned that the service had been pretty slow and got a curt reply that it was Bank Holiday and they were short staffed - while we were being told this another waiter was at the other end of the restaurant flirting with some students having a birthday party obviously a very time-heavy job The rest of the staff seemed to mostly be concerned with polishing glasses and having protracted meetings with each other We finally managed to find out what dessert was on offer - it was coffee or kulfi Which was pretty much barked at us  The coffee did come quickly and thankfully our plates were cleared having stared at them for longer than I d care to remember but was awful and my spoon had what appeared to be curry paste stuck to the back By the time we d waited another quarter of an hour for the bill We only got that because my wife ordered it from the bar we gave up all hope of having a swift drink in the pub afterwards For some bizarre reason the waiter also had to ask what we d drunk and whether we d had poppadoms For the first time in my life I d been to a tandoori restaurant that didn t offer me poppadoms  We should have told him tap water  Another trip to the bar and she d paid and we escaped this shower Needless to say she didn t tip  To begin with they d just been slow but by the time we left they d descended into surliness and snide grins If Fawlty Towers had been set in an Indian Restaurant it would probably resemble this Suffice it to say we won t be going back and I would recommend avoiding this over-priced over-hyped place when there are far better restaurants in the area

My Wife and I decided to have a Sunday evening meal in the pub as we hadn t been out for a while and chose this one as we had good experiences in the past We were brought our drinks promptly and our order taken in good time   The this is when it went down hill We eventually received our meal an hour later we mentioned how long it had been to our server who turned out to be the manager and received a we re really busy with no apology In actual fact the pub was not that busy they just had a large party table Our glasses were empty and were not asked if wanted a refill so We tucked into our meals a little disgruntled a few moments later a waitress brought over a plate of onion rings and told us that they had some spare and they would offer this as an apology this was amazing as we had actually ordered a side of onion rings and had not received them anyway So we were paying for this apology I must say my burger was o  k but there s not much to get right or wrong with a burger however my wifes pie has got to be the worst pie in the history of pies The potatoes veg and meat were packed into the pie which we were informed of when placing the order  however there was barely any meat and absolutely no gravy sauce or moisture in there The pie had been cooked dry No one came to check our meals were ok until they collected our plates at which point we voiced our opinion The waitress was very apologetic and spoke to the manager who gave us a discount however the slow service poor food and the fact we paid for the apology onion rings which we had ordered anyway just means we will not be returning

We ate at this restaurant on the 22 03 14 having read the good reviews on this website Despite being a Saturday night the restaurant was only half full so the staff waiting on the tables were not particularly busy There were 4 members in our party After waiting 20 minutes we had still not been asked what we would like to drink and eventually had to ask the waiter to take our drinks order Alter another 15 minutes we were eventually asked what we would like to order  The food finally came after being in the restaurant for 1 ® hours we only had poppadum s in between The staff were quite happy to take our drinks orders whilst making us wait an extortionate amount of time to bring our main out This meant that we ended up spending much more money on expensively priced drinks whilst we waited for our food  Once we eventually received our bill the waiter was rude and discourteous and we were not asked at any time if we were happy with our meal Whilst I would agree that the food in this restaurant is good our whole restaurant experience was ruined by poor customer service and lack of attentiveness from the restaurant staff

After being a loyal non complaining customer for a number of months disappointed to say its gone down good and proper over the last few months and today was the last straw Dirty fat supplied our chips with a coating of black bits which my chip loving children refused to eat Gravy is lumpy and pretty discusting and as for batter it s like eating pudding mix  On quietly returning the items of food confronted by very abrupt owner fryer and his less than polite wife who after a heated debate refunded my money and told me not to come back  Maybe they have had a marital tiff but the quality of food now coupled with appalling customer service leaves me no choice but to add to it s already rubbish reviews  And at the prices they charge it s not what you expect     However sealane fisheries 2  the smaller shop at the other end of the resort is lovely  foods lovely and staff very friendly and welcoming only downside is lack of parking but worth the walk

was told to wait at bar for 20mins which turned in to nearly an hour and then just about to be seated and was informed that they hard run out of chicken and the ribs was another 15mins wait  so we walked out surly they could see we was waiting and new that they were running out and could have asked us if we was expecting chicken and given us an opportunity to go some where else very poor management in my opinion

DOG awful from start to finish rude staff from the moment we walked in chicken was rubbery like and just awful mango chutney was something i have never experienced before feel sorry for people who regular visit here as there are almost certain to be a lot better elsewhere

Went in for a sunday lunch The sunday lunch was advertised at 9 unfortunately I ordered one It should have been priced 50p The food was terrible Tasteless gravy like brown tar mac Limp over cooked vegetables Chicken dry salty and depressing Imagine a school dinner then imagine something far worse and you ll have a mental picture of the calibre of the meal At 9 a pop they are almost mocking the customers Avoid at all costs Terrible Staff were friendly enough though

Having been here three times now please DO NOT GO Deciding to give it the benefit of the doubt foolishly again I decided to treat my wife on bank holiday Monday lunch Firstly the Lady on reception is as welcoming as an East German border guard  On a bad day Was seated and asked for a Campari and Soda The waiter said they did not have this assured him they would at the bar so off he went came back 10 mins later and said the batman had never heard of it so offered me the drinks list and guess what There it was lurking in the drinks list the ultra rare and exclusive Campari Ordered starters of cured ham and melon and beet root and goats cheese salad The Ham was wet and tepid with what looked like chunks of watermelon on the side disgusting The beet root salad was basically a large plate of beat root with about 1oz of goats cheese sprinkled on top both starters were topped with watercress that my rabbit would have refused should have been thrown away At this point decided enough was enough cancelled the mains and quickly departed Take my advise don t go If in Birmingham then go to Adams this is quality fine dining not overpriced pretentious garbage Lastly as a real bonus whilst in the restaurant there are local chavs in the bar with kids running about drinking Lucozade from the bottle No thanks never again

I agree the most expensive Soda and lime anywhere at 2 60 for the same drink at Lion in Edgmond 60p Stiperstones Inn 1 00 other places I have been a charge of up to 1 50 is made and may be considered fair The attitude was poor when queried it and the comment it costs lot to provide is rubbish but if you prefer you can Squash and water for 1 00
Butter and salid dressing were rancid Lamb chops tasted horrible This was probably why it was the special of the day for 9 99 pounds

I ordered steak with chips absolute disaster meat was smelly tasted horrible i thought i would be sick it smelled like toilet  Accompanied with soggy nearly white chips salad on a side horrible basically my plate looked and smelled like a piece of crap This place for food is NO NO NO

Me and my girlfriend ordered a takeaway here and the food was quite frankly rubbish and very expensive at that If you really want a proper curry go to Cleobury Mortimer You just have to see their responses to negative feedback on here to see how they treat their customers Haven t you heard the phrase the customer is always right

I am unsure why my first review has been removed  there was nothing offensive I am a genuine honest person who had the misfortune of being a customer at this establishment The owner chef is trying to make out that there is a hate campaign going on I can assure you I am nothing to do with any of the other people who have written reviews This is a public free-speaking forum to allow customers to voice their opinions  My opinion based on the one visit that I made in September 2013 is that Misty Waters is dirty too hot and the food is not worthy of the price that it charges Drinks were served incorrect and then spilled the steak that I ordered was not served as requested The table cloths that others have mentioned were stained and had food on them the vinegar bottles had fat inside of them and there were flies everywhere We had a baby with us and were appalled at the state of the place  These are not lies as I was accused of last time that I wrote a review and I am astounded that this man was allowed to write such a response back to me I only wish that I had taken photographs to prove what I have written is the truth

Just a very average pub Had a real old man pub feel to it unfortunately not in a good way  I think the new management must ve ruined it The first time I went the food was poor - my sandwich being dry enough to look like it was toasted Having given the place the benefit of the doubt it didn t redeem itself second time around The only reason it got one star was because they allow bikes to be stored inside while you have a pint The landlord is reasonable like that

Only the second restaurant in 25 years of eating out that I ve walked out of without being served Went in about 6pm after a family day out Busy with drinkers outside but restaurant was quiet Friendly welcome and seated straight away After that it all went very wrong Waiters were too busy chatting and laughing with each other to come over That is until we got up to leave

I have eaten twice at Calzone pizza place now and the first time I said I d never come back but my family decided to give it one more try  To be honest it wasn t a very good idea The best part about the evening was the service but as far as the pizza goes  TERRIBLE  I am Italian myself and this gives pizza a bad name Pizza dough is all pre frozen you would get better out of tesco for less than half the price What kills me the most is that there are so many bad reviews about the pizza and they have done absolutely nothing about it Seriously it costs pennies to make fresh dough especially when your charging that amount for each pizza   If they started using fresh dough and marketed it as a new change I think they will do very well from a business predictive but until that day comes I will not eat there or advise friends and family

Have heard a lot about bentleys over the years and decided to give it a try for a special occasion Well where do I start First impressions wert good Small children running around the dance floor all evening was an eye opener  But thought not to worry as we came for the food My god what allful food First the bread rolls were stale The state was OK although the prawns had obviously come straight of the freezer as they were ice cold and tasteless No staff came to offer a drink I had to call a waitress over as we were about to start our main meal ordered a bottle of red Merlot that to be honest was horrible a 5 bottle of blossom hill or echo falls would have been better No water offered again had to call a waitress over to ask for a jug of water No ice or lemon with it The mains were again obviously pre cooked my wife had the duck she couldn t eat any it was like a month old bit of fat and gristle My rib eye was not much better the veg was tasteless and cold Sweet was ok We never complained only when the waitress took our plates did she ask if it was ok as my wife left all of hers To their credit when we received our bill the cost of one meal was removed from the bill which was a pleasant surprise But in general food was very poor and was not cooked fresh it was some old meet that was pre packed Hence to say would not return

Staff are ok but slow at clearing tables and asking for drinks Went on recomendation the whole experience very average and looking at the general cleanliness of the establishment I would be worried Personally I don t think it s good value at all unless you like eating dry average food in large quantities Spend your money else where unless you are very easily pleased

Four of us went for a lunch meal all had different items off the menu and the food in each case was awful Luke warm over cooked and just plain terrible one of the worst meals I have had Should have complained but as with friends who we hadn t seen for ages didn t want to spoil the meeting so kept quiet Go for a drink but eat elsewhere

What can I say about this FAST FOOD Establishment  calling it an ITALIAN restaurant would be an insult to the more exquisite restaurants that deserve the title  I initially went to this place to have a few drinks with my friends one of which decided that this place would provide good food and atmosphere HA   We were told by the waiter manager that there was no free tables in this what seemed deserted place when we finally got our food order placed on the table  I should have realised then that my starter seemed like it was bought out of ICELAND then to to make matters worse my main course had MEAT in it when I CLEARLY chose a VEGETARIAN dish   My meal was corrected after I raised a complaint to the waiter  manager MANUEL fawlty towers who just shrugged his shoulders not a word of apology and went about his business and then waiting 30mins for our bill that was only because we grew impatient of waiting any longer and requested it again My advise to anyone who reads this GO EAT ELSEWERE  save your money
Walked in at around 6 and stood at the bar for 10 mins before leaving nobody else at the bar lots of staff on all busy no eye contact with us they just completely ignored us Won t be back

Awful awful awful this  restaurant  and I use the word loosely has to be the worst I have eaten at in my entire life We visited there on 10th Jan  14 as part of a party of 24 people for a 21st birthday celebration We arrived at 6 30p m and were seated immediately in the rear of the property in front of the kitchen which we had a clear view of The first thing that struck me as odd was the fact that there was little or no movement going on in what one would expect to be a busy kitchen on a Saturday night in north London We were soon to find out the reason for the lack of activity After the initial round of drinks we ordered our meals The starters eventually arrived after a considerable delay At least 3 people at my table including my wife immediately complained about the uncooked food they were served The owner who was standing right beside our table supervising the kitchen had the plates returned to the kitchen to be re-heated Shortly after this I had to leave the place to go and move my car as the parking in that area is atrocious I drove around trying to find a space without success for at least 20 minutes As I was parking I received a call from my wife telling me not to bother parking because we have to leave as the restaurant needed our tables for an 80th birthday party they had booked I couldn t believe my ears as I had not even seen my main course yet never mind eaten it I was hopping mad I returned to the restaurant to find that my wife had already paid our portion of the bill and my main meal was sitting on the side in the kitchen waiting for me to eat elsewhere in the restaurant but as the place was full I don t know where i would have been able to eat it I told the owner to box it up as a takeaway Whilst waiting for it everyone else around me who had eaten their main meals were complaining about the tasteless food they had been given We had ordered a 3 course meal and were only given enough time to have the starter I would strongly advise anyone considering visiting this establishment not to do so my major concern is safety and where we were seated there is no fire exit If a fire started in that kitchen anyone seated back there would have little or no chance of getting out i can t understand how they are in business Not that there would be much chance of a fire starting in that kitchen as all they do is warm things up in a microwave They have the cheek to impose a 12 5 service charge which I would not have paid if I was present when the bill was paid All in all a thoroughly awful experience Don t go there

Drive on home and collect a meal from your favourite take away  At least then you will not be told at 7 45pm on a Sunday that the kitchen is closing in 15 mins despite them advertising the fact that they serve food until 8 30pm  Steak orders were mixed up so sirloin and rump were cooked ar*e roads about pie sent back to be reheated meat was already tough and dry roast potatoes were indeed deep fried as another reviewer has commented Whole place was cold and a huge jobbie floating in the loo Waste of money and spoilt an otherwise lovely day out

I recently popped into the Flying Horse for a pint with a mate of mine My draught beer was off however when explaining this to the manageress i was told that it was impossible that there was a problem with the beer Rather than attempt to resolve the problem in any way she just repeated how it was impossible I returned the beer and purchased another beer Very small problem which could of so easily been resolved by an approachable and considerate manager We will not be returning for a pint or a meal in the future
Do not use the fruit machines   You will lose and the staff watch them and empty them after their shift  Also they close when they feel like it  Avoid
Please do not eat there I went last week absolutely shocking service cold food and had to wait for a beer necer again

we are very fond of Indian curry  Last Saturday we had a take away from cinnamon ferndown we didn`t get real test All the food we dropped in bin we have decided we will never order here again Very bad food

Although I don t frequent this bar on a weekly basis it is generally very good - however the member of staff serving me today think she may have been junior management by the way she was loving playing with the till keys was dreadful I obviously made the mistake of standing in the invisible part of the bar - you all know it the bit in the middle at the front next to the till With a woman to my right no-one to my left this was going to be quick - but I didn t bank on a parade of other women coming to the bar and getting served before me whilst I was left to dehydrate When eventually she decided to serve me my comment that I mustn t be invisible at all was met with a do you want served or shall I serve someone else - the looks she gave flattened my friends pint of peroni Oh how I wish I could transport her to a bar that knows how to treat those that pay the wages - Yates for instance This place needs to put their staff on a customer service course and teach them how to smile

They describe this place as Authentic Indian Cuisine  well it s not It s just the usual very poor quality thrown together stuff made from the same base sauce For example Rogan Josh is a classic Rajasthani Lamb dish and doesn t have tomotoes in it King Prawn Rogan Josh is as authentic as King Prawn Shepherds Pie A shami kebabi is made from finely minced lamb and dhal brushed with beaten egg here it s simply a seek kebab not a very good one at that in the shape of a burger Dansak is another classic Indian dish made with a combination of dhals it does not have pineapple in it Vindaloo is a garlic vinegary Southern dish which bears no resemerlance to what s served up here Try explaining this to any of the waiters and they haven t a clue what you re talking about Of course I realise that they re not Indians but from Bangladesh so don t describe this poor quality food as Authentic Indian because it s not

The White Hart has been the family comfort blanket restaraunt for years Used to be good service and food I guess they must have new management judging by our Saturday evening experience Shockingly dirty unattentive slow servuce with mediocre food Felt sorry for the trainee who was the only visible serving member of staff Wont be going back Sad

We booked this restaurant for a party of 18 on New Years eve Several members of our party had travelled from Canterbury to be with us for the evening Another member of our party was nine months pregnant therefore we opted for an earlier booking of 7 30pm as can often feel poorly when eating later - so this was the prefect timing However the starters did not arrive until 9 45pm and one had been forgotton totally despite only haalf of the party having starters 9 starters approx  Furthermore the table was not cleared and there was no sight of the main courses arriving for a further 45 minutes until we promoted them to bring some cutlery and plates As you can imagine by this point we were all becoming quite annoyed At no point did any of the staff apologise for the wait but eventually brought some of the food out and greeted us with the phrase Do you want the food or not its getting cold he began putting it on the table and we discovered that it was already cold At which point we all decided that New years eve was runied and we promptly left the restaurant - still yet to recieve any apology or explanation from the staff  I would never return to or recommend this restaurant to anyone - a total disgrace

So 10 people booked for Sunday lunch upstairs at the Marquess of Anglesey to celebrate a birthday - 9 of whom ordered the standard beef or chicken roast the other person going for a home made pie  Do you think maybe the order caused consternation and panic in the kitchen with Chef holding his head in his hands wailing - They want roast On a Sunday How did that get on the menu  We assume something like this must have occurred since it took an hour to serve us actually it was sixty-eight minutes but after the first hour the older members of our party had fallen asleep and the younger ones had lost the will to make old bones  Talking of old bones when the food did finally materialise a couple of optimists hoped it would prove to be well worth the wait WRONG Think school dinners 1950 s style The chicken was Sahara-desert dry the potatoes were just back from collecting their pension and the vegetables resurrected tasteless mush  Service generally was somewhere between tortoise-like and non-existent getting drinks was nearly as challenging as getting food and - having eaten - the wait for the bill was similar to visiting A&E in a busy hospital and hoping to be seen before you die  Of course after about half an hour we should have found someone to tell to stick our order and left Had it been just the two of us we d have done so The problem was being with a larger group where some had travelled from outside London for the special occasion  The only saving grace is that I ll never have to return to this awful place and - thanks to Tripadvisor - I can warn you too

Having been to the other Kulu Kulu on Brewer street on a number of occasions I came here thinking I would find more of the same Wrong  Very little variety of sushi Only salmon sashimi and pretty flavorless at that The conveyor belt was almost empty it was spinning sadly with little to show The miso soup was probably from an instant bag I don t know but it was nothing to remember  The way to the bathroom in the basement was tricky and when I went down I found myself locked in with the lights turned off Well I eventually got out to an uninspiring dinner Maybe it s better to go for a quick lunck when in Covent Garden but save your Japanese dinner nights for somewhere else

Visited on sunday 20 05 2012 Had to ask for correct change at the bar given change from 5 instead of 10 not a great start Decided to give their Sunday roast a try Got to say was the worst meal I have ever had and pricey too 50  for 2 starters 2 mains 1 half of cider and 2 house wines My partner had the smoked salmon salad to start was hard pushed to find any salmon my mussel starter was just ok We had two roast beef mains absolute rubbish the cardboard yorkshires will haunt me for a long time Draw your own conclusions from the reviews mainly terrible with one or two excellent

Saturday 14th June 2014 As soon as I walked into this restaurant I felt as if I was being judged  The starter came extremely quickly and was suprisingly different italian nachos but this was the only thing we enjoyed  The mains were lasagne and bolognese boring I know but both tasted very BLAND For the price of the food and the way they are described on the menu you would expect quite a tasty dish but how wrong I was  The service was also poor from the staff who did not seem bothered other than chatting amongst themselves As there was an England game on most of them basically didn t want to be there and i m guessing the chef who does decent dishes had the night off  We fancied a dessert but in the end decided not to even get one as we were so disappointed to be spending 40 pounds on absolute crap Hopefully this is just a one off as Jamies restaurants seem to have good reviews everywhere but here

Visited some friends in the village this weekend and popped in on Sunday afternoon for a quick drink We drank up quick and left due mainly to a couple of louts singing football songs and swearing had we have known they have sky sports we would nt have gone in the first place  The atmosphere was terrible There are some truly excellent pubs near by The Black Dog and The Compasses to name a couple so really no need to go near this place at all

As a chef i know what in talking about been here 3 times now and there will be no 4th chance the waiting staff are happy to amuse but the chef IS the joke  lumpy wet mash potato soup for sauce and dry old meat ain t what i call good cooking quite surprise how highly people rate this  needs a face lift too

They have okay lobster noodle but are certainly not good at making other Chinese food The dishes we had tasted very salty and the customer service is almost non-existent If you ask the waiters to do something for you which they don t want to do they will just walk away and leave you waiting for a long time Oh by the way if you get along with one of the waitresses she will complain to you about how poorly she is paid

I ve eaten Thai food in a variety of places around the world but only Hanuman Thai has prompted me to warn other people to avoid this place like the plague  Not only did my girlfriend and I have to wait for over an hour before we got shown to our table  which was booked for 8pm several days in advance but the food was truly appalling My beef jungle curry can only be described as washing pot soup with some stuff thrown in Tasteless beyond the extreme chilli flavouring and utterly rancid  The atmosphere upstairs was quite nice but then my girlfriend and I had to negotiate the drunken thugs populating the bar area downstairs to get to the toilet where I vomited up my my meal  Hideous food Reasonable service Won t be back ever

Went to this low quality harvester and it s horrible the service was terrible and the salad bar was cross contaminated and looked like it was prepared by monkeys and the chips had been re - heated and looked like a baby had played with them 1st my food was cold and my wife had more hair in hers it looked like the chicken was wearing a wig when complained she was asked if she wanted free desert not even another main crap never again

we went here for a meal and the service was dreadful our orders came out wrong parts of are meals were missing and my mum s steak was all fat and no meat by the time they did sort out the missing parts of our meals we had already eaten what we had and had to wait 15-20 mins for it to get sorted very unhappy and will not be returning

Rick this is not good enough and you need to shake it up I ve never written on trip adviser before We eat out a lot Booked weeks ahead and looking forward to it Arrived on time at 8 30 on Saturday and shown to the lounge Ordered in 15 mins and champagne ok Shown to table expecting to find the appetisers but was 25 mins before they arrived we both got very irritated and hungry Got apologies and told starter on its way but it arrived 55 mins after sitting down Place had some empty tables Only two choices of fish bass and sole where was the splendid local seafood Bass swimming in butter potatoes waterlogged fried courgettes were soggy awful More apologies Didn t bother with pudding as by then it was 11pm and the staff were moving nearby chairs and out of the restaurant This seems to be a very expensive training establishment making lots of basic mistakes

The service was fine hence the one star  the curry mmm if i d just wanted some sauce then i would have ordered a bowl of gravy there was absolutely no flavour to my Chicken Bhunna as bland as it could be  strangely enough my friend who had a chicken tikka with sauce had exactly the same slop as me Buy a jar of Pathak s instead and make your own

Every year I spend around 9 days in Brighton at a large card playing tournament Last year I discovered this restaurant and went every day sometimes twice Also took many friends and spread the word about it This year I had one excellent meal However the next time I went despite there being plenty of seats they told me that my group of 6 would have to sit in three twos OR would have to wait for an hour and a half in a very much take it or leave it kind of way they could have at least tried to shuffle things around  They don t take reservations  The next day a similiar thing happened not even a pretend sorry we d love to have you but we are full from the front of house So we gave them one more chance at around 4 30 the next day Things looked good since there were only a few customers and plenty of seats but we were told that the kitchen staff needed a break and we would have to wait an hour Not even a sorry The upshot is that we will not ever be going to the best restaurant in Brighton ever again Their sister restaurant is on the seafront so I will try that at some point but if their attitude is the same we will eat elsewhere Have to give you one star since I was turned away 3 times Sorry

When this restaurant first opened we went along to try it having received the wrong order and then a replacement came out with what looked like a pubic hair on it I got up and went to talk to the Manager He then swore at me after that I promised never to go there again  A few years later however my partner recently got a GroupOn voucher and so I thought I would give it another shot however having tried to book even though there are spaces available I was told there were no spaces for GroupOn voucher bookings This is not in the T&C s and so on trying to explain this to the person he hung up on me  It doesn t matter if they have turned around the food quality this restaurant just does not deserve to survive  There are many other more friendly options in Cambridge please choose any other than this one

My fianc€÷ and I visited this restaurant expressly to try their Tuesday Night Steak offer of 2 steaks and a bottle of wine for 30 The waiter took our order promptly which probably was the high point of the evening The wine was good and then the food arrived  the steaks both ordered medium rare were grey and very fatty and accompanied by a brown watery sauce masquerading as a red wine jus and wholly without flavour It bordered on the inedible so thank goodness for the accompanying salad The waitress did ask whether it was good and seemed entirely unconcerned and almost bemused by our lukewarm response We then decided we had had enough and asked for the remainder of our wine to be corked and the bill This took such a while we decided to pay at the bar to speed things up Having heard so much about this place we were seriously disappointed and will certainly not be returning
Waited ages to have my order taken - then nothing arrived Will not visit again Only go here if you have all day to wait and certainly not if you re thirsty on a very hot day

Fantastic if you enjoy waiting 1 hour for cold food and then another 5 minutes for condiments they should be on the table first so your cold food doesnt get any colder  Asked by the waitress if everything was ok  No its all cold was my response  Sorry was hers before she walked off never to be seen again  50 spent altogether Last time I went here for a roast dinner I had to run to the toilet to spit out the beef as it tasted like it had been left out by the the bins for a full summer Never ever ever again will I go to this den of incompetence  and neither will my 1 000 facebook friends  or their friends for that matter In this day and age with the internet the times where you only tell 10 or so people about bad service you d think the managers owners would take that into consideration Twice Ive been here and both times the same result Disgusting

Never never again myself and my family decided to treat my mum for mothers day and take to what i thought was a nice Indian restaurant  something different Well clearly the waiters did not want to be there as there attitude was awful and the food was bland and the naan bread was dry as a bone almost like it was days old The toilets were also dissapointing wee on the floor and it stunk  avoid this place

I tried this as someone said it was nice I should have gone with my gut instinct or at least what I wanted as I didn t enjoy it and I could use the word I never use and say I hated it I had something that looked like water with meat and greens floating so maybe one of their soups     I didn t have more than 6 7 mouthfuls but I wanted to at least show that I had tried it   I was very sick when I got home and for a long time too but it may not be related but I am presuming that my body just didn t agree with it Just my opinion of course

I m not a curry expert but I ve had a few here and there and even a couple in India Tonight not wanting a over hot dish I decided to go for the Butter Chicken Curry After ordering and waiting one full hour  there was a 21st birthday party going on  our meal arrived Simple to say it was a mile away from an authentic  Butter Chicken Curry My disappointment was obvious and the manager asked in a condescending manor if all was OK No it was not  I have been 3 or 4 times to this restaurant and always enjoyed the food but not tonight It will be my last

Our daughter booked a table for five plus a baby in a buggy for 2 00pm Saturday lunchtime On arriving at The Weyside Inn we were told by the Waitress even before we had been shown to our table that on ordering our food there would be at least a fifty minute wait This obviously was not a good start after we had taken the trouble to book On being shown to our table there was not enough room to swing a cat let alone park a baby buggy We questioned the Waitress about the delay in being served food and we were told that because it was a nice sunny day they were busy with outside services We chose not to bother ordering food but moved to the bar area for a drink We found a table just outside the service area which appeared to be in complete chaos and we overheard the Waitress in charge completely lose her control over the attendant Waiting Staff and Chef My daughter went to the bar to order drinks and was confronted by surly bar staff who appeared to be stressed out by food orders from the outside eating area that were not being fulfilled by the kitchen My husband and I live in Chichester and are frequent visitors to The Crown and Anchor Young s pub in Dell Quay who are second to none with regards to service and standard of food I would suggest that the staff from The Weyside give them a visit to see how a good pub and restaraunt should be run Obviously we will not be returning to The Weyside
