Having walked 5 miles to the plough changed our shoes and arrived at 1 50 we were turned away after being told they had had a quiet lunch time and the kitchen was closed So we then drove 10 miles to the Cherry Tree and had an excellent meaL
Staff openly complaining that they are under staffed Not what you want to hear Don t order the lamb steak It s a kin to dog meat Awful experience

After 3 previous disappointing experiences I thought it was worth to give this local restaurant another chance Went on a Friday night after founding an interesting offer on www pizzaloungeandbar co uk PIZZA PIZZA PIZZA ALL PIZZAS ARE HALF PRICE TILL THE END OF THE MONTH EXCLUDING SATURDAY & SUNDAY  As soon as we walked inside the half-full restaurant we were nicely greeted by a waiter who showed us a table When I mentioned the offer he replied that I must have checked their old website our new website - he said - is www pizzalounge-restaurant co uk  Luckily I decided to walk away From my previous experiences I knew that full price their pizzas would have not been good value for money I have now done some research and it turns out that the supposed NEW internet address is not only unattainable unknown to all search engines and registered to someone in Lithuania The only active website for Pizza Lounge is indeed www pizzaloungeandbar co uk very prominent across the homepage - this domain name has been registered in January 2013 by someone  in Rotherhite

I placed a telephone order on Monday evening around 7 45pm I had to speak to 2 very rude gentleman to explain my address and where I was living so that I could get my order delivered there My order turned up after 4 more phone calls at 9 45 yes 9 45pm 2hours after I ordered it needless to say the food was horrible my lamb shish was like eating rubber and my pitta bread was as soggy as a wet sponge Very poor service with very poor food
We had a table booked for dinner but popped in for a lunchtime drink Staff very rude and ignored us for 10 minutes Decided that they didn t deserve our custom for dinner
Wow  This place is heaven on earth  The food the staff and the ambience is pure Italy  Grazie for a fantastico time X francesca and John

This was our first visit to the much acclaimed Ring o Bells in the village of Christleton I am not sorry to say it will be our last The menu is quite limited and so having decided against a starter we thought a nice steak would suffice How wrong can one be my partner was more fortunate or perhaps just lucky she chose an 8oz rump 17 which was ok however the accompanying garnish half a tomato and one of those daft little cup things they use these days to hold a few chips was not good I decided on the 10oz ribeye at 22 the most expensive item on the menu When it arrived again with half a tomato and the same daft cup of chips which incidentally looked as if they had hit the deep fat fryer more than once plus a side of onion rings  3 50  should nt these be part of a steak platter I digress the ribeye was not edible full of gristle and cartilage so I asked for it to be changed but not wanting to risk another ribeye I requested a rump knowing my companion s had at least been ok when the replacement came I had asked for it medium rare it was pretty much well done and dry but also very tough even the steak knife provided could not make much impression I complained again and was offered sweet and coffee which we declined and asked for the bill The waitress who was helpful sent the Chef s apology and the managers apology but he did not deem it worth a visit to our table He had told the waitress to get our name and address and he would send a voucher still no visit from him Our evening was spoilt my partner having finished her meal before my second disaster arrived I don t think we will be using the voucher even if it does arrive

My wife and I went to the derby arms on the 5th of July The service was dreadful we saw food sent back on two tables and two groups walk out After 50 minutes waiting for a starter we did the same The staff seemed to be in meltdown on the day of our visit We often dine at the Punchbowl at churchtown and have given 5 stars

We have had our dose of ripoff for 2012 from steins fish restaurant Falmouth 2 portions of cod and chips don t think we ordered childrens portions this was disgusting I m sure the chips were chill chips not fresh potatoes and the price well don t start me off Tartare sauce was nice

Often working late in Leeds and sometimes grab a quick bite to eat before I head home I watched this place get taken over done up and was really looking forward to some nice ribs Wrong  Arrived and ordered half ribs sides of coleslaw and chips The slaw was from kfc really shredded and not great in taste Why can you make it fresh thick and crunch  What a shame The chips were ok The ribs themselves were ok but the sauce was so heavy in salt I only managed 3 in total I left most of the slaw and half the chips yet the unattentive staff who were all munching when I arrived didn t ask if my food was ok once Nice one guys  I see why you make customers pay upfront and why the place was empty  I m so disappointed for me and for you I love ribs   I thought it would be a nice eating experience YUK Prefer macdonalds to you place  I won t be back nor will I recommend If you don t sort out the rib sauce service and other aforementioned stuff you won t last long in the city centre

This place is popular because of the setting but the management realy need to gert their act together You can only book on line monthe in advance when they must have cancellations or free tables You call the restaurant phone number no-one ever answers There is an answer phone facility but they never bother to call you back Given the last few reviews too we wont bother trying again How long before it closes

There are many many good things about The Crown at Westleton The setting the wine list and the atmosphere are all first class The menu is imaginative and appealing indeed everything was set for a memorable meal and so it proved for one reason - the food was dreadful  A very ordinary beef starter at 9 50 was eaten in three small mouthfuls I pointed this out to the waitress who very politely smiled confirming it was a very small dish The sea bream was bland The saffron potato terrine cooked in fish stock tasted off On collecting the plates the head waiter asked how the meal was Without giving me a chance to answer he said rather confusingly   superb superb  and walked off We declined the pudding and opted for coffee which never appeared  At 80 for two courses and a bottle of wine I feel The Crown is overrated over-priced and complacent

This review is not about the food or service which were perfectly fine Instead I am writing this review to report a very troubling incident we witnessed at this restaurant My fiance and I were having a nice meal At around 7 30pm a young Middle Eastern-looking couple with a small child came in and were immediately told that the restaurant was full There are several disconcerting facts that lead us to concluded that the couple had been turned away simply because of the colour of their skin 1 Being a Monday night there were approximately eight empty 2 person tables at the time None had reserved signs on them 2 My fiance and I did not have a reservation and were seated in a very nice table next to the window just a few minutes before we are also white  3 Earlier a white family with small children the same age as the Middle Eastern couple s child were seated without a reservation  I would like to give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt but unfortunately I really cannot think of a legitimate reason for turning away the couple They were well dressed and seemed like perfectly nice normal people who were just looking for a place to eat  The women who turned them away was middle-aged and was behind the bar next to the door I got the impression that she was the owner and or manager

Strange encounter - went last week for a coffee and snake at lunch time I went with my better half and our poodle dog I was not expecting to be let in the main restruarant area and happy to sit outside their establishment by the market with our coffe lunch The waiter absolutely refused to serve me as we had a dog He was happy for us to sit on his seats just refused to serve us anything even to take away  His attitube was rude - upset my other half and the poodle Non of us will be going back Their loss as poodle was quite popular with the other customers

I ve ordered from Hoi Shan a lot in the past but the quality of food has declined to being the same old cash and carry slop you get from any old Chinese takeaway Double doses of orange food colouring and MSGs all round We gave them a miss for a while but we re at friends tonight who still order from them Ordered at 8 20 phoned at 9 40 to see where the order was and we were told the driver wasn t even back from a previous delivery and would be coming to us next which would be at least 20 mins as we live outside newton  No apology or offer of any consolation We phoned back to cancel and they had the cheek to sound put out by us instead of apologising for the inconvenience Order cancelled still no apologies Sure Friday nights are busy but getting another cook another driver and another phone line would be helpful then at least you could compete on service if not food quality We won t be using you again there are SO many other options that get it right why should we give you yet another chance
A poor disorganised buffet ghastly meat that all tasted the same and churlish service all in a noisy cramped environment for 19 95 And then then they gave me a loyalty card

Luke warm food cold plates wait ages for the food no customer service from the waitress tiny portions that look nothing like the picture on the menu We had to ask 3 times for the bill we complained to the manageress and she admitted that they had has loads of complaints tonight and gave us 50 off We were at an F&B near Lakeside a couple of weeks ago that was so bluish you had to wait 45 mins for a table but when it came to food and service it was amazing Tonight the restaurant was half empty Pizza Hut next door looked really good will go there next time

Used to eat regularly at this pub Still like the feel and general atmosphere but hey we went Feb 2014 and will not be going back in a hurry Had to pay 4 00 each for a mild shandy   queried the price and retort was  thats what the till says   Way too much in my opinion Ordered 2 rump steaks Arrived and the accompanying chips were more like left over scalpings than proper chips half a small tomato and one small mushroom Steak arrived concealed by rocket should have been watercress obviously carefully arranged on top of it Soon became obvious steak burnt and charred outside and red inside very tough It was spoilt by poor cooking No-one comes to check if all is ok with your meal now like they used to Old chap who used to oversee the place was a quiet pro and kept the staff and the catering spot on   I guess he may have gone now and BOY does it show Seems full of young inexperience staff and no-one taking the lead Greene King get a grip and take a look at the place   this is the second time it has been poor we gave you the benefit of the doubt   We will not be back again due to prices and poor food   Great pity

Was charged an extortionate 3 00 for entry when we had rung to ask if they were showing it this was not mentioned  I then Queued for 3 4 an hour at the bar staffed by 4 bar staff for roughly 250 paying punters without getting a drink  I then when I asked for my money back when I left without watching the match was accosted by a the doorman and told to come back at closing time to get a refund  Needless to say it just sums up an ethos of grabbing your money and then not providing any kind of service what so ever Will not ever be returning suggest you give it a wide berth too

After a five mile walk in the Puddletown Forest we decided to finish with tea and cake at Under the Greenwood Tree  On entering at 3 47pm the shutters were down but the cakes were still on show with a staff member cutting a slice for a customer to take away Realising that drinks probably were not an option when asked I requested two slices of cake to take away The reply was that they could only sell packaged cakes as they were technically closed Gobsmacked

To say I was very disappointed is an understatement having sampled this particular establishment in person I must say that it does not travel very well at all   I received notification via a well known takeaway App that my food would be with me at 8 which was already a while to wait but anyway  8 came and went and when I checked the App they had pushed the delivery time  Annoying but anyway the Pizza arrived late for even the extended time - No apologies from delivery driver  The pizza was freezing to the point where the cheese had solidified and there was a layer of grease on the Pizza - Lovely  The fresh basil had wilted into the smallest green dots which were almost unrecognizable - I m still not convinced it was basil Apart from that it was lovely  The dough balls can only be described as 4 5 large grapes which were freezing cold and resting on a bed of wilted warm salad leaves  Had they put the basil in the wrong box I would not recommend a delivery from these guys unless you like cold greasy cheese and warm wilted salad bundle this together with the price and you have yourself a very expensive warm cheese salad

Have enjoyed several meals at Ashiana but this evening had the worst ever Took over half an hour to deliver poppadoms in a half empty restaurant  starter when that eventually arrived was OK but nothing special The mains was inedible - I like spicy food but the chef clearly thought that spice was more important than flavour This was by a long way the worst Indian meal I have ever had and I certainly won t be back and would not recommend Ashiana to anyone

Three of us ordered food and drinks at the Waterway tonight the local pub near where I live We sat down at a table a waiter took our order and returned after 10 minutes with it While we were enjoying the drinks and food a waitress came to our table and ordered us to move telling us that the table was reserved If the table was reserved why did the other waiter serve us we asked and she repeated rudely we should move because the table was reserved There were no free tables so where should we move to we asked To this the waitress suggested that we stand with our drinks and food When we protested and we were polite the manager ordered us out When we asked what should we do with our unfinished drinks and food he replied he did not give a damn what we did if we did not vacate the table straight away he would get security to throw us out and he got a burly security guy to show that he meant it And when we asked if he was going to refund the money for our unfinished drinks and food he said of course not and shouted that if we did not want to stand hold our food plates and drink glasses in our hands and finish our drinks and food we should get out At this point the security guard started pushing us out A friend of ours an American of Indian origin who works with NASA whom we had invited asked the manager if his rude attitude was related to racial prejudice because all the time the manager was threatening us he was particularly starring down my American Indian friend Feeling extremely humiliated by the managers rude attitude we walked out Though this is the closest pub to where I live I for one will never return If my American Indian friend is not welcome and is treated rudely and we are all treated rudely this is not the pub for me to come to and invite friends and this is not the service and attitude we expect in the Britain of today

I felt compelled to write a review following the absolutely appalling customer service my girlfriend and I experienced  We had just been to see Aladdin in the theatre directly opposite and coincidently a friend of ours was having his 30th birthday drinks in Bar Soho having pre-booked a table It was our intention to join the group for a few drinks following the show  We arrived just after 10 pm where we spotted one of our friends having a smoke outside and we had a short chat Our friend whose birthday it was also came out and after welcoming us said for us to give our name to the door staff and we would be let in  In front of us a member of the door staff was having a dispute with a male who was of no connection to us I assumed he was a supervisor as he was wearing all black unlike the other staff who also had high-vis I overheard him disallowing the individual entry even though the other member of staff tried to explain to him that it wasn t the individual who they had asked to leave earlier  Anyway our friend led us through and my girlfriend went in first and received a stamp on her arm As I went to follow the door supervisor asked if I had a stamp I said I didn t but I was on the guest list and gave my friend s name Immediately flustered and visibly frustrated which I think came from having dealt with the other male he said I would have to join the back of the queue and pay for entry I gestured towards my girlfriend and he asked if she had a stamp to which she replied that she did because the other member of staff had just given it to her The supervisor said he shouldn t have done this He refused to listen to the fact that my friend had a booking or the pleas of my other friends saying they did not have to pay  Calm and collective I said that it was fine not to worry about it and that we d take our custom elsewhere My girlfriend went to leave and he tried to say that I was being abusive Another friend tried to reason with him by which time I couldn t be bothered to get into a debate He then tried to say that I wasn t being refused entry but I just had to queue and pay It was almost like he realised he may have made a mistake but didn t want to admit it Either way I was more than happy to leave by this point as was my girlfriend  It was extremely disappointing that we missed out on joining our friends but in hindsight I find it humorous that I was told I was abusive It s seems to me that the individual was way out of his depth and couldn t handle the pressure of a busy Saturday evening I would love to witness how he deals with someone who is actually abusive and intoxicated  I m happy we didn t put any of our money into this establishment and we went elsewhere  Avoid at all cost unless you are happy to risk the hit and miss service on entry Judging by other reviews it looks like it will be more than likely a miss
Went to the restaurant for an evening meal and ordered well done stake it arrived not even medium to well but very medium and under cooked for my liking sadly put me of my whole meal

Bear in mind a bowl of pasta is approx 20   The food is terrible The courgette flowers stuffed with mozzarella and deep fried tasted only of old oil and cardboard not even texture an actual cardboard taste The calamari starter seemed to have been deep fried in the same oil and was worse than what you might expect from a half decent pub The pasta was not good not much taste to the goats cheese ravioli and the veal ragout was woeful served with a touch of careless disregard for presentation like it had been spooned out of a Tupperware box from the back of the fridge Fellow diners that had the seafood risotto had 2 prawns and a smattering of skinny cockles Looked underwhelming  23  To finish they serve up some deep fried biscuit strips with icing sugar that taste just like the starter   Using the same recycled oil Service was good wine list was good but cheapest red was 32 so you d hope for smth good  For food choose carefully

Arrived at 4pm looked quiet so knew we would be able to get a table wrong Nobody at the front desk and after seeing half a dozen staff just walk by with no acknowledgement decided to find someone to seat us followed the next staff member who was walking by and asked why no one was on front of house told she was doing something and would be with us in a minute then just walked off   After a few more minutes she arrived back low and behold no tables available so sit and wait we were called to our table after 19 minutes It took us a while to decide what we wanted so our order was taken at 4 25 not served until 5 10   and the food was cold obviously some was ready before the rest and kept on the warmer until all was ready that meant all the veg was cold chips too my salmon was warm but OMG I didnt realise salmon could be that dry and awful None of us were happy with the poor food and poor service certainly wont be going there ever again  Just one more thing you cant reserve a table so you have to take pot luck with availability
Went on a Groupon deal - they even managed to make that feel vastly overpriced

This was a very disappointing meal We often frequent Bar San Juan in Chorlton Manchester and El Rincon central Manchester Ambiente does not begin to approach the food service or authenticity offered by the aforementioned We found it s trying to be something over and above normal authentic Spanish tapas and fails Pan Catalan came as two small pieces of bread with a very sparse covering of chopped tomato plus balsamic vinegar Please when has Pan Catalan ever come with balsamic vinegar Not a salt pot or olive oil condiment in sight Albondigas although very nice in a coconut and lemongrass sauce but hardly Spanish and the smallest portion I have ever had anywhere Champignones were again a small portion and came cold This was pointed out but when they returned the portion was much smaller than the original they has obviously not taken it very well All the tapas we ordered came at the same time this doesn t happen anywhere else they are served as they are cooked and appear continually on the table this is part of the experience The jug of Sangria we had was the weakest ever It was more like coloured lemonade barely a trace of red wine and the price of a pint of Cruzcampo was more expensive than central Manchester over 4 This was plonked down unceremoniously on the table without a word it was promptly returned

So I went in not been in for a while I paid 9 25 for a chicken burger - to take away  The place was reasonably quiet a large group had just left I sat down and waited  And waited  Dozens of burgers were served  I waited  I stood up asked where my food was  It s coming came the response  I waited  More burgers came out of the kitchen  I finally stood up and asked where my burger was At this point nearly half an hour had passed I was told 5 minutes  I told them where to shove it and walked out in disgust They kept the money I kept my dignity  That s the last time I m going in there Or any other GBK for that matter

I was early to visit a show next door and thought I d have a glass of wine before the show I walked in and the bar was quiet a few tables taken just a couple at the bar before me so I waited my turn As the gent before me was paying the bar man was having a little trouble closing the till draw he was slamming and slamming and slamming the thing everyone in the bar was looking wondering what the commotion was a few were standing up to look over the partitions the noise this guy was making was astounding unfortunately I was near enough to hear the expletives being uttered through the noise of the ever slamming till drawer  I couldn t face it and turned and left there was absolutely no need for the outburst at all either damaging the till or the swearing Doubt I will go back again I ll just head for the bar in the City Varieties next door A shame really as the Swan does have a good wine selection but I doubt I ll rush to trouble it

Booked a birthday meal - emailed that two of my party were vegetarian Arrived early - having been advised it was ok - and was told the set Sunday lunch menu was the only one available at that time Only one choice for vegetarians which was not acceptable Said we d wait until the a la carte menu became available - only to be told the vegetarian choices listed would not be available - no choice but to leave

The meal was a treat for a family occasion I had heard great things and so expectation was high All food came on metal serving dishes no plates The dishes were scratched and gave the appearance of being used by many many people before me plates would have been much more appropriate as crockery felt like I was eating out of a dogs bowl I ordered the chicken tikka kebab which was so over spiced it obliterated any other flavour in the dish followed by Lamb Kashmir which at 8 75 contained 4 pieces of lamb which was a yet another sign to me that this place is milking its customers When the bill arrives the largest detail on the slip is Service charge not included I also felt pestered by the service staff who not only interrupted conversation but leaned over me while I was eating and placed their hand next to my drink while slouching over our food to ask if the meal was OK It is hard to get a table which pushes up demand and keeps it relatively busy but this is a misleading indicator as to the quality of the food and the overall dining experience and more a telling sign as to how small and poky the place is Even the cheap lino floor covering was so worn the surface vinyl had disintegrated Will never waste my time and money in this dump again much better heading off to Rusholme for the real deal

Always enjoyed the food under the previous owners but my first visit under the new owners was a MASSIVE letdown Waited 40 minutes to get a drink another 30 until they took my food order and then another 30 minutes until the food came When it did it was really really bland Then had to wait another 30 minutes to pay And the worst thing It wasn t even busy Poor Won t be making a return visit

Took client here for lunch luckily he hasn t held it against us Chips obviously fried in old oil barbecue ribs undercooked and warm salad I left food on my plate very unusual for a nineteen stone ex-prop

A couple sat next to us had been waiting an hour for there light lunch and were told quite abruptly it last being cooked at this point they walked out We continued to wait but then decided after not been served for 15minutes that we would find somewhere else to go The manager approached as we left we a pad to take our food order however as I explained we had not even been offered drinks Very unlikely to return
Really disappointed  salty sweet and sour pork  even the dog turned his nose up   Had purchased previously from there several months ago when it opened  Not quite the same quality of food anymore

I visited nyc bar and grill with my friends expecting a reasonably nice meal and an enjoyable experience It is safe to say that I left more than disappointed Although I went on a Friday night it was reasonably quiet and there are no excuses what so ever for how poor the whole experience was We ordered the table for half past 7 and had ordered our meal by 8 o clock The starter came to the table for quarter past 8 which we were ok with For the price which I paid for the nachos they were really not enough and what there was was about edible I wouldn t go any further than that The staff were reasonably quick to take the plates off of the table Yet it was the disastrous wait for the main course which was abysmal We had finished our starters by half past 8 and we didn t see any signs of our mains coming until half past 9 when slowly but surely 8 out of the 10 meals turned up So by quarter to 10 8 of the meals had turned up and the staff recognised that 2 meals hadn t turned up One member of staff had the decency to tell us that they had forgot to make two of the meals When we had finished eating them by half past 10 and they were not worth the wait what so ever I had a Hickory BBQ half rack of ribs which came with coleslaw and fries The ribs were average but the fries were barely edible I left the restaurant wanting a dessert but wasn t willing to wait any longer I would certainly not recommend anyone visiting here for no type of occasion

Our group visited early on a Sunday evening before a concert in the festival hall The place wasn t busy at all so we were shocked to be told by our server that about a third of the menu was unavailable Given half the menu was missing we ordered some olives that were so salty they were inedible Some others had the salmon carpaccio Turns out its a load of smoked salmon on a plate with a garnish The mains were also disappointing One order of salmon filet was particularly bad To start the order was delivered incorrectly as cod and so was returned to the kitchen only to be replaced with salmon only moments later As a result it turned out to be raw inside The waitress apologised in fairness but by that point not even a glass of the acidic red wine could numb the pain I was surprised to see Gordon Ramsay quoted in the menu but when you realise the only positive endorsement is of the coffee alarm bells should have rung a lot earlier Lesson learnt We all left a little very underwhelmed Sorry I won t be returning

Visited the excellent cathedral of Ely between Christmas and New Year and decided to try lunch at the Lamb hotel in the heart of the city What a mistake I know that this is the time of year when some service establishments struggle a bit too many customers not enough staff too many late nights  all the usual excuses However this particular visit provided plenty to bleat about One guy behind the bar taking all the food and drink orders So a 10 minute wait there only to find out that half of what we wanted to eat was no longer available well it was nearly 1 30 after all Not to worry though it s the season of goodwill after all Back to the scruffy table to join the rest of the party and then the waiting began After half an hour it was time to see if the simple bar snacks we had ordered were out of the microwave yet Found what I think was the poor lamb who was in charge out front and eventually informed we hadn t specified white or brown for one of the sandwiches This was a surprise as we had ordered wraps and these came as standard pale white Finally we were served the now cool and not very appetising snacks Overall not a great experience and if it was my little lamb I think we d be visiting the abattoir soon I ll award 1 star though for location and it s a good-looking building pity it doesn t live up to appearances

Christmas lunches at Chartwell Booking essential the NT members newsletter advises Been trying unsuccessfully for three days to book via phone email and Twitter Vmails and emails unanswered  Should have learnt from the poor dining experience at Petworth earlier this year  Not really the way to impress members but do they care Given up

I had a very awful service at the Novikov recently I have been a customer for about four years now I love this place I often come to the Asian restaurant and the bar and also bring my Clients along ˜ The staff at the restaurant are amazing The Security at the door are normally familiar and friendly  On my last visit on Thursday the 23of October at approximately between 11 30-12 30pm I was stopped by the unfamiliar grumpy Security at the entrance He told me that the Lounge bar is not open for the general public and that there is a private function I told him that I am a regular customer He didn t want to know I had a three clients with me as well I was a bit embarrassed a front of them I told my Clients about Novikov and highly recommend this venue I was about to leave when Security changed his mind He told me that he will let us in if we spent 100 each and if we look after him I obviously understood what he meant by that Anyway it was to much effort to go elsewhere I agreed to his terms I shake his hand with money in it at the entrance And he let us in I was very angry This is never happened to me before I had to maintain calm for the sake of my clients I was fuming I will never go to the Novikov again Its disgrace to charge your regular customers a fees to get in inside to have a few drinks ˜ I have also notice that there is where no private function either The Security not only charge me to get in but he is also lied to me about the private function ˜ This is very appalling behavior I will most definitely not come back and bring my clients The standards in Novikov is drop down dramatically I did also write a complaint through the restaurant website I haven t even had an acknowledgment email back  Please avoid the Novikov       Not worth the money

Me and my partner decide to go to the Plug & Feathers for a nice meal but it did not plan out that way As we arrived we ordered drinks from the bar and then proceeded to find our selves a seat after sitting down and being ready to order we sat there for a further 20 minutes before a very rude and abrupt ginger waitress with glasses finally decided to come over and take our order after staring at us for the past 5 minutes she then took our order in a manor which i can say i have never been spoke to in my life in a restaurant it seems that this particular waitress has never heard of customer service as when she was taking our order we asked her what burger she would recommend and she replied rudely and very disrespectfully with I m a vegetarian i don t eat burgers  which i then replied Ok but which would you recommend she then replied I just told you I m a vegetarian  i couldn t believe my ears So i just proceeded and ordered any of the ones on choice after spending a further 20 minutes - 30 minutes waiting for our food after we heard the bell ring 4 times and no member of staff bothered to check if anyones orders where ready we proceeded to watch the ginger girl who had served us talk to other customers and staff in the same manor as which she had spoken to us in now I m no expert and i don t work in a restaurant but i am positive that this manor isn t seen as positive and customer friendly after finally getting our meals which were both very dry and luke-warm from sitting under a light for the past 20 minutes or so after we finished our meals we proceeded to go to the bar to pay for our meals when our visit just keeps getting better Once going to the bar we was served by a lady who seemed to be management which also had just about as much customer service as the ginger girl when i was paying for our meals i felt as if i was something that she had found on the bottom of her shoe i can truly say i have never once experienced anything like this and i will not be returning and telling friends and family not to aswell other than the bad customer service skills of members of staff the restaurant has a nice atmosphere and can really achieve but they desperately need to have a strong word with both staff and management

We had the fish and chips The worst I have had in my life Chips just a soggy oily mess The fish looked good but exploded when prodded with my fork to an empty shell of nothing An elderly foreign couple on a table near us had the same God knows what they thought of our English fish n chips However the barmaid was really nice
Absolute crap is the only way to describe the food at Bamboo  Avoid at all costs I m afraid  My friend even said it was the worst meal she has ever had

We had a poor experience of afternoon tea at the Quorn Country Hotel where we were redeeming a Red Letter voucher  on Thursday 6th November In a cold conservatory where rain was dripping through the roof we were served tasteless sandwiches hard scones and then had a job finding a waiter to bring the tea and with stale cakes to top it off  it was not an experience to be repeated Frank and Doreen Armstrong - Leicester Forest East

After having spent a lot of money in store we decided to treat ourselves & have lunch Restaurant  cafe may be more appropriate was probably 2 3rds full but EVERY one of the remaining free tables were uncleared messy & dirty Dont mind paying for lunch but object to clearing cleaning my table before I even sit down Decided to give this place a wide birth & went home to make a sandwich Definitely will not return

I think it can be difficult for restauranteurs if you show their  chefs at work  Handling food literally comes into its own here cross contamination after copious sweaty brow mops without washing or even wiping hands placing food on the plates with hands My meal looked dull on the plate when it arrived dried by sitting at the hot plate for 5 minutes skinny cold dry chips fishy tasting tomato and a dehydrated mushroom on a plate what a harvest  harvester The main dish a steak was not to my liking very rare it almost crawled off the plate 13 pounds plus for the meal The service was good Gordon Ramsey needs a visit here Poor harvest from the Harvester  I did complain to the waiter who said they would pass it on
Cant beleive how poor it was Took an hour for the starter arrive  Had spare ribs  1 spare rib was boiling hot next 1 had ice on it and was cold I will never eat here I like my health

I have just tried to book a table for two days time they say i will need to leave a deposit in order to achieve this quite normal act I have never heard of anything like it i dine out twice per week and have never been asked to do this in the past  i wont be eating there again

Hugely disappointing After making ourselves comfortable and ordering drink and food we were rudely told to move from our table on the pretext that it had to be made up for other guests No apology offered prior to walk of shame to a dark corner in half empty bar Food and wine overpriced and mediocre Our original table was still unoccupied when we left about an hour later Mystery how a place that can make you feel so unwelcome gets accolades as a top bar

Ever since this pub has changed hands it has gone down hill I believe that all the recent reviews say it all We used to love eating here but I would not ever eat here ever again We knew that it had teething problems and thought after a while we would give it another chance We went tonight and found that instead of improving it has become even worst We had to wait 45 mins for our order and when it arrived it was cold not even lukewarm   When I cancelled my order I was told that they had for some reason not recorded the table number and had already sent the order out On other hands they had warmed it up once and we re willing to do it again we are talking about chicken   We were not the only people to return our meals and there were a lot of people unhappy   Please think twice before eating here Nice beer but seriously awful food

took wife mum and dad 29 3 2016 for dinner 5 each gammon dinner chicken casserole scampi let me say these were the worst meals ever to sum it up it was swill gammon was like one thin rasher of bacon evrything was horrible DONT EAT HERE

Wow shocking been going here for years  They ve just done refurbishment We had carvery our little girl had chips sausage  Set meal then they told us the free ice cream had run out for our daughter & we had to pay an extra fee   the place is total rubbish now   never go there again nor will any family members
Really not good tiny portions hairs in the food cirrus were cold Ketchup on the table sticky plastic table clothes Avoid at all costs

Absolutely appauling On 2 occasion s we have now had extremely overcooked chips pork ball golf Balls would have been a better description and the duck was the fattiest i have ever tasted The first time we experienced this we were not too bothered but to have the same again then it is just ridiculous  14 this cost us and i wouldn t of payed 14p for it Unfortunately we live out of town and making another trip to take it back was not worth it as we were so put off We just wont use them again

microwaved paellasmicrowaved frozen tortilla frozen croquetas and many more worse comments i will not say I am half spanish half british and have lived in spain and eat spanish food and that is NOT spanish food The hygiene was unacceptable and very horrible But fantastic waiters shame the cooks are apauling Do not go my recomendation and if you are spanish and want a laugh feel free to go

The food was horofic and tasteless Got stomachache afterwards  Food was not the value of the price and also it wasn t fresh The plate was full of onions just to make it look that it s full  You could smell the chicken and biryani was horribly tasteless without any salt or any other spices  Waste of money had to go somewhere else afterwards to change the taste and to eat properly

We had been recommended to visit Annie s many times however what a disappointment First impressions were very good for a Friday afternoon and the service was excellent until the burgers arrived  We all commented on how dry the burger was but with various topping s they are disguised clearly a policy of the chefs to hide the fact you may be eating a burger that has been overlooked Whilst eating a member of staff asked if everything was acceptable to which we replied yes The reason being on too many occasions when eating in a restaurant with friends if someone s food is not what they were expecting you return the food and then find yourself eating alone when your meal is returned  It was for this reason alone on this occasion we preferred to accept what had been served  However when the food was cleared we did mention to the server that the burgers were very dry to which she relied they were par cooked before service and then reheated with various topping s On learning this we asked yo speak to the manager who provided us with Annie s cooking practices It would appear they are par or part cooked prior to service and then the various topping s are placed on top and once again grilled to perfection  His words not mine  Reflecting back on his explanation surely experienced chefs are able to freshly prepare and cook a burger after all that is the only product the restaurant sell Perhaps not at Annie s  We were disappointed perhaps during a busy service the burgers are cooked fresh to order but clearly not during our visit
This place was such a good restaurant and now has been badly damaged Every time we go they refuse to take credit cards only cash this has now put us off and we will never return again
I ordered the Special meal with Fried Rice It was very bland tasteless and unseasoned I won t be visiting again

We were in Brigg on a short business trip and thought we d visit China Royal for a nice Chinese What were wasn t expecting was to encounter one of the rudest and unhelpful members of staff I have ever encountered Upon arrival we were quickly sat at a bench seat in reception with a menu shoved in our hands the restaurant was empty and it felt a little strange looking at a menu without being seated at a table To cut a long story short we ended up leaving the restaurant and settling our drink bill without ordering any food due to the waiter having quite possibly the worst interpersonal skills I have ever encountered My advice would be to stay well clear of the China Royal Luckily we found a fantastic restaurant just around the corner so it worked out great in the end

I run a small business in a different sector than this but I serve the public so it is with regret that I feel I should write this review Small business should try to carve out a niche to differentiate themselves from franchises and big chains Service has to be the key  When our party of four arrived we were greeted politely and directed to a suitable table All other tables had been served except one couple who were placing their lunch order as we were seated Within a minute menus arrived and less than five minutes later our order was taken 4 bowls of soup and a pot of tea Not too difficult then New arrivals came and all were greeted promptly but after 10 minutes or so no food for us Despite numerous requests for the soup it took 45 minutes to arrive No explanation No apology No sense of service  It was easy to see what was going on greet new arrivals and get their orders to hook them in but forget about everything else This is business at its cynical worst I don t blame the serving staff although they showed little understanding of their customers  In this context the quality of the food and value for money are meaningless The meal was ruined before it was placed upon the table

Had take out from here for the first and last time The chips were cremated dry and inedible the chicken balls were chewy and tiny chow mein passable but even the prawn crackers were stale To add insult to injury it wasn t even cheap lesson learnt stay clear

I eat out 3-4 times a week 1 or 2 times with our children who we were with this time My wife and I have both worked as bar staff in pubs and restaurants and as a result are generous tippers and always try to look on the positive as far as service goes  This info is relevant when you read the story of the most bizarre pub experience of our lives  We had had a great day out at Howletts with friends who also had children who were asleep  It was about 5 30 so not main restaurant time and as the pub had a kids menu that it would be fine if we brought children in It is 2014 after all  We had placed a sizeable drinks and food order and were chatting happily when the waitress who I am guessing was the landlord s wife came up and said that people at the bar had complained about the noise the children were making and we were to keep it down  My friend made a flippant comment asking why don t they leave rather than us and the waitress stormed off The landlord came charging back extremely aggressively telling us how he was going to stop cooking if we did not do as we were told  We thought it best just to leave because this was not at all pleasant  My wife said they should not have a kids menu if they weren t happy to have kids in the pub  I commented to the landlord on my way out that the way he spoke to his punters was disgusting literally those words and again he charged around the bar again and squared up to me pushed my shoulder and looked menacing I was carrying a 3 year old at the time  He went on to say that the waitress was in tears over that comment and that we were really horrible people  Clearly something else very odd was happening here as we had entered the Twilight Zone  We left and on our way out the locals at the bar were all shouting get out  Another couple of families left at the same time as us having seen what had happened to us  I wish I had read these reviews before going to the place The landlord s wife is obviously left to run the bar and wait during less busy times and she was obviously not having a great day No wait staff should have broken down in tears over that comment  The landlord should be running an inner city football pub and not attempt a gastropub as he is the pub industry s answer to Basil Fawlty he obviously dislikes the punters he has to work with and neither have an idea about how to deal pleasantly with people  This pub is great if you are a local but outsiders beware of the rabid dog and the locals carrying pitch forks

I ve eaten a lot of Thai food in the past from street vendors in Bangkok to restaurants behind the old Kai Tak airport in Hong Kong a really good Thai restaurant in Guildford Surrey and many others in between I mention this to make the point I know what to expect not to bang my drum  The food we had in TukTuk was horrible We ordered Chicken Pad Thai Green Chicken curry and crispy beef A simple quick eat The chicken in the curry had no texture thinly cut and slimy There was also too much salt in it I couldn t actually say that the meat was chicken  The chicken Pad Thai was just very wet noodles the cheapest chicken that was fibrous and over cooked A cheap nasty combination of ingredients that had no relation to any Pad Thai I have had before  The crispy beef was sweet and crispy Not great but at least edible We had plain boiled rice that was fine  I really cannot say anything good about the food and will never go near or recommend this restaurant A horrible experience

Went here for a family occasion knowing that when I lived in Gloucester it had a good reputation Only a few of the party had starters so cant comment on them Thought I would be safe with the herb steak so myself and my wife had that Asked if the chips could be substituted with a jacket potato but the sullen waiter just replied dont do jackets so opted for new potatoes Meals came out and wifes meal consisted of 3 tiny potatoes a piece of meat that certainly wasnt a quality cut 1 mushroom and some overcooked peas I had the same but with chips Steak was very fatty and poorly cooked and the flavour was overpowerd by the herbs so could of been eating anything peas were nearly soggy and had no flavour and chips tasted like standard chip shop chips Probably should have complained but as it was a family birthday event I didnt want to spoil the occasion The rest of the party were having puddings so we also had one Sticky Toffee pudding that I had was OK although nothing special but cheescake that wife had was flavourless  With 2 bottles of house wine and 8 soft drinks between us the bill came to 25 per head for a second rate lunchtime meal The sasd thing was I was looking forward to eating here as my first job when I left school was there and back the 1979 it had a cracking reputation

Went to Auberge at the weekend it seemed fairly busy The restaurant was closed for a private party so we sat in the bar area which wasn t too bad It s not the cheapest restaurant of it s kind but we thought that for 15 per dish and 5 per glass of wine that we would get decent food The wine was nice but when our Beef Bourguignon arrived large parts of it were cold Not luke warm but stone cold like it had just been taken out of the fridge Wasn t at all happy about this and did complain The staff took it back to be warmed up but it had already spoilt the whole meal Although the staff did apologise there was an element of not caring in her tone and demeanour Even when it was brought back hot the food was average and for the price there are plenty of other options that are far better

Over the Christmas period myself and my daughter have visited this hotel twice for coffee before I start this review I should point out that we are both locals and I have known this hotel all my life right back to its trust house forte days I have always known it for its great food and hospitality so this is hard for me to write but I will not be treated like a second class citizen On our first visit over Christmas we were first met by a very friendly young lady who took our order and showed us to our seats so far so good the problem arises when we come to pay I went to use the toilet whilst my daughter payed on my return I find my daughter is unable to pay by debit card as the hotel has a 10 minimum spend this is not a problem as I will just pay cash but it does appear a problem for the waitress who is holding her hand out in a very aggressive manner and looking down her nose at us Visit two this Christmas we are met by the same waitress who s body language towards us was one of looking at us like we are something under her shoes we place our order and she thrust her hand out and demanded the money in a aggressive manner we drank our coffee and left This hotel will never see my hard earned cash again

Took some clients for Sunday Dinner What a big mistake  Starters were reasonable but nothing to get excited about  Sunday roast We have to ask for some cutlery as there was none present at the table The quality of food was well below par meat was ok but have had a lot better and vegetables were cold and undercooked No sauces present to compliment the food and when asked for some we were presented with a pot of sachets the kind of thing you would expect to be given in a greasy spoon cafe not in a restaurant We finished our meal and asked if we could have our desserts outside to enjoy the sun and was told we had to pay our bill first before we could have any deserts as they have people leave without paying never have I been so insulted in my life I am a PAYING CUSTOMER Not a thief We were also told that drinks would be added to the bill and we would have to go and collect them ourselves from the bar Toilets were filthy dirty and looked like they hadn t been cleaned in weeks one of our clients female went to the ladies middle toilet to find that no provisions were made for disposal of sanitary wear so had to endure seeing peoples rubbish on the back shelf on the toilet just what you want before you eat  Reported to council as health hazard We would have had better food and service from McDonalds Would never return even if you paid me

If you like burger and chips for sunday lunch this is for you otherwise avoid where possible we were told that the rotiserie was broken which wiped out the majority of the men including steaks cheap and cheerful doesn t even come close

we went out for a family meal we ordered the stilton sirloin steak medium nothing to difficult Waited for a while but it was a Friday night so to be expected Food came and the steak had been showed the grill it was RAW So we informed the young gentleman he then proceed to take the steak off the plate and informed my wife to enjoy her chips and peas while he got the steak re cooked 5 mins later it came back out with a blob of stilton on the meat My wife started to eat it but getting down to the thicker end it was still raw So we asked for the manger and she tried to tell us it was because of the shape of the meat What she didn t know is that my wife is a chef at another establishment The excuse s she gave was total rubbish all I can say is I will never eat here again we had to barter to get some kind of discount off the meal  She made us feel that it was our fault when all I wanted was a nice night out with the family which you will not get here Awful place never again

Complimentary spicy chicken bites were raw blood near the bone and very chewy Scallop starter was very much over done which you wouldn t expect when paying a premium price Main course of fish pie was clearly re-heated in the microwave due to hot and cold spots during eating lamb shank was cold and again obviously re-heated and then sauce added after so no flavour in the lamb We had high expectations of this pub- restaurant but was deeply disappointed on top of that an inflated price tag of 70 for the food we half ate not impressed what so ever

A nice pub with great views and pleasant staff ruined by a bolshy landlady and one of the most disappointing roast dinners we have ever had  It didn t start well when we went to the bar and witnesses the public telling off of one of the staff by the landlady However the food did smell good so we ordered the road beef dinner Dry over cooked beef with hard roasties and a small amount of veg The only saving grace was the gravy We have eaten far better locally and at 10 35 a pop eaten better for cheaper too On our next visit we decided to skip the food and just have a pint Half way in to our drinks the landlady came over and asked it we d ordered food I replied that we were not eating and thanked her She appeared very put out and I felt like I d farted in church  Basil Fawlty lives on in this one  In fairness as I have said the staff appear great They are friendly and efficient Homemade pies seem to be a speciality of the place and we have yet to have one so they might be good too Just avoid the roast and the attitude

We had been to the tower of London to see the poppies took a short hop on the tube and arrived at 17 10 Although we had booked the waiter was not interested in this he just said table for two and sat us down even though I said we did book At this time it was not busy so I guess no problem I booked just in case I ordered one spicy and one plain Poppadom My wife ordered a veg samosa I ordered a meat samosa they arrived within 5 mins but no Poppadom I had to ask  Before we were halfway through the starter our main course appeared and the table was too small to fit on 2 x nans 1x dall 1x sag aloo and a special lamb Karaih plus a side of Pilau rice The rice was cold lamb swimming in oil sag aloo very salty and takka dall lentils not cooked out None of it was over hot and felt like it had been re-heated Probably one of the worse indian cuisines we have have encountered We shall not be going again although we will visit brick lane and try another

We went with friends for lunch The prices are very high and I would be flattering the food and service by calling it mediocre 8 hours later I still feel as though I have a cow inside me and my wife is very uncomfortable The menu has virtually no consideration for the fact that one of the group may not want to eat a fairly grisly lump of meat  yes one of the three short ribs was very chewy that shouldn t happen at their prices The mash and the chips were very ordinary and a salad was drenched in dressing Alter charging 24 for the meat you then have to pay more money for the sauce which is daft because the ribs would be far too dry to eat without Just another excuse to charge more The service would have been adequate in a restaurant charging half the price  no finger bowls and after we chased  twice including walking across the restaurant waving my sauce covered fingers we were brought two bowls to shaw between 4 Really Really ordinary  and that s polite Massively overpriced Pity too because when we walked around Westfield afterwards there seemed to be many other restaurants to choose from Next time we ll know

Was really looking forward to having aGluten Free restaurant in Christchurch However was sorely disappointed We got a table and had to wait for 8 mins to be served We ordered our breakfast which took a further half an hour to come There was no mushrooms so not sure if they put the avocado in place of the mushrooms or it always comes on the side but not what I expect with my breakfast The baked beans were disgusting The fried bread or it might have been toast was inedible The smoothie took 20 mins to arrive and had to remind them I ll admit we did visit a few weeks after they had opened but speaking to colleagues at work it has not got any better

We had our wedding reception in mill field school in Street we booked 17 roomS AT THIS HOTEL where do I begin Very rude manager smelly rooms and fousty smelling breakfast was awfull uncooked food run out of everything no plates for our food cold coffee then the manager raised our room rates by 10 per room cause not every one had turned up when infant n they had he then took 10 off each room and told us to hurry up and leave our breakfast at 10 am as it was a running restaurant and wanted to have the bar open for lunch time on a Sunday don t waste your money in this horrible hotel

Gave this restaurant a second chance after previously having a below standard carvery but things still same Dry vegetables because left uncovered the only edible part of the meal was the meat and Yorkshire Raised issue with chef and got a blank expression so got management to deal with issue and ended up with full refund for food and a free sweet which was great

Car park was filthy as was the restaurant despite it being empty most of the tables were dirty the coffee tasted like cheap jarred coffee despite costing nearly 3 served with a dirty saucer the food was over priced and over cooked and the toilets were disgusting  If you can see that the restaurant and toilets are disgusting Imagine what state the places you can t see are like  Awful  Will never go there again

Went on Friday evening hoping it had improved after a past disappointing experience as it is next to my wife s office We had to wait at the bar until our table was ready Nearby were the 2 managers of Smollensky s drinking at the bar it was a little after 9pm The cocktails although taking a little while to be made were good and the 2 bartenders very nice So was the the woman who took us to our table From that point it went seriously downhill Our starters took nearly 1h to come and our main courses even longer The food was poor at best to bad The staff although very nice seems to seriously lack of training We felt sorry for the 2 girls working so hard to keep everything together We have not seen the 2 managers once and realised as we were leaving that they were still drinking at the bar  My wife wanted to go to tell them about our disappointing experience but it was nearly midnight by then so we didn t see the point of talking to people drinking for the last past 3h   I can say one thing though managers of Smollensky s stop drinking and start sorting out your restaurant

We booked Miah s kitchen with a Groupon offer and we were looking forward to spending the evening with friends From the outside the location looked clean and well presented Upon entry we were greeted and seated Everything was going to plan  The waiter approached and took a drinks order and presented us with some menus the approach to the menu was interesting as you could gain a greater insight into the dishes on offer by looking at the food stains on the menu  a novel approach  The food ordering process was efficient and purchased poppadoms and a pickle tray We then waited for our starters to arrive After what seemed like an eternity they did arrive and they were adequate - hardly worth the wait but palatable  We then embarked on the wait for the main course which seemed to take an eternity When the food eventually did arrive the naan bread was burnt the rice was congealed and the mains we ordered were tepid The taste was okay although it was not cooked as hot as I specifically requested Two requests had to be made to remind them of the 3 chapattis my friend ordered His tepid curry was lukewarm at best when he started eating  At the end of the meal we requested the bill The other Miah s Kitchen in Leeds has a limo this venue does not have a printer to produce an itemised and legible receipt When we presented a debit card for payment we were told the card machine was not working - surely something they could have pointed out upon entry After I complained as if by magic the card machine sprung back to life A request was made once again for an itemised receipt as it was not clear how much they had charged for drinks and sundries - this process took 16 minutes and the result A scribbled receipt  Overall a truly woeful experience clearly there is no leadership at the restaurant The drinks and sundries and overpriced and the lack of pricing transparency and intermittent card payment facilities does not inspire confidence Our experience was certainly not unique and all tables in the venue were complaining about the terrible service provided We will certainly not return
Was very disappointed by the size of the portions and also because the Lamb Balti seemed to be 70 large onion slices and very little lamb

Booking for 9 people Service was poor with staff who weren t particularly helpful or knowledgeable Food took a long time and was sadly not worth the long wait  Altogether very average for what are above average prices  Nice grassy verge outside for the kids to play around on which was the highlight

Simply very poor management and staff that said it all for us  As we are local folk i thought it would be nice to come and see the live music and have a glass   thats went it went all wrong my partner requested a white wine   only to be told they had run out of glasses   what a joke of a place  it may be they had a large sitting but you dont just run out  you clear tables quickly   we did get a glass a few minutes later but it did spoil the first few minutes    This place is nice inside and lots of money has been spent   they need as a company with lots of outlets to look at the staff and kick some out  or shut it down and start again   sorry the new mill learn quick or you wont be there in 2 years better still go and visit Bills in Taunton WHO do deliver outstanding service every time

Being local to the area my wife and I tried out the restaurant on a rather cold evening At around 8pm this spacious restaurant was virtually deserted Just a couple of young ladies who were just finishing their meal I cannot fault the service the staff were friendly and polite  The starters were fine Onion Bhajis and Lamb freshly cooked and tasty It was the main courses that were absolutely disappointing The pilau rice was greasy too much ghee and tasteless all the sauce based dishes were far too stodgy The Chicken Jeera was requested as madras heat  but was bland and what taste it had was unpleasant I resorted to fishing the few pieces of chicken out of the sauce The wife s Chicken Tikka Masalla was a little better but again suffered from the texture of the stodgy sauce The vegetable stuffed paratha and sag aloo both tasted odd we left the majority of these dishes  To be honest a Tesco Indian Ready meal was tastier than this offering and the familiar dishes we tried were among the worst examples in my experience A disappointment and I m afraid will not be in a rush to return to the Swad

I live directly opposite Alfresco in the flats above the Holiday Inn I haven t visited for some years after my last bad experience there but thought I would give it a try with my partner Whilst we were seated quickly and on the terrace over looking the sea the rest of the experience was terrible  The staff were neither friendly or helpful We asked for tap water which arrived 20 minutes later with the waiter admitting that he forgot  We just wanted a lunch and ordered one course each I just ordered a salad from the starter menu and asked for some chicken to be added The food was reasonable but imagine my shock when we are handed a bill for 33  This is for 1 course each and tap water My salad in fact in total cost 18 95 Utter rip off That and the poor service Avoid avoid avoid Really disappointed  Suggest if you want the view take some lovely wine and cheeses and sit on the beach directly in front You ll have a better experience without paying an arm and a leg for it

After many visits to the Skyrack for drinks I was impressed albeit maybe through tainted vision   However upon my most recent visit following a long day in the sun I decided along with friends to go for some good old fashioned pub grub After I browsed the menu I settled upon a burger  What was to follow would be a life changing experience I can only only describe what was served between my stale bread bun as the cremated sole of an old shoe  This coupled with the unintentionally triple cooked chips can very politely be described as an abomination  It is safe to say I won t be returning in a hurry to hand over 8 69 of my hard earned cash as I am sure I could rustle up a better burger by lobbing a rancid old flip flop between two pieces of mouldy bread

They are still going and are just changing names and menu to get more of a tex mex  grill  steakhouse crowd through the door Same owners It s always been a tough place for a restaurant in Fulham and once the new wore off no one understood what low country american food meant Hopefully the newer scaled down concept will work out because us Fulham supporters love the place

My friends and I ate here for a sit down meal Initially the staff were very polite and our drinks arrived quickly Although the food was very enjoyable one waiter was sitting down on his phone whilst we were waiting for our plates to be cleared Considering there is a 10 service charge added I expected attentive staff To top it off towards the end of our meal we witnessed the older manager shouting at a customer who was trying to pay their bill Overall food was ok but some of the staff were unprofessional and the manager was abhorrent

Went with my wife with high expectations Very very disappointed ordered fish and chips and my wife ordered fish-cakes When my meal was served the chips were cold and soggy these were changed for hot but soggy chips The fish was more batter than fish The fish cakes were poor and the side salad looked like something off the compost heap Most disappointing meal ever

The staff were lovely Decoration choice looks as though they ve let an 80 year old blind farmers wife do it Management very unhelpful and far too dim for that level of job  Menu was extremely limited on top of that the first 2 things I asked for were out of stock When the food did come which in their credit was quite fast however I can microwave a packet burger in 5 minutes too it was abysmal The burger was dry and tasteless the salsa was clearly from a packet and unimaginative the chips were underdone and anaemic and I m fairly certain the nachos were Morisons budget brand The only slightly edible thing on the plate was the guacamole The absolute worst was the bun which to put it lightly looked felt and tasted like it had been scraped from under the arm of a homeless man and had all but one of the hairs removed  Great day though

Poor staff attitude and cold food - too many young kids who don t know the art of customer service As Toy Keane would say   Shocking  Nice surroundings and very good beer - but not good enough to ever eat there again  A place to drink but avoid the food don t expect to be giving staff tips

The longest serving restaurant in town although it has changed hands a few times seems to rely on its past reputation Service is sluggish at best and the food most likely to be cold Ours was yet again Complaining only has the effect of annoying the manager who shouts at you This time I wont be back

I haven t visited this pub for about 8-9 years because it wasn t very good Thought we would pop in for a Sunday roast on our way back from a long walk  Now then where shall I start Walked in and eventually we were met by a waitress and we were more than happy to be sat in the bar as long as we were fed  First of all they got the drinks order wrong there were only 3 of us 2 sodas and a lime and soda not hard  I ordered the pork belly and was overjoyed that this was on the menu as I d had it many times before elsewhere and loved it  What came was what can only be described as a dark brown crusted globule of fat no crackling For 11 95 you would expect a decent piece of meat not what looked like a child s brown leather shoe that had been kicked around the car park  I sent it back and asked for roast beef instead It came back and the manager said there you go I ve kept the trimmings on from the pork belly trimmings = 1 large pig in blanket which to my amazement they had the cheek to charge me 79p for  The roast beef wasn t off the joint it was what tasted like pre packed sliced beef and heated up in the microwave The cauliflower cheese I ordered as a side never arrived and was still on the bill They also charged us too much for the drinks that they had messed up in the first place A simple Sunday meal that turned into an extremely disappointing experience We ll take my Mother elsewhere for her day out next time Get a grip Grrrrrrrrrr

How this Fish and Chip shop won an award is beyond me the staff new or not do not listen to orders clearly  Food Standard is well below acceptable Fish NO taste other than the oil it was fried in  Sausage in Batter as above tasteless and just greasy Chips were acceptable however you would expect far better from a previous award winner and this was shocking so if your thinking of grabbing your Friday night grub pop to Queens Park its superior
The spotted cow has been closed for some weeks now I live nearby and will review again if it re-opens Meanwhile you will need to find an alternative

Casa Carlos was one of those restaurants that I d never been told about by friends and only knew by driving past on my way home from the town centre And it s no wonder that no one speaks of the place The food was not as I d hoped You can tell that there was no authenticity behind it and that it was all purely learnt from a reciepe book The manager was a disgrace Most definitely the worst part of the night was watching him drown in drink at the bar It created a shockingly bad experience as it made an uneasy feel throughout the restaurant The staff were lovely and very on hand however seemed uneasy whenever the manager was around as he would speak down to them and shout for the slightlist things when he could of easily participated and gave a helping hand LIKE ANY GOOD AND SUCCESSFUL MANAGER WOULD  I really do not think that he is a suitable manager and his assistant manager was twice as bad Overall I have never experienced anything like it The only good thing I have to say is well done to the staff for making the experience slightly bareable and mainly being able to stick around with him there

I have worked in the Hotel & Catering Industry for many year and I know that good customer service and hygiene is paramount for the customer  We pre-booked a table for 25 people family on 4th May 2014 as it was a special occasion our father turning 80 years old on that day We were asked to make a pre-booking payment of 150 00 this we paid We all arrived at the White Stone some family members travelling far especially to be there to find that the conservatory room that was reserved for us was in a terrible and poor hygiene state To begin the tables had wax chocolate and debris over it the knife and forks had stain marks some with dried food adhered to them Candle holders were dusty and the bottles of water that they served us had mold growth inside the bottles The waitress later changed the water bottles giving us water jugs that were not properly cleaned and had finger marks over them The waitress apologized for lack of hygiene but then mentioned that the hygiene of the room was up to standard We couldn t dine here as we all felt
Been out in Cheltenham walking back to the hotel Asked just for a starter and a beer would have got better from Asdas but then they short changed me for 10 quid what a joke

Look s nice inside very retro American Diner the food came quickly   Oh dear VERY Cheap Burger Van quality ingredients uninspiring burger in a bun no garnish no nothing chips burnt on the outside raw in the middle the breakfast was consisted of the cheapest sausages known to man the rest was swimming in a mixture of grease and water   oh and the coffee didn t have that much coffee in it

We got there and they tried to understand if we was up to spend money receptionist was looking for some really nice tables and when I said just to eat something and maybe 1 beer she gave us the worse table I ve seen in that place Food was nice well cooked and tasty and didn t take too long but as soon as the manager comes to ask how we feel you can see this fake smile on him I started talking on how much better the food was than our previous dining place and he turned his back to me and left Then came after 10 min saying we need to hurry because they need to setup for next customers   We was still eating  After another 5min he came very rude asking the same but super rude I asked the bill They gave me the bill I paid with 50 and they didn t Bring me the change He came to the table and said nothing and was furious looking at us I asked where s my change because obviously I am not going to leave tips to this kind of people and he went to get it and then he was just waiting for us to leave the table I asked if we can sit at the bar for another round of beer and he said first in First served   I gave up on this place literally Absolutely outrageous  Waitress was very nice though

Our first return for some time after a very disappointing Sunday Roast when the standard that day was highlighted by the roast potatoes which were luke warm  This time we ordered up market  fish finger sandwiches   The greasy poorly drained overcooked two fingers were contained in banded chiabata bread The banding was so burn that the whole had a strong carbon taste  The combination of these factors bound together with a fatty white sauce and limp salad caused me to feel uneasy and reach for my Rennies My wife spend the whole afternoon vomiting and feeling distinctly unwell The ambiance and excellent management deserve better

Recently probably since 8 jan 2016 the quality of the guest ales on sale has fallen away On sat 22 jan i called in at 6pm to try and have a word with the manager who mostly works evenings I bought a pint of hook norton old hooky bitter but after a few minutes knew that the taste was wrong Isaw the manager to mention this and talk about other concerns His response was i put that on myself today which was factually true as when i came in for a coffee at 0845 it was not on sale He then went to the kitchen and i didnt see him again ileft the rest of my beer and lwent home I have been drinking real ale for 30 years and was in the licensed trade for 15 years and beleive i can tell when something is off or not as it should be i used to spend between 30 and 40 per week here so now much of this is spent elsewhere As regards the coachhouse christmas ale this has been on sale between 14 and 28 jan and not surprisly it has stuck

We visit this restaurant regularly especially for birthdays and celebrations On this occasion the food was very poor Chewy scallops burnt burgers and basically disappointing food all round Some meals weren t available at all When we complained we were told the waitress would tell the chef No apologies  When you spend the amount of money we spent you would expect the staff to at least be apologetic

So her I am after walking the dog for a couple of hours and I see their outside sign for Burger and Drink 4 49 and being as I am having a late tea I thought I would avail myself of this On reaching the bar I asked for the above special and I was asked which burger I would like and the lady behind the bar reeled off a list of choices so I took my pick I was the asked if I would like chips or salad I said chips plase I was then asked which drink I would like and I asked for bitter shandy the bitter was off so I asked for lager shandy The bill came to nearly 8 00 when I queried that I only requested the advertised special the lady said that is for a plain burger only Okay I said make it a plain burger then and she asked me for 5 49 and when I queried this she said it was because I was having an alcoholic drink that it would be 1 extra  Non of the above was pointed out when I asked for my original order ie just the deal as advertised I could tell that the lady was becoming frustrated with me and so she remarked that it is in the small print  Now I ask you who has time to study the small print of a sign some ten feet high and designed to attract the attention of passing motorists Anyhow I decided not to proceed and left the pub it was not a matter of cost it was a matter of principle if I had wished I could afford anything from the menu a dozen times over it s just that I object to establishments like this trying to make a mug of me  All a pity really because I have been here on a few occasions in the past and it has been okay but I am guessing that it maybe has a new regime my wife had a bad experience a few months ago so I should have known

Very poor service Tables were dirty Staff seemed to pay no attention to when people were queuing at the bar to order which also stank of beer worse than any of the pubs I ve worked in in the past  None of the main courses we wanted were available  no fish and chips  - best avoided
