My wife and I made the mistake of stepping in here for a drink a few weeks ago The beer selection is very limited and the wine is worse The pool table kept us there longer than we would otherwise have tolerated - there was no atmosphere the place was almost deserted while we were there What a dive

I took the family here to enjoy a new years day dinner and when stepped inside I thought I was going in a Premier inn restaurant the decor was awful When shown to our table and given a piece of paper that was the menu it was very limited of choice ok if all you wanted was with chips frozen ones at that  No rice or pasta dishes  The family settled for the burgers and I fish and chips another disappointment the batter thick to make up the size of the fish and greasy and frozen chips not to mention the peas well over priced I had better ones in paper at half the price can I go on  The puddings came from blakes or another manufacturing company for the price you were charging it could have been home made  We are local people and I am a chef retired  Did you know frozen chips have a coating of wheat on them to give them colour something to be aware of with customers requiring gluten free  Will we be coming Back again No way a great disappointment

I visited Wetherspoons Yate  Thorns Farm  located in the shopping centre on a Sunday morning with friends We ordered vegetarian breakfast but they had run out of sausages Our second choice was Salmon but they had also run out In the end we went for toast and marmalade but guess what They had run out of marmalade  My friend noticed that when the waitress was bringing our cutlery the waitress was scratching her neck with the end of my spoon  We did not leave a tip we will not return

How can this be called a Japanese Canteen serving long grain boiled rice without any seasonings and no Japanese ingredients maybe Savoy cabbage but that s about it Really bad  certainly won t be coming back

For my Mum s birthday a group of the family went to Severnshed for an evening meal  The atmosphere in Severnshed is excellent - great location great scenery very nice interior and bar area The music was excellent too  The food was just as excellent as the atmosphere Thumbs up all round kudos to the chefs Excellent quality food and tasted beautiful  However the service we received tonight was horrendous  We were seated on time at 8pm It was not until 9pm when we were asked what we would like to order We were waiting for an entire hour to order our food  The main meal was not served until 10pm - a 2-hour wait  However for 2 of the family they were waiting for an extra 15 minutes After complaining a manager  said that the 2 meals would not be charged for However there was no apology to the group of us from the manager or the waitress  We finished our mains around 10 30pm when we were given the dessert menu The waitress left us with our dessert menus and decided to go off and clear tables - when many restaurant goers were leaving She did not return until 11pm For the entire half hour she was clearing tables when there was no demand for tables at the time  At 11pm we said we would not be ordering a dessert due to the delay We were all also worried about how long it would take for the desserts to arrive if any were ordered  Even when asked the bill did not arrive for a further 20-30 minutes  There was no apology whatsoever from our waitress or from any manager She did not thank us for dining at Severnshed nor did she say goodbye  The service we received from the waitress was very abrupt Not even a friendly smile and she seemed to be rushing everything It was busy and they were clearly short staffed but all that was needed was an apology I feel sorry for the poor chefs - the food was of excellent quality and from scenes in the kitchen everything looked very hectic  When we were first seated the waitress gave us our menus and also threw specials menus down on the table When some of the group decided to order from the specials menu we were told that this food was only served until 7pm and on Monday to Fridays We visited on a Saturday We should not have been given these menus and these menus did not state the times and days of when you could order so after being given these specials menus we expected we could order from them but we were not allowed  The atmosphere the food and the music may have been excellent but when dining out you expect to receive excellent service too There was no hello no thank you no goodbye and no apology  We have honestly received better service from Domino s Pizza before When a pizza arrived very late once they were very apologetic friendly and offered vouchers Not a problem at all Why couldn t this happen with Severnshed  There is no reason for us to ever return to Severnshed It was for a birthday meal and we were all left disappointed by this shocking service  It was an absolute shambles but thank you to the hard working and clearly stressed out chefs who provided an excellent meal once it did turn up  To anyone from Severnshed who may be reading this - you seriously need to employ more staff and have a friendlier and more apologetic attitude towards your customers You lost out on sales because a very large group of us didn t want to order dessert due to the service we received with our main course For the first ever time when visiting a restaurant we did not give a tip Your service was not worthy of one What does that say about our feelings An apology as well as a smile goes a very long way y know  Another note to add - you clearly breached health & safety laws by placing 2 chairs in front of the doors to a fire exit Not safe at all in a busy environment should anything have happened Management here need serious change

went on wen for my girlfriends birthday she ordered prawn cocktail to start prawns were frozen and when she got her main a steak it came to table cold service poor even do it was quiet poor management never again and the cheek to but a service tip on the bill john

I never do these review things but after my birthday last year in a hot desert surrounded by taliban i didnt think food or service could get worse  i was wrong  Went for a meal out with friends on recommendations from a year or so back  Went in on a wednesday night Ordered drinks and asked for a table for 4 stood waiting for about 10 minutes in this time a war broke out between 2 young children probably the owners children with plastic guns rolling on the floor and shouting at each other right next to the restaurant section  After being seated we were given the menu s which had a nice selection and ordered our food with more drinks  The drinks took half an hour to come out and some were even missed the food took even longer  The meal was edible but something that could easy be slapped together with ingredients from Aldi and a working knowledge of a household cooker  The Sirloin steak my friend and I ordered was very fatty the chips were oven chips and the salad was like the bagged leaves you can get at most supermarkets  Our other halves both had fish dishes Scampi and Salmon neither were impressed with the quality of their meals  We will not be returning very poor service poor food and high prices considering quality
Good food let down by poor service and no communication with kitchen and front of house would I go again no

Our party booked in advance and pre ordered for the youngest members birthday Arrived at 20 00 as per our booking After 55 minutes one of the party asked the chef why we had not received starters He got extremely aggressive and seemed to want a fight I have been on this planet for 52 years and have never witnessed such atrocious customer relations Of course such aggressive behaviour caused our party member to react in the same manner which did not help The chef s partner proceeded to make excuses about how busy they were etc   Alarmingly she then said that we only have a small kitchen If this is the case why take a booking for 15 people if you cannot cope The starter then turned up over the course of ten minutes but it was another hour before we received the main courses once again over a period of ten minutes What happened to the days when a party ate together Call me old fashioned but if those served first displayed good manners and waited for others their food would have been stone cold All of the party on leaving this restaurant agreed that the food was reasonable but were disappointed not to receive any apology for the TOTAL LACK of service a drink on then house may have placated some In fact after a few comments were made to the chef owner his ARROGANCE returned and he wanted to fight and or call the police One of the younger members of staff said on leaving you need an NVQ in customer service  What more can I add I have had some good times in this restaurant but will not go back again until some form of service is restored such as a new owner I am now advised that we are all banned Absolutely incredible when we are those that have been wronged

i would not eat at this resturant again me and my husband went there yesterday the one in kingston park newcastle we had muscles for starter x we both became very ill x so i phoned them up and spoke to the manager called carl which i told him what had happened and he called me a lier i am now going to take this further as it not excptable when someone comes down with food poisioning from bad food hygeine

I went with my Family We made reservation for 6 adults 2 children When we arrived they made it for 4 adults and 2 child They didn t have any more places So we have to squeeze ourselves Ppl are not friendly and the Price is way overpriced I informed them that i will have to rate them and it seems they don t care They charged 12 5  services which i refused to pay  My advise if you have to come here make sure you receive the confirmation by email or sms

Despite it s funky appearance and friendly staff this place is an old school Boozer  Ordered two coffees totally undrinkable and I m not being pretentious they were genuinely really sour As was the atmosphere with every one in there totally legless by 5pm on a Sunday afternoon I was looking for a nice local pub but sadly this one isn t for me

I have popped in here a number of times when in the area I remember it just for its appallingly slow service I am in there now with my son we ordered a couple of cups of tea and a sandwich and are still waiting 20 minutes later I am sure it s not just us because last time we were here a woman who had been waiting a long time just exploded at them and walked out For the Love of God raise your game
Terrible service will never visit again The staff were rude We felt like we were an inconvenience

Just got home after a meal out at the smoke steak house First choice starter shrimps was sold out at 7 30 pm Garlic Mushroom starter was just breaded frozen mushrooms with no taste and a dollop of mayonnaise Main course Ribs and chicken came straight after starters had been cleared and were both cold I sent them back and were returned with soggy fries and warm coleslaw and dried tasteless chicken and ribs  Will not be eating there again

Food is really bad Steaks are like leather Give you a cup of chips  which consists of between 8 - 10 chips  totally inadequate propotions get same for 2 for 10 as for buying just 1 meal Swore last time i went  6 months ago would never go back Sorry is all you get back when complaining didn t press any further because of company with  IN A NUT SHELL IF YOU LIKE INEDIBLE FOOD WITH SMALL PROPORTIONS AND BAD SERVICE THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU  STAY WELL CLEAR

A friend ordered three snacks Two correct orders arrived but instead of sending garlic bread they sent out some wedges We couldn t be bothered to complain so just ate the wedges instead 10 mins later the manager starts demanding 5 for the wedges we ate but still no garlic bread arrived We refused to pay and then the manager barred all of us until he isn t manager any more   As suggested in the title we believe it may have been the blokes time of the month which lead to the poorest display of management I ve ever had to endure All he had to do was send out the garlic bread and we d have had a whip round for the wedges but instead he had a nightmare and looked like he was going to burst into tears  Shame considering how good the rest of the staff are all of the time Let s just hope he doesn t drag them down  Oh and if you were wondering the wedges were fantastic

A so called student bar It is a joke The food is terrible over priced It is a place for mums with pushchairs too sit around with a coffee anf chat not who it should be aimed at seeing as it is a student bar

we have ordered take always several times in the past and food has been very good this occasion 15 4 16 was awful curry s watery bread seamed only partly cooked sag alloo potatoes hard and undercooked also lamb rogan had 4 small pieces of lamb in total  I understand that the tadka is run by the ex vari people vari was always excellent shame tadka has got so bad

Last night I had the bad fortune to pick the Golden Phoenix for dinner The interior looked very nice and the door staff was very friendly Unfortunately it went downhill from there Me and my gf were seated on the first floor in a corner table the menu was already on the table It took about 10 to 15 minutes till a waitress showed up to take our order without any kind of greeting Are you really to order  When I wanted rice with the sliced duck in orange sauce she said that would not be possible Also noodles with my gf ‹s sweet and sour chicken was impossible I still have no idea why but in the end we settled for rice instead of the noodles which was possible After another long discussion the waitress conceded that a separate bowl of rice would be possible with the duck When I discussed the options with my gf the waitress turned away made a face  The drinks arrived very quickly The Tiger beer was luke warm her water was cooler The food arrived minutes later and wasn ‹t hot but barely warm enough The duck consisted of 8 slices of duck in a very thick sauce Both dishes tastes rather bad Having had the duck in a different restaurant in Chinatown before I know it can be much better  When the waitress arrived next she never even asked if we liked the food just brought the bill and obviously was annoyed for not getting tipped When I told her what was wrong she smiled and walked away without a word  Without exaggeration I can say that this was over all the worst dining experience I ever had

Poor service Would not let a injured servicewoman sit at the bar on a stool due to health and safety reasons A member of staff who was off duty removed the stool from said service woman and made a point of it to the whole pub which wasn t full We understand this is a rule if the pub was full but this wasn t the case

Went here on the back of an appealing advert in the local press A big mistake There were only 4 people in the restaurant during the complete time we were there We were to find out why  The starters were ok and this did not prepare us for the disaster to follow My wife asked for the venison and for it to be nicely rare and pink - it is always rare and pink stated the waitress When it came it was very well done but not in the nicest way We ll do you another said the waitress The second attempt was not much better The dish also came with sticky red cabbage - not a small amount but a massive heap quite off-putting  Meanwhile I had the lamb cooked in 2 ways The rack of lamb seemed ok on the outside but very quickly was discovered to be absolutely raw on the inside It had to go back and the chef apologised and offered another one Instead I had a steak  They did offer a free dessert but by then our appetites were gone  Altogether a nasty experience

We was there with a couple of friends on Saturday night Our food took ages to arrive It was only just tepid and my side order of onion rings was cold inside My friend had a train to catch and could not eat it all because of the time it had taken to arrive No apology from the staff who do not seem to care Overpriced Overrated and Never again

This was our first visit to the Rajkot and there was a sign encouraging us to write a review on Trip Advisor so here it is We arrived at 6 00 on Saturday evening for our younger son s birthday There were only two other tables occupied Poppadoms and initial drinks arrived fairly promptly and the order was taken After 15 minutes 3 of the 4 starters arrived It then took over 5 minutes for the fourth to arrive and we chased it up twice during that time Thirty minutes after we finished our starters our main courses arrived We started eating but discovered that two of them were cold not lukewarm but cold so we sent those two back Two of us ordered a jalfrezi which are usually very tasty but these two were very bland No taste just salty We ordered another round of drinks to take the salty taste away but these took over ten minutes to arrive even though they still weren t busy at this time We finished up and left as soon as we could Our first visit to this restaurant and also our last
Initially it looked like a welcoming traditional ale pub Great selection of beers but not good for groups Don t move tables as the staff member on duty doesn t like it Very rude and abrupt Avoid

Myself and my fianc€÷ received an appalling service when we visited the Real Eating Restaurant in Lewes on Sunday 18th September We arrived at 1 30pm and due to the restaurant being busy we made a reservation for 2 15pm Upon our return we were informed that they had run out of roasts which in itself is very poor for this time on a Sunday but were told the rest of the menu was available Although we were disappointed as this is what we specifically booked for we decided to stay and ordered the duck from the menu After a further 40 minutes of waiting the duty manager came over to inform us that there was in fact no duck left and all the food had run out citing that the chefs had left and were understaffed Although she was very apologetic this service was entirely unacceptable It reflects very badly on the restaurant that we had to wait so long to actually get a table only to be told that they could not cook our requested meal a considerable amount of time later Added to this my fianc€÷ is pregnant and was extremely hungry only to be let down  We live in Tunbridge Wells this was our first visit to Lewes which was unfortunately ruined by the terrible service we received  If you are considering coming here dont Go to Bills restaurant just down the road far better service and nice food

Called in for lunch had ham sandwich come with 2 pieces off cheap bread and a square piece of ham charged ten pounds for that plus 2 teas and a cheese toastie again two small slices of bread with no cheese hardly disgusting blatent rip off charging quality prices for the cheapest rubbish they can buy

Where to begin The chips that came with the burger were undercooked The newspaper style paper stuck to the burger bun making the buns difficult to eat The buns were also quite soggy The waiting staff were quite poor in service and I will not be visiting again

My fianc€÷ and I visited Revolution while shopping in York The location is fantastic right on the river and the bar looks great However we sat outside and asked for two pints of coke an extremely simple order and we were planning to order something light to eat when we received our drinks Literally 15 minutes later we were still sitting in a half-empty beer garden waiting for 2 drinks another couple left before us and told the waitress they had been waiting 15 minutes for a glass of wine and a pint of lager  After 10 minutes I asked where our drinks were and was told they will be here soon  I waited another 5 minutes then got up and left

Was looking forward to going to Grand Central and we were warmly welcomed into what was a really interesting restaurant which spanned several levels  5 of us ordered and the food came quickly but we were all a bit disappointed Talking about mine I had a 8oz steak one third of which was inedible veins and which cost 18 95 What I did have was to be fair tasty  The deserts were a different mater 4 people had 2 scoop ice cream and what came was the most tiny tiny portion that looked like a melon baller had been used For 5 it was outrageous I had a banana split and I specifically asked for no sprinkles Pit came with sprinkles and all I got was a banana with squirty ice cream A joke for nearly 7  None of us will be returning

FOOD 5 10 over priced Bland meat really chewy  SERVICE 1 10 waiter couldnt understand us and had to keep getting the manager never said goodbye or thank you when leaving the restaurant even though we were the only ones in there  DRINK 2 10  thought i would go for a bottle of rioja because of the restaurant name and it was the worst red wine ive ever tasted the only reason it scores a 2 is because my daughters tap water tasted quite nice  ATMOSPHERE 1 10 shabby conservatory and about 3 tables dining wont ever return  PRICE 0 10 really over priced for average food la tasca is much nicer and thats saying something  OVERALL 1 10 The fact that they had only 2 out of the 8 deserts available says it all my wife asked for some cheese and biscuits they brought out a bread basket with bread and cheese ritz biscuits and a plate of about 10 slices of chedder and when the bill came they had charged us 9 95 absolute shambles of a place

Ordered a 55 take away The chicken dishes contained no chicken Telephoned to complain and were told the dishes are not freshly prepared & made in advance so they found it hard to believe  well believe it there was no chicken Unhappy with the poor customer service we then complained to manager Max who s customer service was even poorer If you want reheated vegetables & poor service then this is the place for you

I placed an order for a simple 18 inch pizza that comes with four toppings source was forgotten pizza was cold and actually managed to get two of the topping wrong including spicy peppers AVOID THIS CRUD

Like many people we had heard about the views at the top of 20 Fenchurch Street and thought while it London it was worth checking out  Let me tell you the views were fab Fantastic panoramic views of London Take a camera You can do all this from the Sky Garden  Bar  The Darwin Brasserie itself had an OK menu not a huge choice Myself and my partner were served by a chap with an incredibly strong Italian accent He was very hard to understand and seemed to struggle understanding our order He asked us if we wanted bread and olives which we decided would be nice as appetisers before our main courses arrived We asked if the bread came with olive oil and balsamic vinegar which he seemed to say was no problem We waited for approx 15mins before the break and olives arrived minus any dips Within a minute the mains arrived which we sent back as the appetisers and main courses should not be arriving together 15mins was a ridiculous wait for bread and olives We asked the waiter where the balsamic dip was to which he marched off only to bring us a bottle of malt vinegar Clearly there was a huge communication issue  Eventually our mains arrived which were OK Considering the price you expected alot better  Incidentally we didn t see the waiter again while we were dining We found out we were his last order before his shift ended I strongly suggests he works on his English if he wants to work in restaurant in England  Be careful with the olives and bread as they were not priced on the menu We were charged around 3 50 for each A service charge of 12 5 was also automatically added to our final bill which they say is to be paid at your discretion  A good experience for the views but if you want a decent meal perhaps look elsewhere London has much better to offer
We found the setting good but the service did not match the location The food was OK but no more Not on our must go again list

A good thing about here is the fact that on your birthday you get a free meal and cake Presentation of food is always rubbish Ribs very nice though but stupidly expensive It was once the dogs doodahs here but now just a so so place that is drifting away

Had fish and chips here yesterday and was disappointed At a cost of 7 50 you get exactly the same fish and chips you get for 5 quid anywhere else As if that weren t enough they charge you extra for ketchup and mayonnaise all this for the regular takeaway menu Nothing special Not recommended
Lovely lady on reception Food is ok a couple of our dishes tasted similar Will try again maybe to eat in next time around On the plus side the food came out quickly

We had takeaway fish and chips from Bizzie Lizzies whilst on holiday in Skipton Although they were tasty I was surprised to read some of the glowing reviews by other visitors Perhaps we were there on an off night but there was really nothing special about my meal - just run of the mill fish and chips Big portions though

My first visit to this establishment for over 20 years brought two sayings to mind   you get what you pay for  and  does what it says on the tin   I visited on a Saturday evening with my wife and two boys aged 3 and 1 There wasn t a table so we waited at the child friendly bar The place had evidently been busy throughout the day as the tables hadn t been cleared of glasses The boys absolutely loved it from start to finish The food was good the service friendly

I heard lots about Eric s and I finally got round to giving it a try It was **OK** but no more Maybe I missed something I would certainly give it another go  I found the menu a bit conservative and uninspiring Pretty simple menu really    chicken fish steak    don t get me wrong I happen to love chargrilled tuna steak yes it works perfectly with a nice salad but somehow I was expecting a bit more wow from the menu and in the end I found it rather difficult to get excited about choosing anything After going round in circles for a long time eventually I took the vegetarian option which must be a first  The food was tasty enough Again nothing amazing but ** OK ** Some of it a bit unbalanced eg some very nicely cooked scallops obliterated by a rather dayglo relish Portions by the way are very hearty It s bistro style rather than fine dining and feels more like a lunch place than dinner Bread comes one of those flat pieces of slate -  Now the main issue I have with this restaurant Be prepared to endure the most fearful racket during your din-dins Actually I quite like bustling exuberant restaurants But upstairs especially the noise was quite spectacular Unlike other reviewers there were no big parties of 20 or anything just normal clientele It was not helped by us having the probably the worst table in the house a kind of afterthought table-for-2 placed right by the kitchen entrance I feel it would be better to remove this table and trade a little bit of yield for an improved ambiance We really couldn t hear each other By the way the kitchen is quite unbelievably busy and impressive and we did express some awe at the young waiting staff buzzing in and out at 100mph like ants This is a fantastically productive kitchen for sure  On booking I would definitely recommend you ask for a downstairs table  Staff not bad very likeable very young Our young girl could not un-cork the wine She then enlisted her friend who also struggled Neither could pull the cork out because try as they might they were simultaneously pinning the cork down with the retainer of the corkscrew A bit embarrassing but in the end they sort of mashed it out somehow Not great treatment for your 35 bottle of wine  In summary  noisy cramped bustling lightning quick service in at 7 30 out by 8 30  100 lighter for 2  It s great to see a place doing well but I think Eric might consider reducing the volume of covers and just slow the tempo a little

Finally decided to try this restaurant after hearing and reading a lot of positive feedback This was a Tuesday evening so after checking the menus on the website thought the Midweek Menu three courses for 17 50 looked really good and we each could find something we liked on there However upon being seated we weren t offered that menu at all The main menu did have some lovely authentic Italian dishes on there so we weren t that fussed but think that if the restaurant advertised a table d hote menu then they should offer it  Seated at the table we found the oil and balsamic vinegar dip a bit disappointing There wasn t nearly enough olive oil and the vinegar was cheap thin and acidic Freshly baked ciabatta would have been expected in a restaurant with this reputation but the bread seemed nothing more than a regular sliced white farmhouse loaf We both ordered the king prawn starter which was really nice Succulent fresh prawns butterflied in their shells with the garlic butter not overpowering the fresh flavour of the shellfish  For main courses one of us opted for the waiter-recommended salmon with roasted vegetables soy and ginger and and one had the veal saltimbocca The salmon was nicely cooked and very tasty but the roasted vegetables consisted mostly of tomatoes The veal was most disappointing being a classic Italian dish and was expected to be well executed in this establishment The veal was not as melt-in-the-mouth as would normally be expected but the worst aspect was the lack of sweet nutty marsala wine flavour to balance the oiliness of the butter sauce and the saltiness of the Parma ham Unusually for me I couldn t finish the veal because of the heaviness of the butter sauce and after paying these prices didn t feel inclined to invest more on a dessert  The restaurant is very well presented inside and out and the service was acceptable although at no point did anyone ask if everything was to our liking In summary a restaurant that on this occasion did not live up to the standards it seems to be presenting and for 65 including only two drinks was felt to be overpriced considering the quality of the food

I have been to Red Ginger a few times but only now decided to review We decided to visit on Boxing Day while the restaurant was quiet but a lot seems to have changed Since the my first few visits the menu has changed and no longer includes the Sushi dishes that made this one of the better restaurants in Barnsley  The service was good however the food was not all that great Starters were actually pretty good however the mains were a disaster My partners Black Bean dish was very very salty to the point where water was needed to actually wash it down and when it came to my schezwan dish I think the chef decided that he would use chili as the only ingredient as there was little taste to what should be a great dish Doubt we will go back as it seems to have changed for the worse Barnsley has some great restaurants but finding a good Chinese is now a struggle

Great coffee as usual but very slow service At an airport where most people are in a hurry you would think that Costa would have addition staff to help when line ups get too long Pity Coffee - A+ Service - F

Five of us called  including two small children Charged 7 to use wacky warehouse which I thought excessive  especially as we were all eatng and drinking there so would not be in the play area very long The food came  I had a beakfast  Bacon was small  mushrooms watery and tasteless but the sausage was lovely  My wife had a chicken salad Asked for no dressing but it arrived with two ramikin dishes of dressing one of which had spilled out a little  The chicken was fine but salad at this place means lettuce with one slice of tomato Nothing else  no cucumber or onion or anything The childen s meals were OK pizza and chips and fish fingers and chips

Situated in St Aldates we saw this as we got off the tour bus it was a hot day and there were seats available outside They make their own ice cream here- having returned from the med recently - they were not totally innovative or unusual in taste They were supposedly made from Jersey cream but I would not have known The wait in the queue was long and laborious and they did seem to be a little flustered as someone else mentioned There was a lack or organisation about the whole service We got served by very pleasant member of staff she made all the right things but failed to open the coke top gave us very cool latte which had to go back to be reheated the bagel we ordered was nice - pastrami - but she said she would bring it to us outside and we waited and waited - when my husband went back in to complain his coffee was not hot enough he heard them calling for someone to collect the bagel Nice enough but ice cream was 3 40 and the bill for two soft drinks Small bottles 250ml  a coffee a bagel and a small smoothie was 20 so not cheap  Would go again but they need a good manager in there

I have now stopped using this place as I find the service very average and the cost of eating quite high The food is good but then again it s only pizza we are talking about I like the menu offers some nice varities and spins on a common theme  Unfortunately I have often found myself waiting for service and that is often at the point of just getting there First impressions do last and unfortunately for this place I won t be going back I would urge you to try for yourself as hopefully things may have improved

May wait some time to get served a popular eating place with the locals but not that friendly and not a lot of atmosphere some of the tables are a bit squashed in places but food not to bad worth a try i think
pretty poor fair Not the best service and food not especially good for the price Better places within easy walking distance
Been a few times the food is always high class and delicious however this time for lunch the atmosphere was dull definitely better in the evenings The spanish wines are sublime

Disappointing visit today I use here when I visit my hairdresser its an hour from where I live the garlic mayo was left out of my roasted vegetable wrap which I did mention to the assistant when I purchased 2 peanut butter cup cakes to take home when we had them later there was no peanut butter flavour to the cream a token choc something as d€÷cor but the cakes themselves were not nice I think they were old one young lady who was mainly taking the money was pleasant but the other quite uninviting I also bought 2 x rocky road and again these were not fresh

This is a cafe restaurant but we bought their pizzas to take away The bases looked like frozen or pre-prepared and were definitely not freshly made proper pizza bases Pleasant enough but nothing special and we would have been very disappointed if we had paid to eat in

Went here with a party of about 40 after a funeral There seemed to be a couple of other lunchtime do s on just after us The food we had was ok - nothing wrong with it - but nothing made it stand out Open sandwiches  small slices of crusty bread with minimalist toppings  cheese and tomato pizza cremated pardon the pun  to within an inch of its life so it was unrecognisable chicken portions a herd of pork pies at least half of which got left  various square loaf sandwiches some chips which had a slight old oil flavour and some cakes Overall people ate a reasonable amount but whilst it was ok the food had the character of the hotel - a bit of stuck in a time warp of days when people thought it was a bit posh Seems a strange place for a hotel restaurant anyway - I mean Liversedge of all places - it kinda suits the Marks and Sparks Plus Fours brigade I guess expensive and safe Give it a try - you might like it Staff were friendly and helpful which is always a bonus

I went to the plate and porter about 2 months ago for my mums 50th anniversary i had never been before and the first thing i thought was that it look very posh and romantic but then again i thought it looked a bit old fashioned so therefore i think there was some moderning to do with the resaurant We went to the back room because there was a lot of us but i thought we were seated very well and the food was lovely I cant fault it one bit the only problem for me was the look and that it looked a bit old fashioned for my liking

I have just returned from my visit of AJ s Bistro in Blackpool Whilst most of the reviews on here are exemplary I must slightly disagree I had booked through Groupon on a deal for 2 courses for 2 people at 19 I was told once I had tried to order that there was no muscles starter and the Lamb and Duck wasn t available from the mains So really the only main meals on offer was chicken fish and steak  The waitress never really made us feel welcome - I had the feeling she didn t want us there Maybe because we were on a Groupon deal We wasn t told on first entering about the menu options available on our deal and was only told that the food was not available upon ordering Once we had finished the meal the waitress took the plates away but did not offer us the dessert menu or a coffee After a while I had to ask for the bill There were tables that had not been cleaned away and only 3 groups dining  In conclusionn I would say that the food is excellent however if I was paying full price over 70 for a couple for the meal I would of been disappointed However if you can get a deal then its worth a visit

Having regularly visited for Sunday lunch for some time somethings gone wrong The once melt in your mouth roast beef lunch you could now re sole your shoes with To the point we no longer visit this pub

Had been told this was a good place to eat so gave it a try Large menu choice not always a good thing quite a lot of fried food and microwave meals steaks expensive and plates filled with lots of chips to make up for small portions of main item One of our meals was not cooked enough and had to be left rather disappointed on the whole much better pub food available in this area

Coffee was great although could have been hotter Had a sausage muffin at around 10am and it was very poor Sausage was small shrivelled and hard at the ends where it had been kept hot or reheated Can take to dog in which is why we always go there - but was disappointed today for the first time
It s fine the staff were good knowledgable and helpful The wine was good as was the food If you are looking for a good pub meal this is a good choice with a nice location alongside the canal
Very nice quick service The Meze is excellent Try the House Turkish white wine Very enjoyable food

Having read several differing views we decided to try it for ourselves  We hadn t booked a table and staff were reluctant to let us eat despite there only being 4 other people in the pub and no reserved signs on tables I m not sure whether the Bar person had recently had Botox but she was certainly expressionless and smiling seemed beyond her After a 45 minute wait our food finally arrived and was ok not piping hot but not exactly cold either It seemed to take an age for our plates to be cleared once we had finished our meals we were not asked if we would like desserts or Coffee s so we decided to leave it at that and went on our way

I eat out a lot but am rarely moved to review unless I m particularly inspired or irked This place is a good pub I ve been to many times The food I ate for lunch there today was great no complaints The service was deeply troubling One clueless young barman was blameless various hung-over managers gunning themselves soda were mostly absent but a waitress talking loudly and rudely about customers while cashing off and transferring tables was something else I ve never felt so unwanted as a customer service doesn t end when the bill is put down or even paid It ends when you say goodbye to customers I could have left there weeping and no one would have noticed

Let s be upfront - I m disappointed I ve eaten in this restaurant several times over the last 9 months and mostly had enjoyable Greek food good service and bustling atmosphere Tonight I departed from Lamb and Greek Pasta to date very delicious  i chose calves liver cooked in olive oil and lemon and was even asked how I d like it cooked Medium rare my preference It came soaked in some red wine reduction sauce and I sent it back as it wasn t what was displayed on the menu or what I d ordered They took away the sauteed potatoes and green beans to keep them warm After longer than expected I got an overly thick piece of calves liver which was barely cooked - blue in steak terms It was clear the chef had no idea how to cook calves liver and I again sent it back and declined to order anything else prefering to finish my sauteed potatoes and beans So everyone makes mistakes - it is how you make ammends  try to repair those mistakes that really matters I got apologies I explained that I usually get good food and the waitress shouldn t be apologetic or embarrassed - the chef should be they acknowledged they know me and were sorry for serving such a poor meal So far so good I asked for the bill They brought it with the starter side vegetables and two glasses of wine included I d have happily paid for my starter - but feel the glasses of wine and vegetables should have been written off to really show they were sorry  My conclusion - this is a business - and I m just another punter - this is a tourist restaurant I was offered a free drink after I d paid the bill but declined So the morale in my story - good food if you stick to the lamb Leave the calves liver well alone - the chef doesn t know how to cook it  I won t be going back because I think they didn t offer me the right compensation for a very poor meal experience In short I felt treated like an anonymous customer tourist who they wouldn t see again  And actually in that they are right

This is really a little gem the curries are really good quality and full of flavour My Chicken Balti had more chicken than i have ever known in any restaurant before The egg fried rice is different but all the same very nice The high light of the trip was the cheese and garlic naan the best i have ever tasted fresh tasty and very large

My wife and I visited Quince during the first week or so after opening the place has a great deal of promise but really needs to get up to speed to match the local competition The place has been very nicely decorated and fitted out the service was polite and friendly but we got the feeling from the apologetic waiting staff that they could only serve food when it was ready to serve The food was at best OK the ingredients seemed to be of good quality the main problem seemed to be in the balance of the preparation i e  one main course dish hot the other just warm after standing waiting for the second plate The prices for both food and wine looked to be competitive but with two other really good places to eat only yards away in the High Street it really needs to get up to speed to be serious competition We will give it another try in a month or so when the teething trouble will hopefully have been sorted out

I think it s a no brainer that when visiting a chinese restaurant the chances of getting a decent western style customer service is at 10  I have been to many chinese restaurants around the world and it has been very rare that I ever got treated how customers normally get treated at a lets say European restaurant As controversial as this may sound this may be to a culture thing and just how they work Chinese staff are normally very rude in the sense of they throw food at your table they don t give you the time of the day they don t wait till you ask for the bill and you d be lucky to get a genuine smile from anyone The only time they seem happy is when you are going and have paid  This place is one of the cleaner ones in China Town but if you go to the restaurants opposite I don t believe you get silly 10 charges for a table and the food is as big in portions and cheaper The only different thing here is you can get a nice variety of bubble tea and the way the place is set up makes it look clean but i d question that  I have been here a few times now mainly because I don t want to take people who are with me to a lesser looking place that d put them off but if i had a choice and was on my own I wouldn t be too bothered because the food in most of the restaurants in china town pretty much taste the same and you re guaranteed to get the same rude service anywhere there

I ve been here several times in fact my office is so close I could probably have them deliver my lunch for me and I have to say it s very hit or miss Sometimes you ll go in there and half the menu wont be available - but they wont tell you this when they give you the menu rather wait until you try to order Their timings are also a little amiss sometimes lunch is incredibly quick and other times like the last time I was there you will wait 40mins for your lunch Sure you get an apology but that doesn t make up for the indegestion you suffer for eating it quickly to make sure you re not late back to work I d recommend the thai green curry and that s probably about it Fish finger sandwich always seems like a good idea at the time and always disappoints  Of an evening you get some right divs in here Usually pi$$heads that have been drinking since 5pm trying to pull the ladies with their dancing  It s ok until about 7pm then i d advise you to move on

We had a good pre theatre meal Service quick and attentive Menu selection good Flavours were fine good but not great except for the soft shell crab which was superb restaurant small with a crowded feel A restaurant for a good quality value for money meal

We were a party of four with a small child and were pleased on arrival to see a table ready and a child s high chair in place Even though a Sunday lunch time there was only one other table of two people and although very nice decoration   Shame no Japanese front of house staff when restaurant says it is authentic  Welcome very low key and main server very unsure of himself and when we asked something different to the menu we felt we were in a Little Britain sketch as we were told could not do it as the computer was pre-programmed  Were not asked how meal was and felt not only cold in way served but there was no heating and one meal arrived with tissue in it  We had to ask for everything and the only other member of staff was walking around with a look that would not have been out of place on the Titanic when it hit the Ice berg The food was very good although if you want a filling desert do not choose the Ginger cheese cake  A 10 service charge is added automatically which I always feel is unfair and we even had it added to the retail purchase we made which is not really fair  So in summary  Great food but poor service  and will probably only return if need of a Japanese food fix
Not the best food I have had As the name suggests Food Factory that s exactly what it feels like a works canteen then I suppose that s the whole idea Wont be going back there
difficult to east Burger out of a bowl  service good  Deal of Burger & pint good good atmosphere Pub owned by different chain NOT as good as before

Look it was a nice location and the food was fine but when you pay over 80 for a 2 course meal for 2 no wine you expect to be very satisfied The service was lovely and the fish well prepared but there was no wow factor and I probably wouldn t go back

I ate here as part of a large group 14  The restaurant is quite stylish and upmarket The waiter was very keen that rather than receiving 14 different orders we selected a banquet consisting of a mixed starter followed by a variety of three different curries to share amongst us for 18 per head We were brought poppadoms to start which were accompanied by some unusual pickles Unfortunately there was only about a tablespoon of each pickle per tray and they went very quickly meaning I ate most of my poppadom plain The starters were very nice and well presented on a rectangular plate However the main courses were a disappointment Once again the portions were very small and the curries were good but not great I didn t think I got very good value for my 18

Popped into Holt for a wander on my way back from work and thought I would treat myself to coffee and cake at Byfords as I do love their SPONGE cakes After being ignored by all of the staff who were milling about some who did look at me but I must have been invisible as they didnt say anything or approach me and I couldnt catch an eye long enough to say anything I decided to get a take out rather than sit in One of the staff behind the counter was serving a man in front of me but the others were chatting so I waited and waited a bit more and then eventually managed to order my coffee which was rung through the till without me getting a chance to ask for my cake When I said I d like something else I was made to feel like it was a big inconvenience Both cakes were put into one bag without asking so mine got mushed with the one I was taking home for hubby and at the end I got my change shoved at me So overall a bad experience but still good cake hence the Average rather than Poor

We wanted to eat down the road but they finished serving at 2pm so we thought we would try the Magna Charta It s many years since our last visit and it has changed hands and had a full refit which has been done very tastefully with screens creating little rooms all very nice We were greeted beautifully and offered a choice of tables our order was taken and the drinks arrived The food was well presented my scampi was nice but my wife s salmon was tasteless The table was cleared and we expected to be offered coffee but none was offered and neither was the bill I think we had hit a staff changeover no one was to be seen so I paid the bill at the bar and we left OK but could do better would be my comment

From the food point of view I find this restaurant very typical of most Indian Restaurants I have visited Most are pretty bland and nothing special to write about If entertainment is your choice it does provide some music dancing and if its your thing some Karaoke  My big issue with this place is it crams far too many tables in the space available if you are seated in the wrong position it can be quite an obstacle course to get up and away from your table My recommendation is to find another restaurant

Short and sweet review  Since the new manageress has been present everything has improved - I thing she s taken it and shaken it service food and particularly the beer are greatly improved  I personally think that the layout and restaurant seating could be improved seating by the main entrance door is not brilliant particularly in the winter and the route to the toilets is through the restaurant passed numerous tables - I would not sit at these tables bit more thought needed here  All in all greatly improved from a month ago

Visited earlier this month For a set price you can keep ordering food was ok Hardly any meat on the ribs and king prawns in batter were greasy and the prawn tasteless but the chicken skewers were nice to start Paid extra to have the duck as a main item it wasn t great- again hardly any meat At time if paying my card wouldn t go through despite knowing I had money in my account tried a second card twice with no luck my partner also tried his card all accounts had money in so clearly a problem with the machine connection The waiter became very snappy and said that it was obviously our cards and not his machine we had cash on us so paid and left  His attitude left a sour taste overall the meal filled a hole but wouldn t go back

We went for the Meal Deal menu which offered a small choice of pub type food at a reasonable price  The quality was excellent and it was served promptly after our order was taken - 30 minutes after we arrived at the premises  There was a choice of 3 real ales and the one I chose was as good as it gets The wines were competitively priced  All good so far BUT  The waiting staff were all busy but seemed to lack co-ordination and training Avoiding eye contact with customers lest they be given another job was the one thing they were good at  There was a notice near the entrance advertising for more staff It looked as if it had been there for some time  One set of toilets was out of order  With a Premier Inn next door this place has a captive market and it ought to do better

Small friendly pub which is good to watch the football on with the two TV s it has showing sky sports The barman who used to work there Russell was a really nice guy who recognises you which is very important in a pub

Visited this inn for the first time with my wife and brother and sister-in-law for an early evening meal as the inn had been recommended to us by another member of our family The service by the young waitress was very good and three of the four meals were fine however the pork kebab meal ordered by my wife the pork was very tough and inedible the waitress told us that the chef felt she was unlucky and that he would do another one The meals took about 25 minutes to come out not a problem originally however as the rest of us had our food on the table my wife would have been eating hers after we had finished ours so she declined and just ate the rest of the food on the plate We thought that my wife might have been offered a sweet another drink or reduced the price of her meal but no such offers were forthcoming which really disappointed us  The Compton Inn is a typical old small village pub with a nice atmosphere and innovative menu however In view of our experience the four of us will not be visiting this establishment again
The venue drinks and staff are great The food is average Unfortunately on a weekend it s the clientele this place attracts that lets it down Feels like you re at some kind TOWIE audition

Went here a couple of times for a drink while in Newquay Was okay nothing special Good location We got charged for a soda water with our round which was weird as never been charged for a soda water in any other pub we ve been too

This used to be a lovely place so good I was quite taken with having membership here The food was delicious the selection good and the service fab  What happened room  The menu is nothing like it used to be It s been changed and changed so much it s not an echo of its past life I also have issues with this hideous butter they were serving balsamic awfulness on a plate I only asked for some extra bread to go with the pate because there wasn t enough to which I was charged for Now I don t mind paying if I m being a greedy guts but the minuscule pieces that came with the started weren t enough to use half the pate if you layered it on 6 inch thick  It s still a nice place to drink however Nice selection of cocktails averagely priced Poor selection of bar snacks now though They used to do these delicious mini burgers - oh they were beautiful that is until they decided they weren t worth the hassle because they kept getting dropped on the floor  Call me old fashioned but if they were falling off the daft slate thing put them on a proper plate

We ve visited several times over many years almost 20 location is great for walks dog friendly area outside views and access to beach However and I know they wanted to refurbish and extend but the building and decor is getting very tired almost rundown and when we visited it shows Even though service was quiet we were served deep fried sausage not as good a quality as they use to be and the mushrooms were served in a small pool of butter and oil not very appetising but tasty still the same  We will be back but hope to see better quality and better presentation not a lot to ask for 7 50 a head I hope the owners management update the premises

We visited 24 10 13 and both enjoyed the mains Steaks are as expected pretty good The sides were equal to them I enjoyed the wine pot 500ml and thought that a great idea I do have a negative though The deserts I would just do mains on another visit I had the signature chocolate sponge with soft chocolate filling that tasted of very little and my wife had the almond tart which was like a shop bought version Not awful but very much an after thought to the mains which were good The coffee was ok The service was quick and good Friendly Ambience was nice too unless you hope for a quiet meal Its a buzzy place which I liked Its town centre after all Next time I will stick at the mains

This was a regular haunt for me I d taken lots of different friends here and all were impressed with how great the food was The space was small but the atmosphere was always nice and the food was fantastic Nobody was ever disappointed  Unfortunately since the management changed the menu has been noticeably simplified the prices increased and worst of all the food quality decreased to merely average I guess they ll make more money doing this but now the place is no longer special so I won t be taking people there any more A real shame

Ate on Easter Sunday with wife daughter and grandchilden age 20mths & 3 1 2  Service was very pleasant and efficient Restaurant was fairly busy about 60 full of familys of all ages  I had Mushroom risotto not the best although pleasant but could have been hotter Portion was small for the price Wife had fish and chips with pea puree Reasonable portion size but a bit pricey Daughter had burger & chips Good size and flavour Gradchildren had pasta and fries child meal  Lasrgeamount of penne pasta with very little sauce on it that looked somewhat dried in parts small pot of fries which were ok for their ages but would not have done a 6 or 7 year old and expensive for what it was

So this is the re-branded Beefeater steak house The decor is certainly modern open light and welcoming with plenty of other diners The meal was a bit of a hotch potch King prawn cocktail was just plain difficult to eat The prawns were indeed kingsize and covered in a rcih cocktail sause However they still had shells and tails on which considering they were covered in sauce made them very difficult to eat They were presented in a bowl with huge chunks of tomato and cucumber so the only way to eat any of it was with a knife and fork on the wooden block they were delivered on which just made a mess with sauce and shell pretty much everywhere The rump steak main course was good The steak was cooked as asked for medium rare and the chips were good quality Again the presentation let it down - a large white plate a cup of chips the steak and a lot of garden peas frozen presumably  The pease looked like a real after thought  Colleagues were equally disapponted A small portion of moules A tatseless starter of cheese and chipotle dippers - they actually looked like mince pies Overall a very disappointing experience with the steak being the only redeeming feature
This has slipped since apparently changing hands It used to be very good - I hope it gets back to standard

we went to this restaurant for the first time as we had heard good vibes about it we found the staff very friendly and a good choice of food although it was only average when it came the venue is quite small and everything seems to on top of you not a place we would go back to on a regular basis

Wetherspoons have their fans and their critics - but the good news is that you know broadly what you ll get  A large room with a TV somewhere showing sub-titled news channel A long bar with a wide range of drinks including craft beers and decent real ales A fairly standard menu with a different focus each day with a particularly good value meal deal Cheap prices - buying in bulk means that the costs are kept down The London Hatter gets a cross section of the Luton populace with some students from the University just across the road but not as dominated by students as you might have thought  If you hate Wetherspoons don t go there

Admittedly the food was good but hugely overpriced It s not possible to have a traditional tapas consisting of many dishes here without taking out a second mortgage The selection of Jamon for two consisted of eight small bite sized slices of admittedly good quality hams for 13 pounds bread had to be ordered separately at a cost of 2 pounds for three slices  This goes against what is the essence of a tapas restaurant quick tasty plentiful affordable dishes

Given that we booked to go this restaurant based on the high ratings it had on tripadvisor I must say it was a very underwhelming experience The food was OK but both my partner and I can cook better than this The decor was alright though the glass tables don t work if you scratch your chest chin it can look to people on other tables that you re touching yourself up  And the music didn t seem in keeping with the overall effect that the owners are trying to create  Ultimately though a restaurant should be rated on it s food and this is where I feel L Assiette has a long way to go to be worth 5 stars It s not bad and some elements of the meal were good but nothing was exceptional

My wife and me brought my sister for dinner I had been looking forward to the 32oz flaming challenge but they had run out of that as well as the 16oz This was by 7 30 I settled with the 8oz We waited 30 mins for our food even though we were not advised of a waiting time When the food came it had a tiny bowl of pepper sauce The only saving grace was the steak was cooked perfectly Not sure I will be returning
Breakfast experience was poorly managed Dirty plates cold food on occasion Evening meals were better presented

After a moorland walk this cafe provides a welcome refuge We have called several times when the coffee and tea has been fresh and the bacon sandwiches of good quality The chap who runs the place does so with a cheerful smile and there is no standing on ceremony Boots for example are not frowned on That said a lick of paint on the outside and inside would give the place a more professional air Scuffed paintwork leaves an impression of carelessness which is not borne out by the food here Perhaps someone could also find time to update the blog on the cafe s website potentially a useful resource

Stopped in for cocktails with the in-laws to take in the views over the bank holiday weekend Nicely done out bar and a good cocktail list Free charge points for your phone was probably the best thing after the view Cocktails were ok but then the 26 for 2 gin and tonics and a half a lager seemed very pricey
Used to go here quite a lot until we noticed that the staff were taking photos of the customers this was to say the least somewhat disconcerting
Nothing special neither good or bad but convenient if you re in the area As with all chain pubs the food is standardised and unremarkable though if anything a bit overpriced for what s on offer
Lots of nice detail nice decor good staff however very average food at high prices It certainly was underwhelming and I would rather support a local restaurant than another chain which felt soul less

Superb value food [four of us had main course and pud for a total of 32 ] and friendly staff  BUT   the hotel part we do not recommend For the first time ever in hotels after four hours of trying we gave up on sleep because of the noise from the adjoining room [very thin walls ] and left the hotel at 2am There was no night staff so could not arrange a room swap so we chose to drive the two hour journey home  To give them their due when we phoned from home in the morning to let them know they said they would not charge us but the damage had been done Very disappointing way to celebrate my birthday

Went to Jamies with family have been once before a few months ago which I enjoyed but this time came away feeling disappointed Generally felt that we were rushed through and the food was entirely average Will not be going back any time soon

Went for Sunday Family breakfast  staff were friendly food good but not spectacular Had the traditional English breakfast which was good clean and edible Coffee that came with the breakfast included was filtered and quite tasteless WE did not partake in any Moroccan Dishes but perhaps on another time will The waiter was from Bangladesh and the waitress from Spain  The restaurant is in the Food Zone in South Croydon and has many other venues vying for trade
Lunch with friends typical French style Convenient for Harrogate centre Good selection for lunch at areasonable price - must try dinner where the menu looks far better
Good fish and chip takeaway Not quite by the Sea but worth the walk Nice staff and very clean and tidy

An awesome building which is always impressive An ideal church for an atheist The drinks are good but over-priced as is the food It is worth calling in for a drink if you are close by but not a destination restaurant as it once was

Standard but tad expensive pub grub Friendly & very quick service Beer 4 20 lamb shank was succulent 14 95 lemon sponge 5 95 Only 1 stop on free 423 bus from T5 & short walk from nearby big hotels Thistle Premier Inn T5 etc
Good food but portions too large Service was very good and pub was clean Also plenty of car parking space

We visited with 2 friends last night Service was very slow eventually we had to ask for a menu 30 minutes after ordering we were told the starter my wife had ordered had run out could she chose another   she ordered the leek and potato soup Unfortunately when it did arrive she was unable to eat it due to it being very over peppered That said the fillet steak and fish and chips were cooked to perfection some of the best meals we have had out in a while Just need to get the service sorted we weren t even asked if we wanted desserts and it would be a great place to eat

I ve been to Gaucho few times and it is always the same The ambient is nice not great the service good good wine selection and very good meat but the experience is not worth the price they charge you Also the side orders were not really good chips badly fried and mushroom too salty  So average with good meet but expensive for what it is

Went to visit the architecture of the hotel which was closed off for a new years eve package The place looked dead at 700 PP We walked into the bar and got a lot of very strange looks although we were smartly dressed We were not the only ones other customers mainly walkers also got funny looks I asked for a drinks menu and almost thought they were going to say can you afford to drink here Hot chocolate was very good though nice atmosphere toilets are amazing if not confusing as they seem to me linked

We chose the Founders as we were meeting friends for lunch and it was convenient for both of us despite some of the reviews on TA saying that the food was hit and miss  It was a hot Sunday afternoon and many people were enjoying the terrace with fine views over the Thames to the city I d booked a table a few days in advance and had asked for a high chair this wasn t at our table when we arrived but was quickly rectified The waitress was patient with us as we were a little slow to order 3 of our party had the Tower 42 burger and my wife and I had the steak and ale pie  The food didn t take long to arrive and there were plenty of chips with the burgers which were tasty Our steak and ale pie however was very disappointing We expected the pie to be homemade but this was something you d get from a chip shop and really disappointing There wasn t enough vegetables and the runner beans were old tough and stringy  We did order ice creams but after waiting for ages cancelled the order and left As a place for drinks great but I would not eat there as the food is expensive and not very nice

Genuinly can not predict the outcome Been here a few times now and one second we have a lovely simply outstanding dish from a good menu  and then we wait a week for our next course which is simply substandard Do not recommened if your with children

It s been well documented that Wetherspoons had decided not to have the traditional Christmas dinner on the Festive menu this year outrage across the media as the British public were in shock and anger of not being able to have a full turkey and veg dinner with a pint for 6 99 - I admit I was one of them  For the past 5-6 years I ve met an old colleague for this traditional lunch and even though we thought of voting with our feet and try Debenhams research done we decided to continue our annual pilgrimage to the Roebuck Ok I admit I do use more than once a year but the same thing happens 2-3 deep at the bar this at 1pm with only 2-3 staff serving no sense of who is next leads to chaos and frustration flip that to how quick the food comes the quality for the price and the price you have to decide for yourself  Overall what you see is what you get - but for me this time one star less for Mr Wetherspoon and his chain - standards slipping

Warm and friendly people Obviously popular with locals On site parking was a very big plus Food was good but not especially so A good place to go after a rugby match for easy parking and reliable food

The 100 character minimum is rather inconvenient in this case as I would be happy to say simply adequate but I shall expand The Rusty Cutter is a long established Beefeater whose menu is indeed adequate Service was actually very attentive and pleasant with our waitress putting in a lot of effort although she was not clear whether they still sold sparkling mineral water Nachos could have been much more lovingly prepared but had plenty of flavours My partner s mixed grill included a steak which had gone considerably beyond the requested rare  I had ultimate fries which were very good but I challenge their existence as an alternative Surely the crisper on the outside and fluffier on the inside should be standard Are we to understand that regular fries are somehow sub-standard Perhaps they are for people who inhale food more than they chew it My plate-sized gammon steak was OK but peas had obviously been frozen to which I do not object but not made the full transition to hot to which I do  We were glad to have arrived before a substantial Sunday crowd but everybody seemed to be getting served Like I say adequate

Right off the bat so Maidstone is not necessarily well known for star restaurants We lived in London for 10 years in Fulham  before moving near Maidstone and have developed a sophisticated Palate with visits to many starred restaurants dotted across London When I read the reviews here that the food is perfect and excellent  I have to strongly disagree It s actually really average  However I do think the staff are really friendly and the place has a nice decor and a good atmosphere Perfect for a drink or a coffee & croissant I d give it a 4 or even a 5 on the basis of those points  So if you are like us who can clearly tell the difference between amazing average and bad food and expect very good food here - I warn you not to listen to the reviews here about the food and definitely lower your expectations
A thorough pleasant but un-inspiring meal which in fairness was all that was required Very competent friendly service Busy and rather noisy - a typical perfectly acceptable pub restaurant
Having said that the seats are really comfy and sound quality is good  if only they were a bit less preoccupied with being cool and hip
Dined here after reading all the good reviews Service was fine but the menu lacks any real hot curries that I could try I would go again as it has a nice and relaxed atmosphere

stopped here for convenience as good location on side of busy road into cornwall was friendly enough and had locals and tourists side by side food was average but for the size and numbers was acceptable I would stop again

I ve used this chippy for years having lived in Matlock most of my life and the only thing that lets it down is the consistency of the fish quality in particular the cod  sometimes you can get an absolutely delicious piece of battered cod nice and crisp with fleshy white meat other times the same fish can be a bit grey and slimy but cooked  We ve also had the odd occasions where the chips have been decidedly gritty other times perfectly done Prices are fairly average for fish and chips I normally have small fish small chips and a battered sausage which comes to around a fiver Service is good or at least I should say service has improved significantly over the past couple of years at least  We never choose to eat inside as the tables are those fixed ones with fixed chairs a bit like a military canteen  They could probably do a whole lot more with this place to make it more inviting for seated diners Will re-review in another year to see if any changes occur

We came here on a Saturday evening with a strict instruction that we had to vacate the table by a certain time even though we arrived 40 minutes early   As a result the service was lightning fast and rushed  The menu is different and interesting - nice to see some unusual choices - however the reality is less exciting - the portions are very small and there is an element of style over substance the Eton Mess must reflect a 90 profit margin    It was approx 50ish per head without wine or drinks and really needs to decide if its an upmarket eatery or a trendy bistro as it was not worth the money  however the major problem was service - surly staff and some basic errors made it a less than upmarket experience  The whole evening felt as if the place was newly opened and they were still experimenting - it was packed so there is clearly room for something more interesting in Bristol than the usual restaurants  We won t rush back - and though it is expensive and interesting not a safe option for a special event

Overall a good experience  I have been here so many time and very happy with everything  All the staff were very friendly I also took a friend for lunch today and very disappointed with my seafood bucani  It s like it was off  the seafood taste disgusting and it was very smell I even let my friend tried she almost throw up I didn t complain to waitress or anything because it wasn t theirs faults I m not sure I m I will go back there again now
all the courses at our table were tasty and in nice portions but the restaurant is quite pricey  8 for generic starter or dessert and 15-25 for a main

Went at lunch time and was seated immediately Had to wait an hour for the food but got free dessert Food was average but plentiful Kids menu great and lots for them to do like cinema screen and outdoor play area Cheap enough but you get what you pay for Cake selection good and also available to take away

Found the food to be excellent and the service was OK The restaurant does seem to lack atmosphere We were a party of 3 and were sat in an alcove with another table of 8 people The only other busy area of the restaurant was another alcove around by the gents toilet This made the place feel very empty The lighting is so bright you can actually feel the heat coming off the bulbs the staff tried to dim the lights without much success In contrast the lighting in the gents toilet was very dim All in all a nice meal but not sure I would rush back

Why oh why does this happen  6 months ago we had a delicious roast with a very good portion size Sunday 6th Dec we visit for my wifes birthday and i couldnt believe the amount of meat beef on the plate Half the amount too the previous visit One small slice Its was nicely cooked But there is no need for this  Customers expect something for their money at least i do Why do restaurants reduce portion sizes I know why you want too make more money  We were so hungry we just ate I thought the value was okay last visit for a roast but this was not So you get average score Sort this out you will lose customers

Saw the menu outside and decided to give it a go Ordered the fish soup waitress nice girl came back - no Fish Soup  Whats soup of the day  I ask    There s no soup at all she said ok One fish platter and one seabass and prawns please There s no fish she says Man shouts from the kitchen We haven t had our delivery yet  Now this is Thursday at 1pm We are on the FISH QUAY Couple of metres in any direction are fish shops within 100 yards there are more fish suppliers than anyone could want and here there is NO FISH  Ok then Potato skins - yes now we re getting somewhere Spaghetti Bolognese please with Tagliatelle and the cuna pasta with Spaghetti She comes back rather sheepishly and tells me there is no Tagliatelli So I have Spaghetti  I have never ever visited an Italian restaurant that did not have Tagliatelli So the food arrived The potato skins were very nice - cooked just as I like them with 2 tasty dips The pasta dishes were really nice pasta cooked perfectly and with a generous helping of sauce We had Ice Cream next as it was part of the special lunch menu again very tasty So what to make of the place I asked for a business card so that next time I can call and see if the Fish delivery has arrived If it has then I may well return and see if they cook the fish as well as the pasta A few minutes later a group arrived and ordered the fish & Chips with Mushy Peas    and got it   Theres no need to have what must have been frozen fish on the quayside in North Shields  On the plus side cutlery and glasses were clean the salt and pepper pots worked and the toilet facilities although small were acceptable They could do so much better with what seems like very little effort
We called in for a beer - it s exactly what you want in a pub staff are friendly and the place has a busy but reasonable ambience

I ve been to Hache a few times now and it s always good  It does usually take a decent amount of time to navigate the menu because there are so many good options But the cheese burger is always good value the Louisiana is probably one of the best
Went to Trattorias for Christmas lunch there was no Christmas atmosphere just like having a normal lunch and the staff seamed to all be walking round with long faces

Unfortunately small portions are no longer available The portion is now too big and is cold before half eaten I hate wasting food It was my weekly treat especially as a coeliac sufferer they are gluten free I am very disappointed The cost is also 25 dearer I hope I can find another gluten free fish and chips

The food and service are good once you get seated  unfortunately for some reason this one doesn t accept bookings so you have to turn up and out your name down on a waiting list  The more cynical amongst you might think that this is designed to make you but a few extra drinks  The bar area is nice but was very busy and we couldn t get a seat so had to sit outside  In fairness though this was a Saturday night  We arrived and gave our names and then had a pint  and we were seated soon afterwards so perhaps a 25 30 minute wait which wasn t too bad  Food is good and a wide range and reasonably priced  salad bar OK but just didn t seem as good as on previous visits

Called on on Sunday at it s business as usual dirty tables that need clearing  food ok drinks the best thing about it and the reason most people go it s needs some atmosphere as it could be really good

Me & the girlfriend decided to reserve a table for an evening meal at Carluccios so I rang up to do so & was told that they could take no more bookings for that evening but if I was to turn up then they would find us a table Bizarre as this seems we were immediately seated on our arrival as there were plenty of free tables  Immediately on being seated we noticed the horrendous communal salt
