sitting on the table Why restaurants do this is beyond me as I certainly don t want to put salt on my food that other peoples fingers have been in  The waiter was very pleasant throughout our whole time in the restaurant & seemed very knowledgeable on what was on offer We opted for the savoury bread tin to munch with whilst we decided on the rest of the evenings food It arrived quickly with a variety of bread to choose from & complete with a small dish of balsamic dipping oil Some of the bread was ok none of it was good enough to want to order it again  & some of it was plain old stale & not appealing at all  For a starter we ordered the Mozzarella Fuza melting Buffalo mozzarella roasted peppers sliced Parma ham and rocket  I asked if this could be shared between the two of us It duly arrived in plentiful style on one big plate & with two small serving plates It was very nice as the ham was of a high standard However a little more roasted pepper would have been good as there was only a couple of slithers served with the dish  For the main meal the Trio di pasta was decided upon This gave us the option of choosing any 3 of the 12 pasta dishes & having them served as a taster option between the two of us We decided upon the spicy italian sausage with penne pasta the home-made meatballs with pasta ribbons and a mixture of mushrooms with egg pappardelle pasta All three were fine but nothing was outstandingly tasty Of the three we thought the mushroom dish was by far the tastiest & would happily order this one again as a main meal on its own The meatball dish seemed a little bland as the tomato sauce was almost tasteless however the meatballs were fine  Desert was possibly the highlight of the meal We chose a delicious fruit tart with italian ice cream & a gorgeous cherry sundae The fruit tart was of a particular high standard as the pastry was very crisp & packed full with a variety of fresh fruit  The bill was roughly 50 for the entire evening which included a couple of drinks each too So a reasonable price for three courses Overall it was a good evenings meal out Not the best we ve had but not the worst either We would happily return to try some of the meat dishes next time

Have eaten at this Chaophraya once before for a special occasion and it was a fantastic experience and the food was excellent THIS TIME the food was average for the the expensive price charged and everything seemed hurried to get you in and out quickly to free the table Food  The Thai Green Chicken Curry was tasty but was spoilt by the lack of Chicken it contained It probably had less then a third of a Chicken breast in and only a couple of slices of vegetables so it was mostly liquid so seemed more like a soup The Asian Platter starter again tasty but spoilt as the portion was tiny for the 20 price

My son and I went to the Great Nepalese basically because we were hungary and I had eaten there many years ago and enjoyed it The food was still great and for London reasonably priced about 40 for lunch for two including drinks  But the d€÷cor was sadly and shabbily neglected and the toilets down a steep staircase were in a dank basement The walls of the restaurant were covered in commendations from food critics and celebrities some dating back to 1983 and possibly earlier I d certainly go back for the food but not I m afraid for the elegance of the ambience I wouldn t take a person with disabilities who might need the lavatory

The food here is great value for money tastes great and freshly made so I cant fault the food but  the service is another story the staff are not fluent in English and some times food can take a while to reach you staff are friendly but the poor guys working there have minimal understanding of the English language and etiquette so if you do go to eat here do be prepared to wait a while or order in advanced  The decor is moderate nothing too fancy but not the worst with comfortable seating and tables  I would recommend for the food but not for the service

The food was ok a bit bland but not oily It claims to have Sri lankan dishes but just naming a few dishes after some Sri Lankan towns does not mean they are Sri Lankan dishes A big disappointment for me as I wanted Sri Lankan food The good thing was that at the end of the meal we were given a free drink on the house A nice touch So overall I would say that if you fancy a curry and are in Wymondham then give it a go but dont expect a stunning gourmet experience

had the special menu one afternoon evening the pie was nice as was the mash onion gravy needed to be slightly runnier to be of use as it didn t poor out of the jug overall it was a nice quick meal for a decent price the cake after was great as always

The food is ok but seems to be a little down on how it used to be and is could be called bland  But its great for a party and makes up for the average food best to go in a bunch its great for a fun night with friends

I like this place a lot see my review of July BUT there are worrying signs It is deservedly busy but the quality of service is creaking This Sunday lunch table not ready on time 40 minutes after we arrived before we saw any food order for Coffe forgotten and where have the friendly and attentive staff gone Certainly not behind the bar - of at least six staff on duty only one appeared to be doing any serving Saving grace still excellent food Stop trying to cram every cover you can through the door and focus on quality not volume and you will stay a special place to visit

This is your average Wetherspoons pub A good choice of beers and lagers The food is OK and good value for the price Some people expect too much sometimes if you remember where you are and what you are paying you will not be disappointed

Sharing plates small cramped tables shambolic service and primitive wine list I see one of this at any other corner nowadays Extra point for food which is as good as it should be for the price pity for the wine list that makes you feel like not drinking
A very nice restaurant with limited menu at modest prices The staff were very friendly and available when needed I will go back

You can t fault the food its good  However as a dining experience it leaves a lot to be desired  The restaurant is really a conveyor belt of people from dawn until it closes late at night  All shapes sizes families with kids in every conceivable kind of dress code assembles in the restaurant during the day  It s busy predominantly with tourists obviously directed in its direction by their hotel concierge s The service is indifferent to say the least and it is a long time since I have been in a restaurant and asked to vacate my table by one of what appears to be several managers working in house after only occupying the table for an hour and a quarter  This I was told so that they could set it up for the next customers and the table needed to be vacated  It has a reputation as one of the go to restaurants in London not for me I m afraid there are much more convivial places to eat without the ridiculous hustle bustle of the this place

A group of us visited this tea room for lunch Most of our drinks arrived but without milk for the tea and coffee After several minutes I managed to catch the eye of a busy staff member to ask for some milk She didn t seem very happy about this and she placed it unceremoniously on our table without an apology  Most of our food arrived promptly However after several minutes both my soup and my wife s tea still had not arrived Again we had to approach a member of staff to ask for these items  I have to say that the soup was very nice and it came with a cheese scone which is a welcome touch  However our dining experience was somewhat marred by the service we received Some members of staff particularly two older women didn t seem at all interested I would not return

we used to go here as our first option when arriving at our caravan a good place to get our fill before relaxing for the night we went there recently  and came away slightly disappointed  we thought the value and quality didn t seem the same as in the past

The food was very tasty The monk fish dish we ordered had a good quantity of fish but the other meat dishes did not have a decent amount of meat  Price was a bit high for Chinese  Service was very good

Went for lunch one Sunday and overall it was pretty average My wife had a jacket potato which was nice but nothing special I had the mixed grill the meat was well cooked and nice though the peas were stone cold and tomato not much warmer  It wasn t a bad experience but at the same time nothing special Not too expensive and it has nice decor inside
If you want to serve food AND barista style coffee in the morning you need to double your baristas and machines Queue very long and slow moving

Bar was horrendous to get served at due to barstaff not dealing with the queue in a normal matter Moved tables and informed the bar staff of the new table number which they didn t pass onto the kitchen staff All resolved in the end however  Other than that food was good for the pricing plenty of seating area inside and out
We have been a few times but it s hit and miss We have had good meals and just ok meals Not much choice in real ales which is a bit disappointed A wide rarity of meals and a good atmosphere

We went to the Hungry Horse Bath house because of the Hungry Horse MTGG reputation for good food at a good price We discovered it on a previous trip from Seaton whixh is a round trip pf about 60 miles 7 of us in the party and we were greeted by the young very pleasent bar tender who arranged a table tab and served our drinks took the food order which was quite a work up with 7 people who were not sure of what was what The food was average to good but did not arrive hot and the steaks which we asked for as med to well done wewe still quite rare After returning them for some more time under the grill they came back still underdone but this of course is a matter of preference not bad cookery The one thing that did consern us however was a lady who we took to be the manageress held court at a table near the bar with constant conversations with staff who were off duty and she did not seem to be aware of much around her going wrong She was like the overseer sitting on the chair and chatting Quite off putting really Another thing which allarmed me in particular was the sight of whar we presumed to be the chef in a vey greying white chefs jacket with an oven cloth in his hands drying dishes behind the bar   Didn t look hygenic to me at all The place was heaing in the summer when we were here last but it was quiet on our visit with only 5 tables being used The desserts were nice as for me desserts always are and after another glasse of excellent beer we left somewhat disappointed  75 00 lighter and not that impressed Back to Kingsteignton in the future There was little atmosphere There was little to draw us back for more so it is probably the last time we go there which is a shame for the bar tender who was the only one who REALLY tried for us He seemed to be everywhere and doing everything

Walked in off the street last night after trying and failing to find anywhere to eat without a booking so the fact we managed get a decent meal means I have to not embellish the review score just because we managed to eat a decent meal  On my meal alone I would ve been tempted to give it 4 stars as it was lovely I loved the special of ribs jerk chicken and chips with slaw and for the price it s certainly competitive for London My 3 companions also very much liked their meals But I ve given it 3 stars as I have a few niggling issues with the place namely the fact that you could barely taste the alcohol in the pricey cocktails  I ordered a long island iced tea but was told that they had run out of gin so I asked for them to make up for it with extra vodka and rum but when I got my drink it only had a slight taste of vodka and LOTS of ice My girlfriend ordered a banana daiquiri and it basically tasted like a watered down pina colada It seems it would take a very long and very expensive time to get tipsy from the cocktails if that was your desire

Our food was most excellent - dumplings for a starter were some of the best I d had in a long time Plus the other two dishes were very good Unfortunately we ordered a side dish of soft noodles for our 3-year old boy which was listed along with the steamed and fried rice in the menu The price was 6 50 and it was just a plate of plain thin noodles Strangely if you want it with bean sprouts it only costs 6 00 This dish seemed very overpriced given that a plate of rice is only 2

I liked the basement style of the restaurant I understand that it is dark to create a special feeling to eating in the restaurant but it was a bit too dark for my liking I could not clearly see my food I also think the music was too loud everyone in the restaurant was shouting in order to have a conversation

Good range of light lunches including excellent crab sandwiches Service was excellent and friendly good choice of cold or hot drinks A little pricey for what you get and you will definitely need cash in case your bill comes to less than 20

Had a really nice meal service good nice atmosphere although we didn t book they found us a table Did tell the waiter that we wanted the sauce for steaks separate but they put them over the steaks no big deal Ask for the bill to find drinks bill was for 31 70p but only had 1pt larger at 3 80p 2 pts bitter at 7 20p 4 brandys at 14 40p splash of coke was 1 80p large dash 1 50P medium dash very over priced for just 7 drinks I could get 2 litres of coke for the price of a dash I know pubs have overheads but just think drinks we re well over priced

Plenty of room in the downstairs stairs sitting area to have a quite meeting really convenient Coffee break very good but lacked a lunchtime offering like pret really needs a revamp cakes etc are ok but they are not having the option for lunch if they did I would probably have had lunch there as well

I wanted to go here for a while It was a bit late on a Monday and I felt like the staff just wanted to go home The waiter sort of rushed our order and was suggesting dishes before we d had the chance to read the menu He did this for starters main and desert The food was good But I always fine Thai food good I have to say it was not better than any other Thai Restaurant that I have been to in London The desert was cold and its meant to be warm In the end we left sensing the staff wanted to go home

After hearing a lot about this place I thought I d give it a try I went with my family and although I was initially impressed by what they did with the place I soon changed my mind When my non alcoholic mocktail arrived I was disgusted There was a piece of mint and a caterpillar crawling up the side I raised the issue with one of the staff and the attitude of this staff member was disgusting I will not be paying this place a visit again

Yes the place was busy yes the fish and chips were good but not that good and we did feel a bit like herde cattle I think perhaps the best way to have these f and cs is probably as a take away It is probably a bit presumptuous to say they are the best just seems they are taking you a bit for granted
Pub too small for the number of customers food average and overpriced decor poor Car park exit dangerous No idea how it is rated 4th in Whitley Bay Area

Very lively atmosphere but perhaps as a victim of it s own success seating was very crowded by the bar Although the rest of the pub looked a little more spacious We didn t eat here in the end Not sure about the whole idea of serving food on wooden boards and chips in old enamel cup- just a bit cheesy I think but the food looked delicious and the service appeared well organised and I would certainly be inclined to go back to eat Great feature was the absence of intrusive music Allowing conversation and the vibrancy of the customers to carry the atmosphere

Went for breakfast after reading good reviews Waited a while for order to be taken but was busy Cooked breakfast had ok bacon but lots of white fat but quite a poor sausage tasted more economy than locally sourced Brown toast was nice

We had been to this S&W before on the way back from the Wildlife Centre which is excellent and on Sunday we were in the mood for some mexican food and remembered this place Good bits - friendly quirky plenty for a 2 year old to look out  good service at the start of the meal Bad bits - For 15 pounds I expect the chicken burrito to be amazing - it was ordinary and very overpriced I work in Canary Wharf where you can sit down and have a Burrito at Wahaca for 6 95 and that is steak not chicken The other bad bits I could excuse but for the record they were really slow service at the end and despite us asking twice for a balloon - nothing turned up Unsure whether I would go back but probably will but be very selective and stick to a burger

I would like to start by offering my unreserved praise for the serving staff Despite our reservation being at midday and therefore being extremely busy the staff were courteous and friendly at all times  I was with the same BPF party as Elizabeth D her review is below or above mine and I wholeheartedly agree with her statements about the staff and their help with a large mixed ability group  However the food was to be blunt awful Even at 15 for two courses I would still expect fresh food All of my food was cooked from frozen and tasted bland The turkey and stuffing was dry and tasteless the potatoes were average and the Yorkshire Pudding was overcooked I didn t have veg  Oh and the gravy could have been mistaken for treacle though the staff did water it down for some of our  fussier members  The only enjoyable part of the meal barring the company was the dessert Which is understandable since you d actually have to be trying to mess up an ice cream sundae  Now I ve been told that the Apple Cart usually has good food so maybe my poor experience was because of the extremely busy period Christmas holidays and midday and the fact that there was a deal on the Christmas meal 2 courses for 2 - 30 & 3 courses for 2 - 35 and therefore corners were cut to save on time & money  I hope that this will be my sole mixed erring on negative review of the Apple Cart and I can come back here and report nothing but a positive experience  Oh and as a last note for the Apple Cart I think I saw about 4-5 front of house staff rushing around dealing with over 50 customers Do yourself your staff and your customers a favor and bring in a few more hands to help out over the Xmas period  Visit was on the 17th of December 2016 between 12 30pm and 4 30pm

My first visit to the Cricks under its new owners early on a Saturday evening to celebrate my sons birthday I had heard good reports lately but over not impressed At the bar they had run out of Stella Fosters and Stowford We bought a bottle of Australian Chardonnay for the meal but later after dining found that was the last bottle The menu looked similar to other pubs in Alresford with similar prices The starters and mains were served in good time and ample portions although the french fries advertised on the menu as seasoned were more like those served in McDonalds but not as well cooked My wives Sticky toffee pudding was served cold with a strange taste there was no sign of a waitress to complain to untill all other sweets were eaten No charge was made for the offending pudding

The Clipper Restaurant is located in the centre of Padstow harbour and has the potential to be a great venue The entrance via the ice cream parlour does nothing to enhance the ambience of the restaurant However the interior is quite spacious and pleasantly furnished although a refurbishment could make a big improvement  I was warned not to have great expectations about the meal and therefore chose prawns in shells as a starter and fish chips and garden peas as a main course Both courses were good with large portions The wine was very ordinary The service and presentation was OK In general terms I would describe the food as average pub food There is a lack of atmosphere It would seem unnecessary to book a table This is not a romantic venue but vast improvements and vision could change things dramatically

Myself and 9 mates went to this pub last night The first three real ales we asked for were either coming soon or had just run out The forth one we were told that it would be ready in 10 minutes as they were cleaning the pipes Surely this should be done before opening As we had already been waiting for 15 minutes to be served as there was only one person serving with a good 25 people waiting we decided to leave and go to The Blue Anchor
A standard KFC if you ve had KFC before you know what to expect Good service plenty of parking nothing to complain about

Very nice and modern appearance and staff were very attentive  We decided on the 4 course lunch for 25 which appeared to be good value noting the location and it was a Rick Stein restaurant  The start of black risotto with crayfish was to die for however after that it went downhill I can eat fish which still a little soft but the pollock was very under cooked in the middle and think if I put it back in the sea it might have had a chance of life The bread & butter pudding is a fav of mine but this was horrid The top had been blow torched and just tasted burnt and as for the fruit it was a game of can you spot a sultana   In summary think there s work to do if Rick wants to make his mark on Poole especially as there s plenty of competition to choose from Very disappointing noting this was meant to be a fish specialist restaurant

Just been for a family meal at this restaurant and felt a little let down with the experience We arrived 10 minutes after opening and had to wait to be seated as there was only one member if staff We were seated and our orders were taken quite quickly When the pizza s arrived there was a couple of mistakes with the order these were rectified quickly enough The pizza itself was nice and plenty of salad but when it came to desert for my son they never had the lollies that he wanted and we were pretty much dismissed when asking for anything else The amount of money that we paid i thought the service would have been a little better

After visiting many of the company restaurants we had high expectations about the alchemist on NYS The place itself is very nice so much bigger then spinningfield The place is very warm and welcoming We was given a nice booth witched overlooked the restaurant When I made my order there was a small error with my order and they had no problem in changing it to make sure I was happy so thank you very much for this However I thought they made a point clear it was my fault and not the restaurant They did make me feel uncomfortable for a bit as they kept coming over to see if we was happy  But over all it s a very nice pace good food and good service

Good food and service at a fair price Not licensed to serve alcohol Some dishes rather salty but all very tasty Open kitchen can be viewed Rather basic surroundings but very clean Will definitely visit again

Prices were steep but we used a Gourmet card which gives 2 for 1 on at least 2 courses food only  Ordered a drink with no ice and it came with ice I commented on this and she said she d change it for me which was appreciated  I didn t like the look of all the starters so I asked what the soup of the day was - it was mushroom and blue cheese Exotic choice but I don t like blue cheese but she told me it had gone down well with other people I tried it and I didn t really enjoy it but that s my own fault for not liking too much food  The starters came were cleared and the mains came very quickly Excellent service each time delivered by the same woman who knew we had ordered using a Gourmet card But then no sign of her  she d disappeared It was ages before someone came and asked if we wanted puddings but phrased it as I suppose you won t really want puddings will you which was really negative  We did and asked to see the menu We ordered our puddings and it took an age to come The waitress had no idea what the fruit crumble was no what flavour ice cream they sold new staff maybe  Eventually the puddings came but then nobody came to clear up the plates for ages I was tempted to just walk out but we called someone over and asked for the bill Sure enough the bill came again after waiting about 5 minutes and there was no Gourmet discount attached lack of communication after the first lovely waitress had disappeared  The bill was changed merely crossed out a few items and recalculated the price rather than reprint a receipt  and we paid and left It took 2 hours for 3 courses The place was dead so not sure why it took so long Felt like really poor service No goodbyes from the staff or thankyous either  Overall food pricey shoddy service but a couple of members of staff seemed pleasant but the food was elegantly laid out and looked the part I wouldn t recommend Kennedy s just because of the prices and the poor service

The food at the Smoke House was really good We had pork scratchings with guacomole followed by pulled pork and spiced roast brisket on a dual platter arrangement We only needed one portion of each of these between the two of us and we washed it down with large glasses of really nice American beer  The food is great and different but you couldn t well I couldn t eat it often And the place would definitely not suit vegetarians  The service was iffy When we arrived they would not let us choose out table and they said that the one we wanted was already booked even though there were several tables where we indicated some not laid up This was all so off-hand and so patently unreasonable that I would have left immediately if I hadn t wanted to avoid embarrassing my partner By the end of our meal they had removed the cutlery from some more of the tables and there was no sign of anyone else coming into the restaurant  The food wasn t really quick but it didn t take all that long to come to the table and as I say it was certainly worth the wait We shall probably go and look at it again if only to see if they have done anything about staff training

Whilst visiting family in Cleethorpes we went to the wellow so one of our sons could watch a football match on sky Service was okay the food was disappointing a bit like glorified ready meals I would not eat here again

Went for dinner and thought the menu sounded exciting - a British spin on tapas style  Portions were small even for a tapas style but the food was tasty The beef carpaccio was taken straight from a freezer and was served on the plate frozen The dishes looked quite pretty but a lot of it is just visual garnish e g a few peas or beans scattered across the plate  Style over substance mostly  Thought it was a bit overpriced as we ordered a lot of sharing plates more than 3 per person and still left hungry  Probably better as a lunch venue than for dinner

Unfortunately a typical average restaurant There is so much that attracted me to this restaurant but at the end of the day the food is only adequate Only nice feature is the introduction of Dim Sum which to be fair is pretty good so for that I would recommend
Could do with an upgrade Food is just standard and i think it is mainly microwaved Staff are not that friendly

Called in for morning pint Cheery service and reasonable pint Good large seating area outside Returned about 6pm for a couple of steak an chips with mushrooms Sat inside and served food within 15 minutes It was fine and not much left on our plates Would not rave about the place but no real complaints either Staff worked hard to serve everyone and clear tables when they were clearly very busy and under pressure

Certainly the place to come for fish and for evening out when in Folkestone a stylist and well laid out restaurant with inside and outside tables providing a great panoramic view of the harbour The service was very good and the amusing spoof shipping forecast suited an ex-mariner like me  Sadly whilst the food was OK it did not match the expectations provided by the decor and service of the restaurant Paying extra for potatoes or chips I found annoying and not what you expect in a fish restaurant and bumped up the price beyond value for the quality Although to be fair the balance of flavours on the plate was good it was not sufficiently exciting to produce a wow factor for the price  Next time I will take my aperitif in the bar above the restaurant to enjoy the view and ambience and then eat in the Smoke House restaurant just behind It has the same management a view of the harbour and good fish and chips at around half the price

A funny one The restaurant is relatively new and decorated to a reasonable standard On a Friday night it had a good buzz to it Expectations were high as we sat down  Food was average with portions definitely on the smaller side Waiting staff were smart with their ties but not particularly knowledgeable even when it came to the drinks  Having had 3 courses didn t leave feeling full Didn t feel desperate to revisit Plenty of better Indian places to visit

Good quality Indian food with a large menu  Staff helpful and friendly  Main criticism is the lack of a waiting area while the food is being cooked with no adequate seating  Not everyone likes to wait in a nearby pub like me

We visited here on our way home after doing the Way of the Roses ride I m a big fan of Wetherspoons restaurants and I ve never tried a curry from one until this visit  The Beef curry that we got was OK - there was plenty of beef in there for sure but in no way can they compete with Indian restaurants if they serve Poppadums that are out of a packet Naan breads that taste like the ones you buy in vacuum packed bags in supermarkets - and rice that tastes like a microwave meal  It was about 7 for the meal including a pint which is very good value the beer was excellent  - however serving plastic food is never a good idea - you compare this to the steaks that they serve up at Wetherspoons which on some occassions is comparable to high quality restaurants then I do wonder why they bother with curries  The staff were great and I don t blame the pub here as its a chain and they have to serve the food on the menu - having said all this I ve had a few worse curries in Indian curry houses I know if I d ordered a steak or mixed grill it would have been far better

My wife and I had an evening meal and breakfast the following day Only one waiter working during the evening and although he worked hard he needed extra staff could have used a hand Food was very nice cooked perfectly and came out in good time Only issue was the wait for the bill but can t be blamed on the waiter Breakfast the following day was chaotic X2 members of staff waiting same waiter from the previous day was one Had to ask for more plates for the hot food had to ask for butter food was warm Wasn t the same as Premier Inn breakfasts we ve had before seemed lost Would have the evening meal again but probably not the breakfast

I have eaten here before and the food was exceptional however this was a couple of years ago and in the summer this time was winter and very quiet maybe just a bad day waited a long time for food and when it finally came out it was warm not hot shame as this place has a great location right on the coast perfect for boat watching even in winter I will return but hope this was a one off

We stayed in the New Inn for two nights so had dinner and breakfast there twice  Starting with the best item the food was good value you got a lot for the price and the meat was excellent I believe locally sourced  This was evident at breakfast as well There were a few well-kept ales available and a good selection of wines  The rooms also were very nicely decorated and furnished - comfortable bed small but serviceable telly clean and modern bathroom we were happy to spend time chilling out in there between excursions Which was lucky because the decor of the main pub was pretty haphazard and soul-less think Ikea dining tables with chintzy chandelier lights and I would not have wanted to spend any additional time there  What makes this an average rating though was the service - immediately upon arrival literally bags-in-hand we were told that we had to book the restaurant in case they booked up No offer was made to hold a table for ten minutes while we thought about it and in the end there were plenty of spare tables throughout the evening The big-and-comfortable food on sale just didn t really match up with what was then a rather formal approach to service Upon leaving we were told checkout time was 10am despite them knowing that the booking site we used was telling everyone it was 11am - something I feel they could have sorted out by now and no attempt was made to accommodate us further  I d look elsewhere first if I was back in the area - although I d come in for lunch or dinner if I was close

Went here for a late lunch on Sunday It wasn t actually that busy considering the great weather The service was a total shambles  The lady who took our drinks order left the order at the bar then went home as it was the end of her shift followed by at least 2 of her colleagues The drinks  a round of 7 mainly soft drinks took over 15 minutes to come with the bread ordered at the same time an additional 10 minutes  We finally managed to place a food order which took a further age to come  On the whole the food was actually rather good although I had to go in search of sauces and further drinks  This may sound like I m moaning I m not however if you open up a place for people to come and eat make sure you have enough staff to cope with demand
If you ve been to a Costa before you pretty much know what our experience was like This one is a little cramped and the service somewhat slow compared to others otherwise OK

LOADS OF HYPE amazing sea bass ceviche AMAZING Like I wanted it 10x over  that was about it  Then you realise that the art is crappy graffiti behind foggy cracked plexi-glass Then you go to the toilets and OH GOD THE HORROR there are NEON SPLATTER PAINITNGS that GLOW IN THE DARK So after vomiting everything you ve already eaten you hope to fill up on some solid bites But thats precisely all that you get bites One piece of steak One bite of sushi A half bite of chicken  It gets sadder as the dinner goes on Don t believe the hype They put purple cubey things on your food and all the gays in Soho get excited and Instagram it Go somewhere with substance

As curry lovers we went here based on their inclusion in the the Independents top 50 curry houses during a recent week in Cornwall  Had barely sat down when the very surly and brusque waiter don t think I saw a single smile all night asked for our drinks order as he handd me the winelist - ok so we went on a quiet Tuesday out of season but still Drinks VERY pricey 7 50 for a pint of lager and an archers and lemonade had cheaper in London  Food wasn t bad on a par with a reasonable local curry house if more expensive but nothing to write home about In fairness portions were generous but top 50 UK not based on our experience  Nice decor but despite bein one of only 5 tables we were still seated out in the middle of the room at a tiny table felt a bit like school dinners On balance doubt we d return

Used this place a few times over the years It is what you would expect from a set price buffet The food is not WOW in good or bad way it s good for what you pay Free refill s on hot an cold soft drinks are priced a bit high 2-50 but if you have a few then caching All in all don t expect the ritz But can not go wrong for a cheap ish all you can eat Oh and the puds are good

Being visitors to the area and living very far away from the sea we had a craving for seafood and looking for a good place to go we thought this would be a great option We decided to treat ourselves to the sharing seafood platter and for 64 we were expecting great things The lobster and crabmeat ramekins were the stars of the show - exceptionally yummy However the prawn skewers were very over cooked and quite tasteless and the bread was very hard We also had salad on the platter unfortunately this was underneath a hot lobster covered in butter - needless to say it was pretty inedible by the time we were served it I think it is nice food which could be better which is overpriced due to the location Friendly staff and great location made up for it

Went for a pizza as reward for my youngest doing well at the start of her high school year and we went on 29 09 2014 Had to wait for a table Busy for a Monday So that was a good sign We had a starter of garlic bread and very nice it was to We ordered a pepperoni pizza and hot sausage pizza They turned up in good time except the pepperoni was minus the pepperoni Waitress admited it was her fault Mine was kept warm why hers was re cooked They tasted very nice We both agreed that where we sat was like sitting in the hallway And adjacent to the kitchen Service was good Remember to get a voucher off internet Twenty five off food bill

As with other reviews I thought this was a little expensive but more on that later   The menu offers quite a good choice if started and mains We opted to share the fish tikka made with salmon We were a little disappointed to find only 2 small pieces of fish one each at 5 25 but what we had was tasty enough  For mains my partner had a king prawn and spinach biryani  11 95 - a larger portion and I had my favourite - chicken Achari  9 95 with 3 x chapattis Both meals were very tasty and the chapattis were warm light and fluffy We swilled this down with a pint of Becks and a jug of water  The service was good and our waiter was pleasantly chatty We were shocked when the bill arrived at 38 25 OK we re from Bradford where there s a bit more competition and prices are keener but I felt the starters and mains were overpriced But and it was a big BUT I never looked at the price of the chapattis when ordering I knew what I wanted and was gobsmacked to find they were 1 60 EACH   Yes that s 4 80 for three chapattis These were the most expensive I ve ever come across and as I said at the start left a bitter taste  Overall a nice place with decent staff and clean toilets but one of the most expensive curries we ve ever had The price of the chapattis would probably stop me going back The mains were overpriced by a couple of pounds each as was the starter Such a shame - even our waiter was a little embarrassed

This is a decent restaurant no question The staff and the venue are charming and the prices reasonable The fact that there is a three month wait for a table on a Saturday night is however unfathomable The food just ain t that good  If you are going to serve a piece of grilled or pan-fried fish with no sauce or even a herb butter you do need to cook it properly and ensure that the skin is crispy and delightful or removed altogether Even then you are pushing your luck in a place that presumably considers itself to be a fine dining environment My turbot was barely cooked slightly translucent in the middle with floppy grey skin that did the dish no favours at all This is pretty basic stuff and is completely incompatible with a  1 in Cambridge rating Following this with an ice cream dessert that was plainly not home-made did not improve the situation  Having said all that I would recommend Il Piccolo Mondo because its plus points are many just don t expect to be blown away by the culinary experience

Location The pub is surrounded by trees and there is a lake adjacent to the pub Great car park with lots of space  Atmosphere The pub has a cosy atmosphere tastefully decorated with tapestry and paintings  Food The food is good and comes with generous portion  Service The service is mediocre I have to walk around and look for the menu myself  Price The food is reasonably priced With an average price of 18 per person for an evening meal

Not knowing Bury St Edmunds we d asked for a recommendation for somewhere to dine at lunchtime and One Cannon Brewery was suggested It was good that food was still being served at 2 15 pm when we arrived A reasonable Rioja is served by the glass If I were a beer drinker I m sure that the ales produced on site would have been excellent  The food was ok but there was nothing outstanding though portion sizes were reasonable

We were here in September before heading off to the town hall for a comedy night First time visitors The service was nice and friendly and were seated within minutes of arrival It was buffet night The food was in plentiful supply as you would expect The food itself was pleasant enough The pricing matched it You get what you pay for

Having enjoyed food service and atmosphere on previous visits this time we were very disappointed Service was slow and occasionally forgetful  food was acceptable but not always very hot and it was generally very noisy making it difficult to chat It seems they have relaxed their standards a bit too far so unfortunately we are unlikely to return

Visited with a group of colleagues on a Thursday evening On entry we were shown to our pre-booked table with no fuss to be presented with a bewildering array of menus and flyers for various deals and offers to look through Thankfully some of the party had visited before and were able to guide we first-timers through the choices on offer  Our drinks order was taken quickly but they seemed to take an age to arrive which was odd since the place wasn t at all busy and sadly this set the pattern for the rest of the evening  We ordered starters and mains The starters took 35 minutes to arrive The food itself was average at best but perhaps this is to be expected from a chain There was another sizeable wait for the mains and when they arrived it was obvious that some of them had been sitting around under heat lamps for a while so the kitchen co-ordination was perhaps somewhat lacking The portion size of the mains was perhaps a little on the small side for the big eaters in the party but that s always a matter of personal opinion  Overall an average experience and if we hadn t been in a group with lots to talk about I think the slowness of the service would have been more of an issue On our experience this certainly isn t a place to go if you re in a hurry
The menu limited but the food is good It s a handy place to stop for a meal if you are visiting Furness General Hospital Give it a go the food is at a reasonable price

We visited the Devonshire on a Wednesday evening and having read so many positive reviews on TA was looking forward to eating here  Upon arrival I noticed an unpleasant odour in the restaurant it was hard to describe but certainly an organic smell While not untidy or overtly dirty it is my opinion that the eating area would benefit from a good clean the wall adjacent to our table was covered in food stains  The menu offers a decent variety of honest British food at reasonable prices On arrival the food is served in generous portions and is of an adequate standard  The serving staff were very pleasant helpful and friendly but the service a little on the slow side especially considering the restaurant was not busy  Not an awful experience but not good enough to encourage a return visit

Our coffee and cakes were very nice with good portion sizes But it was slightly ruined by the noisy preparation of food and drinks in the nearby kitchen pay area e g blending of smoothies milkshakes etc

Went simply becuase of the name and his past restaurants Never a good idea to rely on a name to give you the best experience especially when that person is not actually cooking Great location saw it in the daytime great views out to sea but we dined at night so no view which was ok Staff very welcoming and all very nice and experienced with good service Small restaurant perhaps 20 tables 4 which were empty all night  Very dissapointed in the decor basic white chairs which had been bought from a jumble sale job lot all shapes and sizes and had been hand-painted and now need a re-paint Basic cheap white tables In fact the whole place looked like it had been done on the cheap except the prices Bread came on a wooden platter but no side plates Very small menu and had a job choosing something we liked Sardine starter was bland Main course of sea bass was very good my wife said I had the Gooose which was also very good The pudding menu was not very appertising so we didn t have any The wine list printed on brown board was hard to read in the soft light but very little choice and on the expensive side as was a bottle of Hix beer We went out of our way to eat there and I wouldn t make the effort again much better and cheaper places to eat in Devon The price although fairly expensive wouldn t have been an issue if we had the WHOW factor but it was just a expensive evening meal

It s simple By far the best beer in Paignton In frequent visits the staff have been both helpful and friendly But   the door staff  security  bouncer is rude and aggressive So much so we won t be returning Not even sure why Henry s have him at the door - your customers tend to be quiet types who like a good pint
Not bad but not as good as it makes itself out to be Good service nice atmosphere disapointed with the food Pricy for what it was

Dropped in for Sunday lunch  lovely garden area warm and cosy inside  lovely staff and great service sadly let down by rather bland Roast Beef  rather tasteless roast potatoes rather dry and again tasteless  Chef lets down what is otherwise a lovely place for a drink  or possibly more important the meat supplied is tasteless doesn t excuse dry tasting roast potatoes
Several of the items on the main menu including the specials weren t available Had to go with fourth   choice Food was ok but menu is a bit repetitive after all this time and needs a revamp

visited the Garden Centre only to use tyhe cafe which my memory served me from the past had been very good Had fish and chips which was considering the quality overpriced Service was good and the staff were friendly Pity the food wasn t as good as I remember

This bar used to be a grotty estate pub but it has been bought out and had a makeover The owners are really trying have done the place up serve good food put on live music and extended the opening hours Please try it they deserve to succeed

Food absolutely amazing We sat near the kitchen and marveled at what was coming out Some amazing venison lamb et al made it s way to our table Strong cocktails when we sat down as well Downside was service We had to ask for a wine list and for long periods of our lunch were ignored by the waiting staff

Visit on a sunday afternoon it was very busy at time of visit 3 45pm  As our guests had not arrived by that time we partook in a drink service at the bar was efficient We were shown to our table in due course The menu was read bearing in mind that this is a Steakhouse not all the steaks were available Our order was taken with amendments which were agreed with the kitchen via the waitress There was a considerable wait before our meal was served not as ordered agreed I accept the resaurant was busy but no excuse to get order wrong DONOT dine here if you are in a hurry but that said the food itself was good Car park full and no parking on roadway double yellow lines alround

Arrived at Restaurant at 9pm there were 7 of us I think the gentleman was a manager who served us short stocky man very abrupt we all thought we had done something to upset him Infact it turned out to be a joke We started to order the dished by number he quickly and very abruptly said we need names of dishes not numbers then we were scared to upset him any more he kept coming over to us asking us if we had finished the Bill came to 93 I asked him for a receipt he replied this receipt is for us I said I want to see what we have had he was very taken back If you want redness this is a good restaurant to come to The food was average nothing special the nan was good apart from that I don t think we will be revisiting

This is basic functional food and served quickly  It was ok nothing flash but was good value for money  The service was good - the waitress was very attentive  Would we go again - probably yes if we wanted a quick burger
Nice layout & decor throughout which lends itself to the character of the building Food can be a bit variable in quality which lets it down however

Party of 16 arrived for a Birthday celebration  orders taken  drinks arrived - Then a problem in the kitchen called for a complete evacuation - So we were unable to try the Ribs - Better luck next time

My partner and I visited here on Thursday 26th September The food was excellent however this was spoiled by the rude staff and poor customer service As we were paying nearly 30 for our food and visiting Rick Steins we were expecting better I would recommend buying your food to take away save money plus no rude staff

I stayed here for 2 nights The room was quite dated and slightly cold There was a portable heater available though The staff were pleasant The food was lovely and the breakfast a real surprise I was informed that the plans are to upgrade the rooms and also the Wi-Fi which I was unable to connect to in my room Overall a pleasant stay and with improvements this Hotel will be superb as it is on the doorstep of town

not been there for a recently Customer service needs an upgrade there is 1 friendly middle aged chap Its right next to the bus when i get off from work and im always starving Late night venue Expect nothing special in customer service but pizzas fresh and tasty

Difficult to rate the restaurant in one word  Food excellent service bad We have been to San Carlo across the road many times Friends have urged to try Cicchetti - so we did arriving early 12 noon as suggested so it wasn t busy We had drinks and 3 starters which all appeared promptly in sequence - fine - but then I don t know what went wrong I had 3 glasses of a nice Sicilian red wine whilst waiting for the next course - our main course During the one hour that we waited occasional apologies were made for the delay Unfortunately we had other things to do in Manchester and it reached a point where we asked for the bill and were preparing to leave without having the main course This was enough as though by magic for the food to arrive We were offered drinks and coffee on the house to be fair but I am afraid time was pressing and we had to go Whilst I can understand that people like the atmosphere and the food I did get the feeling that perhaps regular customers were getting more attention than us Tables adjacent to us although arriving later ate and left before our main course arrived It is unfair to judge a place on one visit - they all have off days - but I feel that in the long term we will be happier across the road in the main restaurant Pity I am sure it s great fun with friends if you have the time
Good value More of a quick Chinaton-like restaurant Food solid with nasi goreng and beef rendang etc Staff not too attentive but quick Can recommend if loo

Noisy couldn t make ourselves heard Staff were fine and helpful but the food was not great With the choice of Japanese restaurants in London this one come well down my list Try Defune now that is good
Very attentive staff Had a tasty burger and unlimited ultimate chips Good value for the money Had a large menu with good variety
Food was good but had to ask twice for hot air to be switched on it was cold and radiators where not on It spoilt a lazy afternoon with our two grandchildren
food was ok nothing more hard to determine what to order when the staff inform you of everything being the best on the street the manager often tries a hard sell on the door

We were looking forward to this as it was advertising their carvery as superior The actual pub and restaurant had been done up very nicely the greeting was pleasant and the FOH staff polite Unfortunately that is really where the good finishes the carvery was on offer at an adult price or a childs price 4 cheaper than the adult but if you ordered the chicken the portion was the same size 1 2 a chicken When this was questioned we were told well we have only been open a couple of days and are still finding our feet All the Yorkshire puddings were burnt and the poor lad on the carvery was trying to cut the meat with blunt knives which even his steel could not put an edge on I can only say good luck to them and we will not be visiting again Being told at the door to pay at the bar and get your ticket then queue for your food and then find a table is not really the way forward Having been in catering a number of years you need to get 1 your margins right from the moment you start selling and 2 your customer service correct Superior this was not and if it carries on the way it was this Sunday I think it will also be shutting down again as you can get a similar meal after being seated at a number of other places in Gosport for a fair bit less

The undeniably large selection of dishes on the menu card comes at a price Not in monetary terms but if you like fresh vegetables with your Sunday roast this is not the place for you Reasonable value for money but not the kind of cooking you d rave to your friends about Sometimes extremely noisy due to this being a meeting spot for groups going to away sports fixtures Sky Sports TV doesn t help as it s mainly soccer that they show
Stopped Over for fireworks show just a little walk about 6mins from the beach Has a small bar attached to it Only down side is no free parking

We booked this restaurant in advance on the basis of the web page as one of our party wanted a seafood platter Legends offer a menu that covers most bases so a varied choice for the others The restaurant itself was comfortable but very noisy as it was full and it was too cold to sit outside The outside tables in the summer must be very pleasant with views across the bay On ordering we were advised it would be about a 30 minute wait as they were busy As they advertise their food as freshly cooked I could understand some waiting time However this ended up being a 45 minute wait for the meal far too long considering what we ordered was mostly pre-prepared anyway A seafood platter a burger and a hot rock steak  This is where the meal becomes divided the seafood platter was very tasty and well prepared and both the burger and the steak were very tasty Sue said it was the best steak she had ever tasted and she usually rates her meals on the vegetables However the salad accompaniment to the meals was an afterthought and the fries that came with the burger were just that out of a bag tasteless fries not the nice chunky chips you see on the web page and the new potato option was overcooked and watery After waiting that long for the meal I did not want to have to wait again for more potatoes so we ate what we could of them A shame as they were nice potatoes  All in all a nice gimmick with the hot rocks and care taken with the main ingredients but let down by a lack of attention to detail with the peripheries and the wait

Been coming here over the years many times since it opened as we live walking distance around the corner Its clean staff smart and service of but the food is not right I held back writing this as thought the previous 2 meals were just so so and less than the norm but went again the other night and place was relatively quiet but food was just the same  For get the wooden boards and chips presented in wire mess  Its basic food that is overpriced  Really hope the new Toby opening focusses their mind because I think the building is great

Breathtaking view Clearly the selling point of Aqua Shard But 12 quid for a salad Seriously I wouldn t be willing to accept such a price even if the salad was twice the size and tastier which wasn t the case Nevertheless the place has a good vibe and is perfect for a romantic date
A group of us visited this restaurant and the food was of good quality fresh and reasonably priced However the service was slow and we were made to feel as though we were an inconvenience
The sushi was very good The environment amazing as far as decoration is consenerd A bit slow the service which was the only downside to it

I have walked past Kench & Bibesy every single morning and evening since they opened on the 20th November Today was the first time they had a menu outside to help sell their wares  Three sandwiches @ 5 each and some soup @ similar  Roast pork with crackling Beef Brisket with mustard sauce Lamb - didn t read any further as I wanted some tasty brisket  Nice fast service from the very helpful waiter front of house Both myself self confessed foodie of all things meaty and my lunch partner good Jewish boy knows his brisket bother ordered the brisket and a coke  Firstly the venue is nice across the road from Smithfields market so no excuse to not have great produce The inside is very minimal but in a nice way compact tables which are big enough  All orders are from the chalk boards so maybe they change their menu on a regular basis On the tables we found a very long drinks menu on the pricey side for the area but some nice variations on cocktails  The food arrived really quick which when lunching in the city is essential the torpedo rolls were filled with a nice amount of beef a few leaves and nothing else There was talk of a mustard sauce and confirmation of a mustard sauce from the waiter front of house chap Such little taste we asked for English mustard to add some extra flavour  The problems here are as follows  The bun was far too dry for the amount of beef They need a much tastier cooking sauce to accompany the beef when you re cooking meat for a very long time you lose the taste of the meat somewhat and you have to rely on putting flavour into the sauce with the meat to keep the whole mixture tasty and enjoyable I don t think the meat was bad but it could have been SO much more flavoursome Once you have that sauce meat combo right you can put it on a dry sponge and people will eat it like it s their last meal On this occasion the bun was so dry that when it got wet from the cooking sauce it broke up so you finish the meal licking your fingers but not in the way I want to be licking my fingers  The situation with the meat could be turned around in a night if the kitchen choose another recipe for their brisket  However my major gripe is with the price of soft drinks There is no way on earth anywhere should be charging 3 05 for a small coke which was mainly ice This is not fair to customers and it is not the route a new restaurant wants to be going Yes 5 for a hot sandwich is good value in London and in fairness outside of London also By filling the restaurant with people hungry for GOOD hot sandwich fillings and charging 1 less for a coke they should be onto a winner  Hopefully they will sort these small problems out because I would like to eat there on a more regular basis as long as the meat and sauce is of a better quality taste and the price of a coke comes down to around the 2 mark  this place could pack out on a regular basis like the chinese restaurant that used to fill these walls but only if they pick up their game and put a bit more love into the quality of the brisket  The other meats could have been fantastic but with the brisket which is the wettest of the three feeling dry in that bun What must the others have been like I d urge people to try this place out as this is only two mens views Given more customers and more time to pick it up a bit and they might just be the next best thing in the area  p s they have a downstairs bar which is behind a secret wall and looks a little like a sex dungeon I d go back for that

Went on a Saturday evening recently not booked and found it not too busy We were welcomed and shown to a table quite quickly  I had celeriac soup with three macadamia nuts which I could see poking through the soup such was the lack of depth It was very tasty but only just covered the bottom of the soup bowl so I finished it within no more than two minutes and at 5 50 was a real profit maker Twice as much would have been a small portion Wife had scallops which she said were very nice  I had kippers for a main course and it was difficult to remove the main bone strip and then I found out they were chewy and nearly cold so sent them back Several minutes later two new ones appeared looking exactly the same as the others and again I had the same difficulty removing the main bone strip and the same unappetising texture of the flesh They were almost certainly cooked beforehand and then frozen being reheated in a microwave probably They certainly weren t fresh as I am an avid kipper fan and know a decent one when I see and taste it and even thawed pre-frozen fresh kippers will do the business They need to change tack on this because the quality was very poor  Chips and courgette fritters were nicely presented and hot Wife had fish and chips which again she said was quite good  Service was good cost was reasonable but let down by a small portion of soup and a pair of not very nice kippers  Not as good as our last visit 18 months ago

A great location in Covent Garden We ate early in the evening and the service was prompt and the staff were very friendly The food was average The chips weren t good- they were McDonalds style fries without the potato The choice of beers was really poor as well Its ok for a quick snack but that s all

Quit smoking in January and was looking forward to experiencing all the different tastes on offer in Fuittion Blended fruit juices were good but not worth the 3 you pay for them Had a sit down lunch and as nice as the Chicken bacon and avocado sandwich was was it worth the money No sorry it wasn t especially as I had no option of a hot side and I detest Coleslaw The waiter gave me every option under the sun with regards to seasoning mayo butter etc which was understandable seeing as they offer GF and non dairy options but I d rather he asked I had any dietary first before going into his long spiel I applaud them for what they re doing but it s not for me

Arrived just after the main Sunday lunch rush but managed to find a couple of tables to pull together You order food at the bar and were advised it may take about 40 minutes to be served OK We had starters and mostly Sunday Roasts with one Thai Green Curry for our party of 9 The food arrived quite quickly was good standard pub grub and the prices were very good No frill service but it was what it was and the staff were very pleasant Drink prices for beers and wine were quite reasonable Nice Cr€—me Brulee to follow
Nothing offensive here with a nice menu reasonable interior and a nice small garden for those 2 weeks a year it gets used Never had a bad meal and do go back Surprised to see bad reviews

We had a lovely meal at Yummy s the food was generally good the service attentive but not enough staff to cope with the number of customers as two people seemed to be looking after two rooms between them  Even so it was an enjoyable evening until I got the bill For what we had it seemed very expensive indeed so we won t be returning

I was in town on a business trip and the barman at the hotel recommend this Indian restaurant I went with a colleague The place was busy and we were shown to our table by a grumpy rude waiter The menu was surprisingly cheap and had all the traditional dished My lamb bhuna was good and my colleague chicken tika was similarly good

Views are amazing wouldn t go there for breakfast as the service is poor and it s help yourself to Starbucks type food and drink If it s cold outside be sure to wrap up as there is no heating in the viewing areas  Good for a free visit but book in advance
This Pizza Hut isn t as hygienic as others The buffet table has food everywhere  The food is ok but still not as good but staff are very friendly

My wife and I ate here a few years ago while travelling home I really looked forward to a post races meal last Sunday and repeating a lovely experience Our meals arrived surprisingly quickly indicating either a microwave or that we were given the same order as the couple next to us or both My steak and kidney was excessively hot with burnt pastry indicating microwave My wife s medallions of fillet had a superb sauce but the provenance of fillet was doubtful her creme brule was hot on the top and cold on the bottom  This was disappointing as the staff were pleasant and tried very hard The ambience is excellent and the availability of well kept Robinsons was appreciated I was disposed to be delighted but was disappointed
Nothing too special I just didn t taste the authenticity of the curries  good for budget and lots of choices

I don t really know where to start with this place I ve been in before for a light bite with family and it food was OK but came here on Friday evening and the food was pretty terrible if I m honest  I had the antipasti for a starter which was decent however one slice of Parma ham two slices salami and 3 small slices of chorizo was a little bit tight for the price It was also served with what seemed to be focaccia bread Oliver oil and balsamic dip & a few olives but it just wasn t eye catching at all I love Italian food and this just left something to be desired  Moving on to the real disaster   I ordered the T-bone steak off of the specials menu which also came with a pepper corn sauce It looked good but upon cutting into the steak I instantly knew it wasn t going to taste great The steak wasn t seasoned prior to cooking & was virtually well done just a tiny hint of pink I then found we had no pepper grinder on our table so we had to take one off an empty table The biggest let down was the pepper corn sauce The sauce it self looked ok but was almost white and I dipped a small slice of steak into it and found it to taste like nothing other than double cream with a few black peppercorns added I make peppercorn sauce at home a lot and this is not how a peppercorn sauce should be I am lucky that I didn t pour it on my meal as it would of been totally inedible  The service was good apart from two check backs within two minutes by two difference people and the setting was nice I will visit again but not sure if I ll be ordering or just coming for a drink  On a lighter note my partner did seem to have no issues and really enjoyed her food  Good effort on presentation but lacking where it counts

Was taken here for a meeting recently and enjoyed a perfectly pleasant brunch in a simple down to earth little cafe Friendly staff a happy ambience a fairly decent coffee efficient service - I could have no complaints at all especially not after the chocolate cake I greedily took away with me The interior treads a fairly well worn path that has been rolled out countless times and the menu was a bit small but then how many choices does a man need All very pleasant and simple but effective
Great food limited atmosphere below average staff not very friendly or attentive But food was very good and ok value for money Nice reburb

Popped into this establishment to grab a quick bite to eat as it looked bright and welcoming from the outside with its large windows and colourful decor They have invested in good quality signage etc in an area of a town which is decidedly scruffy Ordered a very straightforward open tuna & spring onion sandwich at 4 95 and was disappointed that it came as an unremarkable single slice of brown bread with a relatively small portion of filling but an adequate separate serving of coleslaw which to be fair was fresh and ok  Either the price point for this sandwich or the portion size is completely wrong It baffles me why a sandwich lounge in this of all locations would skimp on portion size when there is little or no occasional passing trade Whilst the furniture inside is an interesting mix of retro & shabby-chic they appear to have chosen some chairs which are completely impractical for sitting on to eat  Not something I would repeat as a matter of course when I could have had a larger better sandwich for 3 less in the local bakery

One of the most expensive burgers in the area Not that good Not that bad but nothing special  We were in a party of 12 and everyone was a bit disappointed with the food  The problem is that there is so much great options round here for this type of food  The best thing was the service though Really good  So I wont be back and would probably recommend other places if you know the area

The Lowndes Arms   of Whaddon in rural Buckinghamshire is a typical earthy rustic 16th century pub Rising up from a narrow village high street it gives miles of great views overlooking the surrounding rolling countryside Having passed  the arms   several times on our often scenic journey from Milton Keynes to Wendover we decided to stop for Sunday roast The recommendations we had received from a friend were well founded The roast was very good and plentiful The menu choices for a Sunday were more varied than most The host was welcoming and attentive and the service prompt The only negative was the frontage which gives the impression of dowdiness due to its age However we were glad we stopped and we will be stopping again
Went to a wedding the buffet was good for the budget but the chicken drumsticks werent cooked properly and the toilets decor was old toilets were cooked till temp cooked until

As one of my earlier reviews will attest I am big fan of the Edinburgh restaurant of this chain This one unfortunately was not as good In clich€÷d footballing terms it was a meal of two halves  When we arrived we were informed that there had been a power cut in the kitchen and they were working on getting it fixed We were fine with this and happily retreated to the bar for cocktails whilst the electricians did their thing  After about 20 minutes we were moved to the dining room and our lovely waitress explained that the power was back on but a couple of the dishes would not be available Again this was not a problem We ordered the meat plank for three a selection of artisan bread and then all of us ordered pasta dishes for our mains  The antipasti plank was perfect The bread and oil was delicious Then as the plates were cleared away we were informed that we now had a new waiter He meant well but he would not leave us alone Whilst I acknowledge that it is better than being ignored this level of over attentiveness was interrupting our conversations and it became quite annoying  The pasta dishes were bland and watery which was extremely disappointing We were given a free sorbet for dessert a gold membership perk but this didn t really make up for pasta  I ll still go back to the Edinburgh restaurant but I ll probably give this one a miss in the future

if you in the area the bar is a nice spot for a drink The restaurant menu frankly tries too hard to cover too many bases  so you can have Japanese sashimi Thai satay Spanish ham cigarettes  just for starters Lobster mac n cheese as ok  but I d say keep it simple  The grilled rib eye steak was good
This is good value food and very much a diner and not a restaurant It has a lovely selection of desserts on show made fresh onsite

Have visited several times before and enjoyed the location and ambience of this restaurant This time disappointed by new menu and especially the beef and ale pie which was mushy with a filling more like soup which had soaked into the pastry Other quests meals were much more acceptable Very helpful and informative staff but food took at least 45minutes to arrive from order being placed

On first impression it is a newly built pub very well set out and comfortable  The staff in general can not do enough for you That is the good bit Lets get this straight it is a cheep pub trying to compete with Weatherspoons and it has not quite done it We have been there several times with mixed results reading other reviews I would agree serving the food really hot seems to be the main problem  So my tip would be do not go when it is really busy and it should be O K

Went with a group of friends at the end of July  cocktails and beers were spot on but we were all a bit underwhelmed by the food  The burgers which we d gone for lacked seasoning and were pretty tasteless as was the fish kebab very watery when you bit into it  The starters ribs were v good though  I ll definitely give it another go as looking at the other reviews it seems we might have hit in on an off night

Popped into here for a drink earlier today -- nice enough place and good company Staff were friendly and chatty but I did find out those unfortunate enough to be working on Christmas Day won t be getting anything to eat unless they pay full price for it -- Christmas Menu only on Christmas Day makes sense but you re telling me they can t even provide a free meal for their staff working on Christmas Day Please bear this in mind for next year s booking while you re enjoying your Christmas meal at the Longboat obviously run by Mr & Mrs Scrooge Longface not Longboat Nice selection of lagers btw

We only ate here once The owner or manager was sweeping up outside and just kept going throughout our meal The food was ok tasty enough but you could make any of it yourself with a trip to the supermarket the sweeping generated dust which of course didnt make for a fantastic atmosphere Certainly not the worst place to eat in Polperro but I guess you have to pick your moment to eat around their chores not the other way round as you d assume

All started well the waiting staff attentive and the starters were good and generous in size  As the meal progressed both the quality of the food and the service seemed to drop away Guinea hen was fine but the potato puree too sticky and stodgy for me Took a while to get the dessert & tea coffee ordered The chocolate mousse seemed to be quantity over quality which didn t seem to be the French way  but despite its size it was still consumed before the hot drinks arrived Somewhat cheeky to automatically add 12 5 service onto the bill which I didn t challenge only due to the circumstances of the evening it was my birthday - but not quite the treat hoped for

We visited the restaurant in the early evening and found it absolutely heaving It seems to be a popular spot and the reviews here confirm this The decoration was fresh and contemporary with a relaxed atmosphere all round  Some people have pointed out its unusual location the building used to be a pub of some description and given the proximity to the motorway and the relatively few Thai restaurants in the area then it scores highly in this respect  Our food was served quickly though the staff managed to mix our order up nevertheless they resolved this without fuss The dishes were well sized and quite tasty but nothing that I haven t sampled before and certainly not good enough to justify a price of 14 for a sharing starter and 13 for a Salmon dish especially when rice and noodles were extra  I was also a little miffed to find a very average glass of white wine was nearly 6 Im no snob but neither have I forgotten the concept of value for money  Ultimately a bill of 52 for two people soured what was otherwise an enjoyable experience Perhaps that s me being old fashioned
We like to go here normally to view the football The bar staff are very friendly and are quick to serve Prices are average Crowd can be a little bit off putting but overall I would go back

Stopped in here for a quick glass of wine - the decor was nicely done the staff were lovely the wine was very reasonably priced  10 50 for 2 large Gavi s however the place smelled vile It smelled of a combination of grease stale beer and smoke Even after we left we still smelled it for the rest of the evening - what a shame as everything else was so good
Had a meal there with friends in mid-September 2014 just not terribly impressed with this restaurant as the food was fairly bland but it was still quite pricey
Wasn t as good as I d heard Pizza was very similar to a pancake Staff were very nice though I would go again to see if it is any different
Being a Wetherspoon s pub it will always be popular but with the Tower of London close by there is a constant flow of customers

In November we used a Groupon to go to Beachview Greek restauarant a very short amble from this place if we hadn t done that then maybe I would give 4 dots to Steki s however being so close and so similar one has to draw comparisons and Steki s comes up short   Again we used a Groupon and at Groupon prices it is very good indeed however there is no way I would eat here at standard prices The king prawn starter in tomato sauce was very good and the meatballs kef something that I had were fine Mousakka was good but little aubergine or meat mostly bechemel and only 3 potatoes 5 on online photo and the Lamb Giouvetsi although tasty was a small portion especially compared to the photo online I may sound a bit picky but it all looked a bit meagre I have only just looked at the photos so I wasn t going there with expectations if I had seen the photos first and paid full price I would have been even more aggrieved  Service was friendly and relatively swift especially given that it was only one waitress to quite a few diners Drinks are a fair price  Don t get me wrong this place is better than ok but walk a few more metres to the bottom of Preston Street and you can get a seaview slightly bigger portions and slightly lower prices
very smart decor and overall nice interior but is a karaoke pub and very noisy relatively cheap and cheerful

The newly refurbished Red Lion has had a new lease of life and was looking like a quintessentially English village pub on a chilly Saturday night a week before Christmas The quality of the make over has transformed a nice village pub into a quality new eatery just outside the county town  Good real ale and nicely prepared gin and tonic in balloon glasses Good selection of contemporary dishes on the menu Overall the food was good but not excellent - no sauce with the pheasant and a cold waffle showed lack of attention to detail which ultimately let down what could have been an excellent evening I hope the owners get this sorted quickly so that other clientele don t feel slightly disappointed too

Popped in for a Ham Egg and Chips and a pint Well worth it had Cameron s Strongarm bitter on in Devon made my day Good value decent pub grub nice ham loads of chips will certainly go again Good beer good food clean toilets
I agree with the reviewer below and am not sure why this pace would get five stars The food was mediocre at best bland at worst What s more it s quite pricy

Went there last minute on a Saturday night with my boyfriend - I had the 2 course set menu which was good value about 13 for bruschetta & steak with was well cooked  My boyfriend however had the seafood risotto - AVOID at all costs Looked smelt & tasted like uncle Ben s rice - rice was hard & not cooked & so liquid to hold it together When we said we weren t going to pay for it the waitress grabbed the bowl off the table & marched off before banging around in the kitchen Worst risotto ever seen  Would not go back
