The food is at best cheap and cheerful boarders get ping and ding staff are helpful and friendly decor and fittings are seriously in need of a refit the locals if that what they are travellers are a rowdy bunch and it was virtually empty at 8 30 at night so their noise was amplified through pub If you only want s quick drop in when your busy meal then this place will do

If you like a subway then you get what you expect nothing more nothing less customer service isnt the best when Ive been served  But not been in a few months so might have changed least friendly place ive been to for sandwiches I now go to other shops that are more cheery and welcoming for my sandwiches and coffee

Met up with friends for a meal at 6 25pm on a Tuesday night Warm welcome and shown to our table and told we could choose the daytime menu or the evening menu Our server was Sydonne what a loverly bubbly helpful lady and full credit to her We chose the daytime menu and starters then fish n chips as this was a bit cheaper Starters were fine but the fish was a bit grey and batter a bit soggy chips were great Saw some fish portions going out to people who had arrived later bigger size and looked better so guess that would be the evening menu So next time I would choose the dearer menu still great value and you get what you pay for

We had dinner with friends I had queen scallops to start which were over-cooked and served in a scallop shell on a plank of wood then had a burger as a main course which cam on a plank of wood with fries in a small bucket The burger was OK but the side salad I ordered never appeared I didn t dare have a dessert because of the risk of deforestation The sooner this fad for serving food on odd bits of wood dies out the better  I tried three of the beers with a sip of a fourth and I only liked one a special rather than one of the regular brews The rest seemed tired and lacking any depth of flavour

Had read very good reviews about this place and so was a bit disappointed by my visit  On arriving I noticed a couple eating some enormous looking burgers which made my mind up for me Closer inspection showed they were both eating their burgers with a knife and fork I decided to give the restaurant and not the couple the benefit of the doubt  Mistake Two bites in and the bun exploded This was a shame as the filling and chips were good but I wanted a hand held treat not a pile of mush on a breadboard  Mentioned the issue to the waiter but was pretty much fobbed off and I am fairly sure my criticism will not be passed to where it needs to get to Shame

If you love gardening and have lots of excess cash to waste this is the ideal place to go Very expensive in every area Nice place to look around though OK for a day out if you have young children But an OK experience

OK so there s nothing much decent around SE11 for breakfast brunch afternoon tea & cakes so this certain finds the market and explains its ever busy existence Tucked away in a quiet corner a stones throw from bustling Vauxhall Coffee shop by day with a cool modern mismatch of furniture and design If you re lucky get sofa & enjoy the boardgames or books to pass the afternoon by    however getting any seat is often a game of luck itself Definitely not for the coffee addict but a huge selection of delicious teas served in teapots and quirky china Cakes look delicious  This is a favourite brunch spot however since I ve been coming here the quality of food is slipping portion sizes small yet pricey once prime butcher-quality bacon & sausages now cheap and deep fried  The service is undoubtably this place s let down - inattentive unreliable and slow  In summary a once South meets East London gem that s loosing its shine
Good standard chippy and i ve tried a few Shuts a bit early for me but its a good place and does all the normal stuff with no fuss

I must admit to agreeing to some of the less than complimentary comments from other reviewers We did have to wait for a while but that s not a problem as it was clear they were busy The salad bar is always good but you can t muck up salad the meals are ok but nothing special They knew it was a family birthday bash but other than lighting a cake that we had bought with us they did nothing to make it special We have been there other times but at best the meals are mediocre other chain restaurants provide better quality value food
Dined here early Saturday evening fixed price menu  Food good service and ambience absurdly unrelaxed more like sitting in an understaffed emergency ward than a relaxed eaterie
Sorry to say Michelangelo in Prudhoe has closed its doors Food and service was ok but was not doing enough business to keep it going To much comptition

The decor certainly is appealing and the drinks are nice enough although my hot chocolate - or should I say cocoa-flavoured milk - was positively underwhelming But we couldn t get rid of the impression that the prices and overall attitude of the staff were far ahead of the quality of service delivered For example we overheard a rather unpleasant conversation where the customer complained about being charged extra for having requested additional bread because she wasn t given enough to be able to enjoy the spread that she had ordered Also when my brother went to the bathrooms he came back somewhat shocked and told us that a member of the kitchen staff did not wash his hands after having used the toilet A strange thing to have to mention in a review but for us certainly one of the important details that Macchiavelli seems to not be concerned about too much Shame

The problem I found with manna and most other vegetarian restaurants is that the dishes are all OK but would be much nicer if they had a bit of meat in them The food at manna is expensive and I can t say the flavour or imagination justifies it My main course was pasta a few slices of courgette and cherry tomatoes covered in cream  12 And that was the cheapest main Starters were 8 The setting was nice and the staff pleasant but I just don t think the price justified a pretty average meal
really nice food - if a bit on the pricey side

The price is ok  9 for basic burger and fries but the place is full of desperate hipsters They give you a roll of kitchen roll instead of napkins they don t have normal fries only sweet potato and they don t have normal condiments only fancy sauces All of which would be fine if it was blow your socks off amazing food But it was just food  I ve eaten at The Diner in soho which has a similar serving style but the food is much better and the vibe of the place is much nicer Boozy milkshakes weren t on All in all the most pretentious badly lit place I have ever eaten

I have being going there many times as take away with company discount and fidelity card the prices are good and the food is light and enjoyable When you sit down the prices go up no loyalty card and no company discount and a cheap decent meal become expensive and the service is far to be great Take away or go somewhere else
This restaurant was recommended to me Big double size restaurant Outside space in front nice but buy a Bus Stop on the Main Road [NOISY] Food ok Staff good OK

Gets very busy during the summer months and you must expect to wait up to 30 minutes for a table if you arrive between 6and 7 30 pm Menu is varied and the best for me is the unlimited salad bar don t bother with a starter as this is combined with all main courses

Revisited this place as it is a great place to meet friends and family  Now the colder weather s creeping in its big windows create a cold effect in the place and some additional heating would much improve the cosiness and overall enjoyment of everyone s visit No gripes about the food or service however  always great

I was part of a party of 15 to take Sunday lunch yesterday at the Kings Head about 12 30  The food was good but the poor waitress was completely overwhelmed There were 3 under 5s in our party and the meal took 2 hours for 2 courses in which time I took my toddler for several walks around the pub a trip to the garden and a stroll to the village shops  I had the roast beef which was cooked very well The potatoes were little hard but the other vegetables were just right The gravy was very tasty Unfortunately someone completely forgot my sister in law s main course  For desert I had the Sherry trifle which was delicious and a pleasingly large portion  All in all a mixed experience I m sure it would have been a lot better if it were not for the size of our booking

Nice tasting coffee overshadowed by the wait three people in front of me in the que and waited almost 10 minutes Didn t seem to be any sense of urgency about the staff would maybe go back if I saw through the window that there was no que

The last time I was here with with office folks the cheque was picked up by my boss This time I was here for some dessert and whiskey post dinner The Choc fudge pudding was just wonderful but the remaining items on the menu were not that appealing The Whiskey was over priced and the service charges were really high too Overall i would say go here only if you want to impress someone There was even a cover charge of 9 pounds on a Thursday night

We often drop in here before or after the local football match It isn t the most atmospheric of restaurants and the serving can be a bit chaotic especially when they are at full capacity as often happens before the evening matches last time we walked out as it was taking ages to get our order taken so we gave up & went down the road to another restaurant  There is a good selection on the menu-lots of various Asian food including crispy duck through to sushi which I ve never tried there  The spring roll starter size is generous & tasty I also often get the salt & pepper tofu which is usually very tasty but the time before last the last time we ate there was disappointing with little flavour again the place was full before a match so there was high demand on the kitchen  So a mixed review - worth a go but avoid match nights if possible

Ideal for food with atmosphere with friends however the food does not match the surroundings - could & should be hotter Had worse but don t expect gourmet food Can recommend the pulled pork sandwich though as the taste is divine - just needs to be served HOTTER
Nice welcome and friendly staff managed to fit us in without a reservation food was ok the dough balls and side salad were good but the pizza was average with a hard base

We were recommended this restaurant which sits right at the start of the pier We were told they sold the best fish and chips in town Sadly the local knowledge was faulty I wish I d checked with TripAdvisor first  The fish was OK although a bit expensive Like other reviewers I agree the chips were poor It seems those running this restaurant either never read their reviews or just can t be bothered to improve Sadly I expect they get so much casual trade they don t need to try that hard  It was a nice day so we were able to sit outside and enjoy the view which was the best part of the experience However I won t be back and suggest you give it a miss There must be better places in Southwold

We were on a boating holiday and decided to walk the 20 minutes or so from the boat to the pub after reading several reviews on Trip Advisor In summary the food was OK without being brilliant but did not have the same taste and satisfaction that other similar Broad Pubs offered You expect better for the price paid so we feel unanimous decision for party of 4 we did not receive value for money on this occasion A bit disappointing considering the long walk from the Broads Have had much better at less cost on the same holiday
24 hour service disliked the rain obviously outside

The food was good although they forgot one of our 8 strong groups meal so she had to wait Then when we revived bill there was a compulsory service charge of nearly 15 00 I wonder who really gains from the sevice charge and should be discretionary
The food here is excellent but the staff could have had the odd smile or two Maybe they were having an off day when we visited

Family visit Had a garlic tiger prawn starter which was excellent - but no bread served with it to soak up sauce and no finger bowl considering that it s messy to eat as prawns are partially in shells Adults ordered Lasagne whilst kids had pizza The lasagne had a very tasty sauce but was lacking meat Pizzas were excellent Kids loved the sticky toffee pudding   Tiramisu lacked taste and consistency other than creamy - certainly didn t taste of coffee or any alcohol Ordered a black coffee which was served far too hot and was weak Service was quick but place lacks atmosphere

Went for the lunch buffet at May Sum in Derby A very large room with high ceiling didn t immediately help the atmosphere particularly as it was only 10 full that day I have been told they employed a Feng Shui to decorate the place I d say get a second opinion May be better when they are more people at night And why was it so dimly lit inside Not a huge choice for lunch as reflected in the cheaper price compared to the 11 50 - 12 90 evening ticket - they do a whole Teppanyaki range later All the normal Chinese buffet favorites were to be had plus a couple of Thai ones A large mix of mostly deep fried starters though with a few kiddies snacks thrown in pizza cocktail sausage hash brown etc  The tempura veg was very nice though I went back for more of that Nice  A lot of the trays were half empty while I was there but did get to try virtually everything The Chinese curry was nice and spicy with a good consistency There were a couple of very tasty lamb dishes plus a blow your head off chilli dish The meals were marked spicy or mild so you knew what you were getting The Squid dish was lacking as was the sweet and sour Overall the quality of all the meat lamb chicken beef pork was tender and juicy Quite well cooked  I liked the range of sweets puddings in the traditional tiny portions Cakes fruit jelly But I normally go for ice cream Only one flavour I could find You add your own topping sauce  Service polite and speedy  A very reasonable 6 90 for food but with an expensive pint of Carling this went over 10 I ve given this 3 5 for lack of a good range of dishes couldn t see crispy seaweed or duck and no sushi but it all mostly tasted great and was well cooked A place to fill your belly and have a chat Don t take a book though as it will be too dark to read it

We went to this restaurant at about 9 30pm on a Saturday night after a long day worth of driving The menu seemed appetising and the atmosphere seemed lively even though we were tired and could do with some quiet time  We had two courses for starters the calamares and the mexican poppadoms The calamares seemed old and was not fresh and the mexican poppadoms although nice could have done with some sour cream as part of the dips The mains we had were the burrito and the churassco fiasca which is essentially a kebab with salad and casava chips The churassco was lovely finely cooked with some taste and the casava chips if you like that kind of thing was cooked through which is hard to do The burrito on the other hand was tasteless The chicken had very little flavour and the rice was really really bland  We did complain and the manager did come over and apologise there was no discount given either considering this was our first time to Las Iguanas  The fact the manager came over to apologise and explain a reason why the food was bad is a compliment to him The service we received was very good attentive and friendly I can not fault that at all  The atmosphere although lively probably wasn t what we needed that day The venue is a city centre location so if you are looking for a quiet meal and a drink this isn t the place If you are looking to move on out after a meal then this would be a good place to eat  Overall we were not impressed by the food which is what makes us go back to places Apparently we may get some discount tokens in the post if so we may give it another go otherwise probably not
The food was good I had Chateaubriand however - this is large amounts of beef steak cooked medium rare - it gave me upset stomach and led to intense stomach evacuation Not pleasant

Having had high recommendations we were somewhat disappointed 6 of us went for dinner including two Japanese guests Starters were fine Rib eye steak which was ordered med rare came up almost raw on one half and overcooked on the other half Two ordered pistachio cr€—me brulee which came up served in three half chicken shells on straw Did not taste of any pistachio and the accompanying shortbread was coated in caramel chocolate which was so sickly Not anything like any cr€—me brulee I have ever seen before and hopefully won t meet again  Service was a little slow as well Would not return

Nice food but very pricey though for what it is - unless you have a Merlin Pass which brings it a bit closer to normality Had some colouring bits to entertain the little ones which was helpful Staff seemed nice

Booked afternoon tea the service was very slow had to wait a long time for menus and to be served plus ordered champagne and waited nearly 45min and we had nearly finished our tea before it arrived Food was good and the view was amazing because of the slow service I only rate this 3 star it spolit the day slightly they need more staff to cater the size of the restaurant please note the 12 5 that they add to your bill including drinks

I went here with a couple of friends for tapas and the place looks lovely It was 7 45pm and there were only around 10 customers in the whole place and some of them were only drinking so we went to order food but for some bizarre reason they said it would be a 90 minute wait so we left

Visited The Venue over the Christmas period as we did a number of restaurants and in fairness I must say these were not the worst for the meal was fine but the service was poor The restaurant was half empty but the girl taking our order was lets say less than enthusiastic and although we did not have to wait long for our main meal it took ages to be served again with our dessert and then when it did arrive it was wrong We said nothing to avoid another long wait

I like this place in summer as you can sit outside in the covered area behind the pub and we have come here a number of times over the years Recent Sunday lunch roast was poor value though It came with two tiny roast potatoes with no crispness and a reheated taste Clearly they had run out Meat was OK but laid over a big dollop of mash which formed about a third of the entire dish Slow and odd service The waiter seemed annoyed that I asked him to wipe the sticky table when we arrived Lots of small children running about My wife had the fish which she said was nice So a mixed experience Quite a limited menu Will think twice before going back

They managed to find & book a table for 10 even after their allocation for bookings as already full - great service We arrived on time and were shown our table Then we had to join the bun fight at the bar to place our order We had to do this for everything we wished to order apart from desserts and coffee Not the most pleasant of experiences  Than we had to pay - had time for another drink at the bar while they manually typed the orders from the hand written tabs into the till The till roll did not have any itemised details other than the words drink & food  How were we supposed to check the details for a party of 10 Not a good experience and Trading Standards should look at that practice  However the food was good and the venue is very pleasant just not sure I want to repeat the visit

I ve eaten here 3 times most recently with 3 friends after a trip to the Chelsea Flower Show  We arrived slightly early on a Thursday evening and was told of a nice pub around the corner as our table wasn t ready  On arriving back we was seated and given menus We ordered a starter main each plus a bottle Sancere  We received an amous bouche shortly after but had to chase bread and this was served with the starters  On the waitress pouring the wine my friend asked whether the wine was vegetarian as many aren t and was told she wasn t sure She also said that there was a separate vegetarian wine list however that particular bottle she was unsure about - that surprised us as its a vegetarian restaurant If wine wasn t was the cheese I think I got the best starter and main but that s because I d dined there previously and knew what I was orderering The menu is hard to understand  The jump from 28 for 2 courses to 38 to add a 3rd course we felt was too high and we decided not to have a dessert My friends ordered another bottle of wine and the bill came to 211 for 4 people 2 courses each and 2 bottles of wine Which is on the higher end  In contrast me and my other half ate at the Gate restaurant in Angel the following lunch and had a great meal no booze for 28 including the 20 discount for national vegetarian week  All in all this was my 3rd visit but I wouldn t rush back plenty of other great options out there
The food is good but rather pricey It is very noisy if the place is more than half full They sell some interesting beer
Its a fish and chip shop so you get what it says on the tin  Good quality battered fish and chips I ate in and had the combo which was one hell of a plate full and was pretty damn good

Been a few times service really does depend on time of day and how busy they are I ve been early on and service was quick with drinks and average for food I ve also been when it s busy and service for drinks was slow and food was even slower

The fish was nicely fried light batter and not greasy The chips were good and the mushy peas properly cooked The staff though let the place down impatient and bordering on rude Shame really because it s in a great location

Queuing when we arrived we expected that  We queued for 20 minutes but whilst we were queuing there were numerous tables empty they just need clearing and cleaning - a 2 minute job All who were in the queue could have been seated within 5 minutes at the most Very frustrating Some people walked away because of the queue They should have told us the reason for the delay it subsequently turned out that they were short staffed  If they want people to queue why don t they give people a menu then when they are seated people are ready to order We were shown to our table and were immediately asked what we wanted - we hadn t even looked at the menu Very poor service
I have been in Robert ransomes off and on for the last three monthes the ladies toilets are in a terrible state locks broken lights out toilets seats dirty could do with a good make over
You get what you pay for  weatherspoons are pretty much the same Nice to have a local one but the food is basic Decor is nice and fits in with the theme Nice guest beers

Knowing that this pub restaurant is owned by the group headed by Nigel Haworth and had featured in the Michelin guide to pub dining we were keen to book it for a Saturday lunch for my wife s mother The place was very busy but we were attended to promptly and seated at our table but then we had to wait a little while for the waitress The starters were quite good when compared to standard pub fayre but perhaps not as classy as other supposedly foody pubs However they were tasty and came in generous portions We decided on traditional style food for our mains my wife having fish and chips and my mother in law and I having the cheese and onion pie Whilst my wife s meal was perfectly reasonable the same as you would get in any other pub the pies were extremely poor The pastry was overcooked and almost burnt and we had to search for the contents What there was of the cheese and onion was a light smearing adhered to the inside of the pastry and then there was a great empty void It appeared to have evaporated perhaps due to it being left in the oven for a long period We raised it with the waitress who told us that they are usually better I suppose we could have caused more of a fuss but my wife and I didn t want to spoil her mother s treat who in fairness enjoyed the occasion not for the food but for the trip out In summary I would say the pub is located in a nice setting has a modern style and good ambience The prices are very reasonable However whilst most of the food is satisfactory it is not exceptional In the case of pie making it s pretty bad It s a pub we can tick off our list and we won t be back

We were looking for a B& B but all full We decided to stay for dinner meal was not outstanding usual  Pub Grub  Chips with everything  There seemed to be a problem with card system unable to use our debit card paid cash  Found a bed elsewhere called next morning for Breakfast Food was nothing to shout about Toast was just dried white bread  BUT Asked for pot of tea for two There arrived a glass coffee jug with tea in it Two thick broad coffee cups completely useless for tea The tea was tasteless I went out to the car and took a couple of teabags from our emergency stock and asked the staff too use these  I was informed they DON T have Teapots   Nor tea cups  Where do these people think we are San Francisco  It doesn t cost the earth to provide proper Tea Pots and Tea Cups for the standard British breakfast beverage I have been in Chicago in the U S A and been served Liptons tea in Staffordshire Tea pots and china cups  Meal finished Again paid cash  We will DEFINITELY give all Marstons Establishments a clear miss in our future trips We found a nice caf€÷ in Ludlow which served proper tea in the traditional crockery Nice china cups Proper tea pot What a difference Nice golden toast and marmalade
Food was reasonably good but expensive Wine was expensive and average quality There was no passion or excitement in what they are doing Personally I thought the place lackedatmospere

A last minute decision to book a table in Soho prior to a theatre trip Decision made on the basis of Turkish Moroccan Lebanese style food and this hit the spot We had a set Mezze for 17 each which was exactly as you d expect Nothing unusual or exceptional Swiftly delivered at 6pm it wasn t exactly busy though and just what we needed But because there is so much choice around I doubt we ll go back Nothing at all wrong but definitely nothing special

The food was pretty decent and arrived in good time  The lack of choice on the beer front needs looking at why not get a hand pull on like they have at the olive branch The addition of a disco ball cheapens the establishment and in my opinion definitely does nothing to create an atmosphere

Firstly I would like to say what a pleasant place this is and a very good local asset I am however a regular visitor with my grandson and have to say the service is terrible They never have a full selection of ice cream as is advertised on the board and despite visiting regularly on a Monday morning which is hardly a busy time service is still very slow As an example I ordered a pot of tea and unbelievably had to wait 15 minutes for it to be served The week prior I ordered a coffee to drink in and after waiting 10 minutes I was served with coffee to take out in a cardboard type cup I understand all food is cooked from scratch and under those circumstances it is obvious that you would have to wait the required time   but come on surely tea  coffee can be served a little quicker Another point   very often when food is ordered the waitress waiter spend time wandering around inside and outside with a tray of food trying to find out who has ordered it despite giving you a number card when you order I am sure all local people want this business to succeed and to be fair in the main they do a good job staff are polite however there never seems to be anyone in overall charge

Well located to meet up with people It is however just a place serving coffee and in that respect it is fine It didn t make me feel sophisticated or cosmopolitan It mainly made me think I could of had a proper drink for that price

We had been meaning to visit the Hand & Flower since seeing the Chef Tom on Great British Menu  We finally made it there yesterday a beautiful sunny day Our booking was at Midday we weren t greeted straight away & when we were we were taken to our table - we were sat on a booth that arched around meaning to begin with we had to sit next to each other rather than opposite & also that me feet were dangling unable to reach the floor I m 5ft2 so not too tiny  As we were one of the first customers we asked if it would be possible to move to another table with chairs - at first we were ignored & then the second time we asked we were told  no we re fully booked & all the tables are the same height anyway we expressed that it wasn t the table height that was the problem it was the chair height she was very huffy & went off too see if she could find a chair   she had an awful attitude   I can t understand why a Michelin star restaurant would employ a person with such little patience The food was great but our experience was already ruined We won t be going back such a shame
Great view thought the food was good maybe a bit bland and fairly priced Staff were friendly

It s a lovely location with an amazing view in a prime part of Whitstable however this restaurant is only average to good compared with the premium pricing  I found the staff here very good and attentive The food was reasonable - some dishes better than others Fish appeared fresh However  - Bread was not fresh and appeared to be a sliced baguette you d buy in a supermarket - Paper napkins - Paper tablecloth so cheap - Premium pricing  If you want to charge a lot you have to follow through with the experience I didn t feel it here which is a shame as it has so much potential and probably with little effort Until then I ll go elsewhere in Whitstable

I ve been to this restaurant several times and their food choice from the menu is usually pretty tasty stuff i have to say though that yesterday i got food poisoned with their muscles in kung po sauce important in bed with 38temperature and stomachache thank u
Under the railway tracks in a tunnel close by Vauxhall Station this is a favourite with locals The atmosphere is busy and the service can be hit or miss The food is good but not exciting

Not been to Elmas for a few years hubby fancied a change so went here I remembered a Elmas used to be very swish stylish and a pleasurable experience Sorry guys what s gone wrong Food was ok hubby had a starter which was best out of the meal he had chicken livers the rest of the meal was ok but the fillet steak pasta was not fillet steak sorry to be picky The main guy is as always charming but have to say the rest of the staff seem to lack the old finesse It s too loud it s too rushed and it s not as classy as it used to be to the point of grubby and untidy Sad to say we won t be rushing back

Came here as was recommended & Have been told only good things but I was disappointed when me & my partner ordered the soup of the day which was carrot & coriander it was so spicy i like spicy food so it wasn t a problem for me but my partner could not finish hers they should have called it spiced carrot & coriander  hold back on the pepper chef We ordered mains which were much nicer but my salmon dish was very bland which I found strange as it seemed the chef went from using loads of seasoning to none Any way my partner had mushroom risotto which was really nice for less than 20 two courses & a drink each you can t really grumble
We often get take away from here The food has always been great good quality and real value for money Was saddened to see it got zero in Jan 2014 from food standards agency
Proper pub for proper drinkers A little rough and ready inside but quirky Staff are friendly though and always serve with a smile Food is good

We visited here a couple of months ago after not being here since around April 2013 Last time we reviewed the place quite highly and only commented on a couple of minor things  Unfortunately this visit we were a little less satisfied The portion sizes are now more reasonable and not too large as we felt they were in the past The service is now at the table which is also a positive move  Prices are much the same and there are also lots on the specials board as usual  The overall feel of the place has lost some of it s charm and feels a little more bland cafe than nice country pub now especially where we sat up the stairs  My wife s food was fine and we had no real issues I ordered the Tuna steak and asked the waiter how this would be cooked Fresh Tuna is always best cooked medium rare otherwise the taste becomes more fishy and a little unpleasant The waiter told me that the Tuna is normally served pink which is fine and to be expected  My order came and unfortunately the tuna was overcooked and well done all the way through It was fishy and bland and was not what I was looking forward to Don t get me wrong it was not very bad just not as it should be and more like something you would get from a bought in chain  The fact that it was well cooked may have been a blessing as unfortunately I was a little ill after this meal which is very rare for me having a pretty much cast iron stomach  and I m thinking that if the tuna was cooked rare I could have been more ill  So not a great visit and on this strength unfortunately we won t be back in a hurry

Visited the foxglove this evening the service was excellent the food was good apart from the chips which we were all disappointed with they were like macdonalds fries in size we re not hot enough and I would have been embarrassed to serve them

Found this little place in the middle of the folk festival  Very nice food and atmosphere was good Not too keen on their dog policy as there were dogs strewn over the floor Some good some bad dogs  Now the staff were friendly enough but some lacked the customer service that you would expect Not keen on the uniform dress of them Maybe it was the warm weather but you still need to dress for work not a night out The bathroom needs sorting  especially having the hot water tank right in front of you

I liked this place It had a rustic type of atmosphere The beer was good The food I ate there was fine and simple Reasonably priced I thought the service was mediocre both behind the bar and from the waitresses who brought the food to the table

Normally go to the Artichoke where I find service and food to be excellent but they were filming on the day of our visit so we popped to the coach Service as ever was amazing Food  awful Two burger meals were the buns were tough as nails Third diner had ribs and they were lovely Spent 80 for a lunch so would expect better I don t understand as it s the same company why it s not on a par with the Artichoke Lovely for a drink but won t be eating there again

My wife and I visited for lunch today as we have done a number of times and noticed that the meals appear to be getting smaller Whilst the main part of both our meals was reasonable the side salad coleslaw and crisps that normally accompany them had all but disappeared Both side salads were made up of one slice of tomato two or three pieces of shredded lettuce two pieces of cucumber and a few strands of onion The coleslaw helping was just about the size of a single tablespoon and there were only six crisps with my wife s meal all in all very disappointing We hope that this is not the beginning of changes that will result what used to be a very good tearoom becoming mediocre

Nice meals for 4  Not huge portions reasonably priced - best chips to die for  Good service New landlord very friendly Plenty of choice First visited a few years ago when the smoked chicken pancakes were out of this world but with a couple of landlord changes since the pancakes have disappeared from the Menu Plenty of parking

Anywhere which points out that all food is near half price on the menu raises eyebrows in mind accompanying this the food was decidedly average though well presented  The staff all seemed a little on edge and very rushed Similarly the service was little better than average one starter never arrived and we had to ask for one of the mains twice before it arrived - having said that they did reduce the bill to accommodate for the inconvenience  As Italian restaurants go you can t argue with price but it wouldn t be my first choice

We visited the restaurant this evening and firstly I have to say our waitress Carla from Barcelona was very attentive and pleasant a credit to the restaurant The food was also very good certainly good enough for us to consider returning to this restaurant However our experience was marred by the customer service from the front of house in the restaurant & the lead barman On arrival in the restaurant we confirmed our booking the initial & only response was need the table back for 9 o clock  no good evening pleased to meet you hope you enjoy your meal or anything Taking into account the food was good and the location fantastic we thought we should go again the following day but this time just sit in the bar and have a snack Following a patient wait for the lead barman to have time to speak to me I asked could we book a table in the bar area for 4 o clock His response was NO not I m sorry we don t take bookings just a straight NO  This customer service just gives the typical impression that individuals in these lead roles can treat customers in this manner based on the fact it s unlikely tourists will visit the same place twice based on my experience tonight they are probably correct  This is the first time I have felt the need to comment on trip advisor but this evening I left the restaurant with a bitter taste that forced me to go into print regards two individuals who I felt were downright rude and if it was my business would not be customer facing Great location & restaurant spoilt by some customer service

Nothing special Now do not allow tabs so have to pay as you go along Service can be slow at the tills Cannot book a table and very busy up to about 8 pm I must have been 4 times now and have not been impressed with any meal although the carvery is probably the best value

Having eaten at a number of the Loch Fyne Restaurants this is one of our favourites and certainly one of the first to be opened outside Scotland Set in a rural Northamptonshire Village these converted Farm Buildings make it an idyllic location As always fish of very good quality but I find that since the chain was sold to The Greene King Group some of that magic has been lost Downloaded a 25 Discount Voucher from their website which certainly made it good value We will return but not rush back - pity Ample car parking space

Wonderful old building  but the welcome and hospitality have a long way to go I did not feel welcome but more of a bother to the landlord The young man helping to serve behind the bar seemed tone much more enthusiastic about customer care than the landlord

Lots of advertising got us to try out this Inn as it said it had gone through a large refit What we saw of the inside looked very nice We were ushered into a large conservitory that was stuffy The door to the garden was open but no windows so little to no ventilation the internal finishes were poor flecks of paint all over the sides glass stains on the slate cutlery that was old stained and made you want to wipe it clean  Staff very pleasant both of us had different burgers a beef burger with Cheese and bacon and a Wagyu  The beef burger tasted more like a piece of cardboard the Wagyu burger tasted of beef and was tasty both cooked well Chips were very good but the coleslaw was a very strange pink colour and seemed to be bound in yogurt not mayo if it was mayo it was very synthetic we didn t risk it Can the Wagyu burger be a real one at 11 00 when if you buy them with no vat they average 4 50 each

Our second visit for an evening meal our first some time ago was faultless Hence this time we went with friends  Service was on the slow side perhaps they were a little understaffed  The first course of warmed Camembert shared was excellent and we have no hesitation in recommending it  The main courses had an good range of choices the lamb and chicken chosen by the ladies received no complaints but the men who had chosen rib-eye were served meat which was tepid and appeared to have been prepared some time earlier before being served They were returned to the kitchen and came back cooked a little beyond the medium rare Mine was still only like warm and had to be returned again This time it returned hot - but the other vegetables on the plate were now cold  I gave up but to be fair although now overcooked for our liking the taste was excellent - such a pity  My usual choice of coffee is double espresso for which the barista normally heats the cup with boiling water to ensure that the small amount of coffee is hot to serve and also comes with a glass of water Not so this time our coffee was just warm - a small amount in a large cold cup  Come on Hurt Arms this is far from the standard that we remember and it s time to get your act together  The staff were all very pleasant helpful and were a credit to a restaurant which didn t deserve them

As a resident of Wallingford we have used the OPO frequently over the years whilst the staff change they are replaced with equally friendly people the food remains good the atmosphere fine however my comment is the place needs some TLC the settees in the front of house have holes in them and the general state of repair is poor please spend some money on it
The seating arrangement are too cramped especially near the entrance Staff were all very friendly but sauces mixed up with the meals

Went to Saffron tonight and had a strange old evening A friend and I pitched up at around 7 30 We got possibly the worst table in the place but that was okay as it was Saturday night and we hadn t booked The restaurant has weird lighting - bright fluorescent type was playing loud dance music and screening the news   on a large TV The place was quite busy with a lot of children so lots of noise and lots going on - not a very welcoming or relaxing environment  We sent our first drinks back as they were wrong The staff though not particularly efficient were pleasant and friendly enough The starters came fairly quickly and were VERY nice indeed even though we sent the first pickle tray back as it looked like someone else s leftovers After a long gap the mains arrived which were cold and incomplete We sent these back to the kitchen to be heated up and they were brought back to the table a few minutes later - still not as hot as we would have liked but we ate them anyway when we FINALLY got out cutlery that we had to ask for - they were quite nice in spite of the fact they weren t too hot The yoghurt my friend ordered to accompany her main didn t arrive which spoiled her enjoyment of the food  We did intend to have dessert but decided against it in the end as the experience had been rather tedious and frankly hard work  I overheard a number of tables complaining I did wonder why there didn t appear to be a manager or anyone in a position of authority around to help deal with this Instead one of the waiters was left to deal with all of this In his defence he didn t do a bad job  Our bill arrived and by this point I realised that there was a manager on duty who was hiding behind the bar preparing drinks and leaving his staff to pick up the pieces of the poor service I approached the bar to ask him to remove my friend s main course she didn t eat it due to lack of yoghurt she ordered  which he kindly did  I can t say it was a terrible experience because it wasn t but I doubt I ll ever go back The food was nice but the restaurant is a bit too rowdy for my taste and there are other Indian restaurants in Leeds that offer fantastic customer service

The restaurant looked great as did the menu so we wandered in at about 2pm Apparently the restaurant was too busy to seat us This is of course common when one hasn t booked what was surprising was the fact that the place was half empty with at least 8 empty tables So book a table before arriving

We hand booked a table on line but when we turned up there was no record of our booking Staff were able to find us a table We had to wait an hour for our food and it was average fare scampi was over cooked and leak pie was more air than pie The staff were polite but not overly attentive We have been to others in this chain and the Windhover does not reflect well for the chain

An interesting if somewhat quirky place The tables look quite professionally done from a view through the window A little chilly when I arrived but the fire eventually provided some warmth Tables a little too close to one another so not ideal for an intimate evening out How anyone can cook such a varied menu is quite beyond me and maybe they should try keeping to a bistro theme and not get confused between French Thai British and other places in between The beef bourginon was reasonable but the dauphinose were on an industrial school dinners scale Overall don t expect haute cuisine but it is quite passable on a cold evening Expect the unexpected and you will be ok

Make no mistake we like the Belgian Cafe The service is good and the Belgian beer superb The food is enjoyable too but my does it need a damned good clean and a lick of paint The beer and cider is expensive which discourages drinking more than a little I think the draught cider was 2 10 for a half Please tidy the place up and sand and varnish those sticky table tops
The one good thing about the place is the location  and the anonymity  well that s two good things
Been many times as its local Always queue and food has always been ok Just a little dull and always too busy Can t find anywhere else better to be fair

Went last night Been a couple of times b4 so I must like it Food tries to be different from bog standard Indian and I think it succeeds Nice decor not cheap not much atmosphere but compared to the other local Indians is a cut above the rest
Food is very good but service often slow and unreliable  Several times I have been served the wrong food but to be fair it is has always been corrected

If a restaurant is busy it usually means it is good Despite a near full house service was attentive and the food was not compromised  Brasserie Blanc is perfect for a business lunch 1 A large and varied menu meaning there will be something for all hopefully and 2 efficient service meaning you could if you so desired be in and out within the hour  While this restaurant may not set the world on fire I will undoubtedly be back again for the Onglet 8oz - Free-range Cornish hanger steak harissa butter well worth 15 quid  That said the starter I had was spectacular  the mussels and cod special  Finally I can now respond with confidence to  Know anywhere good for lunch

+ves  Simple well cooked food Pleasant interior Friendly warm ambience -ves Lots of waiters but rarely at our table Had to go 3 times to bar to order drinks and starters Interior so dark with tiny candles to read menu Small uninspired menu and crab cakes huge disappointment soft and flabby definitely not fresh crab  Perfectly adequate restaurant but if this is 1 in Coventry heaven knows what the remainder are like
but got seated literally facing some other lone traveller Shame he was also a man rabbiting on his mobile telephone Managed to skew a bit away from him
It s a nice Italian restaurant with good prices which I recommend it for students  The atmosphere is really youthful atmosphere and simple but tasty italian food

Thought I d take some clients for a nice lunch Atmosphere good food average at best and also not cheap Service was hit and miss I noticed that they take very good care of their celebrity guests at the sacrifice of us mere mortals

I ve dined at VJ s a good number of times and overall it s not too bad  Far better as an evening bar the place is quirky and a little grungy They offer a great spot for evening drinks  The staff are always really friendly and the food is reasonably priced arriving in a timely manner The food is varied and tasty although a little bit on the budget side Good for a quick lunch but I probably wouldn t dine here on an evening  Overall not too bad Never had a bad experience here so I guess you could say this is a lukewarm review

We visited upon a birthday celebration At first everything seemed great then we ordered and the food arrived It then came to our attention that the priority was in fact presentation not quality nor quantity It was basic to say the least The cocktails were fun but definitely not over alcoholic which when concordant to the price is unfathomable The table although a good idea was impractical for eating a Sunday meal with family and music upon levels of discomfort Then to too everything off a 25 service charge appeared on the bill Although no faults with the service it did not warrant that It was bog standard so don t expect any personal service Overall it was okay Not memorable not disastrous Will I be visiting again however The answer is most definitely no

There now isn t much choice in Walberswick with The Bell consistently pressingly the self-destruct button but is The Anchor relying too much on having a captured market There are oodles of positives to this place the menu is locally sourced and imaginative it has a great wine list and it now has great beers both bottled and draught  The bar area is cosy and comfortable and it has great outside seating  The downsides are that it s expensive and the overall dining experience does not justify such prices On a Saturday evening we had to wait 50 minutes for our main course and the following Monday we had to wait 30 minutes even though the place was very very quiet Expect to pay around 5 for a 175ml glass of wine  good though it may be this is bordering on Michelin-starred restaurant prices  Service is OK at best  the staff work hard but don t really know the food and certainly not the wine well enough to recommend either Again not an issue when you pay 8- 10 for a main course but it is when you re paying 15+  A personal gripe is the woeful vegetarian selection I m used to only having one option in most places but a goats-cheese salad as the only choice for a Saturday-night celebratory dinner is very poor I m beginning to think they belong to the Gordon Ramsay school of thought i e vegetarians Sod  em  Overall I love this place and I only hope it doesn t get complacent The Bell can t be as bad as it is for much longer

We had remembered several excellent meals but this lunch did not match any of those past experiences because we were seated on basic hard chairs in an area that had previously been a bar Starters were tasty but main courses quoted as served with salad were really only garnished  One dish included a ciabatta chicken mozarella sandwich that was rather dry and too big to pick-up  Everything was served with large quantity of fries which were well presented but we would have preferred mixed vegetables surprising constraint given the up-market presentation and menu  Staff were attentive though  Could do better - and wish we d read the other reports before we chose to go back there

My dining companion and I spun the golden wheel of fortune this day Being seasoned connosseiurs of the genre we were completely open to the opportunities that awaited us  Of the three dragons in this stretch of the strip we went for the smaller of the group thinking we would be better looked after and secretly believed that they would all be served from the same kitchen  I hope not because I d like to try the other two  The food was absolutely fine and the chilli squid was amazing The one thing that we really found disconcerting was the strange taste of the cooking oil Thankfully most of what we ate was steamed and this was really yummy  Price wise it was OK and it seemed to be busy and popular Our choices included with a score  Prawn dumplings 8 10 Pork Cheung fung 5 10 Chilli squid 9 10 Shu Mai 5 10 Scallop dumpling 6 10 Chinese Broccoli with Oyster sauce 9 10 Hardly a banquet however these are the basic staples upon which most diners will base their meal on I would say this is a good place to go the staff are pleasant and they were attentive But with all the choice along Gerrard street and surrounds this wouldn t be my first choice

Visited the Strada York on 10th May with my wife and 2 young boys Meal was of good quality although the service needs improving The waitress who served us didnt seem to know the menu and struggled to speak english which made ordering difficult It hasnt put me off as i do like the restaurant Just need a little more training in customer service and efficiency

A bit of perspective is required here Two meals for a tenner is probably going to be less than a fine dining experience  There were three choices of meat All were overcooked bone dry and shredded when carved This is unforgiveable The carving table was overseen by the usual surly being who really needs the refresher course on customer services The state of the meat might have contributed to his mood  Yorkshire puddings were       sturdy If your teeth are anything other than firmly rooted and your own then you will struggle You will not struggle with the vegetables Broccoli was yellowing and limp cabbage soggy carrots soft and drying out round the edges  roast parsnips limp and soggy new potatoes starting to dry out on the outside Roast potatoes were hard in parts mildly crispy and totally tasteless Gravy was luke warm and needed an injection of something a humane end to its existence might be appropriate  As a carvery goes this was up there with the worst If a fiver is all you have to spend on a meal then make other arrangements

Just a personal point of view but I think this place could be so much better if they sorted out how to serve the customers and organise the staff more efficiently the system they use is laughable why they can t do table service I have no idea a French style cafe service would work so much better And the picture here is clearly not from this place Looks like ripon race track Surely that is false marketing

A taxi driver recommended this one to us The restaurant looks like it could do with 100k throwing at it but Kumar has a great pedigree from working in London We like Indian food and appreciate it s great variety but no matter how good the food is we do need a nice environment to enjoy it in Flavours suffers like many Ramsgate restaurants to much competition keeping prices unprofitable and investment down

Came in with friends for a catch up decided to have a quick meal Not very quick Food was ok but nothing to shout about Would return but level of expectation is low So if it improves then we ll be happy

i wanted a table for 1 and was stuck at a table obviusley used by people wanting takeaways 2 people sat at my table while waiting for food They brought the wrong main dish at 1st and not really sure if my main dish was actually what i ordered Some scruffy fella on the next table kept talking to me about all sorts of stuff so i just ate my food and got out asap Not the best value for money but was really busy

The staff gave the impression from the start that they wanted us in and out of the premises quickly as it was a busy new years eve They were abrupt and impatient when taking the food orders The food was served quickly and was of average quality the staff were wanting to clear the table before everyone had finished their courses

We chose this restaurant because of the TripAdvisor ratings but we re very disappointed with the food quality We both had Haddock with gnocchi with sauce with whole grain mustard The haddock was dry and the gnocchi was stodgy almost gooey There was no trace of the mustard Service was pleasant and quick The setting was nice although some people on a nearby table were seated opposite the door and complained about the draft when the outside door was opened as it led directly on to the street

The restaurant had a good atmosphere tasty food busy vibes and good views from the window but it is disappointing to see endangered bluefin tuna on the menu - although the meat supplied to the restaurant is farmed and they have longer terms plans to remove it completely from the menu which is reassuring

The first trick is trying to get a seated Often arrive at the door and wait more than 5 minutes for someone to come over Once seated it depends on who serves as to how your experience is going to go There are certain staff members there who don t seem to show much interest in the guest they are serving and just want to get people in and out There s a lady that works there called Lou and if you get served by her you are bound to have a great visit She is so polite and always goes out of her way to welcome you I will say that there has been a change of management that has been for the better The new general manager is really focused and whenever he is working the organisation of the team and how the evening goes is noticeable That said I think the quality of the food is always perfect It s just a shame that you never know what service you are gonna get until you get there and that s why I ve scored it how I have done so

Enjoyed the food but when we arrived we sought out the only table that would take the three of us which was a table for six Confirmed if this was ok which it was but was asked to then share with other diners

A dull cold rainy Saturday in Rye We and our friends were looking for a nice warming lunch We were lucky to to find space for four Edith s is quite small At first we were disappointed that hot meals were not really catered for Unexciting jacket potato soup and one or two others Tea coffee and scones and cakes seemed to be their forte Today we were in luck because a warm quiche was on the special menu One of our party is vegetarian so was happy with the soup I spied what I took to be the last slice of bake well I was told not worry as there was more out back I ordered the bakewell but when it came it seemed smaller than the slice I saw No matter it was adequate Good quality food and friendly staff I went to pay and treat my friends only to be told cash only no credit cards accepted I can be unobservant but I saw no signs announcing this None of my party spotted it either My choices were scurry down the high street in the rain or borrow money from the others I chose the latter As long as one knows what to expect from this establishment I would recommend it and may visit again for the excellent scones

we went out to eat here before a night out in the east end i heard its one of the better curry houses on bricklane i had a madras and sag aloo with rice and garlic nan it was a good meal I ve had better nans elsewhere the madras was pretty good not as spicy as it should be  there service wasn t great but they were very busy to say the least I wouldn t mind going there again next time i m in bricklane but there are lots of other places i d like to try out on the street

One of the many restaurants down Station Road it seems Indian might not be the food of choice down that neck of the woods as it always seems to be fairly empty in there That s a bit of a shame as the food was pretty good and it s an okay sized restaurant so has potential to be a lively place I had a chicken chat starter and Lamb Tikka Balti for main with Keema rice Decent sized portions and the cobra was kept flowing by the waiters which is always a plus Good service but you d expect this on a quiet night Very good value for money

Visited New Years Day Not busy but not empty Staff were in short supply but pleasant Food was as could be expected in a pizza place but most things were only luke warm Big shock was the prices A pint of peroni at 5 25 seems over priced and standard pizzas also expensive Would go again with a taste card

I ll start with a question Why do restaurants recently seem to delay bringing you the bill long enough that you have to send up a flare to get their attention This was what I remember most about my trip to Clowes The food wasn t bad but fairly typical and expected The prices are excellent and a fair reflection on the food I had and especially the service I got After waiting for about 30 minutes after the starters were cleared I was more than ready for my main it was another 20 minutes before I got it This also came after we were told 2 minutes she of course meant 20 All this happened with the staff popping over once to lie about the time it will take to receive our food  Oh and back to my first question wow did it take a long time to get the bill I mean 15-20 minutes after clearing the plates no question if we wanted a dessert or a drink Just ignorance for 20 minutes A friend went to tap someone on the shoulder for the bill 3 hours in total we were there having 2 courses

Lovely evening with my wife to be We both had delicious fish and chips couldn t be faulted The service was great and I wanted to leave a generous tip until I asked the staff who it went to and I was appalled to discover 40 of the tips go to owners of the establishment who are apparently rarely seen

This is a good place to eat and have a drink as long as you don t mind television and sport Everywhere you look there is a tv The place is always well patronised and the staff are friendly Sometimes it seems more staff would be appropriate at busy times We have dined here a few times and it has always been enjoyable

This dining room tries hard to deliver a fine dining experience but falls short despite its rating in the Michelin Guide I had the tiger prawns which were well presented but underneath the presentation very standard fare The pork belly again looked good but the skin was burned rather than seared and the texture fatty and a bit glutinous The dessert proved to be a bar of rather mediocre chocolate ice cream with some nuts sprinkled on top Service was charming but rather random throughout with long waits and items forgotten  I don t mind the slightly idiosyncratic decoation and the slight atmosphere of faded Victorian glories but this restaurant needs to focus on the basics of impeccable service and food if it wants to charge double the price of the St Crispin Inn across the road where the welcome is warmer and the steak and kidney pie unctuous

Went to The Greenwich Tavern for Saturday Brunch Staff were helpful including arranging an off menu order Pub has a nice ambience and for its location at the gates of Greenwich Park does not feel overly crowded Service was fine but the order for my food was inaccurate - the item I wanted removed was included and another was left off Poached egg was rather overcooked Otherwise it was OK

The welcome here is great  Just because it s an  independent  coffee shop does not mean it is a quality coffee shop Unfortunately the coffee was very average All the cakes etc are served with squirted cream and chocolate powder sprinkled over  to cover up their staleness Unfortunately not impressed

Went here in a bad mood following a night at a local hotel Half slept and really not in the mood  However the food was fresh tasty and just what we needed to lift our moods Well done to staff and owners for an enjoyable breakfast at reasonable prices

Have been here before for Sunday lunch and was impressed but not so this time Had a gourmet hot dog  not sure what was gourmet about it though A chewy sausage on a crispy roll for 14  Soup was 6 50 Bread was really good though Not suitable for those who find difficulty climbing steps as there are over 100 to climb

We ve been to Pizza Express all over the UK for the past 20 years This one is not the best It doesn t have the groovy feel of other Pizza Expresses This is in part to do with the layout and acoustics It doesn t look as much like a stylish Pizza Express if you compare with York or Manchester or even sleepy old Lytham The service is impersonal the food is always OK  It is not the best the salads are always really awful in particular  The service is OK the food is OK

I ve rarely been to a restaurant with such cheap furnishings decoration and and tableware The lighting was a single Habitat-style paper-lantern on the floor casting dreary shadows and bringing to mind eating in an unfurnished bedsit someone had just moved into Wall-decoration was courtesy of a graffiti-artist and I have not seen ultra-cheap Duralex tumblers in such quantity since school-days Also not had to drink wine out of such since I was at college although the bottle itself at 20 for some very average house-wine was not very cheap No doubt the idea was to create some supposedly asian shabby-chic designer look at very little cost  Might suit some but I felt like I was dining in a garage It might have been OK if the food was great but it was a fairly ordinary version of the noodle stuff you get at Wagamama though not unpleasant The mains were not very dear though the side we had as a starter was more so at 1 for each of five ravioli-like parcels Service was friendly and efficient

Had dinner at Dumplings Legend recently All diners were shoved into the front section near the window an old trick so table for two was cramped Service was passable but brusque Hot and sour soup vegetarian only was lukewarm and uninspired Mixed starters were hit and miss - the prawn toasts were moist and tasty but the salt and pepper chicken was like rubber Spicy pork siu loung bao were quite tasty but underfilled A la carte meat fish options looked horrendously expensive Table was not cleared after the food was taken away it would have been as simple as replacing the paper cloth so we were left positioning our elbows amongst the scraps of food You can find better experiences in this neck of the woods

We have visited here many times either for a romantic dinner or for business meals  The last two times have had disappointed service The food has been good but both experiences let down by bad service  Not all the staff looked happy to be working and were not attentive to either what stage our meals were at or whether we were trying to get their attention  Good to see them supporting a local distillery though Silent Pool Gin is wonderful  The food is on a par with their sister pubs but service is significantly poorer It is clearly not an individual doing a bad job but a culture or management issue
Food is very continental maybe a little up market the bar is very good and the bartenders know a lot of cocktails

We had the sausage and mash at GBP6 95 and a pot of tea with a little bag of ginger bread biscuits whilst we were waiting The total was nearly GBP20 When the dish arrived not a long wait we were really disappointed with the quantity The plate was huge and filled with tasty gravy in which there was a small saucer sized portion of mashed potato topped with three Lincolnshire pork sausages What there was tasted very nice indeed although it wasn t piping hot but it was ok However there were no other vegetable and we thought that it was a bit of a meagre offering for the money It certainly needed something extra We could see the other dishes coming out of the kitchen and some of them looked quite substantial so maybe we just picked the wrong dish or they just forgot our veg  This was a one off meal in the cafe for us because we don t normally eat there as the food has always been a bit expensive we re pensionrs so we thought we d give it a try after the refit but we won t be giving it a second try  Sorry Clumber Cafe - reduce your prices or make the portions bigger

I could write two reviews for The Gable a day time and a night time  Day  I ve had lunch here 4 5 times on a Friday On a couple of occasions the food was atrocious On the other occasions it was excellent Not sure what to make of that The service is bang average in reality and they could do with an extra couple of people during periods They could also do with smiling which rarely happens  Night  I ve spent many a time in here on a Thursday night Typically the atmosphere is excellent and you end up never leaving The new decor and club downstairs is an excellent addition however they have now taken away the live band on Thursday night - WHAT This is madness as people used to fill the place to have a good time listening to an average band play other peoples songs  All in all the The Gable will always have us in it s web as we are local but naturally there could be vast amounts of improvements
Was looking forward to our pasties as we have in the past but alas we were disappointed The standards seemed to have slipped pasties were only average lacking the usual seasoning and crispy pastry

This is a restaurant is within a hotel and in general a little disappointing unless the hotel is running a special event Breakfast is average with most of it pre- prepared and left for long periods under heat lamps The service is relaxed and some what unpredictable That said not everything to do is on the menu so if you don t see what you want it is worth asking  For an evening meal the menu is fairly small and does not seem to change and they do not seem to offer daily specials The service is very variable because they do not assign the servers to allocated tables so all staff cover all the tables which means everybody thinks somebody else is dealing with it - which is not always the case Has potential but in need of a re-think

Restaurants in hotels are usually a bit hit and miss This was more miss than hit Service was a bit brusque and my spicy lamb dish was very one dimensional My friend s chicken dish had much more depth of flavour
Went with a group of mates and to sum up everything the meals were average Nothing to shout home about but i wouldnt rush to go back

Recently visited The Golden Fleece during my stay in York when exploring Must say wasn t overly impressed after hearing all good things about it Ordered a pint of Carling which tasted off so complained to a member of staff who tried some of it from the tap She said it was fine yet I disagreed and she then said that it might be the glass as residue is sometimes left from the dishwasher She then poured me a new pint but wasn t even a full pint and I didn t get an apology Whilst sitting there a group of 15 Spanish people came in some drinking some not wanting to yet the staff said to them that if you aren t ordering even a soft drink that you have to leave the pub and can t sit there and wait on friends They weren t loud nor causing any harm and the pub wasn t exactly busy and needed the seats for paying customers I found this quite shocking the fact that they wouldn t say it to a mother who had 2 children one of which wasn t drinking anything and they never got asked to leave Just found this a bit off putting the fact that my girlfriend wasn t really wanting a drink whilst in but I got her one anyway which was for the best or we would have been chucked out Please explore I don t want to put anyone off but just wasn t for me

The pub itself has a lovely atmosphere with plenty of seating which is well spaced out The menu promises a lot but doesn t quite deliver Food was not very warm when delivered and flavours not great I had pigeon for starter which was very over-cooked and tough and kedgeree for main which lacked any seasoning Service was very slow and the waitress who I presume was new didn t take the order accurately All that said the price including the discount voucher available on their website was reasonable I think this restaurant has promise but isn t quite there yet I will probably give them one more chance

Have visited Kitsons before and revisited on Sat 6 July The restaurant is dull and needs some lighting to improve the ambience The main course was very acceptable but the sweet was ordinary small and overpriced The service throughout was very slow - we ordered coffee some time later the waiter apologised for the delay and said the coffee would be five minutes After another long wait the waiter came and said do you still want coffee  At this point we decided to forego it and left- Raymo

Living in Isleworth I ve tried the Coach & Horses quite a few times and desperately wanted it to be better To have a good pub with good food just a few minutes stroll from home would have been great but sadly it was not meant to be  To their credit they re clearly trying very hard Attractive d€÷cor with  quirky touches   tick Interesting menu with elaborately titled dishes  tick Amusing quotes stencilled onto the walls tick Good looking food  tick Repeated assertions that they are  passionate about their food   and that they use only the  finest ingredients    tick  Unfortunately it ends there The food is presented well but it just doesn t eat well So far I ve had an overpriced undersized overcooked steak I ve had a burger that was so overdone and dry that it was immediately sent back before being told by a staff member that it was somehow my fault that I wasn t able to enjoy it as it was supposed to be cooked I ve had sausages and mashed potato that was so utterly devoid of any flavour that if I d been blindfolded I wouldn t have been able to tell you what I was eating Friends and family have had similarly disappointing dishes  And I ve never ordered a drink at the bar without first being ignored by a staff member who was otherwise unoccupied Is this the first lesson taught on day one at beer-pouring school I could be cynical and conclude that it is just a slick marketing exercise to flog cafe food at restaurant prices to people who should know better but I think that would be untrue and I do believe their motives are pure But rather they simply lack the skill and ability to deliver on what they promise and the end result is just another example of style over substance  On the plus side there are enough guests at the nearby Hilton looking for a slice of English pub culture and local middle-class families seeking a Sunday afternoon venue to host the kids and grandparents that the Coach & Horses will continue to enjoy their success and believe their own hype and good luck to them  On the down side it means they will feel no commercial pressure to do better and picky buggers like me will need to look elsewhere for a decent meal  Annies at Strand-on-the-Green is 2 miles away similarly priced and light-years ahead in terms of quality and flavour

Visited 17th August 2013 with my wife Early evening c5 45pm before going to the Theatre Service was quite slow in terms of taking orders and delivering the food We decided to share some razor clams one the of the specials as a starter When they eventually arrived after my order went somewhere else there were just 2 on the plate and they were just about Ok maybe a little overcooked Main course arrived soon after - my wife had some pasta with seafood which she described as Ok and I had a steak with peppercorn sauce It was delivered with a garnish of half an orange  Like something out of the 70 s The steak was pleasant but add in a bottle of wine and 2 coffees for c 75 it wasn t a good experience and a place we won t visit again There are lots of restaurants in Islington and this needs to do much better in my opinion if it wants to be in the top one s It does display a TripAdvisor award but not quite sure how it managed that

Nice location near to Oxford Street and Selfridges and at edge of pedestrian street Food mostly crepe based including several vegetarian options Mozzarella and Ratatouille crepe was tasty and a good size to satisfy hunger Prices not bad for what is a tourist location

Visited midweek early evening 3rd week of May There were 9 or 10 of us popped in on spec so to speak and although the place was ticking over the staff found it difficult to cope The service was very slow we had to remind them for drinks several times and he got it wrong twice he had little English The staff were nice though but not very attentive On arrival we were placed at a long table in the centre of the room but after a drink meals ordered poppadoms eaten and waiting for starters a large group came in and our party among others were moved to accomodate them as the staff had forgotten that the large table was reserved Once this group came in our service got worse The food is passable Indian fayre but there are much better Indian Restaurants in South Shields I usually go to The Star of India which I cannot fault so Iam afraid its goodbye Cafe India hello Star

Our first visit to Boomham s new Thai restaurant in the Royal Oak pub on the High Street An extensive temporary menu with some unusual dishes and an extensive veggie menu We shared a fish cake starter and had 3 main courses from the veggie menu plus jasmine rice The food was very good and the veggie options were not full of tofu as is often the case If you want tofu you should chose it There was one waitress who did well to cope as the restaurant becomes busier Orders for drinks were taken by the bar manager publican Only two real ales on offer - greater choice would have been welcome The food was very tasty BUT portions for main courses were not generous and we left thinking we should have ordered more starters or a 4th mains between two  We were given a food bill to be paid at the bar We were then also given a separate bill for our drinks One bill for both would be helpful There is also a takeaway menu available I think we might try this next time We ll certainly visit the restaurant again - it s well worth giving it some support and as a new enterprise it may well iron out some of the glitches we experienced

the place has improved but at busy times between 7- 9 at weekends it seems that that some of the staff just want to hide- their seems to be a difficulty in the use of the tills which adds to the slowness- perhaps thats why they always ask if you want a double as most regular customers will realise that will give them ten minutes of their lives back which would otherwise be lost

Went to this restaurant for a dinner with a friend of mine We have been warmly welcomed by the staff and get a table immediately Zoe the waitress was the star of this dining experience Professional very polite Starter was boring Sprats and an ajoli sauce with a few vegs decorating the dish  back to the 80 Main course the seafood grill Salmon and mussels overcooked 22 95 GBP for a main I was expecting a wow factor dish more vibrant fresh fragrant however although I have received a decent dish for me was definitely overpriced for the quality provided Toffee Apple Panna Cotta Peanut brittle was the hero Dessert tasty creamy and the textures were definitely there Made in a small glass ramekin was very nice and clean However the service was a bit disappointing Just the way it was served to us by the waiter It is not professional to grab the ramekin on top with the hand and serve it to a customer Attention to details is important  Good ideas however some fundamentals need to be improved

The interior decor and feel of the restaurant is good The food is well presented and staff are polite The food is ok to good for a hotel that is at the premier inn level Don t expect fine dining or amazing flavors however it is nice Make sure you book the restaurant has many empty tables but was asked to come back in 30 minutes and they could fit me in Strange Overall I would make this is 3 8 as its not very good but it s better than just average
