Visited this pleasant pub hotel close to Steel Rigg on the Roman Wall from our home in Bardon Mill Five of us ate The bacon sandwiches pretty good Scampi and chips for 8 95 over priced and very indifferent Staff friendly Some gorgeous Thatchers cider This has the potential to be a fantastic destination pub for the locals and visitors alike but need to improve their menu and quality of food
Staff are in a world of their own not helpfull at all Could use more cleaning Staf dress code unaceptable for Mc

Used this pub a lot under the previous management and was excellent  Our first visit under the new team was a little bit of a let down While the food was really nice - I stuck to the specials board and the blade of beef was great  The service was very slow On a week night when it wasn t particularly busy 2 courses took almost 90 minutes and our finished plates took over 10 minutes to be cleared away  As I say food was good

Revisiting my teenage after Mum s funeral went for a drink with the family around 8 00 p m Pub was crowded but easy enough to get served Staff pleasant but a bit overeager when attempting to collect glasses that weren t finished with None too clean but it was busy

Not the usual sort of place we would have chosen but we had been invited by my wife s family so at 7 30pm last Saturday we arrived Even at this time the queues to get in were out of the door so first point here is it s best to book The place was packed noisy cramped and food was everywhere different choices from all over the world Small plates mean that you can t overload but you can go round and round as often as you like  So would we go again no would the rest of the inhabitants of Sutton Coldfield definately ideal for family get togethers and reunions but sadly not for us

Many friends have said have you been to La Nostra so to celebrate a birthday we made a last minute reservation  other tables occupied including one by friends who had asked if we had every eaten at La Nostra  The service was poor the wine I ordered was not house wine and was over 20 I was not asked to taste and just poured  this occurred with the second bottle  I asked for fresh glasses but between the owner and the member of staff they did not have know how to handle wine properly  The starter was small but very good my main course was outstanding and I will return just for that but I don t want to see staff and the owner chatting with each other and ignoring the customer  but the food is a winner

Yesterday we had lovely food - it s great value But the long-standing female bar staff member was incredibly rude to my guest I stood at the bar and heard her gossip and criticise about my friends I really wish the new Manager would get a grip on his rude staff

2nd visit to Grantham Arms and gave 5 stars last time but that was then and this is now Food was very good but despite the staff being friendly and polite the service was poor The facts not an opinion  Arrived 7 30 for an 8pm booking Taken to table at 7 55 and given menus 8 20 had to ask staff to take food order Ordered 2 botlles of red wine but only one left Offered Malbec instead Choose a different red also to find that was also the last one Offered Malbec again During the evening had to chase up the staff with either drinks order or dessert order In summary great food let down by poor service Unlikely to attend again

Dropped in without a reservation accommodated us after a short wait which was good for a Saturday afternoon  Menu wasn t the best little choice went for specials Beef & Beer Pudding and a steak steak was cold so we had to return it but they dealt with that well but nevertheless should never have left the kitchen beef and beer pudding average After dinner coffee described as Colombian & Brazilian Fairtrade beans blended to gives a milder less bitter lavour profile it was very bitter It should be much better given its location

This seafront Indian present an ambitious and inventive menu -- ranging from traditional dishes such as motar paneer to kangaroo I m calling it nouveau indian as the presentation and combination of ingredients brings together the presentational innovations of mainstream restaurant cooking -- such as attractively swirled sauces -- and unusual combinations -- such as spinach and potato dumplings with prunes and cashew Reading the unusual menu which was very obviously put together with love and imagination I became very excited -- and perhaps had high expectations However I could not have predicted the particular way in which this otherwise excellent restaurant disappointed It was that there was an extraordinary amount of sugar in the mostly mild creamy dishes we ordered Only one of the dishes tasted savoury which was a deliciously tender tandoori duck starter No problems with that But the rest of the dishes tasted bizarrely sweet I said as sweet as custard my partner disagreed that it was quite that sweet but we both found the sauces unpalatable and only ate them rather than sending them back because it was fairly late and we were absolutely starving It s important that restaurant reviews describe dishes accurately so I ll be specific about what went wrong for us I do think that probably this is a great place to eat if you avoid ordering anything mild and creamy and stick to hotter tomato-based sauces We had Hara Bara Kofta which is described as spinach & potato dumpling stuffed with dried prunes and a cashew nut and fenugreek sauce The dumplings were beautifully constructed and not a surprise that they had a sweet edge but the sauce was horribly sweet We also had had muttar paneer which they spell motor poneer This was nicely cooked but it s impossible to separate that from the really overpowering sweetness of the dish a real shame We also had bakara begun -- fried battered aubergine in once again an overpoweringly sweet sauce The duck as I mentioned was very good but the lemon rice -- perhaps our tastebuds were overcome by the pudding-like tastes of the main dishes -- also tasted as though it had been sweetened When the waiter asked if everything was OK we said actually no that so many of the dishes had been sweet He replied that it was necessary to have sugar in a creamy sauce and that was that They didn t seem interested that our experience had been so problematic If I was in Herne Bay again I would be very tempted to eat here again but would question the waiter closely as to whether sauces had been sweetened It s all a great shame as the cooking was so close to being very good indeed I d more or less say it was great in fact but just spoiled by using for our tastes far too much sugar I cook Indian food myself and while it s true that sugar can figure in creamy korma type sauces this would be in ratio of about 1 teaspoon for four portions I ve given average as a rating -- but truly our experience was both five star and one star

Group of four out for a meal we booked after reading good reviews we were disappointed The starters were ok plenty on the plate but we had problems with the main courses One steak had to go back 3 times before it was ok the others swapped to get them ok Steak and kidney pudding was dry but with plenty of veg and gravy The atmosphere in the pub was flat there being very few customers it was also cold as the heating was out and only a convection heater was on

I was excited to find an independent coffee house in Mcr Then I saw the barrista s dirty finger nails It is tiny place so the blokey bike couriers felt a little intimidating coffee decent I like the outdoor seating Nearly good - but needs a bit more thought

I had breakfast here on the way to a conference It was very expensive for what it was but I thought I would give it a go  The tea was delicious as was the bacon and egg The sausage however was a tad chunky for my taste and the rest a bit standard  Perhaps it was my own fault for having high expectations but all in all it was no better than a good hotel breakfast That said places like the merrion hotel in Dublin manage to elevate the simple breakfast to higher heights than managed here

We went here for Xmas day and although the food was good for Xmas day the service wasn t great We were all served our starters but he kids starters came out 15 minutes later and the same happened with the main course with the kids meals coming out a lot later Quality of food was good But service needs to be improved

Another visit to this establishment not my choice and was again disappointed by the quality of food Meats and fish overcooked school meal presentation and a mix of vegetables- some over and some undercooked  The staff are friendly enough but that does not really compensate for the uninspiring food

Recently visited for lunch with friends and we were impressed with both the decor and the menu The food was reasonably priced although some dishes were rather steep for tapas Our waitress was very nice and attentive when she could be but we could only feel sorry for her as it was a busy lunch she was running around like a headless chicken whilst what we assume to be the manager guy in suit stood and watched The drinks were reasonable and the Malbec was lovely Would have been a better experience if it had more waiting staff or the manager had stepped in and done some work Good food good drinks POOR Management

If you want a cheap night out then Channi s at the top of Stratford Road is OK but only OK The food was not brilliant the yogurt dip thick and tasty but not sure tasting of what  the Aloo Gobi was more cauliflower than potato and the peshwari dripping in honey and too sweet All in all the best thing was the company and the Cobra beer

I visited Kayla last month and could not fault the service or the restaurant itself However when the food came it was at a luke warm temperature and something I could have made myself at 1 10 of the price I ordered the carbonara which was very bland and overfilled with Bacon lardons which made me feel ill as they were so salty  Overall a lovely place for a special occasion  one off but not likely to go back

This was my second visit to Biltons in the past year The first time was October 2015 I called in for breakfast which was really good I was I was impressed with how they had done old place up from its Dray & Horses days when the place had been run down over years - however  I am not for changing names of former pubs and and such would prefer the name to have stayed as it was On my second visit I was not so impressed It was a Saturday night the place was full and the setting was rather cosy but I did not find the food so great and the chips were particuarly poor - lacking both colour and flavour On a positive note my son really liked his burger which was tasty far better than the steak I ate Overall the setting was the best bit This place gets good reviews locally - perhaps I went in on an off night I would not say never again for me vut I personally would not rush back

Went here for a mid week lunch time meal have to say the experience was fairly average perhaps somewhat less than what I expect at other Prezzo franchises Service was slow waited for a few minutes to be seated which is understandable after which our drink orders were taken immediately and we were offered garlic bread which came before any of the drinks Our drinks order then arrived in two lots considering we only ordered four drinks all of which were pretty standard they should have come quickly and all at once  We then had to watch as the chefs rung the bell multiple times for someone to deliver our food I understand that there was a large party in but surely this could have been accounted for earlier I had the Chicken Caesar salad which was nice perhaps could have done with some anchovies but wasn t overdressed as Caesar salads so often are My partner had a Calzone which he thoroughly enjoyed no matter how sad the garnishing salad was  We asked for the bill once our plates were cleared and then waited about 10 minutes for our payment to be taken it was all rather poorly timed perhaps they deserve another chance

I used to always walk past this place and think I d love to have a breakfast there  So one day myself and a friend popped in I honestly had the best breakfast I ve ever had that morning It was amazing  I constantly return in the hope that I ll have the same experience as my first I have visited the place roughly 15 times I d guess always for breakfast However every time I re-visit the place something else is wrong something always lets you down Below is a list of some of my experiences  - The bread seems to always be rock hard to the point where it hurts your teeth when you bite it  - I once arrived at 11 40 twenty minutes before breakfast was due to stop and the lady was removing all of the breakfast menus She told me It s only lunch now sorry  I had to say to her I want breakfast  it says you serve breakfast until 12  She then spoke to the chef and sorted it out with him when I got my breakfast that morning it wasn t the best it tasted like it had been laying there for hours  - One time I was told we don t have butter  Which is absurd I had butter the first time I visited so why had that changed Every other time I go now I get butter but it s always really hard- it rips apart the bread when you try to spread it  - The staff really don t know how to make coffee I asked for a 1 shot latte recently I clearly said plenty of milk The lady came back to the table with a cappuccino in a latte glass This isn t the first time this has happened it seems to happen every time I visit  One of the things I love about the breakfasts are the small potatoes they re to die for The last time I went I ordered the Gigante as usual When it arrived it had chips on no potatoes The lady said to us there are no potatoes are chips okay  Is this some sort of a joke I suppose it has to be okay if you ve already put them on  The chips were a terrible substitute surely we should have been notified prior to receiving our food  My friend has found egg shell in his scrambled egg twice  I remember one visit the kitchen door was left wide open and all I could hear was house music blurring out  I love house music but when I pop out in the morning for a breakfast it s the last thing I want to hear  One time I received my breakfast and it had no beans on So of course I asked the waiter if it should have beans on He replied I should think so yeah   Reading back over this review I m saying to myself why do I ever go back It is genuinely because the first breakfast I had here was immense Not everything is bad obviously The sausages are unreal herbed potatoes and bacon are perfect  Every time I go in for breakfast the place is DEAD It usually has another 1 or 2 people in The Gigante Breakfast isn t cheap at 8 95 it is more expensive than most of the competition in the area If you re charging 8 95 for a breakfast with no drink it should be worth the money on a consistent basis and the service should be far better than my experiences  The reality is if this restaurant can rid of its inconsistencies it could be the best place in Liverpool for breakfast No shadow of a doubt  The management need to sit down with their staff and sort it out One day you go in there and get an amazing breakfast the next day you go in there to show your friend how nice it is and you re faced with disappointment  Sort it out Bella Italia

Having been passing by this place decided to pop in for a tea with cakes and was hugely disappointed What decor and name might suggest to be a luxury the service and quality of the food provided are more suitable for a budget cafe Macaroons are the worst I ve ever tried really chewy and lacking a crispy crunch I had a dirty fork on the table so raised that issue with Paco who just mumbled some apology and brought the clean replacement No attention from the staff and they call it a luxury place  Will not be back any soon and definitely won t recommend On the positive side decor is lovely

A warm welcome looked to be an encouraging start but we were lead to our table In a cavernous space at the back of the pub The food ordered at the bar  we had a drink and waited for the starters to arrive One of the diners had the spicy tomato soup which was indeed spicy and tomato but was so thick you could stand a spoon up in it Black pudding croquettes were a different story and very tasty Mains looked good but on the whole were under seasoned and a little bland A couple of things could really help this place 1 Waiting staff and 2 Don t turn the heating off at 9pm it was Baltic by 9 30pm

Visit on 10 12 12 Ate here with friends prior the boxing and found staff welcoming The service was prompt and the restaurant was buzzing Given how busy the place was the food was served within 30mins and the quality was what you would expect I had the Chicken Americano pizza The cocktails were quite tame and overpriced I did also have to complain about my flat Budweiser lager Waitress was very good and friendly
went on a busy Saturday lunchtime    food was ordered and arrived hot and tasty a couple of vegetarians in the party were adequately catered for

If there was a Good category between Average and Very Good then this would be the best fit Trading Boundaries can get very busy on a Sunday afternoon We were lucky to get a table and there was some nice jazz playing  To be fair they were rushed off their feet so did well to cope The food and drinks were largely fine but some pancakes had to go back as they were cold One of us ordered chicken so I imagine they simply got the timings wrong When they came back they were good  I like the ambiance and the service is usually very good Always nice to do a spot of shopping after lunch It remains on our list
Food is still very good but the portions seem to have got smaller Not a cheap restaurant but worth a visit

Good food but spoiled by the large number of takeaway customers coming into the restaurant and stood around waiting for their meals Not a great experience at 8pm on a Saturday but very good at quieter times

We stayed here for our wedding night having hired part of the venue for our reception All the staff were excellent at the Montcalm and Chiswell Street Dining rooms and everything was great until breakfast the next day The breakfast is served in the Jugged Hare which is a favourite of ours in terms of decor and atmosphere but unfortunately this was rather tarnished the morning after the wedding The morning breakfast is not cheap  30 to be exact and for that I was expecting excellence Sadly this was not the case Clearly something had gone very wrong as there were tables covered in used plates and cutlery and a lot of disgruntled people it became apparent there were 2 wedding parties in the room  My 80yr old Grandmother had to wait 15mins for a cup of tea the breakfast buffet was full of EMPTY serving trays as the queue snaked around the restaurant You were supposed to be able to order your eggs any way you liked but this was neither communicated by anyone there were no waiting staff to be seen nor being paid attention to as people were frankly taking whatever they could get their hands on as they were starving I m sure this isn t usual trade as how they could continue to charge 30 per person if they got as many complaints as I heard that day I ll never know A real shame and a tarnish to an otherwise great experience

My wife and I visited El Borracho on Valentine s night We were off to Spain the next day so we thought it might get us in the holiday spirit On first impressions the place looked very elegant and tastefully fitted out However the maitre d that showed us to out table was sullen to the point of surly - it wasn t exactly what I would call a warm welcome The same indifferent approach was extended by the waiters and our attempt at speaking a little Spanish fell on deaf ears  As for the food - well it was nice Now nice is OK but it s also instantly forgettable  We started with some bread and tomato which was very good and we had a bowl of very nice olives I then ordered the pork belly and scallops which again was nice Soft scallop with soft tasty pork its a classic combination My wife had the mussels in saffron and hazelnut which she said was very nice We also ordered a portion of tortilla some patatas bravas and a salad to share All of which were very  and I think you can guess here  nice  So what s the problem you may ask  Well the problem is twofold Whilst the food is authentically Spanish in my opinion it doesn t reflect modern Spanish cuisine I have had the most exquisite modern tapas in Spain food that really blows the mind but this was more of a traditional take on Spanish food a colour by numbers And I m afraid instantly forgettable I m even struggling to think what I ate as I write this review  But worse than that is the atmosphere El Barracho is a big place and as such it generates  to its determent - all the ambiance of an airport terminal restaurant This was not helped by the surly attitude of the staff which didn t bother us or spoil our evening but would have made the place seem a little happier and perhaps even inspire me to return  So alas whilst the place is nice I probably won t go back
Food was good but nothing else Service wasnt friendly It was bit expensive Charging 5 star but serving beer in a can  Not as expected

This restaurant is trying to be a stand alone establishment but is really attached to a boutique B and B on the outskirts of Chester It thinks it is great but I don t It is style over substance and the venison was tough as old boots and judging by the way it was exchanged for the lamb this was    my fault We ate here only because we were staying at the guest house and it was convenient it is near nothing except other cheaper more honest lodging houses and a ghastly Sizzler Steak House type chain pub  which would not be out of place on the outskirts of a Hull Council Estate  Good Points  Wine List
This restaurant offer a very delicious dishes especially kebab  nice decoration  lovely staff but a little bit expensive I recommend it for special events

Sad to say that in such a key position with a captive audience in the sunshine this restaurant could do a lot better There was a queue gathering of maybe a dozen people and at least seven staff wandering aimlessly behind the counter No one was eating in the restaurant To be fair everything was being cooked fresh but with such a queue a little bit of prediction would have gone a long way We ordered fish and chip and chips and probably waited a good 15 minutes as did the people in front of me Someone behind got their chips first so not sure how you prioritise customers Although freshly cooked the fish was a bit greasy and good have done with draining the oil before serving similarly the chips Staff seemed hopelessly disinterested and pretty clueless about what their role in the place was Will probably try around the corner next time shame because it s so full of potential This experience was mid afternoon so no excuses about it being near closing time

We thought we d give this a try even though we have been countless times to the absolutely superb cinnamon lounge  Decor was unusual but very good modern fresh and spacious Menu looked very varied and excellent so we had high expectations  The food and service were good but not exceptional and the portion size very small compared to other similar style restaurants This made it effectively expensive and I also left hungry  In addition they forgot a dish and I had to remind them about which they then thought was acceptable to serve when everything else was eaten without an apology  But despite this it was tasty and well intended so we will visit again and see if it improves before giving it a miss permanently

Its average food it doesn t need to be much else capture audience with the hotel next door Lovely staff food can be a bit slow coming out would I come back here again no unless staying in the hotel next door is the honest answer but did I have a bad meal and get poisoned no Its just very average
I use this fish bar quite a lot abnd the food really is hit and miss One day you get nice chips and the next you get soggy mess Fish is always nice but very expensive

came here with 5 friends last night knew from the website that the food would not be the most exciting but were looking forward to a meal with friends rather than a gastronomic delight We we not disappointed nor surprised The starters mainly deep fried did not look home made but were tasty all the same apart from the mushrooms which were watery the mains were big and again tasty and mine brie and cranberry wellington looked quite rustic The chips seemed an odd shape and tasted   well odd too Service was prompt friendly and accommodating and the beer selection was apparently good although two publicised beers were not on We were not rushed but did decide to leave when the music quiz started up good value in that 6 people ate well for &lt  100

I would rate this pub a good rather than average A stones throw from London bridge and sat on the Thames the location is very convenient There is a good selection of drinks including plenty of ales if you re so inclined  It gets very busy so it can be difficult to get a seat though it isn t usually difficult to get served Especially nice in the summer or for a spot of lunch  Average doesn t do the pub justice but very good without having eaten there seems too generous

Popped in for a quick lunch and ordered 4 dishes and a couple of beers The staff behind the bar were helpful and informative The range of beers is very well put together  When the food came it tasted fantastic - very tasty and well presented  My only concerns were 1 the price - given what s available in the area I did not think it represented value for money The portions are very small and we 2 of us went away hungry despite spending about 20 on food 2 one of the guys serving was very surly and unfriendly  Overall great food and beer if you ve got deep pockets or just want an expensive snack I ll probably not be returning though

Used this pub restaurant for 1 night while staying at The Premier Inn opposite It was fully- booked on the first night so we booked for the 2nd night I don t know if it s always this busy or because it was just before Christmas Lovely building inside& out Good service The big disappointment for us was the frozen chips& they had no sirloin steaks This would prevent me using this establishment in the future Such a shame The garlic bread& fish we had was delicious
Good atmosphere Nice friendly staff Ok food fine to eat if you re in the hood not a destination

A group of seven of us met for my Mums Birthday The table was a sensible size for our group Service was ok but a bit of reminding was necessary to get the items we ordered The food was reasonable and filling though my burger looked quite lonely on the plate Atmosphere was good Overall it was good but there was nothing that would make me particularly recommend it
Drop in for coffee as it started to rain slow to be served machine always take time coffee could be lot hotter tables clean always a lot of people in there

We have been to Pinocchio s a couple of times with our son and his partner they think that it is great but we are not as thrilled It is OK but to my wife and myself we have been in a lot better The last time we went there was a big group in having a party and the noise was terrible We could not have a conversation for the noise next to us

Good atmosphere food below average and does not reach the american diner standard it is trying to hit Flavourless over done and boring Staff are extremely helpful and its good night out would be excellent but the food is a massive let down

We ve enjoyed eating here many times before - the food is exceptional - but this was a Friday evening and two large groups of very boisterous women made such a racket that we were obliged to eat up quickly and leave  Hard to know what the current staff can do under these circumstances I appreciate The restaurant has changed hands in the last year or so - the previous owner an ex-policeman would have sorted the problem I m sure  We will return but not on a Friday or Saturday evening
The Masons is a no frills cheap carvery In terms of value for money it is quite good but the vegetables are normally a let-down They always have a few real ales and the prices for these are very good

I want to start of by saying that the food is insane and the new venue is great and works much better than the navigation Good points  We just walked in on Valentine s of all days and it was moderately busy We sat at the bar and asked the host how long for a table we was told 30mins we didn t mind 2 3rds down our pints and we was sat already great The burgers themselves are insane and so are the sides The pulled pork on the blackmore was incredible The wine was also nice for only 12 00pounds The not so good part   When ordering food the server was prompt and polite I ordered wine to asking for sauvingon blanc he s response was a pot of what  Then persisted to bring 3 different wines to the table none a sauvingon Eventually we got the right one after he said  I no the food not the wine I don t want to sound facetious but after working in the industry myself it s our job to know and came across a little unprofessional I get that it s an unpretentious laidback establishment but it seemed that product knowledge was lacking  Other point to say was underneath the restaurant there are contractors working loudly obviously unavoidable but loud and distracting noneless  Overall love the venue and the food and will be back just think staff need a little homework in learning the menu

First impressions not good Directed from car park via the tradesmen s entrance past kitchen and rubbish No welcome by the staff No elderflower or ginger beer The one dish I had fancied from the website Jumbo Brixham Scallops was off Ordered 3 specials from the board - an asparagus and chicken bake and a cannelloni Took 40 minutes to arrive from ordering unacceptable for a daily special Fortunately we were not in a rush The food was fine

Visited after work recently  but have been going to the BGI for years  New menu review  The food is of a good standard here but you will pay a premium for it - expect to pay 40 a head for 3 courses although they do have set menus for 15ea  There always appears to be more staff walking around than customers which is surprising as it took 45minutes for my main to arrive  Must improve

Myself and my partner managed a last minute booking  We had come in after a very hot day I was casual wear and treated like I should of been in a suit so rather than being greeted with a smile and happy to see us we felt unwanted Upon ordering soft drinks we were given glasses that were barely 1 4 full as they don t have draught but yet still charged for the privilege of tenny bottles and didn t seem to concerned about giving us such small drink and questioned why were puzzled again lack of customer friendliness  So we just ordered tap water instead  The staff were efficient and the food came very quickly that I have to admit was very good  The food itself was the best I have ever had but sadly by that stage we just wanted to leave  We were in a rush to get back to Manchester so decided against desert and ordered the bill Sadly rather than a small chocolate coming with it it was literally just the bill  In a competitive town these small details count and although the food was beyond brilliant the friendliness of the waiters was not  I don t even know if it has wi fi as I did not feel comfortable asking

Visited the Burger Shop for a friend s birthday The look and feel is very Shoreditch-y new term but feel free to use it  Exposed galvanised walls and wood works made the interior feel hip and trendy  That will draw people in that s for sure  The staff are top rate At no point did anyone at the table have to ask for anything Our table 12 people were always tended to above and beyond the call They made the time spent there enjoyable  The food was a bit of a let down The burgers and wings were bland the cheese on the hot dogs was unpalatable and the onion rings were large chunks of whole onions I ve had better van food I expected much more from a place that is supposed to be setting trends in the area  I do hope the quality of food increases the Burger Shop has a lot to offer

Hmm coffee and tea passable surroundings superb staff quick smiling and attentive slices of cake we had definitely on the small side but reasonably pleasant Have to say it cost too much for what we had Would avoid in the future and go to the place in the park
Service is good Staff go above and beyond for you Food however is mediocre at best and expensive Used to be particularly good  Lovely environment and staff But better pubs in the area for food

Had lunch in this restaurant in the busy Hyson Green area The service was friendly and the menu genuinely Portuguese with bifana prego and fish among the dishes We enjoyed the bread and olives and the pica-pau for starters and chicken piri-piri for mains To drink we had a glass of wine and a Diet Coke and the bill came to just under 20 We had expected to pay more but were charged only for one portion of the chicken dish which was a pleasant surprise The coffee was also good Perhaps it s a bit mean to quibble but the cafe was quite austere and lacking in colour and the tables were very small If I were in the area I would call in again but I wouldn t drive for an hour to get there which is a shame as I love Portuguese food and it s a rare find in this part of the world

We arrived there on a busy Saturday evening without having booked so we were lucky to have been found a nice table for two Very helpful and friendly staff but they seemed rushed off their feet The olives did not arrive with the drinks and we had to remind out waiter By the time we they arrived the starters then unfortunately arrived straight after the olives The main course was average and we asked for more water but it was never brought The bill had an automatic 12 5  optional service charge added which whilst we paid we felt was excessive and would have preferred to leave 10 cash for our waiter Overpriced for a chain

This is your typical airport bar albeit with quite a lot of power sockets for lap tops etc which can often be an issue in other airport bars Drink is the usual draft fair food nibbles and not much else although you can always just buy a sarnie in Eat and bring it in  but if nothing else it has interesting views of aircraft landing and taking off

Not many pubs have their own vegetarian menu so was impressed being one  Food was delicious Was so impressed that I organised a bunch of friends to have a meal there I thought I would help them out by getting my friends to pre-order their menu selection - this was NOT the idea of the pub but my idea trying to be helpful However on the night one member of the party couldn t come as she had a fall from her horse and was in hospital The dragon landlady insisted that we pay for her meal If we hadn t pre-ordered there would not have been an issue We won t be eating there again Shame as if the Landlady had been a little sympathetic she would not have lost 10 customers

Went on an amazon local voucher which covered two courses each and a glass of prosecco for 29 Along with the bare echoey walls and high ceiling the long tables arranged end to end reminded us of a school dining room not at all the venue to choose if you want an intimate dining experience  Despite its 9 price tag my starter was truly tiny Though the rib-eye steak was tasty and properly cooked the chips with it were like railway sleepers and certainly didn t seem to have been triple-cooked as claimed whilst the vegetables incurred to an extra charge  We had a pint of lager each and the final bill including a 12 ® service charge was close to a further 29 So even with the voucher not an inexpensive evening out Okay it s Clifton so it can t be cheap but I dislike service charges added to the bill and 12 ® did grate somewhat  A reasonable evening then and the food was quite good but we won t go back even on another voucher

first time here and had heard good reviews atmosphere pleasant in small informal surroundings and attentive staff however food let down - may have been change in chef as friends enjoyed many meals there

We had planned to go to the Maypole opposite but it was closed for a private function so came here instead Huge choice on the menu including steaks However we were slightly concerned at how cheap all the food was We went for fish and chips and scampi and when they came they were edible but you couldn t endorse them any more than that We strongly suspect all food came straight out the freezer I had a pint of Landlord s Timothy Taylor and ale I have drunk frequently in other establishments It has never tasted as poor as this one did Not sure what the problem was with it but suspect that it was just very slightly too warm  Staff were all pleasant and helpful and service was fine  I probably wouldn t go back on account of poor food and drink unless there were no other options available

Seems a bit hit and miss Friday night take away ordered online delivered in reasonable time however warm not hot and oil had split through the bag Free Popadoms and onion salad bits Driver relatively friendly Positives tender meat and decent portion sizes Negatives Had a discount through hungry house otherwise can be a little bit pricey warm not hot and the Currys tonight where a little bland not complaint worthy but neither complimentary Previous takeaway delivery from Balaka have been much nicer Will give them another go as have had lovely tasting and hot takeaway delivery previously
Stale Tyrrells crisps and staff that find it difficult to engage with their customers by merely being polite friendly and professional Nice fire

The food like in all Nando s is great The ambiance is truly unique to the chain of restaurants and the staff only help to enhance your experience However it seems to have suffered from its own success - this Nando s is probably one of the busiest I ve ever been and being a student my Nando s experiences are very extensive and as a result there is a very long waiting time for being seated and then for food

The food was very good everyone enjoyed their meals and the lunch menu is good value The staff were very nice but there was a lack of them We had to wait a while to order and the food took a long time to come I would recommend if you re not in a rush or don t mind waiting but I won t be going back as this is the second time this has happened

Made a reservation for Saturday for four people The Inn at Shipley is nicely decorated and has a good atmosphere The place was very busy with lots of diners We waited at the bar for a while without being acknowledged but eventually managed to order a drink and get shown to our table Our guests joined us and ordered their drinks and we surveyed the menu We have eaten at the Armoury in Shrewsbury and also the Combermere arms part of the same chain I think plenty of times and so we were familiar with the menu I ordered the jerk pork belly followed by Rump steak My food was good but my partner ordered the crispy beef salad which she found very disappointing The main problem with the evening was the service which was terrible There seemed to be lots of youngsters running around like headless chickens with no coordination or overall sense of direction The table behind us were also equally disappointed and we overheard them complaining bitterly about the service I appreciate that restaurants sometimes have staff shortages but diners should be made aware of this when we were seated The Inn at Shipley needs to up its game

We last visited the Capannina a few years ago and received a very friendly welcome into its warm and comfortable d€÷cor We had been tempted by a themed music night and the place was full  The staff were efficient but friendly The garlic bread and starters were hot and tasty My wife s pasta was good and I had ordered steak It had been flash griddled and although a decent size the outsides were burnt so much so that I had to cut them away to make the steak edible The accompanying vegetables were only warm not hot  We wanted a rest before dessert and were pressed repeatedly if we were ready to order We eventually decided not to have desserts We were not asked if we wanted coffees or any other drinks  This was an enjoyable evening mostly due to the music and it was a shame the food was not up to the old standard that we remembered We re not sure if we would go again

I haven t been to Pizza Hut for many a year What caused me to break my duck Well followers will be keenly aware that my spouse is a thrifty individual When she was alerted to the fact that the lunchtime all you can eat option is available for a miserly 6 99 she was all over it like a rash  We dined on a weekday and were quite surprised to find a queue awaiting us upon arrival Now I appreciate plenty of punters were chancing their arm on a cheap midday feast but it seemed as if the gentleman responsible for getting bums on seats was going about his business at a somewhat  relaxed  pace  A short while later we were shown to a table and given instructions to effectively crack on at our leisure By this juncture my tummy was rumbling like a cement mixer so I wasted no time in positioning myself in close proximity to the salad bar pizza hatch  I had heard from a good friend that the Pizza Hut salad offering was not to the standard of a well know pub chain that specialises in grilled poultry and their name means  one who reaps   Whilst this summation wasn t exactly wide of the mark I was pleasantly surprised with what had been served up  I proceeded to load my plate with the obligatory lettuce cucumber grated carrot peppers coleslaw potato salad blue cheese sauce bacon bits etc I was surprised to see jalape€¤os available A bold yet inspired moved I made sure to fill my boots although I probably went over the top and ended up consuming one of the fiery devils with virtually ever mouthful of salad  I will deal with my traditional gripe at this stage the cucumbers left a lot to be desired I would suggest that they hadn t been cut up by a dab hand Such was the inaccuracy of the slicing one was left with a bit of a messy pulp rather than even shapes Small matter but easily avoided and I feel games could be risen in the preparation department  Onto the pizza my maxim in this area is that pizza in a restaurant should taste at least 3 times better than something I or Mrs S can pop in the oven I have to report that sadly I couldn t take this view of what I gobbled at PH Whilst it was nice it didn t blow my considerable socks off notwithstanding this naturally I smashed a lot of it down during our visit   Concluding remarks it delivers what is says on the tin If you re looking for a bit of a binge on average tasting pizza for an exceptionally low price then happy days If you re more of a connoisseur when it comes to circular flat bread with tomato cheese et al toppings and just happen to have an economically focused other half you will probably leave a little disappointed but still bursting at the seams   The staff are friendly although expect to be left to your own devices

We went today and ordered from the Lunch Meal Deal the food was OK it was hot but it was fairly bland we didn t complain we wish we had  the staff seemed more concerned with speaking to the Captain who arrived during lunch time surely if you want to speak to your staff you d come before they were serving lunch

We had a real rollercoaster of an experience at river Thai I wanted to book a meal for a table of 8 for my birthday I love Thai food I love rivers This is both Fantastic  When I asked to book a table of 8 they said they took a five pound deposit per person for any table over 5 people I found this very unusual in Shrewsbury You may expect it in London And I wouldn t have thought they would have been open long enough to warrant such a strict policy from previous walkouts I quite simply said that I didnt have anything on me with which to pay that I had 8 people who would all be there at the stated time and unfortunately would have to go elsewhere should I be asked to pay this amount This seemed to change their mind  I then got a phone call later from the manager saying he was sorry but they shouldn t have taken that booking then explained the policy again But then he said not to worry because they were actually quite quiet that night To my mind I don t feel it was necessary for me to be told this  As for the food and the experience We arrive at 8 45 our booked time ordered drinks which came promptly and then ordered food at 9 Food came approximately at 9 45 This felt at the tail end of acceptable waiting time considering we were one of two tables The dishes don t come with rice or noodles which I would find okay if it weren t for the fact that the dishes ranged in price from about 12 to 16 pounds Then 3-4 on top for a side of rice or noodles  Understandably a river location will have higher prices but this simply felt too much for me  The food itself was very high quality came out hot seasoned very nicely No qualms about that The plates were full but difficult to eat with rice as there wasn t much room  Service was attentive toilets were nice Lovely balcony  All in all I didn t come away feeling great A combination of mixed messages about booking long waiting time and high prices mean I probably wouldn t recommend this That being said the place was decorated wonderfully good service and tasty food If the prices were cheaper I may well consider coming again but I know of other places of similar cuisine that I would prefer

The pub looks like any other with no individual charm The menu is quite standard The service was quick and the food was of reasonable quality The food was tasty But I had to send my curly fries back as they were hard and a side dish ordered 5 mins after my main food arrived I probably won t return

We visited on a midweek evening The meals were well presented but small quantities We have eaten at the White Horse in the past and were a little disappointed Many items from the desert menu were not available and the staff explained they had had technical problems with the freezer

The service I feel was average the food though lacking in quantity was fine BUT the glass that my Pepsi came in was not clean particles stuck to the inside and outside did not want to make a scene as it was a 30th birthday do the cutlery could also do with refreshing  looking as though they could do with a polish Not the worst place by a long shot

Food fantastic- as per every cheeky nandos one ventures on Was greeted with a cheeky smile and shown to our seats along with my girlfriend and 4 others we sat down on our table  Which was sticky and took away from this cheeky delight and then I went for a cheeky number 2 in the little boys room to be greeted with everyone s worst nightmare The toilet seat was no where to be seen After finding it on the floor I had to pick it up at which point I m touching cloth and have to do some DIY and assemble the loo This took away from the experience I did return 3 weeks later for another cheeky meal and the toilet seat had been reconnected Will eat again
We ve eaten here a few times always at lunch time The food is good but the atmosphere is lacking a bit However there is plenty of parking at the rear Good value

Being a lover of Brazilian Restaurants having once lived and worked in Brazil I was very much looking forward to trying an alternative to Bem Brazil in Manchester  I have to say that the quality of the Buffet was great and it was pleasing to see lots of traditional Brazilian dishes available it actually reminded me of a great Churrascaria in Brazil called Boi Preto which is quite upmarket and has a good name  Having said that I felt the service and atmosphere let it down it does not have the Brazilian feel that you get from the staff at other restaurants and whoever was behind the bar had obviously never tasted a real Caiprioska before as these were very disappointing who would think you could get Lime Sugar and Vodka so wrong  If your looking for some good quality food and don t mind feeling rushed to eat then give it a go but for anyone that s been to Brazil especially to the state of Bahia where dining is a slow and enjoyable then there are better choices

When this placed first opened we were excited - it seemed to be a first of its kind in Derby A quirky little caf€÷ with an interesting menu and a nice vintage style  It started off brilliantly and we frequented quite regularly We thought the sharing boards were amazing - ploughmans cheese platters or even the basic bread variety The service is always perfect here too - the staff are like beautiful machines But then it all seemed to go wrong   and I just wonder if it became a victim of its own success I could be wrong and I m prepared to stand corrected but I am sure as is my partner that the food portions shrunk and the prices went up The last time we went was a few months back now and we shared a ploughmans which was close to 20 for two people Now I know this isn t a Wetherspoons pub but I expect more than a few slices of ham sticks of celery and a couple of slices of pork pie for 20 It was incredibly poor value  In the past we have commented on how the various boards for ONE PERSON could be enough for two   now it seems to be the other way round Its a shame because I love the style of food served here but I cannot bring myself to spend those prices Maybe I m just tight Right I m off to the Standing Order for a beer and burger

Having read the reports we were visiting our son in Plymouth and decided to give it a try We arrived on time for our pre booked table On admission of the staff the tables are big and not a lot of room between guests We attempted to order but no fish of any kind was available I also ordered a drink but this had also run out not a good start The steak was presented and was good as was the rice and chips My wife s chicken salad was plentiful but minus a lot of chicken she didn t t enjoy it We were not asked if the meal was ok  My wife had to grab the attention of the staff member to order coffee my son and I were not asked Potential of the establishment is obvious but will cease trading if the service is not improved

This is a typical Brewers Fare pub which serves food and drinks at very reasonable prices - especially in the weekday afternoons They never ending soft drinks and coffee deals are really good especially for the driver
One waitress working in restaurant was amazing Shame the food did not match her efforts The food was eatable

This is a much loved Greenwich watering hole along with bar food There are better food options in the area however it is not bad The main thing is the lack or uncertainty about what the bar is meant to be and what vibe it gives off It is rather confused at times Sports are shown small smoking area and pool tables upstairs Could do with a bit more personality seems to have been lost for more than an hour since changing from the Auctioneer

We had a 9 15 booking on a Saturday night so were the last table to arrive We were greeted warmly and told that as a group of four we could try everything on the menu which we opted not to do The dishes were listed in order of size from smallest to largest with no distinction between starters and main courses The choices were unusual with no fish just crab or roes and the meat choice was mutton or teal Two of the dishes our veggie friend wanted were unavailable so she was left with a very poor choice although they did apologise profusely and gave her a free course of the Pollock roes The quality of the food was fine although not exceptional The wine list was very good with some interesting wines at fair prices The service was excellent The overall experience was however disappointing It seemed as though they were trying to be a cross between a tapas bar and a restaurant and not quite getting there

Average at very best There was a rather large group of us but I was still expecting the food to come out hot Only way i could ensure this was by pouring gravy all over it We all went for roast dinners and the beef was very nice but there was not enough in the way of vegetables and the roast chicken that some ordered looked more like a starter as the portion was so small Its a classic case of nice tasting food but tiny portions Might be ok for 60+ year olds but anyone that has a decent appetite will walk away still feeling hungry For the price paid we expected more  8+ for a starter and 15 for a roast Wont be coming back in a hurry If its a roast dinner you are after I would suggest going to a nearby pub

We went to Bank for our first wedding anniversary on the recommendation of a friend The booking system was easy enough  On arrival we entered the restaurant and it was very obvious where we needed to be A lady behind the bar then directed us to the back of the restaurant We were then taken to our table out the back This area was lovely with a nice view of the canals and NIA There are overhead heaters if you get a bit chilly Our server was very polite and friendly The initial service was good There was a slight mix up with my starter but that was resolved quickly Our food was good and the wine was also nice We thought this would be a great evening Unfortunately soon after a large table arrived close by And from that moment on we were pretty much ignored We didn t receive a deserts menu for around 30 minutes Then we didn t receive our deserts for around 20minutes And to top it off we had to go and ask for the bill As we were sat waiting for that for around 45 minutes This was very disappointing And pretty much ruined the evening for us Because of this I wouldn t be recommending here to friends and won t be quick to return

My wife and i went to this al-a-carte restaurant last night expecting great things what a disappointment first of all the table paper place mats and paper napkins how bad is that for al-a-carte Service very poor when taking our food order i asked for a second round of drinks waited ten minutes with empty glasses finished up going to the bar myself Being a special birthday we ordered a bottle of chablis to go with the meal when it was brought to our table she said would you like to try a bit I do not know about anyone out there but i have never heard that said On a minor issue the butter dish that was brought to my wife for her bread roll had a chip in it all in all very disappointed I know some of these things might be petty but if you are paying over one hundred pounds i would expect better

I have been here several times and its good but slightly basic The staff are never very positive they sort of doing what is required and that is all The atmosphere isn t very welcoming there is rarely much music playing Luckily the food is good I have never had a bad meal
More of a small restaurant than a bar Too bright for my liking Good beer if a bit pricey Steak and ale pie tasty gravy but not enough meat No atmosphere

Its all gone a bit expensive at QSF Cheapest wine at 20 a bottle says it all We had a good meal not amazing but with the wine and premeal drinks it was just short of 100 For 2 people Food was good starters well presented lots of french bread Main course of the steak was quite good but the fillet was 6oz no bigger and i was still hungry at the end Not too many people in on a Friday night so I wonder if theyre increasing the prices to cover the drop off in business

Hadn t been to Masala Zone for a while for no reason other than we ve been enjoying trying some of the latest batch of eateries that have recently opened on the already abundantly served Upper Street strip however an e-mail featuring a special reopening offer tempted us to re-visit this one time favourite  The restaurant has undergone a makeover and looks quite stunning during our visit the staff were as attentive as ever and the tray served Thalis were beautifully presented and tasted delicious  Sadly the owners seem to have forgotten the original appeal of authentic street food at affordable prices during this transformation resulting in for us at least a slightly synthetic and somewhat over-priced experience Great food great service but just not quite right Maybe there s a lesson to be learned from the recent closure of very grand naamyaa bangkok cafe

great venue lovely new place lots of staff and thats the problem All that staff and we still had to wait to be served The food took ages and was nice but overpriced May visit again but only as a special occasion as can not pay that all the time Could do great just need to iron out their efficiency and pricing

We were so looking forward to going back as the food service etc is usually fantastic We wanted to take my husbands brother and his wife and had been raving about the place all day We got a table quickly despite being advised of a 40-45min wait It was very busy as usual but our table was ready in 15mins Great Sat down and ordered drinks The place was roasting hot My drink came back incorrect however it was tonic instead of sofa so no biggie and I was so thirsty I didn t care We ordered our food and our waiter was could not have been more attentive or helpful a guy named Joe  Our food arrived My order was incorrect so it had to be sent back My in-laws food arrived and both meals were stone cold They had to be sent back By the time their food had arrived we d basically finished ours so not great timing Our waiter was very pro-active and couldn t have apologised enough He d already sorted out a discount and removed our 25 starters Not a great experience this time and we were really disappointed Will give it a break before we try it again

Beautiful old pub in sunny Lactodorum  a confused pub come eatery  for a pint very pleasant mild mannered old English pub  for food corporate chain of microwaved come slam in the oven for a qwick heat up cardboard  marked up by one star due to character and another because it s a pub that serves beer silly -

I made a Dinner Reservation for 3 They asked for a Credit Card Number which is not very unusual What is however very unusual is that when I checked my account later that day I noticed that the Restaurant had taken  30 out of my account I do object to Restaurants doing this It is fine for them to take a Credit Card as Security  i e if there are no shows  then it is probably acceptable to take money for a cancelled reservation but to take money 4 days before the Dinner is simply not on I do not think that any Restaurant is justified in doing this This has of course soured my visit very much and probably tainted my view of the whole experience as I was still fuming when I went there for the actual Dinner The food was not bad not outstanding but also not bad It also took a little bit over 20 Minutes until we managed to place our Order although we asked several times to place an order The whole experience mainly due to the upfront payment spoilt the whole evening somewhat

The meal was very tasty but when one asked for English meat one just got a vacant look One can get Irish or British or Scottish meat but no English meat Can one let me know when one is going to put English produce on the menu there are lots of producers of good English meat they must be exporting it all    meal was very tasty but the portion of meat was very frugal and was not worth 8 95 and one did not offer the free ice cream sundae
The whole point of branding is that you know what to expect before you go in This is a good Starbucks I go there a lot But it is rather like many others Which I also like

We ve been in Rosemary s few times before in earlier years so went in for lunch There was a disinterested lad and a girl who seemed to be doing most of the work After placing our order we waited about 30 min for our food The pot of tea for two which barely filled two tea cups had been delivered earlier and had all but gone Whilst we were waiting people sat at tables uncleared from previous occupants and waited quarter of an hour for a scone to be put on a plate The lad shouted across the room to a couple that fruit scones had run out rather than go over to them When I asked the guy in the kitchen how long the food was going to be he just seemed annoyed at me and totally unapologetic We weren t the only table where meals arrived at different times - with other tables served in between The atmosphere was pretty terrible because the customers were generally unhappy It s a shame because the food s good and the choice is good better than Koffee and Kreme next door

The food to be honest is not bad here Especially the grilled food Did not enjoy the curries here My only gripe is as with many restaurant in this area is the restaurant is always dirty inside with sticky chairs and tables and disgusting toilets Management sort it out

We found the Rhone Valley Wine Lunch disappointing One starter and one sweet were served in exactly the same style the only difference being the colour of the macaroon and the flavours At first glance it was as if the starter had reappeared but the macaroon had turned green We thought this a lazy attitude for a Michelin star restaurant The pre-desert amuse -bouche was a strange combination of flavours The bavette of beef was chewy rather than tender The courses appeared too quickly and we felt rushed Having been to two top restaurnamts in Berkshire during the past month this was definitely a let down  We would mention that we have dined at l Ortolan on many previous occasions and not felt dissatisfied

Let s be honest we all go to a Hungry Horse for value for money food & they do do good value food The food s not great but it ain t bad either Generally The Sunnyside is your standard Hungry Horse big noisy full of kids running around I had the beef steak & ale pie which was good full of meat no fat or gristle decent pastry My wife had a rump steak cooked rare but was quite dry & a bit fatty My daughter had the macaroni cheese which was OK she ate it all which is always a good sign  We did have to wait a long time for the food 30-40 minutes  which was a bit surprising because they weren t overly busy But you can t complain when the macaroni & pie were priced at 7 99 for both meals & the steak was under a tenner This place isn t for fine dining but for those on a tight budget & unfussy about the surroundings it does the job

Bardsley s has become a bit of an institution in Brighton and gained a reputation of being the best for miles around From my experience over the past few years and recently prompting this review I have come to the conclusion that they are trading on this past reputation as the food is far more expensive that other fish n chip shops the portions are quite small and it really isn t any better than anywhere else In fact I ve sometimes found their chips to taste quite sour old  The food at the one next to Sunny Foods in Beaconsfield Road is better as is the one in the Dip at Hollingbury the one in Patcham and the one half way up Southover Street I don t know their names but they are far better than Bardsley s and a lot cheaper too I suspect that people go to Bardsley s because they did when it was the best alongside 7 Dials which I think went years ago  and they haven t ever challenged that belief since No fish n chips in Brighton or Hove gets anywhere close the quality of the places on the seafront in Hastings but this place really isn t our best effort

Came here with friends was pretty late but fairly busy Friendly staff and nice food Although presentation isn t what is stated on the menus pineapple rice in half a pineapple was actually just spooned into a bowl and just 2 prawns come on ice paid 9 for this rice The duck main was delicious though I just didn t like the surroundings rice inside the tables with plastic fruit isn t really my cup of tea Although I would return due to the food and service I received

It s alright Manchester city centre really does lack a decent chippy and Wrights really is just the best out of an average lot The one thing Wrights has going for it is its central location so I do find myself choosing this one over the rest You can also sit inside which is good  The chips are usually quite nice Again nothing special Same with the fish With their portion sizes personally I feel they could be a lot more generous  I ve eaten a lot worse but I ve also eaten a lot better Tourists wanting to try a truly traditional chippy are better looking elsewhere i e not in the city centre
Lots of pasta small amount of mussels and prawns and over sauced with tomato However the staff were helpful and charming

We went for Sunday roast that was a little disappointing  Lots of it but very much pre-processed cut meat and overdone Yorkshire in a flood of gravy I guess it was kiss for the price but would look at other options locally

This is the first eating establishment you come upon when you clear security at Gatwick North Terminal As a result it is mega busy all the time and the staff are under considerable pressure hence the untidy nature of the eating area We arrived at about 6 pm on a Sunday evening and nearly all the tables had a Reserved notice on them - I have no knowledge of why but when we asked for a table for four they looked around chose a table and whisked away the reserved sign Like all Wetherspoon establishments you have to order your food at the bar and have to collect your own drinks to take back to your table One of our party ordered a tea which was stone cold by the time our food arrived and no offer of a free refill Food was well cooked but took about 15 minutes to come Beer was cheap as always Advice - Good if you have a long time to wait for your flight but if time is tight then move on through the departures hall and go upstairs to the myriad of eating establishments on the mezzanine floor which tend to be quieter the further away from the entrance from Security

Surroundings and menu looked beautiful despite this chose pigs head and black pudding with a fig glaze Black pudding and Crockett were warm in places nothing hot This set alarm bells ringing Chose roast beef and Yorkshire pudding for main course Roast beef was beautifully cooked but Yorkshire pudding was burnt on the outside undercooked on the in which was sent back Staff were attentive and dealt with thi straight away Potatoes appeared to have been cooked previously and then somehow undercooked in the middle We were given extra sauce with our new Yorkshire puddings this was acrid and had obviously caught in the pan I feel lack of attention stopped this being a very good restaurant This was reinforced with three staff standing over the road smoking and as we were paying the bill the waitress although helpfull and attentive proceeded in cracking every knuckle in both hands

A big place space bedecked in a theme of brown - leather wood - and chrome  The burgers were pretty good - but this was pretty basic fare - just an upmarket burger and fries bit on the dry side but reasonably good Some salad and tomatoes would not go amiss hint  No draft beer though some reasonable lagers  At first we thought the waiter was a bit weird bit then we agreed he was just offhand  The coffee was cold Some of the deserts were dry cake in a coffee cup with ice cream on top for 5pounds a head  Would probably suit a group of younger people on a night out who didn t really care too much about the food and service

Visited this restaurant with friends mid week and it was far from busy ordered my favourite lamb jalfrezi and to be honest it was disappointing to say the least far too much curry powder used for my liking The standards of cooking seem to have slipped in the 12 months since our previous visit think it will be some time before we return

Staying in the Holiday Inn Express you have little choice for evening meals The menu is extensive and always well cooked  If it was with the family it would be better the staff are attentive and polite service can be slow which in a large restaurant as this can be expected

Visited Coventry for a wedding and had time to kill on the Sunday so - craving a roast - my girlfriend and I had a look around for a decent place to eat  We found the Blue Bistro after a lot of wandering and when we arrived we were bowled over by the interior and atmosphere it created really impressive looking  Unfortunately we then had to wait half an hour+ for our roasts to turn up which seemed to be the theme for our time there as two other tables waited a long while for their food Not sure why this was we were told half-heartedly that they only had one chef on - I m sure one chef can cope with four tables   but we were provided with a couple of large glasses of red on the house for the wait which was a decent touch  When it did finally arrive it wasn t the most inspiring roast I ve ever had I had the beef which came with the smallest Yorkshire pudding in existence and three under-cooked roast potatoes plus veg Nice gravy but the yorkie and potatoes were a big let down the best part for me   My girlfriend had the chicken which she said was good but that was about it  We shared a creme brulee which was good but left feeling underwhelmed compared to the feeling we got when we walked in  I d be worried if I was in there when it was busy  shame

Visited one week after reopening  Food was fine but   where was the joy Restaurant is very gloomy and hotel corporate rather than Italian inspired  More disappointing the food wasn t bursting with the zingy Mediterranean flavours we were expecting and hoping for  Having seen Giorgio extol peasant food and flavours on various TV programs the menu seemed in tune with the hotel - corporate  As a frequent visitor to Italy and a massive fan of the cuisine we had hoped for so much more especially as it is not a bargain to dine here

Myself and my wife were wandering around Covent Garden looking for something fairly simple for lunch There were lots of stalls selling meatballs burgers pulled pork etc but we wanted something a little less meaty  In the end we opted for Hola Paella  We ordered a medium and small size based upon looking at the plates they had on show with a chicken skewer each Unfortunately the person serving us didn t really load the plates up so really it felt like we had ordered an extra-small and small  The food itself was very tasty both the paella and the chicken Of course the main ingredient of the paella was rice but the amount of seafood was pretty paltry A couple of prawns and a mussel shell each I didn t find the mussel itself  The amount of seating is limited but given the size of the portions we didn t hang around and quickly vacated our table for someone else If I was given the choice again I d opt for a burger from another stall It s easier to see what you are getting

A recent visit to our previously 5 star rated restaurant sadly didn t live up to expectations - the chicken Satays were not cooked properly and one portion had to be be returned 3 times the rest of the food was OK but lacked something compared to all of our previous meals Maybe the chef had an off day but Satay shouldn t be that difficult to get right

My wife and I went to Luscombes on a Saturday night The staff are fabulous very welcoming and attentive The setting is wonderful with the dining room very relaxed and not fussy at all  My wife had the Tuna Carpaccio and the Beef which was very nice indeed I had the sardines and monkfish and although nice could have done with a bit more seasoning It may be my palate but Sardines can take a large pinch of rocksalt to crisp up the skins For dessert we shared the banana tart tatin with peanut butter ice cream  the ice cream was heavenly but the tart a let down   the base was just a blind cooked round of puff pastry with the bananas laid on top just before serving which meant the pastry was very dry and flavourless  We also had a bottle of wine water and coffee afterwards and the bill came to 120  So in summary the food is good but it needs that finer attention to detail to make it great and also justify the prices as in my opinion the bill was about 30- 40 to much especially when there are other establishments very close that are in the same market and have already got the package right  Saying this I will try Luscombes again probably for Sunday Lunch I hope that they prosper and achieve the Michelin star that they are obviously trying for

We had a early dinner and had the 3-course set menu The food was as expected and we enjoyed much  The server on the other hand could smile and be more interactive than only checking if everything is alright  Thumbs up for the bartender for the great cocktails though  Overall we enjoyed our evening
Rubeez was ok Nothing to complain about  The food was good without being remarkable The service was good and the price fair I would go again

Having travelled from North Wales for a long weekend to stay with family We went for a few drinks and a meal at The Fleming Arms The drinks were good with real ales But they let themselves down badly we ordered the meals and when they arrived after a long wait they messed up the order which meant one meal had to go back i was told that the meal would be served within about five minutes but the wait was much longer as the rest of the party had just about finished their meal when mine arrived This should not happen when the till receipt was correct but the meals were not the same as on the order It spoilt a good night Never had a problem there before but will think again befor I ever would return
We have been getting chips from here for years but lately the fish has not been good nor the chips there are better chip shops in Wisbech

Beautiful setting lovely and relaxing views looking over the river The food was very nice what we got but very small portions 3 course meal was just about enough for me but my husband was still hungry by the time we left The service was not bad at all but making reservation was a nightmare they just don t answer the phone I had to go there to make a reservation obviously that would not be possible if you don t live local Quite pricey for what you get but you are paying for the setting so it is still worth the experience

There are lovely views of the Riiver Brock if you can secure a table by the picture windows The cafe is a bit like a slightly upmarket motorway services I find the hot food old fashioned in style overcooked and underseasoned There s a decent selection of cold food with the salad bar probably winning the prize for best value Generally prices are on the high side of reasonable Coffee is dreadful The staff are nice but it takes them a while to clear the tables In the Gents the urinals are in the form of giant porcelain flowers You can buy postcards of them if that s your thing

I found Caboose because of the 1 on Trip Advisor and put it to my mates Firstly I d like to say that comms was slightly slow but adequate enough we did have a lovely evening and the food was very good but personally I felt the experience left me feeling like I had to make excuses for the place to my friends as it had been my idea  Who charges 5 corkage but equally doesn t sell alcohol  Don t see how that is fair but accepted it as per of the experience  toilets are available but are portakabins shared by other street food vendors in the immediate vicinity  the alternative was to wall to a nearby pub they have an agreement with  Starter was really nice and Main amazing with some great slow cooked beef and pork on offer aides were equally good  dessert however were Bakery bought brownies with shop bought Ben & Jerries ice cream  I appreciate this is a prime shoreditch brick lane east location but the 35 per head my meal was didn t live up to the hype despite being able to play my music of choice on their iPad  Do go but just be aware of the circumstances wouldn t choose to go again

Have been here several times before On this occasion we went to a theme night Midnight in Paris which cost 20 per person in addition the cost of our meal and drinks The 20 included a glass of sparking a rice ball and chicken liver parfait on a small piece of toast I was expecting more for 20 My starter of mushrooms was tasty but there wasn t enough I had a vegetarian main which I fedback on the night to say that some of the veg were very undercooked and I felt my comments were ignored My apple desert was not particularly memorable Would I go to another theme night there  Probably not Would I eat there again I d probably give it another go at lunchtime when the prices are more reasonable to see if they were having an off night Having eaten there several times before the food seems to be very different to what I ve experienced before and sadly not for the better Overall I didn t feel full after eating a 3 course meal it was expensive for what it was however on the upside the staff were on the whole very friendly there was a nice atmosphere and I still had a good night out with my friends

Have been there Not once  Always the same story  1 a long queue to the bar if you are without a reservation take your card details in case of cancellation etc  2 have to pay for the entrance 20 person if you are going to come after 10pm 3 always crowding - no space to dance & sometimes difficult to breath  4 great presentation of cocktails nice but costly 5 majority of people are completely wasted 6 lots of expats 7 many pretty girls but it is doubtfully due to of no light and alcohol cocktails 8 very long queue to the sort of clock room   But if you are there because of your friends who don t care about mentioned above and you share their lifestyle etc then you are very welcome
Excellent service average food that could be good with more attention to detail relaxed atmosphere reasonable value for money

We have visited The Old Bakery several times before and given it glowing reviews our last visit however was a disappointment  The service was as usual very efficient and friendly we were well informed by our servers and the wine package was explained in a knowledgable fashion we had a lot of friendly banter with everyone that served us so situation normal  The food however was well below standard in my opinion it lacked the wow factor that we had come to expect from the establishment which appeared to be the result of cost cutting in the ingredients used I understand the need for cost control in order to maintain profitability but not at the expense of customer dissatisfaction  We did not complain but left a little bemused by what we had eaten certainly if this had been our first visit we would not have returned however having eaten there in the past we hope that this is just one of those nights and that when we return again it will be back to it s former glory
