Have used this venue twice a year for last 11 years and until this latest trip have never found fault But and it s a big BUT since refurbishment last year all the more mature waitresses seem to have been replaced with younger staff who were overwhelmed  We have until now never been turned away for not booking especially when staying in the attached Premier Inn but on this occassion we were made to return in1 2 hour this is was despite counting get at least 12 empty tables still empty when we returned Then 1 2hr wait to be given menu and place drinks order Another 1 2hr before food order taken then 3 4hr wait for starter superb main was very poor and late eating made for uncomfortable night sleep  Breakfast was totally different familiar mature server Pat like being in two different restaurants Only problem we were still bloated from late dinner to do breakfast justice  Come on Befeater get some experienced waiting staff back

Stayed here for three nights as working in the area bed was very comfortable and the breakfast was very good too I stayed in room 4 which had recently been refurbished I did stay over the weekend and they had a band on which I could hear in my room but to be honest I was so tired it never kept me awake If working in this area I would stay here again Also has free parking and WiFi Which is a bonus
Went on Friday    to be told they run out of LOBSTER like really that s like so not cool spoilt r evening

having been to this restaurant before we was looking forward to a nice quick  but not in a fast food type of way meal    the place was busy as usual and after only a small wait for a table we sat and ordered   the wife went for a veggie burger and myself the classic burger with bacon and cheese the food arrived and we tucked in only for the wife to find a lump of black stuff upon which closer inspection we found the rest of the charcoal lump that was stuck in the middle of her burger  i told the waitress who was very apologetic and immediately offered a new burger and a refund on her original meal   the replacement came very quickly along with another offer of any food or drink we liked but sadly my wife had lost appetite and only ate half of her meal Its such a shame that a small mistake can put you off a place but i dont think we will be back for a while at least But other than this its a nice place with a different selection of burgers to try
Good service but not much food selection nice views and local beers friendly staff  average food portions nothing spectacular would reccomend if going for lunch or you enjoy the scenery
that night when both of us had acid reflux we think from the black pudding mash that went with the belly pork  As it is quite expensive I shall think twice before revisiting

Yes the food was quite nice nothing special The restaurant is very nice inside very quiet when we visited so no atmosphere Maybe we just booked the wrong time slot The waitress was very helpful and tried her best to meet any requirements we had Just felt overall this was overpriced
As it goes with F & B the food is good as you can expect They do have a few nice breakfast options like American Pancakes Parking is easy and the setting is nice

Found this pub by chance whilst taking a Sunday afternoon drive The pub was very busy but had plenty of parking There were lots of things in the garden such as bouncy castles ect if you had small children We had not booked but the staff were very friendly & helpful & although the place was packed we seated seated very fast We had different starters that were ok the mushrooms in Stilton sauce did not work very well & we all settled on having a Sunday roast which came up nice & fast considering how busy they were The food was not that great great to be honest although the setting & the staff were very nice

We went to this hotel restaurant after evening racing expecting that it might be a little lively In fact it was a little like finding oneself at afternoon tea in an old-folks home The restaurant itself is a bit away from natural light which does not help The staff were fine but not overly cheerful The food was what passes for sophisticated in English market towns i e not very but very average in quality Perhaps we were unlucky in our choices or perhaps the accountants have attacked the chef s budget The wine was expensive for what it was  Sadly this is probably the best there is in Newmarket a town which seems very keen to cater for those who prefer spicy and oriental food - late night drunks perhaps

We visited a few weeks ago in a party of 10 for a Sunday lunch The food was good not excellent The setting everything was quite lovely Staff were attentive and service was good Our main courses were Beef or Lamb Like I say food was good but nothing special The cost was 13 95 for 3 courses it wasn t expensive although not cheap either At that kind of money I was expecting a similar meal to that on offer at nearby Beckworth Emporium near Sywell My afters was fruit crumble and custard which had tinned peaches in it - it really was quite horrible perhaps my taste So in conclusion the food was OK but would I go back probably not Unfortunately there are in my opinion better places to lunch on a Sunday I would rather pay the extra  or two and have a really excellent meal which sadly this was not

Popped into here one evening to have pizza  We ve a Pizza Express local to us and it is delicious everything comes out beautifully fresh and flavourfull  So when the pizzas arrived and we started eating to find out they were OK but nothing special and no as good as what we can get at home we weren t overjoyed  Service was rather slow too plus sitting on the terrace outside on the first floor we were getting mugged by wasps who arrived soon after the pizza was delivered  Overall you could do better elsewhere

Lured in by the 30 discount off food the restaurant is sort of upmarket TGIF with waiting staff perched at the end of your table taking the order nice ambience busy on a friday evening Bit noisy staff nice n friendly with plenty of seating in booths  but if the place is going upmarket then someone needs to tell the Kitchen to up their standards Thai fish cakes made with salmon not too authentic sounding or tasting fajitas ok but no better than TGIF pork belly inedible bit greasy bland  really horrible  to be fair the dish was taken off the bill but that s not the point really it shouldn t have been allowed to leave the kitchen   or the pig even  Conclusion Go there for the atmosphere but don t expect even gastropub food The bill even with food discount is still likely to be in the 40s per person
After all the good reviews we got a takeaway Pasts was ok not much sauce or meat Not sure why it is rated so highly as it wasn t a bargain either

Six of us went for dinner on Saturday night I had the langoustine tortellini pigs trotter and the pistachio souffle They were all good but they all seemed a bit half finished not quite rustic French or fine dining The main definatly needed some veg and I don t expect to have to order a side to make up my meal If it was in a GastroPub then it would have been fine Our main complaint was the service - it started off well and then seriously tailed off - whether it was because we stopped ordering wine at the end of the main 3 bottles already finished I don t know but we had to get their attention to order dessert having been left for 15 mins then with the 15 mins reqd for the souffle the evening was seriously dragging I don t want to be rushed when eating but 3 hours is stretching it a bit Had been looking forward to this for so long and really wanted to love it and was left disappointed - we all were a bit Had I only paid the 39 for the fixed price it would have been good but 110 a head  Now afternoon tea at the Langham the next day - that s a different story - amazing food and service

Disappointing visit not their fault but screaming kids at 9-15 am 3 September 2015 is not the start to the day I want I was later surprised that customers were allowed in with a very small dog not a guide dog in the coffee shop and Bistro - not good

Living in London Cote is a familiar sight They deliver with service but rarely excel Better than the usual chains pizza express strada prezzo etc  Their desserts are worth trying I ve been a few times and would go again

We stayed at the adjoining Premier inn arriving early se decided to grab some lunch before checking in on entering the restaurant at 12 10 we were told they weren t ready and to sit at the bar After around 20 minutes other people entered and were seated in the restaurant area so we found a table and waited and waited but no member of staff brought us menus but proceeded to serve several tables around us my wife approached a waitress and asked for menus with which she replied as we had been sat at the bar we were only drinking the staff need to talk to each other When we did eventually order and the food arrived it wasn t great cold fries also the area was very dirty seats need a thorough clean  We had reservations about breakfast as we had pre booked however we were looked after by Ben who was very professional and received exactly what we ordered Maybe the breakfast staff should Train the lunchtime staff in customer relations

Great location with a fantastic view over the Minster valley  Staff polite and helpful with plenty of outside seating available Excellent selection of beers and ales including Erdinger Alcoholfrei which has to be the best non-alcohol beer out there

Been here few times b4 about 6 months ago seemed 2 have gone down hill abit food came out warm was not in mood 2 complain was enough food shame as staff was nice but than went 2 bathroom toilet had no locks on any doors+was no hand wash which I think is bad 4 restaurant

Have eaten here many times Very nice if you can get a seat outside overlooking the river on a nice day Food has always been good staff always very friendly Quite expensive for a pizza restaurant I would say However my main complaint would be about the people who let their noisy children run around the restaurant The staff really should do something about this

Arrived at 8pm on a Saturday night without a reservation Was asked to grab a drink in the bar area and expect a 25 min wait which we were ok with  Nice table comfy seating ordered drinks The drinks din t arrive so after ten minutes I called another waiter and re-ordered We had the a la carte menu rather than the buffet Food was very good lamb chops to start Tikka Marsala for main The problem was that we waited 35 mins between courses and were offered no apology  Think that they struggled to cope on a very busy Saturday night with what seemed like a minimal number of staff  There are a number of quality eateries on the same street Next time we ll either try the v=buffet or venture over the road one of its many neighbours  Paid 63 for two of us inc 4 large beers and a bottle of house rose wine

It s not a bad restaurant but it s not a great restaurant and it s the only place you can go if you fancy Thai in Dorking and to my eyes that lack of competition has resulted in complacency The place just isn t special enough It s fairly small inside and can get really busy especially at the weekend when the well-to-do come out to celebrate their birthdays The food is fine but uninspired It tastes like it should but is pretty much choose your meat choose your sauce and add rice or noodles There isn t much more too it than that and there should be That was fine 10 years ago but to really impress the Sang Thai needs to inject some new ideas into it s food it s presentation and it s staff or the restaurant is going to age into retirement alongside it s customers

Bring mentioned in the Michelin guide I thought we d dine well here The starters were very nice crab cakes and breaded camembert really tasty food Desert was very nice too chocolate mouse But the main courses disappointed  I had the cote de boeuf with chips which came with a supplement Asked how I wanted it cooked I explained that I usually have rare but what ever the chef thinks is best   you can have it how you like love   was the response so I stuck with rare My wife went for the fish and chips When it arrived the steak was very big but a bit thin and probably medium rare and a bit chewy in parts And of the 6 or so trendy chunky chips at least a couple were not cooked and hard in the middle If you re going to do chunky chips please get them right Fish was fine and very large but again a couple of under cooked chips  I know this is pub grub but the fuss about the mention in the Michelin guide made me expect better Staff were very friendly and the service was good Maybe I got a bad bit of meat and spud
Good time with friends and cheap shots but the local tart who shows up at your table to offer free drinks only then to subsequently charge 4quid a round is somewhat annoying

Standard price standard  formula  middle of the road Innkeeper Carvery Penty of off road parking and pleasant staff less crowded than many on Sunday afternoon or evening and they do always keep everything piping hot  [Kids can eat free with a paying adult]

One thing to underline  the food is good Pricey but okay Staff are good but they need more of them  8 covers in our party all eating and finishing at different times Poor Only ordered mains Two waiters  with a tray each and it would be so much improved And not cocking up the order The business model of customers ordering is okay  but not without an order note book This is fundamental surely More staff  to serve Give covers an order pad  real or interactive Add a waiting area or bar as waiting area  you ll make money - honest  Disappointingly ranks 3rd out of the 5 similar establishments in the city  Not in a rush to return

Went to the crooked billet for lunch today yes it was shocking   Long wait for not the best food but in all honesty it is just fried spirit grub What really should we expect sun shining beer garden packed with council estate kids staff run off their feet shocking honesty of today s world of working in hospitality   One thing that stood out for me young ginger lad ran off his feet but amazingly compromising obviously trying his best didn t get his name but well done you sorted out what could of been a disastrous lunch for us you turned it around young man who ever you are thank you

Ordered a takeaway from the merged Spice Merchant Pagea on Poplar Road The Mixed Grill  6 25 starter was a pleasant enough array of meat to start my Indian odyssey off on However I was underwhelmed by the Garlic Chilli Chicken  7 35  Fried rice  2 50 and Garlic Naan  2 50  Feel ashamed that I cheated on Imlees in Moseley by trying something different whilst my wife was away and this was compounded when checking that the collection discount of 10 at Pangea compared poorly to the 20 at Imlees Whilst the food here was okay I think there are better pickings not too far away

Went to Caffe Nero during a shopping trip with 3 other people It was busy and whilst I accept they want to get drinks out it might help by getting the tables cleaned a bit quicker Coffee was ok That is all

I think we may have been unfortunate picking a night to dine in the restaurant when it was understaffed There was 8 tables occupied but only the one server and as charming as she was she seemed way out of her depth  I was in a party of three and we all ordered the set menu for 3 people We had to wait over 45 mins for our starters to arrive and when they did it was only for two she apologised and we then had to wait a good 10 minutes before the third starter arrived Reading the reviews on the quality of the food I did expect the starters to be better than they were After finishing the starters we then waited over half an hour for our main meals which tasted better After waiting a while again we asked for the desserts and she looked confused and had to check the menu to realise that these were included in the set meal When they finally arrived one of them was missing the vanilla ice cream and we were informed with a smile that they had run out The drinks especially the wine were on the high side  As I mentioned the server could not have been more friendlier but having to wait patiently so long for our food especially when you can see the kitchen preparing take away orders while you are sitting in the restaurant ruined what should have and could have been a really nice pleasant evening

We were luck enough or so we thought to get a cancellation and move from the packed bistro into the main restaurant overlooking the harbour All was well until the waitress supervisor came to take our order At first all was well and she asked whether we were ready to order She then realised that we had swapped from the bistro and told us in no uncertain terms that we were not residents had not booked and were walk ins  Therefore we would have to wait and would be put to the back of the list She then walked away and asked another table whether they were ready to order leaving us in a state of shock and anger We were treated like second class citizens just because we had not booked in advance How shameful  We complained to the manager and to be fair he did apologise having witnessed the event and gave us some wine on the house restoring some of our faith

Spontaneous lunch arrangement having visited previously without any issues seemed a justified idea Arrived and was told to sit wherever we wanted apart from the booths on the far side Waited far too long to be brought drinks and noticed my glass seemed to have mud on the side I asked for a clean glass which was brought back to me topped up- standard customer service with an apology  Food came which was very average but we did order from the lunch time menu so was not expecting anything outstanding I found a hair underneath my chips having already had a dirty glass I was going to let this slide being British and as this does happen occasionally  As I approached midway through my glass of the black stuff my partners eyes widened A thick black ring of residue around the inside middle of the glass How was this not spotted after I had already complained once about a dirty glass I could no longer let this slide  I expressed my concerns to the waitress who went to speak to a manager offering no initial apology The manager who had previously swapped my glass came to offer apologies and standard compensation for the meal and a voucher for a return trip

Went there last saturday 16th May afternoon   Architecturally its stunning with great views from the terraces & balconies  Service was appalling we were not ordering food  just beer took an age to get served  the staff seemed more interested in chatting to mates & each other When we did eventually get served the beer was dreadfully dispensed & the staff didn t seem to know the procceedure  disappearing for minutes on end to get change & glasses etc  The first Pint I ordered was clearly off Cloudy & stank  I reordered  the second beer was end of barrel  Third time lucky I ordered same as friend  We found table on roof garden  But ended up leaving the beer it was awful  We went back down stairs to see what else was on offer & ordered 2 more pints of different ales  Mine wasn t great & It didn t clear so I took it back & chose yet another  My friend drank some of hers but again it wasn t right  Maybe it was opening week teething problems but staff training etc should be sorted & keeping Ales in fine fettle is a must

We came here as a random drop in whilst working nearby Staff were efficient but we didn t see a single smile the whole time we were there The food arrived quickly - we had one of the set banquet options The food was nicely presented but nothing special it was decent enough but it could have been a standard takeaway The portions were a good size though and we certainly didn t leave hungry The location is very pleasant with views across the river although access to the restaurant is up a few flights of stairs  Our meal was very good value - 65 for 2 including beer and coffee

Visited for first time and ordered starter olives and bread majority of olives tiny Main course Calzone whilst the content was good pastry was burnt round the edges and on the base When this was pointed out to the waiter his reply was I ll bring you a raw one next time  3pounds 50 corkage a bit steep particularly as bottle was a screwtop By the way debit or credit cards not accepted Considering this is supposedly an authentic Italian restaurant their performance leaves a lot to be desired

Just back in our holiday cottage after a visit to River Cottage Canteen The rear dining hall was busy & noisy with one or two very young customers not being too happy as it was obviously way past their bedtime Service was efficient throughout the two hours we spent in the Canteen The menus are detailed on large blackboards hung on two of the walls Six starters and six main courses with no sign of chicken or beef anywhere to be seen  The food was fine - we opted for mussels and capaccio starters & for the mains - line caught grey mullet & a major salad comprising sugar snaps heritage tomatoes thyme baked ricotta & hazlenuts  Overall a satisfying experience with no frills but good value for money
Good place for business lunch with wifi Limited 17 for 3 courses inc a glass of prosecco Not enough diners to create any ambience but the food was relatively tasty

We visited the restaurant the food was good however one of our steaks was uncooked so had to send it back When the bill came there was a 8 service charge on it which was a ridiculously large amount We didn t think it was worth that much so asked for it to be removed and left a 3 tip ourselves The music was loud however I had no problem with that

The venue was bright and something out of an ikea magazine The service can not be faulted The corn fed chicken will now that is heavenly coupled with the slightly spicy sauce The combination is great and the chicken wings five piece starter is great The pulled chicken broiche roll is just average which was disappointing as my rating would have been higher The sides have to be paid for separately and are on the pricey side Would I go again yes and with the chain possibly opening in shoreditch London  watch out chicken here I come Warning the sauce is fantastic and is just right

Barnsley is a Cotswold gem of a village and the pub should be equally so However there is a Jekyll and Hyde quality about the place which ultimately disappoints  although you can t help but think that strip away the pretension and that gem is bursting to get out A fabulous summer s day and the courtyard garden just aches for customers to fill it over a classic country pub lunch And there the schizophrenia kicks in  1 2 out of 4 beer pumps out of action Not for the first time   so what I hear you ask does anybody seriously believe this a classic country pub 7 85 for a 250ml glass of Valdivieso merlot available on the high street so hardly unique left me wondering if I had been served by Dick Turpin Admittedly the follow up glass of chardonnay was very good value  The menu is not exactly the most adventurous you will ever come across but if this was a country pub there would be no complaints However either the food must be beyond reproach or there must be more of it to justify the prices charged Sadly the latter rules Rump steak was tasty but to quote my wife a struggle to get through  Chips were light and tasty and the sauce although thin was equally so But it s a steak dish and if the steak does not stack up then what is the point Plaice did not quite fall off the bone but it was at least fresh New potatoes and green beans qualified easily for a game of hide and seek The beurre noisette was all beurre which left a slick on the plate and palate It s not that this was a bad meal but rather that it could have beem so much better Instead there is an element of a place in which one must be seen but let s not focus on the food too much Totally overpriced for the quality of the cuisine and the portion sizes I am convinced it could be better if it got over itself and delivered a better dining experience for those who just want a great pub meal

I ve driven past this place loads of times and have never been tempted to go in The outside decor and general look of the place is a bit off-putting Eventually my wife and I tried it this evening and it was average in every way possible I had a decent pint of beer but my wife s lager was served in a dirty glass and tasted vile The food was average though not pricey but the menu was very flowery for pub grub The bar staff were friendly but the waiting staff were abrupt verging on rude and weren t particularly good In all it was uninspired and other than popping in again for a drink maybe it isn t somewhere I would rush back to

We had a great meal with freshly cooked food which was well presented  We returned a couple of weeks later to be told it was too late to eat in but we could have a takeaway The fish was freshly cooked but the chips were not fresh They refused to cook more chiips because they were about to close Surely the standard should be the same what ever time you arrive and order food

Food wasnt all that found most of the food cold plus all the chef needs to put smile on the face as if like there happy to serve you was abit dissappointed with that plus once i got to the dinning floor was lost didnt no were to go to after 20second later waiter came up to me which felt abit embarassing while everyone looking at you when ur lost but i love the decor how it was done
Service and staff are very good The food is not bad The ambience is lacklustre and the piped music persists so they as the place fills up it is difficult to converse
Food was very nice but the restaurant was very loud and the atmosphere wasn t particularity suited to intimate dinner for a date

My wife and I dined here to celebrate her birthday We had not eaten at Chiquito s for a few years and her choice for the day was a good Tex Mex   We remembered from years ago that this place was usually very busy so we were amazed to be the only customers there on a Friday lunchtime at 12 00 Service was quick very attentive and very friendly they even gave us a helium balloon when I mentioned the birthday - very sweet There was one small glitch my meal arrived with chips instead of the salad that I had ordered it was put right very quickly Maybe I should have done a Michael Winner and insisted that the order was written down instead of memorised  -  Drinks My wife had a Margharita and later a Long Island Ice Tea I sampled both While they both tasted nice it was pretty clear to us that the alcohol levels were minimal so 5 50 a pop was a little steep My lemonade was fine  Food The big loaded chili nachos to share starter was very nice not the best but certainly not the worst we ve had The toppings were good Sadly the portion size was relatively small One main courses was fajitas The super hot skillet on a wooden tray was impressive and even scarred the table underneath My wife liked them despite the flavours being a little bland The salsa and guacamole were unimpressive and not as good in our opinion as the shop-bought variety and again there was not a lot of them  I had chicken quesadillas thin strips that covered half the plate with salad Tasty but not a lot of it and very little chicken filling  Ambiance very quiet as we the only customers for half of our visit I saw what looked like ripped  patched bench seats Gents toilet hand soap dispenser did not dispense anything waiter said it may be stuck he will go fix    All in all we had a good time Maybe the portion size is Chiquitos well-intentioned effort to improve the health of the nation reduce alcohol levels and food waste etc Or it could be that they just want people to order more side dishes and deserts We ordered from the main menu not the lunch menu the lunch menu was cheaper with presumably even smaller portions  Considering everything above I can only justify three stars  My tips if you are hungry plan to order side dishes and or a dessert If you enjoy alcoholic drinks choose something that isn t mixed

We ve been here a few times - when we ve been able to get a baby sitter It does a good job of serving thai food - the starter platter is excellent but the service can be very slow always really friendly though

My wife and I are frequent visitors to this restaurant and on previous occasions have never been disappointed with the food or service in fact highly recommended this restaurant to many friends and work colleagues We visited the restaurant again very recently my wife chose the sea bass and King Prawns Chefs special which was delicious I ordered the chicken pate for starter which was nice and chose the BBQ Beef Burger for the main meal The burger was a cheap nasty frozen type which was tasteless the waitress did ask if everything was OK in which I did express my disappointed She did offer to replace the meal but I declined The waitress did go to speak to the chef returned and was full of apologies but no explanation as to why the meal was poor The food is generally very good and we never have qualms about paying the inflated prices and always left good tips But being charged 42 50 for a bar meal without ever receiving a small gesture or offer of a discount really disappointed me  I will sure to have the same cold attitude next time I pay the bill

busy when we arrived  But I thought the atmosphere was quiet for the amount of people in there the choice on the menu was limited and not much choice if you don t like meat could do with more fish choices on the menu
A great little braissere in the centre of Manchester serving very nice food at amazing prices Good wine list so an excellent inexpensive dining experience Staff young cheerful attentive and helpful

Booked for a group of a dozen friends Problems began when they claimed that we had booked for a table of 20 when I had rung the day before to correct the number to 12 meaning we had to stand around waiting awkwardly whilst they changed over We were then left with our menus for a very long time before ordering and then again our starters took quite some time to arrive One friend had to repeatedly chase up his order of vegetarian momos By the time we had finished our starters and were waiting for our mains it was 18 30 having arrived at 5 The food itself was admittedly absolutely delicious but the whole process around actually getting it could have been improved in many ways and it left most people feeling pretty cranky especially as the slow service was putting many of us in risk of missing our train home None of these problems would have been huge in isolation but it added up to a pretty frustrating experience
Love the decor and it s good to see something like this in Sunderland Food was average- I ve had better I ve had worse Overpriced for what it is but the decor and central location make up for that

First impression was nice decor well presented surroundings  The staff were very friendly and efficient The menu was adequate if rather short on main courses and the chilly heat ratings need to be more accurate  I love Indian food and the Kharai Chicken 2 chilly rated barely reached a 1 for me compared to my local restaurant but quite nice none the less Have a good look at your bill too There were 11 in our party total cost 185 60 in BIG BOLD numbers at the bottom However on closer inspection the small print  just above showed the actual bill was 168 85 with a suggested service charge gratuity of 16 75 again in small print  Obviously its the big bold numbers that get your attention Now I dont mind giving a tip but I do object to being for want of a better word tricked into it A nice place but now where near the best place I ve eaten   sorry chaps

Went here for a meal with my wife in early February It was quiet relaxed and we received a warm welcome The place had a nice ambience - really liked the decor inside Unfortunately the food did not quite deliver I had seafood linguine which while tasty was not plentiful by any means - very small portion  too small My wife had liver - she was told it would be pink which my wife said would be absolutely fine as this is how she likes it but they needn t have bothered as it turned up cremated  Both hungry after mains so we pigged out on three desserts between us which in fairness were delicious The staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable just let down by the kitchen

We visit the Living Cafe Maidstone several times a week It is a great cafe with a lovely atmosphere At the weekend they have the B team serving They don t pay attention to the order spill the coffee when serving and don t apologise  wait for the coffee to get cold before bringing the cakes and then don t include the special offer when adding up the bill Shame because it is a really nice place during the week
Eaten here few times not to bad but service is terrible they over book then can t handle it   Food ok burgers etc   would go again but when its quite
Never been to a smokehouse before Giving an average rating until I visit another to compare the two Food was very reasonable though Left feeling very full

I have been going to this pub for several years It provides basic food which is cheap and sometimes tasty The pub itself has TVs for watching Sky Sports so if you don t like football be careful when you visit The pub caters well for students and has a large outside seating area Not surprisingly many people sit outside to smoke - please look outside in the summer if you are with children and check on the number of smokers I will go there again for fish or a burger

Went here on the Monday night half price day All well and good but the popadoms had to go back as they tasted like they were cooked in old oil After we sent the second lot back we gave up on them  The food was OK but not memorable The portions were on the small side I suppose half size on half price Monday I walked out feeling still hungry a first for me normally I am well stuffed after enjoying a curry  The owner was a nice guy and tried his best 10 10 for effort

We had Christmas lunch The overall package was enjoyable largley because of the charming efficient staff and the general atmosphere The quality of the food was good except the Yorkshire puddings were over cooked burnt and as a hearty eater i would say the maincourse portions were modest The presentation was done with care and the service was friendly and efficient Over all we had a good time  However for somewhere of this potential quality charging these prices the gents loo is a joke

This is a pleasant Italian restaurant not far from Hammersmith Broadway and not that far from the Olympia Exhibition Halls  This means that in the evenings the restaurant becomes very busy and unless you have pre-booked a table it may mean you joining a queue at the door  This in turn means there is a knock on effect or subconcious pressure for you to have your meal and drink and leave as soon as possible within reason I mean by this that you can enjoy a leisurely meal however once you have eaten and your plates are quite promptly cleared away your bill is soon on your table regardless of whether you have finished your glass of wine or bottle  Having said this I must say the staff are very pleasant and helpful and they do not ask you to pay the bill on the bills arrival but its arrival does make you feel your time is up and you should leave as soon as you can I can quite understand the reason but it does kind of take the edge off the visit  Regarding the menu it is of average Italian fare with the addition of a few dishes of the day on a board with nothing to really excite one You can enjoy a wide range of Pizzas Lasagne Risottos with a good selection of wines  Overall a pleasant dining experience and this was my second visit over two days on an Olympia exhibition stand but just average  I

This little farmshop is in a great location sells good produce but the cafe which was once great has sadly gone downhill The coffee is still very good but the food is either good or terrible and the cakes are average but were once awesome when they made on site I don t know why it s dipped but I hope the standards rise again as I miss the the way it used to be

A few days ago I visited this restaurant the food was of a high quality and the female members of staff were very attentive to the needs of the customers I have noticed that a member of staff no longer works at the restaurant from my long years in the catering trade goosd staff should be held on to If I had a criticism to make about this restaurant is about a male member of staff who seems to think that he owns the place I overheard him shouting at the staff in earshot of the customers this is very unprofessional When I owned my restaurant I would never embarass my staff in front of the customers
We enjoyed the food on offer and the ales are nice - however the place although done very nicely is a little sterile for our liking worth a visit though

Been a few times and the food is hit or miss with little middle ground  Chicken wings are a speciality and can ve delicious but I once received a bone dry overcooked portion with no sauce and the waiter practically called me a liar when I said they were  Beer atmosphere and decor are good though so generally ok

We had the carvery with a choice of three meats Gammon beef & turkey The beef was too well done for my liking The price was reasonable  8 95 My daughter and granddaughter both ordered a crab salad which when arrived the crab was off If you can`t tell when food is off before sending it out is a bad sign

My wife and I went here at the invitation of our Daughter and her family The place is typical Chain of Pubs with Restaurant  with divided areas to allow a little privacy All perfectly OK  Our service on this visit was slow and it was not particularly easy to pacify a small child who needed feeding The starters arrived and we had asked for the child s meal to be served with them OK again  Then the main courses arrived My ribeye steak was totally inedible Asked to provide it rare it was certainly overcooked but more importantly it was all gristle and fat When asked if the meal was satisfactory the waitress was advised of the my problem with this meal but also of some other problems It was probably the worst steak I had ever been served To her credit she advised that there were problems in the kitchen at the time and as a result we were not charged for my meal and we received an apology from the manager  I will always like to visit somewhere again if there has been such a problem as it is all too easy to be considered poor when it could be a one off therefore returning again with my family I have to include the fact that the meal on that occasion was perfectly OK and the rather sour note from the earlier visit was eliminated My concern was that they were aware of problems and felt that they could have been avoided  The restaurant is very popular and I have difficulty in giving an average score when in truth it was very poor on one visit but then very good on another

Have been here a couple of times before going to the cinema Staff were friendly enough and the service was quick As with all Pizza Express branches they make a decent pizza and the prices are fine Nothing really to fault here but nothing amazing either So all in all a good meal at a decent price

I joined a birthday celebration here in a party of seven The table wasn t ready when we arrived but only had to wait for a few minutes The staff were friendly and the good service lasted all night  However the food was average which was slightly disappointing I had the steamed pollock dumplings to start and the lamb shank for main course Both dishes were over powered by the high level of spices used and therefore lacked subtlety My fellow diners also thought there dishes were overpowered by the spices However the wine list was good and we enjoyed especially the Argentinian Merlot 2008

Lovely new restaurant in Redditch a much needed variant on the usual selection of fast food and Indian places Food was great with large portion sizes Staff were friendly if not a bit nervous it was only their second day open though My only criticism was the 10 service charge added to the bill and then the card machine asking for a gratuity Foolishly I didn t spot the service charge had already been added to the bill don t know any places that still do this as it is frowned up on I then added a gratuity on the card machine as that s the norm Very cheeky indeed hence my reduced rating don t fall for it I won t not again anyway

Good reviews so we thought this would be a cut above usual  Staff pleasant enough but the sauces one ordinary with no depth of flavour and the amount of meat per dish small Quite ok but relatively expensive for what we got Good if you cant be bothered to cook but not really a night out

We have only ever dashed through St Pancras in the early morning on our way to the Eurostar so when we saw that a guided tour was available we signed up for it The tour was to start at 2 00pm so the four of us booked for lunch at 12 30 and met in the bar at 12 15 The bar is in a quite magnificently restored entrance hall next to the restaurant When you ask for the loo you find it is in a cupboard up two flights of stairs At 12 30 they called us in and led by the ma€¸tre d we filed past about 10 staff at various stations through the empty restaurant to our table Each of the staff in turn greeted us politely Nobody offered to take our coats though  it was drizzling outside so I gave my coat to the ma€¸tre d and was brought a cloak room ticket for it Later when we left my raincoat seemed to have turned into an umbrella as that is what I was offered with the counterpart to my ticket attached I rummaged through the coat rack to find my coat Nobody apologised We ordered a glass of wine each and explained that we needed to be out by 1 45 ie in an hour and 15 minutes time The wine came promptly and we were then left to look at the menu for 15 or 20 minutes and had to ask if we could please order Given our situation we only wanted a light meal One of us ordered the set two course meal and the rest just one of the starters each While our colleague was eating his first course the chef very kindly provided the rest of us each with a little pot of pumpkin soup to accompany him The food was excellent so was the wine  a gruner Veltliner  Getting the bill was a problem but after asking several of the staff who were flitting past we eventually got it at 1 50 p m and so reached our tour just in time  The bill came to 100 so you pay a high price for the opulent surroundings The food is of a very good quality Considering the number of staff about the service if friendly is poor
If you are looking for a tasty hot Thai dish on a tight budget then this little place is just what you need

We ve eaten at The Navigation a few time and the food is really good A friendly atmosphere and good beers I really like it a no frills pub grub place  We booked in at 6 30 as we were with elderly relatives who didnt want to be out all night Food order at 6 45 the starters took an hour to come The main course took another hour after that The lass behind the bar was friendly but run off her feet The deserts were finally served some time after 9 00 after having to go to the bar to order as the waitress didn t come back This was a Thursday evening and the pub certainly wasn t full As I say a shame we ve been put off But I really want to like it

It s Weatherspoons You know what you get Decent ale but bar staff not very switched on knowledgeable Average ding food but value for money Venue fantastic great transformation of a local iconic site You pay your money and take your choice but don t complain as it s JDW

It s over priced for what is essentially just a posh McDonald s The ingredients are better though which is clear from the taste but wasn t worth 15 for a burger and chips Ordering was difficult as it was very loud and the girl serving was a whisperer Very pleasant though  In conclusion it was very nice but over priced and the selection of soft drinks is unrivaled

The Hoxton is all about the location where residents need to jostle for space amongst to the Shoreditch public This is the place for you if you re happy spending 15 minutes getting to the bar and competing for attention with legions of start-up types  I spent so much time trying to get some service in the vast public areas that a lively atmosphere quickly turned to frustration

we visited Cote Reigate with two friends for the first time on Tuesday Lovely spacious layout friendly welcoming and efficient staff and majority of our food was very good with one exception My boeuf bourginonne was tough fatty and gristly and cooked in a very dull watery sauce - very poor  I didnt complain on the night as everything else was so good and I didnt want to spoil the whole evening but I would warn anyone eating there to avoid this dish  Shame as previous experiences of other Cote branches have been pretty decent and reliable

This is typical of the modern take on Indian restaurants with very few of the classic trappings and decor - me I like the stereotype Indian feel of some restaurants - so this feels more like a canteen However the food is good and the service friendly

This is a pub we have known for 40 plus years We ate here for lunch twice recently during a hot spell and despite being vey busy I could not fault the service or the friendliness of the staff The big problem was value or money The first time scampi and chips was ok but 10 plus for a smallish portion The second visit we had ham egg and chips Again 10 plus for the large portion which was ok but my wife had the 7 50 small portion A slice of ham a few chips and some salad bit of a rip off Walk on past the next door hotel which amazingly does not do lunches on a Monday or Tuesday  the place was heaving to a couple of small food outlets which both looked excellent value

We tried the fixed price lunch and thought it was really good value Some of the chilli seasoning was perhaps a little heavy handed which tended to overpower the subtle flavour combinations of JGVs fusion cuisine  The overall ambiance did feel somewhat formulaic and the service perhaps over attentive But we would definitely return We do hope though that on our next visit they have not run out of Gewurztraminer

I was told about the restaurant as the pub had won Pub of the Year 2013 and went for a pint of real ale and my colleague had a class of lemonade total 5  The pub opened at 6pm on a Monday and the restaurant opened at 6 30pm We next door for our meal and were the first people in the place We looked at the menu and the specials board and as we were both on fixed expenses just went for the mail meals I had the 9oz steak and my colleague chose the King Prawns and Linguine The steak was cooked perfect and was presented with the steak on top of the rest of the food I paid 24 for the steak and a pint of draught Becks My colleague paid 16 and had a glass of water Overall the food was very good the service was good and as a one off meal then it was good but cost of the food and drink would put me off from going back again

Called at the Farmers tonight as like other reviewers we have always enjoyed the food here The fillet steak had by 2 of our party was very good as it should be there is not much anyone can do to spoil a good steak but the rest of the food was average As a restaurant it badly needs a refurbishment along with food spattered menus and dirty carpets it looks generally rundown It would have been impossible to walk in without booking a few years ago i hope things improve soon
Our last visit was a lot better than a few months back food better and staff seem happier the fajitas are really good and so is the pulled pork chips will go again

We were encouraged to go to this restaurant because of the many great reviews it has and because we love Indian Asian food It definitely was different - there was no trace of the usual Western slant on curry however the result didn t live up to the marketing and reviews It would be wrong to say the food was bad because it wasn t but there again it wasn t pushing gastrominic experiences either This said we visited on a Tuesday evening and it was clearly a popular restaurant with locals Different and ok overall but wouldn t bother revisiting personally

Service was good coffee I had was also good although cups have no handles which is weird for a hot drink  Rump steak I had was also not too bad but was over done when I asked for medium  Roast potatoes were soggy and gravy was just water which is never a good thing

The food is what you would expect from a Pizza Express restaurant - good tasty However the service at this particular restaurant on our visit was poor It took the best part of 5 minutes for our group to be acknowledged by the manager on the front desk - he point blanked ignored us And our first round of drinks actually arrived AFTER we had finished our starters I could maybe begin to understand this if the restaurant was overly busy but it wasn t
The refurb is excellent and a wonderful setting with friendly staff Sorry to say really average food though - needs to be addressed Could be so good

Popped in for a few breakfasts this week not a bad little place to eat Plenty of seating and the staff were friendly too Quick hint though instead of following the signs to the restaurant which take you up an escalator and then down another one just walk to the opposite end of the store entrance through the doors and you re there

St Mawes eateries were all pretty full apart from The View Our need for a couple of snacks and a kid s meal was adequately met My soup was very good but would have benefitted from a decent bread roll rather than slices of cheap bread and butter Service was with a smile but there was a bit of a language problem Decor is certainly minimalist

We went to the Peacock and on being served at the bar were told that the kitchens were closed as they were having problems with the gas supply so no food We had specifically gone there to eat so were disappointed that there was nothing available so we had a drink and left

Taken by friends as a birthday treat but I won t be going back I had the smoked mackerel starter which was a piece of mackerel plus pate When I asked for some toast with which to eat my pate I was brought a piece of white bread Which was odd but hey ho I followed with the sea bass served with a King Prawn risotto The sea bass was OK but the risotto was very gritty and unpleasant I finished with the cr€—me brulee which was served with     a piece of lightly toasted white bread I presume the chef or someone in the kitchen was taking the piss as I had asked for toast with my pate Your loss

My partner and I were staying over night in Derby for the first time and leaving our hotel were wandering around looking for a bar when we stumbled across this place We popped in and had a decent glass of Merlot each Service was quick prices average However we both wondered why the place was so empty on a Saturday night something the staff seemed to be equally puzzled by judging by some conversations we overheard  We noticed that there was live music after 10 and so declining to look at a menu as we had already chosen to eat at an Indian restaurant we d passed around the corner we left Meal over an hour and half later we returned to find a few more people stood around the bar and a Gary Lineker look alike singing his heart out he was very good actually  The place looked good the toilets were very smart and clean and if full would I imagine be quite a buzzy place Obviously can t comment on the food but well worth a visit in our opinion for a glass of Merlot if nothing else

Well I went in there last weekend with a vegan friend I m a Carnivor but I thought hey I ll give it a go The food was surprisingly nice and very filling  We wernt approached by anyone until 20 minutes after being in there after taking our order it took another 10 to just bring over the drinks 2 cans of lemonade  2 25 each  The meal came shorly after  2 Chilli Con Carnes my first vegetarian one very filling surprisingly tasty so was all round please with that Wouldn t go there if I was in a rush or on a budget O K - plenty of choice though

The venue was super staff friendly but food was just mediocre I had the pork belly and whilst the meat was really lovely the rest of the dish wasnt up to scratch The sweet potatoe fries were dry and coleslaw didnt really fit My partner s ribs were well seasoned but again dry as were the fries  We really wanted this place to be great but it wasn t

Hottest day of the year and staying in the nearby Britannia Hovel I really fancied a curry The restaurant was empty probably due to the fine weather I was on my own and was in and out in less than 45 minutes I had Chicken Shashlik with a Madras sauce Couldn t fault it overall was an OK experience

A few of us ate here on Saturday night after randomly deciding to go here after yaldings xmas market We went in around 8 and were the only people there at the time Quite worrying for a Saturday night I must admit We all had a variety of different dishes and although they were nice enough I am afraid to say they did all taste very similar and fairly dull and boring By no means not edible but when you are paying good money I do expect a bit more from my food I would say only Slightly better than a ready meal from waitrose Maybe I have been spoilt by turmeric gold in tudely The waiters were very attentive and good but with so many empty tables I would expect that Overall I have had a lot better and won t be visiting again unfortunately

Visited The 3 Greyhounds with a group of friends We had been advised that we couldn t pre-book a table so this meant a lengthy wait until well after lunch time This seems a bit crazy but guess means that pub doesn t lose your custom as you have no choice than to wait for a free table  or go elsewhere We had been told by our friends that had arranged to meet here that there were no children s high chairs available & to bring our own booster seat I didn t quite believe this as have NEVER been to a pub restaurant that doesn t have high chairs but I packed the booster seat just in case there had been mixed communication Sadly no mixed communication   there really were no high hairs  Strange that a pub stating at the door that children were welcome until 7pm 9pm in the beer garden didn t actually cater for them  I then needed to change my child s nappy so headed to the bar for the key to the disabled loo presuming that there would be a change table in there Wrong I had to just lie him on the floor Now I m not precious but come on  just go to IKEA & get a few high chairs & a cheap change station & mat This certainly wouldn t make me recommend the place to my friends with kids  or perhaps that s exactly what you want  a kid free pub  The food was nice It was very pricey for what I had but tasty The menu stated that my meal had a salad with new potatoes mixed in   but it had vegetable crisp things in instead Bizarre but nice I didn t question it until after I d eaten it so never mentioned anything to the staff Desserts were tasty but again pricey for want you got  Staff seemed nice enough and were polite

I went with my partner for an evening meal and I have to say the night was mediocre at best The owner head waitress welcomed us politely if not a bit too forced friendliness The chef behind the bar mentioned towards his wine choice before we d even stepped through the door which could be worked on  17 for a bottle of wine I could get online at over half the price The food was enjoyable although most of it felt pre-made supermarket foods A good variety of veggie options which is good as my girlfriend doesn t eat meat Overall not a bad place to go for an evening meal if a little overpriced but not good if you want your occasion to feel special
Took my mom out for dinner staff not friendly food o k will we be going back may be but not to soon chad

There s nothing really wrong with this restaurant but there s nothing to rave about either   The food was adequate in terms of quality - I had crispy duck pancakes nicely presented and haddock chips & mushy peas enormous piece of fish though a little cold good chips and slightly odd tasting peas  My dining companion had a pork terrine deemed OK and a pork steak bit bland  We shared a cheescake which was alright though tasted a bit processed  All this with two glasses of wine came to about 50 - not bad Service was OKish - friendly though possibly slightly too fast In some ways they seem to be trying too hard here - aiming at almost fine dining but missing For example our wine arrived half way through the first course as did an amuse bouche   If I ended up eating here again when visiting Bamburgh I wouldn t be appalled but I think I d prefer to give somewhere else a try

The White Horse is a nice traditional cosy pub in a great location Perfect for a pint after a long seaside walk  However for dinner it is average The menu is very extensive and quite appealing with a lot of seafood options but the food is served very quickly which may reflect the production line corner cutting approach They are obviously busy and popular so they ve set themselves up accordingly but at the expense of the quality preparation and presentation of the food - imho

We had the fixed price menu Every dish was seriously delicious  we had the two fish dishes to start wow and forced ourselves to have desert as it was inlaced and they were both fantastic Service however very slow and hard to find when you wanted something which took the shine off the amazing quality of the dishes

Red curry was tasty but consisted of just four slices of beef & 2 tomatoes in a sauce Mentioned this to helpful friendly waiter who came back and said there s nothing they can do as the portion sizes are laid down by Head Office Food was tasty but I dislike the poor value and having the size of my dinner decided by some corporate bean counter who s maximising profits For somewhere that markets itself as an authentic Thai experience - it wasn t it s just another chain

This is a new restaurant located in the harbour of st Ives so a wonderful location Access for push chairs is difficult and wheelchairs impossible I would think There are tables on the balcony so it is even better on a lovely evening Inside it is well done out and there is a sense of space The menu is not extensive which in many ways is good because they could concentrate on quality The food is good lots of flavours and some interesting combinations There are some specials but they need to be written up somewhere so you can compare them to what is on the menu What let the experience down for me was the service They were efficient but not really friendly or confident They left you with a feeling of a quick in and out no frills eatery with slightly more expensive prices When the front of house is organised better then this will be much improved
My wife eat here and the food was very ordinary and generally over cooked - i e soft vegetables There are much better places nearby with similar prices

Went for a meal with family on a Friday teatime and basically apart from the service it the whole meal was disappointing The food was amateurish at best I had T-Bone steak which was under seasoned full of fat and tasted off Another member of the party had organic chicken and said the whole dish tasted overly sweet All in all a waste of time and money and sadly I won t be going back If you need to pick a Ricci s pick the tapas restaurant it s much better in all departments

the restaurant looked impressive the sea food plate starter was unbelievable and the battered fish main course was so fresh you had to check for hooks  the cod melted in your mouth if not on your plate we just popped in to see our uncle Frankie who we have not seen for over 10yrs  who uses this restaurant all the time for meetings dates or just for a meal on his own  he has just moved from london and we now live in south wales so it nice to see him in this nice place he now calls home  the only problem and it is a problem is the toilets they are very poor and very small two people in the gents and the wc can t be used and the hand washing does not exist I only hope the staff don t use it

I wouldn t say the food was bad it was just expensive for your standard chain food We decided we fancied something different after work and Chiquito was on the way home Being a Sunday night it was fairly empty but the that staff were friendly and efficient We had starters of potato skins and tacos which were fine but nothing special and our mains of Chilli beef tacos and enchiladas arrived about 2 minutes after our starters had been taken away again it was all right but nothing out of the ordinary With a 2 drinks and 1 side order the bill came to 47 with hindsight we could have gone to the Fountain at Clent of the Chequers at Cutnall Green and spent the same amount of money for something a whole lot better It was ok but we both left feeling that it should have been a whole lot better for the money

It is a lot cheaper than paying to go to the top BUT a huge price for a drink and a look at the view For a one off visit it is pleasant to have a drink and look at the view but poor value for a glass of wine and a few nibbles I can t comment on the restaurant as we didn t eat there The view from the Gents is great as well

The wife wanted to try a South Indian breakfast on our visit to Leicester recently So we got their for 10 30 when the place opened  The food was all veggie buffet eat as much as you want for 6 99 Not to my taste missed my fry up for breakfast but it was taste for a lunch would have been fine for me

They are clearly doing a lot right here On a cold Tuesday evening in November the place was packed The pub is warm and welcoming the staff are friendly and helpful the real ale is good the d€÷cor standard gastropub is rural chic We had high hopes of an excellent evening when we booked in for dinner  But the food was a disappointment A smoked mackerel starter had small slivers of raw mackerel which were rubbery and tasted of nothing but raw mackerel A rib-eye steak was under seasoned and lacked flavour It was accompanied by a bizarre salad consisting mainly of raw grated red cabbage thinly sliced radish and peanuts completely devoid of any type of dressing - almost inedible My wife said her sea trout was nice and puddings were OK but we were expecting better However all the tables wee full so somebody must like the cuisine

Lovely view with good beers and wines Food s not bad but then not wonderful or over generous Ok for the price Longest queue for the bar that I can remember Has been good other times If you fancy what amounts to a reasonable bar style meal with a great view over the Solent don t be out off Get the staff to bring drinks rather than waiting at the bar

Chose the location due to local references while it will never be challenging for Rosettes the food was well cooked with good flavour portions if anything were over generous  Chef definitely has talent Good choice of wine Service was friendly and attentative making up for service staff s lack of dish knowledge  Will visit again after a positive first time

Visited as a walk-in and were welcomed We asked if we could sample the mid-day menu and were graciously accommodated First course was very good we had terrine and melon but when the main course of cod and beef was served you could smell the cod as it was presented at the table THE FISH STANK The person who cooked it and the person who served it must have known It is unacceptable for food at a restaurant of this presumed quality to even leave the kitchen in this state it should have been binned there and then Having said that the replacement fish was very good I would not recommend this restaurant because you might not get the quality food that you might expect from a restaurant under the auspices of such a grand chef Wheelers of St James it certainly is not

Whilst the food within Jamies was good it is over priced given its now more attuned to a typical chain restaurant The service wasn t amazing to say the least in fact our waitress was rude didn t smile and was rarely seen - in fact we had to go search for her   If you do attend make sure you don t eat in the basement as it lacks atmosphere

We thought we knew Reina so went in for a very early evening meal The waiting was very efficient and attentive with us being the only people in it was immediate when needed but not pressured The Efes is still on draught and quickly ordered and delivered  But by then we realised that the menu had changed and was now as large as one in the average Indian A few of the mainly less interesting Turkish items remained however it has been padded out by many mainly Italian influenced dishes  The three of us enjoyed what we had the Honey goats cheese salad was excellent indeed the salads which came with the sides were also generous The pizzas were unusual suitably thin but lacking in tomato but acceptable My skewered lamb was of an acceptable standard But we missed the unusual extra that the Turkish Reina had  Sorry but York didn t need another Italian Med restaurant - indeed several larger ones have closed - one very recently I have always preferred the ambience of the Reina to other similar restaurants in York but I m not sure it is staying on our list of York restaurants

We went there with some friends and their kids It was a Saturday night so probably not the best time for food which was ok but nothing special The experience was ruined by a group of men out to have fun which made the place very loud and not quite family friendly Ok place if you want to have drinks with friends

My wife and I chose this restaurant before and had a good experience It is also walking distance from us so I was able to drink wine with the meal The place was quite busy mostly people of our age group - mid to late 60 and over  The service was paced just right and the food was as we remembered - very good but the whole experience fizzled out at ten o clock just as we were contemplating a coffee They started clearing-up and we just felt in the way - we didn t realise they closed at 10 o clock - on a Saturday night We won t be using this restaurant again and will take our business to restaurants elsewhere in our area even if we need to use taxis or I drive but don t drink alcohol We did leave a tip in recognition of the food but the restaurant I would not recommend unless this kind of service suits you
Personally a bit disappointed as I was being told by my friends how good it is It was good but not to the extent of very good Might be a bit overhyped

My son and I always like to call in to Cucina when we are in Morley as it has a nice welcoming appeal to it  I have never eaten on an evening only experiencing the business as a cafe serving morning tea and coffee with meals so I cannot comment on the evening meals  The restaurant can be busy on a Saturday morning Seats are available outside for which there are patio heaters for cold weather though you do run the risk of sitting next to someone who is outside to smoke with their food  The food in general is excellent It is well presented and cooked well The hot drinks are also very well produced a cappuccino always comes with a small side biscuit  The service is not so good Grumpy staff who give the impression that you are inconveniencing them is the norm The food usually arrives reasonably quickly but everybody from the person on the till to the waitress bringing the food looks unhappy to be there  The cost of the food is also not so good Tea and coffee is about what you would expect maybe a little higher but the food is ridiculous  3 25 for two slices of cheese on toast is very high unless somebody is personally mixing the curds and whey in the rear which I seriously doubt

A brief review  Firstly - the place is spotless and inviting - really a great example of a warm and welcoming cafe - not a huge amount of space inside but more than enough  Staff were friendly and polite welcoming and seemed helpful  The food given the high ratings had a lot to live up to But I m afraid it didn t  Sausages and bacon were poor quality - perfectly acceptable but the bacon which WAS thickly cut was very tasteless and the sausages were catering quality at best One other review referenced this and it hasn t changed from then Ketchup and brown sauces despite being in premium-branded bottles I suspect were not the genuine thing and had been refilled - although of course this is only my impression and may be incorrect If this was correct however if prefer them to use a good quality own brand like an Aldi rather than the watery and sour tasting catering sauces  Overall - it is an ok place if you re hungry and in the vicinity - there are many more poorer alternatives but I think the overall rating for the place is incorrect in my opinion

I find over the summer months we will be happy to walk across the road to the park and enjoy breakfast or a snack at this little cafe It can get quite busy when there are bands playing in the band stand but the staff are efficient and polite  It s a cafe rather than a restaurant and there are planty of food  menu choices to go with The owner also runs the cafe in All Saints in the middle of town

We came for our special showtime evening on 4 June 2014 The staff were very good and plenty of them We enjoyed the show but our meal was not to the high standard we had come to expect from previous visits We found both the special showtime menu and the al la carte menu to not offer sufficient choice for us We do intend to come again but hope the menu choice will improve

The restaurant is part of The Green House hotel so as residents and reading previous TripAdvisor reviews my wife and I booked up a table on Saturday evening We had a drink in the bar prior to going through we came out bang on time and waited to be seated The restaurant manager asked if we could wait for a few minutes as our table wasn t quite ready  no problem we ll wait in the bar come and get us when you re ready we said We went back in and as she said we d wait for a few minutes we chose not to order another drink 20 minutes later yes 20 minutes later as I contemplated having a word a member of staff walked over to the group of four next to us to take then in to the restaurant As they moved from their seats I overheard one of them say to the other that 45 minutes is a bit much I asked her to confirm what I d just heard when she did so I walked straight round to the guy on reception for assurance I wouldn t be waiting so long He was a nice enough fellow but as he was French his English is better than my French  he failed to grasp what I was talking about I walked back in to the bar and hoped we wouldn t be much longer Someone came for us immediately Drama over It appears they were short staffed On to the food  My wife s 3 courses were very good mine was undone by my Lamb Wellington being over cooked so a little tough  they also failed to supply a steak knife until I asked  the other courses were superb So in my mind if they said they were short staffed and asked us to wait with a drink on the house they could ve rescued the initial situation beforehand food wise 5 out of 6 courses being very good cannot be knocked On a fully staffed day the score would be a 4 if not a 5

Don t get me wrong the otter is in a great location but for what you get food wise it was way too expensive I had the lamb shank Shepard pie my dad had the fish pie and my mum had the steak  We have had better steak from morrisons the lamb shank was bland and the fish pie was nothing special  Won t be returning

We discovered Austen s by chance but once we saw it was authentic BBQ we couldn t miss out  Service The staff were nice but inexperienced on managing multiple tables so the wait time for bill paying and drinks reordering wasn t very prompt Also a lot of crashing and banging  Food Food was good but the coleslaw left little to the imagination  suggest seasoning to bring out more flavour and less cream  All the mains were great too but they came on a board which wasn t well presented considering the price of the bill total was pretty high  Atmosphere One thing that did really put us off though was that the music was incredibly loud for a lunchtime booking and the staff seemed to get carried away with it  So we couldn t talk and came out feeling shell shocked  Overall To put it bluntly - You re there to run a business that has repeat customers if you want loud music then do it at home but you should make that restaurant space the most enjoyable it can be for the customers not you guys  After food service when it s just bar service Sure put the music up but if I wanted to listen to music really loud I d go to a concert  I m at Austen s to eat and catch up with friends or family so just keep that in mind  Would come again if they got the overall atmosphere brushed up and brought down the prices a little
The menu wasn t particularly exciting but my Gammon was fine However my wife chose the Lasagne and this appeared dried out as if it had been kept on a hot plate for some time

Ate here with the wife on a Friday afternoon Pretty busy but good service Excellent range of beers and gins but a little overpriced Was also disappointed that they wouldn t serve Jaipur which they had on draft by the pint Both had the burger for dinner which was lovely Overall decent but you ve probably got better options around

On a return visit in October 2016 learned the lead chef had left The meal was disappointing with the contents seeming to be of lower quality meat Something needs to be done to restore to the previous standard to induce customers to return

My wife and I wanted to take her mother out for a meal at about 5 30pm on a Sunday We decided to eat at 1885 The Pub as my mother-in-law lives in Stainland within a stone s throw of the place  The pub itself was light and airy and the staff greeted us warmly and made us feel welcome The service was also very good but we were less impressed with the food The two ladies chose the roast beef dinner and were asked whether they would like their beef pink or well done they both chose to have it pink I chose from the specials board and opted for the venison goulash with herb dumplings The roast beef was served pink as requested and although it proved to be somewhat chewy there was plenty of it The two ladies described the Yorkshire pudding as being like cardboard and the cauliflower cheese was either overcooked or microwaved and looked less than appetizing The rest of the vegetables were served separately in a little pot and consisted of boiled potatoes roast potatoes carrot parsnip and broccoli  The venison goulash was not only served with dumplings but also with mashed potato I was also served with a pot of vegetables as described above so the meal was in danger of carbohydrate overload The main issue for me was the actual goulash I am not a fan of mustard at the best of times and the goulash contained so much of it that the overriding taste was one of bitterness This is my fortieth review on Trip Advisor and I am fortunate that I ve never had to give either a  poor  or a  terrible  review All my reviews have given a rating of  excellent  or  very good  with the exception of one restaurant which I could only rate as  average  Both the restaurant and the pub have received many excellent reviews from other diners so perhaps it s just a case of personal taste Nonetheless based upon my one visit I can only rate 1885 The Pub as average at best I didn t enjoy my meal so I have no intention of returning in the future

Had lunch here with the family The setting is very distinctive The menu was limited but we all found something we liked and the food was well cooked and presented Service was smart and the staff were pleasant and helpful We had tried to have lunch earlier in the week but there were no places and so if you do want to eat here book in advance

Paleo is a restaurant on Warwick street in Leamington near the heart of town It is ideally located when people want to organise a night out Parking is not too difficult with a car park within a couple of minutes walk The entrance and the initial look inside the restaurant is quite inviting and refreshing A modern style with a nice palette of red green the use of mirrors on one wall and a lot of wood furniture We were lucky to be there on a Tuesday when it was quite but I can easily imagine it becoming quite loud on busy evenings  The menu ended up disappointing me and my partner The concept of paleo would imply a few more noticeable changes to the regular items found on a gastropub menu but this was not the case here Actually there was nothing really different from any other mid range restaurant in the area We ordered the spicy pork balls for starters The meat was tender and very well cooked It had a hint of cumin but not much else The pickled onion was an interesting addition Our main courses were the salmon and the artichoke Unfortunately even though the salmon was cooked well the seeds or the matcha sauce that were promised were hardly present and had no flavour The biggest disappointment came from the use of pickled spaghetti vegetables which had no flavour but of the vinegar It would have been more paleo and tastier to use these vegetables but raw The artichoke did not taste like much either although the tomato ragu and the halloumi were nice Sides were recommended as just the main ingredient was provided with the main courses  For dessert we ordered a pecan pie which was acceptable not too sweet for a change but the crust was not very tasty The chocolate hazelnut tart was nice with a very interesting crust but the filling hardly tasted like hazelnut The hazelnut ice-cream was nice though Overall the food selection and quality was average and was it not for the use of more exotic spices seeds sauces I would have qualified it of being too expensive  The staff was young but very approachable and friendly The premises were clean and well kept the bathrooms had shared sinks very nice with a granite top and copper -colored taps  and were clean as well  I would not go there again as long as the menu is not improved and more original but this was not a disastrous experience either

The restaurant was very busy but the initial greeting was poor as the layout was not great We were shown to our table where we were greated by a waiter who seemed to be in the wrong job - very poor customer service Food was OK but not great and we were not im pressed with the overall experience

Had visited a few places on Smithdown and decided to give this place a go Staff were nice and food was good I think it s a little over priced for the quality of food and service but still enjoyed the meal
Tried both Nude Sushi Box locations in Manchester Centre I prefer the other one For some reason this is not as good even though it s still okay
