This was our second visit to the Old Bear inn and after experiencing a fantastic meal the first time we knew we would enjoy it second time round Friendly staff great beer and lovely atmosphere It was clear they had a different chef this time as food was ok My steak was meant to be cooked medium but came out raw inside and stone cold in fact it wasn t cooked at all Waitress cleared both of our steaks to be done again and fair enough the chef came out and apologised Although the steaks still weren t cooked how we ordered Which is a shame The starters and desserts were good and good portions Would go back but maybe something easier to cook and not the steak

We have been here twice  First time very nice service was very good we were served by Thai lady But the second time we went we were served by two English girls that really didn t give a dam about customer service  One of the waitresses told the other waitress to  CHUCK US over there in the corner  THAT WASN T THE BEST START FOR THE EVENING The Food was okay again The experience of the to english waitress have put us off going again Though the food is lovely
We popped in here for a quick bite to eat and found the food to be nice very original place to eat Only downside was the portions weren t that big it was reasonably priced though
Food is nice but often run out of one of the meats  I think the place needs brightening up Being a bit more modern

I booked weeks in advance to ensure that our friends from Portsmouth and ourselves had a nice meal We arrived 5 mins early only to be told in an abrupt and scolding tone  your 5 mins early you know  Your tables not ready  We were eventually sat at two tables of different height that had been pulled together amateurish In short bad staff no wine list below average food  compared to Jamie s in York & Portsmouth  don t bother going do your self a favour and go anywhere else Become a gold card member it might improve the service   Make sure you tell them when you book I am a gold card member I did tell them when I booked You get more benefits from Tesco with their club card  Come on Jamie get to grips with this lot

I know this is a volunteer team working for the RSPB And yes the shop is excellent for bird food gifts and the extensive range of books on bird issues But the modern charity has to offer more than a simple cafe when competing in the modern world The CCTV of the birds is nevertheless amazing  The Earl Grey Tea lacked the essential taste the bread was a bit on the hard side was it part toasted with the chicken sandwich and not much chicken and not that good  The side salad was rather old fashioned and poorly presented with cheap crisps added The coffee is OK

We visited the Cow for four nights running It is very difficult to review as for three of the nights everything was fine i e food and servive but for one night it was abysmal service was non existent and the food was very small portion and poorly presented  Maybe it was the bosses night off So for three nights I would give it 5 stars and for one night one

Got a takeaway delivered this evening Ordered chicken gang mussaman a curry that I am very familiar with from another thai restaurant and unfortunately it did not live up to expectation The curry was very heavy on the tomato flavour something which I am not used to in this curry Also had satay chicken average  dim sum bland  jasmine rice just plain boiled rice and what I thought was going to be pad thai but turned out to be just rice with meats in it On the whole rather disappointed In the future I ll stick to Yum Yum Thai and live without the delivery

This place has great variety on their menu at a decent price Their staff are lovely but always seem to be busy and rushed off their feet So you might not get the attention to detail in customer service However it is still a place I highly recommend

The food was fantastic large filling portions But i was served a cracked and chipped glass waiters did not poor the drink for you either We were never asked if our meal was ok at any time Shame as this could be something special My partner asked for one of the sauces not to be added to her meal it still arrived with it on the plate

We were advised of a 45-60 min wait for a table for 5 so went to the bar and had a few cocktails After 35 min we were presently surprised to be called for the table The food and drink were very nice not outstanding far from the best Hard Rock food I ve had over the years but more than acceptable The problem which has pretty much forced me to highly restrict what I can do for the rest of my trip was when it came to payment The server darted off very quickly with my card yes taking it away from the table and out of my sight  and after about 2 minutes of not knowing where the hell she was she came back to give the receipt but had to be asked for the card which she didn t have  After she darted off again I d already decided my only option was to cancel this card immediately on exit  This went on for a couple of minutes when she miraculously found the card in her servers pinny which she d checked half a dozen times in the search for this card  Seriously train your staff as this is not acceptable card handling etiquette in the UK in this modern age  Cards should NEVER leave the owners sight as advised in many police identity fraud prevention campaigns over the last couple of years  I m now left without my Visa for the rest of my trip even of she did off any kind of assurances I couldn t trust this unbelievable breach of etiquette  which now causes more than a few issues especially in regard to paying for our apartment

We have been to Blackpool Sands beach so many times and have used the cafe on numerous occasions but have never yet visited the Restaurant On the last night of this year s trip to Devon we thought that we would treat ourselves to Supper on the Beach to round off a great week The food was perfectly acceptable fresh hot and the service was very quick However it was quite pricey for what it was with the best example being the Rosemary & Sea Salt Foccacia Bread was 6 99 for two very small pieces of bread  Having said that we would visit the restaurant again the next time we are on holiday in the area The view over the bay and the beach is excellent

This former estate pub as become a Hungry Horse Pub Lovely Job inside I will start from the beginning We my wife and I walked in the front door and saw the large bar in front of us which at that pint did not appear to be maned I looked over yonder and there was a table in the far distant wall had a meeting of staff We found a table and sat down and browsed the menu my wife used the toilet and I did after also Still no staff I went out to check my car because we had left our dog in the car On my return the staff suddenly appeared from no where and I said there was no one here a while ago  a voice behind me said you only just walked in I was informed by him he was the manager this I found a little hard to believe because of his appearance I informed the staff it was my first visit to a Hungry Horse Pub they duly told me the procedure on ordering etc We ordered our food Surf and Turf Blue & a Baby Back Rib & Steak Medium also two large glasses of house Merlot When the food came out we were warned to be careful as the food and plates were very hot I am afraid to say that was not the case My steak was over cooked to medium and the Peas look as though they had been on the stove for an hour or more My wife s steak was cooked to well done And in both cases the Steak was tough The Scampi on my plate was very good and the Chicken also I found the staff very noisy behind the bar and the were laughing and giggling which made me a little uncomfortable I have to say The waitress Gemma that took my order was very nice and polite and did seem like she had a station behind the bar We also had a sweet I had the Trifle and my wife had the Knickerbocker Glory both were excellent Would I go again yes I would but the staff need to be shown some discipline About the toilets they looked spotlessly clean but they did smell strongly of urine this could be solved with a little Flower Disinfectant The bill came to 36 25

Worcester has several small Costas rather than one very large one This review is for the one located at The cross essentially the centre where most people walk either from the station or Crowngate or anywhere else  The restaurant is small though has very high celilings giving a good drinking eating experience and above average expectation of themed decor and is open longer hours than usual for high street coffee shops Queueing is normal much of the time except very early and late on However often runs out of popular food items at busier periods though still has the large comfy Costa seats Staff are generally friendly and efficient bringing hot food to the table without fuss It is let down by poor restroom facilities and people queuing there can be overfacing and detract from user experience if sitting nearby

This place has a really nice feel Not what I expected to find in St Neots but we were glad we did The food was fresh and cooked over charcoal on an open BBQ  The staff seemed disappointed that we did not order starters and having seen the portions we could have had both a starter and main Often the food in these style of place are so huge you only need mains but this was well designed  The staff were friendly and polite  The only complaint I have is that the menu was at least 50 more expensive that the online menu This is a bit naughty and what looked good value was in fact quite expensive for what we had It was nice but did not justify the much larger bill than anticipated

We had a meal at Mings on Friday evening Menu sounded good so we thought we would try it as we both like Asan food We had a table downstairs and whilst quite nice decor wasa devoid of any atmosphere We ordered a fairly pricey bottle of wine which was served by the waitress pouring 2 glasses on the empty table next to us without inviting us to taste Not a good start The starters arrived and they were very good especially the soft shell crab The main courses were good but nothing special We would not go again as it fell way below the wow factor

Recently stayed in the splash landings hotel and decided to take a walk over to the crooked spoon for dinner The Pub looks amazing and is really well themed The greeting from the staff and the whole service throughout were amazing We were seated promptly and then went up to order no problem  Then when it came to the food it unfortunately went down hill The food took over 35 minutes to come out even though only 25 tables were full I had ordered the steak unfortunately when it came out it was cold and chips only warm was a real shame that the food didn t live up to the excellent service standards set out  Alice in the front of house team was amazing and stood out throughout and went above and beyond

Came for the steak and ribs at the Fat Badger which normally does good food But the ribs were awful  Some of the worse tasting ones I had had in a restaurant  Definitely won t be getting them again unless they change their recipe  The steak my daughter had was good though And the wait staff are excellent  Thought a 1 80 for a small Sprite for my daughter was a bit excessive too

I went here whilst on holiday in the area I was very pleased to find that they don t take bookings and on entering we were welcomed with a nice pub setting by the bar However we were promptly shown to an extension at the rear This was a large echo-ey room with a high ceiling reminding me of a caf€÷ at a garden centre This seems to be so that they can fit in more customers and capitalise off the label of it being Rick Stein s Pub  The food was all very delicious but as you would expect it was more expensive than a normal pub The staff were all nice if inattentive
We visit Cedic several times and it s a typical Wetherspoons only problem is it s so cold they persist in temperature down at a very low level as a constant cold draught it s warmer outside

We went for Sunday Lunch and had the three course set menu The starter of piquant sweet potato ravioli with fish I thought was superb but my other half was unimpressed The main course of roast beef and Yorkshire would have been better at the London Inn in Stamford for half the price The apple sorbet mouth cleanser was very nice The dessert was a stodgy tasteless bread and butter pudding and custard with a side of wonderful orange marmalade ice cream The ambience was good the service friendly the selection of drinks wide and high quality As you can tell a mixed experience You may well think it s worth one visit to say you ve been to the Pub of the Year buy for 35 head with drinks - plus the drive out to Clipsham - we ll probably decide to stay in Stamford next time

I m nine years old and I went to this inn with my family We arrived at this place after not realy finding else and I wished that we didn t come The food was pretty average and we were the only people there so as you can guess the the atmosphere was terrible The only good thing was the waitress  I advise you don t go here

My major gripe with Ocean View was the location of our outside table It was encroaching on the walkway from inside the restaurant to out Consequently I spent a large amount of time tweaking the table position as various people brushed past me  It would be better if they removed a table from the row to generate more space  We found the service average but the negatives in the review are more than made up for by the exquisite views over looking the bay and cob  The food was of good quality with large portions and competitive pricing They serve a good range of drinks including local ale from the Town Mill micro brewery

We d booked but waited quite a while for our table service was quite slow food was okay but nothing special Biggest issue is the noise - don t go there on a Saturday night if you want to hold a conversation with the people opposite

Went for a meal at the Retreat for my Dad s 60th birthday Lovely setting and very stylish inside The drinks are very expensive 8 50 for a beer and a glass of wine is a bit steep As for the food I went with a black pudding and bacon starter which was actually very nice For the main I went with the seabass and wasn t really impressed I thought the fish was slightly rubbery and needed a bit more seasoning and the roasted veg was nothing to write home about I d have preferred a white wine sauce with baby or roasted potatoes and green beans The zig zags of chocolate sauce on the plate were also unnecessary and unappealing Having said all that my sister in law had the chicken risotto which was beautiful and the peppercorn sauce which came with the rest of the families steaks was to die for The staff were friendly and helpful especially the Chris Evans lookalike host owner who was very attentive and a good laugh I get the impression that the quality of the food on offer differs in terms of what you have and when you go which considering the expensive nature of the restaurant needs to improve Not too bad all in all but a bit more consitency is needed I think
Good portions of filling food Good pit stop for us on a Saturday lunch time Friendly staff and good ale

I visited this pub restaurant last Friday for a friend s birthday celebration We had a table for four which was tucked into a very dark corner with peeling paint on the walls One of the chairs was broken so I swapped it for another on an adjacent table  Service initially was very slow but picked up momentum to such a degree that as soon as our starters were removed the main course arrived which was too soon in our opinion However the waitress was very pleasant and friendly and the food was perfectly good pub- style food with very good portions Being close to Milton Keynes means that it is a fairly busy pub and a reservation is suggested at weekends
Been here once before they are one of the only places in Newbiggin that are open so late The food is pretty average Prices are good Staff are friendly

Called here for a typical English pub lunch with some first time in UK visitors from Taiwan Busy Saturday before Christmas so kept expectations to a sensible level Was helped to find a table for 4 in the Cabinet Room downstairs and all seemed fine Then however had to wait 15 minutes to even be able to order a drink and lunch Food when it came after a further 20 minutes was ok - nothing bad or good to say - just ok Service was not great at all - clearly not enough staff and the staff under pressure didn t cope brilliantly I really wish the management would not skimp on staff - I realise costs must be controlled but I wouldn t go back here because of the poor service

This is my local Pizza express I have eaten at this chain for over 25 years and for over 5 years in the Marlow branch which is where I live  The food has always been consisantly good and so has the service We had gotten to know the management team and the staff as we come in so often but there has been a change of management and staff recently and boy does it show  We were in there last night for our ususal Thursday night treat and what a difference the staff make Before I go on our waiter was great friendly and attentive can t remember his name but he was a young guy with spikey hair and a cheeky smile and I have no gripe with his service  We waited about 45 minutes for our food to come and when it did arrive it was served by the assistant manager it was plonked down on the table with no appology for the wait and no would you like pepper or chili oil or another drink as our glasses were by now empty No smile and clearly no customer service skills Both our Pizzas were dry and no where near the usual standard that we have come to expect from pizza express We were so hungry that we just ate them Yes they would have offered to make them again but we had already waited 45 minutes for these dry offerings and would have passed out if we had had to wait any longer to eat so we just ate them  So management please take notice You need to sort your management out on the floor as this would never have happened with the last guy who has now gone to your Henley branch He ran the place like clockwork and his staff were the best Another suggestion is that in the Marlow branch you have a seating area to the rear Can this not be the family friendly seating area That way people who do not have children with them can eat in relative peace without screaming children shattering the ambience  I am not a moaner without good reason - see my last review for your restauraunt but I do expect good service and good food or I will just go else where that can offer me just that I hope that you guys have not gotten so big and corporate that you have forgotten your original values becuase that would be a shame  I hope you guys can sort this out as I have been a fan for so many years but Prezzo is looking the better option lately

We recently walked toDartington via the riverside path from Totnes which was beautiful & strongly recommended-its not too arduous Feeling peckish we entered the Venus Cafe which we found to be clean & tastefully decorated in yellow & blue reflecting their beachside origins The cafe was not too busy and the staff pleasant and attentive and not facing the rigours of the summer season which has provoked some negative comments in the past Provenance is the watchword of this business witha total emphasis on organics Expect to pay premium pricing but is this justified From my experience I think not We paid just under 24 for 2 small Americanos 1 breakfast panini with french fries & some salad 1 beef sandwich with 3 potato wedges & some salad The big disappointment was the advertised horse radish with the beef was not available How could such a key condiment be unavailable The sandwich lacked the kick it needed and I found the beef mediocre My wife thought the panini ok but the sausage had a strange flavour These meals were a fairly typical choice for us but we have eaten better for much less elsewhere and was a reminder that organic does not necessarily equate to better flavour or quality Venus probably have a monopoly at most of their locations and whilst I admire their ethos & desire to take beachside catering to a higher level on the basis of my Dartington experience I will probably give them a miss in future
A group of seven of us called in for coffee I had an Americano and the coffee was good and we were well served but I would have preferred a larger cup for 2 40
Well what can you say Its another Wetherspoons with all the traits that go with it day time drinkers youngsters getting lashed etc etc  Good selection of beers at good prices staff were good

ended up here after arranging to meet friends at old orleans which was boarded up just my luck twice in two days went to a restuarant that was no more but thats croydon fast turn around anyway food was ok and so was the price pretty much what you d expect from this sort of themed chain toilets not great though

Port Solent is the place where my partner and I had our first date so we like to return here every so often On Friday the 27 02 15 we decided to drive to Port Solent and have something to eat we looked at some of the yachts including the lively lady before deciding to have a pub lunch in the Sir Alec Rose which is a Weatherspoons public house As it was a Friday we chose to have fish which comes with either a soft drink or for a pound more an alcoholic one  Because I enjoy a decent cask Ale I decided to try Harpoon which I have never tried before whilst my partner drank lemonade and lime Its nice looking at the yachts whilst dining and although like any other Weatherspoons house you know what you are getting regarding value for money its a pleasure coming to Port Solent to enjoy the scenery

my wife and I often use this restaurant for spur of moment times as you dont have to book in advance we have never had bad meal So saying we do try to go at quiet times I like the steaks & gammons always good
Great food if you need to something quickly and want more than the normal soggy sandwich Food is freshly prepared and tastes great It s a little pricey but worth it

We use this place on a regular basis gets incredibly busy and noisy if you want a quiet place to talk this isn t it Often have long queues for a table but well worth the wait Great lamb chops really good Chicken Biriani nan breads are also good If you can handle the wait and the noise a great place to eat

My Wife and I decided to have lunch out last Friday whilst looking after our grandson 18 weeks old The choice was the Crown at Penn or the Plough and we decided on the Plough as we like Italian food and knew there would be space for a pushchair However we regretted our choice as soon as the food arrived My Wife chose a mushroom pizza which wasn t anything special and I had gnocchi a particular favourite of mine but when it arrived although reasonably tasty was what could only be described as a child s portion for the sum of 13  Anticipating a small wait we were attracted to the Homemade bread olive oil and balsamic vinegar to share as a starter but were speechless when it arrived - basically 4 small slices of panini style bread and oil All for 4 75p I did comment on the starter when paying the bill and asked if all was ok with the meal but received little apology We have eaten here before on a few occasions and have to say had good and bad meals but were prepared to give it another chance It will be sometime before we return
Had heard good things about this pub however wasn t that impressed with the grub ok but nothing special  Pub Quiz is good though

My daughters and I had a meal at Imli for two of us the food was okay although my Biryani was a little bland One of my daughters had a big problem She found a total of three blond hairs in her curry At first she thought that it may be her own hair but they were bottle blond my daughters is darker When we drew the attention of the waiter to the problem he changed the meal without a second thought but the manager or owner didn t appear to have been told  A nice restaurant but I would always be checking my food for unwanted extras

We have been regular visitors to this restaurant in Nottingham and have always been very pleased with both the service and food However our last visit was a little disappointing We have selected the shared starter containing a selection of items on many of our visits This shared starter has now changed the beef ribs and the prawns in filo pastry have been replaced by chicken wings and chicken again in the filo pastry This starter now consists mainly of chicken and for a cost of 15 is not worth the money It felt like the restaurant had changed owners because the food for the starter and the service had changed for the worst The Tom Yum and Tom Kai soups were very good and all of the mains on the set menu A were fine Will we return maybe we may give this restaurant one more try before we cross it of our list Cutting back and trying to save money on the shared starter will reflect on your customer s experience return to the standard you used to be

We came here by chance after a visit to the ski slope in Hemel Hempstead I was glad that we did as the food was very flavorful I would definitely recommend you visit if you are in the area but be warned that their portions are very small for example we ordered smoky beef briskets which even though were very nice cost 5 25 for 5 small slivers of beef

We went for dinner to this elegant and beautiful restaurant Our expectations for this place were quite high and in my opinon the experience was a little bit dissapointing The service was very nice and attentive but for me the food was just average The starter was an antipasto with cheese and meat very bland Our main courses were a mediocre grilled swordfish and a ryb eye steak well cooked but lacked of the wow factor To be honest I can ‹t understand why those main courses were in the specialties of the menu maybe we chose wrongly To be fair the value for money is ok and not pricey if you compare with other restaurants in town

This place could be much better than it is It s very lacklustre You can see the kitchen which I alway like but it made me nervous as they just didn t seem that competent The menu isn t very varied so we ordered fish and chips and the fish was alright but very standard and the chips were not nice at all They tasted like cheap frozen chips  My friend had a pie of the day and really liked it We thought we would have pudding and out of five options two weren t even available and this was lunchtime The sticky toffee pudding looked nice but was very dry it s something that really should be you know sticky  It really seems odd to me that a place would even bother being this average in that area where there are so many restaurants and cafes The chains nearby are much better I like the Strada over by HMS Belfast with the great views go there instead

The Floating Bridge Inn is located right opposite the ferry known as the floating road as the ferry is actually classed as a road  The Inn offers outside seating with excellent views on a dry sunny and warm day It is olde worlde and has a good menu but the best is locally caught fish Small medium and large Small with chips and mushy peas at 6 00 is truly great value and served quickly and nice and hot Staff were friendly and are well used to visitors with an apetite

The place was quiet at tea time on a Saturday normally I would worry as this tends to be a sign of a bad place but my partner wanted to go in  We went in and most of the staff seemed to be huddled in the top corner of the eatery sitting down and chatting  The place lacked the experience I have had in other towns cities  The service to take the order was slow but the food was there very quickly  Again not a good sign but the food was ok  nothing special  I would only attend this particular one if I had a good enough voucher to get me in

The place is clearly trying to do great things offering a special service and working with local suppliers However I had a sandwich served with crisps the bread was not fresh and the crisps had a distinct touch of staleness

Not that this matters to me but there were no vego options This upset the missus a little bit My starter was the finest little dish I can ever remember eating in a pub Slow cooked rabbit that had been stripped from the bone cubes of confit potato bound in a rabbit stock and mustard butter emulsion Peaks of acidity from finely jullienne strips of granny smith accompanied with a glazed rabbit leg peking style Absolutely fabulous That was it however Cant remember what the missus had it was rather lack luster She had beef for main which was too rich and I had pork for main which was just average plate of fat Didnt bother with dessert Hard one to call really

It depended what you ordered as to the level if enjoyment The fish and chips and the steak were winners and cannot be faulted The haggis and scallops starter was just not very tasty and endured rather than enjoyed The smoked haddock risotto was heavy and far too salty which meant the meal stayed with you for some time not in a good way  I think the chefs need to do more tasting as they go not just serving up as it really is just a fine tuning issue  Wine was good and service excellent but as a regular Loch Fyne visitor both here and elsewhere in the country it was disappointing tonight
Nothing special but reasonable food and as much as you can eat vegetables

Cool place top beer decent food except cooked a bit well done good service spoilt by kitchen spreading margarine on rolls brioche which overwhelmed any smoky flavour so it would be more accurately called  Samuel Jones Margarine & Ale House

Late Sunday lunch 3pm waited 30 minutes for a table I ordered Beef roast the lady ordered a well-done burger as you need to write down what you want I d guess that would left little room for error - How wrong The burger was cooked very rare and had to be sent back I can only think they were that busy they were in a race to get food out the kitchen as soon as possible as the table next to us had to send back two meals as also undercooked one of which was fish for a child In a stroke of irony my beef was overcooked it was to the point of being tough unfortunately that then turned the lunch into a solo dining experience as by the time they d brought the second meal out i d finished mine so my dining partner and i pretty much watched each other eat I had to ask for extra gravy twice and it still didn t turn up The starter was a selection of Italian meats and bread  12 one type of bread isn t a selection nor was it Italian or served with any butter or even oil and vinegar - One starter two mains one drink each - 55 far too expensive for very average food and lackluster service I don t mind paying 50 for a decent lunch but i d expect the little touches like having water or bread brought to the table without being asked and food that was cooked as requested The staff were seating people with the previous diners plates still on the table Personally i d rather wait another two minutes and have a clean table When it came to paying I was asked how it was I confirmed disappointing reiterated that we d sent back one meal but nothing taken off the bill as no-one with the authority to do so was available Dont have someone manning the till if they dont have the authority to do something about a compliant Very disappointed as reviews i d read were very good and i really did want it to be nice it just wasn t
I was taken here by associates for breakfast and it says what it does a very nice cafe but thats it would eat here again for breakfast

Lunchtime visit As has been said in other reviews you know what to expect here We made use of the 3 course lunch deal for 15 95 per person and this is undoubtably good value The food was fresh and fair quality There were two drawbacks 1 It wasn t busy and whoever drew up the rota s got it wrong The waiting staff were good but only one chef who was working his socks off but we still had a 45 min wait for mains too slow 2 Why do people bring their over indulged and ill disciplined children out and spoil the experience for others Zizzi is a fine reasonable choice better quality probably than its competitors and better value The location in Newark is good but pick your time to go and make sure there is more than one chef working

Been twice before and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience Went with a large group this time and felt as if we were too much trouble - food was ok but service and overall attention seemed lacking compared to last time  Was ok but wont be rushing back

had sunday lunch at the bull hotel food was very good but the waitress was so miserable cutlery just dropped on the table no serviettes was never asked if everything was ok when we went to pay not a thank you or good bye not surprised we were the only ones in there

Had a half-decent meal here Reasonable prices and good service No reason to complain about anything It was very empty which might not be unusual for a Tuesday evening but the indian further down the road was so full they couldn t fit me in for at least 3 hours

La Cloche is very much an upmarket Cafe Rouge but with an all star cast of French family owner chef and waiting staff - either that or they are excellent at mimicking Gallic natives The table d hote lunch menu at 12 95 for two courses has a modest choice of dishes but we understand that the a la carte menu in the evening is much broader with plenty of choice  Our starter dish for the lunch comprised wedges of marinated salmon - gravadlax  - on a bed of new potato A refreshing beginning to the meal Afterwards we took the minute steak with pommes frits The beef was very good and cooked to perfection Tarte tatin was not on the lunch menu but the chef happily found a portions from the evening menu  For me there were too many foreign wines on the list to the extent that finding a decent wine of French origin was not easy but the Patron was on-hand for sensible advice The Bergerac was fruity and a tad expensive at 30 but the Gaillac Cuvee des Drilles was an earthy libation at a modest 24  Paper napkins did not go down well although laundry costs for linen are not that expensive No doubt the evening service with the a la carte menu would have banished the use of paper napkins All in all a reasonable lunch that will encourage us to take dinner at La Cloche later on

I think the title says it all really nice coffee and cake The staff are all very friendly BUT and I am afraid it is a very big BUT the service is agony I have now been twice - early so there wasnt a massive crowd but it really has put me off If you could give 1 2 stars they would have got 2 1 2 points rather than 3 A real shame

After deciding to try this place again recently with a friend I can maintain that the service here is very off-putting both times I ve visited waiters have been very blunt and it creates a bit of an awkward atmosphere During my most recent visit my friend asked the waiter which red wine he would recommend to which he replied I don t know and then told her which one was the cheapest Not exactly what we d asked for and a little insulting  The pizzas and pasta dishes are always good and food is great value for money so it wasn t a poor visit but I will always choose their sister restaurant Pinocchio over Donatello due to the more intimate and friendly atmosphere

The fillet following a second trip to the kitchen when it returned cooked to my original asking was delicious However it returned with a corn on the cob possitively chilled to the point of inedible I didnt bother to eat it nor complain as my wife  whose Sirloin was delivered at the same time as the first visit of the Fillet was part way through her meal Ambiance was lacking with lighting rather stark and a table where we were on view to a punter sat at the bar in the pub section Poor would be too harsh but would have been my rating if it was just me

I had a meal hear and I have to say despite the good reviews the pizza was a crushing disappointment It looked a little like it was bought from the asda across the road Perfectly round very small and not very authentic looking Having said that it tasted fine  Otherwise The service was good staff polite and house red drinkable  If you want good Italian pizza in Kingston go to al fornos That place is far better

we booked dinner at Swinton Park s Samual s restaurant for a special occasion on a Sunday evening we arrived at the hotel and when driving into the grounds the impression of the hotels was stunning and on arrival we where warmly greeted by professional very friendly staff and shown to the drawing room This was warm and cosy as it always is we ordered drinks to start with before we sat to look at the menus We do appreciate that this is a country estate and we do expect that a selection of game would be on the menu but there was only a selection of game on both the starters and mains selection a variety of different fish This makes it rather difficult for someone who is not particularly fond of game and not really a fish eater When speaking to the staff the Chef agreed to provide a turkey diner as an option which we thought was fine We where shown to the restaurant and our starters arrived firstly my wife started was a green salad a mixture of salad with cheese curd and a dressing with less than the palm of your had of salad on the plate My starter was wood pigeon and again well cooked but so small it resembled 2 cloves of garlic with a small amount of green and a dressing to the mains i had ordered the halibut which arrived with a piece of halibut about 40mm by 70mm in size on a slice of Cauliflower a small spoon of pureed veg and again a dressing of sorts My wife faired somewhat better with her turkey dinner which had 3 slices of turkey which was very dry 2 Brussel sprouts 1 carrot a portion of layered potato and a small amount of gravy over all my two course would not have amounted to a starter sized portion if both had been combined There was no option for extra vegetables and all for over 55 we have mailed the hotel with no response but as they are a restaurant they should cater to cover members of the public who firstly are not game eaters and not particularly fish eater chicken or lamb would have been an ideal inclusion but not available we asked for the bill and left without a sweet or coffee and called into the coop in Masham to buy some thing to cook when we arrived home we have on many occasions eaten at Swinton Park but not again at this standard

On Sunday night the restaurant was very popular and we were lucky to get a table The service was good and the staff were pleasant but the food was slightly bland The slices of chili were not hot and I could not taste any garlic If it is a spicy pizza it needs to be spicy and taste of garlic  I have had really good pizzas at Francesca s but this time it was okay

Ate at this restaurant for the first time having enjoyed a decent coffee there previously Service was just about adequate rather than attentive and the waiting staff did not notice that my main course arrived without the potatoes it should have had After I pointed out the omission it took a further 7 minutes for the missing potatoes to arrive and there was no apology offered My companion s steak was tasty but tough and really did not live up to the description ribeye steak It was more like a budget supermarket cut Despite those problems I would say that we enjoyed the meal overall being fairly easy to please and in terms of flavours offer no criticism at all The atmosphere was busy and cheerful but the noise levels bouncing off the bare walls made conversation difficult and became quite wearisome after an hour or so Nevertheless I will probably give the venue another chance in the future but not if it I am with someone I need to talk to quietly or to endear myself to Cost-wise I would say slightly overpriced

Stopped off for a lunchtime time snack which was served by pleasant staff in a characterful bar with a roaring log fire Thought the background music an unnecessary intrusion but would visit and eat more extensively when returning to the area
Have been to Ryans many times it represents basic but good value for money food in the town centre they serve a good pint of Guiness too Well worth another visit

We called in on our way back to the hotel for a quick drink on Saturday night As soon as we walked in we realised its not very Irish It has an Irish theme but feels like a chain of pubs The drinks were reasonably priced for a City centre and was pretty much what you would expect of a pub chain but didnt make you feel like you were in Ireland

Down in Leeds for a concert so had a meal out and decided to try Souvlaki The staff were nice & friendly and we opted for the two course and glass of wine for 15 95 per head I tried fish cake never had a fish cake served in batter but it was fine my wife opted for the meatballs which came to the table tepid We spoke to the staff and a fresh meal was offered but a quick zap in the micro was sufficient for our needs It was a bit dry but hey ho onto the main I again tried fish which was lovely but my wife had the chicken with black olives and rice Unfortunately the rice was embellished with bits of olives throughout which was not to her taste We mentioned this to the staff and 10 was taken off which was a good gesture would we return probably not

We must have caught them on a bad night based on the other reviews We booked a table and arrived 10-15 minutes early We were asked to sit in the bar area which is fine but not once in the 15 minutes we waited were we asked for a drink nor were we provided with any menus  We were shown to our table but still not provided with menus The staff then asked if we were ready to order   Before the food arrived the table to the right of us complained that the food was cold and the table to the left complained that their chicken starter was raw They argued with the staff for a while as they didn t want their main course but were eventually persuaded to have it  We waited a little longer than we wanted for the food but in fairness the food was good We did however order another round of drinks which never arrived   The staff were friendly enough but the service overall was poor which let the whole evening down  I personally will not be going back in a hurry but if they get the service right it will be a success

We ordered a take away The order was prompt The Thai green curry Thai calamari roasted duck curry were all good Only problem is that the restaurant forgot one dish They offered a refund It was just a shame that there wasn t enough food for everyone which made it a bit disappointing

The food is good - aromatic flavours well presented The service was hit and miss - easy to attract the attention of staff but after the main course they seemed to lose interest Quite expensive - and service charge already added on bill although which is unusual for Rochester Hopefully the service will improve and then I would recommend the restaurant- at the moment I would say try it and decide for yourself

Ordered King Scallops cooked in a garlic chilli and white wine sauce for starters having ordered this on a previous visit however when it arrived it tasted of just scallops and chilli I had to double check with the waiter that there should be garlic in this starter and he said sorry due to the rush the chef left it out so I never got my garlic kick apart from that the rest of the meal was very nice Great atmospheres

I haven t been there for a few years because it s on a steep hill which is difficult to climb if you re crippled as I am  I remember it as a very attractive pub with a superb uninterrupted view of the sea - great place to visit on a summer day  The food was average in the old days - no idea what it s like now However when John Bourne was the publican the beer was always kept beautifully

We stopped off here on the way home from Hastings and were very disappointed I had a veggie burger with chips and a tea which was 9 20 which I found extortionate for a roadside cafe The portions are average and the service is definitely without a smile The young lady at the counter had a scowl on her face the whole time she served us and even moaned to the chef in front of us that she wasn t getting any tips Surely she should realise that if she gave good service she would get good tips  The chef that brought the food was a tad cheerier but all in all it felt like we were an inconvenience for being there They have a garden area which is empty as they don t allow dogs due to hygiene issues so we had to sit with our dog and toddler outside the front of the cafe We also noticed that not many of the bikers were eating there so perhaps they have found it too expensive All in all it is very doubtful that we will return which is a shame considering we live just down the road and could be regulars

We have been to numerous Weatherspoon establishments in the past and have usually been fairly impressed with the food served However on this occasion I found the food to be average at best It was not particularly hot and the service was not particularly quick

I went to the cafe again the other day for a quick noodle soup with my girlfriend The broth tasted nice and must have been cooking for a good while as the menu states The rest of the soup was really poor though - undercooked cheap noodles and definitely not fresh wonton The service was also very mediocre surly welcome uninterested service no goodbye acknowledgment at the end of the meal This is the second time i ve been to the cafe and while i know a lot of people really like this place i just don t know what the all the fuss is about It s not that cheap either there are much cheaper asian restaurants in this part of the world that serve far better quality cuisine  Not sure if i ll return

We visited on a Monday lunchtime and the restaurant was empty so lacked any sort of atmosphere A waiter greeted us showed us to our seats and then rushed the explanation and what we had to do to order - they then disappeared not to be seen again You had to order and pay at the counter so it s semi-waiter service and like Nando s feels like an upmarket fast food restaurant We both ordered a Taxi burger and onions rings which tasted great but if we didn t have a taste card I would question the value for money Some nice touches include free monkey nuts and free refills on certain soft drinks But unless they have an offer on I don t think I would rush back to pay full price

We booked Sutton Hall for a celebration meal on the strength of its menu and location Our main course took a very long time to arrive after our OK starters Three of us had what sounded like the most adventurous dish on the menu These three dishes arrived looking as if they had been under a heat lamp for twenty minutes and were consequently very dry even chip shops manage a moist suet pudding  In a large room we only ever saw one waiter No excuse for sending out food like that-we will not be returning

Lovely location for this cafe but sadly the prices are dropping to the pocket for even a basic nibble I paid 4 50 for a small pastie with no side salad or chips or gravy sorry but that s just a rip off  3 50 for a slice of cake yes Victoria sponge  Sorry I will be taking a picnic next time I go I advise you to do the same

Have tried this restaurant a couple of times now and really wanted to like it and to be fair did not think it was awful BUT found it to be a bit pricey for what it was and the menu was not to our taste The food was just average nothing special and on both occasions found all the food to be completely overwhelmed with garlic Some may like that but I prefer to taste all sorts of tastes I ordered a camembert which I shared for a starter and a piece of salmon with crispy noodles as a main neither of which mentioned garlic in the description and both of which tasted of nothing else I could not taste the salmon at all and my breath smelt so bad the next day not just a bit either it was awful My husband had the steak which was ok but under cooked to what was asked and as mentioned on other reviews frozen chips a peppercorn sauce was ordered and it took your breath away it was so strong Other members of our party had steak one had pork belly with sweet potato and mustard mash and one had liver and again nothing was better than average Average food is fine for average prices but for two courses with a bottle of wine per couple it cost around 65 per couple which I think is above average The service was good although the plates were cold and the portions were average although we did have to ask for more vegetables which arrived quickly I personally would have liked to see more fish options but it is not unusual for there not to be So to round up all in all an average night for a not so average price

We had moored our boat close by on a Saturday evening and decided to give the Waters Edge a try as it had recently been refurbished The evening started well as we enjoyed a pre dinner drink at the bar and were then shown to our table We were both impressed with our starters but the problem came with my wife s main course fish dish The centre of the fish was still cool and wet being slightly undercooked We complained to the waitress who apologised and sent for the owner The owner arrived in a clearly annoyed state and in a brusque manner insisted that the fish was cooked perfectly correctly hadn t been frozen and offered to show us an invoice to prove the fish was fresh that day We found the owners attitude offensive unprofessional and not in keeping with customer care values After all all that was required was for the fish to be taken back to the kitchen and cooked for a while longer My wife was unable to eat the meal we paid the bill got tired of waiting for the change and left
Wasn t bad but overpriced for what it was and we were on a groupon  Rubbish selection for vegetarians Hate the font on the sign
Pleasant staff and surroundings nothing outstanding but nothing to complain about As we only had drinks we cannot comment on food

We visited bella italia on a whim after walking into town from the train station We had large bags to take in and they seated us in a very awkward position where our bags would be in the way  It took a while to be served but when the food came it was lovely and really enjoyable the puddings were lovely too I recommend the cookie pudding  The staff seemed rushed off their feet and it was a struggle to request another drink when you had finished your last one They also forgot to give us cutlery for our puddings and it was difficult trying to get their attention to ask for some  The food was lovely the service was average and the price was expensive for what you got - especially for the drinks  Will go again for the food but may try another one of the chain in another city due to the service

Stayed at the cotton arms camp site for 3 nights Good Location Food Beer Bad  1-Failed to tell us we needed tokens for the shower so couldn t shower the first morning In general facilities are very basic and quite far from most camping spots  2-Hard to book emailed 3 times and had to call twice  3-Staff member rude when asking us not to stand by the fire because we were blocking the heat  we had just come out of the rain and wanted a drink and to warm up A smile and some manners go a long way So we left and went to the Dusty Miller opposite for dinner which was excellent service and food

I came in my for my meal around half past 8 on a Friday the restaurant was pretty busy I was seated promptly and given a menu the waiter took my order and brought me a glass of water the service ended there  Before eating at Giraffe I wondered whether I would have enough time to do so however the note on their menu stating that they endeavour to serve food within 15 minutes assured me that it would be ok I didn t eat until after 9 o clock I waited somewhere around 35 minutes for my food Luckily I wasn t in a rush but if I had been I would have had to have walked out  The food was actually quite tasty I had the salmon with wasabi rice

A disappointing experience from start to end  I booked a table to celebrate my wife s birthday with the children 3 & 2 yrs old  during the phone call I was told we must be finished before 7 to accommodate the next booking I accept this is booking custom but to be so vocal about our presence being an inconvenience was a surprise  The restaurant is well laid out with a great extension which will be amazing during the summer The first waiter was insistent on removing the spare wine glasses as to prevent our children breaking them his words  The specials were not cheap at 25 each but we had heard positive reviews unfortunately our meal was ruined by cold sausages served to our daughter 2 years old  After waiting 45 minutes which I have no issues with the food should be hot and freshly prepared the problem was food served from the children s menu seemed an after thought as opposed to fresh restaurant quality instead serving pre-cooked sausages we sent them back and in few minutes fresh sausages arrived but again these were cold cooked not pink but cold The issues is compounded as when paying 50 for two mains we spent the time distracting our daughter from her lack of food  The special was average A rack of lamb should be a rack I revised lamb chops three individual pieces of lamb  The waitress was brilliant and mortified by our complaint 185 aims to be a premier restaurant but falls short  The children s meals were refunded but if you can t cook children s sausages you shouldn t be claiming for high quality

My family have eaten here quite often over the years and generally it is to be recommended  The food is normally very good and our latest visit was no exception However we did notice that they have cut down on the quantity of vegetables and potatoes they were only just adequate  The owners weren t arouind on this visit and the front of house seemed to be somewhat po-faced and distant until it came to pay  The big let down for me was the dessert I very much fancied the treacle tart with clotted cream and remembered the last time I had this I was disappointed that it came cold Who wants cold treacle tart for goodness sake  I therefore asked the waitress if the tart was warmed so she went to check Back she came to say no it was cold So I then asked if it could be warmed so off she went to the kitchen only to return to say the tart could not be warmed  I would dearly have loved to ask what was so difficult in zapping the tart in the microwave for a minute but decided it wouldn t be fair on the waitress not her fault the kitchen staff weren t competent enough to operate a microwave so chose something else
food quick we had a all day breakfast but unfortunately they didn t have any mushrooms so replaced with what I liked so I choosen onion rings   it was ok   price reasonable nice staff
Good breakfast but wouldn t go back for the evening meal which is overpriced for the quantity and quality

Arrived by chance as looking for some dinner whilst staying in hotel over the road No reservation made but this didn t seem to be a problem Quickly seated and drinks order taken Venue was quite busy with a large party but this didn t seem to cause any delays with the kitchen able to deliver Food well presented taste wasn t anything special however Well priced food and drinks

A have visited this restaurant a few times but have the say the that last visit was extremely disappointing The food was average and only just warm The service was OK but not spectacular and it was nt even busy  Don t think I would visit again in the forseeable future

Food was good especially starters calamari and scallops and desert chocolate brownie  Unfortunately though the service was VERY slow IT took about 15 minutes after being seated before we could order drinks then another 10-15 minutes till they came back to take our food orders Dinner itself was then close to a 45 minute wait After the meal there was another long wait just to get the bill

I ate here last night with my wife and daughter We had pre-booked and I would suggest others do because several people were turned away due to it being full  We waited 5-10 minutes for drinks orders to be taken and wasn t ready to order food so the waiter said he d come back We had to wait another 10 minutes for him to return We ordered garlic bread for starter and I ordered a pizza and my wife ravioli of the specials board The waiter advised that it may best all coming together because otherwise it may take along time He was correct because several other tables around waited over 20 minutes between there starters being taken away and waiting for their mains  We had to ask for crayons 3 times for my daughter to do some colouring When they were brought we had 1 felt tip pen and 2 light pink crayons that cannot be seen on white paper So not much good  Overall  it was ok but just didn t seem organised with people having to wait too long

Myself and three friends went to Circo on Sunday 20th April The atmosphere was excellent but one of the bar staff blatantly tried to rip me off for 30 of the 50 note that I handed him He was not only unapologetic but damn right rude when I sussed him out We reported this to the door staff so he ll hopefully get the bullet

Not our first trip but memories of the ambiance and setting in this idyllic Cotswold inn made a return most welcome  Overall for lunch the menu is fine  the food OK if not outstanding and the service good yes it does seem at times as though you have been sidelined but when it comes it is smiling and helpful  But the Inn has style and a history and is worth a detour  It was a pleasant experience again and we will return

I had dinner in chin chin a few months back This time the menu changed and the portion is not as much as I previously had It has greatly reduced I was looking forward going back to have dinner but it was a disappointment Overall it was still great food and waiter was very polite

I enjoyed my food  Choosing the nandos for starters and the pulled pork for my main Can t fault the food staff were very helpful always offering drinks One member of the party could not eat their starter apparently was not up to standards at all  A little on the pricy side but as a treat out I would definitely recommend this place We went on a Saturday evening which was quite lively and probably best for friends and couples rather then people with younger children on the Saturday anyway

Have eaten lunch upstairs with family earlier in month Food good although table service was a work in progress  Booked for breakfast today and was seated downstairs All staff friiendly courteous and efficient Fairly quiet- perhaps five other tables of diners We mostly went for full English but was a source of major disappointment When cutting up sausages for kids realised they were at best warm rather pale on outside and pink in centre Turned out this applied to all of us Then realised that the food was generally cold and potentially undercooked Staff were quick to remedy and could not have been more apologetic Overall experience was the proverbial curate s egg good in parts Come on Pierre we want you to be a success

Been to this particular branch a couple of times an have never been let down by the food it has always arrived hot and fresh and portion sizes have been somewhat generous HOWEVER the one negative that alway gets in my way is the staff not all of them however  Just a select individual who deems it fun to speak rather bluntly to individuals and not take into account somebody with autism for once I followed this up and emailed through to the main company with name of the said staff member in hopes that it will be looked into  Such a shame as otherwise this place would get 5 stars take away this element and the place is brilliant with very friendly staff and good quality food
Visited with family for a meal the food was not very well cooked and not hot enough surly staff who were very slapdash in their approach Will not be visiting again

This was our second time visiting Sushi Samba and in the interest of full disclosure I have to say we were really impressed on the first visit with the atmosphere service and food This time was a different experience entirely The atmosphere is of course the same and still impressive - the views alone are worth a trip up the lift It s the food and service that fell far short this time though We went for an early dinner on Saturday and were seated around 4 30 The restaurant staff still seemed to be preparing for the evening rush and I suspect this is in large part what led to the poor food quality and weird service  We started off with a round of appetizers consisting of the pork belly and the wagyu gyoza Both tasted ok but were served luke warm - room temperature really We ordered salmon rolls for our son which he enjoyed and the black cod and fillet from the robata grill for mains along with a couple of the sushi rolls The fillet like the appetizers was served at room temperature We d ordered it medium rare and it was that but felt tough as though it had been sitting for a long time The cod was actually very nice and one of the few things we really enjoyed The rolls we ordered were all decent and the one with shrimp tempura and chili mayo was actually quite good  We also ordered a couple of pieces each of yellow tail and salmon from the nigiri sushi selection We asked our waiter if it was possible to get it aburri style - flame seared on top He at first told us no not possible because there was no grill at the sushi bar A different waiter overheard this and said it was in fact possible so the initial waiter confirmed our order of sushi and returned several minutes later with salmon and yellow tail sashimi We explained that we had ordered the sushi rather than the sashimi and he took the dish without comment and returned to the kitchen coming back several minutes later with the proper dish Overall the food was just not up to what we expected from the place - especially given the price  The service as well was strange Our waiter seemed impatient most of the time We spent a minute discussing which main we wanted and he was shifting from foot to foot looking at his watch the kitchen other waitstaff etc and generally giving off the impression that he had better things to do We told him the first main we wanted and he said very good and walked off - so we had to call him back to give him the rest of our order and when we did he seemed quite irritated One of the strangest parts of the meal was when shortly after our appetizers arrived the cleaning staff came in and started mopping the floor around our table The smell of bleach was an extremely unpleasant accompaniment to the meal but none of the staff found it even slightly strange that they d be cleaning around us while we were eating I saw another table that was boxed in against the window by a wet floor sign at one point  As I mentioned at the start of this review I think a number of these issues were due to the staff preparing for the evening rush but this is absolutely no excuse If you re going to keep your restaurant open between lunch and dinner you should be prepared to give the guests that visit during that time the same quality of food and service as you would at any other time And mopping the floors between tables that are seated is just weird and unprofessional

An okay experience Lovely building though a little pastiche - would have been a fabulous space before which ever firm moved in and ripped out the original features to replace them with driftwood Food arrived VERY quickly almost too quickly   slight worry that it may have been microwaved Okay price though a little onthe steep side for what it was My triple-cooked chips I almost sent back for another cooking Nice wines Worth a visit

Service was slow Staff were not very interested in customers Our group shared 5 different starters and they were all very nice Quality of main course dishes was variable I had lamb with rice The lamb was meat on the bone tender but not seasoned The rice with nuts etc was dull unseasoned luke-warm sprinkled with very few nuts and a few tiny pieces of mince Good quantity but uninteresting for a meal out Moderate prices and BYO alcohol are the positives We had a Lebanese meal in another town a few days earlier and that was very good quality and so we were expecting better

Being Turkish Cypriot I think its safe to say that I know when your at a good mangal The food was very seasoned well very tender and the lahmacun is definitely up there with the best I have had being in Cyprus Turkey or here  However I don t want to harp on about the food and would rather focus on something that lets this place down  The service here is AWFUL I headed to the restaurant at 8 30pm on a Friday night without a booking and was told to come back at 9 30 After walking around for half hour or so me and my friend cam back to wait at the bar and have a drink We were greeted by the same chap who seemed surprised to see us 9 00pm He looked at his watch and said  I told you 9 30  Not the way i want to be greeted at restaurant  After finally being seated we had to get up and walk over to the service point to get menus as no one served us Twenty minutes later and we finally were served I ordered lamp chops which come with rice and salad however didn t want the rice so asked for a large salad instead I was told that this couldn t be done as the till wouldn t let him remove rice from the order  After waiting for an hour the food was finally served and was up to expectations Great food as usual but the service needs to be looked at  NOTE TO MANAGEMENT  You really should treat your staff with respect in front of customers Threatening to beat the s*** out of them whilst customers are around perhaps isn t the best idea

Relatively unadventurous kids 17 and 14 but 17yr-old wants to travel in the Far East next year and a v cautious wife I ate well they didn  First off no alcohol Second off only 10-20 of tables full on Saturday night 9pm so none of the atmosphere other review spoke of We felt a bit scrutinised by the staff but we really enjoyed ourselves Fresh salad cut with coriander in the cold rolls was gorgeous the warm soggy rolls another of the starters were fantastically flavoursome 50 of the beef tough but everything v flavoursome The 17yr old liked her crispy fried free-range chicken and steamed rice the 14yr old found the belly pork too much - thank The Lord he d had bangers and mash at Goddard s earlier Wife ate spring rolls and probably found that enough Quite limited range of the menu but everything done well and full-on authentic Vietnamese  56 for 4 but quite a bit of our food went back uneaten
Used to eat here often when visiting my Mother Last couple of visits have seen slow service and average food D€÷cor is very tired - urgently needs a refit

Not a very friendly inn restaurant which lacks atmosphere The food was ok but not cheap We sat in the bar area not the restaurant for our meal which might have been a mistake as no other customers appeared

The 2 courses for 12 95 is definitely worth the money but don t expect wonders  The grilled Halloumi was a huge portion for a starter but had no colour from the grill  The Kleftico was fine but not a patch on Olive Tree s up the road  The Beef Spicy was remarkably dull Not spicy beef wasn t great The reviews previously suggested more unfortunately it s hype

My wife and I visited the coffee shop for lunch on Wednesday 19 3 14 They seemed to be short of staff it was lunch time and not overly busy as we arrived at 12 45 We waited and waited for what seemed to be an age before we were visited by a waitress For some reason there seemed to be confusion by some of the staff Plenty of toing and froing But not much happening Our order was taken but not placed at the kitchen This was most unusual and as regular visitors we have never seen that type of problem before We hadn t got too much time available so unfortunately our experience lasted probably half an hour longer than we would have liked However I must say the food was excellent So it s not all doom and gloom Hope it was just a one off

Good Points To quote Jules Winnfield in Pulp Fiction These are indeed Tasty Burgers although I don t know how they compare to Big Kahouna burgers And I didn t have them for breakfast The staff are attentive the parmesan and truffle oil fries are heaven Bad Points The tables are a little crowded

We were greeted most warmly and offered a spacious table near the front window The table linen was delightfully crisp and the room itself was nicely decorated and airy Our pappadoms drinks and starters arrived promptly The house red and white wines were good value and matched the food well  Unfortunately the food itself was a disappointment bland and poorly spiced The Tandoori Mixed Grill showed very little charring with the result that both the chicken and lamb seemed strangely stewed Perhaps the tandoor was not up to full temperature The pilau rice was very plain almost like plain boiled rice The lamb bhuna was better and the meat tender and succulent  In short this could be an outstanding restaurant if the cooking was considerably better The service was excellent professional and friendly and the room itself had character and interest What a pity the food itself was not very good

My partner and I dined here on a recent weekend stay in Mudeford The restaurant is very attractive the staff efficient and friendly although not an Italian waiter to be seen The fish was excellent sea bream cooked in a tomato based sauce sealed in foil However the accompanying roast potatoes were I am sure reheated and therefore hard and unpleasant My partner was less impressed with her choices and her mushroom starter course was below par So on the whole pretty average

My wife is Filipina and to be honest we did expect a bit more from this restaurant It could certainly do with a spruce up The food was adequate buko pie was excellent  Prices are certainly on the high side to the quality of food presented There are many restaurants like this in Cebu itself - adequate without being inspiring so maybe we were looking for too much

Been there for my girlfriend s b-day service as ok not too bad but could be a little bit better for the price of what we paid How the Italian like to say  Mamma Mia so expensive I would recommend another place if just want to have pizza pasta and a glass of wine What out for your wallet lol

Great spot in the middle of Hungerford town decent selection of drinks standard food service a little disinterested though It is never good to feel like an inconvenience Will return and hope to feel a bit more wanted as it is quite close to us

Went tonight for a friends 30th It was busy as one would expect for a Saturday evening well I d expect it to busy but obviously the management didn t  It s the only pub restaurant I ve seen where there s more people stood up than sat down The queue to order food was about 20 orders deep as was the queue for people waiting to be seated All this time there were about 8 staff walking about serving food etc and just two behind the bar serving food and drink customers I almost got to the point of walking out and going elsewhere  When I eventually got round to ordering the food the staff member that served me was a bit rude insisting I ordered one thing when I actually asked for something else  Once the food was ordered it came pretty quick so the cooks did a sterling job there  I went to the bar after we d finished our meals to request the child s jelly and was assured it would be with me now  I actually waited 20 minutes for it to arrive and was even more shocked to see it was a prepacked jelly so God knows what took so long  I m happy with the cleanliness of the place and the atmosphere but my overall experience was just average

The restaurant was very busy we sat outside as we had the dog with us We had 4 meals quiche chilli soup and 2 jacket potatoes Unfortunately due to how busy it was the meals took 20 minutes to arrive and were cold and had elements missing At the prices paid you would expect more

After wondering around York for the morning we wanted a breather and a nice cuppa and found this The atmosphere was great inside due to the decor and music  We played a game trying to find the songs we knew off the notation paper which is utilised as wall paper  We ordered tea for two as well as a bagel which arrived a little over done however still edible and a toasted breakfast muffin The staff were very friendly and it was not too crowded so great for a little respite from shopping or exploring

The food is good for what you would expect from a chain pub nothing dazzling with the standard fayre of steaks burgers fish & chips Good bar so plenty of choices of liquid to wash down your surf n turf

Six if us had lunch here and whilst we had a good time I would say the restaurant is at best average Firstly the toilets smell either of bleach or worse Toilets are very poorly maintained We were the only group in for lunch and when three if us ordered a dish the waitress returned to say they only had one left I also ordered a desert that when arrived had not set properly and was inedible They did offer another foc and a coffee on the house to compensate The atmosphere was very dull and the staff looked really bored and uninspired  To summarise there are lots of restaurants in the locality that offer better service food and atmosphere This place has a load of potential but its missing an attention to detail and a focus on the customer Would give it another try to see if its a one off as some of the food was great
Food good and reasonable prices but you may have to wait for a table on a Sunday as it gets very busy They do a good breakfast at a good price and you can top up on rea and coffee free

This is a meal revue not a residential review The event was a large and significant birthday celebration lunch and in the run up the hotel had been nothing but attentive and proper On the day we had been allocated a separate and quite lovely room and it became clear that the hotel had taken so many other lunch bookings there probably wasn t an option Sadly and despite advance information nothing had been done to accommodate one of our party s coeliac condition apart from a couple of pieces of very ordinary looking bread nor for another s egg intolerance The food was OK but far from outstanding and given the stable the hotel declares itself to be in - the Gidleigh collection of Andrew Brownsword hotels - and its ambitions for its own Michelin status it s got a long way to go The staff were all unfailingly lovely thank you for clearing up the glass I managed to sweep off the aperitif table  but forgot things and if I dare be brutally honest didn t understand English well enough to know what a Cointreau coffee is A couple of wines from the house list were very good indeed I d love to say we d go back because the setting is quite beautiful but we re spoilt for choice in the area and there are better places to eat Oh well never mind we were largely well looked after had fun and were pleasantly surprised at the overall cost

Ok first please let me say this   LAMORNA cove itself is a slice of heaven I could happily just sit and enjoy the views all my life the coastal walks are a delight though can be a tad tricky at times the cafe is a tad expensive but us tourists are always being fleeced one way or another and the food and cakes are exceptional so I ll let that be now     The owner of Lamorna though is a different kettle of rotten fish  The toilets probably have never been cleaned and I d take your own toilet paper if I were you it s always empty  The car park attendants are doing there best to black list the place and have A levels in rudeness seriously if you park here take a picture of your car between the lines and two of your ticket as they will try anything to fine you  The wharf also has been left severely damaged by the storms and no attempt at repairs made  he has also built a lovely breeze block wall across a lovely property this you see as you enter the cove and is a total disgrace as it spoils the view as you enter in simple terms Lamorna it s self a jewel locals very friendly  owner and car park attendants a disgrace

Very excited by what I saw when walking passed and tried the following day  Food was good but took a while to arrive  Waiter seemed over worked and rushed  Food reasonably priced  Would return but not in a rush

Had a late lunch here following a visit to the nearby Imperial War Museum and took advantage of the lunchtime deal - pizza and a glass of wine for 10 This is a good offer the pizza was a good sized ham and tomato and came with a very generous glass of wine The welcome was warm and friendly my only gripe was the optional service charge of 10 which was already added to the bill I don t mind leaving a tip if it s been earnt but I do object to having the decision made for me
Helpful staff pleasant enough with quick service Sat at bar by revolving food server Everything seemed nice and fresh Good value

This is the on site eatery for the Premier inn at York North Nice friendly staff but a very limited wine and food menue and a tad pricey ie cod and chips 10-95 and no white zinfandal wine on menue ok as a one off but in my case once was enough

I live in Sprotbrough where the Boat Inn is and with experience I will only use it as a last resort The food there is only average the drinks are very expensive around 4 for a pint of lager  I believe the Boat Inn owners think they have a captive audience and it is idyllic on a sunny summers day down by the river and lock etc The staff are mainly young people who work part time and can give the impression they don t want to be there To take young children there can be risky as there isn t a play area for them and the river and canal nearby

2 adults 1 child in our party Arrived and were told 20minute wait for a table  We were given a buzzer and the Staff suggested we wait at the bar for it to start vibrating to indicate that our table was available we didn t order any drinks at the bar 5 minutes later it went off and we were shown to our table Waitress then started by saying let me tell you what we haven t got which as we had already decided to opt for the Downtown set menu only left 1 starter to choose out of the 3 listed Oh well ordered this Anyway plus the classic burger all round and bottomless drinks lemonades couldn t have coke as this was one of the things they had run out of  Food and drinks arrived in reasonable time but the waitress did not seem that interested in checking that everything was ok or whether we would like refills of the drinks While we were waiting for the food to arrive we were watching the entrance and noticed that nearly all the people were being directed to the bar area first which seemed strange as there were clearly empty tables and oddly that the ones not buying drinks at the bar seemed to be getting seated quicker than those buying drinks now the cynic in me starts to think
