Maybe a deliberate ploy to get more money from drinks at the bar  As for the food the starters were ok but uninspiring the burgers did have a good flavour and the chips were ok but we didn t feel that we had gone to a restaurant and had a meal out as there was nothing that made It feel any better than say going to a Burger King or macdonalds for a burger which if we had would probably have cost us less than the 40 00 we did pay  We did not tip the waitress as she only showed any interest in us and asked us if we had had a good day when it was time to pay and presumably the chance of a tip and as their receipt says on the bottom Only great service deserves a tip and whilst we had service it was a long way from being great  It seems that the overall ratings for TGI s is average and we would have to agree In today s world of hard earned money if you are looking for a meal out then there are better places in Poole to spend your money

We ve been here several times and enjoyed the quality of the food immensely but our most recent visit with the family was accompanied by very disappointing service We and the two other tables who were seated upstairs all felt completely ignored by the waitresses we spoke after waiting 20 minutes for our starter plates to be cleared  They delivered food but had to be flagged down for new drinks Even after we d gotten the bill we were kept waiting so long to pay more than ten minutes with empty glasses all round that we trooped down the stairs to ask to pay  We d assumed they were simply run off their feet downstairs so imagine our disappointment when we found that the three waitresses working had two tables down there and were mostly just cleaning up and closing down Literally the first time I can ever remember leaving no tip at all in a restaurant A nearly two hundred pound bill for two courses and two rounds of drinks for four people in a visit which took over two hours and we re not slow eaters   Anyhow like I said the food was genuinely delicious Just go when it s quiet and ask to sit downstairs so you can flag a waitress down

The Glass Boat because it s a boat is one of Bristol s different restaurants  The food is good the service is good and the dining experience is that bit different  OK the menu always seems to include at least one item that requires a translation - evidence of a slightly presumptuous style But that is not reflected in the genuinely honest approach of the staff  In a city that is now bristling with restaurants the Glass Boat offers something a bit different

The venue is nice but I m not a fan of having a TV on in a restaurant I guess it is next door to Stanford Bridge The service is fine The pizzas however are distinctly average It s a real shame because it is my local pizzeria but the pizza express on the kings road is so good There s a pizza express in Fulham Broadway station also but it s appalling If you want a good quality pizza in Fulham go to dominos

The restaurant is really rather average for dinner but much better for breakfast  I entered the restaurant for dinner and the head waiter said that he could only accommodate me in 20 minutes time despite being half empty No apology - just cannot fit you in before 8 Only one other table table entered in this waiting period  The other staff were charming and helpful  Where I sat I could hear the head chef shouting very loudly at the kitchen staff and waiters Either don t shout or sound proof the kitchen  My starter of Caesar salad was minuscule although tasty  My broccoli leek and cheese pie was certainly above average with a nice crust and the filling was not overcooked  A pity as I will be staying often in the hotel but will not choose to dine here
It s in Rickmansworth but it s prices are in Mayfair A nice pub but scores lower because of the exorbitant cost of booze

Sunday early evening and the place is half empty which should be good  but the noise from a large family table 16 echoed around the high roof Nice greeting and quick service too quick as we got another tables drinks Small bits of bread and olive oil as an aperitif then ribs and a salad for starters and fegatini with lamb and mint for mains All very tasty and appetising The prices were a little more expensive than our usual two Italians and the food not as good so it may be another 6 years before we get back

Went here for a meal with some friends last night booking was easy enough as i always do this online wherever possible so its good to see the website has this function Have been to ASK before down south when in London and remember it was good but i think this place has still a lot to learn  The place is very modern inside which is nice was moderately busy and service and the waitress was friendly and happy to recommend dishes We ordered drinks and probably must of been 30 seconds we got our drinks starters arrived quickly too Starters were good and very filling A bit of a wait for the mains we actually forgot that we ordered them  Some had pasta other a pizza the pasta tasted funny and a bit off sour on mine and was very appetizing Others did enjoy there pizzas I had the Fettuccine Porchini which was very creamy The menu does have a good selection Quick service average food there are better places to go if you want an Italian in my opinion local to the middle-brook Reasonably cheap with drinks and a 3 course 20 per head Definitely try and see for yourself

Make no mistake The Crown and Anchor at Dell Quay is a pub in the full sense of the word It has TV screens with football showing sometimes it has a nicotine stained ceiling dog treats on the bar and a stack of high chairs in the corner Quite obviously catering for the mass market of seasonal visitors in the summer rather than regular lunch goes it gets very busy there at weekends especially if the weather is good  I would describe the decor at The Crown and Anchor as rough and the toilets as unclean On my last visit here while seated near a window I happened to look behind the radiator that was next to me only to see mouldy chips fluff and old napkins trapped behind it  The staff are ok but the service could do with being a little more friendly and personal All things considered the food is pretty good to be honest

First visit to celebrate my birthday Excellent welcome and service and they had heeded our request not to be seated around any of the Halloween paraphilia they had around which was appreciated Food good we both had fillet steak they didn t quite get it right on the medium rare and medium front - but nice steak and to much sauce served with it The owner manger was very attentive and concerned that we hadn t got the steak cooked just as we like - we appreciated her concern Overall it was a good experience not fantastic but good

Went for lunch but unfortunately missed the carvery and specials We ordered Lasagne and Pork in cider with veg and roast potatoes Food was ok but veg and potatoes were dry and probably left over from carvery
Food was what we expected for the price Ales where good and served well Would go back again as live close by

A little bit dis- organised waiting for a table a while found our own table very busy place the waiting staff were doing there best but i think they were overwhelmed at times and didnt get much chance to clean up some food on the floor and the tables were lightly cleaned

We stopped for lunch  We found our own seats and helped ourselves to menus  When the barstool noticed our menus were swapped for lunch menus - not really a problem however I did ask if I could order from the main menu and was told no - which was then contradicted when another party did the very same thing 10 minutes later and were allowed to  The food is well done and nice  If they can get the service right it would be a wonderful place deserving of another star

Have now eaten there twice Whilst the salad bar is good on both occasions I had cause to complain about the chicken 1st visit it was very dry and despite the waitress s denial I am convinced it had been kept hot on the grill The 2nd occasion my chicken portion was so shrunken that I thought it was widgeon I was also put off by the draught beer It should never be served ice cold That temperatures is for lagers I shall not visit here again

We had this venue recommended by friends who raved about it Maybe we caught it on a bad day Monday 14th Oct  We were a little early but the table was ready-a plus point Chose the standard afternoon tea It was good but only just good no more than that We had expected above average and felt that two scones were a cheap filler upper even if the cream with them was excellent Those sarnies were nothing special Our waiter obviously went for a break halfway through our tea as the service became a little less attentive We did not enjoy being gawped at by the visitors to The Baths who seemed to have license to wander in and out of the eating area at will take photos and generally spoil the elegance and atmosphere of this lovely place The young lady on the till seemed a bit vexed that we didn t wish to put a tip on our card payment-that would be because we d left our tip on the table but didn t feel the need to explain ourselves to her Overall we were a bit disappointed We would still say to someone try it  but it has a long way to go before it gives Bothams at Whitby a run for their money

Four of us in our 60s 70s booked a table for 7 30pm on a Friday evening and were soon seated We sorted our drinks out at the bar and made our selection from the menu only to be told that there would be a 45 minute wait for our food to be prepared  Shame really but I suppose it was a Friday Everything fine waitress friendly but busy so not a lot of interaction Nice but nothing special
Been there with some friends for dinner service was nice for a reasonable 16 The big sushi to share platter didn t look as it did in the menu pictures and it had surimi on it

Mary Jane s Fish Bar is really in two halves one half is Take away and the other half is for a sit down meal The range of fish etc is very good and the chips are just great Portion sizes are reasonable and the prices are competitive with other similar venues in Cromer My wife and I have been several times but usually with a group all going to Cromer pier to see a show The service is fairly quick so overall I rate it good

We loved the drive into Ston Easton winding through the woods until you reach the manor house  We were greeted by a lovely man who suggested we took drinks in the lounge we were given the choice of any of the rooms to have our ap€÷ritifs in - we chose one of the lovely main rooms complete with large chairs and views of the grounds  Once shown through to the dining room we had a chance to really take in the decorations around us - slightly over the top and old hat but I guess they fit the look they are going for The menu offered a good choice - on a whole we both enjoyed all of our courses I thought my wild trout with pickled cucumber was excellent though the confit duck terrine was forgettable Their wine list is interesting and not too pricey the Pinot Noir from Orgeon that we chose was perfect  We took tea and petis fours on their beautiful terrace in the early summer sun It was an all together pleasant midweek lunch it must be said

I have not been to the Barley Mow for some years and the d€÷cor since we were last there gives a very warm and relaxing atmosphere Greeted by polite and friendly staff who were very attentive and made us feel very welcome However whilst there is a good selection from the menu the food only warranted an average rating and I agree with Rachel H s review that more time should be spent on the quality of food and not the quantity The food arrived promptly but one of the steaks was not cooked as requested and the gammon and the pineapple had spent too much time on the chargrill  Finally having eaten at another restaurant quite recently and being charged 4 09 for a large glass of Chardonnay imagine my surprise when being charged 5 15 for the same drink at the Barley Mow I could have brought a good quality bottle of wine for the price of the two glasses purchased here

The menu here is very good and there is a good selection of cask ales Staff friendly and attentive but if you hit a shift change you can get forgotten  The only problem I find is that whenever we eat here the vegetables always seem to be cold on arrival Even if you send them back they only revert to luke warm Occasionally it is obvious that the food has been under the heat lights for too long but they are very good at replacing food if you let them know there is a problem Overall pretty good but some attention to detail required

Popped in for a quick drink as it had started raining staff pleasant enough pub looked tired with peeling wall paper tables needed a good clear down and clean Shame as location looking over the sea front is lovely

It s a family restaurant that doesn t want to forget it s still a pub so there s music blaring and a fair number of drinkers in the public bar But the rest of the place is spacious and there are plenty of tables The menu though should be a warning - there s nothing they can t offer steaks burgers ribs curries sandwiches Italian Mexican You just know it s all delivered by a catering van and warmed up specially for you That said the food was tasty enough and it wasn t expensive

I was really looking forward to the French Table as I have heard good thing about this place Maybe my expectation were too high but I felt it was a normal high street restuarant with very high menu prices I have eaten in top restaurants in central London who serve great food and paid alot less But on the positive the food was tasty and the service friendly The venue itself is small and tables are very close together which makes the place feel very cramped After seeing the final bill I didnt think it was worth the price as there are other great restaurants in Surbiton charging alot less for their hospitality

Have dined here a few times now Food is always good value and good service Restaurant is clean and fresh looking still unlike the Harvester across the road  Standard experience at othe similar chain restaurants

Went there to celebrate the new job of my girlfriend and upon entry the restaurant looked the part We were sat in a far corner of the restaurant feeling rather neglected by the service Looking at the menu it seemed very well priced however we were later informed that the burgers were not served with any sides but 6 95 for just a burger is very over priced I opted for the sea bass and my girlfriend opted for the burger and ordered a side of sweet potato fried and garlic bread to start the food was good but the sea bass was small i wouldn t mind visiting again but i would consider other options first

Went here for a office lunch in December 2015 I was impressed that we didn t have to pre-order our meal days in advance - a good sign I thought The staff were lovely throughout the visit no complaints there at all The started and dessert was delicious The main was easily the worst Christmas dinner I have ever had The portion was small the vegetables not cooked through properly so it was a huge let down I had heard great things about the restaurant but alas it dint live up to expectations Maybe it was just a bad visit Personally I wouldn t rush back there but if I did go there with friends I would be interested to see if my opinion changes

On arrival the car park was packed   and all tables seemed taken but as we were early  not a problem Table fro three   with three starters and three mains For me   the main of Fish Pie was awful  possibly the worst I have ever eaten  Well half eaten Poor quality white fish swimming No pun intended in a watery white liquid Tasteless    and bland All was saved by attentive smiley service

Ten years ago this seminal Soho restaurant was leading the way for great Asian cuisine Although still better than most I fear its glory days will be behind it if it does not up its game Don t get me wrong the food is good the service impeccable but I always expect more I will be coming back soon as I live in hope that the spark will come back

Friday lunchtime Not very busy so service was fairly good Food O K Needs a total re-paint what paint there is is filthy and needs a good clean inside and out It needs new furniture and carpeting It looks as though they have been to a car boot sale or auction and bouight whatever chairs they could find looks really tatty The carpet is a disgrace especially where the food is brought through I expect to see children but I must admit they aught to be more controlled Will call again when when the work has been done BUT NOT BEFORE

We visited late on a Sunday afternoon so perhaps we were unlucky to get dried up offerings but it disappointed The service was friendly if a bit slow but when the food arrived disappointment set in My cheese scone was well over cooked and dry and not very tasty Linda s fruit scone was a bit better The coffee was okay and they did serve decaf tea which was good to see The surroundings are Spartan and the upstairs section is up some very steep stairs Not good for the less fit Average at best

This is a conventional Thai restaurant It does not try to be hip or trendy or experimental with the dishes There s Thai decor & waitresses in Thai costume However it is cosy food is passable & service friendly Overall it is good value

Ordered takeaway First issue no prices were on the website if you have to ask perhaps you can t afford it - lol  Well across the board prices were more expensive than any other place we ve ordered from in the area - justified not in our opinion Food quality flavours were around good to average and portion sizes a little on the small side  I m use to getting two servings from a biryani  Customer service was pleasant and seemed efficient but the worst mistake placing the order in a paper bag and not sealing the containers properly = stained car seat not amused  Would I eat here again probably not but others may love the style and prices  So despite everything I would say give it a try it s different from your usual indian restaurant

Chose The Otter Inn as a halfway meeting place to meet family We arrived at 12 15 and diners were already eating their luncheon choice from the carvery Obviously a popular place for locals as the place filled quickly and a long queue formed Three choices of meat and three prices could be paid for a small medium or large plate Only one visit to the carvery so no going back for more  Not that we wanted to Atmosphere was souless with a canteen  air  about it and the food matched The table was wobbly and bare with mismatched cutlery Very friendly chef however we would have preferred him dressed more professionally with the whites white and smarter trousers rather than track suit bottoms and scruffy shoes Sorry not for us

We decided to stop by for a bite to eat after work Things got off to a bad start as a waitress forced her way past us on the stairs like a bull in a china shop We were seated by I assume the manager who talked us through the menu and advised a waitress would be over soon for our drinks order Our actual waitress was lovely and very attentive  We ordered a lemon vanilla martini to drink from the limited cocktail menu The drink was not amazing but it looked nice in the glass We got tap water for the table but this tasted off I think the glasses had not been rinsed properly  My squid and mussel pasta was delicious really flavourful and a decent portion The pizza of the day of chicken pesto this was a major let down The base had a huge amount of crust and the lack of cheese was a surprise It was impossible to cut too Overall I think this place is just a little bit pretentious and I would advise you to stick to your local italians

I was attending the Everyman Theatre for their Rock n Roll Panto Having enjoyed the Everyman Bistro before the refurbishment we were looking forward to enjoying a pre-show meal in the Pen Factory especially having read the reviews on Trip Advisor Unfortunately my wife and I were both disappointed with the menu and left without ordering No complaint with the ambience No complaint with the excellent selection of craft beers Paddy I m assuming it must be down to my advancing years 75 I struggled with the menu Maybe a Lasagne for us oldies

I have been slightly disappointed by this restaurant I have been to this restaurant several times and it was always very good Somehow the last time they managed to disappoint me Took forever to serve the food and once we received it was not great too  Roti canai was assembled from defrosted paratha  They have so much potential but

We ve eaten here a couple of times and the food and service are good This time we were seated out the back by the toilet and kitchen doors It s way too bright out there and people keep slamming the door into your chair as they go to the toilet

Good draft beer and a great atmosphere Disappointingly the menu is stuck in a time warp and would benefit from being refreshed Despite its failings its still a favourite Book to eat early as parking is very limited

There was a very good atmosphere here with good music being played and we all felt very welcome We went upstairs for drinks becuase downstairs was far to packed A downside maybe was that i felt the drinks where a bit pricey and there was a bit of a wait for drinks as there was only one person on the bar However i would recommend this place
went there for a pizza nice base and ingredients Order a Parma Ham Pizza probably they just need to put on it more Parma ham mine was with just 2 slices of ham  But in the end it was good

I got the mixed salad box The food is good and tasty However is suffers from that 1980s thing of the veggie option being the meat dish minus the meat I m not expecting more from a stall that specialises in goat meat But basically the salad portion is the same as what the meat eaters get but with air where the meat was I did have a bit of a go at the man serving Standing in line probably isn t the best situation to have a discussion so it probably seemed more of a moan than a explanation The standard options with meat make up a lunch If you take away the meat you don t have a lunch Veggie s don t have smaller appetites I understand the economics but I would rather pay more and get more food As I m typing this I m already feeling hungry and will probably go out again to spend more money topping up my feeding needs So I m willing to part with the cash to feel more full I would rather that money went on more salad than a chocolate cookie Shame - as a good mixed salad and this a good one  is as rare as hen s teeth in the Borough market area

Visited on a Tuesday night when the restaurant was rather quiet We were greeted by a friendly waitress who showed us to a table in the centre of the restaurant which was slap bang in the middle of two tables that were very close to our table which made us feel quite uncomfortable I asked the waitress if we could move to another table in the corner which seemed to be free however we were told that it wasn t ready yet  This was annoying as the table was left empty throughout our whole meal and no staff attended to the table in order to make it ready   Food was average Ordered a blue cheese and bacon burger which tasted nice however the bottom burger bun was soggy and fell apart whilst trying to eat This was the same with my girlfriend s burger We had noticed that there was a lot of food sat on the pass waiting to be taken out and staff seemed to be more preoccupied by cleaning tables than serving the food You would have thought being a burger restaurant they would have mastered the art of serving a burger a non soggy bun to accompany their burgers Shame

We Have loved carluccio s for many years The new menu reduces the amount of pasta dishes on offer and gives more expensive choices The 2 course lunch deal has disappeared  this may prove a bad business idea given cote around the corner still offers their 2 course deal  The food we had though was very tasty See my pics I had ravioli filled with cheese and lemon  wish they would bring back the sage and butter ravioli see my pictures Would liked to have given the food 4 rating but new limited pasta menu takes it down to three as I can t opt for 3 5 Bring back lunch deal please
Staff were friendly but the food was very average my wife s starter only had 2 scollops which were cut in half and my pizza was very average won t be going back

Visited the lakeside for a Sunday lunch with family  Goods points Food very nice everyone enjoyed their meals and staff who served very pleasant  Bad point restaurant was quite cold  Disgusting point I went to the toilet which had 2 cubicles one was occupied so I used the other Whoever was using the other cubicle left their cubical and the toilet room without washing their hands When I returned to my table I asked my partner who came out of the toilet before me and she stated a member of staff

At 16 95 for two courses it isn t bad value but it really isn t up to the standard the surroundings lead you to expect The menu was limited - fish or beef but this wouldn t normally worry me as I much prefer well cooked fresh ingredients from a limited menu than a huge choice of stuff from the freezer We both chose fish sea bass and sole Both were very nice but the fat cut chips and mashed up peas that accompanied were not great not seasoned and not much taste  For starters we both had the squid served in a limp soggy batter and pretty tasteless but on a bed of really exceptionally good spicy salad I m trying not to be deliberately unfair but they could really do so much more - the restaurant room is great the ambience is great the staff in there are really good attentive without being intrusive  and it s just such a shame that the food is only pretty average  We would eat there again but only if there weren t any reasonable local pubs serving food

Myself and my partner visited early evening on a Friday and we had no problems being seated The staff were polite and attentive and said all the right things at the right times the only thing was they were a bit miserable But you couldn t knock the food and that made up for it excellent

Went with my wife while visiting London First impressions were good- a well-designed comfortable restaurant with a decent atmosphere when full The tables however were closer together than in our local unpretentious Italian The staff were attentive and friendly and service was quick However I have two major criticisms The food is over-priced My starter - a plate of rocket seasoned with cheese with a wafer-thin cheese crisp on top was more than 14 The prices would have been acceptable if the food had some sort of wow factor but it doesn t My main course was plaice The quality of the fish itself was so-so and the basil crust potato olives and tomato sauce just didn t work For 28 it was seriously lacking My wife s verdict on her lamb was that it was very nice but 80 of it was bone The wine list however is extensive and our desserts were good Thank heavens we had a very full and delicious bread basket I don t know how restaurants get Michelin stars but I ve eaten in plenty which are better than this charge half as much and don t have a star Perhaps we were just unlucky on a first visit
Good fish seats crammed in The sort of fare I have at chips near my home but costing less  Not bad

If you like neon lights and illuminated fish tanks this is the place for you  If however you like a good curry you are best to avoid  I found the food to have very unpleasant sour taste on two occasions of dining here Also the meat used was also very industrialised and was perfectly cubed at 10x10x10mm Service was very mechanical and had little personality  Just to add weight to this comment I have worked in the food industry for over 10 years and many of which was developing Indian food for the grocery retailers so I know my way around a curry menu and also now how industrial cut meat comes in

Popped in for a Dinner last Friday night portions of the ribeye steak was extremely small after finishing the wine no more was offered  it s like they were rushing to go home even though was only 10 to 10pm nothing special was not a wow experience

Visited here in January with family food was nice but veg was cold We were hurried along with the courses and felt we were being rushed to finish our meals What really put us off was when we had finished the bill was promptly given to us we said we were going to order another round of drinks and sit in the bar so we could pay all at once But as soon as we got up another waitress thrust the card machine into our hands and more or less demanded payment there and then Made us look like a bunch of crooks about to do a runner therefore i have to say its put me off returning again
Got take away from here - all pretty standard Staff were stressy though which was a shame A smile and thank you wouldn t hurt

First visit here and after visiting a Marston s pub before thought we would have the Sunday lunch which had been recommended from a visit to a different Marston s pub Very disappointed veg tasteless roast potatoes mushy and the chicken came out as a whole chicken with skin and bones not carved like we expected my husbands face was a picture as he can eat meat but has a major phobia about bones It was just like a microwave meal really On the other hand the puddings were great we had apple crumble and sticky toffee pudding Had 2 sunday lunches and 2 puddings for 15 which is a great offer but unfortunately the main meal wasn t to our liking

Very nice food duck salad very nice when we arrived the table was ready I felt i was rushed off the table keep filling your classes and clearing give you no time to enjoy it I must say the food was very but should be for the prices they charge

We visited early evening before a theatre show even then there was a lovely atmosphere downstairs and very full Unless you are lucky enough to get a booth table you will feel very squeezed in and suffer from a small table somehow it still works  The food was a mixed success I had a wonderful beef dish with amazing side of petit pois both recommended along with the amazing bread My wife had the salmon dish which was by far the worst fish dish she has had for years The Salmon fillet was so over cooked it was bone dry and lost all flavour  If we didn t have the problem with the meal the rating would have been higher as the rest of the experience was very good The staff are excellent efficient with a sense of humour

Had fish and chips both were reasonably good Fish was big and tasted ok and chips were no better than average but small portion Very expensive compared to other chip shops and service was incredibly slow

My wife and I visited here and were going to have something on the two for a tenner menu but after having a look at the limited options decided to have a mixed grill each at double the price which let s be fair is still not a massive amount for a meal but enough to warrant a good meal  I ll be fair enough to say it was average Edible but certainly nothing to write home about  We probably won t be visiting again

Wonderful food but      the service levels are very poor for a restaurant which wants to achieve high standards Having to constantly chase for them to take orders  drinks even napkins  lets them down so much

Twelve of us booked a table for Sunday lunch My wife and I opted for roast which was OK although the veg was underdone Others had variety of steaks and deserts Pub was very busy as you would expect on a Sunday Showing football on large screen Haven t been here before - obviously very popular local for people living in the Plympton area

The restaurant looks really nice and the food was fine But it was let down by very slow service in a restaurant that was not at all full  To his credit at one point the waiter apologised for the slow service saying it was because there was large party on another table it had 6 people

Very empty but ok inside Lovely tarka dal Chicken Korma was tad sweet and a stark yellow colour Lamb tikka masala was also very sweet and a very lurid red colour All in all tasty but really must lay off the food colouring

We were very happy with the attentive service and pleasant atmosphere The food and drink was good and competitively priced However the issue of a bill with a 10  optional service charge added is a pet hate of mine and it must be said not all nearby Greenwich restaurants adopt this unpleasant practice If you are going to increase the listed menu prices at least do so in a less underhand way

I so wanted to like this restaurant so much but overall I was disappointed along with my 3 companions On the plus side I liked the interior decor and ambience of the River Cottage Canteen Winchester  It was buzzy yet relaxed we were able to linger over our meal and weren t rushed through Service was attentive and efficient without being over bearing We started with 2 sharing platters - a Veggie and a meat platter between 4 This was the best part of the meal - plenty of variety and good flavours The mushroom crumble and lamb with beetroot were the highlights For mains I had the fish stew which was good but very rich  i have been spoilt by the Cornish Fish stew at Sheekeys in London which is divine The duck leg was very disappointing and very salty - two companions had this and were both struggling to find anything good The plaice was ok - my friend said it was a bit oily Overall the manis were pretty average Lemon curd posset followed which was a nice palate cleanser but the honey and almond cake was dry  So its a bit of a curates egg  good in parts but overall we left disappointed We did feedback via the  in house form We wouldn t return- sadly

A regular haunt Costa in Leighton Buzzard has friendly staff but is a victim of its own success Queues can easily snake through the shop at peak times and patience is a must Finding a seat can be a challenge especially if you are flying solo but if you ditch the usual British reserve and share a table with a stranger some interesting conversations can be had

I recently stayed at the Reebok stadium the night before Newcastle United played Wigan at The DW Stadium We didnt want to stay in the hotel and explored the surrounding areas of the stadium and found The Harvester nearby From the outlook the place looked busy but the building work and beer garden needs a good transformation as looked dirty and run down As we entered the place we were greeted by a lady who showed us to our table Not before long we were served by a friendly waiter named Matt We thought it was only right to have a pint of guiness with it being the weekend of St Patrick We ordered 2 rump steaks which when arrived were piping hot and cooked to perfection Overall our meal and service was excellent We felt as though the outside needed a good tidy and lick of paint while inside was nice but may need a refurbishment in the very near future On a personal note we would like to thank Matt for his kind service and if anyone attends The Harvester recommend his services as he was friendly and wouldnt be a problem to go out your way what ever your request
As title really we had the 18 course meze and although was plenty of food the food itself wasn t great quality or of great taste Was ok service was good not sure we would go back voluntarily
Was not the best steak I ve had for over 100 for just me and my wife  Pleasant restaraunt but I feel very overpriced for the quality

Wish I could tate this place higher but there were a few minor things that left me a little frustrated  Perhaps there was a staffing problem that Saturday but despite waiting to be seated I was not acknowledged by the one member of staff that seemed to be serving meals to a busy restaurant so I quietly sat myself down and made my lunch selection of soup followed by mushroom risotto I waited ages for the girl to reappear but after about 25 minutes I suddenly spotted a small notice in the far corner that instructed me to place my order at the counter which I proceeded to do  I then waited what seemed an exhorbitant lenght of time for the soup to arrive which when it did arrived with my risotto hence the long wait despite the fact that it was quite evident that I was dining alone  The soup was delicious and when the risotto arrived that was good too and had not demished in quality despite being kept warm for 15 minutes while I ate the soup  Probably just as well I was merely killing time waiting to see friends who live in the village  Do go and try this place I am sure you will have a better experience the food was great had there been just a little extra attention to detail and it would have a been a fine lunch

We haven t been to the Fox & Barrel for nearly a year after an average food experience Yesterday evening we returned and five of us had very good starters & main courses This was the Fox & Barrel at it s best However on asking to see the desert menu we were abandoned so took matters into our own hands retrieving a menu from an adjacent table I then attracted the waiter s attention but he declined to take our desert order saying he would be back later When eventually returning he told us a desert order would take 20 minutes to arrive and it was clear by his manner he hoped we wouldn t order He told us there was only one chef preparing deserts and hence the delay We decided to order a single coffee and then left Whilst this was going on the head chef was standing by an adjacent table talking to guests All in all it was a somewhat disappointing experience The Fox & Barrel serves good food at it s best but needs to recognise it has serious competition in the area offering a superior dining experience

The service and the people working here are brilliant very friendly but the overall quality of the food was just okay  I find these chains to be a little hit and miss so wasnt expecting great things but had hoped for something better after reading the reviews  Will give it another when next in the area

Don t make it to Camden much but was up there the other day wanted a quick lunch out of the rain and Poppies was the first place that I sited The place was booming but one of the many very pleasant staff on hand found me a table quickly and left me with a menu Didn t think to scan it - after all when your in a chippie what else would you want - and ordered a regular cod chips mushy peas and coke  The food came quickly enough and the peas were I must say more plentiful than I had expected and very tasty too The chips were also quite good - double fried nicely crisp on the outside and they didn t congeal across the meal The cod by contrast was a disappointment only a 6 - good crisp batter but the fish was not as flakey as it could be and it must be the smallest regular portion I ve ever seen all things considered I just don t think that the meal warranted the 16 10 bill

Sunday lunch so not the full menu Pork was good but the sirloin beef was fatty and grissly - looked like it had been bought pre-cut rather than carved from a joint Service was OK although waiter forgot to tell us about the turkey special Nice inside and good atmosphere and will definitely come again

I went there few times for dinner or just for drinks always been a good time Food wise is nothing special but the atmosphere is what makes that place special so the location and the interior I will keep going good cocktails and nice beer

Good food spoilt by slow service from the kitchen  We went for a family Sunday lunch seven of us I would estimate the restaurant was about 40 full and the table service in itself was polite and attentive but the kitchen was so slow it took 2hours 45 minutes from point of placing our first food order to finally paying the bill and leaving  I ve eaten here at other times Friday lunchtime mostly and it was a lot better again very good quality and served much faster  Its a fantastic redevelopment of the old smelly pub that it used to be and its been done very well indeed  the speed from the kitchen let it down that day I will go again but I will avoid Sunday lunchtime

Booked here as we had a Tastecard and wanted nice surroundings relaxed atmosphere which this place has you can tell by the pictures   Greeted nicely shown to table we had booked waiter friendly Ordered 10oz Ribeye & a Pork dish wrapped in ham & a bottle of Hardys Riddle Had to wait a little while for the wine and the food came shortly after Steak cooked to perfection delicious but pork dish was a little on the small size even for the Wife  although well cooked and presented We asked for the dessert menu but didn t chase it up didn t get it decided against it paid up n left  With the Tastecard offer n tip the bill came to 40 which is fab value but would have been closer to 55 without the card  Loss of 2 stars one for the smaller portions one for the value  Note we had the same bottle of wine for 7 45 at Molloy s the night before  this was 17 85 at Brasserie Brunel - and two mains for under 8 better portions too  Better surroundings at Brunel lovely atmosphere but you are certainly paying for it
The Bell is now in the hands of green king group in my opinion it as lost some of its appeal its not the same anymore

We chose this restaurant for a meal because it looked very nice - good stylish decor We also chose it because it had a 2 for 1 offer on the sandwich board outside Being a bit cynical about offers I double checked that there wasn t a catch  No  I was told all you had to do was download the voucher code from the website which myself and a co-diner did there were four of us  Service seemed OK initially and we ordered our drinks After at least 20 minutes of waiting they eventually arrived We then had to chase the staff so we could order our food - we were on a time limit The food then took about half an hour to arrive - we had now been sat there for 50 minutes The food was actually very good no complaints there However when we came to pay the waiter said the 2 for 1 deal was Sunday to Thursday this was a Saturday  I informed him that the waitress didn t mention that despite me specifically asking about the terms and any catches I suggested he honour the offer which he did after a little bit of persuasion He then went off to give the waitress a dressing down All in all the food was good but to echo other reviews the service was very slow and the staff did seem disinterested in us

I have been here many times over the years but this experience left me vowing never to return Having been asked for our drinks order quite quickly on what was a very busy Saturday night we decided to give our food order at the same time as we knew exactly what we wanted although the waiter failed to write anything down The starters arrived and were enjoyed but we then proceeded to wait another 30 - 45 minutes before asking if we had been forgotten The waiter  proprietor s son  was quite defensive and disputed the length of time that we had waited saying that we could see that they were very busy Eventually the main course arrived but upon tucking in we realised that the dish was not what we had ordered As we had waited so long already and couldn t bear to wait all over again - we were hungry - we duly ate the food though severely curtailing our enjoyment When the afore-mentioned waiter returned to clear our table and asked if we had enjoyed our meals we explained that we thought that we had had the wrong dishes he made light of the fact saying that we all make mistakes We told him that we thought that his attitude was very defensive and unapologetic to which he disagreed By now his father  the proprietor  had got involved I said that we had been to the restaurant over the years  which he acknowledged  but told him that I didn t intend to return due wholly to their attitude to which he said  up to you  I was frankly amazed at their lack of customer service They then proceeded to bring us our bill without asking us if we would like anything else  which of course we didn t  and we realised that we were being thrown out - never to return  It is clear from our experience and from reading other reviews on here that all is well if all goes right but if anything goes wrong it s the customer who is at fault
Food good and basic Local sourced however feel it could be better The food was well cooked and flavoursome Not as good as the Craster arms but still worth going to

I regularly go there and food is good and also the atmosphere I have a friend who works there and serves us well Only thing i would like to tell you is dont give tips as it goes to owners and not to the staff I know it as my friend works there

When arriving in Kaspas we were greeted by a friendly manager who sat us to the table and explained the ordering process When in the Que for ordering there was a peculiar smell there was also boxes of waffle mix just behind the till stacked high The food itself was a generous portion looked good but just tasted ok and did not live up to the hype The drinks were a differant story like my order and the surrounding tables next to mine it took over 15 mins to bring the drinks which is ridiculous when all they do is put a curly straw in a glass bottle of coke Overall the experience was very average had good press and advertising but did not live up to the expectations

This was not the first time we had eaten here but from my point of view it may well be the last We had booked a table for four and were initially disappointed to be shown a table large enough for four but only dressed for two Easily put right sure but not the point  The menu is extensive perhaps too much choice especially when taking into account all the daily specials Service was prompt enough - perhaps on occasions too quick Hardly had cutlery been placed on dishes than the staff were there to whisk the used stuff away The food was quite acceptable although nondescript I had Calamari as a starter The portion served was small and my plate filled up with a poor salad Calamari to my mind does not benefit from being served with salad The other starters and main courses were no more than acceptable although the House wine left a bitter aftertaste That said it did seem as if the Waiters were to a certain degree running round like headless chickens The only ones who seemed to have a sense of order about them were two young ladies who went about their duties in a calm efficient manner and got a lot done  The greatest disappointment however for what is a popular restaurant was the condition of the toilets I was able to see into the Disabled toilet and this like the Gentlemens  had paper towels all over the floor which in turn was absolutely filthy Just what the Ladies was like I cannot say The restaurant may have been busy but there really is no excuse for this

The Waggon reopened today after refurbishment and we went along to take a look  First impressions count for a lot The old Waggon was tatty but full of character The new Waggon has carpet carpet  on the floor in all but the main bar and while money has plainly been spent here the character seems to have largely gone Thirteen hand pumps on the bar together with a selection of keg beer cider and lager means that the choice of tipple is quite wide but the food offering was limited to a few cobs I ve no idea whether more food will be offered once things settle down  The pub has been enlarged The long-closed shop wasn t it a hairdressers once was been knocked through into a larger seating area and the predominantly pink and let s face it awful Barbara Cartland lounge has gone too But what s in it s place is smart enough but the Waggon was never about smart  but you could be anywhere  The bar counter seems bigger than before and it was a silly decision to site fixed seating directly opposite it particularly as the other seating areas are now enlarged You never could get past the bar if anyone was sat down and you still can t A standing area perhaps with a couple of those high tables would have been a much better choice  The beer selection is OK but Bathams will be sorely missed Overall I was underwhelmed and the features that made the old Waggon so characterful and distinctive have gone sadly It s smart but that s not what the Waggon was about

Went here for a meal last Saturday evening Had read the reviews and was looking forward to it good meal The first problem was various dishes not available as was Campari to drink However we then had a 1 hour and 40 minute wait from arriving at the restaurant to being served our first course We were given no explanation for the delay until 10 minutes before our first course was served We should have bee notified on arrival of there was a problem to give us the opportunity to eat elsewhere The food when it eventually arrived was very good albeit very small portions  We did not bother with desserts or coffee due to delays and a lack of transparency from the staff Sorry out of principle I would not eat here again for fear of a repeat performance
service was good prices are good The food was ok the pizza wasnt the best i have had but nice enough to go back Good for a decent meal

Had a nice enough lunch here - food was pub grub The dinner menu looked good but quite pricey Staff friendly and attentive Cater well for families Good location close to the beach Pretty quiet but it was out if season

It does what it says it s a carvery you get the usual selection of meats with the usual vegetables The choice is yours as to how much you eat specially if you like your vegetables Staff are busy but that s to be expected Otherwise it s a great for a family

We ve eaten here many times but unfortunately things seemed to have fallen apart the last time  Staff were as friendly as always but the quality of the food wasn t up to it s usual standard No oysters - I notice another reviewer had this issue Food wasn t as well cooked or presented as we have experienced in the past  We probably will go back but if we have another below average experience it will be the last time sadly
Good choice of menu but lacking in atmosphere Service was ok but rather slow Food good and served by friendly staff
This restaurant has been around for years  have dropped in a few times for a tasty burger well positioned in the town centre

It was early Saturday evening and pretty quiet The food was good and the waiters attentive A couple of minor annoyances was that my Son s pizza was not cut and they didn t ask whether he wanted lemon in his coke They just poured it straight in It was only after leaving the restaurant that I discovered that there had been a 10 service charge added and my wife had left a tip

We went for dinner over the bank holiday weekend This is an unpretentious local which was bustling when we were there - a nice atmosphere and the landlord and serving staff were very friendly and welcoming Not very smart and verging on the scruffy Food-wise the pub offers standard pub fare rather than anything particularly exciting or imaginative - chilli con carne fine but the special sea bass was disappointing Good beer selection

Its pub grub pure and simple Well priced OK service OK food Value for money It gets very busy and tables are not cleared too fast and everything else seems a bit rushed Staff need more training some replacing to be honest Good for a quick low cost meal

After the funeral at Alford crematorium the family had arranged a buffet at The Windmill Hotel This was nicely prepared and presented A selection of sandwiches savoury pieces and lovely gateaus were served Teas coffees as requested A lovely relaxed atmosphere for everyone to mingle and remember a very special person I cannot comment on the hotel facilities or the Indian meals but what we had was satisfactory

We are regular foodies and have heard varying reports of this restaurant so wanted to make our minds up from our own experience When we visited it was not busy on a thursday night that said it is late shopping and I Was surprised at the lack of customers We were greeted and shown to a table about as far away from the food you could get directly under an air conditioning out let and freezing We moved tables and sat and waited and nothing no waiter no one after five minutes or so we got up to look at the food and were so disappointed never went back to the table just walked out and nobody seemed to care or question why Good luck and I hope your experience is better than ours
We had an enjoyable family lunch here Whilst the dog ends still abound the front door the service  food and price are all good  Give the place another try and try to look past the shortcomings

Our order was taken and the food arrived promptly The meal was very nice and there was enough on the plate to fill me up One minor moan is that it took the waitress a long time to bring us the bill after we d finished eating Otherwise no issues

Food was really good different from most other standard indian restaurants However the service was slow other clients that arrived after us had finished their dinner before our food even arrived  Then part of it was burnt Service was poor we ordered two naans got just one Had to ask various times for some things like water or an extra plate that was missing from the laid table Drink portions were tiny but priced like regular drinks elsewhere The full dinining hall was incredibly loud due to bad acoustics design could hardly hear each other on our table It was either too hot or too cold when AC was switched on No spoons were provided to serve rice We asked for a jug of water but just got water in their tiny glasses but other tables did get jugs Bill was placed on our table before we asked for it

We came on Saturday night a group of 7 of us after Akbars was too busy  The restaurant was reasonably busy but still lots of tables available  The food was really excellent Everyone really enjoyed their food and the service was speedy and professional except it was completely service without a smile The guy serving us was an older man and he was really efficient but just very cold No time for a smile or to make you feel welcome which was a real shame as despite the food being amazing and the restaurant being really nice we would probably not return as we just didn t feel at all welcome  Very sad as we are the type of group to return time after time to restaurants we like and when the bill came to just under 200 I assume that would be good business

the place itself is really nice and greatly decorated the food is average and the drinks arent so bad however the atmosphere is completely dead nevertheless it was quite hard to find a waiter for service we were shocked that a place with not so many customers was finding it difficult to still provide service i may still try it once more but if it fails to provide again wont be returning

Went with a group of friends on my recommendation and was rather disappointed Desperately wanted to enjoy the experience but it was frankly very ordinary I believe there has been a change of ownership according to their website and on this showing it s not for the better Some of the dishes were a bit tired particularly my Char Siu and my friends Singapore Noodles The website says that they re now cooking using a healthier style with less additives  I don t want to be flippant but I think I d like the additives back please To balance the criticism the Crispy Aromatic Duck starter was fine and extra pancakes weren t a problem Portions were generous  The wine list was simply a joke The list itself was fine a good selection including quality French and Italian red wines as well as the usual new world offerings The problem was that they simply didn t have most of them In the end I had to ask the waitress to tell us which wines they did have rather than what wasn t available  On the plus side the setting in a Grade 1 listed building is lovely and the staff couldn t have been more friendly and attentive The cost was 30 a head including drinks which isn t too expensive especially for Burford  Maybe we just got there on an off day but this has been and could be much better

Dined here with family The place is very friendly and a very good location just up from the Green in Southwold Service was very good but the food was a bit hit and miss I can understand how it has mixed reviews Our main course and dessert were very good but the starter was just a disaster prawn tempura  I would go there again as I think they are on the right track

Good priced pub grub in a converted cinema The premises except for family section to the side are rather dark and a little dingy Good parking at the Rear in Essex Street  Free for 2 hours  Staff were polite and food served within 5 10 minutes
Food great but portions are small if you do not have chicken for the price its a treat rather than a regular venue

We tried it out whist staying in a neighbouring B&B on a Sunday night The food was delicious we both had a roast but took forever to arrive which seems a bit of a shame given the restaurant was less then half full I found a piece of tinfoil in my food which the waitress or perhaps she was the manageress didn t seem overly concerned about  That said the Hungarian waiter was very friendly and coped very well with the awkward lady on the table behind us It s seems there are some management issues but the staff clearly work hard and go out of their way to make you feel welcome I d give it another go

I cant say I was in total awe of the place  all in all  quite average I think the waitresses looked great and added a bit to the authenticity of the place Food was slow coming but was good when it did arrive It has a the chance of being something so much more without too much more effort Will go back again for sure but certainly wouldn t be a weekly venue for me
The staff are very quick to remove plates and glasses as soon as a dish is finished  this doesn t make for a very relaxing experience

Second visit when in London Great location just off Regent Street Good welcome and staff attentive Food very agreeable a touch overpriced and the wine too but it s London  Don t think Piccolino s will disappoint but there is plenty of choice nearby so they have to keep on their toes to stay ahead of the pack Would we return probably

Me and my partner chose to eat here when visiting Padstow I couldn t eat mine as the burger wasn t good and I rarely leave food let alone a burger  My partner had a fish which was lovely  The chips were cold but in the defence of the pub I overheard a man stressing that staff were off sick  Dog friendly which was lovely and nice quirky little pub to drink in no doubt I m sure there was some upstairs part but unsure
After reading reviews I was surprised that the experience we had wasn t excellent Food was ok but there is much better customer focused cafe  bistros in Norwich

Not having been here for quite some time Not much to shout about wait not to long Shown to table placed order Then told no Gammon Got our salad from the bar only to realise that there was no Cutlery to eat it with Not a great start

I d just found my evening accommodation at a fishing lodge and needed something to eat I saw Pizza Express near the car park in the centre of Bicester but thought I d explore a bit before eating Sure enough there was an independent Italian restaurant Having been seated I was finally served my drink and totally ignored Yet there were only 12 people in there 5 minutes later I was on my way back to Pizza Express It took just 30 seconds before a genuinely friendly waitress welcomed me and showed me a table 3 courses and a glass of white set me back 26 50 including ice cream which tasted of real chocolate and real vanilla A very predictable meal with no surprises Why didn t I leave a tip My salad came served on a warm plate It was June When the waitress asked if everything was all right I mentioned my preference for a cold plate with a chilled salad She told me she would mention it to the Chef - leaving me to reflect that as she had brought it to me she must have felt that the plate was warm

Had some light bites for lunch here recently baguette and a kids meal the portion sizes were average and the quality average for a chain pub like this If you ve gone to similar pubs before you know exactly what you re going to get

I have visited on several occasions and it s difficult to sum up I have had some good experiences particularly the Sunday carvary but also some dreadful ones particularly when waiting for 45 minutes only to be told they d lost my order

Stopped here for lunch by chance when looking for a nearby 4x4 distributor so opinion not swayed by the mixed reviews on TripAdvisor for the Hotel part of this inn Pub has a traditional look which is fine but that shouldn t stand in the way of freshening everything up a bit - it is amazing how many pubs still appear to have smoke-stained ceilings years after the smoking ban came in -the male toilets in particular were pretty shabby Not suggesting that they change image just try harder with the cleaning and maintenance and give the place a lick of paint occasionally Lunch-time food menu was quite extensive something to suit most people I would have thought My partner had the fish-cake starter as a main course after asking the waiter how big the fish-cake main dish was - it was the right choice as the portion was more than ample My Caesar salad was also a very good portion size with plenty of well-cooked and tasty chicken although for the purists there may have been a few too many non-traditional ingredients The staff were pleasant and attentive service not exactly speedy when there were few customers but within an acceptable time for a leisurely lunch With a drink each the total bill was under 25 so nothing there to grumble about - food would have got a Very Good but the shabby d€÷cor reduced overall score to an Average

We arrived dead on time as we often do to be told that the restaurant was running a little behind and would we mind waiting at the bar for ten minutes If you know me you don t  you ll be well aware you re not that the bar is my home from home and this news came as a great delight As ten minutes crept towards fifteen and many subtle hand gestures and less than subtle come-hither looks in the barman s direction later we were finally blessed with two glasses of unspectacular but very drinkable red wine  As fifteen minutes approached twenty a waitress informed us that our table was ready and offered to carry the wife s glass to the table before her I was more than capable of carrying my own apparently Bit sexist  We ordered our starter and it was aMEZEing Plus it only took the staff 10 minutes to realise we might need some glasses with our bottle of tap water Being well dressed respectable sorts we were hardly likely to swig it from the bottle like a pair of Neanderthals  For the main I ordered the duck but I was dreaming I was dreaming of the steak She ordered the ravioli and the realisation that I no longer love her hit me like a heavyweight s uppercut  Minutes after the mains had arrived the apologetic knife and fork man made his first and only appearance of the night  How do you expect them to eat without their knives and forks  he barked at the waitress He then set our cutlery down Incredibly he intuitively knew that we were both left handed despite it coming as news to the both of us One job knife and fork man One job  In all the food was very good - the only qualm I had was that the right hand side of my mashed potato was under seasoned However the left hand side was doubly salty so it all evens out The ravioli In the face of such blank and unaffectionate glares I dared not to ask  The cheeseboard was the cheeseboard That s really all I have to say about that  All in all a silly and clumsy night customer service wise However it had a certain indefinable foolish charm to it The hapless staff though most notable for their haplessness seemed like a bunch of jolly good eggs and the food was not half bad It was half good  Oh and a special mention for the incredible candle rotation they have going on Throughout the evening we were treated to no fewer than four different candles Ruddy marvellous

We popped in for a quick meal before we headed off to Wymondham for a theatre evening The staff were friendly and helpful The atmosphere pleasant with a large fire spreading a warm and pleasant feeling There were four of us and me and my wife had a vegetable curry dish I thought the parsnips were slightly undercooked but my wife was happy and liked them a bit crunchy  One of our friends had chicken and he loved it His wife had a Haddock dish fish cake and she was very happy too All together with one glass of wine and 1 1 2 pint of Adnam s Broadside the bill came to 50 which we thought was acceptable They didn t charge for my glass of tap water

Group of 7 of us went for a birthday meal here on a Saturday night food was great and the cocktails were nice Although a lot of ice  Only problem was the service food took a good 25-30 minutes for our food Good atmosphere if you don t mind a bit of noise Definitely try and get a seat outside as the fold away metal roof is pretty cool

I did ponder for a bit before calling the three star rating because on paper it seems a bit damning especially in the context of a raft of 5 star reviews recently and we went this weekend so I d like to start by pointing out I don t think 3 is bad it s just average which to be honest reflects my overall experience and that s also with consideration to other 4 and 5 star experiences I ve rated  The restaurant seemed to be buzzing and I was a little disappointed to end up at a table in what seemed like a quiet alcove with about 4 other tables in there I didn t get to grips with the layout of place to work out if it was all like that but it just felt a little out of the way Perhaps I could have said something to get another table but tend to go with what I m given At the same time I can completely see if you don t speak up you don t give anyone the chance to address the point  We went for the sharing menu and of the 3 mezes we particularly enjoyed the fig and ricotta salad the texture of the cheese was lovely and the flavours all married together very well I also enjoyed the colour and tastes of the beets potato and parsnip spiced rostis For main I chose the coconut curry and while the flavours were all there I found the texture a little claggy for my liking The accompanying crunchy fresh papaya mango and cashew salad got its crunch from copious amounts of celery - just about the only vegetable I really don t like It may or may not have changed my choice I might have asked them to hold the celery but as a big part of the salad surely it s worth a mention on the menu  I did try and have it but a few mouthfuls and I just picked it out in the end  I was pretty full at this stage but the assiette of chocolate was delicately presented and delivered a range of chocolately treats without overfilling at the end  Service was slow That s something I rarely encounter as I enjoy a laid back unrushed evening as much as the next man but it did drag not the night or the company   but the flow of service to the point where we were sat with empty plates and empty glasses longer than I would normally expect to have to Partly this was due to the newness of the waiter I m sure and he was a lovely guy I just think he will benefit from some time in the role to settle in and scan for signs menus closed means we re ready to order empty glasses probably means we d like to be asked if we want another drink and perhaps a more experienced fellow staff member could keep a watchful eye out and help with that learning process It did feel like there was a nice vibe amongst the staff and I probably could have brought any of this up there and then and it would have been met with courteous consideration but I didn t want that to define my night All in all we were in there almost two hours where an unrushed meal of that nature would generally take about 90 minutes in comparison to similar evenings  I m deliberately calling out these things in a picky way because this is a review site after all and I genuinely hope the feedback will help I still had a fine night out just that it happened to be a bit more middle of the road than other reviewers experienced
Great service lovely staff very welcoming Food is OK but it s SO expensive It s not worth the money

The starters came out and were very nice unfortunately things went downhill from there When the mains arrived the starter plates had not been removed and so we had to pitch in on the waiting front We all had burgers which were cold with cold onion rings and cold fries Also no vinegar or HP sauce We were on two tables and unfortunately the two tables didn t arrive at the same time and there was only our party of 10 in the whole place  The desserts arrived and they were still frozen If the service could be improved a bit I think the place could be top notch

I visited in the last week and it was suh quiet night that a member of staff invited our party through to the restaurant before the booked time It is a charming building with a nice atmosphere albeit there were only about 8 diners max that evening Our waitress was charming but not very clued up didn t remember who had order what and failed to top up glasses form the wine in a ice bucket out of our reach No condiments until we asked for them although there were some on other tables so it wasn t house policy  Food was nice but not wow fabulous the smoked salmon starter was perfect in consistency just not as much flavour as I expected The steak however was spot on for a medium steak but the accompanying vegetables were few and not very flavoursome the sauce on the potatoes was ok but didn t add much  If I had been paying I would have been more disappointed As it was the company was great but the service wasn t up to scratch and the food was mostly good but as other reviewers have noted quite bland

Had a Christmas meal at Haz Restaurant for 9 The service was good and speedy The food was prepared well and tasted good We ordered from the set Christmas menu which had 3 different options at different prices All in all a good dining experience but tilted slightly on the pricey side for what you get

This was not our first time at The Architect but it seemed not as good as previously The beer was still excellent and the wine was quite acceptable but the food was a little disappointing a couple of small bones in the fish fillets and the rump steaks were a little chewy

I have previously written in glowing terms about the Queen at Dennington but it seems to have changed and not for the better I had won ton dumplings as a first course Whereas the Chinese steam won tons these were baked and crisp and did not have much flavour My main course was plaice which was seriously overcooked A friend had risotto which was good and two others had fish and chips which they liked although the portions were enormous Tiramisu was on the dessert menu and I was able to place this one in the top 20 of my world survey of Tiramisu

We were a party of over 20 From the Christmas Menu I had Prawn Cocktail Lamb & Apple Pie Yes I am over 65 I have had many Prawn Cocktails over the years and this was the worst I can remember I do not think some shredded lettuce with what I can only describe as bits of prawn on top with a zig zag of sauce is acceptable unless the aim is to save money The lamb was good but the vegetables very plain but acceptable Those who were served first had to wait for the vegetables until we all had our main course luckily I was one of the last Things looking up until the Apple Pie and custard The pie tasted good but the pastry was     as if it had been micro waved Drink prices were acceptable for a restaurant Staff tried their best to cope with a large party As the restaurant is divided into sections I could not count the number of diners however in our section there were only 1 couple I understand that this restaurant is attached to the Highland Restaurant in Broxbourne which I have frequented many times over the years Perhaps I was looking forward to the same food and was simply disappointed
Really Great Value for money full of taste  great staff and a pleasant the service is fast and there is no waiting around these people no how to look after there staff  i shall return

Great english waterfront olde worlde pub so ambience great Good selection of beers and wines Menu however has been shrunk in content so not a great choice For a waterfront restaurant I expect fresh fish on the menu and the only choice was fish and chips not exciting The fish was fresh but neither cod not haddock and had little taste This was our third visit so after 3 mediocre meals I decided to make this review

My girlfriend and I visited the Hogget for a nice meal out after reading good reviews online The ambience in the pub is nice - it was quiet when we first arrived but filled up nicely during the night The serving staff were fairly busy throughout the night but still had time for us if we stopped them - perhaps a little more attentiveness would have been appreciated  The food itself was nice - my girlfriend had a nice fish dish whilst I had the burger which was tasty but a little dry The real ale was good including a good Rugby World Cup Special  We might return here but with plenty of other pubs to try nearby it won t be top of the list

Not a bad pub Three ales on tap and good service The asian food was quite nice Nothing wrong really just lacking a little something I suspect it would be quite popular with students as it is reasonably cheap the serving sizes are huge and it has a cheerfulness about it  Nothing wrong necessarily just not enough standout qualities to rate 4 stars

Went here couple of months ago with friends wasn t impressed reserved our seats got there on time and had to stand up for half an hour to be seated Once we was seated ordered food it came i had lasagne and chilli garlic bread as a starter food was average at best Best part was the chilli garlic bread Much prefer Spaghetti House in the same area
Disappointed with the food and offhand service compared with previous visits The food quality varied depending upon the choices made by the ten guests in the party
Food was ok but the greeting from the landlord was pretty grim Very dour faced Not a place to go to for a smile well he did smile when I paid the bill Not going back not at all

We went there for an evening meal and ordered our drinks first My wife had a lemonade my son a pint and we ordered our meals We wanted the special deal a meal for 2 with a bottle of wine for 20 The lemonade and beer arrived but no wine I asked the waitress where it was and the reply was we haven t got any red wine  A discussion with the boss found that there were several bottles of red just no Malbec left Food was good but please train your staff more

I found the service to be efficient rather than friendly with our food arriving with little delay The decor is a little dated with very bright lighting The food was excellent with good portion sizes presented well and tasting exactly as it should do

Went for a late lunch with the family on Christmas Eve We had a look in the nearby Wetherspoons but there every table was taken so we decided to try this restaurant which we had been to once before in the evening and not been impressed with but I would never condemn a place on the basis of one poor performance It was a mixed bag We arrived and despite the restaurant being less than half full a product I suspect of the poor reputation the establishment has gained since opening  were told that he would have to wait 5 minutes for a table and up to 40 minutes for our food No problem though we would have a drink from the bar first I noted before that if you had to wait for a table there was nowhere particularly to do that This situation has only been changed by the unpopularity of the venue meaning we could sit at a table near the bar The bar is somewhat limited 4 bitters two of them McMullens 4 lagers we noticed they didn t stock J2O s I selected McMullens AK which was okay if uninspiring I was there with my partner and our 2 teenage daughters I note that all three had difficulty getting off the high stools at the table near the bar After a few minutes we were shown to a booth The delay was even harder to explain when the waitress had to wipe the table for us Why the 5 minute wait menus were ready waiting for us The restaurant has a pizza oven and a griddle which seems to dictate it s menu options The children wanted starters and we chose garlic mushrooms and chicken wings with a barbecue sauce For mains my partner and I chose steak my oldest a penne dish and my youngest rotisserie chicken The starters arrived rather slowly considering it had emptied even more in the meantime The mushrooms were supposedly cooked in a garlic and cheese sauce and came with dough balls They arrived in a skillet on a wooden platter with the doughballs on the platter It s a simple dish which makes it puzzling why they couldn t do a better job when not under pressure The doughballs were burnt on one side and the mushrooms were covered in a cheese sauce of a very strange consistency with no hint of garlic once you removed some of the mushrooms it was apparent that there was a pool about 1cm deep of oil in the bottom see photo  The chicken wings were simply cooked in an oven with a dish of barbecue sauce on the side It was adequately done but then it required no cooking ability whatsoever Within an acceptable time our mains arrived I had asked for my steak medium-rare and was pleased with the chefs effort at this I do find that chefs often have difficulty with this even though it should be simple My steak wasn t the best quality but was thick and when I cut into it released a little blood onto the plate I know some people find that horrible but it s the way I like steak I had a mushroom and stilton top to this bizarrely it came in a little jug and consisted of small whole mushrooms in a stilton sauce which was very nice My oldest enjoyed her pasta it came without cheese as requested but again there was little garlic and with olives should have been in the singular My youngest reported that the rotisserie chicken was very dry but I accept that this is partly a product of the cooking process chosen In summary I enjoyed my main course but there was something to criticise in virtually everything else The service was slow for the number of covers being ordered but front of house were certainly adequate I think the impression I took away was that the organisation had reduced staff possibly because of falling sales rather than address the problems which have been highlighted in reviews on here Would I eat here again Maybe but I think the only reason this place will survive is the lack of competition in a small town I don t think it would fare well in a city
as stated food not bad but bad customer service whats up with wroxham it used to be a lovelly place family friendly and don t use barnes barn craft boats dirty management anti people

Slightly disappointing in that while the fish and chips was excellent the topping on the pzzas was rather sparse for the money I had the duck which was really tasty and well cooked but not a lot of it
