I visited this restaurant with my girlfriend last week We were very much looking forward to our meal after reading previous reviews We were greeted on arrival very pleasantly by front of house and shown to our table which was nicely set in the restaurant which is an old converted cinema The young lady who was our waitress for the evening was very pleasant and took our order efficiently Some of the food was very nice but other parts were average I had the rump steak for main which was nicely cooked but the home made chips were probably the worst I have ever tasted and were drowned in salt The peppercorn steak sauce was also not particularly tasty I did actually explain after leaving the chips that I didn t enjoy them when the chap form front of house asked me if everything was satisfactory He was very helpful and told me that he would remove them from the bill however when it came to pay the bill I was then told that because the chips were part of the steak dish they could not be removed  The atmosphere and setting of the restaurant is very nice but myself and my girlfriend agreed that we had experienced much nicer meals for a lot less money
All regular from frosen seafood carrots onion and tastless bell peppers Not exciting

Called in for lunch whilst being shown aroun Exeter Quays Inside tables were busy and as it was sunny we sat outside Service was good and there was a good range of drinks & food on the menu I ordered the ham sandwich will 2 in our group had the smoked cheese and chutney I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich and the bread was lovely However both who had the cheese though that the smokiness of the chees was overpowering and ruined the sandwich Sitting outside was pleasant until a pneumatic drill opened up on the premises next door We finished quickly and left  So a bit of a mixed experience

Popped in for a meal with my 7yr old grandaughter & wife and we were not dissapointed We didn t have to wait long before we were approached by Lynda waitress who did a superb job of looking after us The meal was excellent value for money  32 11 for two main meals and two rounds of drinks and we will be returning

Nice city pub just across the road from Waterloo station can get busy but a good choice of ales await you Large screen tv s for sport are dotted around the pub if that floats your boat Food is good basic pub grub If you are delayed use this place rather than the overpriced rubbish in the station

We went for a family Sunday lunch to the Ashcott Inn On arrival the restaurant area was very cold but nice and the table was well laid out There was a good selection of food on the menu and we placed our order The food did take quite a while to arrive and when it did it was served in several stages with no effort being made to collect the menus which had just been left all over the table The Pork meal was served without the apple sauce and was swimming in luke-warm gravy and the bread sauce failed to arrive with one of the turkey lunches ordered I had opted for the Turkey lunch but the stuffing that came with it was stone cold I did complain to the waitress who apologised and took my food away I waited quite a while for it to be returned and this time my stuffing was nice and hot However it would appear that whilst they were waiting for my replacement stuffing the rest of the meal had been left to cool down and was now only luke-warm Several other meals were also served with cold elements The menu for the Turkey lunch also stated  with pigs in blankets   but it should state  pig in a blanket   as I only got one very small one as did the rest of our party We did select Desserts after our main meal and we waited a long time for these to be served In fact they were only brought out after we queried where they were and in total we waited over half an hour Also in the disabled toilet there were no hand drying facilities and although this was brought to the staff s attention nothing was done to rectify this After reading so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor regarding the Ashcott Inn I can only say that our visit there was a real let-down and very disappointing We will not be rushing back in the near future

Booked and arrived for dinner with friends at 8pm Friday evening Very busy always a good sign but unfortunately our table was not yet ready It happens no problem We were invited to have a drink at the bar this restaurant is not set up to allow for people to stand and have a drink at the bar there simply isn t the space Another booking turned up and was forced to wait in the doorway until we had been seated at which point they then squeezed into the bar area   Seated and the table had obviously been cleaned however the tablecloth was soaking again made aware to the waiter and was dealt with swiftly and effectively The waiters were very friendly and gave a great detail on the dishes on offer they seemed to know what was being served and made some good recommendations  Starters served in a reasonable time as were the main courses the food was fantastic we all tried each others dishes and no one was disappointed Unfortunately the service began to falter we had to ask repeatedly for drinks on several occasions and when asking for the bill had the same experience The bill was delivered and despite the restaurant being much quieter by this stage we had to ask a number of times to actually pay All in all great food and the service started well just a shame it wasn t seen through and when leaving we got the feeling they were glad the evening was over rather than the warm welcome we received upon arrival
Great location good service and a good carvery but on my last 3 visits the beef has been very tough Stick to the turkey or go somewhere else

Made a takeaway order from here in May  General selection of starters got lamb chops and a chilli chicken dish for main  All reasonable quality - lamb was a wee bit tough but the flavour was there  Chilli chicken dish looked full of food coloring and was- chilli powder hot as opposed fresh chilli hot but thats the only mionor complaint really  Service was very quick and came with a little party pack of wet wipe toothpick and chocolate which was a nice touch

They tried to recreate a Brazilian atmosphere in Sheffield which is nice Unfortunately the meat prices here in UK are not compatible with a full rodizio service with unlimited fresh ramp steaks for everybody for example making some cuts to be a bit dry not freshly cooked on grill  I went in a Sunday roast lunch with only 7 cuts So could be a bit of unlucky Anyway A nice experience if you like beef otherwise it would be a bit expensive About the salad bar the best feijoada so far in UK Far better prepared than the cuts made me remember Brazilian food

This is a typical Morrisons Cafe The food you get is pre-packaged frozen and there is little freshly made so the quality is much the same as any other supermarket cafe Breakfasts are the best value lunches are ok and light snacks and sandwiches are cheap but fine as a filler The problem I have with this particular cafe is the staff As with most Morrisons you order at the front of the cafe wander past the sandwiches and cakes and pay at the end of the counter At this particular cafe it s very hit and miss whether the order point is manned or not I have stood there sometimes for 15 minutes before a member of staff appears only to be told order at the till  Why dont they put a sign out to tell you this  I always buy a black coffee here and recently noticed there are two machines serving black coffee One is 1 29 and the other is 1 39 Upon reaching the till on this particular occasion I enquired what was the difference between the two coffee s only to be greeted with a very smug member of staff who happily informed me  the price   what a smug little git   Now if this were a new member of staff or a scruffy straight out of school oink I could understand it but this tall giraffe-like male has been there for some time Last week I stood at the front of the queue and was served by the same `oink` This time despite a large queue of people behind me he suddenly and without saying a word walked away from the till towards the kitchen I stood there for 5 to 10 minutes wondering what was going on along with the rest of the ever growing queue before he returned and carried on as if nothing had happened no explanation no apologies nothing  This man is rude smug obnoxious and a pain in the proverbial He looks as if he doesn t want to be there and makes that fairly obvious The other members of staff have a similar attitude and approach although he is the worst offender  Surely it is up to the manager to ensure the till s are manned at all times and although the food is of average standard this is no excuse for customers to be treated as `average` people  we re not cattle The food is ok the staff are lousy

Decides to visit after reading tripadvisor reviews Place is well presented and menu options are good I had phoned in advance about a 50 percent off deal being advertised via discount apps on my iPhone and found the same offer advertised on their website They said its no problem and mentioned nothing else On arrival I confirmed that we had the booking with the discount only to be told we needed to come on a Monday or Tuesday which has not been advertised on the app or mentioned by them when we booked for that evening 1 hour in advance  We were immediately irritated by this and the excuse given was that we needed to have a taste card with us or come again on a Monday or Tuesday This is amazingly silly and does not make for a good impression at all we decided to stay none the less The food came and one pizza came without a topping as advertised It was quickly resolved with a generous side portion of rocket  The rest of the meal went well the bill came and of course without any discount  Service charge has already been applied at around 12 percent or so we gave 3 twenty point notes for a 56 pound bill only for the waitress manager to immediately enter entire amount into the till and carry on with her work Amazingly rude and unprofessional There was no way we were paying around 20 percent top given we had initially expected to take advantage of their 50 percent off deal and the service reall wasn t good enough to justify any more than the obligatory 10 percent So we had to awkwardly ask for our change A really sad experience given the reviews In all honesty I think the main issue was the relatively low quality of English spoken by the staff which led to a number of small mistakes and confusions Nevermind

Had a Tesco voucher to use so called in early in the evening We used the early menu two courses for about 11 We were attended to by the waitress and we re pleased with how she dealt with us The two starters were value for the money  I ordered the bacon salad which the wife had as she didn t like her smoked salmon starter wheni it arrived We had the chicken and chips for a main course but unfortunately we did not read the menu sufficiently and didn t realised it came flatten with bread crumbs Our fault Place was quite empty probably due to time of year and time of day Unfortunately we were not that impressed with the choice on the main menu and will not be returning until we can see a better choice on the menu

Went for dinner with a large group and while they generally coped well with the number of meals the quality of the food was rather mixed The majority were extremely happy with their food particularly the lobster however the steaks were very problematic The taste was excellent however both were extremely underdone - one that was meant to be medium was closer to blue and both were extremely chewy and difficult to cut I ve always had great meals here in the past so hopefully this was a blip and I will certainly be back

We have visited many times over the years improvements have been made new kitchen ect The meals are good but the tables are cramped and very sticky for the Real Ale people this is possibly a plus but for people having a meal it s a bit off putting

After an initial excellent visit to the Dairy Maid with friends a couple of months ago we returned with my Brother and Partner who are over from New Zealand We chose Censi s as we left it too late to get in Fresco s or The Colosseum  Teignmouths other Italian restaurants  We booked a table upstairs and very nice the newly decorated place looks too but that is a far as the good goes Two out of the four meals were average and the Pizza really bad We shared Bruschetta as a starter which as another reviewer has commented on was soaked in oil with large chunks of garlic distributed about it The main meals were Carbonara which was described as gloopy risotto which was tasteless plus a pizza which is new on the menu and was just awful Fortunately my Marco s tagliatelle and chicken special was really good as it was on my our first visit  I do not like leaving bad reviews but Tripadvisor cannot exist only on good reviews and we did write to the restaurant letting them know that the food offered the previous evening was not great Up until now we have not heard back from them which is another disappointment  If I were visiting Teignmouth and wanted dinner in an Italian restaurant I would go to either Fresco s or The Colloseum both of which are excellent I will be keeping an eye on the reviews for Censi s to see what the general consensus is re their pizzas If I were them I would take them back off the menu as they are a real letdown  If however they improve we will be back because apart from anything it is handy for the the new theater and the excellent bar The View within it

This being the first place I came across when visiting chester appeared rather trendy from the outside however the story was to be different inside Upon sitting down the place felt claustrophobic almost as if it was trying to cater for too many people at once the seating almost bumps in the adjacent tables seating on one such occasion my partners chair was nudged buy another customer squeezing past The food that was ordered was ok but it didn t seem to really have the WOW factor that was expected The visit was made particularly unpleasant by the noisy barrage of buses and the occasional hint of diesel fumes that enter in when the door is opened and closed The decor is the only real area that doesn t fault It was an unpleasant trip and I shall be seeking other places in and around Chester to eat

Arrived at a rapidly filling-up restaurant for a reserved lunchtime table Hurriedly shown to a table by a waitress who rushed off to the kitchen to bring out food for another table 10 mins later we were given a menu just as we were contemplating leaving and a drinks order taken Another 10 mins passed before the drinks arrived again just as we were contemplating leaving but no offer to take a food order which was taken by the boss a few mins later  Entire restaurant served by two inexperienced and frankly scruffy waitresses Young barman kept coming I asking for coffees from the big silver machine for bar patrons the girls had to deal with that as well as serve the entire restaurant on their own  The food took another half an hour to arrive but when it did it was pretty good Not outstanding but not too bad either Portions were small for what they charged A small side order of petit pois came at 4 if you please  how much is a bag of peas  Overall impression was scruffy inexperienced overworked and panicking staff which spoilt the atmosphere Eating out should be about the entire package - and calm experienced and smart staff will enhance the experience for customers Shame all it would have taken was a bit more professionalism and an extra body and I d be giving them a much higher rating As it is I ll probably not bother going back as there are too many other good places on their doorstep  I d hazard a guess that their location on the main road to Sissinghurst Castle & Gardens means they get a lot of non-repeat customers and so they are not overly bothered by giving their customers a reason to return Locals will drink in the bar where they serve their pizzas Can t comment on that as I haven t experienced it but overall the restaurant just makes 5 10

Firstly who am I to really judge a restaurant over its fine cuisine credentials I haven t been to enough of them to know what s good and what s not so good So writing this almost 4 weeks after the event should be a lot more of a sober assessment as what I remember should provide a good acid test of the restaurant s lasting effect Well I remember leaving the establishment satisfied as the two courses were enough for me and my friend I remembering the waiter babbling on in English with a very French accent about the soup and wine whilst introducing us to the menu I don t think I m a Phillistine but even an initial have you dined with us before question would have teed up the service to us nicely because no assumption should have been made about what we knew and didn t know about the restaurant and fine dining After getting a good feel from the website I would have thought carrying on that feel in the approach and service to the customers would be spot on Don t misunderstand me - the only thing I would actually mark them down on is the dimly lit restaurant as I have this pervasive memory of being seated in relative darkness But I also remember my cut of lamb being supremely succulent and tasty And as a representative of fine cuisine they did not disappoint in that regard at all However I haven t a lasting memory in the same way as I have with the few higher end restaurants that I ve experienced over the years so I ll stick with my average rating Besides it was the company that I kept that made the evening enjoyable as we laughed a lot at some of the shared observations we had Probably my partner in crime might view things differently but I stick with my final comment - room for improvement

I took my daughter to this restaurant and we were really looking forward to the good as the previous reviews were excellent  The meal was nice but not spectacular the atmosphere was none existent as it really quiet the service was excellent I don t mind the price but think the food should reflect this and to be honest it didn t  Shame but I will try it again soon

The Good Burgers are tasty and hearty with a limited-but-attuned choice of topping combinations The meat isn t overcooked nor is it mooing between the buns The fries are crispy hot and have just that perfect splash of salt to give them some added flavour  The Bad Now that Steak & Honour has a brick-and-mortar restaurant they need to move away from the street food van mentality that still seems prevalent in how they take and process orders There s no excuse for a gaggle of people waiting in front of the counter vis-a-vis Gwydir Street Hot Numbers when the van is serving out there Invest in a paging system that alerts customers when their order is ready Giving someone a ticket and stating  Oh it might be 10-25 minutes   doesn t cut it  The Ugly Part of the anticipation for S&H finally getting a restaurant was just that it was finally a restaurant A place to call their own and make their mark while also offering customers a comfortable dining experience Instead of creating a unique and enjoyable dining environment S&H s restaurant looks like a Mill Road kebab or chip shop Did the designer of Peri-Peri Chicken also design this place The tables look and feel like IKEA failures the walls are bland save for random pictures of people with burgers in their mouths the chairs wouldn t be out of place in a primary school recreation room the color scheme especially the stairs  is boringly simple and spartan  You have a restaurant now S&H it s not all just about the burgers and fries  All in all the quality of the food gives it the 3-stars It s a shame really because I ve been a frequent customer of the food vans at Hot Numbers & was hoping S&H would knock it out of the park with this new restaurant Instead they ve managed to do a boring corner kick that just elicits a polite applause

A nice pub that I have visited twice on a weekend recently The place is decked out with retro feel old flea shop paintings PVC banquettes and concrete tables It is spacious plenty of elbow room between tables and ambient music was pretty interesting selection The menu was standard revamped pub fare - burgers hot dogs mac and cheese nice roasts on the weekend Good coleslaw sides For the type of business John Salt is the food was great good portion sizes not too expensive Beers we also in good condition A lot of local drafts on tap local from Camden for example as well as international in the fridge imported from Hawaii for example  However on both times I visited the staff were either really nice friendly and helpful and others were completely sour - as if asking for a drink was impossible But again this place is whatever you call it - a pub  bar or boozer The owners probably don t want moody bar staff but there is more than often one in every place A pity I wouldn t go here for a special meal or any kind of gourmand experience I would go again for sure for a Sunday Roast  hair of the dog lunch on a Saturday  after shopping on Upper Street for a rest or suggest to the boyfriend as a place to meet for dinner to get him to pay because he will like the beer and I find the place comfortable and nice to look at

This is the second time I have dined at the Forbury Restaurant I have dined from the Market menu and the A La Carte and the food is really really nice Good wine menu and the restaurant looks great It all comes at a price though - they don t do the lemon sole in town  However there is something about the staff in there they are just not very friendly The first time I put it down to it just being a bad day The second time though and the experience my group experienced was just the same  I cant really put my finger on it other than to say they are polite but you do feel like you are causing an imposition of them each time they come and take your order A few more smiles and a anything else you need right now would just go someway to match the service to the price of the food  One other point I would make is if you book a table for later in the evening don t expect relaxed dining Our starter main and dessert came out quicker than McD s flips a burger We had gone through the three courses in under an hour

went yeaterday for the 3rd time previous 2 occasions have been good so recommended it to couple who came with us got seated ordred wing sampler having said how good it has been before they arrive thrown on the table just put on a tray with some dip the chicken they came from must have been anorexic not much meat and half were cold all 4 of us ordered ribs and pulled pork meal love ribs waitress took order but came back to tell us they were out of ribs  at 4pm  we reorderes chicken and pulled pork meal and pulled pork meal 20 mins later chicken and pork meal arrived 15 minutes later and still awaiting the 2 other mains we asked the waitress who had to retake our order manager came over when the 2 meals arrived and told us we would not be charged for them whilst he was there we sent back the onion rings which came out cold meantime people were being served ribs which they had apparently run out of food ok service is crap
We ordered from here for a quick lunch We purchased a cheeseburger each and chips Overall it was nice for something quick and easy However the staff could do with being a little happier

The atmosphere is good The staff is very good But the food wasn t great Just average But expensive So was the wine which wasn t great either Paid 20 odd quid for a bottle of Picpoul de Pinet which was harsh I mean the wine I had sausage and mash Sausages were very nice but the mash was very dry and I mentioned it to the staff My good lady had a steak which she liked but the veg were also dry and slightly over cooked Overall nice place but they need to improve the food in order to justify the prices Lovely garden outside though and we might try lunch there in the summer

The food was generally adequate although I ve had better hotpot in a little place in Manchester called The Rovers Return  The cheese was vile It looked and tasted like it had been hacked from the body of a decaying walrus They serve beer from a local brewery called Shires  It s the usual cabbage water stuff the bearded loons of CAMRA enjoy so much Not my cup of tea but I noticed an extremely drunken scotchman guzzling gallons of the stuff  The locals are as they say a rum bunch  I imagine the competition for the office of village idiot is very hotly contested
The place was nice in the sunshine Food ok for a pub service quite rapid I wouldn t think of going here for anything special

Having heard rave reviews I was expecting something great here In the end it was disappointingly mediocre For it s positives the burger was nice I love a brioche bun and the burgers were tasty and well cooked Less impressive were the warm not hot fries and the lack of sauces in the vicinity of my table Equally uninspiring was the milkshake For five pounds i wanted fresh strawberries mixed with nice ice cream What I effectively got was a small mcdonalds milkshake at 5 times the price For a modest double burger certainly not large by any stretch of imagination  fries and a very small milkshake my bill was 17  As other reviews have said value for money is not there and I think I would rather go to mcdonalds in future It may not do as nice burgers but the fries will be hot and the cost will be far friendlier to my wallet

food decent enough very quiet and lacking atmos and staff couldnt wait to cash up and get home at 2200 on a saturday at least that is how it felt as a customer if i was hungry and passing i would eat there but i probably won t be so there we are 4th meal out last week  lucky or unlucky me at this type of establishment and sad to report 4th out of 4 not bad not good two s and three s but averaged up to three

Having seen that Bombay Spice was rated No 1 for restaurants in sale our party of three just had to give it a try as we love the flavour and spiciness of Indian curries Bombay Spice is a lovely place to dine in clean tidy colourful very relaxing and with very efficient service We thoroughly enjoyed our popadums and chutney tray consisting of spiced onions a lovely mint sauce a delicious red sauce and the best chutney I ve tasted in years  However thereafter all food delivered was pretty tasteless One of our party had Sheek Kebab which was OK but the Vegetable Pakora was just two flat pancakes that were totally tasteless The Aloo Chat was similarly tasteless and we normally love Aloo Chat and Vegetable Pakora We hoped that the main course curries Shaslik Tikka Sizzling Balti Akbari Cham Cham and Lahori Sizzler Gosht would be an improvement in flavour but although the curry portions were very large they were totally lacking in flavour As for spiciness there simply wasn t any  not even on the Balti Akbari Cham Cham which carried a 3 chilli rating The food presented was definitely satisfying from a hunger point of view but the starters and main courses we had that evening were very disappointing from both flavour and spiciness viewpoints which is a shame as otherwise Bombay Spice looks a lovely place to dine Maybe we ve just been spoiled by the excellent curries we ve had elsewhere

We were staying at the nearby Travelodge so used this pub for both our evening meal on the Sunday night and for our breakfast the next day On both occasions it was raining so no one was using the garden or the balcony yet unusually for a J D Weatherspoon s the place was almost empty on the Sunday night and even emptier on Monday morning Given the location we would have liked to sit upstairs to enjoy the view but on the Sunday night there was a small group upstairs listening to loud music and on the following morning as soon as we sat down at a table we were informed that the upstairs was not open  Both meals were fine but the pint of Abbot that I had on Sunday night was the worst I ve ever had so I guess that this is not a pub where you want to order real ale  If you compare this to a similar one such as the Electric Elephant on Margate seafront you have to wonder why one is well patronised while the other is strugling to attract customers

We were hungry an required fodder but didn t fancy anything too heavy so we went for a lighter Italian menu avoiding pizza   We had a blueberry milkshake which was lovely and then a tuna salad and a tuna baked potato The food was very nice not too bad value and the restaurant was nice and clean Only down side why serve salad with no dressing and the lettuce was literally a leaf plonked on the plate No real thought to presentation That being said there was a half hour wait as they had obviously been caught out with the first real day of sunshine and were busy so maybe that explained the salad It was nice though and we would recommend this as a pit stop service ok food generally nice
Usually good food at all times but last visit had appallingly slow service which when dining with a young family has awful consequences Then when food did arrive only two of four meals arrived

Went here last night with a friend as he bigged it up was slightly dissatisfied with the long wait on being asked for a drink  Should that not be asked once I m sat  Beautiful decor and loved the atmosphere wanted to give 4* rating however the chicken was quite bland could do with a sauce  I gathered that they forgot the asparagus when taking the order as it didn t come out till we asked for it Was raw and only 4 pieces for 4 95 - basically 1 20 per piece wasn t impressed  Starter - the tiger prawns were fantastic I wanted to order dessert but decided against it due to poor sides  Will try again but not in a hurry

We had quite a nice meal - family of four eating standard fare - two kids burgers one steak one pasta Quality was OK and value reasonable but very slow to come out which sort of spoiled the evening Could not be bothered to stay for pudding Waitress was nice and did warn that there would be a wait because they were busy I never understand that - do they expect to not be busy   Anyway a 1 hour 20 minutes wait for the food was a bit too slow for us

We had had a rather exotic meal out the night before and were on our way home from a weekend away so a keep it simple burger didn t seem such a bad idea The recently developed complex of restaurants in Greenwich by the river includes this branch of Byron and of the riverside eateries it was the only one we hadn t tried Bit noisy as you might expect but friendly service and the food came fairly quickly although they were unable to provide my home made skin on chips because they had run out  Of course were these really remotely home made they could have simply made some more but no matter Trouble was the french fries replacement were incredibly bog standard I should have followed my son who had crispy courgette which were quite impressive reminiscent of tempura Very disappointed also when I saw the very standard looking bun Bread has improved massively in this country over the last few years so why can t an upmarket burger bar provide a bun that doesn t stick to the roof of your mouth Oh and my burger was cold Is that normal I ll have another in a couple of years an find out Maybe

Pleasant surrounding and staff food was OK Be careful if you eat outside the seagulls knocked my plate and drinks off while both my wife and child were sat at the table other that we have enjoyed a few meals there

We visited here as a family of 6 - two children and the out laws After being told our food would be a 45 minute wait we decided to stick it out as we were all hungry AND it was drizzling outside I ordered the salt and pepper squid which arrived after 20 minutes along with my wife s fish and chips After a few minutes of eating the chips which were cold  the waitress came back over and asked for my wife s food back as it was destined for someone else  I got stuck into my squid actually very nice before she decided that needed to go back too An hour after ordering the rest of the food arrived - as did my second squid It was obvious that we weren t the only ones disappointed with the service judging by the barrage of abuse the bar staff were getting from other hungry customers patiently waiting for food is there anything worse than being angry-hungry - I think not   London Inn you would ve got a 1 had the food not arrived hot and actually very tasty Sort your customer service out

We were looking forward to fish and chips at Mark s having enjoyed our meal when we were last in the area a couple of years ago but have to say the fish was a disappointment tasteless and watery my wife had cod and i had the haddock but both pieces were not what you would expect chips were fine though wouldn t return sadly

The photo is incorrect This is a little locals pub set in a churchyard on the outskirts of Worcester Good for a well-kept pint and simple wholesome food I agree with previous comments about the excellent ham egg chips

Food and service was average We had the set dinner lamb and chicken main courses Portions were too small however meat was tasty Service was too slow the waitress who deal with us had no smiling face I thought she did not want any more customers when we got to the restaurant Dessert options were too limited for the set menu They can improve better

I d like to give this 3 5 stars for this visit There was a lot to like and I suspect that we were a bit unlucky There was a very large group of young girls and I mean 8 9 year-old young which was a bit weird and *very* noisy Apart from them we seemed to be the only customers  There was only one person serving the owner I guess but no complaints about the quality of service Between the two of us we had 5 tapas selections pimentos al padrone bruschetta not sure of the Spanish name  whitebait calamari and kidneys in sherry The pimentos were really excellent Gia thought they were as good as any we d ever had The bruschetta was tasty The whitebait and kidneys were OK but the calamari were very disappointing  Portions were quite substantial That s one of the problems with tapas between two  Discounting our unhappiness with some of the food the meal was good value  We *might* go back but probably only with more than two people  Parking was a pain We found a spot in a side road 5-7 minutes away but only after driving around for about 10 minutes looking It s hard to know what evenings might be like

Whilst it s great living in a village with it s own Chinese restaurant it s a shame that the food is often 2-3 more expensive per dish than others in nearby Wallongford or Didcot meaning it can be cheaper to travel to those towns and eat  There is an extensive menu and food quality is generally good As the villages only Chinese it is often busy and it does seem that service suffers when this is the case Certainly when we went it felt like an eternity between courses  and we had to chase up our drinks order
Went last night and there was one poor guy serving about 30 people the wait for food was 45min there is just not enough staff on duty I left as i could not get served

Took my other half on a date night after reading good reviews Place looks nice and was quite busy Our mezze starter was decent and the spicy hummous was tasty Unimpressed with the service No one really smiled or paid us much attention they weren t that busy  We were told to give them the nod 10 minutes before we wanted our main course I did so and our food arrived 20 seconds later Had it been waiting Just a bit off As was the service in general I wouldn t go back there for a romantic meal

I forgot to mention that two of our party ordered a sweet that was on the blackboard to be told it was not available and the suggestion to perhaps remove the item from the board was not taken up for some reason altogether a disappointing evening
staff ok lunch well had set lunch pate to start not bad next chicken never had so many bones in one meal

For views going up the Shard etc 5* For a restaurant 3* The setting is truly stunning of course and we went on a glorious sunny morning for breakfast The menu is limited and we went for the safe bet of Eggs Benedict which was ok with good quality ingredients although the Hollandaise did have a skin formed where it had sat on the pass for too long Listen we went for the views we got the views As a destination experience of the Shard 5*
Quaint idea for a pub but unfortunately far too small almost impossible to get a seat and overpriced
One of the better Cote restaurants I have been to Overall my seven friends and I had an enjoyable evening here Service was attentive food tasty wine reasonably prices Well done Guildford

I went to the Naked Turtle in Sheen a few days ago - on a Thursday night - with about 12 colleagues for a retirement dinner The venue looks good The music was lovely but then it went a bit downhill We were put into the conservatory on separate tables The barstaff was quite rude and the waitresses were not far behind on that score The food was average and overpriced The menu very limited It was very dark so it was difficult to see what one was eating Beware If you book as a group and some people don t turn up you will have to pay for their meal - company policy and it is on their website It was one of those evenings you regret I don t think it works as a restaurant as the set up didn t feel very professional to me Maybe better as a jazz bar I would certainly not go back
Sandwiches tend to be nice however they struggle with larger orders Ask for no fat each time comes with fat  if you cant make without fat then tell me and I wont order

Group of 10 of us for dinner We ate off of the 75 per head set menu The service was good and the food and was nice with some of the dishes being exquisite  The interior is modern and chic and well laid out However it is a little bit dark and very loud which gives it the feel of a night club  The overall experience was good but it didn t feel special enough for its Michelin star and the prices

Arrived around 3 58 for afternoon tea having visited and enjoyed this Tea Room before welcome not as I would have hoped but in hindsight guess they wanted to close No chance of a sandwich as kitchen was closing whilst at the same time another couple were being turned away Ordered a scone and tea which was lovely albeit a little expensive Verdict disappointed with the Service which in a tea shop is so important Food always tends to be good but with other excellent establishments in the area will sadly probably go elsewhere - never understand why such establishments who employ a number of staff cannot show a higher degree of flexibility

This used to be the hotel restaurant prior to the Pass opening and since then the value offered has declined whilst the content of the menu has become sterile and predictable like a Marco Piere White grill

Lovely sunny Sunday and we felt a riverside bar and restaurant was the order of the day Alton Bridge Hotel our chosen venue for lunch and drinks outdoors  Arrived around 1pm drinks and sat beside the river in the spacious well equipped riverside garden Table pre-booked for 2pm lunch  Nice cosy interior bar and restaurant not large but nice and quiet Starter of soup was delicious and served with warm bread different soup to menu option but not a problem Dinners were brought to table while I was still eating soup starter no attempt was made to ensure we were ready for main course Main course - 2 Roast Beef dinners with all the usual trimmings I requested no garden peas and specified this to the young waitress sadly my dinner came with garden peas and I had to request my food was re-plated and returned minus garden peas This was promptly done but our Yorkshire puddings had to be requested for us both as they were not provided with either of our Roast Beef dinners Pepper pot on table had to be changed as this was empty too  Overall beautiful dinner very tasty nice vegetables and nicely presented but poor quality service by young waitresses let the meal down I would eat there again because food was nice and surroundings were perfect I just hope the management train staff better for customer service
This was just ok Although it has a big reputation this place is just alright This place is ok if you have kids or want pizza and is the only nearby place

Myself and my girlfriend visited this restaurant recently for an afternoon date The decor and service were second to none - really set the atmosphere for our meal Upon perusal of the Menu i realized the prices were fairly steep for the food they were offering We both ordered a starter which I could not fault - Garlic Flatbread and Pulled Pork Potato Skins The Main Courses however were a massive let down my girlfriend ordered a very impressive sounding Pulled Pork Chicken Burger which was very small and unimpressive indeed - my girlfriend commenting that the most impressive aspect of her meal were her fries  My main course of King Prawn Fajitas arrived very professional looking on a Sizzling Platter however my appreciation for the dish ended there The 10 prawns on my platter struggled to fill the 4 tortillas I was provided with which was disappointing for the 14 99 I paid Also the Prawns - although appearing they were cooked properly - were obviously not fresh as I was up all night after the meal with a very upset stomach We won t be hurrying back here
If you need a quick take away for chicken or wraps this is a good place at the Aldersgate Food quality is okay as compared to the price

Waited at the bar for a heck of a long time partly due to the massive orders people in front were making but also to a misjudgment of staff required Pulled a good pint and had very nice dog-friendly seating outside Food looked very nice although we didn t have any  I d like to go back to try the food

visited on a Saturday night it was a very busy bar but we got served quite quickly The place seemed a little rough plastic glasses and my bottled beer had to be put into a plastic glass music was ok did not stay that long after this

We arrived at 6 30pm and checked that we could be fed and away by 7 45 We were told this wouldn t be a problem - the restaurant was quite empty We ordered drinks and a main course The drinks arrived quickly but no food After waiting well over half an hour and seeing at least two tables who had arrived after us get their food we asked what was going on and were told that it was just coming  A couple of minutes later the food did arrive but by the time we had finished it was too late to order dessert and settled for a hastily downed cup of coffee It ended up being a disappointing experience - a shame because the food was good the waitress friendly and the setting was enjoyable But the food service was dreadful and ruined any relaxation that otherwise we ought to have enjoyed

The food was quite good Highlight was the mouth-watering lamb grill and not too sweet manggo lassi Curry and lamb briyani was average I did not like the type of rice the restaurant used  Service was good The only annoying thing was four different waiters came to our table over a period of 20 minutes asking how the food etc  A very spacious and comfortable restaurant It gets busy on weekends so make a reservation because it is only the Indian restaurant in that area Reasonable price averaging about 12 per person without alcohol

Upminster is crying out for a good restaurant like this they just need to change a few things and it could be great Food is mixed some very good but menu doesn t change They need more specials for greater choice and a better wine list some good wines - happy to pay a little more  A good start need to venture out now

Before this restaurant expanded this was one of my favourites in Bristol great atmosphere delicious comfort food great service and fair pricing Since then my experiences there have unfortunately been disappointing The staff are friendly and helpful and the place still has a good atmosphere but the portion sizes are incredibly mean especially the desserts and the pricing is completely unreflective of what you get The tiramisu which we ordered to share was a mouthful of tiramisu that you could eat in one bite and the apple crumble was served in the same little saucepan used for the sauces to accompany the steak  un utter rip off given that it s 6 50 The soup of the day starter  4 95 was equally mean and the fish and chips was very average with a relatively small fillet of fish that was more batter than meat and a handful of chips The restaurant gives me the impression that generating maximum profit has taken over from serving good food and fair portions

Food was very nice I had the Game Pie others in our party had the Staek & Ale Pie the Sea Bass the Chicken Duo and the Rib of Beef The Beef looked pretty amazing but everybody enjoyed their food  My mash was a bit stodgy so I asked for a little jug of gravy like the one served with the Steak & Ale dish sadly she forgot to bring it Like she forgot to take our order until I told her we were ready oh and I was charged for desert We never had desert  It wasn t me  Was the retort Hmmm ok In summary It s a nice atmosphere food is pretty good for the price if not a little expensive but I think we got the trainee waitress Won t stop us from going back though

I m not big on name restaurants I ve been to a few most notably on of Rick Steins places in Padstow they usually come with so much expectation that they are hopelessly disappointing I m looking at you Ramsey  Carluccios was a better option being part of a chain that has a famous name attached Slightly different prospect Anyway we went in and was taken to a nice banquette by our waiter We d barely got the menus open when he was back asking us to order drinks As were don t really do alcohol we wanted to look at the soft drinks and we asked if we could have another couple of minutes He seems to be mortally offended by this and stomped off 20 mins later he finally came back to us after seating people either side of us taking orders and delivering starters to both sides all the while steadfastly refusing to acknowledge us  Disturbingly he was also flirting slobbering over the young girls on the table next to us He sidled into the space between table and bent over A lot There isn t much space between the table which meant that for most of lunch we had a waiters bum in our face Had it been a nice bum it might have been seen as a bonus and he might have got a tip arf arf  but as it was it was a rather unpleasant distraction  The food eventually started to arrive and the Chicken Liver Pate was exquisite The Milanese di Pollo not so  nothing wrong but it needed something with it other than salad leaves to make it fly The dessert a rum and vanilla panna cotta with candied orange peel was enough to make a grown man weep Once we actually got it  We were thanks to the ineptness of the waiter running out of time before our next appointment of the day so we ordered dessert and coffee together even having a bit of a joke about it and having a mad discussion on the difference between a single and a double espresso The dessert arrived The coffee did not The dessert was cleared away the coffee did not arrive After much flirting by the waiter again with the next table we finally managed to catch his eye And he somewhat sourly asks us if we d like to order coffee We already have done we equally sourly respond There s a brief moment of huffing and no you didn t  after which I remind him of the conversation we had about it  Oh yeah  he says and a full 25 minutes later from the second time we ordered it some 45 minutes from the first time we get the coffee Which it has to be said was awesome and possible the best espresso I ve tasted  But the whole meal which would have been hugely enjoyable was spoiled by a waiter who seemed to determined to put the concerns of the contents of his pants before the needs of the customer Plus y know I had a blokes backside in my face for nearly two hours Not the best advert I m afraid  ****Addendum I went back to the shop part of Carluccio s in Tunbridge Wells as I d seen some rather tasty looking Mortadella Being a mortadella fiend I had to get some Despite being the only person in the deli part it took 25 minutes to be served and then after asking for mortadella I was given first ham then mozzarella and finally mortadella The person serving although she was very pleasant to chat to eventually had absolutely no productt knowledge I might have asked for grated fruit bat given the blank look on her face when asking for mortadella  It sad when a potentially great experience is turned into something less than enjoyable and frustration but staff that don t seem to give a toss

Everyone who goes to Bamburgh knows the Copper Kettle This time we called in and were definitely pleased with the outside patio area and the new toilets Inside though the overall feeling was one of tired decor and tired waitresses The cream tea was very good though
okay pancake house good choice but okay pancakes at a high price for the food you get Maybe try again soon to see if it has improved

Part of a large group  and the overall experience was not too bad If you want an intimate classy meal  this is not the place If you want amazing tasting food  again not the place If you want lots and lots of average tasting Chinese food this is it Prawn toast amazing  Duck pancakes poor Lots of choice and desserts pretty good

The Bridge is of course in Clayhithe roman for clay harbour but the powers to be have condemned the place to the history books just like the very good specials boards that this pub used to have and made a visit worthwhile Even then it was a chain pub restaurant Chef and Brewer so why this option has stopped I know not  Having booked earlier we still had to wait at the wait here sign for nearly five minutes before being asked had we booked and then show to a table feet away It was not until about 10 minutes our drink order had been taken that we were informed that there was a delay of nearly an hour on cooking was this OK Given that it was now 8 45pm they were told its got to be as its too late to go anywhere else It took perhaps 15 minutes for our drinks too arrive Service was indeed slow  The food was disappointing in terms of range and portion size The range is now just the norm pub chain offerings and the portion size small  As time when on we got the feeling that we were not wanted and indeed our bill arrived in under five seconds of asking for it  Would we go again Perhaps yes but only because what was offered is a little better that other pub chain offerings  Overall disappointing

Blimey All the good reviews this bijou little cafe has been receiving in the past including from me has made it a very popular place to go It continues to deliver but some aspects are beginning to suffer probably due to the levels of customers rocking up there At 9 15 it was almost full  This particular weekend it could have been mistaken for a Crufts Preliminary event  Dogs everywhere Even two being wheeled in sitting in a childs pushchair  Now don t get me wrong but a dog does NOT belong in a cafe  restaurant especially in pushchairs OR sitting on an owners lap eating off the table-top And willfully ignoring the NO DOGS IN THE DELI sign really takes the biscuit  NOT THE MANAGEMENTS FAULT I agree but I object to the intrusion into MY breakfast brunch by yapping slobbering and whining hounds that are not what I pay money to sit and eat amongst  I think the owners need to review this concession to dog owners  I must also regrettably report that elements of my Kitesurfers breakfast were not hot possibly not cooked long enough and my wife s Knickerbocker granola had Greek not frozen yoghurt so had become a bit cloying Hey-ho possibly again due to customer numbers putting stress on the kitchen staff who are normally spot-on with their offerings This is very unusual  However it won t put us off calling in for breakfasts that fill you up for the day in normally a very pleasant cafe by the sea all for a very fair price

Lovely atmospheric pub Good selection of real ales Knowledgeable staff re beers if a little patronising Excellent menu and specials selection Service - on a quiet Tuesday lunchtime - was bit like M&S cafes - very slow The food when it arrived was excellent with good sized portions They do speciality pies of which you can have a half portion 12 95 with all the trimmings I heard the barman say that a half portion of pie weighs about one and a quarter pounds + chips mash etc I think you would have to be very hungry

Last minute decision to eat out on Tuesday night - arrived about 9pm Wonderful fish and chicken pie main meals and excellent sweets Friendly and efficient service Natasha  Problems will IT system when it came to payment handled well

This is our second visit We like this restaurant it is a great addition to the Reigate restaurant scene  The food this has been generally faultless My wife is vegetarian so excellent food for both meat eaters and vegetarian guests  Service I have seen some very negative reviews on service It would be fair to say that the restaurant staff were keen to ensure service was good and overall the timings for service were good for us The staff had clearly read the reviews and were keen to ensure they got it right  What is beyond doubt is this restaurant is very successful particularly at the weekend so book a table We arrived early for our booking and were accommodated There is no doubt that the service team work hard at these busy times  On the subject of service I really liked the friendly service we received I think they have got a good team working here  Everyone will make up their own mind we however will definitely be back
If Chiquitos is providing authentic Mexican food  at 54 for two dining I struggle to understand how authentic Mexicans can afford to eat

Been 3 times now most recently for my birthday celebration a couple of weeks ago with 13 others Well organised good ambience waiters excellent and very tasty food my mouth is watering thinking about it  Despite changing the number of diners 3 times including when we arrived nothing was too much trouble and all was done without complaint A good way to dine here is to pick your starter we choses a variation on mixed kebab on a sizzler then let them cook for you Gorgeous The house wine was fine and not too expensive and at the end they ordered our taxis which arrived quickly Negatives away from the centre of town nowhere within 2 minutes walk for a drink beforehand that s all Will definitely go again soon

Train delays are not a problem in fact they are a blessing if you settle yourself down to lunch here I should point out that I love train travel so I love being at a train station waiting for train even if it is only going to Harlow Town So having a nice place to wait maximises that feeling The prices are what you might expect at an airport but that does keep out the day trippers so on a Saturday afternoon it was a quiet and relaxing place for lunch or just a beer I had the classic burgle and chips Though I am not a fan of meals served on old chopping boards the chips were nicely presented in a wire basket and well cooked The burger was char grilled and very tasty The beer was cold and there was a silent TV with sub-titles if you wanted to keep up with the Olympics
I went there on a team building night out It was fun and served its purpose I wouldn t recommend this four couples or people who don t like loud music

We arrived at Casbah on Friday morning We didn t know whether it was table service or take a seat ourselves staff must have seen us as they told us to take a seat and we ll be right over  We looked at the menus and found a good range of food and drinks But we had to wait around 10 minutes for the waitress to come over and take our order However when the waitress arrived she as extremely polite and apologised for the slow service and offered to compensate us with a beverage of some sort Our food arrived shortly Our Coffee s were just how we like them  The staff are really polite genuine people just need to pay a bit more attention to customers  Well done Casbah
Lovely steak with no gristle and good chips to go alongside Good basic food at a sensible price We sat on leather couches before going to the table to eat our meal

I ordered takeaway from this place one Saturday afternoon the food arrived within an hour  a reassurance that it was freshly cooked  It was delivered by a smartly dressed man in a suit to my door he was very polite  The rice was perfect the curry likewise a perfect mix of spice and heat very authentic and so filling Value was great also  Would recommend this to anyone who appreciates good curry

We went there for lunch just the two of us It was mid week and although there were a few other diners the staff outnumbered us by about 3 to 1  There was a great special offer - starter curry rice or nan and a side dish all selected from the main menu for a money saving 11 00 per person There are different special offers it seems every day and different ones most evenings  The food arrived quickly and was very tasty The portions were of a good size and we left feeling very full With a couple of alcoholic drinks and some poppadum to nibble until the food arrived the total bill came to a very acceptable 34 00  Good bits - the restaurant now has some outside seating - looks very smart - down side - overlooks the road and Earlswood Station Good bits - The lovely crisp clean linen and fresh d€÷cor inside - the downside - music was too loud aircon noisy and someone was using a drill while we were eating
Superb little place Have been here for Indian in the evening and breakfast in the morning Great food nice atmosphere and very good value Is a BYO license so don t forget your booze
A good carvery with tasty hot food helpful friendly staff Gets very busy on a Sunday afternoon but that s a good sign that it s worth the wait

After a busy day in London shopping we really wanted to find somewhere where we could chill out and we did The Old Coffee House is a lovely old London pub full of charm and character really old fashioned and homely nothing flash but you can relax and enjoy a drink or three and a good pub meal Food was served promptly and it was hot and fresh Nice old pub
Nice selection of food and very tasty Good name for money Drinks are a little expensive but that s restaurant prices for you

Having received a couple of recommendations we thought lets give the Fox and Hounds a try The surrounding village is beautiful the coahing Inns former stable yard now provides lovely outdoor seating However we had booked and the only seating available was in the cellar - don t get me wrong it has been converted in a comfortable dining area Passing the bar on the way to the cellar there were several Ales on offer - Real Ales -and the couple I had were much appreciated as they had been cared for One slight disappointment we had booked for a Sunday Luchtime and their menu ha changed such that some of the expected meakls had been replaced with traditional Sunday Roasts Don t get me wrong these were excellent - and I repeat my fellow guests comment here s well We all enjoyed the substantial and tasty food we each received We all came out feeling full not bloated but well and truly sataisfied I am just going to have to come back not on a Sunday to try the other Menu s in fact probably next week - and looking forward to it

My wife and I hadn t booked but turned up quite late ish on a Saturday evening We were given a table which to be honest looked to be in a part of the restaurant that was too busy we asked for another and were granted it It was busy very busy  a typical Italian waiters were attentive without being obtrusive We had two bottles of wine starters and mains the food was delicious especially my lamb shanks very sweet and tender Just generally good food and a good evening My only concern was that the toilets looked to be very basic To me if the toilets are clean then the kitchens will be  nothing worse than scabby toilets that needs looking at But other than that very very nice

Had lunch there just before Christmas Food and wine really good I can only say the atmosphere was average as there only a few people in at lunchtime It was the last Saturday before Christmas so everyone was shopping I have been here before in the evening and the atmosphere is great I thought it was good value as the paella for four was more than enough food The wines are excellent and the staff really helpful in choosing wine and food Well worth a visit

Superb all round  My wife and I had a lovely meal here last night This was our first visit here The food was superb excellent menu choice and the service was very good too  The restaurant was very nicely laid out and we had a lovely evening out  We would definitely come back

One of those places that draws you back  the food is very good the staff are attentive but not in your face  Value for money is a byword here  One MASSIVE plus for us jolly Englanders is that they don t serve alcohol     But you can bring your own and they don t charge corkage   In a nutshell if you are in Wantage and want a damn good feed [ and you just happen to have a bottle or two upon your person] then trot along the Sylheti You wont be disappointed

The restaurant is tucked away in Covent Garde easy to get to Very comfortable bar with good range of drinks lots of work groups present and romance around So eight very happy people climbed the stairs for dinner good food very drinkable wine and brandy What more could an old man want

We had a really good night at MEAT liquor with some friends The burgers cocktails etc are genuinely very good and our waitress was friendly and helpful  It s dark noisy faux grungy and alternative and packed around the bar area but that s exactly what you should be expecting and consistent with how they market themselves Complaining about it would be like whinging about the lack of steak at a vegan joint  The only thing that stops it getting 5 stars is that you re paying a premium and queuing because of its considerable popularity
good food and drink clean and tidy pl enty of parking nice freindly staff

We don t often have German food and while I wouldn t want to make a steady diet of it what we had at lunch yesterday was delicious  The Bismark Herring starter was out-of-this world if a little on the skipy side in terms of the size of the portion The chopped liver was pretty damn terrific The Wursts were great and the saurkrout flavorful The service was a bit harsh and when we asked certain questions the answers were very brusk and rather unsatisfactory  It is Wurst you will need mustard  and a there were a couple of mistakes with the dessert order  two of them were forgotten  All that said I d still happily go back again

We had a party of 9 with ages ranging from 10 to 95 years old some of whom were quite demanding in their choice of food The environment was pleasant with various areas so there was the impression you were in a relatively small restaurant There was not the noise you can get in a restaurant with as many covers as this restaurant The wide range of Italian and English food met all our varied demands the quality was good the service was very polite helpful and prompt The prices were reasonable They did make a small mistake with the bill which was quickly corrected I believe it was a genuine mistake We would go back again

Nomu has a great atmosphere and truly excellent service The food is of a very high quality and I have enjoyed most items on the Japanese-inspired menu They have some surprisingly low-cost specials between 5 and 7pm

Returned to have a meal and had a lovely time Staff very friendly and accommodating for food allergy  We had booked with a livingsocial offer for the Friday night and pleasantly surprised by how unhurried everything was  that does not mean slow service Lovely seabass fillet
Nice beer garden with piped music soft rock  in a friendly pub with a choice of fine beers Does bar meals up to 4 pm although we never sampled them - they looked tasty
We had fish and chips that are a bit pricey  cost just under 25 for 2 and 2 waters but tasted great and served up in an historic building

Tasty main courses we opted for the 8 95 banquet offer The starter portions were smaller than I expected and were mildy spiced I wasn t too impressed with the kebab in the starter too much colouring and binding ingredients I think  I like my curries reasonably spicey and the main courses didn t disappoint We shared a garlic naan and pilau rice with prawn Madras and a mixed balti The balti contained pieces of the same kebab as we d eaten in the starter but the sauce masked its consistency and flavour  The waiter was very attentive and we had a good old chin-wag about food restaurants and travel A real pleasure to spend time with him He appreciated that our tastes were definitely in the authentic home made spiced and garnished to bits ball park  To sum up then main course made up for a bit of a slow starter and I d rate the restaurant at very good value for money Expertly prepared main courses demonstrated the genuine ability of the chef A lovely welcoming atmosphere and pleasing decor  Well done
Really nice environment with good selection of tapas wines and very pleasant staff Will definately be going back

Easily booked a table via their web site and arrived expecting the restaurant to be quiet on a Wednesday evening at 8 00 The opposite was true every table was taken and a number of people were turned away due to tables reserved all night A very popular restaurant so book a table in good time We had a short wait for our table in the mean time we were looked after by freindly and attentive staff The meal was lovely apart from a small problem due to personal choice which was amicabley resolved Highly recommend this restaurant but do book a table in advance
I visit regularly for a quick drink after work Staff are quite friendly Food is cheap and pretty good for what it is Something for everyone on the menu

The room was pretty good with a lovely view over the estuary comfy bed and everything worked and was clean  Restaurant was fairly limited on choice but I was happy with what I ordered It was a Monday night though so I can understand this  Breakfast was good and they even opened up early for me as I needed to be in a meeting by 08 30  All in all a very good value stay and I will be shunning the local Travel lodge and Premier Inn in favour of this place from now on

Spur of the Moment thing went for a Curry for tea Been here a few times actually my wife s favourite Indian  Staff very friendly and attentive excellent choice on the menu and it won t break the bank Food well presented and hot - oh and very good to Try the banquet nights on Tuesday or Wednesday for a fixed price - great value Recommended

This is a lovely little pub that has been cleverly refurbished to be trendy without being pretentious and still retaining an original characterful charm Food is great fresh and a good choice Staff are friendly and good selection of beers and ales  Great place for quiet drinks Sunday roast or to sit in the small courtyard garden area

Bilash is a great restaurant and my partner and I very much enjoyed our visit  The restaurant itself is very plain and simple in terms of decor but clean warm and welcoming The staff were welcoming friendly courteous and efficient  The menu isn t as extensive as you ll find in many other Indian restaurants -- their policy seems to be we ll stick to the few things we know we can do really well  However we both found dishes that we liked the sound of and I think there s enough choice to satisfy most customers  The food was served quite promptly and was very good indeed There s plenty of attention to quality and detail and my partner and I both felt it was some of nicest tastiest and most satisfying Indian food we d ever tasted Definitely a cut above the average  The bill came to over 85 which we felt was a little on the high side given that we didn t have much alcohol with our meal This is the only reason why I m awarding four stars instead of five Yes you have to pay for quality but even so there comes a point where the price seems surprisingly high  Overall a very good restaurant that we d be happy to go to again It would just be nice if they trimmed their prices a little

We had a table booked for 18 15 on Saturday 12th December for a family meal 5 adults and 2 children Most tables were full and ours was ready and waiting for us fully laid out with Christmas crackers and menu s We was attended to straight away to order drinks by a very pleasant member of staff and were delivered virtually straight away We placed our starter food order from a very varied menu and was delivered in a short while no complaints whatsoever The same for the main and the dessert no waiting hours just nice The children were asked if they wanted a child menu and were also offered colouring books and crayons The whole experience was without fault

On the four hour drive from Cardiff to Chester my wife and I stopped here for lunch My wife is coeliac Gluten Free Diet for medical reasons and it was really good to see such a well defined menu with lots of GF items for her to choose from Well done Brains who own this restaurant on the outskirts of Hereford The nachos were fantastic as a starter to share
Good food well cooked nice ambience pleasant staff There were six friends one couple looked after our dog whilst on holiday and this was a thank you They liked it

I knew about this pub from way back when it was the Mucky Duck & it had a bit of a reputation so we tended to avoid it but on a recent site visit they re having work done to provide a roof terrace I was pleasantly surprised to see that not only had a complete makeover it also brewed it s on beer on site & I duly made a note to revisit with my girlfriend in tow to sample some of their ales & food which we did last week Both of us loved the look of the place & enjoyed trying some of their many beers including their own brews  the black IPA was very good The food whilst not fine dining was more than adequate pub fare - both of us opted for one of their salads with a portion of fries on the side & there were no complaints The staff were also very helpful & attentive We would definitely return especially for the beer

Called in here for the first time tonight Staff were friendly without being over the top Meat was fresh and tender plenty of veg all fresh and hot Only one gravy other pan empty but that was the only negative Always used the Toby before but the last few visits have been really poor and this is a much better alternative We will be back
Booked early evening  glad we did as there was not a spare seat in the house Food was good although a little on the pricey side for the main course dishes

As a veggie it is always a joy to have to decide what to eat rather than choose from a limited selection The menu was not too extensive a good thing but pleasantly varied in terms of ingredients and spicing  My colleagues are not vegetarians and were not well versed in Indian cuisine but the waiter was friendly helpful and attentive to the right degree We started with the ubiquitous papadum but were impressed by our main meals The cooking was very good and the spicing was excellently balanced Although the restaurant is not licensed it is fine to bring your own alcohol with you We were content with our very tasty and soothing mango lassi I shall go back if I am in the area again and it is something of a culinary oasis of real cooking in an area that has several mass-produced offerings

Really impressed with the whole experience especially the service which right from the moment we entered the restaurant was top class  The restaurant is airy and bright and well laid out so you are not sitting on top of other guests  Prices are quite high but still felt at the end of it that we had got good value for money which to me is a sign of good well run operation Could have tried the well priced lunchtime set menu but too tempted by the a la carte choices  One to remember and will go back
Lovely interior quite quirky Good selection of beers fairly standard pub menu but well cooked food
A good atmosphere in this pub friendly bar staff you can have banter with Served promptly and with decent ales Convenient location and plenty of space in the pub Would definitely visit again

Had read very good reports so visited for 1st time Would happily return Service is very efficient and friendly Chicken tandoori starter was excellent- really moist and tasty Chef special dansak was slightly disappointing  plenty of sauce but a little lacking in content but overall thoroughly enjoyable meal Vegetable bhaji was really good

Given its seaside location you d imagine a restaurant like this would play it safe with its menu and stick to traditional basics They don t here at all and what is served is a broad range of dishes at a decent price We went for tapas and what we were served was very good Two plates each for lunch was more than enough so don t over order unless you re a big eater I would recommend the fried parsnips with a honey and dijon mustard sauce Out of this world Great to eat and drink in a place like this with such a lovely view stretching over the Solent to the Isle of Wight

Living fairly nearby I ve become something of a  regular at this restaurant I can t say the food or service is the greatest but there s  something about the place that just appeals I can t take any of the other reviewers to task - they are pretty much correct in their observations- but for some reason I just can t put my finger on I ve throughly enjoyed every visit Maybe it s because this type of  Italian is fast disappearing only to be replaced by a kind of  fashionable version where the service is good but robotic and the food better than here but  soulless  Sometimes it s best just to go for the funkiness and forget the flash Incidentally I was taken there by regular and see the same folks all the time so it s definitely working for somebody

Went for Saturday lunch on a busy summers day First impressions were of a slightly daunting  boozer but inside the staff were all excellent and efficient  We were warned that it would be up to thirty minutes for lunch understandable and acceptable but it arrived much sooner to everyone s delight The manager was buzzing about checking on the customers and making sure that tables were cleared There seemed to be plenty of staff behind the bar clearing serving tables etc  Overall pleased with the decision to stop here for lunch and would go back again

WE live locally so this is one of our regular restaurants Its typical caf€÷ rouge fare but recently they seemed yo have upped their game a bit Friendly and efficient service their set menus are good value Perhaps not for a mega-treat for a birthday but very good everyday food Obviously will go again  and again
Great location on the river  great food  chunky chips nice too preferred the older decor with the leather sofas the new grey furniture and refurb has resulted in a starker atmosphere
An enjoyable meal well cooked nicely presented decent wine list Quite a small dining room - may be best to book

never been before yet only 10 mins away from us interia was warm and cosy staff polite and helpful food was very good and hot the breaded mushrooms for a starter were to die for on our list for return visit

This was our first time eating at the Cove restaurant and we were very pleased with the food drink and service The location and ambiance are superb looking out over the Marine Lake on a fine summer evening     it doesn t get much better than this We tried the Beer battered fish with hand cut chips and the Beetroot and goats cheese tart followed by a Honey panna cotta with pickled plums all on the early evening dinner menu 6-7pm Tues-Fri  We will be back to try the main dinner menu in the very near future

I have made numerous visits to the frog and rhubarb The food has generally been of a high standard and the tapas is great Bring back the meat loaf on the menu for the winter May visit again for our xmas meal with friends

If you have run your dog s along the beach at Kingsland Road or Cudmore Grove this is a welcome welcoming friendly place at which to recover and relax either indoors or at a picnic table outside From a full breakfast or fish and chips to a simple bacon or sausage bap with much more on offer including puddings they do it very well and always with a smile The nearby car park is free for an hour or 20p for two hours This first-rate always-bustling place is open for 364 days a year

This restaurant is a real gem Very tasty vegetarian food All served cash only from a counter downstairs for people wanting to eat in Order pay and take to a seat When available You get a glass for the fresh water on each table BYO if you need to Each day a new menu No reservations This restaurant manages its logistics magnificently well It is small but service is quick and through-put as well Take-away available upstairs Highly recommended also when not a vegetarian or vegan I am neither   And don t forget the tasty deserts

Has more than its fair share of atmosphere and is pleasantly located next to the city wall and handy for the Barbican where I caught Alex Higgins playing Jimmy White a few years back in an exhibition game - just thought I d share that with you  I ve fond memories of this place going back a fair few years and it has remained a favourite of mine through various renovations and changes in character

I love this place Not sure how long I have been eating here on and off Could it be 25 years Anyway thoroughly enjoyed an impromptu Valentines lunch on the 14th and the food service and atmosphere were as good as ever I know it s cheesy but if you throw a little bit of money at a decent bottle of red the big glasses come out Satisfyingly deflating the egos of all the Montepulciano slurping alpha males in sight The Ripasso is excellent  However the faint whiff of drains at the entrance really really needs sorting out and a charge for a tiramisu that I didn t have and didn t notice till I threw the bill away the next day was mildly irritating

This is a cheap and cheerful pub restaurant The staff were great showing us to a table straight away Clean and well decorated The food although standard pub food was well cooked and presented and tasty
Have been several times with the Curry Club from the pub five couples all served exellent authentic food you can take your own drink which is a bonus expecially when you use a groupon discount

Last went to red lion 12 months ago and when my daughter told me she had booked for 7 of us for a family birthday on 16th march i was a bit worried our last visit was not very good after reading latest reviews i was even more worried However everything was very good very pleasant waitress very good service and all food ordered was available and quite acceptable Its only fair that after giving a poor review on our last visit that we give credit this time for a good experience
Excellent food would highly recommend it Can not be beaten for quality value and price Will be going again
