Wooden Village Hall with that friendly old fashioned charm Good service and food excellent Well worth a visit Situated on Arksey High Street Just off Station Road Arksey
Always a great experience when eating at The White Horse Good sized portions and reasonably priced too Having dined here numerous times both the food and service have always been consistently high

The food was excellent and the service was exceptional We had a party of 12 and the standards were very impressive Would certainly go back again Premium pricing but well worth it Excellent environment and was packed so a very popular venue - guess you need to book well in advance but try it

Our daughters booked us a table for our anniversary and it really didn t disappoint The restaurant is basic clean and comfortable-because of being in an arcade and with outside seating you can almost believe you re in the Med Overall  the service was friendly attentive and quick The food was mostly very good our only gripe was the olive oil for dipping which had next to no taste-small price to pay for what was overall a very tasty and enjoyable meal  especially enjoyed the whitebait and then the ox cheeks  A relatively small drinks list but enough to keep us happy Price ok- 60 for 7 tapas bottle of wine and four drinks
Ate here once during tis year s Three Choirs Festival Food perfectly adequate at a reasonable price but service very slow and although polite not very welcoming
Food is good here specially chilly paneer but there is lack of seating specially if you come with your extended family Good ambiance too

Saw the Tea rooms on the pier and decided to go in but had a really big surprise It was like entering the Savoy Tea room We decided to use the bar and the level of service was excellent The price of things we Middle to High 2 half s of larger and a coffee came to 7 10 but not bad If you are meeting someone special or having a business meeting this is the place

A pleasant surprise A simple setting which must have taken effort The good is well prepared and a good size portions Not quite fine dining but all the better for it Did miss on a egg not having a soft centre for a fish cake but otherwise a meal for three went without a hitch A really nice piece of cod for me and another main course of duck was excellent
lovely old fashioned pub with several real ales and full of character well worth a visit together with another pub close by called loggerheads although didn t get there this time
Really good value for money Good menu selection with two meals for 8 45 Nice surroundings and friendly staff Highly recommended

We went for the Oyster bar as part of a weekend away and werent disappointed The place is buzzing and vibrant and we were welcomed and shown to our seats at the bar Wine selection was good and not at stupid prices Great selection of Oysters backed up with knowledge from our server We had 2 dozen oysters and polished that off with some great wine Would return here

Food here is excellent and the location if your lucky enough to get to sit outside and on sunny evening is amazing with great views over the Solent to the Isle of Wight Closest reastaraunt I know to feelling your eating out abroad There are few restaraunts we would travel so far to eat out and this is our top one The service started well but we were ingored between the main meal and getting to order the desert Also found a number of items on our bill for someone else s table so beware  Arrive after 6 00pm and there s free parking outside

Friday lunch visit Confit duck rabbit for mains well cooked and seasoned Baked Alaska flamed in Grand Marnier to finish Theatrical  Service pleasant even if the waitress didn t seem to really know who RB is  Would definitely return as excellent value for money

Even though they were busy we were quickly shown to a pleasant table in the front bar and made to feel welcome The menu choice to intentionally limited but as a result our order came quickly and we were very pleased with our choice of dishes Their wine list is good and varied with a fair range of prices Very enjoyable

4 of us went on Friday evening for a meal Although the restaurant was full we were shown to our table straight away and our coats taken The waiter was extremely attentive but always from a distance never in your face He was more than happy to answer any questions we had re the menu The squid starter is outstanding as is the suckling pig main My wife had a salad and the sirloin with tomatoes which although good the Sirloin weren t the outstanding steak she was expecting Both other guests were very happy with their meals The desserts were very nice too All in all a very worthwhile second visit which will definitely turn into a 3rd visit
Good Pub Food and a great selection of Beers and Cider  Nice people and great value for money  Will go again
Although a little pricey we managed to get seated without a reservation Best steak I ve had for months Staff very friendly too

This pub used to be dire       the sort of place that has trouble written all over it A few years ago that all changed with new owners and a full revamp of the pub  Today I m proud to call the Northbrook my local From the bar to the restaurant all of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful  Foodwise they have a good selection of bar food and food in the main restaurant The Sunday roasts are a great shout as is the burgers Deserts are not the best unfortunately

We were recommended this restaurant and we re not disappointed  The staff were lovely The food was outstanding I had possibly the best pork belly I ve had in a long time Cured by the chef - crackling crisp and the underneath crisp too and not as fatty as usual Served with a hogs pudding scotch egg and outstanding cider jus  My partner had the bream - very generous portion 2 large fillets in a lovely lemon sauce with wonderful creamy mash  Pudding - well it was just as good You can surprise yourselves  Wine list was varied and not expensive  We booked again whilst there  Definitely recommend It s not the cheapest in town but then you get what you pay for
Great Fish and Chips and great value  They do a well priced kids meal and the freshly fried chicken nuggets are better than McDonalds

The Frozen Mop is on of those places you take the family or granny out for a meal in the countryside  It s nicely decorated with a lovely feel to the place  it has a main restaurant and also little snugs to sit and eat if you wish  I like the menu it isn t pretentious and has all the classic meals with the occasional twist  if you are looking for reasonable value quality food and good service in a lovely environment  then i would recommend it

Good lunch reasonably priced as were the drinks Good choice at breakfast but some of the food was cold Didn t book the included breakfast for the stay at the Premier Inn so paid at the bar I think it wouldn t have been noticed if I hadn t paid

Never been to Sushi restaurant before so a little apprehensive This soon disappeared when I was welcomed with warm smile from the waitress My fellow diner was a regular so he took the lead with ordering Lovely tempura soft shell crab and prawns to start If I was being very critical it was a little greasy The next few courses were great and the tuna was amazing  tasted very fresh  The restaurant was full of regulars and the menu was great for a beginner like me  enough grilled and tempura for those less adventurous Don t be out off by thinking it s all raw  it s not  Parking ok in regency car park  looks like they have made much safer with extra security and ticket only entry The on road parking is not coin so be prepared by registering for phone activation To be honest the car park is better as cheaper for up to two hours
Food not great but really good atmosphere All round a really nice and cosy pub would go again for drinks especially in the summer time its great

Went into London for the day booked a table online the night before There were limited table times due to the last minute decision to book I now know why as it was busy all night  The food was great and defiantly value for money we had a sharing meat board with biggest gherkins I have seen  I followed with a pot of mussels and the waitress sold us dessert that I did not have room for but loved  If I was being critical I would say they needed a couple more team on as they have quite big sections so some people got food and drink at the same time All the team and mangers very friendly the open kitchen is a real plus  Will be back

We visited the Chung Ying Restaurant for a family lunch on Tuesday 29th October and had a fabulous meal Delicious food lovely clean restaurant and excellent service We have visited this restaurant many times before and look forward to returning soon
the restaurant was very busy at around 5 30 pm I had steak and ale pie I found this was very good and I did not wait very long for it to arrived
After walking around the castle we decided to have dinner and had a wonderful meal in the Rising Sun the staff were excellent and the food was great would go back again when in the area

We tend to meet family here for our Christmas get together and have been doing so for about 3 years now This means we normally end up going with the set Christmas menu rather than the day to day menu  The staff are generally polite and prompt and service is usually on the money so no complaints there One area where they really seem to push the boat out is they ll often allow us to cherry pick food for our nephew according to what he wants which keeps him happy and is very welcome so does wonders for keeping order at the dining table -  Food we ve had to date has been very good year on year and it s a pleasant environment that reflects the building you re in Good for parties family groups or couples so really all bases are covered

We had a terrific family birthday celebration at the Good Earth Very nice combination of excellent ingredients expertly cooked and beautifully presented by people who clearly care about what they do Service was also spot on with right blend of attentiveness and calm Menu was excellent for a broad range of ages and tastes Happily recommend if you have the budget as it is far from cheap

4 of us visited on Friday for a meal and catch up The service was very good and the staff worked well to make sure we were looked after  The restaurant was busy with a mixture of small and large groups of people but this didn t affect the quality of service we received  The food was excellent and I can highly recommend the Thai Fishcakes as a starter The Roti s are also fantastic as an accompaniment to your main dish  Pricing is reasonable for the food quality and we will return again I d recommend booking at a weekend as it does get busy

I was here for the launch of a magazine in the function room at the back and while I was in London I arranged to catch up with friends When I arrived the place was really buzzing with a great atmosphere - it was a Friday night and there was hardly a seat everybody having a rare old time eating drinking and I dare see merry making too My friends had got in a bottle of wine an also ordered their meals- I was running late due to a delayed flight The food was very high quality the wine list pretty good and very reasonable The staff coped admirably with such a crowd and I ended up getting pretty sloshed on their Cabernet Sauvignon All in all a great pub with peely wallpaper and mismatched furniture The outdoor smoking area at the back is nice
Good selection of beers and reasonably priced wine list Food was very good both the choice and the quality Great value for money
Good hot food served quickly and well presented Staff very helpful and friendly If you are on a budget well worth a visit

We turned up but could tell from outside that they don t do the buffet on a Sunday Decided Frankie and Benny s would be better but after close to fifteen minutes without being asked what drinks we wanted we upped and left and returned to Pizza Hut All the staff and especially the girl who served us Jessica were very good and really friendly We had starters and main Both were very good but we could have had the free salad that came with the main as the starter Wish we d gone there first

If you like your meat this is the place for you You choose the cut of meat the size and how you want it cooked then leave the rest to them Just about managed a pudding between us One guy came in and ordered a 23 oz steak Now thats just plain madness

Amazing drinks bartender Eddy made our night memorable yes this bar gets busy and probably hundreds of people around such a long bar and 6 bartenders you ll have to wait a bit for your cocktails but hey victim of their success Try the Oriental daiquiri or Love & Rocket we had the Asian platter  the meat melts in your mouth

It has to be said that the pubs in the area are very diverse in their quality and approach to customers The Manifold seems to have it right Through not perfect we found the Inn to be friendly warm clean and the menu selection good and reasonably priced The food quality varied from excellent to average None of the meals were poor but the quality depended on the staff on duty The quantity served was generous and the meat tasty and well cooked Sweets are also generous and well made We will certainly come back but do not expect a gourmet experience We don t need one

It is as you might expect lots of UK tourists celebrating a special occasion of some kind with first class expensive service and good food in a room like you would find on an ocean liner The French sommelier s English was so unintelligible I did not understand what she said about the champagne so I bought the cheapest

Fab burgers and great fries  and amazing shakes too full to try a dessert  Hard to fault other than it took a long time to take our order  didn t really bother us but in a place that busy I imagine a fast turnover of customers is key

A mid week evening meal on a promotion which gave you plenty of Prosecco a sharing platter to start and the a choice of a pizza or pasta each  The starter was badged as choosing from their pasta bar station which turned out not to be the case The promotion is running across all of their restaurants and as this is a smaller venue we guess they don t have the floor space to accommodate As it was the selection was good had some unusual items that we probably wouldn t have chosen but enjoyed nonetheless and with one exception it was all very tasty  Main courses - we had pasta and pizza between us were excellent  Desert and coffee followed not included in the promotional offer and a bottle of sparkling water was had too  With a 12 5 tip slightly unexpected automatic addition to the bill as it was only dinner for 2 and not a larger group we got change from 60 Personally I don t tend to include drinks in my tip calculation - delivering a bottle to the table doesn t warrant 12 5 to its cost  Overall we d definitely go back - staff were pleasant food was good and there were enough other mid week diners to give the restaurant an atmosphere

Reserved a table the day before Arrived in bad weather and stopped at door to drop off mother Staff passing immediately offered to assist Shown straight to table Two lunches with three meats and one senior lunch went down well Generous portions of hot food Sweets were enjoyed after a gap to allow for settlement All staff were friendly efficient and created a good atmosphere We will return
Located right on the waterside of thevBrayford pool one of the nicest spots in Lincoln Typical wetherspoons you always know you re going to get good food at a very reasonable price
Nice meal and good service Quite close to the hotel Italian style restaurant Good value for the money
Met up with friends on Sunday and had a great meal good choice on the carvry and serve hot very friendly staff and a good atmosphere a good job we had a table booked as the place was packed

1940s style cafe selling proper traditional English cafe style food and tea served in old teapots with tea leaves and a strainer lots of nostalgic stuff on the walls and shelves staff are very welcoming and friendly prices are very reasonable Outside seating is very limited but my preference is inside anyway It s always been quite busy when I ve been but always managed to get a seat

We ve stopped off a number of times over the years and watched the many style changes the restaurant has gone through however the one thing that hasn t changed is the food Freshly cooked and hot Fish chips and a decent portion of mushy peas This visit was Friday evening 11 12 2015 So I was quite surprised at the negative comments on this site just goes to show there are some miserable people out there
Visited with friend Good choice of food which was delicious and served well Pleasant surroundings
I found the Caf€÷ Rouge to offer a good value breakfast that was improved further by the quality of food and the presentation

Nice hotel in the middle of pangbourne rooms have been refurbed but still have single glazing etc As in the town centre a bit of road noise but this quietens down at night Food excellent staff friendly only downside is parking for only about 6 or 7 cars but it is next to a public car instead

I was in a group of four out for an evening meal Each of us had a different selection without any complaint at all I was originally going to give three stars but on reflection the time spent just flew by which to me indicates that the surroundings were relaxing so on the basis of good honest food and relaxing surroundings I ve decided that it warrants four stars
very good food and the staff are very attentive but tables are a bit tight and you cannot start a conversation with tables to close I will go back and try a table at the corner

I visit here fairly regularly and is one of the nicest bars in Lytham Drinks are always well made service is generally good and good food They often have offers on the food which is good too  You generally get a good crowd in which is a change from a lot of places on the Fylde Coast but is prone to the odd 50p millionaire but there harmless It does get very busy friday saturday night and on sunny days tables on the terrace are at a premium Overall one of my favourite places on the area for a drink or lunch Classy feel reasonable prices and a good clientele
Wagamamas is great making oriental food accessible The quality is good the service is usually quick and its reasonably priced You really can t go wrong

Went on a Thursday evening the place was lively Mains were delicious as was the dessert Well priced plenty of options on the menu and the staff were very friendly Overall a very nice evening out recommended

This restaurant although small is a gem of a place  The quality and quantity of the food was excellent The portions sizes were very generous and excellent value for money The prawn puri was one of the best we have ever had not only in taste but in the quantity of prawns used and also the beautiful spices  The owner chef welcomed us to the restaurant and also came round the tables asking how the meals were We found all of the staff to be polite and friendly  Would highly recommend for an excellent meal at very competitve prices  My only negative comment is the menus were looking a little tatty and could do with being replaced Otherwise a good night was certainly had

Looking for somewhere to eat on a Saturday evening I went to Sergio s Italianissimo with my better half It was early so not to busy Got busier whilst we where there Starter main course and wine Great value

This is the latest of a number of cafe s that have opened in Wantage so to hold it s own it will have to be good I am sorry the previous reviewer dint have such a good experience for up to now I can only say good things about my visits the welcome is as geneorus as the portions and and the service prompt If there is a problem it is the location just out of the town centre but the short walk is well worth the effort yesterday i introduced two friends and I am sure they wil return Herb N

If you are visiting Durham Cathedral this is an excellent place to stop for refreshment This small cafe offers a very tasty range of sandwiches soup and cakes in a light and relaxed environment - a much more intimate space than the larger restaurant in the cathedral itself A range of seating makes the place different - ordinary chairs and tables but nice comfy settees too

Four of us had lunch here on Sunday and I was very much looking forward to it having checked the pub s website and read a couple of gastropub top 100s However chef of the 165 7 course tasting menu of your favourite foods with premium wine flight plus a glass of champagne obviously takes a well deserved day off on Sundays when the menu is reduced to a safe choice of three starters four mains and three puddings  We arrived at 2pm expecting it to be packed and it was a lovely surprise to find a nice quiet village pub that wasn t rammed to the rafters although obviously not such a great situation for the owners who I m sure would welcome the extra business  My ham hock starter with pickled veg and gooseberries was lovely a generous slab of meaty ham that went superbly with the fruit and veg - 10 10 and all very promising The spicy sweet potato soup was good but not that spicy which was a bit disappointing  Mains were a bit hit and miss The fish was as is so often the case overcooked and the rib of beef came with overdone Yorkshires and underdone roasties but the meat itself was excellent and certainly tips the score into very good rather than average  Service was polite but a bit stiff - it wasn t informal and relaxed as it should be in a pub or as it should be in a place like this that sets very obviously high standards for its food and it all got a bit comical when first the Coravin machine wasn t available despite a huge sign advertising it then they had sold out of their most popular wine and then the chef of the day couldn t find any fresh mint as they didn t know where 165 7 course tasting menu chef keeps it We were having a lovely time though with great friends and so none of this mattered in different circumstances though I might have been less equanimious  My pudding was fine but I didn t enjoy the coffee and the cheese plate wasn t great although as it was shared by the other three it was all scoffed  So there were plenty of things that weren t right but the excellent starter great meat and the lovely setting more than made up for it I d even come back on a Sunday as my expectations would be appropriately lowered but what I m really looking forward to is a trek out mid week when the good chef is in - the 165 a head menu might have to wait though

Good atmosphere cheerful happy Resteraunt Food good for vegetarien great starter Nan was hung on metal hook at least 4 foot in diameter Service great even if a Man Utd fan No hurry main courses good both well filled by end of meal If you want a quite romantic meal not the place to go if you want to see life buzzing around you and a happy bunch of people go here

Friendly pub in remote location Morwenstow is miles and miles from Bude with restaurant including a large well-lit conservatory dining room and outside seating in good weather Serves food pretty much all day during the summer season reduced hours in winter  making it an especially nice stop-off for walkers on the coast path Good pub food large portions Very friendly staff as others have noted

Regrettably we had occasion to send cold food back but I have to say the consequential customer service was absolutely fantastic They were determind to ensure that we did not leave hungry or unhappy and we didn t  They completely turned a sour experience around which means that we have the confidence to recommend it and indeed return ourselves

Pre De La Warr gig meal So handy lovely meal prompt service Quite delicate flavours Had a hot chicken dish which was excellent mixed dumpling starters also excellent My wife had a hot sweet chicken dish that was just a bit sweet for our palates The garlic nan was lihht and delicious If we are back in Bexhill we would happily return

With our planned cafe stop closed for their annual holiday we decided to try Walk Mill a place I had not been to before In a quite location making it safe to leave your bikes unattended but also having space to put your bike inside if the weather was inclement All the cakes were homemade and reasonable priced however there did not appear to be any gluten free option We could not fault the coffee and cakes we had see attached photo and will be returning again in the near future There is also a large wood burner which will be a very inviting on our winter rides
Don t be put off by the entrance to this pub restaurant We were made to feel more than welcome by Sean Good food friendly service and pleasant atmosphere We will go back soon

We went the other night to celebrate a friends birthday The staff attended to our table of 15 with speed and efficiency and the flavours of the meats was fantastic Thanks to all the management team who ensured our visit was special Cant wait to visit again soon

Went there for breakfast on a Saturday morning and was surprised how quiet it was There was plenty of staff the service was prompt and efficient and the food was very good The Welsh rarebit and poached egg can be recommended Cost for 4 people was 38

We visited the upstairs restaurant and where amazed by the good value For 27 we both had 3 courses and a bottle of wine The food was proper pub grub and we where impressed by the gammon Would definitely recommend oddfellows to anyone

Located on The Kingsway The main road next to the beach you have a great sea view while you eat The Captains Table provides most meals that you could want My wife and I went for the fish and chips It was very good value at 6-50 I think the reason we both left some chips was because there were too many on our plates I thought the service was excellent the waitresses were all smiles as they did their jobs

Visited The Plough on spec It has a comfortable welcoming atmosphere and offers a more extensive menu than most pubs The menu is varied and whilst offering the basics it also has that something different We were a group of four who all chose something different and all the meals were excellent albeit a little more expensive than standard pub prices Despite not being particularly busy when we arrived the initial service re drinks and taking of order was slow Otherwise a very good experience

I popped in to this new restaurant quickly for the first time to collect a take away pizza and some pasta  Firstly I was very impressed by the atmosphere Italian music playing in the background and full tables filled with good food and plenty of chat  There are about 10 tables in this restaurant and all but 1 was taken amazing for a Sunday evening in New Romney  Secondly the food The pasta was cooked perfectly and had the perfect blend of tomatoes olives onion and chilli  The pizza was a wonderful surprise and a million miles from the usual poor efforts served by local kebab shops in the area The pizza was not over cooked and had a generous topping of rocket  All things considered a great addition to the area and an example to follow for neighbouring restaurants

I decided to book at the Fisheries for a family lunch as we have previously had both good food and good service here I m glad I did the staff were again friendly and welcoming the food was very good and overall it was exactly what I wanted - an enjoyable lunch with nice surroundings I will no doubt be booking another return visit

Came in here after visiting Little Johns grave very apt after a long walk really needed a cool drink normaly im a real ale drinker  but being hoy and bothered i had a pint of lager Lot of people in here and people eating but we didnt stop we had to go somewhere else Nice friendly pub
Went in here after gig at Barclaycard arena Nice bar with a good menu Worth a visit when close to the venue

A couple of friends took me out here for an impromptu birthday dinner and we were well looked after The sharing starters were more than ample the soft shell crab was delicious and the mains were really tasty I had a love duck dish and washed it down with Beer Lao a really rather interesting rice beer from Laos Would definitely recommend for good central Thai food

Staff were friendly and helpful food arrived efficiently and was accurate to what we ordered The food was enjoyable and a fair size portion standard harvester quality and I would recommend if in the area

After spending the morning on the beach we went on the hunt for some lunch After checking out the ludicrous prices at Winstons Fish Bar next door we opted to give Raddys a go Well best decision we made all day They had disable access for our 4 year old son who is in a wheelchair and the tables were low enough for him to eat in his chair The staff where friendly and happy to help if required The food was generously portioned to say the least well cooked and tasted great The coffee was pretty good also Overall we had an enjoyable meal which was good value for money The decor was a little on the tired side if you want to get picky particularly the toilets could do with a revamp but everywhere was clean considering the building gets worked hard as it is a cafe restaurant during the day evening and then a pud club at night We ll be eating here again upon our next visit to Weston for sure

We held a leaving do for one of our senior execs here last week Excellent location with a bright open space at the end of the restaurant bar Plentiful supply of beer and wine with staff on hand to keep flowing Pizza etc to fill the food gap also All in all an excellent evening in an ideal venue Will use again
Everything you would expect of a straightforward no pun intended fish and chip shop Friendly staff and great value We always make a beeline for this shop when we re nearby

Went to Nonno s for the first time last weekend with my wife just for a meal out We booked late and could only get a table at 6 45 which shows how busy and popular this restaurant is but this was fine for us  We were nicely greeted on arrival the order for drinks was taken quickly and when we ordered the food it came quickly was well presented looked and tasted excellent There was a choice of 3 Specials for main course - I chose the Medallions of Beef in a Masala wine sauce with Asparagus It was excellent My wife chose Seafood Rissotto which was tasty and had a good selection of seafood in it  Now Nonno s is not cheap but you get what you pay for It is well staffed and serves quality food I would recommend it for an Occasion meal Of course if you can afford to go on a whim then do so

Popped into this one in the Hilton Hotel near Tower Bridge Great restaurant and bulletproof in terms of what you can I usually go for the squid for starters and then see what the specials are for main course Great value and food

Called in for a coffee and was excited by the innovative menu on offer I had avocado cheesecake which was very good and my wife had a borek platter which was good - and huge Certainly worth a visit if you want something to eat that is not typical coffee shop

We booked late and they accommodated 16 of us the service was excellent the food order was made in good time and it all arrived together and considering the restaurant was fully booked that was good The food was all very good tasty and well prepared definitely worth a visit
Came here for the first time last weekend I love this type of food staff was polite food was a little pricey for what it is but really enjoyed it Thanks

My family and I recently visited this restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed our experience We were immediately greeted upon arrival by Raj who was fantastically enthusiastic He made sure we felt comfortable and at ease throughout the evening The food was delicious with lots of variety from diverse backgrounds It was very easy to find your way around There was a family atmosphere which emphasised the fact that the restaurant is enjoyable for all ages We would definitely go again if possible  Howard Family

We haven t been here for a few months after some bad experiences with waiting time Today was totally different  The pub was relatively empty but the staff were very attentive We ordered our food and it came very quickly I had the chicken pie and it was delicious My family member had the ham egg and chips She said it was the best ham she had had in ages  The prices are reasonable Our only sight negative was the options on the menu A few of our old favourites didn t seem to be on the menu There is still plenty of choice though

All sorts of drinks meals and interesting objects-d arte in one location Very unusual settling with out-door log burning kilns that have scented smoke and remind of the old charcoal burners hideaways  A lovely experience that sets out to entertain with good giggs on many evenings and comes into its own most of all in the summer  Highly recommended

Royton is not known for it s restaurants however this branch of a chain of restaurants has proved to be a gem We were given a warm and genuine welcome Our table by the window was great The menu was not too long with a good selection for anyone Our waiters were always available and helpful The food arrived quickly and was very good Drinks were very good with a good selection of wines The restaurant was very busy which demonstrates the success of this restaurant
Nice atmosphere decent food good place to eat with a group of friends or family Good friend staff heledto make it a nice evening
Great friendly service and atmosphere always busy and not long to wait good food and fun menu Burger and chips a speciality and a treat well cooked and served
My friends and family go to Chefs regularly the food is good the price is right but best is the service  If you want something cooking to your taste no problem as it should be
Beautiful setting with great views Wonderful menu if a little on the expensive side for some things First class service and friendly efficient staff Not the place for a light meal Burger and chips 12

I tried the Swan and Dog for the first time recently having previously eaten at the Old Mill and Chequers on the Green pubs It was a Sat night and the place was packed but the food arrived promptly and I was pleased to see that the portions were as seems to be a signiture of these pubs big  This is definitely a good place to go with friends if you want atmosphere decent food and big portions
Valve for money friend sly staff A must for that better burger excellent corporation pop and it s free have two glasses

My wife and I have visited several Chaophraya restaurants in different cities and have never been disappointed with the meal we ve had This time it was the lamb shank massamam yellow curry and it was fantastic Honestly a great alternative to a traditional Thai dish The service is always good and was again when we visited although it s a little more expensive - I do believe in paying more for good food and good service so am always happy to do so and would definitely go back to any Chaophraya restaurant

booked a table weeks ago and thinking it may be busy No need to really Nice atmosphere with a good crowd being catered for with the waiting staff attentive Ours was Sean who catered for our needs Food was good with bruschetta and dipping oil as an entree I had a Portobello mushroom starter followed by a Pizza and enjoyed a large Peroni Partner had Hake on a griddle which she really enjoyed  Recommend checking the drinks prices as they can really bump up the bill Enjoyed the night and will call again when in Exeter

Booked in this friendly restaurant again on our recent stay in Boscastle Have eaten here before and it s one of those places where you re pleased to say it never changes Quality of food and wine is consistently good here and that s matched by the friendly and attentive service from the staff and owners  Brilliant
The quality of the food is good but the main appeal is the ambience and the service It s a lovely relaxed atmosphere and a nice place to go even just for a drink

I had an absolutely fantastic time This was my second time visiting so we decided to take the kids Was family friendly they enjoyed the play area Overall the atmosphere was friendly and inviting The food was good however i felt the wine list was lacking The staff were superb especially the waiters and waitresses My waitress made my average Tuesday feel special and her enthusiasm was a refreshing change I will definitely be visiting again

His is perched above Lyme Regis bay a heart thumping walk up winding steps but commanding a magnificent view out to sea  We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and were looked after brilliantly by the staff The place was busy as it was the height of the tourist season and the room was warm in fact very warm at times but luckily we were placed near a door to the terrace My wife started with the local grab which was an generous portion of fresh and tasty meat served with fresh bread - magnificent I had the the fish fingers and chips for main but had food envy again for my wife s brill The restaurant very generously game us free chocolate s to finish our night We ll be back

Visited the coffee shop for some coffee Dorset apple cake and stunning views Wasn t dissapointed Lovely day so went outside the front not the hotel where there was seating for the views and also a sculpture of the Olympic rings
I ve been going to this Indian for 6 years It is the best in Sunbury - nice food attentive service and a nice beer selection  The food is priced competitively

Nice country open planed pub with great atmosphere Good selection of draft beers and well kept the food was excellent with plenty to choose from liked the option that my Son was able to have a smaller portion sizes which was priced accordingly
Good friendly service terrific food and wine choices Lively atmosphere without being too loud   Will be returning again and again

We fell upon this place whilst looking for somewhere to eat before attending a rugby match on Friday night  I have given the restaurant 4 stars but would have liked to have given it 4 5 if possible We did have a small issue with a side order but the lovely lady who works there I believe it s her family restaurant could not do enough to resolve the issue giving us another free side order  My wife loved her saut€÷ed mushroom meal and I had a gorgeous and large porcini pizza  If ever we are in the area again we will definitely go back
Back in the area and Mac remembered me straight away made to feel welcome with good service and a smile Tarka dall is excellent

We had dinner on Valentine s night Things did not start well Having given our name the Maitre D took us to the wrong table and then left us standing in the middle of the dining room like spare parts at a wedding while he went off to find the right table Having seated us he brought the wrong menu so then went off again to find the correct one We were surprised at the lack of professionalism  After that however things greatly improved The sommelier and the waiters were excellent The menu was varied and beautifully presented It tasted good too We would have given 5 stars had it not been a poor start When we are next in London we may pay another visit

Sunday lunch with my 80 year old father and his partner Three course table d hote menu  12 for 1 courses  18 for 2 and 21 for 3 We had all 3  10 discretionary service charge Perfectly OK for us  Lovely crab salad to start for me with Cod for main and cheese board three cheeses to finish Complimentary and tasty bread came first Other guests had a barley and lamb soup followed by chicken breast and lovely puddings  Very good value  We were first to arrive at about 12 30 Was a bit worried when empty but quickly filled up Leisurely meal over ca 2 hours was just what we wanted Service not speedy but perfectly acceptable  There are ca 5 or 6 steep steps to get access to restaurant important when you are dining with 80 year olds  but there is a wheelchair lift by the side albeit we didn t see it used  We were able to park immediately outside - might have been fortunate  Overall - worked for us Would go back if in area again

Arrived and were seated quickly and given menus and offered a drink immediately Service service service this place has got the right attitude The food was well presented cooked to perfection and all served with a smile We will return very soon Justin & family

Stopped on the way into Fareham shopping centre It s a good choice to have a late full breakfast and is was really nice & good cup of mocha coffee to Staff are all very happy and helpful and willing to supply a good service and it shows Coffee is lovely Italian type coffee and it was a really enjoyable eating experience

We had a really enjoyable evening at the restaurant This is part of the excellent Royal William Yard development and is a great location  The staff are efficient and friendly trying to make the visit a real pleasure Food is freshly cooked and comes promptly to your table A tasty option for all occasions

Bill s arrived in Horsham with a buzz of excitement that I have not encountered over a restaurant in the Town before its reputation throughout Sussex is well known and its huge success in Brighton and Lewes is expected to be mirrored in Horsham but has the one time independent now turned into just another chain I went along to find out  Immediately I was struck by the venue the former town hall of Horsham Owner Bill Collinson has chosen his location and building as carefully as ever and it pays off with its unique and beautiful architecture contrasting the homely rustic interior The familiar produce and wares are still present although not in the abundance to be found in the other  stores   This is definitely more of a restaurant with a cosy ambience and a relaxed soundtrack the caf€÷ feel of the Bills Brighton is gone and replaced with a trendy London feel We were escorted upstairs to our table and served well by attentive staff who although marginally over keen were polite and capable  To start I ordered the bruschetta of British marzanino tomatoes and basil The bruschetta was slightly over toasted however this didn t detract from the dish being tasty and filling with a nice dashing of balsamic vinegar and some goat s cheese to add a different texture to quite a crunchy dish  For the main I had the pan fried salmon with beetroot tortellini with a pea mint and chickory salad The salmon was slightly dry on top but perfectly cooked in the middle the salad beneath was a nice contrast and the tartare was refreshing Unfortunately my beetroot tortellini was delicious but far too few two pieces of medium sized tortellini made me thanks the stars I had eaten a starter  To finish I had the warm chocolate brownie which although adequate was nothing more To drink I had the La garenne syrah with the starter and the Le duc viognier with the main both were well priced and complimented the dishes particularly the second  Despite enjoying the evening I admit to being a little confused by Bills Horsham it is clearly a restaurant but seems to struggle with the evening weekend dining experience and appears to be much more suited to the daytime meals and coffee brigade The laid back Lewes Brighton vibe is replaced by a slightly awkward muddle of formal evening and informal daytime dining  The building although beautiful and fantastically finished was cold and led to one of the staff bringing my wife a blanket which is fine outside a pub but in a restaurant where the bill for two easily reaches 50 I will leave that up to you I think it is a small gripe for such a great restaurant and it didn t tarnish our visit  All in all our evening was very good and certainly a nice change of speed from the Italian chain-fest that is East Street and we will definitely be returning The variation of the menu the location and the undeniable beauty of the interior and exterior makes this an excellent edition to Horsham and despite the slight identity crisis is still clearly a must visit for the area  http  esbreviews blogspot co uk

We visited the Crispin yesterday evening for dinner and beer Excellent pub very friendly welcome Showed the menu table of our choice Curried goat and dumpling for 2 of the guests plus a sirloin steak for myself The sweets were excellent cheesecake cheeseboard ice cream and treacle tart Good beers from the Green Hop Ales of Mad Cat Brewery Overall excellent

Tried to get a table at TGI Fridays but was fully booked so was given this restaurant  as a recommendation  Not knowing what to expect since a true Roadhouse can be a rowdy place went with open mind  On arrival was greeted politely buy two burly doormen who asked if we had a reservation which I initially thought implied if u haven t your not getting in  which for 7pm on a Thursday was surprising   but we did have one and so was escorted down stairs  which means no wifi   We was shown to a booth  I d ask every time of a booth as the tables seem a tad small  Our waitress was very prompt and greeted us with a lovely warm smile  in truth Chanel was the highlight but Anna who it turns out was on her first day was an able back up  gave us the cocktail menu and took our drinks order and allowed us to peruse the menu at our leisure  The menu it has to be said is a tad basic but then it s is just a Roadhouse   But even I was able to find something to order so it can t be too bad   battered squid and ribs  The food was lovely though if I m very harsh I d say the plates  metal  and the glasses plastic  left me thinking really   If I did have a criticism I d say it was the size of the plastic glasses  was it  I m a non drinker and so I will have a soft drink but there glasses are just one size  SMALL or regular large is not available which is annoying and expensive   The RoadHouse has a late licence and fills up later on in the evening with alive band from 9pm and a dance floor  It s a place I would go to again even if Chanel wasn t working lol

No bigger than a coffee shop so you ll have to book but what a great little place Fine service and knowledgeable staff with quality wines and food to match  For an idea of the price we ordered 3 wine tasting sets 3 x 50ml with 5 cheeses and 5 wines and two coffees to finish which came to 65  Westbourne is a great place with plenty of places to go for drinks after so make a night of it

We haven t visited this restaurant since Diane was in charge Oh how the atmosphere has taken a nose dive The current incumbent Maitre d has an appalling attitude and table manner Friends of ours who visit regular have the same opinion Everything seems to be too much trouble for this guy and his sarcasm knows no bounds The young staff are superb and can t be faulted they raised their eye brows when we questioned his table manner they said other people had said how inappropriate his attitude was for Il rosso they apologised and said that that was just the way he was My wife and Sisterinlaw wanted steak and both asked for it to be well done but oh no not with this chef He thinks he knows better than us how we want our food It would seem you can have your steak any which way you want here as long as it s bleeding all over the plate Come on Il rosso lets get some standards back or even better get Diane back

Ive been travelling around West Midlands and stopped in Pendulum pub for couple drinks and food Surprisingly food was lovely very fresh well served Drinks was for reasonable price and really good have no complain Pub was worm and nice while outside was cold Stuff was really helpful and friendly
We had a meal in here recently whilst staying at the Crossover B&B good food and atmosphere fire was crackling and service was really good

Had a nice sit down meal and a few pints at the Fox Excel during Comic Con at Excel Despite being almost full at least 800 people  The food came out within 15 minutes and was very good The staff were polite despite other reviews i have read on here and were very helpful in helping me charge my phone and call a taxi  I will be coming back in October

Walking in it certainly has its own character which you wouldn t expect from how it looks on the outside The menu is dripping in BBQ glory I opted for the pork burger and was not disappointed Though pricey it tasted great it would ve been nice to have some fries thrown in for the cost though Enjoyed the rum-based cocktail forgetting the name but complemented the food nicely A few of us stayed later for the live music all very enjoyable and a nice evening out overall

I visited Brasserie blanc southbank for their preview of the autumn menu I was pleasently suprissed at the high level of service and the great quality of food I have been to the venu many times before when it was Chez Gerard and I felt that brasserie Blanc have really lived up to the expectations of a real brasserie in France As I said my experience was excellent and I will definately return many times

Went for a meal with my wife as had been getting good reviews  Food was tasty and well presented Only slight issue was that the service was a little slow Don t known if it was just a blip but that is the only thing they need to get on top of in my opinion but would go again
It was really nice experience in your restaurant I was in Brixton and was looking for somewhere to eat for a lunch time You guys really surprise me with your service and food
The staff are very friendly and the potions are large so visit when you are hungry The food is very good and served with a smile every time

I was great need of a good shot of decent coffee and asked for a strong cup WOW  superb strength but not bitter black coffee with carrot cake millionaires shortbread needs some work to get taste up a bit

It makes a great change in a city like Bath to have a very modern place to eat Right next to the station platforms and about to start brewing beer within the restaurant it s got a fair bit of novelty too The food was generally really good although the chicken was a little dry the drinks were good they brew plenty of options off this site already  The service was really good attentive nicely so and everything came at the right time Would happily recommend and will probably return
Liked the food although a bit more would be good speed of service was good  Took clients out and they seemed to enjoy it Very good overall

Great Value Italian Food My wife had the spaghetti bolognese which she just adores I had the chicken breast with creamy mushroom sauce - the chicken was a little over cooked and rubbery which was disappointing you need to keep a check on consistent food quality  I had the same dish last month when I was in London I ve been visiting the same restaurant for years and it was definitely much better My sons had pizzas which were excellent My daughter-in-law had the lamb shank which was delicious Excellent house white wine I will return but maybe not for the chicken breast

Star and Garter is a great addition to the Falmouth food scene We went for evening dinner and the staff were friendly and the atmosphere is good The menu is always good however they had run out of two of our choices and we had to change our order Saying that what we did order was very nice The view from the restaurant is very nice but when we booked they can not reserve a table by the window which is a shame When we visited there was evening entertainment which was nice a lady playing the piano Although a bit loud if wanting a quite evening meal Overall good food good servise and a good experience

Great food we had the sharing platter for starter and the Thai green curry and the hair red curry Both brilliant Service also very good Only part that could be improved is the atmosphere - listening to one direction doesn t really create that Thai dining feeling

We visited Leo s on Saturday the 2nd of July and were pleasantly surprised first of all the older lady that welcomed us and took our orders sorry we didn t catch her name was lovely gave us advice on our food and didn t rush us to order All our food came in good time and was very tasty My pizza was one of the best I ve ever had I d also recommend they cheese and tomato garlic bread  I think they also do takeaways any chance of delivering to Sheffield  We will definitely be back

It was Christmas Eve and we had booked to see the panto at The Theatre Royal We arrive at Ask at midday and did not have a booking Nearly all the tables were reserved but the manager did his best to accommodate us 4 adults and 2 kids into a booth The food and service was very good This is a very good little restaurant with classic Italian food in a relax friendly environment
Nice food nice staff Had four poached eggs on brown bread and Mike had full breakfast realy good will visit again in the near future
Nice quirky place very community-spirited eg jam on sale raising funds for local projects  and the best coffee in south Leeds as far as I know

Six of us took up the 35 four course deal incuding flowing prosecco The food was excellent and the ambience was very good The only down side was a surprise on the bill Having had a couple of welcome drinks and a couple of after dinner cocktails really bumped up the bill a lot - and I mean a lot So go for the food and drink deal and stick to it
Sometime service can be slow because they only have 1 person serving Good choice of Real Ales available
Visited on lunchtime with some work colleagues Food was excellent and 2 courses for 10 on lunch menu was fantastic value Will go again

No fuss just a simple cafe serving dumplings and light asian food Foods are freshly made and delicious Dumplings are their specialities The fried noodle with red ginger was delicious and tasty This cafe offers an intimate asiatic feel with friendly waiters

We have been before a number of times and decided to treat our friends for their wedding anniversary booked and attended 6 of us and were taken downstairs for our drinks cocktails Then to the table the staff were very polite the information about the steaks was attentive & very helpful Food as always delicious they also brought the celebrating pair a glass of fizzy each nice touch in a busy but relaxing and comfortable setting Not cheap but good value and well worth a visit or two

Initially greeted warmly by the barman who proceeded to take drinks orders which turned up quickly Starts to go down from here - took 25 minutes for someone to take our order Not good as in a rush The waitress seemed unsure as to what to do From here on things get better Starters took max ten minutes to arrive and were excellent Main course appeared shortly after and was perfect  Would have got 5 stars but for that initial delay in taking orders

Very cosy pub friendly staff and a more than decent Sunday dinner Even though the food area was packed the service was quick Good value at under 10 Can t comment on the standard menu as our whole party had the Sunday lunch  I have also been in just for a pint and would recommend A good local pub in a fantastic location

Due to the poor quality in the Ramada next door we embarked on the Boathouse and we were not disappointed It was a busy Friday night yet we managed to get a table and order some Hunters Chicken and Burger and chips the food was of a very decent standard

Not many restaurants in Sheffield would have a buzz about them on a Monday night but The Castle did Obviously the mix of great pub food and draught beers is a winner with the locals and those like me that travelled from Leeds  Service was great and the whole experience very good

I had dinner here with my partner and a friend after work The welcome was warm by the staff and we were presented with a well curated wine list After being presented with a very nice bottle of wine our starters arrived  The choice of food was focused but wide enough for variety with very well balanced flavours It was all quite delicious and certainly a nice mix of French and Italian culinary heritage presented in a way that is accessible  I would recommend for a small group of friendly foodies or an intimate dinner with that special someone

Our family of 6 called at this Hostelry at midday on August 9th on our way to Bristol Airport The Winford Arms has a goodly sized car park and many tables both inside and out for familys to partake of a drink and or food Despite being very busy we were all served with our meal in a relatively short space of time The food was piping hot and of good quality staff were conscientious and enquired whether everything was satisfactory and were happy to take our further orders for drinks at the table A definite must for food whenever you are in the area
Had a fantastic meal excellent quality and a good price We ordered off the specials menu Mixed grill and Sole had desserts and a bottle of wine and had change out of 60 Very good indeed

We had a 2 night stay Sunday Monday  The room was full of character very well decorated large comfortable and very clean  The food was excellent on both nights and breakfast simply amazing Only disappointment was that the open fires were not lit minor detail  Good bus service to Henley and some great places to visit nearby Thank you to all the great staff at the White Hart for a great break  We left the restaurant before 10 30 on both nights so cannot comment on the previous review about being thrown out at 11 00

Having visited this pub restaurant before I honestly wasn t expecting much as in the past it has been mediocre at best but this time it was a little different On arrival we we re given a warm welcome by who I assume was the duty Manager - A young man in smart dress We approached the bar and again were greeted with a friendly hello we ordered drinks and were reminded that we would need a table number to order food The food arrived in good time and was hot and well presented It was probably the best meal we ve had from an outlet of this type We ordered deserts after and they were very nice too I hope they keep up the good work I will be visiting again to find out

Must be the best place to eat in Warrington Located in a Manor House in Victoria Park The ambience is superb The menu is short but with excellent choices The lamb was beautifully prepared and really succulent The staff were attentative but not overbearing The live music was present but in the background Will definitely return

Went with a large group 35 of us for a Christmas meal Lovely food not rushed and great atmosphere I ve never had a bad meal here Very reasonable Great so far But when we wanted to sit and chat with our drinks the Karaoke was put on Bizarre range of songs for a Dec 2013 songbook Morcombe and Wise Bring me sunshine Wonderwall New York New York Hey Baby Someone said that they were a group of songs for drunks Not very Christmassy Also it was on REALLY LOUD to the point that we ended up leaving though we d have preferred to say longer and have a few more drinks
Lovely fish and chips quick polite service and very popular Would recommend and will visit again when we are in Seaton

I have been to Red Peppers twice now within the last month Both times have been varying in terms of service quality whilst the food itself has been excellent  Located within the Mailbox complex Red Peppers is a very inviting restaurant that seems to cater for varying cuisine styles I like how they blend popular stuff such as pasta and pizza into a menu with burritos and steaks Very versatile Both times visiting I have had the Chicken Burrito which is very yummy plentiful portion with a nice amount of garnish Their pizzeria breads are also yummy The ambiance is warm and relaxing the walls decorated with varying items This aspect of the restaurant really does not have faults  As for the service the first time was great Very attentive and pleasant staff The second time however bearing in mind it was on a relatively quiet Sunday afternoon wasn t so great The staff seemed rather lazy and a lack of attention really seemed to come through Having worked in the restaurant business before I know how sometimes it can be a bit tedious therefore I m always willing to be a bit more relaxed about service quality This however was pretty poor and reflects badly upon the restaurant Which is a shame considering the quality of cuisine on offer I feel this is one aspect that could be improved  Overall Red Peppers is certainly a restaurant I would recommend it just doesn t seem to tick all the boxes consistently at the present time
Nice clean and pleasent pub with a lovely view out on to the river just sit and enjoy the sunshine as people wave as they pass by A+++
We had full run of the private function room which had a bar solely provided for our use The service was also dedicated to our every wish The whole evening was a pure delight
We have been going to this restaurant for a few years It has changed hands in that time but the quality of food stays good Larger choice of food recently you can always find something you will like

We re Blackpool locals and tend to avoid Blackpool restaurants as generally speaking they don t have a great reputation Trip Advisor has started to make us think again We visited AJ s on the basis of its reviews and rankings Certainly it s not much to look at from the street - indeed you could easily miss it altogether - but inside AJ s is spacious airy and modern without being cold We opted for the midweek specials menu of simple yet well priced options We began with an excellent homemade pate complemented by a delicious chutney The gammon dish that followed was well cooked with the very best chips I ve had in ages Hardly haute cuisine but perfect after a busy day at work The house wine was good and the wider menu looked interesting and varied if a little on the pricey side  Best of all though was the service from the owner and her daughter Friendly attentive amusing and extremely personable without ever feeling forced or overdone It turned a restaurant to which I would probably return into a restaurant I ll definitely try again And next time I ll be exploring some of the steaks which sounded delicious

I ve been looking for a really good Japanese restaurant since visiting Japan and have tried several offerings in London but have been left wanting However that has all changed now since discovering Eat Tokyo their food is the best I ve tasted since being in Japan and at a price that is palatable too I have already been back and will be a regular from now on

Good Indian in the city centre Nice to go with a bunch of people so you can order plentiful enormous naan breads - COVERED in garlic really yummy It s really lovely place to dine if not a little noisy but that s ok if you re with a bunch of people Very swish decor and nice lighting which makes it a bit of an event The food is lovely and nicely presented- there are some great vegetarian options on the menu too I feel that it was slightly expensive probably due to aforementioned decor location but not overly so for such a nice experience Also add the staff are polite and nice Defo want to go again and try something like a paneer curry

We enjoyed a family dinner at the Queen and Castle for the first time in several months We were upstairs it was quite busy and overall the experience was enjoyable Food was good - Seafood Platter Fish & Chips Sea Bass Burger all nicely presented Only moan was that that coffees and dessert went a little off track and arrived bit by bit

Opened in January 2016 presumably in the same premises occupied previously by Ciao Ciao  Amarone Ristorante is an excellent new Italian restaurant My wife and I were impressed by the warm welcome the extent of the menu the quality of the food and the coverage of her necessary gluten-free diet The highlight for both of us was the Ragu which accompanied pasta tagliatelle for me and gluten-free fusilli for her

3 course good value set lunch at 14 95 today had plenty of choice with 5 options to choose from 2 with supplements This gives a very nice deliberation over the menu  Jug of tap water served without requesting - very nice touch  Small carafe 500cl of house wine tasty and mellow  Coffee at 2 50 not extortionate  Not been here for a few years but it still retains a class act in the culinary department in suburban Bristol Not far from Redland station but in the Residents Parking Zone during daytime hours so you may have to pay to park locally if not on foot  Well recommended

We went on a busy weekend late afternoon Good atmosphere as soon as we entered A very helpful staff member Zivile talked my elderly mother through the menu explaining each dish and then ensured through the evening that we were satisfied All the various food served was well presented and without exception excellent A great place to go for a family outing thoroughly recommended

We picked an odd time to go to The Castle 4 o clock on a Sunday and crossed our fingers everything was as good as it had been previously  It was  Lovely French Onion soup on a wet and miserable day in July followed by a T-Bone steak cooked exactly how I ordered it Lovely service even as it got busier and busier all of the meals were of a decent quality the Sunday Dinner platter looks amazing  Puddings looked good too and a lovely pint of Speckeled Hen to top it all off

Cam only talk about Sunday lunch -12 quid or big plate with 3 meats for for 14 quid Good feed with plenty of spuds yorkies and veg Not fine dining but a good grub at the right price portion which we all enjoyed   Large selection of ale and some nice quality largers  Nice guy who runs the pub and makes time to talk and welcome to customers

My wife and i decided to start Xmas early this year and chose The Plume of Feathers for our Xmas meal - we were not disappointed I had the salmon and prawn starter and it was delicious - my wife had and enjoyed the pate We both had turkey and all the trimmings for our main - the vegetables were all cooked perfectly  the parsnips were my favourite  - it was piping hot loads of it and the turkey was tasty After a short break the trifle and cheese and biscuits arrived which we duly polished off but now we were both stuffed - but we still had more to come in the shape of a couple of small mince pies each Service was with a smile and very efficient Its a nice cosy pub too with a homely atmosphere So all in all - a great success If you have not been - give it a try - and hopefully you will enjoy it as much as we did Jim and Moira Stevenage

I visited with my family a little while ago We were feeling hungry and we spotted a sign for a little diner down an alley We looked at the menu which included cooked breakfasts snacks American food and the usual selection of drinks and we decided to stop by  The first thing you notice is the decorations on the wall The artwork is all based on comic book heroes like Spiderman and Wonder Woman My nephews are mad on these characters so they loved it I thought it worked well with the American diner theme The children were also given super hero colouring sheets with crayons The crayons were on their last legs but they still enjoyed it  The furniture overall was a little tired The carpet wasnt in great condition and the chairs while comfy enough we a little dated Overall the funky decor did enough to make it a decent place to eat  The waitress was very friendly and was very good with the children She seemed to be doing a lot of running around including upstairs to the kitchen  Perhaps they would benefit from another member of staff though I suspect that financially it wouldnt be viable  We were served in good time The menu offered a decent choice and the prices were reasonable When the food arrived it was very tasty I had a breakfast which was clean and nicely presented The children shared a couple of sides and the portions were good The tea and coffee were both good as were the milkshakes for the children  Overall we had a nice lunch here The decor lends itself to people with children who were kept entertained throughout the meal  The waitress was friendly if a little rushed off her feet  If I were to visit Truro again I would consider a return visit and I would probably recommend a vist for those interested in American cuisine as long as you dont expect too much from the decor

Me and my partner went to this Chinese restaurant because it was very near our hotel therefore convenient to get to  The inside of the restaurant is very nice and pretty but the outside needs a little modernisation or a new layer of paint to neaten it up a bit  The staff were friendly and easy to understand as well as accommodating so no problems in that department  The food itself was very good In my opinion Chinese food starters are the best and this doesn t disappoint I would recommend the barbecued pork ribs and the dumplings The noodles with the main course were very good not overly greasy like a lot of other Chinese restaurant do noodles  Overall an enjoyable meal would recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Chinese food
Was very noisy when I visited however it was a Friday night but otherwise very happy with this restaurant

We had booked the pre-theatre menu which included a cocktail and had been tempted to have a dessert which we wouldn t normally do - great decision The starter and the main course were both really good but the chocolate mousse was one of the best I ve ever had - worth going back for just to get this It s a really good atmosphere in Hix and the food and service complement it - if you have time pop into the bar downstairs from the restaurant - very buzzy A great place all round

I have read many reviews about the rude attitude of the staff here In my opinion you will be treated the same way that you treat them and I was only ever treated with courtesy and a friendly welcome  The rooms are clean and tidy the breakfast is superb The menu for evening dining is fairly limited but that allows the excellent young chef to deliver beautifully cooked food every time I highly recommend this place for a stopover or short break

Visited with my girlfriend on a hot sunday lunhtime in June 2014 Arbutus offers a 3 course set lunch meal for 19 95 per person The food was nice with a nice balance of flavours and neat presentation It was not delicious but it was pleasant and I would recommend Arbutus however I would never have guessed that it had a michelin star based on the meal I had  I would highly recommend the cocktails which were fantastic and like the meal reasonably priced The service was efficient though lacked any personal touch A pleasant meal not exceptional but pleasant

We went at lunch time before a concert good value at 16 per head for adults and 9 for children however it is quite a lot more in the evening Great buffet selection of salads and side dishes really tasty and well prepared We enjoyed the various kinds of meat being served at the table found it all delicious and there was no problem with the speed of service however the restaurant was fairly empty Coffee was good too One point to make although they do offer a vegetarian option it is really a place for meat eaters would definitely go again at lunchtime

After I read the reviews I popped n for an early dinner with my wife The staff were friendly and chatty The burger was very good we tried rosemary chips and they were excellent We especially liked the milkshakes which came in some unusual flavours Salted caramel to die for Highly recommended

We passed the Firehouse grill when on holiday in st Ives and it always looked busy and had a good atmosphere so we booked a table they were very busy and we got a late table the staff were very friendly we ordered starters and mains the Posh burgers were lovely they cost about ten pounds with Stilton and red onion as extra but worth the money  A good night
What a fun way to eat great relaxed atmosphere and exceptional food  Get your bibs on and get stuck in Great fun place for a date or with friends

A great retro venue for dinner on a Saturday night brunch on Sunday or midweek coffee and cake Food is always very good great selection of cakes and a lovely atmosphere Only negative is the venue is cash only and alas cash machines are few and far between on Lark Lane

The restaurant was very busy the staff efficient and friendly and the food was delicious The service was quick which is exactly what was needed as we were going to a show and did not want to be delayed

Marstons new pubs are really well designed with lots of comfortable seating areas with windows The service is quick and efficient with a good choice of menu The food was excellent and the Marston s Pedigree beer is as good as it gets

I visit for a friends birthday and there was a fairly large group of us we were a bit of a nuisance with billing and seating - The food is great and the atmosphere is too There s also wide range of selections for all appetites Jim who served us was incredibly friendly Thank you Jim
Visited this restaurant just before the Wembley FA final on Sunday 23 March Very clean Good food polite service and reasonable price I would visit again

We turned up at 10 45pm so felt a little guilty asking for a table  the staff were welcoming and friendly  I have previously been to Little Bay restaurant in Farringdon and had been impressed by the menu food quality and value for money This Brighton restaurant has similar selling points  Had the beef carpaccio to start - a nice texture of meat combined well with onion capers and some cornichons I had the duck confit for main course and Lucy had the fillet steak Everything was cooked perfectly well seasoned and tasty the sauces were full of flavour even the veg was good The profiteroles for dessert were good but we struggled to finish them  The whole experience was satisfying enjoyable delicious and excellent value for money I have never had such appealing food for the same cost  The atmosphere is intimate although the red heavy curtains are a little oppressive I cannot fault the staff even right at the end of their shift they were professional without exception  I definitely recommend this place and its counterparts in London for excellent food atmosphere and value for money

Went to Kungfu on a Friday evening 5 30 and booking advisable and had a 2 hour slot for eating Despite the place virtually full with a buzzing atmosphere we had more than enough time to eat our food We were helped and guided by a young waiter Adrian who could not have been more helpful Nothing was too much trouble for him Good selection of food - limited though if you are vegan vegetarian Dim sung were a little dry but all other dishes were adequately warm Sweets selection to die for I certainly think it represents good value for money and would not put anyone off from trying it Have to say that I had read reviews of Kungfu prior to my visit and some were not too good -rude staff cold food but at was not my experience Would I go again -yes

Wandering around Camden looking for dinner so used the tripadvisor app and saw the single review for this place so thought we d try So glad we did - we never would have found it otherwise and had excellent pizza lovely crispy thin base and pretty much any topping you could want Great value friendly service - just want you want for a casual but tasty meal that s not one of the chains

we went and had the all day breakfast and found it to be very tasty  well cooked and terrific value  Coffee is fresh and not to strong  just the way I like it and the owners who are also front of hohse are welcomming and obliging  the kids even get a complimentory lolly  Can t quite understand the review by Heacham girl  it seems at odds with our experience  and we ve been several times now  I d say give them a try and form your own opinion  I sure you won t be disappointed
steels is one Restaurant you keep going back to  great food great service the tables could be bigger  warm friendly staff
Warm welcome from very friendly and helpful staff Lovely decor inside and comfortable lounge area outside Haven t visited for a while but been back twice in a week
Great atmosphere and quality food We will be visiting again in the near future  Great to see quality restaurants and micro brewery bars in Whitley bay

Post theatre nosh up Had the smallest Sirloin but it was sooo gorgeous The barman showed so little knowledge of the wines that I have dropped a star off but otherwise this is somewhere I can t wait to take my Date again And they very pleasantly arranged for us to sit side-by-side rather than opposite &lt 3

Without doubt a high class chippy For me the problem is that there is never anything ready and you order on entry which means that there is always a waiting queue for your food and it can sometimes take a long time which can be very annoying especially if you are short on time However the food is well worth waiting for excellently cooked and served with a smile
Food is tasty and portion size about right I ve been when it s reasonably busy and waiting times and quality goes down a bit

Popped in here for a business lunch and was very pleased with the speed of service and quality of food for the price Very knowledgeable and polite staff Next time I m in the area I will go out of my way to visit

Don t let the Fish and Chips put you off - this is a high quality restaurant with good food good serving sizes I never go for the large portions now  great service always clean and it s licenced if you need a drink I always order lightly battered fish my wife always have grilled fish with salad I have never been disappointed here and will always visit when in Shepton

As always the staff a friendly and the food is of a high standard I recommend going when it is not busy as the wait times can be long but that is in no way the fault of the staff as thy are a small family run business

A really warm and welcoming atmosphere with an excellent choice of dishes Also very good value We were with an Italian colleague and the Pizza got a big thumbs up from him which is a real recommendation

I can take or leave pizza but really enjoy the pizza on offer at Tradizioni Having looked through some recent reviews I am astonished by quite how many pizza experts are out there -- comparing these pizzas to Domino s or Zizzi s offerings is frankly bizarre As stated by many Tradizioni offers a particular not-thin and not-thick pizza base the like of which I have certainly eaten in Italy But all that aside the appeal of this place for me is that it is independent fairly priced convivial and the food comes fresh and fast It is not a place for lingering or to my mind a romantic evening it is a fun friendly clean unpretentious joint that does very tasty pizza good vegetarian options at fair prices I d far sooner eat here than in some tedious plastic pizza chain

First visit here   quite a small place but adds to the atmosphere We were 2 couples who sat at the rear part of the searing area We went for the set menus  all I can say we were unable to eat everything The food was fabulous if I must say one of our friends is a vegetarian and she really enjoyed what they had within the set meals Most certainly will be back   the reason for not getting 5 stars would be for the place being fairly small and compact  nothing more than than  great staff helped with the menu
