Really tasty breakfast for a fabulously affordable price For a spoons the interior is above most spoons i ve been in Food gets there quick coffee is free refill in the mornings as well It s making me hungry now hopefully my Chinese comes soon then I can review that yay

Been going Derby Pool for years I really enjoy their food especially the BBQ chicken stack  They have a free salad bar available with every main meal purchased and refill drinks dispenser available with every fizzy drink purchased  Prices are very reasonable and staff are very friendly  Parking right outside and wifi available

This restaraunt provides a varied selection of cuisine from the mainly Indian menu The service is good with knowledgable staff who are happy to explain the menu and suggest appropriate side dishes The food was full of subtle flavours with nothing overpowering or over spiced despite having a byriani it was not a mouth burning experience but perfectly balanced Definitely one to return to -

Been going regularly for the last 3 years and have recently seen a vast improvement The new landlord is doing his best under difficult circumstances I personally can see the improvements and know of further improvements to come The food is now excellent and the waitresses are friendly and always willing to help Certain comments recently that I have read about this pub are grossly over the top and I think the people making these comments have a hidden agenda

I would highly recommend the Bloody Mary burger well actually any of the burgers  Generous portions and friendly staff I enjoy the humorous quirky menu however i wouldn t recommend this place if your looking for a romantic meal as it s not that pretty and has the odd old dog wandering about
We ate at the bar downstairs Fabulous Jamon Serrano and some nice white wine The guy behind the bar - Cameron was great and very attentive Good place to go

I went to the One-eyed Cat for our joint Xmas do and it was as I have ever found it excellent I have yet to have anything less than excellent food in this place but what always make it special is the level and quality of service It is friendly and attentive without being too much especially noteworthy on such a busy day

The food is excellent and rates highly with the family Family age ranges are from 3 yrs to 63 yrs Really friendly reception followed up with very friendly and helpful staff The restaurant has a very nice atmosphere which is great for enjoying a relaxing family meal  The meal was delivered fresh and hot and within a very acceptable time scale from ordering As a family we have visited the restaurant on 3 occasions and will certainly add to that figure An all round very good experience I would certainly recommend the Las Iguanas restaurant at Cribbs Causeway Bristol and just a few minutes drive from the Cribbs Causeway M5 Motorway junction

We ve dined here on our annual Cornish visits 5 years in a row Never had a bad meal or a bad pint The food is really top notch for pub food and the chefs obviously take great pride in their work Thanks again  see you next year

Tasty burgers at restaurant prices During the busy period of the Christmas rush Five Guys managed to deliver on flawless timing The unequivocally wide array of drinks to choose from are a must try but note large fries are for more than two people Would definitely come again perhaps on a less abundant day in a bit to experience a more  well prepared burger

As a large group of 7 adults and 4 children visiting Freshford for the first time our experience of lunching at the Freshford Inn could not have been better We were reserved a table in a side area which gave us space and privacy the staff were fantastically attentive and the food delicious and good value for money We would highly recommend it

Actually it was the night before Saturday 2nd April We were a party of six four adults two teenagers Our table s were in the centre of the first room making it slightly difficult on one side to pass until we moved the tables a little Most double & foursome s seemed to have more space On refection the window seating may have served us better That s our only complaint As for the service the staff were extremely polite and very attentive The food was plentiful My starter Smoked Mackerel one would expect a fillet there was three could have served as a main meal The other starters Mushrooms Garlic Soup Pate & Melon were plentiful The Main courses Steak Hake two Chicken & two Vegetarian meals were beautifully presented with ample vegetables We struggled to clear our plates One could not finish the night off without a Sweet to end a very pleasant evening Thank You Blue Mountain

Popped in here for a quick bite to eat Service was pretty prompt given there was a large queue for takeaway always a good sign  We had 2 x haddock and chips and 2 x pie and chips with a drink each which still gave us change from 30 for a couple of ice creams
Had a really nice cappuccino in here  and chocolate cake The atmosphere was really nice  especially as it was near Christmas
Recently visited this restaurant on a Friday night and was pleasently surprised Really enjoyed the food especially the Pavlova   Worth a visit and will be returning Try it

We visited and really enjoyed our meals which were of a good size and good quality The bar area is quite old fashion and hence quite quaint and friendly the only draw back was the large Sky TV which was showing football a level which would not have been annoying but there were a group of young men who were very loud and seemed to love the sound of their voices

From outside Tiger Bills looks like a theme restaurant and my Malaysian-born partner was sceptical whether it would do authentic Asian food We ordered from the Thai menu and when the food arrived it was quite authentic so I m told  and tasted great The staff were friendly and we enjoyed the meal
The service was friendly the food was great the view is breathtaking The food especially the drinks are very pricey though

Booked the 7 Square restaurant after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor We were not disappointed The food was excellent cooked to perfection by a knowledgeable chef We had the set menu s with wine and it came to 50 for the two of us Not bad for Warwick The only complaint I would have was that the plates were cold and that meant the food got cold very quickly Apart from that the service and the ambiance were excellent

Great place in a fantastic spot on the beach at Polkerris Easy going lunch spoiled by the service from our server who was dour and had forgot her manners Pizza was excellent and well recommended Dessert was great too  Would recommend booking in advance to get a seat as there is limited seating

This is a deli and a cafe and I must say I was very pleasantly surprised by my lunch here Cafes on the front and the main drag often don t bother making much of an effort but here they obviously care about what they serve Friendly too
We went to Chester on a very cold Sunday and went here for a coffee and sandwich Good service Good sandwiches not expensive for city centre Great little stop for a refuel and warm
Popped in Saturday Got seats at the bar Cheap prices Good atmosphere Nice talent I ll be back guys

First-time visit while on business in Liverpool a quiet Thursday evening but we had a warm greeting and excellent service throughout Prices are a touch higher than usual  but the food was uniformly excellent and they even prepared a dish that wasn t on the menu with no fuss I would very much recommend this restaurant though must admit there s nothing especially out of the ordinary about it but sometimes a simply very good Indian restaurant is just what you need

Attended with a large group - was impressed with by both the service and food Even though we where a group of 14 all the meals came out together and there weere no complaints with everyone thoroughly enjoying their individual meals We will definitely return

I attend the Priory Cafe quite a bit when visiting family The food is excellent and the home made items are lovely and much better than a standard cafe The service is a bit hit and miss depending on who serves you If the owner serves you then you are in very safe hands They do have a tendancy not to listen and forget to butter bread all very minor things I have not been impressed when they handle money and then making your sandwich without washing their hands again the younger staff All in all very good and a great cafe
Very nice breakfast good selection lovely coffee Very nice staff and good view of the green It s like gay Paris but in the West Country Zuit alors it s a proper job
Been there couple of times super friendly staff and good tasting food  Tried their lasagna its superb and a must  Looking forward to try new dishes next time

Not meant for large groups that I ve been able to see but the atmosphere was great for a party of 4-8 Food was delicious and there is a vast choice of beverage alcohol and non-  Very friendly staff Free Shuttle bus makes rounds to local hotels near Heathrow  Will see you again in a few weeks

called in today first time since reopening service was good had a meal from what they call the deck a twist to a carvey I guess best selection of draught lagers I have seen for a while and 6 cask ales will be going back again
It was busy but they still managed to service me very well the food was lovely priced at a reasonable rate

The food here is without doubt good food there s something for everyone on the menu and the specials all sound very nice Everyone in my party enjoyed the food here although the only downside is that staff aren t as efficient as in other places but they were still friendly Will definitely be back

Alright thats the limit of my french  My 3 friends and I went to Le Crepier Papin on Friday evening - my 3rd visit - the food was great the service was a little slow but they were very busy I dropped my fork and even before I had a chance to say anything the waitress brought me a new one The food was excellent and great coffee
I had a lovely meal and the service was fine There was no fault at all just a bit pricey but thats how it goes If the foods good and im all good
The food and service were excellent I have been on 2 occassions a couple of years apart one for xmas work do and the othe other for lunch with friends

We were both very hungry after a day off and a 5 hour visit to London Zoo It was quite early on a Monday evening but there were several other dinners We were seated quickly and had warm home made bread with hummus served straightaway which was very welcome indeed The whole experience was very good lovely food  i had a Spicy fish stew preceeded by babagnoush and my wife had Moussaka for a main and some filo cheese parcels as a starter Also had a bottle of very enjoyable Turkish Red Wine

Called in there for lunch this week Had some Tesco Clubcard vouchers to spend and we were shopping in Chester for the day Service was great from the beginning we were asked where we would like to be seated and offered drinks straight away All the food followed quickly and was of good quality All the staff there were really helpful and there was a good atmosphere in there Will be going again on next visit to Chester

Small friendly pub serving up good wholesome food Your typical pub grub cooked well and at reasonable prices  price range 8- 13  The kitchen is very accommodating and will taylor most meals to suit If you want chips with your chicken it s on the menu but if you prefer potatoes and veg then simply ask and it s provided The fact that the chef also happens to own the pub ensures that the food served is always to a high standard Good size portions means that on both our visits we could never manage a pudding which was a shames as they looked delicious Be prepared to have 5 6 locals always stood at the bar in the lounge dinning area A small corridor takes you through to the bar area complete with a small pool table a place we never neede to visit Can get busy particularly at weekends so it s probably best to book a table in advance and we re told a must for Sunday lunch As there s virtually no other pub in the village of Blockley eating in this pub every day for a week wouldn t be a problem Tip  try the Steak & Hookey local ale pie Delicious
we was doing some shopping in hessle rd and end up in this asda cafe in lunch time it so busy full house and need more staff to service the customers people wait quite long for foods

Eight of us made the trip to Glossop last night to partake of a spice fest at the Ruchi and had a very enjoyable evening  Despite dealing with take away requests the service was first class and had very little time to wait between courses  Warm and crispy Poppadoms are always a good sign and often a benchmark to the whole meal  Starters were served in due course and following an acceptable resting time between courses the waiter asked if we were ready for our mains - nice touch and attentive  All meals served at one time and hot with excellent presentation and ample portion sizes  Complimenting the meal we shared a large Nan bread - and by large we mean large  At the waiters suggestion rather than ordering several small nans it was more economic to share one of their large specials  All meals were correct and extremely enjoyable and the final bill was not out of keeping with the standard of food and service we had experienced  All in all a great night for our curry club and a venue we hope to return to in the future

Very traditional pub with a real fire good beer and friendly staff well worth searching out Doesn t have a huge menu but what they do is all freshly prepared If you are after a gastropub experience this is not the place for you but if you want simple well cooked food in traditional surroundings this is the place to go
This pub restaurant has had a change of management recently I think We were there for a wake which was very well managed with some imaginative and well prepared foor and good serivce

The food is nice enough and atmosphere Is good The price is expensive and to dine here it is costly The staff are friendly enough and check regularly for empty plates and drinks that need topping up Been here for a birthday celebration and the staff made it special Good for families and friends for a cheap meal out
Good food cooked to order and lighter early menu gives a good choice Looking forward to some new dishes this year More fish please

its lovely that Tanskeys has opened Friday Sat Sun nights this summer for a drink and bite to eat and to watch the sun set over the estuary on these lovely light evenings Nice choice of wines in particular For us it was a lovely way to relax on a Friday night
Waited about 15 mins to be seated which wasn t bad for 9pm on a Saturday night Service was excellent and food portions tasty and plentiful Will def return -

I have often walked past here and seen the menu on the outside wall A tenner for a burger you must be joking  My son studied at Leeds University and took me for a gourmet burger and I am hooked Have to say it was the best burger I have ever had It had to be I am the stereotypical Yorkshire man that only opens his wallet when I have too  I am a big burger fan at heart and will pay a tenner if it is a good one  If you go for a burger pay the extra for a large with a good topping and a dip as an extra for your chips The thin double cooked chips that come with the gourmet burger are rather special if you like that kind of thing I don t like those thick skinned wedgies that are often served in higher end restaurants so it was a great pleasure to be served proper thin and crispy double cooked chips with my burger The one s you get at NOS are superb  A word of caution You don t go here for the decor It s a student bar at heart But if you get students paying that sort of money for a burger it says a lot about the quality of the burger  Gets lots of toppings and a dip and enjoy

The setting of this restaurant is very good and this is reflected in the demand The service is good and efficient There is a good range of food and drinks and the seating is comfortable The prices are reasonable and overall the place can not be faulted

We found the khan Baba which is opposite the Science museum after being on the Coronation Street Tour We found the staff pleasant and attentive The food was excellent especially the delicious peshwari nan and a hotter than average Tikka masala and a tasty Chicken tikka balti Nice restaurant

Steak was over cooked asked for medium rare got well done The manager was great and gave us free desert and coffee It s a nice restaurant tho pianist gave it a great atmosphere and was very busy  90 for two with wine Give it a go it s worth it even if the steak is over cooked

I have been to the Seven Stars many times most recently for Sunday lunch The staff were very friendly the beer was in good condition and we had two very good burgers- plenty of good quality meat Good medium sized chips- I personally prefer French Fries- thin and crispy bistro style  My only hang up is that I always feel the bill is about 10 more than it should be Our starter of sough dough bread hummus olives and tzatziki was 7 50 The hummus was excellent as were the other ingredients A good place- I will go back as it is always full of fun people and has a great atmosphere

This is an out-of-the way village pub in a lovely location The garden is a wonderful haven during the warmer months and the bar eating area is nice and cosy during the winter with a logburner in an ancient firelace The beer is well-kept the food nearly always good and sometimes excellent nearly always as my wife once had a poor starter Wish I could remember what it was A terrine I think  The landlady and staff are always friendly and helpful and we try to visit at least once every few weeks always rewarding Well worth the effort of searching it out

We went there with a Tastecard which limits your choices quite a lot but the food was all very good and the decor is quite impressive too  We went as a pre-theatre meal and if you plan on doin this you need a good and a bit as there is a lot of food coming your way The staff were excellent about this as I mentioned it when we sat down so they had things worked out well so we could get goign on time
Great-looking food upbeat music and modern vibes Worth sitting outside before your meal for a cocktail overlooking the London skyline

We had a friendly welcome on each visit in a traditional country style restaurant with some character The food was very good from an atractive menu of English food The prices are not too expensive and we think they represent good value Easy to find with a large car park
A nice relaxing place to go for a quiet drink and a bit of downtime What else do you want from a pub

Ignore the look the shabby decor and the need to share a table with strangers The food is superb and cheap  You may have to queue but if you ve got time to kill before your train who cares Be patient and enjoy

Called in after seeing sign on A4 just out of Marlborough Nice pub situated in a quiet village Warm and friendly welcome from the landlady Good beers and wine I ordered the duck and was asked how I would like it cooked I asked for pink and it was cooked to perfection Very good service throughout and prices very reasonable Will call again when in area
Saturday morning breakfast just across the road from the Travelodge where we stayed Excellent quality and great value in a friendly atmosphere

I rode down from London with a friend as a personal challenge with aim of getting to Brighton for a well earned brunch and coffee  Lucky Beach Cafe on the beach front was our target destination and despite the driving rain we made it The staff were great and let us move some tables around to put our bikes safe- you can see why it is popular amongst the cycle community  Great brunch and really good coffee

Located in a stylish old pub building right at a set of traffic ligts getting access to this restaurant can be a bit awkward depending on your direction of travel When I arrived it was busy but the service and the food were first rate The owner keeps an eye on operations all the time and I have no doubt this contributes to the high standards I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and am pleased to recommend this restaurant I would go back

The second visit to this very welcoming pub cum wine bar cum restaurant opposite the Royal Courts of Justice in the Strand and another very enjoyable lunch - one of the best Scotch Eggs in London made with a duck egg  followed by excellent cod in crispy beer batter and chips Something for everyone - both good everyday and fine special occasion wines guest and own beers - and a friendly and knowledgeable serving team led by the ever cheerful and enthusiastic manager Andy

Our first visit here after hearing good things Went with friends and were not disappointed Food was excellent with a substantial menu Servings were ample and service excellent My only criticism was that it is a small rest And so appears cramped Very little room between tables and no privacy Everything else makes up for that and we will certainly call again
Good and friently service always clean and reasonable prices The food is good but not great Worth it for some pub grub on a night out but probably not to go to specifically to eat

This is the best all you can eat restaurant I have been to There is a huge selection and variety of food from many different cuisines However although the food is good for an all you can eat in comparison to meals in a normal restaurant I feel the food is of average quality This was most apparent with the desserts with the ice cream in particular being very cheap Thus although it is good for an all you can eat I wouldn t rush to return

We had a really good food experience at Peachy Keens We were in the Travel Lodge next door and went in for Dinner My wife had not been in a Food Factory before She really loved go back and forth to pick the food she liked I really enjoyed the currys

Go here for the food not the service Although the service is pleasant it s just very rushed confused all over the place but you know what it adds to the charm of this tiny scruffy looking restaurant The food is the positive a massive positive 5star food 2 or 3 stars for everything else

There are a lot of cafes in Faversham but this in our opinion is the place to go for good coffee and a wide range of specialty teas The cakes are good too Not tried their other food yet but the menu looks interesting It is small and has an eclectic range of tables chairs and a couple of nice sofas - don t be put off by this This it is not a Jo s cafe They also have a courtyard at the rear where there are tables Good place to get talking to other people Good to see such a classy little joint making such a success of things

Stopped in here for a drink after going to Goodwood races V friendly pub Decent pint of San Miguel Dog friendly which is always a plus Would definitely go again if I was staying in the area Recommended
Great place & atmosphere Delicious drinks surrounded by a very chic crowd Everyone heard about the eggs shape toilets coming from a science fiction movie A must do when you visit London

The team really looked after us from the moment we arrived  Great local beer and the food was very good I had the hake which was very tasty My friend had the scallops which she described as really fresh  The icing on the cake was on our departure there were no cabs available It was a bank holiday weekend so it was busy locally Our fantastic waitress Lotty said as there were no cabs she would drive is back to our hotel Stunning service Thanks Lotty and team at the Polgooth

We were greated by very friendly staff on arrival for Sunday lunch I had the hamburger and my wife and daughter both had the Sunday roast Both meals were very nice The service was quick and friendly We sat in the ncie garden at the back of the pub We are very pleased to see our local pub under very improved new management

Visiting with family we were immediately made to feel welcome by the friendly bar staff and open log fire The waiter who served our table was pleasant and we were impressed with the range of food on offer from the two menus and a specials board Despite the size of our group the staff were very good with ensuring we had everything we needed and the food did not take too long either We came later in the afternoon so the restaurant wasn t as busy as perhaps we would have liked but the pub side had a number of people in it so the atmosphere did not suffer at all We had a thoroughly enjoyable visit and spent some time with the managers at the bar after our meal who we found to be rather lovely hence our surprise at some of the other reviews  We will be visiting again perhaps in summer to take advantage of the beer garden we spied from our table

Went to Northallerton on 19 November 2014 to do some Christmas shopping and my husband wanted a new all terrain coat so we decided to go to Sam Turners We were surprised at the size of the shop and very surprised that they had a cafe As it was lunch time we decided to stay for a bite to eat We had bacon brie and cranberry panini which came with salad home-made coleslaw and crisps It was delicious and very reasonably priced It was the first time that we had been to Sam Turners but it will not be the last As well as getting my husband a coat we had a lovely lunch

We visited the Jazz Caf€÷ yesterday on one of the hottest days of the year and the place was packed Having said that we ordered at the bar due to how busy they were and got served our drinks and food very quickly We sat inside while the jazz quartet played away and tucked into the amazing fish and chips they serve Good prices for the size portion you get and location  I feel that some reviewers are doing this great little find a dis-service It was busy yesterday and there were children there and they were enjoying themselves  Yes the music was a tad loud but that s what you get when you choose to go somewhere when there is live music- that s why it s called the JAZZ caf€÷   People come here to appreciate live music on a sunday  I understand the cafe s policy on buggies as these are big bulky and dangerous when waiters are bringing round hot drinks and food to avoid accidents  Ignore the negative reviews it is child friendly and a great find
Recently visited thoroughly enjoyed myself exceptional food great staff Would certainly visit again when in the area for work

We have been coming to Vallum for years The ice cream is always amazing and made locally The coffee is consistently good unlike some caf€÷s where a cappuccino is more like a latte On this occasion I had Pecan Pie which was unbelievable I have read some reviews saying Vallum is pricey It is at the top end for a cafe But is worth the trip
If you like Indian food mainly Nepalese here this is really worth a visit Good food friendly staff and sensible prices do book in advance as it is sometimes very busy
A great atmospheric Pub with plenty of charm friendly staff excellent menu with plenty of choice We have eaten here for many years and the Harbour Inn never disappoints

Dinner 24 May 2013 The food and wine were good as was the service Apparently it s usually full especially at weekends so you ll be lucky to get a late booking in the restraurant There some first come first served tables in the bar but early booking is best Take your sat-nav because the village is hard to find and escape from afterwards

Having been let down for the last time by our local we walked out and drove here to see what they offered What we got was a cracking burger friendly service and a nice quiet atmosphere It wasn t the quickest service and we were held up by a trainee learning the ropes but we weren t looking for fast food and the food was certainly worth the wait We will be back for more and have recommended to several friends

Fabulous choice of food greeted us and perhaps most memorable was the huge Salmon on display which was cooked to perfection The rest well you all know the drill great choice of chinese and indian food and then of course a very varied desert section

We met some friends of ours for lunch here This is an old pub with low door and ceilings but a really warm and friendly welcome It oozes history with its simplistic style and rustic charm It is a real ale pub with some very interesting beers and you are able to take the bottled one s away The food was excellent especially the bass that I had Each of us was very complimentary about the food which was flavoursome and nicely presented The location is excellent just a few minutes from the A34 and M4 whilst being just far enough away from them to provide a peaceful and tranquil location I would say that this is English pub hospitality and food at a high standard

not to be found in the centre of Worthing but slightly out on the Brighton road A good practical restaurant without the frills but with friendly and efficient staff and reasonable prices A menu of wholesome fish dishes cooked well and served generously plus a couple for non fish eaters and reasonable wines Certainly worth a visit if you are down this way

Just wanted a snack  Ordered teas coffees and cakes Then the assistant told us that if we bought the cream tea specials it would work out a lot cheaper  Plenty of seating toilets clean and fresh Had a lovely cream tea and friendly staff

Although I have to walk 20mins and past about 10 pubs to get here this is well and truly my local Friday and sat night are busier until the kids all head up to town centre but generally t is never too packed you are always able to get a seat and the staff are always friendly and efficient Sure there are snazzier Wetherspoons but this one has a bit of ambiance being an old church and is enough out of the town centre that it is full of quieter customers Thank you for many years good service George s
Just re opened Helpful staff good menu Salt and pepper king prawns fabulous We had the buffet menu  good value great food

As with most spoonies the food and the drink are good but I have had better in other branches The staff are normally super friendly and do a fantastic job especially when you consider that the amount of money spent on this particular pub must be at the lower end of the scale They do a lot with not very much to work with Its my local so don t take to much notice of the dates I visited or what I had when there

The beauty of living in Whickham is the plentiful supply of decent local pubs  The Bridle Path is friendly and clean good choice of drinks and decent atmosphere Food is just like any other chain pub you get what you pay for

We called in for lunch while sightseeing and shopping just the thing to rest our aching legs centrally located in the city which was ideal Ordered food and drinks at the bar food was brought in 10-15 minutes even though it was quite busy there Service staff and lunch were all good no complaints would go there again

While visiting friends in Bath I dropped in for an evening meal at Jamuna I ve visited before and the food is always of a high standard and the staff are very friendly and keen to please The service is very good and you don t have to wait long between courses Ownership of the restaurant is due to change hands soon so I hope the high standard stays the same

Our last night in York and another restaurant picked from reviews On first look the a la carte menu seemed on the expensive side for a small restaurant but the Fixed price menus offered grat value We arrived early and were shown to a table for four as restaurant was full However shortly after a table for two in a better location became vacant and we were invited to move another example of the service we experienced all evening The dishes we chose were all excellent and accompanied by a bottle of water tap brought to table and some good house wine The only negative was it got uncomfortaby hot as the only cooling seemed to be from two ceiling fans On the evening one was above a table occupied by a large party and they asked it to be switched off However we enjoyed our meal as we did in the other two restaurants we visited during our 3 night stay in the city and would recommend

Want to get in the mood for the Rio Olympics try the Carioca Restaurant for a taste of Brasilian Cuisine Turn right from the Underground tube station right into the maze that is the old Brixton market opposite Ralph gift shop and the Happy Dumpling is the little gem of that Carioca well frequented by locals and tourists alike It can sit a dozen inside and another dozen outside whereby a hot heater overhead makes you want to stay longer as you watch the world go by I tried the Bahia fish cakes and sweet chilli sauce by locals for a quick snack My partner chose the roast butter nut squash with red cabbage spicy chckpeas and chorizo salad all served by larger than life Martin the waiter Delicious This was washed down with a tongue tingling Raw fiyah the local ginger beer For those strong and hungry enough there is the Pele beef rib bun or Carmen the special Brasilian Bombshell burger
Called for lunch with my wife both our meals were good as was the service The standard menu offers a wide choice of meals and a lunch time special menu is available for 5 Monday to Saturday

This chippy is brilliant First class tasting fish and the chips are great Ate outside for some reason chips always taste better and to top it all the owner have my dog a battered sausage for free what more do you want

This is a fairly small cafe with a fair number of tables so it can be a cosy fit Having said that it makes for a warm atmosphere and I enjoyed it They server a cracking cup of tea and a scone that is of a decent size warm fresh and tasty
We are Ludlow residents and have a good choice for eating out As vegetarians this narrows the options for gourmet meals The Green caf€÷ is ideal

After hearing great things about Five Guys and seeing the Dayum dayum dayum video on Youtube I had to try the place out when it opened in Leeds  The first impression was very good it was clean and very much like an American fast food place in the US The menu is laid out in an easy to read way and the guy at the counter was very ptient as I got to grips with how to order  I went for a bacon burger and little fries with a soft drink you then choose from a selection of free toppings such as lettuce onions mayo ketchup etc I think that s a great idea as I am a bit fussy with stuff like that and normally have to request things are left off  They give you a receipt with your order number and you get your drink and take a seat until your order is called  The drinks machine is like something from Star Trek it seems to provide anything you can think of from one machine I went for Sprite Zero and there were then even more options such as Sprite cherry orange vanilla and more  When my meal came I opened the bag to discover that my little fries was far from little it was a very generous portion indeed and in fact I only ate about half The burger was delicious you can tell the meat is fresh and not frozen they are very much like Wendy s in the US in that regard and the bacon was super crispy in the American style  I was very happy and left very full sure it was pricier than McD s at around 12 00 but the quality was far above the slop they serve there As the old saying goes you get what you pay for  I would definitely recommend Five Guys and I am sure I will return the next time I go see a movie at the nearby Vue
Had a lovey steak and the 8 bottle of wine offer was a nice bonus Good atmosphere and an all round comfortable place

My partner and I had been wanting to try the Pelican Diner for a while now having seen some incredible pictures of their pancakes We finally got the chance to try it out and were very impressed The diner has a proper beach-side vibe The food is not overly cheap but the quality of the food is great so is worth paying the extra for MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A MILKSHAKE they are absolutely to die for I m so glad I didn t go for a coffee  The only reason my review didn t get 5 5 is because the service was a little slow which I don t usually mind but my partner s plate came up quite a while before mine did Pelican Diner also does not take card payments  I will be back for more pancakes and a milkshake soon
I visited this particular Turkish restaurant recently  in short very cosy  nice lighting  and great food It s a lovely place to dine would go there again for business and pleasure
Great range of mostly locally sourced food with some excellent seafood Staff are friendly and you are not crammed in Outdoor eating is fantastic with setting sun dipping below hills Overlooks marina
A backstreet pub converted to a Nepalese Restaurant It was slightly hard to find but very worth it  The food was tasty and very enjoyable  Enjoy

This is a good local restaurant that is very welcoming and friendly The food is good but not excellent however it is good value It was quite so no real atmosphere however this was probably due to very snowy conditions causing cancellations

Returning for the first time after about 12 years or more I found the pub almost unchanged and still a perfect example of the pubs that were once found throughout the Chilterns and especially on the line of the old Icknield Way By 1230 the pub was already busy with people who so evidently knew each other and there was a comfortable atmosphere - no music   but agreeable conversation Well kept beer and good food - only the Bread and Butter Pudding let them down and that was it was like the cake-like product sold in supermarkets instead of the crisp-topped fluffy and creamy pudding that it should be such a shame particularly because [having checked] all the on-line recipes are for the proper pudding  All the other food was plainly made in their own kitchen and a delight in consequence but maybe the sweets came in a van The furniture is well worn and space was tight but everywhere including the WCs was spotless So few pubs like this have survived that it was heartening to find it again - and though I now live in the Cotswolds not the Chilterns I intend to call in whenever I can
Clean pleasant and right opposite the holiday Inn Food good value even better Service lovely Just what I wanted

We went there every week for four weeks for steak night NIce friendly helpful staff no issues with meals and cheap with weatherspoons meal clubs including a pint A lot cheaper than London and was a very clean tiday and accomodating pub Always booked us a table for at least 20 and sorted out tables if more of us went as a group Cant fault it

Have eaten here on numerous occasions in small and large groups and as the family pub goes I think its great staff and management are welcoming and there is a good choice on the menu at sensible prices Food is quick and of good enough quality not the place for fine dinning or a romantic meal but a great place for a works outing or family get-together

The decor is a little dated but I cannot fault the food or service The staff were very attentive and always ready to answer questions The food was well presented and tasted wonderful I would not hesitate to recommend this place

We went out with another couple on Saturday night for a meal and had a good meal at a very reasonable price The pub always has a good range of beers and does a nice Pinot Grigot too Due to the amount of customers in the pub we had to wait 30 mins for our meal but were told this when we ordered it so there was no problem The bar area was busy at times however it was well staffed and we were served pretty quickly and the staff were friendly In addition when we had finished the meal the plates were taken away quite promptly This is a really good value pub and probably because of this can get quite crowded at weekends however we had a really enjoyable night out there The only negative was that the toilets could have been cleaner and probably need updating

We have had lunch here several times this year and the food is always excellent and very reasonably priced The two-course set lunch is a bargain at only 5 95 Service is always prompt efficient and friendly  As the restaurant is situated on a busy road when the large windows are open and folded back then traffic noise can be very distracting  Well worth a visit and much better value than many of the restaurants in nearby Canary Wharf

popped in for drinks after a meal close by great selection of gins and knowledgeable friendly service heard lots of good things about it but wasn t clear on what the offer was they offer an ever changing selection of small plates do breakfast lunch and evening dishes a small space but wasn t packed so we were comfortable will definitely go back its on duke street so close enough to town but thankfully its frequented by humans and not some of the disasters you see falling around city centre drop by youll love it

We visited Fifteen for our 5th time and for all the same reasons Great venue Great staff Great food Great value for a Great experience especially fora family of 5 Always on top of their game in every aspect and we all know the Jamie O story but go and experience it too You will not be disappointed

We arrived at the White hart at 4pm not realising it closed at 4 30 However it wasn t a problem for them We ordered a selection of leaf teas sandwiches for the table & cream teas The sandwiches were lovely excellent fresh bread and a good amount of filling I had the earl grey tea which was a lovely refreshing blend My companions were equally happy with their choices The cream tea consisted of 3 small homemade scones with Tiptree jam and clotted cream Again very nice & the perfect amount maybe the scones could have been served warm The owners serving team couldn t have been more hospitable & they deserve every success If you re visiting Essex rather than just whizzing up the motor way stop and eat here It s opposite a lovely gallery with some of the fantastic art being displayed at the White Hart
If you want a good Beer in a traditional pub this is it Not only great beer good service reasonable prices it has a great atmosphere which is hard to find these days and a great beer garden too

Took my mother wife and four year old to the Quay Not much choice for the veggies tuna pasta was one however they service was good and the food we chose all served a purpose The wife had a Thai dish Pad Thai and said it was wonderful We ve made Pad Thai in Thailand before and would know if it was inauthentic as stated previously Fresh food served with a smile

Not only had our daughter graduated with a good 2 1 degree but had also been offered her dream job so we thought we would go out for a celebratory meal Northants does not offer many options for fine dining so we decided on to go to an old favourite in Harlestone The restaurant was busy on a Friday night but we were shown straight to our table at the time we had booked The service was friendly and efficient and drinks were served immediately and our order taken It was fish night and a good range of fresh fish dishes were on offer The scallop starter was excellent followed by a well cooked spit roasted chicken duck salad and sea bream which were all first class With a very nice bottle of Rose from the extensive wine list and pre dinner drinks the bill was a reasonable 125 including an additional tip A very safe location with a buzzy atmosphere - we have not had a bad meal there and would thoroughly recommend it

From the outside you wouldn t think much of the Hermitage Inn - particularly concerning food It s very much a traditional pub The feel continues inside but around the back there is a smart little restaurant  The welcome was friendly and we both chose the Rabbit Pie from the specials board The pies were excellent with a terrific puff pastry lid A good choice of desserts from the fridge and ours went down very well  Excellent value unexpectedly decent quality and very good beers from Jennings at the bar

Have visited there a couple of times and it is a lovely local restaurant in Reigate French themed with generous portions and well cooked Would recommend for special occasions as cant afford to go there on regular basis Sometimes they do 2 or 3 course packages which are good value
usually get take - aways from viraaj and its always quick and tasty at good value  wonderful indian food  one of my favourites in Sheffield
Great addition to little chalfont Sweet setting friendly service and great quality tapas Calamaris with chilli and garlic were a winner

Always a please to eat at Wagamama where the quality and choice of food is wide and tasty Situated close the the Odeon Cinema it s ideal if you are going to grab something after or even before your movie If you are a lover of Chinese or other oriental food then I would recommend this restaurant for it s choice of lesser known oriental country s cuisine

Bollywood lounge doesn t look much on the outside but on the inside it is wonderfully decorated giving a great dining atmosphere We too had booked the table with a groupon which I received as a gift and can say we didn t have any of the issues that other groupon users had  We started with poppadoms and a pickle tray which are standard in all Indian s I ve been to followed by the bollywood sharing starter This was delicious albeit small for a sharing starter which becomes a defunct argument by the end of the meal as we were all full  For our mains we shared a selection of curries with a couple of rices chips and a family garlic naan  All I could say is that the food was excellent all good quality with no issues  To concluded we had a great meal with great atmosphere I would however consider it slightly pricey compared to other great curry places in the area Even with the groupon which only covered our starter and curry our extras came to just over 30 The drinks are fairly expensive at roughly 4 50 for a pint of Cobra and 3 for a large coke  A place definitely worth another visit

We called in on a Friday lunchtime whilst on our way to our holiday destination St Ives  This was our second visit as we called in on our way home for breakfast last year Trevaskis came to us highly recommended last year primarily because of its range of desserts The lunch menu starts at 12 although they were happy to take our orders 20 minutes before kick off We opted for a lasagne which was piping hot freshly cooked and obviously home made The Jewel in the crown is the desserts counter for anyone that enjoys a good dessert this is the place for you  Trevaskis has a massive range of home made gigantic desserts and puddings priced at little more than a fiver   The cafe is is nicely decorated with high quality fixtures clean well run and is well worth a visit I would have given it five stars is they hadn t have messed up our bill charging us for more desserts than we actually had  In their defence they were very apologetic and refunded us very quickly once we queried the bill

We visited the Lendal Rustique without having booked We were found a table in a busy restaurant without fuss or delay The atmosphere was welcoming and there was a pleasant hum of conversation We were looked after very well by the two young people waiting at table in our area The food was well presented and tasty the house wine was perfectly good and the prices more than reasonable We had a thoroughly enjoyable evening Thank you

Went here last night after a day out at the football Booked in advance after seeing some good review on tripadvisor  Menu has plenty of options  first time I ve seen a mixed bhuna at a curry house  All 4 of us enjoyed our staters and mains would definitely go back again next time I m back in Hull
This is our local Indian & has always maintained high standards of food & service Staff are friendly & attentive  Always a relaxing enjoyable experience

Visited here with two small kids and was made to feel most welcome Plenty of things were provided to keep them entertained and the staff were patient and helpful The food is good if not particularly memorable although the rib eye steak was very tasty You wouldn t come here for fine dining but if you want a decent meal for the family this is a good choice
Great restaurant fantastic service from Angela and the team - food was spot on and hot enough for the regular curry admirer

I come here as often as possible I bring friends family wife and children - any excuse  A relatively recent find for me I ve been here at least 10 times since discovering it I love the tapas menu and the food is always great The staff are brilliant and the setting is amazing especially the courtyard garden area with it s vines and fish pond Brilliant - keep it up

Was pleasantly surprised Food of a very high quality clearly cooked by someone who knew what he was doing An imaginative and impressive but not over-comprehensive menu with rabbit pie loin of pork etc All standard fare and not too pretentious Very good value as well I would say that presentation might be a little better though maybe this would push the price up However very highly recommended

Big friendly pub excellent value for both food and drink garden right on the River Lee with moorings The Landlord even lets you take your bicycle through the pub so it can be by your side if you re eating in the riverside garden Handy for Rye House Speedway Rye House Go Cart Track and the railway station

All you can eat Brazilian with excellent service  Their food is above average And the selection is immaculate  Drinks are lovely and you can eat us Much as you wish paying around 30gbp  Excellent location and service as well  Definitely give it a go
We always enjoy the food here Usually pop in for lunch and never disappointed The only reason I enjoy shopping in Ramsgate

My partner and i visited this branch on the 16th of this month and the customer service from our server was exceptional it was clear that he took pride in his job I think he was italian He had a excellent relationship with all his tables

We stopped off for a couple of cocktails while out shopping for the day  The place is trendy enough with a good atmosphere and we were seated well on the veranda as the weather was nice  The waitress was polite and helpful taking the time to go through the cocktail menu and suggesting ones to suit our taste  thank you you were spot on  We really enjoyed the visit and we will see you again soon
I come to St Ives often and never have bad meal I would recommend but the fish batter was a tad to fatty for me but that s it The portions are large I was thrilled

Being a huge fan of the Ruby Murray  there was no way I could pass up on what TripAdvisor listed as the 2 curry house in London The reviews mostly seemed positive so off I trotted to West Kensington to put this impressive rating to the test   Upon arrival with my prosecco in hand beer is way too bloating for a meal of this magnitude I was totally unconvinced at the building that lay before me the exterior was not one that I d typically associate with a high-end Indian restaurant let alone 2 in London  As me and my dining companion entered we realised we were the only people outside of the staff in the restaurant We had arrived at 6 40 40 minutes after opening on a Tuesday so whilst I didn t expect the restaurant to be full I expected there to be someone  After being seated a family of 4 was then shortly seated directly next to us which didn t help the feeling of claustrophobia the restaurant itself is without doubt the smallest I have been in - something the owner Rocky would later describe as a way of keeping things intimate and personal  Moving on to the food we started with two poppadoms and the traditional selection of mango chutney thicker than usual although this wasn t a bad thing  mint yoghurt this had a slight kick to it - very good  lime pickle pretty standard and onion I can still taste this the following morning   Next up was the appetisers I opted for the vegetarian option of Aloo Tikka which was a very bad choice Being a dedicated carnivore probably doesn t help but I didn t find the dish satisfying at all After trying my companion s Lamb chop which was very tasty and the right size for an appetiser I knew I had made the wrong decision  The restaurant was now filling up and close to capacity Despite my bad decision making with the starter I was starting to feel very optimistic about the mains to come  I wanted to try something different to the standard Vindaloo I often opt for so I went for a chef s special dish - Lamb Tawa  After consulting the waiter my companion was recommended - and opted to go for - their classic dish of Naga Chilli Massala  I accompanied my dish with a coconut rice & a garlic naan  The lamb tawa was in a word - awesome Thinly sliced layers of tender lamb were accompanied by a rich sauce and an optional green chilli which you can leave if the dish is too hot or devour if you want an added kick - I went for the latter  The chicken naga dish was also very hot and very good For anyone accustomed with the naga chilli - that distinct flavour is here in abundance  The rice & naan were both satisfactory although if I was to do the meal over a rice is to definitely be shared by two people   With the reasonaly-priced-bill came an After Eight mint which for me was a nice touch as growing up this was what traditionally accompanied the bill - not the mints or generic choclolates that are all too often served up as other restaraunts  The meal ended with the owner Rocky telling us about the history of the restaurant asking our names and pointing out the voice of Baloo from The Jungle Book was currently amongst the diners  Good food Great service And in the words of Arnie I ll be back

Every time I visit the capital the Liberth Bound always gets a visit Great atmosphere you can relax quite happily and more importantly you can hear yourself speak The food is the standard you expect from this chain and for the location very resonably priced My London a Local

Visited here whilst on a visit to London with my family Really nice atmosphere and food Also the staff were really cheerful and friendly The only thing we weren t so keen on was the fact that 10 of the meal was worked out and then had been added on to pay for the tips - so we didn t have an option of how much we tipped the staff This may be a normal thing to do in London however as we are not local to the area we are not familiar with this Overall a really good visit

I was recommended to eat at the Onshore and I wasn t disappointed Service was excellent and the set menu was very good Some of the best mussels I have had for a while I really liked that they had four choices of red and white wine by the glass I will definitely eat there again when I am back in St Ives
Nice atmosphere good food friendly attentive staff reasonable prices has live music events would go again

A bit up market from Waetherspoons but similar prices It is a Mardens House so your limited to Pedigree etc Very child friendly with inside and outside play areas It is really a pub pretending to be restraunt

Went there in May with my other half and went again last week on a staff retirement do I was very impressed both times and the food was brilliant on both visits I would definitely go back whenever I could As there was a big party we did have a bit of a wait for the food but it was worth it

If you are after a typical Indian restaurant then Viva Goa isn t for you that s because it s unique I had the Tiger Prawns with a delicious sauce and my partner had the pork vindaloo both exquisite tasting meals The service is impeccable too I d definitely recommend this restaurant if you are visiting York and we will be calling into Viva Goan again

On visiting Sidmouth I noted this had a great review on Tripadviser and gave it a try I was greeted with a charming and welcoming traditional Devon building with good parking Staff were available to order drinks on walking through the door We found several tables were reserved but found one free We decided to go for the carvery which appeared very nice on viewing with spotless food area While a friend paid for this at the bar a young waitress come to the table to inform me her boss had sent her over to remind us in future to wait to be shown to the table She appeared embarrassed by this but we excepted her comments The food was piping hot and a choice of three meats and help yourself to arrange of veg The staff were polite and appeared to enjoy there job This is well worth a visit and I highly recommend the carvery but don t forget staff need to show you to a table first
Friendly staff and a good selection of draught beers Mondays are the best value with all draught beers at 2 49 a pint  I have not eaten there on a regular basis but it is of a good pub-grub standard

Impression  Small clean simple but contemporary popular amongst Chinese customers which means authentic food  Menu list is short with photographs so very friendly for first timers to the restaurant and to Xian cuisine Surviving business situated right opposite the Emirates Stadium shows its doing very well for a good reason  Advice  They expect you to book a table first But if there s space they will give you a table preconditioning that you ll leave before a specific time The place is small so expect to be seated near other customers or even share a table They do not accept card payments They do not include service charge There doesn t appear to be toilets but then we didn t ask Price per item generally range between 7 to 10 the mains  They cook to order so food are prepared fresh Waiting times are reasonably fast depending on time of day Cup of water is free for now and is popular so ask for it  Opinion  Food is top quality and tasty Not like what you get from the common Chinese Cantonese restaurants Xian cuisine spice level is between mild to medium and nowhere near the levels in Szechuan cuisine Most dishes are pastry noodles with combination of beef or chicken Staff are friendly and helpful and seem to know their own menu items well  Will I return Yes

I d never actually been in this place as it looks somewhat chintzy from the exterior but having lived in Teddington for quite a few years decided to give it a try It s part cocktail bar part restaurant with a guy that plays the piano this was Saturday evening so you might say it has a quirk factor  We had a few drinks at the bar - some average cocktails - but because the place has such a friendly buzz especially with the guy playing the piano decided to stay and eat there The food was absolutely fine  We shall return either just for drinks or for drinks and food to re-sample the fun atmosphere

Chose and booked this restaurant via OpenTable because it was very close to our evening theatre venue Proved to be a great find and would certainly visit again  Very small upstairs and downstairs but that creates a friendly cosy feel Choice of talking to a helpful waitress or ordering anonymously via a tablet on the table We chose the waitress route but the photos on the tablet gave a great impression of the food  Limited menu but the food was freshly cooked and very tasty The LW burger was exceptionally good  40 for starter main and soft drinks - which was great value Next time we ll probably try the vodka recommendations as well  Only negative the upstairs gents could have been a lot cleaner  Recommended give it a try

Having eaten in several Italian places I must say that That s Amore is one of the few ones where I would go back to without hesitation The food is really good and their service is very friendly Would recommended to anybody

We went last week to this restaurant Two of us are vegetarians two not The vegetarian food was well cooked and interesting The two fish eaters said their fish and chips was outstanding Service was good the view over the beach in the evening was beautiful and it was not expensive All in all a good experience
Had a great walk over the hills towards Lyme Regis for 6 miles coming back to the carpark by the pub Fabulous crab sandwiches & local beer Just what the doctor ordered

I have been to this pub many times before and always felt a warm reception The new overs have been amazing with the occasional light live music that you can either talk to friends or sit and enjoy a book  The restaurant part was great with the wall being hand painted and meals that where just as delicate A fantastic reasonably priced starter and meal too full for a pudding made for a lovely enjoyable night with family and friends

Visited here last night with my sister & daughter and although it was very busy we were shown to our table had drinks & food order taken quickly and food arrived promptly Staff were very attentive Champers was on offer for 20 a bottle and most people took full advantage of it

We were welcomed by several smiling staff and offered the option to go straight to our reserved table or to have a drink first We made our way to the garden where we found a table in the sun and our drinks followed shortly After finishing our drinks the waitor came and escorted us to our table in the restaurant which was in a cramped corner He could see we weren t too happy and asked us to pick another table which we did There were several other tables in use and the restaurant slowly became fuller as the evening went on We wouldn t have noticed however as our waitor stayed attentive throughout and although the wait for our main course was long it was certainly worth it My wife had a lamb dish from the specials and I had fillet steak which were both cooked to perfection and very tasty I would however recommend having at least two courses as the portion sizes were adequate but not huge The waitor mentioned that champagne was on offer that night and we were recommended a 35 bottle that ended up being 30- a nice touch for our anniversary  Overall I felt very happy with the service and the food I came on tripadvisor to recommend the Greyhound and was astounded to discover all of the bad reviews I would say take them with a pinch of salt and find out for yourself- I shall certainly be visiting again

Hungry after the pictures heard it was good so gave it a try Friendly helpful staff lively atmosphere Good hot well presented food accepted on line 25 voucher i had pizza girl friend had pasta and meatballs both yummy will definitely go back

Kathmandu palace s not open for lunch but on this occasion they did open with no problem at all We had a great time even know I was unable to stay for the party as I was working but my friends enjoyed the atmosphere the food and the service Thank you again for your kindness we had a great time
We had a small bite to eat and it was nice The main bar is small but perfect Its quaint quiet and worth a visit in my opinion
Huge pizzas great prices good atmosphere and very friendly and accommodating staff for a family 5 years old s birthday party with all the attendant thrills spills and noise that brings
Very wide and interesting menu many fish dishes and the Venison was superb Rooms also good

We stopped into The Grace whilst house hunting in June It was Father s Day and despite being fully booked the guys found us a nice table that they could turn around in time The roast is top quality great meat and the trimmings were top quality We ve been living hear for 3 months now and still haven t found a roast quite as good and there are a lot of gooduns about
Went here for lunch today Had very nice bacon sandwich and pot of tea Good value and the lady behind the counter was very nice and helpful Would advise people to go

We had intended to eat elsewhere but arranging a table for eight on a Saturday night in Leeds os not easy   Our table was waiting for us when we arrived very short notice  Steaks were excellent and for a hotel restaurant keenly priced Many thanks for ensuring my little boy 30  didn t starve on his birthday night out

Jamie s in Norwich is situated right in the centre of town at the end of a beautiful Victorian arcade The restaurant feels welcoming with loads of character and design features creating a relaxed artisan-style atmosphere Tables aren t too crowded so you don t have to share your neighbours most recent surgical experiences and the table service is generally satisfactory and friendly Menu is limited but there are always specials to enjoy and the food is much better than you would expect from a standard Italian restaurant Value is reasonable - even better if you join Jamie s club which has regular offers and discounts Definitely a venue to consider
This was a return visit as ever the staff are very friendly and attentive the food is fantastic but the place is VERY noisy They could do with some acoustic absorbing panels on the ceiling

A great family night out at this restaurant the staff where very attentive and the food was fantastic I went for the specials menu for my main which was dover sole but they had none left and it was only 6-30pm so I had the lemon sole instead which was lovely and went towards making up my disappointment over the dover sole All the other members of my family were also very pleased with there food The staff are very warm and welcoming and couldn t of performed there task any better My only niggle with this restaurant was there are to many tables getting to the toilets was impossible without disturbing other diners and we where constantly getting disturbed by staff getting customers coats which where hung next to our table my brother who comes to this restaurant quiet often said extra tables add been added since there last visit I suggest they remove them which would make this place perfect Parking can also be a problem but that isn t the restaurants fault if you do go you can park opposite in the town hall car park which you can use in the evenings even though it doesn t say so I would definitely recommend this restaurant but you need to check where your been seated

We are in the Lake District for a week and have eaten at the Mortal Man on two occasions and both times the food has been excellent The main course quantities were extremely large leaving us no space for starters or desserts The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and there was a good atmosphere in the bar and restaurant

We ate at The Fox a couple of weeks ago and were delighted to find the original owners have returned I had an average dinner sulky service in the summer with my Mum and wondered what was going on This was not the same place I had enjoyed with my husband on previous visits But  several months on and The Fox is back  The pub is re-vamped Once more the atmosphere modern and warm Yes the menu is small - albeit delicious - while staff and kitchen find their feet and new systems fall into place Service was charming I ve worked in the hospitality industry and it s never easy  Especially a re-opening We drank Negroni s at the superbly stocked bar run by an expert bartender ate gorgeous food and basked in the glow of this establishment s return to glory

Decided as a family to have a pizza night Original plan was Dominoes but decided to give here a go as they re just around the corner  3 very nice 9 5in thin crust pizzas and garlic bread pizza for under 20 and to be honest they where worth every penny  We certainly won t be going anywhere else in future for pizzas

I was in a group of 12 so as you can imagine finding a cuisine everyone liked was tough Then someone suggested Jimmy Spice s as it has a selection of Asian European and American food types We went in and were greeted by very friendly staff The night we went Friday seemed to be a fixed price for unlimited food type of deal  15 is not a lot of money for all the food you could potentially eat  The plates are tiny so I had one plate of Indian food and a plate of Chinese Both of which were tasty for the most part  Especially liked the salt chicken and the fried beef  We re not talking formal dining here nor will we see Michelin stars but the food was pretty decent with a generous array of vegetables meat and spices in all the dishes I tried  In all I think everyone in our party enjoyed their food the restaurant had a friendly atmosphere and staff were helpful and quick to respond If you re looking for a well priced varied place to eat in Birmingham with a little something for everyone you may want to check here  Could also have Sushi pizza pasta dishes salads tex-mex and many others

After eating a lunch at this restaurant I took the plunge and booked an evening meal for 4 of us to celebrate my birthday From start to finish the service and food was exceptional Nothing too much trouble and Cazz the waiter was attentive without being overbearing Will definately return the sooner the better Ramsgate has a rising star in Il tricolore and it deserves continued patronage

Myself and my partner stopped here having abandoned our soon to be out of fuel vehicle The staff were very friendly and it was easy to converse with them clearly being happy to welcome in tourists  The pub had quite a local feel and was dog friendly with no less than 3 dogs seen sitting besides their owners The was by no means to the detriment of the venue which is quite spacious and spread out  The food was very reasonably priced and had nice feel of being home cooked with an attempt to be a little bistro I don t know if this was intentional and it didn t quite deliver in that respect but there is no disputing it delivered on what was expected which was good quality pub food  I would advise that if eating the Exmoor Burger it is quite a considerable size and you won t be disappointed My partner had bass with a lobster sauce which she also said was very pleasant  Drinks were also very well priced so this was a really nice surprise when it came to paying  Worth a stop by either for food or if this happens to be towards the end of a walk you find yourself on

I had not been to Nicks Diner for years and years probably 15 and possibly even 20 years I use to live a couple of mile from it when the old A11 road was still the main road between Norwich and Attleborough Which to non natives of the area would be the first problem actually finding the place  Here is a hint if you follow the signs for the college and get yourself to Morley you won t go far wrong Although there are still a few windy twisting roads to negotiate there is usually no shortage of people to ask When we arrived all 7 of us we asked the staff if they would hold the cakes behind the counter and they did so with no bother at all Just a point to note if you are taking Birthday cakes along with you whilst they will bring birthday cakes to the table we were told that they would be unable to serve them as they were very busy and that s fair enough  The waitress was excellent and attentive and took our drinks and meal orders promptly and between the 7 of us we ordered a wide range of starters and mains and here is another hint unless you have a bottomless belly choose your starters and mains carefully to leave room for dessert as the portions of both are excellent in size and very filling A word to the wise it is predominately Burger driven but does have limited veggie options A big plus they have WiFi and display the password which was great cos I could send pictures and very favourable comments about the food out onto my twitter account It disappeared just after 9pm though might have been that the usage had maxxed out or as the restaurant was so busy too many people were using it I could go through each item that we all had but there is really no point it was all delicious plenty of it great quality and excellent value for money I will definetly go back there and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone who is into Burgers with style

Restaurant was very clean with a nice ambience our waiter was friendly and attentive My wife had the fillet steak which was superbly tender and altogether excellent I had the Wagyu beef which at 55 with a portion of chips was seriously overpriced in terms of the eating experience There was no sign of the expected marbling in this steak nor was it especially tender or tasty There was an area of inedible gristle at one end that had to be abandoned For this money I expect something way better than this Will also mention that the plates were not properly heated The chips were some of the best I have ever tasted

We went here weekend of 29th June on a Living Social voucher and paid 25 for a Room upgrade When we return we will not be paying for the upgrade as although this does keep up in the old main building the rooms are a little tired Overall we enjoyed our overnight stay and the dinner was very good and you just chose off the main menu which was excellent The drinks were a little expensive however for just a short walk you could save up to 50 on these prises as there are numerous [4 6] Pubs within a few hundred yards The atmosphere was good restaurant nicely laid out and relaxing and the staff were all extremely helpful and pleasant We were definitely impressed with our stay here which is in a lovely location and will definitely be going back again in the future

It was quiet when we arrived at this small restaurant just one table occupied with fellow tourists However the menu looked good and the wine was reasonably priced So after a long day we had a great meal and i was very impressed with the tasty nan bread but they were small so i had 2 as the waiter warned me they were small Not the most atmospheric indian i have ever been to but it was just what we wanted having been out all day

Bedroom although comfortable was in desperate need of an update The decor doesn t appear to have been changed since the nineties This was disappointing as the restaurant appears to be stylish in decor The bathroom was poor mould in the window and on the grout As the hotel wasn t full I would have appreciated a better room

Great place and fab location We were lucky enough to sit out on the balcony on a sunny day Beautiful views and great food - I had the veggie breakfast  [i recommend the Dorset tea earl grey Really good ]
Popped in for a coffee and a pizza slaice Absolutely wonderful Lovely strong Italian coffee with a slab of gorgeous cheesy T pizza

My wife and I enjoy Prezzo s so gave the Port Solent one a try and found this was up there with the best around Sevice was first class and the food was great plus with a taste card got 15 off the final bill

On a busy street corner just before Brighton s famous pier lies Very Italian Pizza- otherwise known as V I P  While unassuming on the outside this quaint little establishment offers up some of the finest casual dining in Brighton From pizzas and calzones to pastas and salads the range of dishes on offer is decidedly standard fair with perhaps the mini- empanada style calzones being one of the more unusual items  Yet it is in the sheer quality of the ingredients the fresh sweet and herbal passatta the stretchy and luxurious mozzarella and the voluminous and tasty dough where V I P excels  With high providence cured meats from pancetta to prosciutto and a truly excellent standard of olive oil- most especially their homemade chilli oil- any dish can be purchased with full confidence  Nonetheless yet rightly so most people will come to V I P in search of their pizza fix and honestly after having dined here it will be a fix that is satisfied for quite some time  V I P pizzas are truly enormous Rather than the standard radial style here we have vast and robust platforms of pizza bread  adorned of course with passatta mozzarella and your choice of toppings  One could accuse V I P of using too much cheese and not enough sauce but this seems to depend largely on what type of pizza you order I would personally avoid going for a white pizza as the lack of tomato passatta may leave one yearning for moisture and sweetness among a palate of pure savoury saltiness  With a properly balanced pizza however V I P is truly excellent value and will most certainly satisfy any pizza lover  On a busy night the fastidious owner with her small militia of quintessentially Italian waiting staff will do their best to keep up with demand as hordes of hungry pizza-lovers jostle for position in a tightly packed yet traditionally adorned premises All manner of Italian items of produce line the shelves of the restaurant and there is a mini deli near the kitchen where excellent quality pizza bread can be purchased standalone for as little as 1 a loaf  It is must try for pizza lovers and a great overall experience that won t burn a hole in your wallet Fantastic
Good meals well served by friendly staff especially considering that it was so late House wine that I would recommend The current management have really improved things

Went here previously when it was The Beeches - so booked up ad hoc on a Saturday  Web site told us no tables available until after 8pm undeterred we rang and they took our booking no problem  Arrived and it was only half full great welcome and pleasant entrance  bar area  Nicely appointed inside and staff very friendly  Has the feel of a family owned venture as all staff eager to please  Great food nice variety on the menu and the kids loved it too  Definitely worth a visit in my opinion

The place has been super popular for ages and we have been hearing rave reviews about it so when an opportunity arose we decided to give it a go General impressions when you walk in  really underwhelming   It does look like a restaurant stuck in the nineties the staff looks rather bizarre and not modern at all but the menu delivers on the traditional Italian food  and after all that is what you come for to an Italian restaurant The portions are humongous so it is a very good idea to go as a larger group and order fewer portions than there are people and share everything  and feel like a large Italian family on a night out The food itself is all good  nothing super extraordinary some things are great others just OK - guess it s just like Mamma used to make and again it all feels very homemade and very generous Good pizza good fish desserts just so-so All in all I would highly recommend going there especially with friends and family One tip  do not wear anything that is hard to wash  like suede or leather  all your clothes will smell of food when you leave the place  probably the biggest issue with otherwise lovely Il Bordello
