I go down to the Britannia Inn regularly and am familiar with the staff and the management Darren the manager keeps a good pub here with a consistent high quality of drinks and various hot foods I know people occasionally complain about waiting times cleanliness and food quality but lets be realistic This pub was opened many years ago temporarily as a venue for the Liverpool International garden festival and thankfully was allowed to remain as a watering hole for locals and the many passing visitors to Liverpool Yes there are some issues but im aware that budget restrictions and quites simply the footfall passing through this pub on a daily basis sometimes is the cause for some slight lapses in regard of high quality achievement The bottom line here is the pub is extremely friendly with hard working staff and management the food is of reasonable quality at an exceptional price and the beers and drinks are always well prepared and served with a large selection of branded names The pub is very appealing and particularly friendly to disabled people who are treated with great respect and consideration with the pub having good wheelchair access too  With the fantastic views outside  i sit out every time i visit  you couldnt get a more satisfactory experience at such value anywhere else in the city So lets stop griping and realise that the Britannia Inn is doing a great job overall in keeping both regulars and visitors happy in so many ways that the occasional issues that can occur i could forget in a heartbeat Well done Darren Lisa Josie and all the staff who have kept me and my wife as well as thousands of others so well looked after for so long
Ordered through Deliveroo and gotta be honest was pretty cold when it arrived that being said the pizza was next level mrs warmed hers up in the oven I ate cold and it was still a 4 star pizza
I went here with some friends and we collected our food very quickly ok Food and nice atmosphere I would recommend this place

This was my first visit to The Cosy Club The service was friendly and we didn t wait around too long The other members of the party enjoyed their meal I ordered Tapas which was nice One of the Tapas dishes I did not enjoy but to be fair that was more down to personal taste than quality The waitress noticing I had not eaten it offered me a complimentary coffee Although I didn t take her up on the offer I thought it was a kind touch I will be returning with my fianc€÷e next time we re in Bath

This cafe is a small and appears to be family run establishment just near the harbor car park in Bridlington We stopped by last year and were amazed at the size and quality of our breakfast for the price So much so that when we returned to Bridlington this year there was only one place to go No fancy decor or frills but for good quality excellent value food you will struggle to beet it And they have even added brown toast to the options It must be hard to survive in a small town with so many cafes but they are really welcoming and friendly and offer great value

Had three meals at Bettys during a recent 2 night stay in Harrogate First was a lunchtime visit when we queued outside for ten minutes then a further queue inside We had tasty club sandwiches and a plate of chips We returned in the evening recommended when it was much quieter had a nice meal with wine and a pianist playing  They serve until 9pm  Third visit was the following day when we had the traditional afternoon tea but this involved a further queue We were fortunate to have a window table on each occasion the food quality and service were very good

My friends and I - we are all writers and one a former food journalist - fell upon this small restaurant by accident and it was a pleasant surprise Greeting and service was nice throughout The situation is great - we had a table overlooking the Harbour on a beautiful sunny winter s day it felt like New England Delicious calamari to start followed by the seafood platter shared by two - the high point of which were the scallops which were to die for The only minus mark sadly was for the coffee which wasn t good Otherwise I d be happy going there again Added to a walk along the sea front it s a perfect day out even off season

Slightly formulaic menu but reasonable prices for the area and tasty food We had the halibut which was tender and only issue was I prefer it to have a crispy skin Service was prompt pleasant and polite Good atmosphere busy and popular Not a gastronomic experience but wasn t expecting it to be Handy for a bit to eat after shopping perhaps

I have here before but I fancied eating at home  I picked a menu for two which comprised of a good selection of mixed staters about six starters each  For main there was Rice  a Chechen dish  a hot Beef dish an a Pack Choi with noodles  All good sized portions  All this for only 25 00 for two persons  Great value and very tasty  The order arrived on time and was well presented

The landlord and landlady are very nice as and welcoming as where the people in the bar the beer was excellent I did not eat there but the food looked very good I am from Lancashire but the crack was very good to I will be back there soon

We have dined here on several occasions while visiting relatives There are 2 areas the original pub with fairly typical tables and a cushioned bench along the window wall with chairs on the other sides of the tables This all seems quite cosy and comfortable There is also a modern extension with tables and chairs that seem a little more formal I have never been able to fault the food here - it has always been excellent They change the menu gradually over time but there are always some favourites such as steak gammon steak sea bass as well as delicious home made pies which are available in small or large portions  the latter being very generous  Likewise there are plenty of tasty starters I would say the sweets are good rather than excellent My only reason for awarding 4 stars rather than 5 is that the service can be rather slow when it is busy I don t find this to be a problem but if you are in a hurry it could be Pricewise I feel it represents very good value All in all highly recommended

Nice pub in famous Chapel Street Provides good fancy dress Balls and has an authentic atmosphere Further down there is the interesting Admiral Benbow and the Penzance Arts Club Keep going if you can to the Lock Inn and the Yacht Inn after your visit
Could be quite noisy sometimes but I forget the noise with the very nice Menu they have for the Brunch on sunday   Even the coffee is good which is almost impossible in London

Staying in hotel round the corner so really convenient Friendly welcome Nice atmosphere with friendly and attentive staff Had the London set meze for 2 and weren t disappointed Washed down with a Turkish white About 50 which given location round corner from London Eye we felt was value for money Would definitely go back

As there is a lot of buffet restaurants to choose from in manchester this one has to be up there with the best lots of selections and very nice food we were a group of 11 so were pleased to be sat as a group which usually isn t possible so definitely be eating here again in the near future

We have dined at this resteraunt before two years ago so whilst wandering around Windermere looking for somewhwere to dine as soon as we spotted The Lamplighter both my wife and i said  we ll go there so we did That in itself tells you what great food they serve We both ate off the special board which can be expensive but delicious but there is a superb menu with meals for all budgets I had Sea char and the wife selected Sea bass both were cooked to perfection as were our desserts To assist the less knowledgable wine drink like myself The number of the complimentary wine to each meal is placed alongside it on the menu whcih we thought was very helpful The waiter and manager were also very friendly and helpful and we didn t have to move a muscle all evening other than calls of nature It was a lovely evening in a truly lovely resteraunt The first visit we had another family with us and eight of us celbrated my 50th birthday here We saw the place in the afternoon and reserved a table We had a lovely time agai and even the kids didn t have any complaints The waiter also recommended a very tasty port to compliment our cheese and biscuits which went down very well If in Windermere i recomend you eat here as you will love it
Good value for money never leave hungry and decent BBQ Cocktails weren t too expensive and were an unexpected highlight
Great atmostphere great craft beers  the fish pie is really tasty however the meal a tad small so had to purchase some fries to fill the void  great for a works meal and just lunch

Great three course meal a set menu with a selection of choices for starter main and dessert A different standard of food compared to your normal chain pub grub fare The drinks are excellent as were the staff and the refurb of the pub itself was of a good standard this does reflect in the prices though so a place to go for that something special

I m not saying this place is on par with a good restaurant but for something different for a takeaway I d say this a must if in the Hillsborough area  Healthy in comparison to other takeaways not too expensive decent variety friendly staff  Don t do delivery though unless it s over 25 over lunchtime
Nice place to eat Very friendly staff both on food and at the bar Full of little hide away places not an open room Food was good service was good atmosphere was good Would I recommend yes no problem

We dined here for a family reunion having travelled from Chester All eight of us enjoyed the ambience of the restaurant and thoroughly appreciated the food choices many of which we ate We were taken care of in awesome style by our friendly host Marcelo who was excellent  Good cider too

Great little find First visit will go back for sure Authentic family style Italian good value Calamari was delicious and I think we may pop in for lunch one day to try a pizza as they looked fantastic Service friendly and there was a nice buzz in the restaurant
We travel across town to get our fish and chips from here my family have been eating from here for well over 20 years Always fresh and tasty

It s small It s very cosy It s fairly new    and it s very French The immediate impression is of a crisp well run establishment You are greeted in French - not forced Allo Allo  - and before you know it phrases that you may not have used for decades find themselves tumbling without embarrassment from your lips Oh Yes then there s the menu which is small and also very French It proudly tells you that the Fish and the Meat are sourced from shops in Chester Market but even the pats of butter are French We declined a starter and my partner ordered the Sea Bass I the Entrecote with a side of Haricot Verte Delicious bread is served and we chose to have an Oil and Balsamic dip The wines which by now you won t be surprised to read are all French are subtle and the proprietor is knowledgeable and willing to suggest the appropriate wine for your meal We both found room for the Crepes Our meals were thoroughly enjoyed and were served at a gentle pace The close proximity of ones fellow diners was not the problem I d expected We ll be back

I had some friends visiting and thought it would be nice to go out for Sunday breakfast also saves me the washing up We decided on BTP as I had heard good things about the breakfast there and they were right the breakfast was great We had to wait a short time until a table became available which I took as a good sign and didn t mind Sadly we went back on another occasion with some other friends because our first experience was really good This time we went in the evening the place was half empty and the main meals were shockingly bad   note to self BTP for breakfast not dinner

A really unique pub with amazing internal decor wonderful bar shaped like an old galleon ship and you can smell the wood mixed with the hoppy smell of ale excellent The was a rugby match on so the landlord was in full voice for his beloved Wales and it all added to the atmosphere he even did a free bbq for all the punters where do you get hospitality like that these days Had a really nice pint of one of the pubs home brewed ales and my pal had some local cider She we were well fed and watered while soaking up the atmosphere Wales won so it was even better
On a wet and cold Jan 1st the service at this pub restaurant was excellent The food was of a high standard
If you are expecting the usual Indian food don t go here this is something totally different Another Type of food altogether  Def go again
Atmosphere is like a pub in the pub area but fine dinning in the restaurant with a great garden when the sun is out Good selection of meals and Great service
A tight squeeze but very popular limited space so sometimes you can t get in Food is very good much home made especially the cakes If you can t get in try again

A few of us from work decided to try and break the laws of nature by going to TGI Fridays on an ACTUAL Friday Disappointed to report nothing happened and the universe remains as was  Onto the visit Came with 5 colleagues and we suspected we should have booked ahead but it was no problem at all The staff were all really nice and friendly and a special shout out goes to our waiter who was friendly knowledgable and had a slightly scary fascination with Minions he was a grown man but very funny nonetheless  I went for the chicken fingers not actual chickens fingers whilst my colleagues went for things like the hot dog massive the burgers looked good and the veggie option who knows  The drinks came quick and were regularly topped up and the food arrived speedily too  All in all not quite the party-haven I remember from my youth but a great place to go for an affordable meal with friends or colleagues or both if you are that kind of team

This has been one of our favourite places to have a drink and food setting is really nice you can sit out and look out over the village of Diggle You can walk along the canal to Uppermill or stand on the railway bridge and see the Standedge railway tunnel which is one of the longest in the world The hotel has just been refurbished and a really good job has been done the new owners are very nice and helpful several real ales are always served one being a local micro brewery The food is very good and value for money this is a perfect place to stop after a walk along the Huddersfield canal Rooms are also available if you want to stay over at very good prices
gosh the chicken dish i had was first class with chunky chips kind of food i like My wife had prawms and she managed to clean the plate

Have ate here on two occasions once on an evening another Sunday lunch Both times the food was of a very high standard The Sunday roast was gorgeous meat was tender gravy rich loved the red cabbage cut through the rich gravy lovely Service was good decor was good as well more so if you like the colour purple  Overall great experience and as a diner your looking for confidence in food when you go out and you certainly get that here thanks

Given some of the negative reviews i was a bit uncertain of what to expect - however the food was very tasty and freshly prepared and some of the most authentic Thai i ve had in a while Reasonable value for money and service was excellent - if i m in the area i would certainly go again
Good Beer good beer good beer good beer good beer good beer sorry but had to use 50 Characters to leave review lol

Relatively short menu but enough for most tastes and everything done well Service was personal and friendly Surroundings were well thought through and welcoming The starter platter was tastey and the burger full of prime beef Well worth a visit

We had different starters Prawns with Smoked Salmon and Black Pudding with Blue Cheese both were excellent Good portions and very very tasty I had a rump steak my wife had the Gammon both were excellent the chips were the large hand cut type lovely Service was good and the staff very friendly

Was in the area for a wedding over the weekend and visited the pub twice Once for drinks on Saturday and for a meal on Sunday evening Both visits were really good and the patio area out the back has lovely views Meal on Sunday was very good has one of the sharing plates the salt beef salad and a flatbread of cheese and caramelised onions baked in their own pizza oven All food we had was really nice well cooked and presented Service was also efficient and friendly
Excellent service amazing food and fantastic value for money Would highly recommend and we will definately be going back
Rum punch is delicious & so was the food Plenty Of choice on the menu Friendly service Good atmosphere
Good choice of food available averagely priced minimal Beer Wine offered which is a little higher prices than normal  Overall a great place for lunch

Customer service was bang on Atmosphere was relaxed and peaceful the restaurant itself is stunning Dimmed with candle lights spaceful and elegant Recommended wine was beautiful and the food was stunning I had a chicken dish served with potatoes could of been better with veg but didn t take the taste away My boyfriend had the jerk chicken and said it was also beaut Would definitely go again when visiting liverpool
Stopped in here for a quick bite before heading to Manchester the staff were very friendly and food was fast hot and tasty love it

We moved to the area a couple of years ago and have been doing the trot to Carshalton when we wanted a decent pub We ve drunk at a couple of the group s other pubs so we had high hopes and so far we ve not been disappointed Decent array of ales and quite lovely staff We ve done a couple of evenings and it s been nicely busy And a couple of Sundays there with the kids   The pub is big enough that you can have children there without getting on people s nerves So far we love it  leaving the fifth star to be added if they get the kitchen right

Clean enough room and shower was fine for one night Quite small but OK for the price Very noisy outside though as it s a busy road and late at night people going home drunk so if you have a room overlooking the front it could be a problem Limited parking but I got a space so was fine   Best thing - amazing breakfast Nice people too Would stay there again

I think I got taken to this pub when I was much younger and living about 20 miles away Since then I ve grown up a lot and moved to Huddersfield and now live about 10 minutes away Always a good meal here I ve never been and left either dissapointed with the food or service or felt like I was still hungry Thoroughly good value for money and would always come here for a carvery over the Toby down the road

I visited on a Saturday for lunch and was impressed Although it was fairly quiet I found the service to be very efficient there s an open kitchen where we watched the only chef tossing pizza dough into the air and generally moseying around in true Italian style The had a great atmosphere consisting of good music  mainly Dean Martin  attractive d€÷cor and furniture The place was spotless even the toilets if I may be as so bold to say so  I had the Pannacotta to start which was delicious the bread was clearly freshly baked and a pizza for the main which matched the starter in its quality  It wasn t cheap but not too expensive considering that it s located in the city centre

A very nice a welcoming atmosphere this is probably the best Wagamama branch I have been to and their chefs made some great food for us The flavours were as good as I ve tasted in any Wagamama and our waiter named Paul was extremely pleasant and made my girlfriend s lunch very enjoyable for us both he even sang happy birthday  I very much recommend the duck ramen which tasted delightful and the white chocolate and ginger cheesecake

We have had a coffee break on a number of occasions at this establishment We have always been greeted cheerfully and have enjoyed our coffee and scone It is a restful tea room and easily accessible from the A1 Alnwick Bypass We recommend The Old Stables for good quality produce and value for money

Great food loved it Mild to hot good variety The BBQ wings are the best I ever had repeated as my whole family loved it The interiors are exciting and comfortable The only issue was very long wait for the main I guess it was an exception I would have rated 5 if the food had come on time or someone bothered to come and tell us but I would rate their service as professional as they did all they could to make our visit very satisfactory will definitely visit again
A group of us went to pre theatre dinner It was very good and suited all of our different whims Guess you always need to book though if you are going to the theatre as we were

We had a late dinner here and it was lovely the owner was very friendly the food was great we found them helpful they were happy to chat with us and give us tips on where to go the food was clearly home made and delicious we would go back
Good coffee amazing deli panini topping up with good service I am giving only 4 stars as they should have a lunch time deal  Highly recommended

We decided to go out for Sunday lunch at the last minute The Crooked Billet was fully booked in the restaurant but they had space in bar where they seem to serve the full menu as well as a cut down bar menu The friendly staff made a point of covering a couple of menu choices that were not available but the menu is large enough for that not to be an issue My wife had the roast lamb and I had the beer battered fish Both done perfectly We will certainly go again The bar and outside table area is dog friendly

We visited this restaurant twice during our few days in Berwick We found the food and the service extremely good It is a relaxing restaurant with a good atmosphere and friendly host and is ideally situated within the town We couldnt fault the food we especially enjoyed the fillet steak

This is just a very well thought out and executed restaurant not quite Michelin starred but damn it - pretty close The location is a lovely part of Katherine s Dock which feels like you have been teleported out of busy London The restaurant itself is comfortable and welcoming The staff could not have been more engaging and pleasant but also professional and knowledgeable Then we get to the food which is tapas but nothing like the tapas I ve had before in Spain or in England This is a very inventive version of tapas - I m not a food writer - I cannot do the dishes we had justice - but hey go yourself and taste them you ll thank me - Would I recommend it I just did

Visited Sunday night with friends having stumbled across restaurant earlier in the day Great welcome - food fresh and tasty Thoroughly recommend eating here AND Vittorio not sure of correct spelling  has a lovely singing voice

I visited The Yard recently with friends  Atmosphere is nice for couples families and small group of friends having two dining areas inside and one outside  Food was delightfully presented and tasted as good as it looked I had a Burger which was fresh and very tasty the best I ve had for quite some time  Creative use of ingredients but at the same time very well balanced with complimentary flavours Friends had a sharer which they said was very good particularly the fresh spring rolls and pork Service was very good staff friendly as well as helpful and attentive too your needs not a long time for getting the order out even Have no hesitation in recommending this foodie place and Malton as a destination for good food

We visited Shabana recently whilst visiting family in the area and enjoyed a decent curry  We rang to book but needn t have bothered because it wasn t very busy even on a Saturday evening  We were seated and waited to get order our drinks and we waited and we waited Finally our drinks order were taken but dissapointment prevailed as there were only small bottles of cobra and only Kingfisher on draft - come on a curry isn t a curry without a giant bottle of Cobra or Kingfisher  Finally our drinks arrived but with one of our party having to wait  We then orderd our food and were pleasantly supriosed by the quality of the curry - they ve obviosly got a good chef  But we wanted another drink so ordered them but for some reason they didn t arrive so had to reorder - terrible  Overall the food was excellent but the service was terrible

Visited the Tempest on 1st June 16 Despite the resurfacing works going on in the car park which was full always a good sign  we managed to park on the side of the road The pub had a very friendly atmosphere and we had not booked but a table was available The menu is not extensive but wide enough for most tastes Prabably best to do a few dishes well than churn out masses of pinged rubbish We had a starter main course and sweet all of which were extremely tasty and very well presented and deelivered in ample portions The staff were very attentive and efficient I would recommend The Tempest to anyone who wants a good value and good quality meal

What a super place this is A huge fireplace and old-fashioned armchairs make it difficult to leave The menu is very interesting and varied I was spoiled for choice and would have been happy with at least 6 out of the approx 15 on offer The home-made Thai crab cakes were excellent though a sweet chilli side dip would have been a good idea No complaints though I shall look forward to a return visit

This is ideal for lunch it is years since I have eaten here in the evening I tend to come here to take advantage of the set lunch menu whilst at work The food is good if standard Thai fayre but is very reliable with good service and great value  As a regular visitor they must be doing something right I d recommend this place for anyone looking for reasonable tasty food served well and promptly if you gave an hour spare away from the office

Great meal food was tasty had burger with brisket meat very soft and tasty corn dog was lovely shake was nice but did not enjoy the donut just being picky the restaurant is a little cold now with winter coming needs to get sorted will be back
what s not to like Kim and Steve make you really welcome the food s good the wine s good good atmosphere

I ve been here four times now and each and every time the meat is done beyond perfection   you really won t get better anywhere  But  the salads   it s a lottery Now and again you get one so sour and tart that your face just puckers up and you can t think of anything else for the rest of the evening I know about tangy   but this is exponentially beyond tangy  I genuinely do recommend going but if you get a salad try it fast and get it changed if it makes your lips smack the back of your head

This is now a vast improvement on what it was in the past The decor is excellent and and it seems no expense has been spared on trying to make this the In Place in Harrogate The food was great and the staff were extremely attentive but that should be expected as it had been open less than a week The wine list is extensive but overall I felt that as a bistro it was expensive in excess of 220 for 4 people 2 of which were teenagers  including drinks for 2 courses Request a table behind the front screened area as I think the bar will become very popular and it will mean that you are eating amongst a throng of young drinkers at busy times Will certainly try it again though

Breakfast with a friend and like many others who have written reviews on Dishoom I was also sceptical about British Indian food Being an Indian myself this place seemed even less exciting but boy was I wrong Fresh dishes flavoursome and interesting flavour mixes topped off with reasonable prices and brilliant service It s really the small things that make the experience when dining out and from being seated immediately to being asked for water rather than the conventional can I have some water please i m dying of thirst from the Central Line to being given extra time to order breakfast because my friend had not arrived yet rather than the conventional breakfast finishes at X and you re Y so Z  No complications no fuss just excellent service and pleasant if not mindblowing food I look forward to my next visit and testing the curries On this occasion I speak for the breakfast menu and the delicious chai seemingly bottomless and give a great big thumbs up

Had a fantastic meal at this restaurant which was spicy NOT swimming in oil great friendly staff Could have done with some background music and to give a better entrance impression remove the clutter from the doorway as well as fix the strip in the floor - loose the duck tape - it really lets you down
Went with four friends looked at trip advisor beforehand and the reviews were positive  Everyone said how good the food was  the Dansak was as good as any I have eaten  also feed value

The starters are very good value with lots of choice For mains lots of fresh kebabs but if you like fish there is a choice of sea bass or sea bream grilled to order with fried potatoes and an extensive salad A great place for an inexpensive freshly cooked family outing Booking advised - restaurant was full by 19 30 on a Wednesday Would definitely have given an overall rating of 5 if waitress had not picked up a fork which had been knocked onto floor and put it back on adjacent table

We popped in here last weekend on a hot day so Caff was very busy We had a nice visit and ordered a couple of toasties there was a mix up with one being on the wrong bread but that doesn t bother us The milkshakes were brilliant the best part was that the woman managing the shop heard that we were looking for a longer parking space and offered us hers for the 3 hours we were in the area  this was brilliant and very lovely of her We will definitely be returning Many thanks

We visited The Bellhouse for lunch never been before but I believe it used to be a harvester  It has the feeling of a country pub in a built up area which is nice We sat outside on a day that wasn t particularly warm and was in fact raining This isn t an issue as they have huge heated umbrellas in their outside seating area  We went to the bar to order drinks first impressions are so important and the man behind the bar gave the impression we were an inconvenience to him We ordered drinks with one being a diet coke the drinks were placed on the bar without too much enthusiasm from the bar man but with no indication which was the diet coke so I had to ask Customer service in the UK sucks and spoils what can be great places  Our food was delivered promptly and tasted great but there was something missing and that again came back to the lack of interest from the staff If they could sort that out then I would go back again as the food is good

My wife and I went on a Sunday afternoon for lunch On offer was a all you can eat menu for 18 95 per person You could choose as much as you liked from a set menu Most of the food was very good it was just let down by a few things We has chicken satay spring rolls BBQ ribs and seaweed for starter and were all really nice The crispy duck was let down by dried out meat and too much crispy fat We had a variety of beef chicken and lamb dishes for main course - all pretty good Staff were friendly and attentive - I would definitely go back

We went to this restaurant with our 2 kids and parents for a simple Lunch We had the pleasure to appreciate some nice pub food We were served quickly and our kids had some specials from the kids menu We are grateful the chef was flexible enough to adapt to our kids wishes We also liked the decoration and the room we were in was very quiet which we enjoyed for a family meal

Booked last minute for our first night out during our stay in Torquay Kids had huge burgers with great chips and very hot  Wife had the Thai which was rated very highly Service was good Portions huge We had a good evening enjoyed our food and waddled away very full

Excellent high-end Indian cuisine not your typical high street fayre Had poppadums masala dosa and Alleppey Prawn Moilee from the dinner menu all excellent washed down with a bottle of Tucker and interspersed with some lovely amuse bouche including tomato & lentil soup and lychee ice cream  Superbly presented excellent service

Prezzo is one of the most reliable chains of Italians in the UK This was my first time at this branch and it didn t disappoint  We arrived at 13 15 and explained that we had tickets for Buckingham Palace and needed to eat lunch and walk back across Green Park for 14 45 The restaurant was very quiet but the staff were great ensuring we were able to complete our meal of two courses and coffee with plenty of time to make our entry time without ever feeling rushed Two pizzas and a chicken dish were all delicious and the service was friendly informative and efficient  The building has an interesting history having been a bar in the 1960s I would definitely go back again

My son and myself visited the Black Lake Inn on the Hilderstone Road Meir Heath Stoke on Trent There is a good choice of starters We both had garlic breaded mushrooms which cost 3 25 each Then for a main meal he chose a rare steak and commented that the chef truly knew how to cook rare steak His meal was Steak New York and cost 12 95 I had a meal called surf turf and cluck which consisted of 10z rump steak cooked medium scampi and chicken breast etc My meal came to 14 95 The meals were quite big and reasonable in cost The service was friendly and although the inn was very busy we did not seem to have wait long for our meals The place is well worth a visit
I am eating there once in a while the food is good service nice very cosy place They have a good menu lots to choose from It is always tasty something different

Visited early in the evening and chose the festive menu The steak was very good and the service was excellent Don t understand the reason for the very large lettuce wedge which was unnecessary but the meal and service made for a pleasant evening

Formally the Ruchetta Restaurant we returned to find a new name Ristorante Reno s and new management The food was excellent and the staff extremely friendly We have never seen this restaurant very busy but it desrves to be - well worthe the drive to visit it

This cafe is great It looks like a typical greasy spoon and in fact does have the typical egg bacon baked beans chips if that s your preference but as it s run by a real Italian family they also do lasagne for example and other Italian dishes and very nice home-baked pies  But if you just want a s=up of tea and a couple of slices of toast it s great for that also

Nice characterful pub food good dog friendly ample parking prices were a little steep but no worse than most pubs within the area I d recommend booking a minimum of 24hrs in advance as you get turned away when it s busy

I last visited this restaurant a year ago and thought the place expensive I have revisited and found a contrast to a year ago The menu is clearly redesigned showing more options and prices available though the wine is listed on the boards in chalk above your head and if you do not look you will miss the prices The meals from cheap to expensive depending on what you want to consume look at the menu for a cheaper variant if available Wines range with a decent taste to the palate both a good range of white red or rose wine available Food is freshly cooked so expect about 20 minutes so if alone - take a book or a kindle  I did and no objections raised  If there is a group going I recommend making reservations beforehand Without a drink a meal can cost less than 10

It s a great afternoon out for my granddaughter and I to cycle over to Heath Tea Rooms and call in for some refreshments We always spend our time outside so I can t really comment fairly on the tables inside the premises Outside the gardens are extremely well presented the refreshments are really nice and being on Heath Common there is almost no noise An island of tranquility The staff are extremely helpful and always make sure my granddaughter is served what she wants

started visiting in 2013 but quality started to deteriorate so stopped in mid 2015 re-visited mid-august 2016 and pleased to say it seems to be back to it s best sunday menu sensibly limited to traditional dishes and it seems to work not cheap but bearing in mind quality and portions pretty good value good selection of wines and cask ales only negative is that they allow dogs in the main dining area
Excellent menu choice service and food was good but a bit more pricey than our local Chinese restaurant

I visited recently with my family for Sunday brunch we didn t book a table and found ourselves a bit lucky to get a table so I would definitely recommend booking where possible  The menu offered something different to your usual brunch spots which was refreshing and the quality of the food definitely backed up the quirky menu and buzzy atmosphere  One to try if you are looking for a bit of variety in your brunch routine

My wife and I ate at Postilion on a busy Saturday night and had pre booked We had a nice table near the window but the restaurant is split into 2 main rooms and my main advice if you pre book would be to make sure you don t get the table by the kitchen door  Food was excellent for starters my wife had satay beef and pork patties and I had 3 little pigs both excellent and for main course we both had steak which was cooked perfectly as asked 1 rare 1 medium  The deserts we had Banana and Toffee Cr€—me Brul€÷e and Crepe both excellent Service was good although one of the waiters reminded me of Manuel from Fawlty Towers  and prices reasonable  All in all very enjoyable and I would return but just be careful not to get the table by the kitchen

Visited hungry after a show The restaurant is friendly unfussy and easy  The choice of food is good the flavours and textures genuine and interesting  Very good value for money and fun to be sat next to the staff eating and chatting at the end of service  Just what we needed at the end of a long day
Early evening meal with my wife staff were very friendly and various items we ordered came with very little fuss and was good and tasteful
The food here is very good and the service is also nice I had a Lamb Bhuna which was cooked to perfection I will be coming again

Whether I pop in for supper with my wife drop in to meet friends to catch up with news I am always made to feel welcome be it a quiet midweek early evening or bustling rush hour food serving period  I have met friends who manage a large number of eateries and joined them for supper in the Jolly Sailor and they have commented that the food and service was better than one would expect So comfortable have we been at the Jolly that my wife has requested we celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary there  Visit and take time to sit and watch the river it will revitalise you in all ways

The Kings Arms in Ninfield is a place to go for good value food  It is quite often packed out so go earlier or later than normal to get a table I have found the staff to be quite unfriendly at times but I would put this down to how very busy and stressed they get  On my last visit they had run out of cutlery the queue for the carvery was very long and our table hadn t been cleared  it was the last table in the place  However it is very inexpensive and a homely place  I will still return

Food great had the two course early bird menu both meat and vegetarian meals very impressive although not a huge vegetarian choice across the whole menu The table was however a little too close to the kitchen and till so a little noisy and squashed in Also a little cold I am guessing the atmosphere during lunchtime would be better to make the most of the conservatory

Nice Italian chain slightly more up market than Strada - more professional and personal service hence more expensive Had a very tasty seafood risotto will the wife had seafood linguini which she enjoyed Wine a trifle on the pricey side but not enough to put me off  Was fairly quiet  possibly due to location on our visit there are lots of tables and the place is well cared for so I presume it gets busier later in the evening

I have been using Livingstones for 15 years It is always my first choice for coffee and a light snack sandwiches cakes jacket potato etc all at very reasonable prices  In the morning they do a bacon roll and a coffee combo for a bargain price  What sets it apart is the calm atmosphere the friendly manner and the usually quick table service of the volunteers who are young and old alike  I say calm atmosphere but of course sometimes young children playing can make a bit of noise but we ve all been children haven t we  I understand that the profits are all put to good use in third world countries so all in all a good cause  Give it a try or at least pop your head in and see if it is for you - it s a few doors from the Arts Picture House - another excellent venue - why not pop your head in there as well they do more than fillums

We had a very tasty takeaway meal We choose on of the set menu options and we weren t disappointed  The food was delicious and the portion sizes we big enough to feed more than just the 2 of us  We would definitely recommend Lanna Thai

Don t expect cordon bleu but what you get is good pub grub served throughout the day seven days a week at a great price Dave is an excellent landlord and well backed up by Laura and likable young staff Easy to park in decent surroundings as well as an historical 400 year old building Well worth a visit - ignore the complaints of diesel 122 who probably would be better shopping at Tesco

James - I tend to always go for a Burger As always it was as i expect from a Whetherspoons Good Burger Kaya - I had a HUGE hotdog I put lots of Mayo and Ketchup on it I like that you get lots of sauces I would eat this again  Jen - I just went for a Ham Panini and Chips It was nice and filed a hole I would like to see a better select of Merlot from the bottle Not a fan of wine from a tap

We went here because of a family birthday It really was superb with everyone satisfied in the end The menu is slightly limited but that s what you d expect from a fish and chip restaurant I ordered the breaded plaice and it was some of the best fish that I have ever eaten The portion was huge and well worth the price that I paid for it However while I will admit that a sunday lunchtime is not the busiest the atmosphere was lacking and not many people were in there
nice afternoon tea very good brew fresh cakes charming service and at a reasonable price we will visit again

Sue and Alfredo are a lovely couple and have made sure that their cafe is perfectly located in the very centre of Bexhill town staffed by warm friendly waiters and chefs and serving delicious twists on English Central European and Iberian dishes Eating here is an education in how varied and fun the cuisine of our homelands should be while the owners are unpretentious and just jolly good fun Very much recommended for those seeking high quality and affordable food in a low key setting

Great service in a small but cosy little restaurant food was excellent and very reasonably priced as well as the wine being cheap and of good quality Would definitely recommend to anyone and will make sure to come here again

We went to this pub on a Wednesday evening for the first time and ordered Linguine from the bar service The food was actually well presented and was particularly tastie It came very quickly and we were able to finish the meal and carry on with our evening very quickly The bar is nicely historic and well decorated and the staff were pleasant enough
Pulled over for a lunch dogs outside only which is fine beautiful views lovely food Kept passing on the way to the beach glad we pulled over Worth a visit
Seems well run efficient and smart nice place for a group meeting

Other reviewers who like The India Club seem to have it right I have been going for several years and it is indeed unchanging including during a very recent visit I would add to all that positivity that it is above all a very civilised place it does one good to be amongst such staff and customers I have rated its food as v good though it is more enjoyable than outstanding I have rated it as good for business and it is but not if you want to show-off It just isn t that sort of a room

good value meal everyone reasonably happy  mixture of menu meals kids meals & carvery carvery was very well cooked although strange choices of vegetables would have liked to see some plain carrots Broccoli or cauliflower On the whole it was worth the stop on the way home and would probably use again

Made a last minute decision to visit this restaurant for a party of 5 they were very accommodation and found us a table at short notice  The level of service was first class and very attentive without being in your face plus more importantly every member of our group remarked on the quality of the food I can thoroughly recommend the Fresh Scallops & Prawns in a puff pastry which I should have asked as a a main dish but larger - superb flavours and texture Well done to the whole team who worked well together
My second visit to this lovely restaurant Nothing out of this world but a good menu and friendly efficient service Will certainly return
Great little place can see why it s busy Great food Good service awesome cocktails with a twist A must

We visited the swan over the August bank holiday for a drink after a night out at the theatre The place had a nice atmosphere friendly staff nice crowd Nice views over the Thames Definitely worth a visit if your looking for a mellow venue along the southbank

this is one of three golf courses within a 15 minute drive from home  lucky me  and is well worth a visit unusually you can play either 9 or 18 holes and front or back 9 first it has something for all abilities with plenty to test your skill level there is plenty of parking and a well stocked golf and accessories shop the restaurant is excellent and caters for everything from a light snack to a full steak-dinner and the menu is varied

Very good restaurant with a good selection of food We had three course and all was very good high quality food My Wife is American and was very impressed with it Only down side with the restaurant is the layout and features of it It s a pub and sadly doesn t have the American diner feel or vibe to it But I am being picky Worth a go

Me & my wife called here for Sunday lunch  The staff were all very pleasant & helpful  The carvery was very good plenty of meat & good choice of vegetables  Good beer choice with two cask ales Timothy Taylor & Black Sheep  Luckily my wife was driving  Happy Days
After driving round to try and get a last minute Sunday lunch we tried this place and was not disappointed

As part of a weekend celebration of a major anniversary we booked in a group of over twenty family and friends for Sunday Lunch The tables were located as promised giving easy access for the children in the party to the play area which they enjoyed We could all order a la carte which was not on offer at another place we had tried and the meals were all delivered incredibly quickly given how full the place was Not only that everyone in the group was well satisfied with the quality and quantity of the food We appreciated the friendly and efficient service from start to finish and heartily recommend for such a group booking
A spur of the moment meal out with my wife son and daughter in law what a lovely spur of the moment really enjoyed the food as did all of us

Came here for lunch on Saturday seemed popular as there was a few people already in and it turned out to be a good choice Food was decently prices and didn t take long to come out The dough was very fresh as I got both garlic bread and a pizza My girlfriend got lasagne which she also enjoyed Our only comment was that the staff didn t seem too happy I don t think we saw the girl crack a smile and she didn t say more than a few words The food would be worth returning for though

Girlfriend s friends visited from Ireland and a visit to Duck & Waffle was high on their list of things to do The staff can either be very welcoming or quite rude This time around they were polite The lift is an experience in itself and the venue is amazing Cocktails are on the upper end of what you d expect to pay and the range is brilliant Worth a trip just for the cocktails dinner requires a lot of notice to get a booking Bone marrow cosmopolitan was my favourite

Came here fort food as we were staying and working in the area Restaurant is very nice inside and roomy The service we had was great from an attentive waiter The food was excellent and well priced The free brandys at the end of the meal was also a nice touch

Although we had to wait rather a while for our food they did apologise and cancelled the cost of the starter in reparation We had Belly Pork Tuna and Fish&Chips - all very good and I thought the Tuna exceptional served with apricot & tomato salsa The Lemon Meringue pie was lovely and light and beautifully presented but I would have preferred a little more bite to the lemon

We have dined here a couple of times now it s perfect for couples date night or family treat Whether your going for lunch or dinner still dress better than casual It can be persevere as a tad snobby but that s not a bad thing The food was a little overprice I think they may be trying a little too hard to push fancy food with flowers for Ongar Road but none the less again why not aim high The bar round the corner could be a great setting for drinks but the same DJ is always in there playing the same songs I think they need to mix the entertainment in to draw in the younger crowd

Were asked on the phone when we booked if we had any particular likes and dislikes so I explained that we were vegetarian When we arrived we were given the vegetarian menu and given a choice of seats by the very nice lady behind the counter  Our first choice of wine was out of stock so the waitress asked us what we liked and went to ask somebody else for advice She managed to find a bottle of exactly what we wanted from the exact country and region Fantastic service  Overall the food was very good the service excellent and the wine fantastic Would definitely eat here again if we came back to Ludlow
A pleasant caf€÷ with an old and comfortable feel There are a number of shops also selling a range of unusual things Nice place to sit in the sun by the sea with a coffee

The food was amazing i have no complains at all All 5 meals were to a high standard We had a few cocktails which were very nice And i have had a few cocktails in my time A big thank you to matthew paige w and summer

We are here during a weekend the first thing to point out is that the car park is tiny - maybe enough to for 20 cars We arrive as a party of 5 adults and a 2 month old baby who breast feeds The staff were great and provided a friendly fast service  There is a nice atmosphere here with a bunch of humerus pictures dotted around I ve been told these are from local artists  The toilets were very clean and baby changing facilities are available  The menu is fairly uncluttered with just a handful of tasty sounding dishes We ordered a few sides to share there were all around 5 each and were all really tasty veg dishes I ordered a crab salad which again was very nice but the portion was on the small size especially since main dishes are around the 12- 18 price range My dads meal came out slightly later than ours maybe 5 minutes at most  even so the staff apologised at the slight delay and gave him a larger portion  Deserts were really good I never end ordered one myself but tried the chocolate mousse and also the apple tart The tart was for 2 people to share and id recommend it if your undecided on a desert The presentation was also top notch I ve included a picture of it

Visited Planet Buffet on the 28 7 77 for a meal as it was my birthday overall I ve given it a 4 star rating  This Chinese restaurant has been in Hereford for a while now it doesn t look much from the outside and it could do with a bit of a makeover both inside and out but very satisfactory The food was great couldn t fault it plenty to choose from all very fresh and tasty and you can go up as many times as you like  i went 3 times just for the mains  twice for dessert  the drinks in my opinion were reasonable strongbow 2 80 pint boddingtons 2 80 pint pint of coke 2 50 Thought they would be a lot more exspensive  I ll most definitely be visiting this restaurant again  Adult prices  11 50pp after 6pm  pretty sure kids eat free with 1 paying adult  was also given a 20 off voucher to use on our next visit of take away which is a bonus

Went to eat at the Spring inn for a family celebration and got a booth next to the window in the conservatory area Staff are great and they look after you well Choice of food is good and you can swap things around as well if you fancy something else Everyone enjoyed the food and the atmosphere is great All in all good food  good drink great time
Excellent place to get a pub meal when staying at the Old Station in Petworth - only 5 minutes away Good beer and good pub food from a varied menu

We were in Hull City Centre currently AKA the bombsite on Friday April 1st and gravitated towards Princes Dockside where the pavements unusually are NOT dug up I had heard that Cuckoos had closed and decided to try the replacement-Blue Water I should mention that I never liked Cuckoos- bland food and indifferent service  Was very encouraged to see an interesting menu- breakfasts light bites mains sandwiches cakes etc There was a good & varied selection of drinks as well We decided to have a light ish lunch and chose Moroccan meatballs with hummus and Halloumi with chilli Jam Both were delicious nicely presented and had really flavoursome sauces and attractive and tasty garnish We both enjoyed both dishes but felt that some bread-to soak up all the beautiful sauces-would have been perfect The staff were very friendly and comfortingly seemed to have an interest in & knowledge of the product We enjoyed it so much that our light lunch was embellished by a selection board of cakes the star of which was the nicest Victoria sponge I have tasted Two meals cakes and four drinks including a large glass of house white cost under 30  Was pleased to find somewhere nice-and different in the city centre

We were on a cruise break and so were in Southampton for the evening  We therefore wanted somewhere near the quay to eat  This is a cosy relatively small restaurant with some nice touches Home made delicacies add to the quality We had some nice cheese pastries  The fish tasted fresh and was well cooked and our desserts were lovely  Portions are small but you get quality not quantity and that was okay for us  Cocktails were a little overpriced and some of the supplements hard to justify but overall we enjoyed our visit and would go back
The breakfast here is awesome we have knick named it BBB  Big boy breakfast it really is great the fried bread is to die for

Went for a drink Sunday afternoon and returned for a meal Monday evening Fairly quiet both times but service was still excellent Ales wonderful and food definitely superior to most chains  Just above Pulteney Bridge nice location

Excellent place to enjoy Nandos Opportunity to eat both indoors and outside the restaurant Excellent customer service plenty of tills so the movement of customers is quick everything catered for Exactly what a Nandos should be

Went here for a meal to celebrate our sons graduation Visited on a Tuesday night Not particularly busy Bar orders felt slow Ordered two beers poured straight away and three cocktails The cocktails took some time to arrive I know they have to make them but still seemed slow to arrive we ve just come back from a week in Greece where cocktails ordered appeared within a couple of minutes  The upside was that they were nice once they arrived  I thought the beer Peroni was pricey at 5 a pint but then I guess that s South East prices for you Food was great Good selection and well cooked Would come here again

I ve just been back to Il Mascalzone having last been there some years back We were all very impressed with the food - good portions well-presented and really tasty There s a wide selection on the menu from pizza and pasta to full meat and fish dishes Service was good too the waitresses were all friendly and efficient Il Mascalzone is Italian through and through - there s even a TV on the wall showing Italian programmes For us the only downside was that the restaurant was extremely loud mostly because the place was packed but they re also playing thumping music in the background Which all made conversation pretty difficult without constantly having to shout It was a Saturday night so probably not so bad at other times Overall a really good Italian restaurant great food good prices and good service Recommended

We chose the wild boar and chorizo burger and a basic burger Both very tasty served with prepared coleslaw and triple fried chips All served by an attentive but not pushy waitress who also looked after the drinks The Fullers London Pride beer was the best I have had served at the correct temperature Cost about 25  Yes we could have found one of the very varied eating establishments along the Broadway but we wanted something with some character  which had some history Although the existing building was built in 1902 the Swan s name on this site goes back much earlier The restaurant is up a lovely heavy oak staircase on the first floor into a large but quiet room Here we enjoyed some tranquillity away from the bustle of the streets of London Don t be put off by the very noisy bar downstairs just go through after seeing the menu on display out on the pavement  The Swan is 1 minutes walk across the road from Hammersmith Station and 5 minutes from the Hammersmith Apollo where we went to see Renaud In fact we were able to see the artist s billboard outside the Apollo from our table at the Swan while we ate upstairs A good start to our evening show
A typical harvester where you get good value for money food The waiter was attentive but not over bearing good views over the harbour A pity that they had run out of one of the bottle beer choices
Does what it says on the tin  Fast fresh fish &chips To make this review 100characters is nuts parking outside is difficult because of the popularity of the fish quay area itself
Went with friends and our dog Had a great meal good value for money very welcoming staff and the dog was also very welcome Nice atmosphere good food what more could you want
Went there with family The food was very good i recommend the roasted duck the crispy duck Waiters were attentive and kind I strongly recommend Price are adapted to the quality of the food

Me and my girlfriend ended there almost by accident looking for a place to have a late dinner at the Albert Dock We got surprised because of the joyful ambient that combined groups of people having drinks or other still having their meals The both of us ordered fish&chips and we got quite satisfied with the quality of the dishes and the service giving the fact that the prices were not exensives at all Quite advisable

Went with a huge group of friends for an early Christmas dinner and one of the waiters by the name of Connor was really really friendly Made the extra effort to check that everything was in place and was up to par Even gave us free champagne towards the end of the night Great service

Visited here yesterday during work childminding  It was a nice break for the children and they enjoyed their milkshakes and caramel doughnuts Loose tea was lovely and got plenty out of it Contrary to previous reviews on this experience the tables were clean and the service was good and prompt Will definitely be revisiting
Don t let the location put you off this place is great It s got a really original menu and the food is prepared to high standard Definitely one for curry lovers

I have always been a fan of the Fairman Being a Weatherspoon s you know what you re going to get Beer selection is great and the pumps are always clean My only comment is that the place is long overdue a refurb Lights half hanging off the wall grotty dirty paintings on the wall and different colour temperature lights on the exterior aren t giving the place a good image If anyone from Weatherspoon s sees this Please put some money into the building
Great little bar Good location on main street with a few seats outside Good atmosphere good service good drinks selection
Choice of 4 ales the 2 tried were both well kept and enjoyable Nice pub feel the sort of place where you could feel at home over a couple of pints and not feel that you were expected to order food
The Pub was a nice place to end a good day of sightseeing The food was good value for money & did not have to wait long for the food to arrive A nice way to unwind after a busy day

Took a while to get a seat but once that was done and the food ordered then it was very efficiently delivered Steak was cooked how I asked so no complaints there On busy days you can feel a bit rushed to finish your meal as people stand there looking at you with that hurry up an eat look on their faces
Hard to argue here friendly staff good food and really good value  7 per dish  Nice atmosphere would definitely recommend
Friendly service comfortable nice decorative order recently decorated and very clean loos Excellent Lamb Hotpot and Robinsons Ales

I visited this pub with friends on a rainy Monday evening We had booked a table for 8 00pm having failed to get a 7 30pm booking because the restaurant was full We arrived 15 minutes early thinking we could enjoy a drink at the bar before getting our table but that proved more difficult than expected because there was nowhere to sit or even stand  We huddled in front of the bar getting in everyone s way and hoping we didn t have to wait too long Perhaps they could reserve a little space somewhere for diners awaiting their table  Got to the table and was immediately presented with the menu The waitress did not ask if we would like a drink and abandoned us to read our menus A good selection of dishes at reasonable prices Our party of four all content that they had found something to their taste Orders were taken including drinks and we were served about 20 minutes from the time we sat down at the table Reasonable for food preparation but 20 minutes without a drink is just too long  Food was of good quality well cooked and presented As the meal progressed and early diners began to leave the service at our table improved markedly  A little disappointed to begin but my opinions lifted as the evening progressed We left in good spirits having enjoyed pleasant evening

We selected the tasting menu option without the wine option and then couldn t agree which of the delightful dishes we enjoyed the most I went for the cod two others the pork and one the pre-dessert I did select a nice white wine from the massive list to accompany the meal and lots of fizzy water with coffee extra afterwards Service was excellent though it would have been better if the first two courses had arrived sooner as we indulged on the bread very nice though it was  The room did get a tad noisy as the evening wore on

This is the third time we have visited the White Lyon The food is absolutely excellent Some of the best Thai food we have tasted The staff are in the main very good The atmospere is also very friendly and welcoming  However the level of service drops dramatically when the place starts to fill up We will keep coming back as the food is that good But that service needs addressing That aside the place is excellent
Worth a visit to enjoy your fish and chips crisply fresh You will see a large queue in the shop for takeaway always a good sign The menu is varied and reasonably priced service is quick and friendly

Being lovers of Thai food we recently visited the Siam Smile in Cheltenham We were there on a Monday night so it was very quiet and were served quite quickly  The food was good but not the best we have ever had I felt that some of the flavours spices were just tempered back a little although it did clearly state on the menu how hot some of the dishes were  I think newbies to Thai food would not be disappointed but having been to Thailand and been to a lot of Thai restaurants in the UK I felt it was not quite up there with the very best  Overall though we did enjoy the evening and it is very popular as a takeaway option

been there before a few years back then called the Balnoon Inn what a improvement the new owners have made a comfortable clean restuarant serving delicous meals at a reasonable price certainly will visit next year on my next holiday
The food here was very good and the portions good value for money enjoyed the battered cod and chips

Every time we come back to Brighton we make the trip to Hove Park Cafe in it s idyllic Hove Park location  The coffee and the food are great whether you re really hungry or just want a snack Also the staff are really cool and the atmosphere is very chilled and laid back perfect for a late brunch

Got lost one sunday afternoon and came across this place so popped in for a drink with my partner just to check the place out my first impression as i walked through the door i noticed a big open fireplace with a log burner that was actually on and made the entire place feel cosy and a welcoming heat from the early chill upon ordering a drink and having a sneak at the menu which had a good range of different things to choose from we settled at a table and decided to have some pitta taramosalata and some greek sausages   great flavors  I had a stifado for main which was full of flavour and melt in the mouth tender and my wife had a mousaka which was equally tasty portions good for the price would definately go back and worth the drive in my opinion and to top it all the waiter told us about their traditional greek nights at the end of the month which ive not experienced before but will be trying to book for  i would recommend a trip to this restaurant to see for yourselves

I ate at The Basement with 3 friends and we had a very good meal  The menu has a variety of dishes and styles and the food is a good price Situated right by the Harbour and with outside dining in a heated marque conservatory it is a very pleasant spot to dine in an evening  All in all good value good food and a nice location

Very good food Manager is very keen to help if you wish to try new dishes and keen that you should wish to return At the end of the meal you get a box of chocolates if your party is minimum of four persons  Sometimes a bit over attentive but not enough to put you off Have visited several times and will certainly continue

A friend from Yorkshire recommended this pub for its Carvery Good quality and value for money It was because we had just re-located into the area She was absolutely correct which is a good job as we were taking our family and it could have been embarrassing It most certainly was not

My guest was in London on business for the day and needed to catch a train back north just before 20 00 so we chose this place for a convenient early dinner  Both the food and the service were very good Given the location I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and value for money The staff were attentive but not overly so They were also efficient which is a plus when you have one eye on the clock because there is a train to catch The place was perhaps half full  My guest was on a gluten-free diet one of the reasons for choosing an Indian restaurant as most Indian staples lack gluten but he needed to ask one or two questions which the waiter could answer with ease and confidence which was impressive  Well advised my guest plugged for one of the specials a lamb dish served inside a pumpkin skin He said it was very good I had a crazy craving for a mixed biryani and was very pleased with mine Not quite the dizzy heights of biryani in the finest restaurants in Hyderabad but very good indeed for a Thursday evening curry in Kings Cross My portion was huge so the fact that I left a fair bit behind was down to portion size not the quality of the food The vegetable curry on the side was a little bland on its own but made a good gravy for the biryani  In short as I said in the title very good for its price and location I ll certainly return here if when in similar circumstances again
The food here is sumptuous and the groceries for sale abound A very welcome stopping place at the edge of a very busy road Not to mention being able to visit the farm animals
Easily booked using their web site Our table was ready when we arrived A good warm welcome by staff  We were served quickly and the food was excellent A little pricey but on the whole good value

Visited here on Saturday night as part of a group of 7 and was a little concerned that it wasn t very busy and some of the tepid reviews here on TA  I have to admit that those initial fears were unfounded Yes it s not part of an antiseptic chain somewhere pretending to be something it s not and the beamed rooms only add to the charm in my opinion The orders were patiently taken whilst everyone tried to decide and change their minds halfway through because of all the choice When the food arrived it was lovely  You only had to look at all the empty plates for verification of that fact  One slight point to raise - and appreciate some people like to be in and out quickly - was that we felt the mains followed the starters quite quickly But it s not a major criticism - just a personal preference  We were made to feel very welcome by all the staff and was a great evening enjoyed by all We shall certainly be returning to sample some of the other dishes we missed out on on this occasion  Thanks again and see you soon
Lovely food by the beach with a lovely beer garden area Great value with big portions Great selection of St Austell Ales

My wife and I visited Betty s on Saturday 30th August A small queue outside - should have booked Didn t have to wait more than half an hour though Opted for two pink champagne afternoon teas OK not the cheapest maybe but what we had was very nice and very pleasant service from the waitress Heartily recommened

We stopped rather late on the way back from the midlands at about 2 pm Lovely big smiley welcome and Of course your are not too late It was very gastro Pub in design and yet it works Menu was good Service was excellent and it felt like we had visited many times before We sat in the bar not the restaurant and if I lived down the road it would make for a very good local  No stress just relaxed competency  We left refreshed and calm
Very nice Spanish restaurant on Queen Street in Clarendon Park just off Victoria Park Food is excellent and so is the wine list Inexpensive Staff is courteous and helpful
r u readi 2 pimp out if so go here like srs man u ever see that film soul plane ye well this is basically that in dessert form well gd init bit sickly tho nar mean

Popped in for lunch and really enjoyed it We had the sampler platter some soups and a trout salad All the dishes were very good and we found that place very relaxed They had a 2 4 1 on Pinnacle which we took full advantage of   a couple of times -
Efficient friendly service Delicious pizzas washed down with a cold Peroni Rossa Would recommend  nice atmosphere

Birthday gathering of 14 family members and food service and bar all excellent Great joice of cocktails available menu is really wide and covers all tastes and the food was amazing It all arrived at the same time even though most people had chosen differntly The house red and white are really good value and the heated seating area outside is a real plus even in mid January Well worth a visit

Thursday Night is Steak Night at the Bell Inn The standard of the meat was superb and presented in the best Pub food manner Steak Chips Very Nice Too and Salad Very Nicely dressed If you can eat it all I would be amazed Even the Cheese Board was enough for two to share with some very good cheese This local Pub has got themselves someone very good in their kitchen And they have a good selection of Real Ale
You will need to look for this one but the greenhouse glass cover eating is fab Add the food drink music and good service well what else is there Well done you folks
Good fresh food fast service have eaten here three times and always had a positive experience A suprisingly large and elegant dining room also Very good value for the location

Went here early Saturday evening for a few beers and pizzas had a surprise with the green pizza though it s a big salad on a pizza base Note to self read the menu more carefully the others were truly delicious though and great beer choices too Enjoyed it

First timers and absolutely loved it Great food brilliant atmosphere and a mouth watering selection of cakes for desert Very reasonably priced with generous portion sizes We will be visiting again soon

Offering a wide choice of reasonably priced dishes this restaurant decoratively created from an old riverside warehouse is attractive for its ambience good food and especially the very genuine welcome and help of the staff We can testify for the litre flagon of house red which seems to go well with every dish The unique temperate climate of this corner of England gives a summer from May to end of October so the attractive terrace is well-used We recommend it to visiting yachtties who agree with us that it is not a place to eat in hallowed silence for it resounds to a shared happiness which is very Italian
If you are in Brixham on business or working and need a good cup of coffee and something to eat then head for this cafe where Dan and his team will serve you excellent coffee with a smile

First off the food was absolutely sublime I went for the quail starter and my girlfriend had the crab For the most part whilst eating our starters both of us looked like we had been recently lobotomised and hardly shared a word This was because the flavours bursting out of each mouthful were so complex and delicious a certain amount of concentration was required to make sure none of them got away - the citrusy sauce in amongst the traditional earthy quail ingredients was a thing of beauty The veal main also delivered on flavour as did the desert However upon our arrival at 14 30 for lunch our booked time we were told by the maitre d that the kitchen closes at two thirty  I was not sure what to say Were we too late to order Was I supposed to order within four seconds of sitting down Were the kitchen staff all about to leave I m sure the comment was not meant as such but it made us feel like we had to rush our meal and really did have an affect on our enjoyment Guys - if you are going to take bookings at half two then please make diners feel just as welcome for showing up for a later lunch as you would for those who book early A throwaway comment when you have been looking forward to something so special for so long really can affect how a diner views your place

Not the first time we ve dined there but have always found the carvery to be very good Food is always freshly topped up and the meat is carved when you say what you want Serving chef was very happy but couldn t say the same about all the pub staff but then someone has to work on a Sunday Overall the food is excellent and well worth what you pay

We stayed nearby & found The Red Lion on our first night in Alnmouth Sunday when they mainly serve a Sunday Lunch type menu We had a table in the Restaurant as it is more comfortable after we had had a drink or two first in the Bar Very pleasant evening we had too nice starters & good main course good food decent value nice pub & friendly staff Even though they only serve to early evening people were still welcomed close to the advertised closing time without issue

Bistrot Pierre has a nice feel and atmosphere The staff are friendly and quite attentive Had a lovely evening apart from a couple of things though - my main course the Burger Maison and frites were pretty much cold I didn t want to hold up the rest of our group and I was hungry so I did eat it and to be honest it still tasted all right I did mention it to the waiter and he apologised but reading other reviews it does seem to be a problem Also my daughter ordered a Traditionelle Tarte Flamb€÷e which is definitely on the menu as coming with salad or pomme frites and when it didn t the waiter told us he d checked with the kitchen who dismissed it and said it didn t come with them Hopefully these issues can be addressed as I think the restaurant could be just what Altrincham needs and it would be a shame if it didn t get the repeat custom

We came here for lunch  party of 4 Parents and girlfriend  The starter was great And the service was good everything was going so well Until I decided to order the sea bream after expecting a fillet I was served with a fish The whole fish I was a Virgin in these regards  This was a poor decision I had never gouged the eyeballs of a fish before  nor had I removed bones  This went horribly for me I ended up taking and hour and a half to finish whilst having a bone lodged in my throat Great life lesson for me  All in all a horrible experience all down to my own decisions  9 10 would go again

I had their 2 courses set The starter was the mush of chicken liver and it was really nice I then had some diced beef It was nice and it tasted as the real-homemade food I really have to mention the vegetable mush It was amazing and tasty After all this place is of great value of your money
Just looking for a quick meal prior to going to the theatre - food was tasty and a good varied menu  Decent food  good service  and not overly expensive by London standards

My wife and sons wanted lunch so we decided to try the mustard pot and we were pleasantly surprised The fish and chips were fresh and tasty and the pie was meaty and obviously home made all at a reasonable price the decor is very much in the tradition of the English village Inn warm and inviting and the most important item the beer is very much the traditional ale wih a few imported beers to choose from The staff were attentive and friendly without being annoying and the charming landlady was on hand to ensure no one was ignored and every detail was attended to An altogether pleasant experience
My wife and I visited last night and was very pleased Good food  nice surroundings and great service Pub recently changed hands and looks like they are getting it right Well done
Nice atmosphere good service good food good price VERY friendly There is little more to be said about this pleasant Italian restaurant I WILL be returning and on a fairly regular basis

Casual eating for the seriously rich inhabitants around Marylebone High Street Gives a very good feel for this neighbourhood which has actually been very cool since Paul McCartney stayed here with Jane Asher and family back in the Sixties
