We booked online - simply enough Arrived and were directed to our table but requested if we could have drinks on the balcony Drinks arrived promptly while we viewed the menu When ready we went in to our table and ordered Starters arrived in good time and were all very good Mains also arrived promptly and were delicious All followed by desert and coffee No complaints about food - all very good - in fact number one son said best burger he had had  Only comments would be - drinks a bit pricey but not unusually so - deserts also a bit expensive for their size but again his is not unusual in restaurants these days At no point in the evening was the place full - despite the sign downstairs saying fully booked - however I would rather they were half full and delivered a good experience than packed to the rafters and under delivered On the whole a good evening From a group that regularly eat out in Brixham

I attended with friends on a late Sunday morning for some breakfast lunch  The service was very friendly the building is nicely decorated with an industrial feel to the architecture and some interesting ornaments and oddieites on display  The important bit though the food While the menu is fairly limited compared to some places that offer every dish under the sun there was a good range of traditional breakfast meals and should have something to appeal to all tastes The food arrived quickly and tasted good I opted for a sandwich and soup while friends had full English breakfasts and the accompanying smoothie was lovely  All in all I liked it here Given it s over 100 miles from home I m unlikely to return anytime soon but if I lived in Derby I d be sure to visit again

If you are looking something to round off an evening in the either of the fabulous real ale establishments of the Devonshire Arms or the Coopers Tavern you should definitely try Apne Despite the place being full with a very large party we were very quickly seated and service was prompt throughout the evening As well as the usual suspects on the menu it is worth considering something from the speciality menu I chose one of these which was a chicken tikka curry surrounded by Bombay potatoes and pilau rice  Although there is no licence soft drinks are available but you can also take a pint from your chosen tavern -

I think that the experience you have of the Red Lion is going to be dictated to a significant degree by where your table is located My table for two was trapped between a large table seating about ten and a partition Space was rather tight but the bigger problem was that we just could not hear each other at times and I am not saying that the larger table beside us was being particularly loud - it was just the acoustics of the location Service was a bit slow at the time I ordered a glass of wine just before the food was served and then had to eat really slowly so as not to have finished the meal by the time the wine arrived Despite all of this I am still giving a four out of five on the strength of the food itself I will definitely go back but will try to find a quieter time or go in a bigger party to avoid being the shoe-horned in table for two
Good value restaurant the set price buffet is excellent  situated in the pleasant High Street of Stevanage Old Town

Happened upon this place while wandering around Rye - glad we found it Very stylish decor and presentation of food and service was excellent Good selection of beers  5 for kids meal including drink and ice cream Mac N cheese was apparently even better than Dad makes quite an accomplishment for any restaurant Milkshakes were also delicious and we didn t try them but they also had freakshakes on the menu I had the sliders and they were good but a touch dry With a smothering of burger sauce and perhaps leaving the burgers a little pink in the centre this would have been a 5 rating All in all a great lunch
Always been very good when we go here we go back so that says it all  service is always good too and the food is always quick love it
Good food well cooked and served Nice ambiance and good views from the windows We went on Saturday lunchtime the place was busy but the food still came quickly The Bakewell puddings are a must

As some friends and I are meting up for an evening out next month I said I would investigate Jamie s as a potential venue I was shown to a table in the window area great view of St Martins but also the less impressive construction work The friendly waitress arrived within 2 minutes of my sitting down and asked if I wanted to hear about the daily specials I d already decided what I wanted from the main menu but later heard her give the details to other diners and was impressed with her detailed knowledge of each of the dishes she was describing My food was absolutely fine a starter of mushroom bruschetta main course of roast scallops and posh chips and finish with an extremely rich chocolate and espresso tart These were all well cooked the chips are absolutely perfect  My only slight reservation was the layer of rock salt that the scallop shells sit in to prevent them sliding over the plate A good idea unless you also have the fennel and lemon salad on the same plate Inevitable result is that the salad leaves were rather over-salted I think that one needs a re-think Drinks of a glass of prosecco and a decent sauvignon blanc plus a very decent macciato gave me a bill of 41 Not cheap but certainly reasonable value for the quality of ingredients and the skill in the cooking and mostly presentation I was dining quite early so the place was not even close to full but there was a friendly buzz of conversations from the other diners Decor was ok reminded me of The Gourmet Burger Company in Brindley Place I ve given my thoughts to my friends and we are definately going there in April Its not the best restaurant in Brum but then its not pretending to be What it is is good food drink and atmosphere tied together in a not-too-expensive bundle Well worth a visit
we popped in for lunch on a Saturday Cous Cous dishes were lovely Tender lamb chicken and mezze were delicious Friendly service and good location for the shops and Marleybone station

This is local to me so I go about once a month The coffee is always good and I think the flat white is my favourite The staff are friendly but t he food is only so-so The best thing I think is to stick to the coffee and cake Last time I wen with the family it took a long time to feed a table of six It works better for couples

had a nice mixed grill wife had cheese and tom toastie your average but decent food for weatherspoons beer as always excellent breakfast next morning though served on luke warm plates unususl for ws as they are usually piping hot but would still recommend as this place was fairly quiet nnd comfy
Great food and excellent service all round lovely decor and nice to see one of englands oldest pub preserved in such a good manor
I have been here last week the place is very clean I had ALCATRA which was very good tasty service was excellent i will be back
Excellent high quality food good service and a reasonable bill The Inn was very busy when we eat there but this did not affect what ended up as a most enjoyable evening

Having previously eaten at the Gatwick Airport branch my girlfriend and I decided to drop in here for an evening meal when we were in the area I feel the main draws of Giraffe is the varied menu which gives a good range of dishes across some different styles of cuisine Asian and Mexican influenced dishes seem to predominate but there is also a range of more traditional burger and grill items I was impressed with my food I feel something Giraffe do well is thinking of little twists to add to the character of the dish toasted seeds on top of my burrito rather than just smothering it in cheap cheese like you might see elsewhere  We also had a cocktail each which proved to be tasty but a little  weak  for my tastes Overall atmosphere was nice and pleasant and the service was about friendly I think the 12 5 service charge added is a little over the top for two waitresses covering most of the tables Lastly and I think this is quite rare for a chain restaurant I left feeling that there was plenty left on the menu worth returning for  I d like to try their brunches some time as they look super tasty

Very good value for money in a nice quiet area outside Derby City Centre My stays are usually for just a few nights for business reasons A friendly relaxed environment with good food and beers Breakfast is always excellent served by Ann who is always courteous happy and smiling
Excellent food and soup well served hot and generous Staff engaging and helpful but why do they have to close @ 5pm sharp when the Dockyard doesn t close until 6pm Coffees really strong and tasty

Booked Real Greek in St Martins Lane for a pre theatre meal Service was all one could wish for fast pleasant helpful smiling Food was good tasty what it said on the tin And yes the chips ARE light fluffy and delicious as the menu promises Salt cod great Chicken skewers a general favourite Thin site and quite small so imagine could get crowded Jolly and friendly heart if West End rather than place for a romantic date or business meet

we attended for a family meal and was pleasantly surprised the venue is very nicely decorated and feels warm and friendly tables were spotless and clean and staff very friendly we went to order food at bar and within 20 minutes it was on our table piping hot and a plate full and really tasty some great offers on throughout the week including kids eat for a 1 on Monday

On entering this old building one has the impression of an old public house but there is upper floor dining in a non pretentious room which has seen better times and is in need of redecoration However in our experience the menu provides flavoursome food presented well and served by efficient staff who are keen to please

I was adamant I wouldn t return after 2 previous visits 1st visit I waited 25 minutes for a single espresso with only 2 other tables present 2nd visit the calamari were rubber However on my most recent visit Alex our waiter was a breath of fresh air Very attentive & helpful he assured me that the calamari would be delicious this time around He was spot on The mains lacked flavor & style however the service somehow made this irrelevant Overall a good visit

Finished work in town and fancied a pizza so had a wander after seeing the disgusting looking take aways hanging about it wandered a little further  Stumbled across a nice looking place down a side street and after asking a for a few sugestions on pizza and seeing some nice looking bottles behind the bar decided to ask for my pizza on a plate and settled for a nice bottle of vino may have to start an after work tradition Big love to MAMMA M

My son and I ventured in for an evening meal and were welcomed and lead to a table in a reasonably quiet dining room Service was prompt polite and friendly The menu was reasonably priced and with a number of familiar Mexican dishes plus some specials that we decided to venture into My son was a little hesitant at ordering the Shark but was frankly surprised and pleased with the dish

We enjoyed a first class Christmas dinner last December the turkey dinner was the best ever we have dined at some expensive restaurants and they did not come near Yes we have booked up for this December
Child friendly with safe enclosed garden good food and drink with guest ales polite and friendly staff

Very much enjoyed a Sunday Lunch meeting up with relations I had not seen for many a long year As I had spent many years in and around Sarratt in my youth and indeed enjoyed a number of visits to the Boot 50 + years ago I was really pleased to find that the Pub has still retained much of its old character The food was all of a very high quality and served professionally even though it was a busy Sunday Really liked the fact that we were not rushed and spent a very enjoyable afternoon reminiscing while the rain bucketed down Would love to come back again
We have been to the Pheasant on a number of occasions and the food is always on top form Great menu well presented and delicious Cant fault the chef or the local produce

On impulse trip out to nearby pub for lunch Never eaten there before Decent menu Decent service Generous portions Reasonable prices Not gourmet food and not five star but certainly good value We will return and we recommend it
Good food reasonably good service good atmosphere although the restaurant is a bit noisy due to the height of the ceiling

Visited The Plough on a busy Saturday lunchtime with my dad aunt and grandma and was very impressed with the decor service and most importantly the food Both my grandma and aunt can be quite conservative with food but both were really happy with their fish and chips and crayfish cocktail which was supposedly a light bite but was huge and plenty for a main dish  My burger was good but could of been a little bigger and rarer but this is me being ultra critical Pizza looked really good and everything was presented really well  Their ale was well looked after and think overall it is pretty good value Will definitely be returning for their BOGOF pizza night on a Monday

My wife and I arrived at Covent Gardens on our way to the theatre We had decided to go early and look for a restaurant Luckly we found Cantina Laredo just a short walk from the tube station We like Mexican Food but we have not found many realy good one in London Well The staff were welcoming the service was efficient and attentive the menu was not overwelming but there was a good selection of most traditional Mexican dishes The food was excellent and the drinks were as well A Lucky find

This was our second visit to the Plough We went on a Saturday evening and the pub was only moderately busy The lamb and steak were excellent and the portions were of a good size The service was fast and efficient Definitely worth a visit

We spent a night here and were pleasantly surprised by size of room and quality of ensure - particularly when you consider this cost a third of the price of our previous night in bath A word of warning - they have a guest singer guitarist on first Friday of month when we were there and he was very good and we enjoyed the night but just don t expect much quiet before midnight We also ate there but this was not quite such a good experience - lets just say the menu read better than it ate and the execution of the cooking was very imprecise We did complain and got a reduction in bill without a quibble but would sooner have had it right in the first place

First time I visited on my first trip into Surrey and this is a nice pub restaurant not far from my hotel and near Box Hill too  It s a busy place but relaxing in a modern decor I enjoyed a lovely full Rioja wine my food was very good and the lamb rib starters were lovely and moreish I had venison which was ok maybe not the best I ve had anywhere but very tasty food at the end of a busy day and the spinach I ordered as well was excellent  This is a good place for a stopover meal out and its popularity is no doubt deserved I m glad I found it Many thanks to the staff
We have been to this Nandos a number of times and the food is always great and the service is very good Be aware that it can be very busy so be prepared to wait for a table but it s always worth it

The food is of a reasonable quality as is the service  However the menu is more than tempting there is something for everyone s taste The Kitchen will go out of it s way too meet ones culinary requirements and without extra cost or fuss They are far better at catering for large numbers and they excel at wedding receptions

Have been to Harland Place a few times now and couldn t agree less with the majority of the reviews The food has always been delicious staff very friendly and food and drinks served quickly It is a fairly new place in Norton so I think given time could also get even better Also a great spot to meet for a few glasses of wine and a complimentary bowl of olives of a Saturday night Great place for couples familys friends

Lots of different ice cream flavours Not cheap and portion sizes can vary but ice cream is very tasty Good layout of tables with lots of space but the floor was filled with tissues etc so was a little dirty Had to get a cloth to clean our table but with lots of ice cream i guess you can expect the tables to be sticky I prefer to take out when visiting or sit outside on the street

Always a reliable bet for a family treat The children always get want they want Never too much trouble for the staff The pizza that Daisy had was great Pudding - to much choice - no chance we all love it

Coastline looks lovely inside since they redecorated It can be very busy at peak times and service can slow down I can t fault the food and the icecream a are delicious Los of outside seating I regularly stop there for a snack after walking the dog and we sit outside

Had a lovely dinner yesterday evening in Jenkins and sons with a local friend where I noted the service is remarkably inproved The Sea bass was excellent as was my fancy Burger The young waitress was very friendly extremely knowledgable on both the menu items and the wine list and provided very fast and efficient service The outdoor street tables were all full as diners enjoyed the warm evening sunshine

I came to the ruby with wife Augustine my son and daughter we had a lovely meal with lots and lots of food  The food quality was great and the spinning table was amazing for sending items to the other family members Overall meal I cannot fault only downfall was the price of drinks the bill came to 20 for 4 cokes  Would rate to friends lovely family meal

Had a beautiful meal last night as a group of us celebrated my friend s 60th birthday All the meals were excellent and the service was very good with attention to detail  Obviously this is run by a new owner who is finding his feet  but I could not fault his work so far  I particularly liked the chicken in the sauce with English mustard Excellent  I would not criticise anything at all Very good and I would recommend it
Excellent service from very attentive staff We all had steak which was cooked perfectly and just as we had asked

Great atmosphere with some hustle bustle and a general feeling of everyone having a good time  Had heard the food was suspect but we found our food absolutely delicious tasty and well cooked No complaints at all Spicy Yes but that was expected and indeed required Sauces Hot Spicy Yep you bet Fantastic experience  Service was good and attentive even though we were there at a busy time Didn t feel rushed and left to chat and people watch -as you do Would heartily recommend

Visited here for lunch a few weeks ago and it was lovely I ordered a club sandwich which was massive with a side of sweet potato fries my other half had some type of pulled pork type sandwich again with sweet potato fries and we both thoroughly enjoyed it
Good lasagne Good hunter s chicken Very helpful service Nice family pub Good guest ales 3 5 stars on food hygiene but no problems we could see

After the disappointment of not being able to get into the Crab House due to them not be efficient enough to serve the number of tables they have It was half empty and said they couldn t serve us within 30miles and then they would shut Anyhow   We decided to find somewhere else Ignoring the unhelpful waitresses suggestion we looked up local pubs and found this one  What a great choice Staff are super friendly and helpful Food was of a high standard the kids were made to feel at home even got their own table  I had beef and ale pie which was fantastic my partner had scampi which I stole one or two off her plate  Crispy and succulent The kids servings were substantial and well cooked  Plenty of choice for drinks too Rae had Raspberry and Nettle a great choice  Price was very reasonable 2 adult meals 2 kids and 6 drinks 40

Popped in on the way home for an early evening meal Plenty of choice on the menu including the specials all perfectly cooked and served hot the staff are very welcoming and helpful  Finally being a 2 for 1 gastro-pub the value for money really hits the spot 2 mains 2 desserts and a couple of drinks for 25 bang on

Lovely location located in the pretty village of Huggate on the Wolds Way Very traditional Yorkshire pub landlord can give the impression of being a bit cool and wasn t too chatty when I tried to start up a conversation but nothing to worry about  Would have been nice to see a real fire in the main bar instead of a wood burner that was hard to see inside as glass was very dirty But the food was great and loved the famous steak pie which was amazing and very filling  Will return again soon

Dropped in on spec Sunday lunch time ordered from the extensive vegetarian section of the menu spoiled for choice  Two halloumi stacks portion of chips aioli horseradish and roast garlic mayo later washed down with Whole Earth fizzys and we were well satisfied Delicious food prepared and served with care and style by a small team in a quirky little basement-vibe room Fully recommend

Called in for Early Bird but ended up a la carte Wanted somewhere handy near theatre Surprisingly good food and service Tasty hot n sour soup prawns in batter and chow mein noodles Decent menu Modern clean and friendly Would visit again

We joined about a score of friends many of whom were staying at the hotel for a memorable evening meal Apart from the usual pub restaurant fare they specialise in curries so there was plenty of choice Friendly service generous portions but above all the atmosphere with music and entertainment in one corner the bar in another and areas with both large and small tables It was worth a visit to be right at the heart of the community but there food was most enjoyable too Another great find

Have eaten here a few times now I always enjoy the food the staff although very busy will always explain the various dishes S E Asian Style of eating is different to the U K order dishes as you go don t try to order three courses or everything will arrive together  I read one complaint review stating that one of the waiting staff did not speak English      come on now its part of the experience and each item on the menu is numbered with a full description of each dish  Probably the closest to authentic Asian food that you will get in W Yorks

I stumbled across here while trying to find a coffee while waiting for the ferry  It was a Sunday afternoon on a nice sunny day so there was a lot of people out enjoying the weather I managed to park close by on the street but otherwise there was parking further away  I had a Latte and didn`t have to wait long for the drink outside The Prices where reasonable The place was busy but not crowded There is one unisex disabled toilet so you may have to wait for the toilet if required   Would I come here again Most defiantly Would I recommend to other Most defiantly

Last night we decided to eat at Cotton Eyed Joes and very enjoyable it was to They specialize in BBQ steaks and burgers with a real american style We started with a sharing platter of onion rings wings potatoe wedges with cheese and bacon and nachos with cheese and jalapenos and assorted dips This tasted great very generous in the portion size My wife had the whole rack of ribs for main and I had the BBQ chicken and half rack of ribs The ribs fell off the bone and the chicken was moist and succulent with some very tasty crispy fries and coleslaw The whole experience was helped by the very friendly and efficient staff and a bottle of Proseco We both thoroughly enjoyed it and will be going there again when we fancy eating this style of food again

Stopped in here for a few drinks Saturday evening It had a decent atmosphere and despite it being packed didn t take long to be served The place is very clean and toilets maintained a decent level of cleanliness even at peak times The terrace gardens are a nice addition also Loads of different beers and ales to choose from and although I didn t eat I did see the bar staff taking food to customers that looked very good  Will definitely visit again next time

The lunch time buffet is a smaller and cheaper version of the evening buffet still good food but not a massive choice As the time went on the buffet shrunk so at around 2 30 there was not much left but when asked for more the helpful staff went and made some extra food

Really good pub food average bill for family of 4 around 50 with drinks Good selection of standard fayre + a few different options + very very good burger selection a few of these a bit different to the norm but very well done Great place in the Summer big area outside on the grass a hog roast every now and then and a great place to go for walks from across Walton Heath and Mogador in general

Myself and other half can quite often be found here on a Saturday lunch time enjoying a particular favourite of ours - the burrito For value and taste they are awesome The shabby chic d€÷cor and eclectic mix of customers also add to the charm of the place - catapulting me back to my students days  Other choices on the menu are also well worth a try too Be back again soon

We were looking for a meal last Thursday evening and had a walk around Hunstanton Came across the Steak and Stilton by chance Despite not having booked the young man in charge was very accommodating and we were shown straight to a table the service was good albeit the man in charge was training someone in the process which didn t distract form the service we all have to learn sometimes The meal was lovely and including drinks a very reasonable price

We ate here last night on a lovely sunny evening The terrace overlooking Roberts Park & the river is a perfect place to enjoy a great pint of Saltaire Blond  Served in a proper pint-pot Our food order was slightly complicated with some wanting just a starter some bar snacks & some full blown Sunday roasts but the staff were very accommodating & got everything to us at the same time so we could enjoy our meal The food was very nice though quite expensive All in all a nice night though we will be back
Menu may be restricted but the food is of a good quatity the staff are very friendly and helpful The set menu is very good value

A favourite for many years I often eat here when in York on work trips A great place for friends but also if you re flying solo  A good wholesome menu of hearty fare in a cosy little restaurant Much better to visit here than some of the big name chains that surround the Minster
Clean efficient polite helpful staff good menus and featured specials days if you have visited one Brewers Fayre you will know what to expect

Go to the White Pyramid between 5pm and 6 30 for 2 for 1 early bird discount We were expecting a limited choice from the menu for the early bird but happily there is a good choice Maybe the portion sizes were small No  Not a bit of it the plates were large and full so no complaints Service was very pleasant and prompt too Don t be put off by the tired looking exterior and decoration the food and service is worth it

Situated on the lovely Church Street just down from the Cathedral this is a charming restaurant with a lovely rustic decor The service was quick friendly and attentive and the food was impressive I had a late breakfast of almond croissant and coffee which was fabulous Unfortunately my partner s boiled egg was quite underdone but she enjoyed the idea of marmite on the accompanying soldiers  Would definitely recommend - just disappointed it s not open Sundays when I m often in Hereford

The menu is very similar to and why not in Mansfield but that could never be a bad thing The staff were all excellent both friendly and efficient The bar area can become a little cramped but this is only due to the popularity of the venue

Went with five other people after day at York races Straight to table on arrival and enjoyed great service throughout A couple of the group found the menu a little lacking but I had the minestrone soup for starter and the meatballs for main course and both were excellent These were surpassed however by the profiteroles which were amazing The best part of the evening was the bill we had three courses two bottles of wine and other drinks and the bill was 142 for six of us which I thought was great value for money would go back
Do not pass by this restaurant A second visit and just as good as the first Great service better food and all in such a professional environment We will be back again Thank you very much

Disappointed that our fave restaurant in Manchester Ginos now has a 10 service charge on orders This was the reason we ceased eating at Rosso We always tip more than 10 of the bill anyway but that is because of the meal and the service we receive and not because we are ordered to do so  Sorry Gino Much as we love you and your restaurant we won t be eating there again
surprisingly good burger considering the size great place to go with a group of friends  steer clear of the wings or anyone else eating them

Food is tapas style so you can try a few options from the menu The king prawns were particularly good The restaurant was very busy when we was there but service was still very good and only a little bit longer The restaurant itself is very nice and modern and Italian styled We were a party of 5 adults and 1 child and the bill was very reasonable If you like Italian food this is definitely a restaurant worth trying

We visited TGI Fridays  Cheltenham last night Booked for a conservatory table On arrival we were informed of electrical problems with the lighting A few drinks later and in day light we were escorted to a conservatory table and ordered our meals Within minutes the electric for the bar lights and TV screens was cutting out the waiter informed us of associated kitchen problems A few drinks later and a slight wait and the food arrived  Now the point of this report the manager converted an unfortunate situation into a very satisfied customer The bill came fully complimentary for our patience I can t find fault with that at least 100 written off A BIG THANK YOU

As a local pub its fine and the only proper pub left ion Limehouse History gets you a certain distance with clients as does authenticity The beer is good too which is not as easy as it sounds   The food is good fare especially upstairs and served by friendly staff I ve eaten here opn many occasions now because its guaranteed to be good

I have eaten hear four times now Twice in the bar and twice in the restaurant The restaurant food is very good but perhaps a little expensive However I had lunch in the bar last Thursday and I have to say the fish and chips were amongst the best that I have ever tasted Excellent
Go in the evening not lunch time Lunchtime staff and the atmosphere isn t a patch on the evening experience

We have been here several times and are planning another visit very soon its a robust busy locals chinese restaurant with freshly prepared ingredients very friendly staff and very large portions The only advise - don t over order

Expectations were low - an Italian restaurant near the inner ring road some 400 m from the centre And the d€÷cor seems a bit kitsch - wrought iron chairs painted frescos with putti roman statues But the service is warm and personal and the food excellent The best cannelloni I have had outside Italy Give it a try
We visited just after Christmas - 4 adults two dogs and had a lovely lunch Despite being vedry busy we had drinks and food in a timely manner  personally I recommend the cumberland sausage barm

Let s get this out of the way first If you re looking for a cheap night out look elsewhere  Yes it may not be cheap but it never pretends to be and as is the case you get what you pay for Fantastic food with average portion sizes for similar venues  Try out the Winner Winner Chicken Dinner offer  Great selection of cocktails Definitely give nights a go NEW lanes that are maintained to very high standards  Give Groundhog Mon day a go for bowling  Again quality never comes cheap Tailor your visit around what offer fits you best and enjoy the night

Had a midweek visit with family and friends I arrived a bit early and was greeted seated and looked after with a cheeky starter Food as usual was very tasty Begum Baher remains my favourite 6 very full and happy diners for 48 can t be at all bad

We actually booked the entire place for our wedding and most of our guests stayed here The place is steeped in history and looks like it is about to fall down like most buildings in York  We chose it due to its location slap bang in the middle of York overlooking the Minster and its quirkyness We checked it out a couple of times on a reccy visit and the food did not disappoint Very traditional English fayre with the odd delve into its medieval roots potted meats etc and great cuts of lamb and beef The ale selection is also excellent with my own favourite BrewDog on tap with guest ales changing regularly The day of our wedding also coincided with the annual ale festival so i was in dreamland The staff were also fantastic and looked after us fantastically well and we have been back several times since location wise you cant beat it well worth a visit and a room for the night if your in York for a few days

We dropped in while walking around the City on a lazy day off and we were delighted that we did Really nice feel to the place due to a lovely higgledy-piggledy mix of tables chairs and a sofa You get a really friendly welcome here too We just had coffee and scones this time but will definitely give the rest of the menu a try when we go back The coffee was very good I don t say that very often and the fruit scones were delicious with butter clotted cream and jam It s a lovely little place - give it a try

My wife and I ate off the double deal menu in the evening two for around 12 and thought it provided very good value Nice selection of Belgian beers Somewhere a bit unusual with very friendly staff Different deals are provided during the day so it pays to look carefully at the menu some dishes are only served at certain times Recommended
A rarity these days good well cooked but simple pub meals generous and well presented in addition to a warm atmosphere Very relaxed and refreshingly not trying to present food with a modern twist

Quantus is located in a quiet road off Chiswick High Road and could easily be overlooked The atmosphere is quite intimate the staff are attentive and friendly and the menu does not disappoint The cooking is very good and the recipes have clearly been thought through with some care and originality The end result was a very good dinner in discreet & pleasant surroundings altogether a rather agreeable discovery

If you like a traditional high street indian then this isn t the place for you  We found Ganges to be elegantly styled with attentive service by charming staff delicious food that offers some interesting flavours and a reasonably priced varied menu We ll be back soon

Arrived around 3pm - around 10 other customers but my friend and I were there to enjoy a couple of the excellent cocktails and smoked salmon sandwiches after a local business meeting as an alternative to going to a pub We were not dissappointed at all and we shared three different cocktails a Margarita a Long Island Iced Tea and a Caipirinha all expertly prepared by Max the Bar Manager I have always found the staff both friendly and efficient and Julius the owner was extremely welcoming and in good form The lovely Simone added the female interest I have only eaten bar snacks there including during my recent Stag Party but I am sure that the restaurant food is of an equally high standard The evenings are generally busy with an interesting cross section of customers either in the bar the restaurant or weather permitting relaxing in the large front seating area

We have eaten here several times both as a couple and with friends and we have never been disappointed The menu is super and there is plenty of choice Service is prompt but not pushy Coffee is excellent and it is hard to fault this restaurant You will need to book for Fridays and Saturdays

My girlfriend and I visited in January after wanting to try the place out for ages and we were not disappointed I knew ages in advance that I would be ordering the T Bone and thoroughly enjoyed it   it barely fit on the plate and was cooked to perfection The fillet steak my girlfriend ordered was delicious too and she ranked it very highly and probably the best she d had  We have a Tastecard which MPW s participate in and took advantage of 50 off our food bill by ordering 3 courses each Starters  potted duck was nice but not something we d order again and Calamari which was as good as anywhere I d had it before The desserts were nice but not sure if have enjoyed them as much at full price The only downside was the 10 service charge I ve only experienced this in London before so was a little surprised - we always leave a tip but would prefer to choose how much we leave based on the experience

Visited on the 16th of February for breakfast at around 11 30am - although it was extremely busy and was only 1 table left which is what we got Everything was great - food was lovely warm took 9 minutes to reach us from point of ordering Lovely and friendly staff Great example of a wetherspoons pub Recommended if wanting a breakfast out and about
An enjoyable Sunday lunch Despite it being a busy bank holiday weekend we found a table for 4 of us 3 x belly pork roasts and a New York burger later and everyone left full and happy

For my husband and myself having a dog Sara s Tearoom being dog friendly is very attractive to us I found the young teenage girls polite obliging and they did indeed smile My reply to the comments from Norwich Dude are I personally know of Sparrows nest which is expensive and the Staff there certainly do not smile  The Italian Coffee is first rate admittedly the Scones were small and a little dry Our Jacket potatoes were fine the Chili filling was home made and was very tasty and most importantly reasonably priced The Loyalty Card is a welcome bonus  The small garden is an absolute delight a peaceful haven awash with flowers Such commitment from the owner Full praise to her  we shall be visiting again and wish you good luck and good weather for the forthcoming months
Nicely prepared food which is not too greasy The table heater was dirty as was the cutlery They need to improve their washing up
Good to very good food Service is usually prompt friendly and professional A good place to meet for lunch
Popped in for a light lunch consisting of just one starter and one main A virtually rmpty restaurant but this didn t detract from a generally warm and happy atmosphere A pleasant service

Nice little Korean place Little hard to find as it s of the beaten track Great value lunch menu I was stuffed and trust me I m a ganit like I said very authentic kimchi Tried saying thanks in Korean but the girl said she was Chinese

Staff helpful on arrival As a group meal selection pr-ordered Names called out and first course served Took a while to serve the group with others waiting stating Please start Felt a bit of a lemon as the only one missed out Duly arrive with apology Main course steak perfect and fine flavor with small serving of hand cooked chips Having just returned from fine dining in Hove Sussex where a bowl of a small selection of fresh vegetables was always offered disappointed to fine none several others wished for the same
Great food lovely views over the river great for families high chair for babies very relaxing love to come in summer and sit in the large garden will definitely come back Stella Artois on tap

First time to visit relatively new restaurant in Wetherby and went for a work Christmas meal on 22 12 10 9 of us went and we booked in advance A week and a half before going we needed to change our booking date which was accepted with no problem even at this busy time of year which was good Food and service was very good with friendly and warm atmosphere in well appointed newly built restaurant area When one of our party wanted to alter the way her meat was cooked this was done quickly without fuss and happily The only down side was the lack of choice of bitter but selection of wine was good Would definitely go back with or without work
The cakes were wonderful cappucinos hit the mark very quant very close to Warwick Castle a little gift shop too

There is nothing posh about Birdies Paper table cloths Nothing matches ie cutlery crockery furniture Menu is written on a board Birdies is extremely popular & you have to book The service is not fantastic but the food is amazing I would describe this place as maybe a little trendy that attracts people of all ages There is plenty of choice of starters from Bacon and advocado salad to Sweetbreads Bread & Olives are a must Mainly fish for mains & a good choice of desserts Portions are generous & food quality will bring you back time & again Unfortunately on our latest visit the menu had changed & there was no Sea Bass in general it was not quite up to it s usual standards However Birdies is still one of the best around You should book at least a week in advance for Saturday evenings even 2 weeks during the summer months

Drove past this place and from the outside it looked nice On going in the staff were very friendly and attentive The menu was fairly wide and a good selection on the kids menu Sunday roasts went down well with the veg being especially good  Great place for lunch on an autumnal day
We turned up early evening without reservation and received a warm welcome form the cheery staff Service was efficient and the food good All in all a good pub food experience and good value for money
We ve twice visited The Globe and have been very pleased with the food and service There could be better signage as to where the toilets restrooms are located Apart from this it s a very good pub

i was out with my girl friend for dinner on sep 3 2011 to be honest buffet had plenty of choice for food and service is also good sweets are awesome i enjoyed that night by having dinner in flavourz i will Defoe return

A good find Hmmm  get take away or eat inside the restaurant for 4x the price I think I ll get the take away thank you very much The pieces of fish were HUGE so I can t even image what the jumbo sized portions are like I was greedy and ordered the large portion of chips which were great and still tasty cold a couple of hours later I liked the care in which the guy salted the chips and tossed them slightly before wrapping it up for take away  All in all friendly staff and great fish and chips After all it s the healthiest meal for all the family according to the print copy on the package

One of us had been offered a special deal by one of the promo companies When we sat down we were told that whilst it was a member of the Hakassan group we had arrived at the wrong restaurant The other one it seems is Japanese and by which time nobody wanted to move albeit it was our first time here and were fearful the a la carte menu would mean paying treble of what we expected At least 3 Managers came to see us offering nothing but excuses and no help at all We dined enjoying the experience immensely but still feeling a little quite a lot disappointed I got up to visit the mens room and came upon a very impressive looking guy who turned out to be the General Manager of the whole group who bothered to look at the ill founded offer and investigated it thoroughly and agreed it was totally out of order to market the restaurant like this I ahd told him previously it s like going to a football match and the wrong team comes out to play He was extremely understanding apologetic and made some decent concessions that made us feel much better Restaurant has amazing food and ambiance
Excellent food with old school service and hospitality however the restaurant could do with a makeover decor wise Prices are really good too

This dining experience actually turned out to be a nice little surprise  As we were paying 20 for steak or lobster chips and salad in central London the initial expectation was reserved  having eaten at other steakhouses in London spending a lot more we were prepared for a nice meal but nothing amazing  It is safe to say we were wrong  The whole experience was excellent we were warmly greeted and shown to our reserved table Drinks order was taken swiftly and they arrived in good time  When it came to ordering the food it was surprisingly difficult especially as you only have 2 options I am a bit of a foody nothing majorly elaborate so actually only having a choice between 2 gave me more of a feeling of missing out than I was expecting luckily the missus is also a bit of a foody so we settled on 1 of each and shared  The steak was excellent cooked to perfection with a cut that surpassed expectation for the price tag The lobster was equally excellent we went for the steamed option rather than the grill option I think that is a post steam thing but it is good to have a choice  Both were fresh moist and delicious steak was medium rare and we could have easily had more the salad was basic but nicely presented with a nice dressing and endless chips was a nice add-on but not needed on this occasion  For Steak Lobster and a couple of drinks I don t think 50 was a bad price to pay for 2 people at all would definitely recommend this restaurant
Great food very freindly staff Very good value Would not hesitate to eat here again were I to visit Chester again Will recommend to others

We ate on the top floor the ground floor has a nice looking bar  There was a good view out onto night time Exchange St The tapas style food offered good choices with the suggestion being to try 2-3 dishes per person Some of the dishes were really tasty chicken wings and Spanish patatas One dish a fish stew had everything in place and looked good but lack any real flavour Did the cook forget the stock that night Good ambiance friendly staff and enough about it for us to want to give it another go and try some different dishes

We had a family meal at this super italian restaurant recently the atmosphere was great and the staff were really helpful There were 10 of us in the party of all ages a number of us had the chicken della casa a superb choice with chorizo sausage in a red spicy sauce It was devine those who had steaks said they were done to perfection the younger ones had a children s menu and really enjoyed the whole experience There is a very extensive menu and the staff are pleased to explain the dishes to you All in all a great night out We will definitely be going again
i like fish and chip from nice clean the funky fish every time i go to play in east park this place may open only few years the fish is really tasty and chips are very good too

Read about this on Wikitravel as it comes highly recommended by the cabbies that frequent it On arrival I was seated and after I placed my order I was served complimentary fresh prawns with bread and butter a very nice thought I ordered cod and chips with a bottle of house white The food arrived and the portions were huge and only managed to eat the fish While I was there I did bump into a classmate who s now a cabbie and had great interaction with My main disappointment came when I settled the bill only to realise the waitress cashier shamelessly overcharged me 5 for the house wine I wouldn t say don t frequent Superfish as their food is very good but beware of the slim ponytail
High quality Meze in good sized portions Excellent local atmosphere that beats the big chains hands down Friendly efficient service that felt genuine not forced

Lots of plusses- interesting menu- wow factor puddings- great service  Good wine and beers First course took a while to arrive so I suggest giving bread dips The wall bench was a touch uncomfortable for the height of the table But good for vegetarians and we will return soon

Prefer to dine in rather than get takeaway  The restaurant is not buzzing but really nice comfortable and clean Would recommend for families especially for toddlers and lil uns  Fish is really really nice and fresh and is not drained in cheap oily batter chips are a bit chunky and potatoey but still nice  Overall nice place would recommend

The Grapes has been the Hub for a nice meal and drink within the Formby Freshfield area and with its multimillion pound refurbishment just before Christmas it s yet to disappoint I have titled this review smart casual for one very good reason this pub is a fine balance between somewhere nice to eat as a couple as well as a great socialising place to meet with friends and family for a few drinks The smart finish inside of oyster blue paint and varnished wood gives the pub a very classical vibe the bar space has been decreased after the refurb allowing for more space to stand and make orders They have also incorporated a specific area to eat meals which used to be open for people to sit with a drink but has now been allocated for meals I have only ever eaten there once and wasn t dissaponted I mean don t expect Michelin style food here people but when I say fine pub grub you get the picture Totally worth a visit if you re in the area as I feel that this is the poshest pub in Formby Hope this helps

Having visited this place many times over the years this place never disappoints while they will never win Michelin stars and the dining experience is not going to suited for those regular restaurant goers this place offers a lovely environment and a decent menu for those looking for a quick pit stop for lunch
Enjoyed the food We had a selection of starters and a main to share Prices reasonable Felt that the service let the side down as we felt rushed and unloved or it would have been 5 stars

We make sure to enjoy lunch here every time we visit Padstow  As usual the food was delicious especially the Pulled Pork fried meatballs The pizza s are very nice but I prefer mine a little less fancy by way of ingredients That s not a complain as they are made extremely well We did miss the fresh crab on toasted brochette bread this year   The staff are lovely and look after your every need  Looking forward to 2017 already

Great Value for money Kids can play as long as they like for 5 There is a pub right next door  part of the same building so you can relax and enjoy a drink  food while kids play Drinks are a little pricey though
I think its that kind of place reaaly nice for family or friends during the lunch Simple food but effective We had a really nice meal in here not amazing but really nice
Very friendly with a decent pool table and a decent selection of drinks Also shows live sport and is really the young persons pub in the village
only ate here on one occasion and that was for breakfast and i have to say it was excellent dont know the cost it was included in the price of our stay

Today was special as my favourite Godson celebrated his 22nd Birthday and his choose this restaurant for his Birthday meal Along with my best friend my Godson Mother and eight members of the family we meet for his special evening I knew of the restaurant as we are local to Clevedon however don t expect it easy to park near by They have a small car park but the local roads are very busy and not easy to find a parking space close by Best go by text or get someone to drop you off especially if it is raining rather like this evening The restaurant is down some stairs and set in a French type celler rather charming but a little noisy as lots of full tables and the conversation echoed throughout so a little hard to hear each other speak The waitress was very attentive and soon brought our drinks while we selected our meals Good choice and you can pre order if a large party to save time We choose not to do this as happy to wait the extra time for our food to be prepared I won t go into all the selection as the menu is available to view on their website We were all happy with our choices and the food was well prepared and very good  It may be slightly on the expensive side but there is a special of a two or three set meals during the week or for an early diner on Fridays in all this evening was around 30 each with two courses with wine beer and coffees  We chose not to have a desert of my friend as always had provide an excellent Birthday cake which the restaurant presented to us along with the usual Happy Birthday sang by everyone much to my Godsons horror  So highly recommended and well enjoyed Thank you
This is the best restaurant in Plymouth for Good food and nice ambience There is accommodation but it wasn t used as we live close by There is a lack of adequate car parking space at busy timesd
Good breakfasts and excellent salads at lunch Lovely sun terrace to the rear  The music though will ensure the shortest possible visit
always pop in on my visits to see my parents and the barmaid Beth American  always makes us feel welcome   would recommend this pub to anyone in the area
We use this chain when we can and it is always consistent despite the location The olives are of the best we have ever had and even though it was a busy Friday night service was quick and attentive

We were staying in Weymouth kids wanted chinese this one was nearby with good TA reviews so we ordered food Everything was hot and well cooked not too greasy and reasonably priced for portion size Possibly not as good as back home but really tasty and no complaints from the family would I go back Yes would I recommend Yes

The burgers and starters here were very tasty and with some creative combinations the drinks were also quite good but most menu options are a little bit on the pricey side I wasn t a fan of the popcorn shrimp but the burgers were impressive The service was a bit slow and it was a bit cramped but i suppose it s a popular place A good place for halal diner style food

This establishment just caught my eye when walking down the high street it looked well maintained and different to the places I normally visit I visited on a Wednesday and it had a good mixture of customers such as family s and groups of friends Service was quick I ordered one of there steaks with a peri-peri sauce which was cooked correctly all the food was hot and fresh so no complaint s there They had a good selection of milkshakes it was hard to choose which one I wanted  Unlike other reviews I received good service staff where friendly and attentive It would have been nice to have received a check back on my food but there was no issue s anyway Price was correct for the quality of the food and it was a good place to just stop by for a quick meal

Attended the recent 6th anniversary of the opening Very good food nice setting generous hosts Staff work hard and good service On one recent visit for dinner with guests had to complain about one dish but otherwise very good Very highly recommended Lots of parking

2 adults and 2 older children went along at 4 30 on Sunday and it was very quiet although the booths that we wanted to sit at were booked up apparently The orders were taken quickly and efficiently and the food arrived soon after The dough balls are our preferred starter followed by 2 excellent lasagnes a gluten free pizza for my gluten free wife excellent but why are they smaller than ordinary pizzas  and while I m at it why are there fewer gluten free dough balls than the normal portion  My son doesn t eat cheese and the waitress wasn t fazed by our request fior a pizza with no cheese The main courses arrived just as my daughter was eating her last mouthful of starter maybe a bit too quick off the mark there  They took our Tesco vouchers without question and so we just paid for the drinks As usual we found Pizza Express reliable and friendly with good food and service although this one is not as an impressive building as the nearby Clifton restaurant in Bristol
the food was good for the price the staff were very accommodating we had two steak meals which where very well cooked we will return in the near future

Popped into The Madras with a friend recently whilst visiting Hull We opted for the set menu 5 courses for around 9 maybe less which included starter main course choice of rice chips or bread a vegetable side curry and ice cream or coffee to finish  It is fantastic value with good quality food and a good choice on the menu The service was great - would definitely pop back

Myself my wife my little brother who has Downs Syndrome and our 10 year old son visited this restaurant for dinner on the Friday along with some drinks  we found the premises very spacious and the food was very good and reasonably priced  also had breakfast on the Saturday morning dinner again on the Saturday night & again breakfast on the Sunday morning  All in we found the food very good   however on the Sunday morning we did have to wait 45 minutes for our food to arrive looked like shortage of staff   Only real complaint was that the premises on all 4 visits would be that it was far to warm that made it very uncomfortable   but on a positive note   the staff all came across as very friendly  The Meikle Family

My girlfriend and I went to Zeret for our anniversary 24th February 2014 because of the high rating of the restaurant on TripAdvisor First I can t say that the place is romantic outside it looks like a bar and it has little charm Inside is more looked after but it isn t a venue that impresses you for the setting However when it comes to the food it s a different story I took one of their typical dishes with their flat bread upon which you have to put all their sauces It was amazing Simple but original and a totally different taste from those I am used to The ingredients were nothing special you can find them in every store but the feeling and the experience were unique Total price in the region of 30 00 It seems cheap but we simply ordered a main dish each we drank tap water and we had one dessert In a word reasonable Really worth visiting

very nice discovery when walking in without a reservation The lovely starter salads made my lady smile I loved the fish soup only to name two items Overall it was quite delicious food the desserts could be a bit more inovative but overall we shall return

I recently returned to El Paso to find that it s moved next door into what used to be the Moorfoot Tavern It s now a bit larger and posher but it still has a reasonably intimate atmosphere the food is still excellent and the service friendly Our bill inc alcoholic drinks was a very reasonable 20 per head The only thing missing is draught beer or more specifically any real ales We ll definitely be going again

This place is always packed - tables are a bit tight but it s worth it A selection of appetisers to share is a great way to sample different things - stuffed olives sea bream carpaccio crispy squid tuna confit salad all great Cocktails were good too - the lemon granita with Prosecco and cassis really sharp and tasty Two of the three of us had a great main  ravioli and duck ragout linguine but the ricotta rigatone was too big and the cured meat with it very fatty They took it off the bill Very attentive service and great ambience

I really like this place the service is very good with nice friendly staff and the menu has a good variety of food I really like the big open space this place provides will return when next in the area

Love it here Where else can you get a whole bloody roast chicken delivered to your table Great beer garden friendly enough staff and nice huts to move into with patio heaters for when it gets a bit chilly Only one toilet for the blokes though which isnt the best when two East End hipsters emerge from it looking perky on a Sunday afternoon REALLY That being said it still a great little find and it s nice to see some great boozers sprouting up around Clapton

Ten of us dined here on Saturday 14th November Escorted to the table 10 mins earlier then booked and the drinks order was quickly taken Wide range of food ordered although first course took awhile to arrive the food itself was hot and fresh Wide choice of many options for the main course however we did have an issue with two of the main meals but in fairness to the restaurant this was quickly resolved to everyones satisfaction and the food was enjoyed by all Desserts excellent When the bill came everything was as ordered point to note on our party of ten the service charge had been included
Great cocktails drinks and decor Always really busy though so get their early Takes a long time to get served Pretty pricey too
Perfect for that family dinner when you can t be bothered to cook at home Good value Good grub Staff could be a bit more aware Had to ask for table to be cleared before ordering desserts
Friendly staff good food friendly service But please warm it up big single glazed windows don t keep the heat in An enjoyable place to be and I ll certainly be back in the Spring

We were guests at a wedding recently and thoroughly enjoyed this alternative and quirky venue Although not the biggest it felt homely with plenty of nooks and crannies to it The staff were so helpful and always willing to offer assistance The food was ample and very decent indeed with the drinks surprisingly well priced considering it was a wedding most venues see this as a chance to ramp up the price  Brilliant really enjoyed it Well done to all the staff

Arrived at the pub for a business lunch with a new client and could not find the staff to me more accommodating the menu had a good variety and everything we had was really well cooked The pub has a lot of old world charm and found the whole experience very pleasant - the speed with which we served despite the pub being very busy was perfect for a tight lunchtime schedule - will definitely use it again

Middle eastern small plates - with the sweet potato wedges with tahini and balsamic getting a special mention Great value and good veggie selection If I m being picky - music was probably a bit loud but then I was the oldest man in there and the onlu one without a beard
Frequent visitor of Mango Tree The place will never let you down However you might find it slightly overpriced so would recommend the 50 or 40 top table disccount
Quality of food is good and you are well looked after but it trades on it s Fernley-Whittingstall ownership as you would expect and portions have got smaller recently but prices are still high

Having just checked out latest reviews for this amazing venue before confirming my next visit I am disappointed to read last entry This unique restaurant not only offers excellent quality and choice for a fraction of London prices BUT each order is freshly prepared to the customers requirement and certainly worth waiting for If you want fast food go to a burger joint I will certainly go back again and again and again   Besides I have a thumb war to win
Cosy little restaurant food was very nice staff were efficient Given the table next to door and carry out area which was not ideal

Visited Sunday evening with my wife We selected from the small plates menu All the food was lovely well presented and tasty Would recommend the battered halloumi cheese The service was also pleasant and a nice environment We will be back I m sure

Went into Trinity Muffin Break today Had great service from a young lady who was very smiley and funny We ordered the toastie and muffin deal which was very good value Really loved the coffee and the welcoming environment would definitely recommend

A little overpriced but in all fairness the food was excellent the chicken starter was cooked to perfection and the portions are quite generous Only given 4 stars due to the biriyani not coming with a sauce had to be ordered extra and the little poppadoms whilst being pretty are annoying as we were all constantly picking clumps out of our teeth Well worth a visit   It s not a traditional menu and if you prefer a lot of heat you need to ask they will spice up the dish for you
Consistently good takeaway Chinese food over many years Sweet & Sour Chicken and the Thai Red Curry are two of my favourite dishes at the Golden Flame Plenty of parking to make life easier

We came here when it first opened to try it out and were not impressed Aesthetically pleasing to the eye but food was well below par the mixed grill was resemblent of a kebab shop overcooked dry and lacking flavor  However they have come a long way since then and we could not fault the food this time Meat full of flavour and tender The only negative is the lack of bread with the mezes 4 small pieces of flatbread with 2 big ramikins of hummus and tzatziki  Could do with an extra waitress  waiter as the girls upstairs looked rushed off their feet on a busy Saturday night  Overall I will definetely be visiting again as it probably is one of the best Turkish restaurants in Northamptonshire

Quite expensive for a chain restaurant but I found all the staff were very good friendly and helpful Good ambiance The chicken wings starter was excellent best I ve had beef chimichanga was very good although could do with more beef Salad very good desert was average and drinks are on the pricey side To sum up I d go again

This restaurant situated in the basement of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Knightsbridge - it is surprisingly roomy and we found it lively and buzzy The food was not exceptional however the service and atmosphere was great Great wine list I would return again
This is a little gem that I only just discovered 10 minutes from home Nice food good value and highly recommended Will be back soon Thanks

Visit to see daughter at University led us to city centre for meal and chose Veneziana as other options nearby didn t inspire Have to say was not at all disappointed food was very good and generous helpings Thought overall price was good value for money Restaurant quiet when we visited so cannot comment on speed and attentiveness of service Would go again

Had a three night stay in Liverpool and ate here on 2 of the 3 days  Friendly welcome on arrival and quickly shown to a table  Fair selection of burger choices and side dishes to add on as required together with both soft and alcoholic drinks  Order taken quickly and food arrived in less than 10 minutes  Not the cheapest but well worth paying the extra for quality  Will certainly seek out Byrons in other cities

This restaurant food is really good value for money You can have a choice of four different meats pork beef turkey or gammon  When you have selected your meat which is served to you you then help yourself to all sorts of vegetables Go back for more if required Reasonably priced but a couple of pounds dearer on a Sunday Can be VERY busy on a Sunday and of course at Christmas

This was my regular for most of the 80 s but have hardly been in for a while Great service from the staff - not intrusive but friendly and welcoming Good choice of food served nice and hot on a cold wintery day and comprehensive range of drinks

We booked a table to eat here on the Saturday of the August Bank Holiday weekend We were met by friendly staff and shown to a discrete table downstairs Our drinks order was taken within a couple of minutes of sitting down and delivered only a couple of minutes later The menu was varied and appealing and we both decided to order from the 3-course set menu which had a reasonable choice The food was well-prepared looked appetising on the plate and each course was very tasty We had a couple of drinks each and our bill came to a very respectable 50 including tip  which we thought was good value for a 3-course meal and drinks I would recommend this restaurant to anybody looking for good food a relaxed atmosphere and decent value

Happened upon this place whilst in town The rolls are enormous which to be honest caught me off guard as was only reasonably hungry but can hardly complain and while not the best I ve had were certainly good quality and tasty The waitress was also very helpful and attentive Definitely worth a visit and will be back again with a more ravenous appetite -

Booked a table for 4 just before Christmas  I called a few days before to book a table but on arrival there seemed to be a bit of panic on behalf of the waiting staff as they couldn t find my reservation The manager took over and quickly found a table for our party and a potential complaint was averted  The menu was extensive and contained both safe options and a few items that were a bit off piste The food was served in a timely manner but not rushed it was hot tasty and imaginatively presented Staff were attentive without being subservient  The final surprise was that the bill was remarkably reasonable - we did have to question one item on the bill but this was dealt with quickly and without fuss or question In short - pleasantly surprised We ll be back

Went for a meal with my partner booked table for 9pm and it was still busy was shown table but for our first time we would have like to have been talked through the menu we knew it was Italian tapas but had to ask recommend number of dishes Food was lovely good portion size and very tasty Staff were friendly and the chef brought out our food nice touch My parter had seafood stew beautiful didn t have room for dessert but will visit again to sample these next time Would recommend

A combination of 100 s of beers lagers & wines & a different take on food make for a lively venue in Birmingham It s an ordinary  bar with great food There are too many beers to chose from - which seems a hard criticism really I didn t eat on this blvisit but have had the vegitarian dish before - Halloumi cheese which was very good  Well worth a visit on a road full of good pubs this one stands out
Nice place friendly staff meals where lovely the ribs were nice and the chicken Kiev steak pizza all went down a treat defo return

Just recently found out they have a brand new head chef what a relief so good wish I knew his name Last guy was a shambles Great service think her name was Pippa so sweet clearly new but despite this was very attentive and understandable to my very old Mother  Think the manager on was Kath or Kat but she s clearly doing a good job Shame to hear Georgia is leaving she s always made our weekends special Hopefully they ll convince her to stay However this place looks like it deserves a better rap than it s getting on here clearly had a bad couple of weeks but hey we are all human I will be back very very soon  One last thing Yes fires are great but glad their boiler is being fixed this weekend

I ve been there today for a team lunch and I would definitely recommend for their USA southern food Everything looked interesting on the menu ranging from Bbq sandwiches burgers and deep fried sea food dishes We even benefited from their weekday lunch deal which includes starter or desert plus a main and a drink for 10 which is incredible value

Enjoyed Friday and Saturday evening meals 29th and 30th july All 3 of us were presented with excellent main courses of Lamb steak  home made stew  ham off the bone and excellent desserts all accompanied by quality ales and friendly service Surprised to see the negative views of a customer in june but i suppose nobody can get it right all the time but at least its evident that the proprietor takes these complaints seriously look forward to an early return to this excellent venue I am sure that in the unlikely event that anything dissapoints me i will make it known and it will be put right

Set in a lovely busy part of town Jamie s Italian was just as I had hoped  Lovely food good service well priced and a beautiful setting  I visited here in a lunch break so i was short on time and had a reservation for 1 30 arrived bang on time with my girlfriend arriving 2 mins prior  Got a drink at the bar and then informed that the table wasn t ready yet   we finally sat down at 1 45 I understand that this isn t a long waiting time but when you have a limited amount of time I did expect to be seated rather promptly  The meal in itself was perfect the food came out quick and was very well cooked as you d expect  Not badly priced 2 main courses 1 cocktail 1 beer was 50  So well worth a visit as long as you re not pushed for time
Went to the Harrow today for a late lunch with 5 friends n had one of the best burgers I ve ever tasted Great staff n lovely Atmosphere Will definitely visit again Yumma

Sirloin steak was excellent my companions salmon in a hollandaise sauce was superb Vegetables were cooked to perfection and the service was outstanding Loses a point due to the subdued lighting within the restaurant Would still highly recommend a visit

Arranged to meet a friend here and because it it s location just off the M3 it was the first place I thought of that would be easy to give directions to I have already reviewed this place and I didn t give it a good report so I was planning on meeting up and moving on swiftly to another place  However on arrival my friends had beaten me to the place and had already bought a round of drinks - so we had to stay Anyway on entering it was obvious the place had changed Nice welcoming sofas in the bar area now and a book case with books to read It s made a real difference to the place as you now have somewhere nice to sit and drink There are still tables elsewhere for diners The main thing that hit me were the bar staff - really welcoming and very friendly and efficient The place was also buzzing so obviously the changes are for the better  Didn t eat here just had drinks but we stayed for several hours Will definitely go back again next time with food
Lovely setting by the river Good service Lovely food Frozen ASDA pizza box in the kitchen - yes the one I had just eaten
Went here for evening meal on the last day of May  Good selection of food and all tasted OK Waiting staff buzzing about all the time  Dining area a bit dull Price pretty good

We ve only tried a takeaway from here but it was very good There s a nice range of fish dishes on the menu plus all the old standards but with the options of chicken or lamb tikka rather than just chicken or lamb The chicken tikka Dhansak was delicious as was the Muktaj The sag paneer was a little disappointing Excellent nan and poppadoms Decent pint of bitter whilst I was waiting to pick it up too

After some Fawlty Towers-like experiences in a number of establishments in nearby Lyme Regis & Seaton we were ready for something nice And we got it Beer is a lovely little town large village The restaurant was busy but we had almost over the top attentiveness The waiters kept popping over to check we were ok - it seems that they have acted on some of the criticism on earlier reports  The time for main courses to arrive was just being on the verge of being too long but we enjoyed our starters and were topped up with drinks so it didn t matter We were on holiday  There were five of us and we all had something different and all of us enjoyed what we had  We would return there and after the appalling service we d had at a number of English-managed places these warm and friendly Bangladeshis made this last meal of our holiday a very pleasant one
I always go healthy option grilled stuff Lots of salad choice of suaces Not too badly priced Friendly staff

First visit to Vx Bristol for some vegan junk food The place has a nice atmosphere and was really busy when we went at 14 00  We ordered Soy Oreo Milkshake and Chai Latte to drink Both drinks were really good and the Soy Oreo Milkshake was the best I have ever had There was just one thing that bugged me and that was both drinks only half filled the cups They either need some smaller cups or need to just fill the ones they have to the top If not you feel like you have only got half of the drink  For food we had a Vx burger and a Quesadilla Both were really tasty but both were very messy to eat and as they came in baskets you could get yourself in a bit of a state The burger tasted really excellent but the Quesadilla although really tasty was a very big wrap with very little in it Only a quarter of the wrap had filling and it was so runny and sloppy that it just split the wrap and it all oozed out of the bottom It tasted really good but needs something to bulk it out and stop it being too sloppy  Overall I would definitely recommend it but I hope they continue to perfect their products

Visited the KD a few weeks ago food was great fish excellent and desserts yummy Staff and service was excellent even though restaurant really busy Food obviously cooked to order Will certainly visit again Good atmosphere

Enjoyed a very tasty and spicy disk of Chicken Naga recently after a recommendation from the waiter who first checked that I liked spicy food The food was very tasty and flavoursome rather than overly hot The restaurant always appear to have plenty of couples who come for meals and take aways The atmosphere is always better when it is a little busier and Indian music is playing

Regular visitors to Blacker Hall Farm both to buy food from the shop and also eat in the restaurant cafe Recent visit this week was excellent While the restaurant cafe is always busy we were able to find a table and order quickly Food was superb and I would recommend you try the Smoked Brisket Burger Staff are friendly and the service was good It is a great place for families to eat with a good children s menu and outside space to keep them amused We will be returning again

I have been dining several times in Piccolino and I have to say that even being a franchise Chain the food is excellents  Good points in Piccolino s - Several fishes I would recommend spaddinni - Good selection of starters - The menu is changed each seasson not big changes but you can see new stuff - the service is very good I had once a bad experience with a waiter she was a bit stupid  but I have to say that the rest of the times the waiters are very servicing and nice - Pizzas are very good thin and crispy - I don t drink wine but I think they have a good selection of bottles  I go very often to this place and I will continue  Eat on the menu with a beer a main course and a starter is about 25

We had very good food efficiently served as a pre-theatre meal The food was fresh tasty and not pre-cooked The atmosphere in the restaurant was superb with people clearly enjoying the experience and most anticipating going to a show in the nearby theatres

I heard about Legends on the Thursday and was keen to see if it lived up to the rave reviews I managed to grab a last minute cancellation for the Sat night and was happy to discover the food and friendly service was even better than expected The soft shell crab was excellent and the wasabi blows your socks off better than I ve had in Tokyo The menu is a real mixture of tastes with something for everyone A nice informal atmosphere and delicious food well worth a visit I ll defiantly be going again and soon
