although I live in north London had my parents visiting the UK just a few weeks back and after reading a few reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to give it a go for a Sunday roast  really easy to find just a couple of hundred meters from Greenwich park entrance  we have been welcomed by the owner and chef who`s name is Tom brilliant hardworking Irish guy  who talked us through the menu from A to Z recommending his personal favorite dishes  Food-wise I must admit that most likely it was only my fourth Sunday roast I ever had in London but besides that we had lamb pork beef and ham with the BEST gravy I ever had in my life and obviously plenty of vegetables on the side after that we had about three pies to share and a couple of whiskeys drinking quite a few guinnesses through the lunch  you might wonder then how much we paid well only 64 for the three of us bargain of the weekend  will Definitely be back and I strongly recommend it as suggested by Tom is it best to book only a couple of days in advance place has got about 7 8 tables  Riccardo

Went to all bar one as the meeting place for the rest of the group and the atmosphere was great we were debating whether to eat there but as it was a saturday night and quite crowded in there we decided not to was a good place for casual drinks the starting place for a night out

Belgo has quite a limited menu for food but as you really should choose the mussels which have a range of exotic flavours this doesn t matter Service was fast The beer menu is extensive with something for everyone
Great friendly service a nice simple menu to choose from and delicious pizzas done well highly reccomended

We went there with a friend who lives locally for an evening meal  The pub itself is very charming in a village location and only a mile from the A1 M at Scotch Corner - so very accessible for travellers  At first sight the main menu looked a bit pedestrian with not a huge choice However there was a Specials Board which was almost as long as the main menu That s a good sign since it indicates probably menu that changes quite frequently presumably to reflect food that s available or in season  The meal we had was absolutely fine and the bar and waiting staff were polite and attentive  All in all a very pleasant experience
The rasam soup was great  The chicken chettinad & dosa was good as was the parota Overall a nice experience

Was in Newcastle the other evening with friends and went to Mama Mia s Italian restaurant at 46 Pudding Chare close to Grey Street and the Theatre Royal We had a lovely meal in a very clean and pleasant restaurant with attentive staff Two minor niggles - firstly it is situated in a narrow street with no immediate parking and secondly there was no disabled toilet Other that that we certainly would visit again
Good food good service not too long to wait - and not expensive either
The food was hot & tasty The views and sunshine fantastic and when i came to pay the bill it was mega monday so mega cheap Brilliant

I had been at the River Cottage Canteen before but went again last week The starters my friend and I had figs and chicken wings were very good especially the figs though the concept of urban honey sounds a bit to silly For main we had the lamb and the pulled pork Both were very good Compared to my previous visit - probably more than a year ago - I had the feeling that the portions of the main dishes were far smaller than before The prices don t really translate anymore what is served in terms of amount The selection of types of cheese we had for dessert was very good A couple of nice strong types of cheese
So much was so different - an hour-long queue to get in no poppadoms and the most interesting inventive posh street food that I ve had in an Indian restaurant I loved it
right on a beautiful beach good service good value good food very reasonable wait time very nice no faults at all

We were looking up for a toilet when we saw BHS there is a lift to the restaurant the restaurant is extremely spacious and we took a window seat we had some tea and cakes as a mid-morning break it is very clean nice tables and chairs and nice staff the prices are quite reasonable and value give it a try

We had been warned about slow service but booked a table for 20 00 about 45 minures beforehand they were able to fit us in The servie was fine and seemed a perfectly normal speed I feel the menu is slightly restricted but does cater for all I suggest it is worth a try and I never saw any slow service

My wife and I today visited the Walton Arms for Sunday lunch There are still a good selection of real ales although they no longer include the excellent Jennings beers that I used to enjoy We were also disappointed with the meals I the steak and kidney roly poly which I felt was too much suet pastry and too little meat whilst my wife had roast beef and Yorkshire pudding and had to leave all the beef because it was too tough to eat To be fair they did not charge us for the beef and the starters were excellent but nevertheless it was disappointing after anticipating the usual excellence However we will definitely give it another try before giving up on this restaurant which has been so good in the past

Had our 1st nights meal in The Ship food was very well cooked an well presented could have had vegetable options as my Wild Boar sausages and mash was very nice but didnt fill me up great selection of cider from the barrel and beers

I have now been to this restaurant four times and every visit has been a good experience The food is good especially the tagines and the meatballs and pleasantly different from the standard fare in other similarly priced restaurants in the area It is well placed for a pre-theatre meal
The food is average but plenty to choose from If you visit for lunch during the week it s a really bargain and surely worth it a try

My friend reccomended this place to me and i wasnt dissapointed There variety of food was great from mexican to sushi and even little burger Also the desert isle was to die for i went a bit over the top with the profiteroles  My only concern is the food wasnt piping hot like it had been out a while maybe turn the things that hold the food up a bit to keep the food warmer But it never put me off my food one bit  A very nice all you can eat
Good quality tradition chinese food but difficult to get access for wheelchairs or prams and decor is very dated Service can be done with a little improving also
Visited once for teas coffes and liked it so I came back The owner manager is very friendly Menu is authentic french service is smooth atmosphere is very relaxed Definitely recommend it
Had a great time here the food was great and I enjoyed the retro theme and friendly atmosphere My biggest criticism however is the price of the drinks  3- 4 for half a pint of beer is way too much
this is my second time eating in thai edge and I am impress Brilliant food atmosphere is great for friends gathering Service is great and fast Definitely will come back again  Keep it up Thai edge
Sound basic cafe friendly staff excellent breakfasts and good value Often call in here during lunch break

Our first experience at The Anchor and we will return The food was interesting well-cooked and presented and very tasty Total cost for two 3-course meals with a bottle of wine and a couple of pre-meal drinks was just over 100 The food quality was very good and the atmosphere it s a converted pub was convival Staff were helpful and attentive without being intrusive

Went to Chiquito for dinner with a bunch of friends before going out in Central London we had all different things from the Menu and everyone was happy with their meal We also had cocktails which were really nice as well Our waiter Ricardo was friendly and suggested his favorites dishes Definitely recommended if out and about in Central London and looking for nice Mexican food

Welcoming staff on a busy Tuesday evening looked after us very well Food was excellent - I had Guinea fowl - which arrived promptly and was a very attractive as well as tasty plate of food We will no doubt return
Friendly tasty burger and pleasant restaurant Staff were friendly and cheerful Good choice of dishes

A delightful pub in the beautiful county of Rutland The Horse & Jockey is a lovely country pub with a friendly atmosphere and plenty of outside seating in the sunshine The food is good quality and plentiful - you will want to have a walk around part of Rutland Water afterwards  Well worth a visit of you are in the area
the food is good and not to expensive the bar could do with extra staff but the beer larger and wines are fine the place is friendly clean and the staff try hard
Been here several times and had a good night on every occasion well kept ale fine and prompt service and good food
1st visit to this pub even though live locally Good atmosphere food good value and tasty Staff very friendly Will definitely revisit

A wonderful experience from start to finish A short walk from the room down the amazing hotel staircase Service & food were top notch The wine list is extensive a lot of it seriously expensive However we found good wines within our range

We booked in for a pre Christmas Sunday lunch here a few weeks earlier and were disappointed when it appeared they d double booked our table which we had selected for my fathers access as he is unsteady on his feet  The place was packed and they appeared to have bitten off a bit more than they could chew that day Once the food arrived it was of a good quality and plentiful previously we had been served drinks at our table but I had to go to the bar myself on this occasion We will certainly visit again when it s hopefully a little less busy

We dropped in here with some friends on a lovely summers day Friendly welcome and service from the manager Jamie Took a table in the large beer garden Menu extensive all the usual pub favourites There was a mix up with our order but the wrongly delivered items were replaced with no hesitation This is a venue that you could well pass by since many people just leaving Highcliffe are probably only intent on getting to Bournemouth - worth looking out for on your next journey Evidently the pub has just been taken over - I only hope they don t change too much

Having lost the will to live with overpriced chains charging upwards of 3 50 for a coffe i popped into coffee culture one day and was most suprised A large coffee for 2 85 which tasted better and was the same size as a large at one of the major players  Pleased to see that it was clean a big bugbear of mine in eateries  had friendly staff and opens at reasonable and consistent hours  Will most definately visit again and try the cake and other cakes etc on offer

This is a nice restaurant offers a good variety of food all of which is well-presented and made using quality ingredients For the money and portion-size it s good value as well We sat on the ground floor which is undoubtedly more atmospheric and intimate and is recommended if you re out as a couple the upper floor is better for larger parties - though the restaurant feels better suited to small parties or couples anyway Staff were friendly helpful and attentive
We visited for lunch on Sunday and really enjoyed the food atmosphere and service we will definitely return

Nice local beers and friendly staff Great place to spend any wet days Traditional pub grub and the the young waiter was very professional Only negative would be that the food was too stacked on the plate but that is not a criticism
Great place for a quick breakfast Delicious big fat bacon butty on toasted brown bread Good coffee and tea Nice light cafe with views towards the waterside Big area for sitting outside too
We shared a Seafood selection and were not disappointed Lovely cod prawns calamari fishcakes and chips & dips Great value and nice staff
Had anice meal here this week There is a special midweek me€¤u that is very reasonable The wine and beer are a bit expensive but the food is fresh and very tasty

The restaurant has a modern but comfortable feel to it The quality and presentation of the food was mostly very good Quality not as good on second night of our stay I believed this was because they were catering for a large business barbecue Underused by guests in the evening

An impromptu meal at this restaurant was an excellent experience Staff polite and attentive and my partner was very impressed by her meal Mine was excellent too We ate early on a Friday so establishment was quite quiet They were doing lots of takeaway business with locals they obviously know what s good

This restaurant is a gem yet to be discovered by the trip advisor community It seems like the personnel is a bit unexperienced but making a good effort The dishes I ordered were quite good They also have a very nice selection of asian beers
Great surroundings food very good and great choice Prices are reasonable and great beers You must try it out

Having just moved to the area this is my second visit to the pub and can highly recommend the carvery and the drinks This is one of the few pubs in the area to sell Jail Ale and it was served well The wine was excellent too and not expensive The carvery was fantastic better than the Toby which was my favourite until eating here Good slices of quality meat and good choice of veggies to boot Okay it may be stuck in the 1980 s with dark pseudo-beams but there is a definite drive and willingness to change that This is a good local pub and will only survive if we locals and tourists support it Give it a try

6 of us all had a good lunch here Reserved seated immediately Was very busy - Saturday afternoon Service was quick food all good and ate in full Personally didn t like the dressing on the salad not a fan of mustard  Little bit chilly every time door was opened - could do with an extra door to keep out the cold during winter months 6 lunches and drinks most of us had 2 only came to 54 Choice of sandwiches panini jacket potatoes etc an all serve with chunky potato chips which were nice

It was dark cold and raining in Newbury when I walked into Art of Siam Instantly I was cheered up although quiet there was still a reassuring hum of activity in the restaurant The service was good and the staff very attentive the wine was excellent and the food was to a very good standard Just what was needed on an dismal and dank evening in Newbury

I frequent the caf€÷ fairly regularly and on the whole it s an enjoyable experience By far the best Waitrose caf€÷ in Gloucestershire Sure it gets busy but what do you expect when most people are there for their free tea or coffee Reasonable selection of food and snacks and the staff are always helpful and friendly Only let down are the loos - they are in desperate need of refurbishment I avoid them completely these days

The range and quality of the food is unsurpassed anywhere for miles around Beautiful Jewel of a restaurant that is somewhat hidden by its first floor location  Not at all overpriced I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants food quality decent value food with a touch of class

Very pleasant with good food our 2 year old G daughter was well looked after as we all were  Enough of everything to eat in nice surroundings  Cost is very reasonable and the staff are polite and friendly
Good range of Italian food well prepared and competently cooked Main course A bit slow in arriving so would recommend allowing time for your visit Overall though a satisfying meal and would recommend

Had a romantic weekend away in Stratford and opted for El Greco because of the high trip advisor rating and because my good lady speaks Greek We opted for the Mezze menu The food was all lovely and certainly filling Service was a little slow but maybe being a busy Friday night its to be expected would we go back definitely -

I visited Tampopo in Reading for a workmates leaving do on a Friday evening and was generally pleased with this restaurant  We had a party of nine so were able to sit around one of the long tables so perhaps a round table would have been nicer  The food is moderately price which didn t really bother me this being a special occasion Although my choice of starter Gyoza wasn t available the tampura prawns I had instead were very tasty For my main course I went for Pho Xao Bo I had a fair crack at this noodle dish with the chopsticks but forks are on offer  The food was served quickly and everyone got what they d asked for first time The staff were friendly yet unintrusive One thing to note you will be offered prawn crackers on arrival  but these are charged  To sum up - this was worth the visit and this is an interesting concept - asian cuisine without leaning on the two big guns of Indian & Chinese

& is therefore very good indeed  Popped in on a Saturday for lunch Pretty quiet and a small buffet rather than ordering Food was all good hot in both senses and fresh  Tasted like Indian food I had eaten in India which is the name of the game - and let s face it all you can eat for 8 in London is a very good deal

Tucked away down an alley yard in Kendal-speak opposite their sister shop but well worth seeking out for breakfast through lunch to tea Successful fusion of English cafeteria with Middle-Eastern mezze Quietly veggie Vegetable soup was industrial-strength warming and filling Mezze are well-mixed and tasty Or you can have a bacon roll with ketchup Fine selection of delicious cakes to fill any crevices after a meal or just for tea

Visited the Tipu Sultan as knew it as the Jug previously and was curious to see what it had become  Very friendly staff inside nothing was too much trouble the decor was very nice and it was nice to see an open kitchen where you could see food being prepared The seating was okay we sat in a little booth which was quite comfortable  The staff were very nice and polite when we arrived it was fairly quiet and the staff were around but not overbearing leaving us to eat our meal in peace which I thought was a good balance of their roles  The selection of food available was vast as well as their drinks The food tasted good too  Well worth a visit if you are in the area

Very quiet pub 3 meals took a long time to arrive This did give us more time to enjoy the character and the beer which was served and kept well The food when it arrived was excellent  I was with 2 coeliacs who were very pleasantly surprised by both the menu and the quality of the food although my liver had been either over cooked or hot held while waiting for the fish Well the liver I was served anyway not my personal liver All in all a very pleasant pub as long as you don t go expecting chain pub serving speeds but you go to pubs to take it easy anyway right

We don t bother wandering about looking for which place to go now We ve been to Dean s a good few times and the food is what you would expect for a seaside fish n chip shop As good as Martellos was in Dymchuch years ago

I booked a table here for a group of 16 Rotary Club members for an early afternoon meal before going on to visit the House of Commons where we were to have a tour of the place  We were welcomed by the staff with a smile and the service we received was top quality The food that we ordered was really well prepared and very tasty There was a very good selection available on the menu and there was an added bonus that on a Monday there is a promotion for 50 off the cost of the food ordered  Every one of the 16 of us enjoyed the food and complemented the staff on the way that they looked after us considering that the restaurant was extremely busy

it was a surprice to find this pub off the beaten track  might have been a popular spot but we stumbled across it on a sunny sunday afternoon by chance beautiful beer garden lovely little pond and very countryside feel to the whole place Cant argue with the drink as it was cool and refreshing  was going to be  and the service very pleasant as the main arrived it had to be a roast and it was DEEEELICIOUS  the sweet was nothing to go wild over but it done the job required and 2 bottles of rose  RJOCA  went down well among the 4 of us  the biggest shock was the bill  120 pounds 4 people aperitifs  roast dinner and 2 bottles of rose and 2 desserts  dead cheap if you consider the quality  we must go again but don t forget to book if you want to sit inside  we didn t but it was hot and we grabbed a table outside
great to visit the shard and eat at aqua very good food good service but there was a long delay serving the main course one of those things to be sure wine is expensive

had three courses here with my partner menu read very well and the cooking of the individual elements was very nice I felt some of the dishes lacked balance though and perhaps needed a bit of tweaking to take this place up a notch

There is a certain amount of nostalgia about visiting this pub you many many years ago when it was owned by the Whitbread Brewery company my father was Mine Host and together with my mother they were the first to introduce Pub Grub to the area Increasing the choice of cold pork pies or a packet of crisps and a pickled egg  Of course the Weighbridge has undergone a few transformations since then and I m glad to see they now have a decent sized car park and a covered walkway to the toilets  I have no idea if the present owners are even aware of what I have written above but during my visit I was pleased to see that the tradition of serving good food has become something of a tradition  For first time visitors even although there are many delightful things on the menu a must try is one of their now famous 2 in 1 Pies of course according to my friend the freshly cooked fist and chips was also delicious  The entire experience was a treat doubly so because it was my turn to chose where we were going to eat that day

Nice quaint little cafe on one of the main streets in Cleckheaton Great service and friendly staff  Large menu with lots of choice from full English breakfast to sandwiches baguettes Jacket potatoes salads etc A very nice place to stop off for some breakfast lunch
had a fabulous meal last night at san remo food was very tasty hence the garlic and chilli heading excellent value for money  and very fast service in all great food and a good time
Went as a party of 12 altogether Food and service were fine and good value for money overall The service was excellent - thanks guys

Family outing for Sunday Lunch to celebrate at birthday Age range 15 to 80 We had drinks in the elegant bar before going into lunch Several interesting choices from the long gin list Interesting to note you get different tonics depending on your choice of gin We all ordered from the €˜ la carte menu and all had excellent meals Bit of a long wait for dessert as there was a problem with a panna cotta not setting so we got a complimentary dessert to share while we waited Not necessary but a nice thought  The Woodspeen is always good and this was no exception
Ticked all the boxes good food good choice good service and near the Sunborn where I was staying - good indian restaurant

The nook kindly opened for us in the off season Now you can bring alchohol into the premises however for us the food was more than adequate fantastic in fact without the need for a drink  Cosy restaurant with great food well recommended

attentive but discreet service no pressure to order and wine options by the glass vvg for lunchtime selecting 4 mini mains for 2 to share really good we had fish pasta salad etc all well presented staff v helpful
An unusual venue decorated with celebrity memorablia and providing cook you own steak on rocks experience Food was very good and the staff excellent
Service was great and the place has a very relaxed feel Food is good and by far the best I have had in Beckenham

I am quite new to gin so a gin tasting menu at the London Gin Club seemed like a thoughtful gift as an evening out Now I m from Somerset so when I think of London Clubs I foolishly think oil paintings leather chairs and a reluctance to accept women as members The London Gin Club is not one of those Clubs A small bar in an old pub with old enameled signs nailed to the walls and ceiling and a traditional wooden floor The gins were good the service equally good and enthusiastic and the venue packed full of cheery gin drinkers It was a fun experience just lacking in oil paintings

Nice food interesting wall art although you feel a bit of a plum staring past people to read it helpful staff it was the Saturday after Black Friday so was very busy  they put on a special birthday message and song on the big screen which was a nice touch  all in all very good

Coulsdon High Street aka the Brighton Road has its fair share of eateries La Scarpetta is outstanding its neighbour Sichuan Gardens is excellent too The former offers interesting pasta dishes pizzas and everything else you would expect all cooked and served to high standards The only drawback is acoustic sound voices and music can be distracting

Watchet is a sweet little town but the eating opportunities are quite limited The Spice Merchant rescues Watchet from gastro-oblivion We all enjoyed all the dishes and the portions are big This includes the starters so take care not to over-order Friendly guys running the show too

went there for the first time having seen the great reviews on this site  We haven t had Japenese in the UK before and both of us thought the food was wonderful The fish used in the Sashami was so fresh and and just a delight The teryaki was yummy to say the least Japenese food is not cheap but it is good value just for quality Thw waitress was very helpful and very nice girl My only niggle was that the main arrived before we finished the starters but it wasn t that big a deal
Quality ground beef nothing like the mass produced burgers you get elsewhere Very attentive service lovely atmosphere

Don t get me wrong this is a lovely  indeed fabulous  restaurant It just needs a few tweaks to make it outstanding Of course I m only speaking from my own experience so here goes  Sadly we got off on the wrong foot phoned to book and was told that the manager would call me back in about 10 minutes to take my booking The 10 minutes came and went but no call back Busy with other things on a work day I eventually called back two hours later to see what had happened - and was told that my booking had be logged after all Hmm  So the big night came and off my wife and I trotted Bombetta is immediately welcoming with a lovely warm bustling and friendly atmosphere and the air is full of delicious cooking smells The lighting is soft as is the Italian opera playing in the background and the d€÷cor is tasteful and balances modern and traditional successfully  As it was later in the evening and we were hungry we decided to order the main courses Bombette rather than share several small ones My wife ordered the chicken with Taleggio I ordered the pork with prosciutto Both were very good but mine was a little salty Also a little more bread to accompany the meal wouldn t go amiss However this aside both portions were plenty if you added a couple of sides  Italian wine was of course de rigueur I ordered a bottle of Fiano  but was told it was not available An Italian restaurant without Fiano The waitress who was always friendly and helpful without ever being intrusive recommended the next bottle down on the wine list This was unfamiliar to me but good It could have been a tad colder though We then shared a dark chocolate and hazelnut torte for dessert which was very satisfying with a distinct hazelnut flavour throughout  One fly in the ointment was the rather loud foursome we were sat next too Not only did they talk extremely loudly rather selfish in such an intimate space but their topics of conversation including one couple s daughter s diarrhoea were not pleasant to say the least I know this is not Bombetta s fault but perhaps the manager could have had a quiet word with them They were hardly inconspicuous  So overall a very very pleasant experience at Bombetta - just a few tweaks would make it outstanding I will certainly be back
Nice little Indian Restaurant just down a side street in the centre of Bowness on Windermere Great food and also includes a takeaway

Mid-afternoon lunch while waiting for flight connection in T3 LHR A good choice of food on offer & all at a reasonable price I had a Chorizo burger with a side of Chili Brocolli and a large drink for 17 Meal arrived timely and the waitress Tanya was friendly and professional Highly recommend this venue

As frequent visitors to London we stumbled across 28-50 when heading for The Union Cafe - and we are so glad we did Food outstanding staff helpful friendly and attentive Atmosphere just right for our leisurely lunch
Good for a coffee and has parking in the High Street which makes it a easy Good brunch menu if you re in the mood No dislikes

Greeted by friendly staff price was very reasonable and the food came right away  Got some patties to go for later and the drinks chiller is packed full of great and varied sodas juices punches etc   Oxtail rice and peas Mac n cheese and fried chicken   Chicken was hot and crispy came with a sauce but really didn t need it as it was full of juice Rice was perfectly cooked and the oxtail was rich gelatinous and full of flavour falling off the bone Mac n cheese was a bit overcooked but the flavour was spot on  The only thing I would change is the tropical sun hot sauce in favour for my usual encona hot pepper just personal taste tbh  Give this place a try as I ll be sure to come back next time I m in the area

We went out on a Saturday night There were 5 of us I was surprised that it wasn t busier for a Saturday night at 8pm It filled a little heading towards 9pm but there were still tables available for 2s and 4s  The food was nice and good sized portions too - I didn t feel I was being conned  The service was adequate but for a brand like Carluccio s I was expecting something a little more special

Food Brilliant Staff Brilliant went with avout 30 people for a birthday mean and every was served quickly and food was piping hot and tasted lovely it wasnt overly priced either as we went mid week when there was an offer on
Nice food good atmosphere friendly service all round nice place to eat and drink good value for money enjoy the buffet eat as much as you like

Unless you arrive shortly after opening expect to queue The fact regulars do just that is indictive of how popular this Italian venue is Expect a boisterous evening with laughter plenty of talk occasional singing of waiters serenading a birthday diner wafting smells of wonderful garlic and great food The portions are generous and not unduly expensive However no cards are accepted only cash I have been enjoying this venue and my 90 year old mother  for years

Our first visit Small but interesting menu- not pub grub Good cooking and decent portions We paid 28 for a two-course meal for 2 including a pint of lager and half of cider Friendly service Tip is not included We ll go again to try the evening menu Seems very popular and is worth a try

No quibbles about the location and views We turned up without a reservation and were cheerily accommodated after only fifteen minutes It was in term time and on a pretty dismal day so wouldn t try this at peak times The menu is a little pretentious fancy names in Italian or faux gastronome French disguise pretty average food albeit well presented and cooked Don t expect burger and chips and the catch of the day is going to be something you ve never heard of  The staff were pleasant patient and helpful The furniture is modern glossy and appropriate without being cafe naff Expect to see your bill to be inflated by charity donations and service charges They don t tell you this until you read all the stuff on the reverse of the menu All in the name of a good cause of course  One of those places to mark off your bucket list but probably not to repeat except to vist the beach
Arrived on a Sunday lunchtime only food was a roast lunch But a great welcome grand beer and food was value for money We enjoyed it and our dog was very happy Would go again
I have visited the cafe twice - both midweek lunchtimes The food was freshly prepared and tasty and the selection of cakes for afternoon tea was delicious We also received good service

Great little cafe in Chilwell brilliant and warm welcoming owner and staff Some of the best cakes you ve seen and tasted Great mix of drinks as well from coffee and tea to freshly made fruit drinks to the Choczilla a must try if they are still doing it  Food is nice my only little niggle and it s more because I m a fussy eater the food selection is limited I m not a fan of quiche so would like another option like toaties pannis or just a sandwich roll

We unexpectedly found ourselves in York on a wet Tuesday lunchtime feeling hungry Rather than visit one of our usual haunts we decided to try somewhere new We stumbled upon 1333 by accident but were delighted by our find We had the 2 course set menu which proved to be excellent and together with a bottle of house wine the bill came to just over 30 for the two of us great value  If I was looking for a negative I would have to say that the service was a little slow but we had plenty of time so it didn t matter  Well worth checking out

First of all the view from this branch of Thai Square is amazing It has large glass throughout the restaurant that you can see Putney Bridge and River Thames when you are dining  Secondary food was good We ordered seafood platter and some other starters Seafood was fresh staff said they get fresh lobster delivered everyday Personally not sure about the lobster but certainly their prawns squids were fresh and soft shell crabs were amazing Lobster was a little dry Didn t like their Tom Yum soup which taste sweet somehow Overall I will rate their food 3 8 if I can do that to 1 d p  Cocktail precisely measure mixer proportion and always taste same and great  Finally their service was good Attentive and polite But I can feel it could get slower towards peak time packed with people so baring that in mind gives your meal experience better  Overall I enjoyed I will come back

A very popular restaurant that serves great food and has friendly staff but i ordered a hake dish and got Cod i was a hake fisherman for 20 years so i know the difference this was disappointing as everything else was lovely

To be fair this place has always been one of the better options in Cannock for a good meal However it has the potential to be 5* Recent visit on Sunday afternoon wasn t to the usual high standard but appreciate it had probably been a busy day given the weather Love the little Forrest walk beside the Tavern and the grassed area outside Missing a simple activity for kids Even a tree stump would suffice Good food good beer great scenery

This place is the go-to chinese takeaway for my friends and I Very reasonably priced and has meal deals from 6 7  The food is great nothing to complain about there and the staff are very friendly They take card 50p surcharge if under 10 My only complaint is that they aren t open on Fridays

We tried carrot and coffee cakes and they were delicious and portions were big so I was really glad we chose that place Tea is served in pots with refills so it is good On the other hand coffee quality is average at the best They should be careful roasting coffee or get a better one Service was ok not very attentive so no tip was given

The staff were attentive upon arrival We were shown to our table as our party was 7  The waiter named George was very good although he was looking after a load of other guests and could have done with some help We had to wait a little as some of our party hadn t arrived he made sure we had enough drinks We ordered our food and when it arrived we had to wait as the bread was missing from the a starter The mains came and was ok The food was very good  We ordered some more drinks which took a while to come as they were busy hence need more staff Didn t order a sweet as we had a birthday cake which the lit and brought to the table  And the whole room sang happy birthday to our mum who was 89  We all said we would visit again Many thanks to the kitchen staff and cooks for a nice meal and to George for looking after us  Would advise to book  Enjoy we did
Food was perfect for a pre cinema meal Cooked fresh not a place for a whole evening out but nice enough
Simple french food and really affordable nothing pretentious here just simplicity and tasty food good address for french food lovers

Great find opposite The Premier Inn on Hanover St Liverpool 1 Ideal for breakfast our party of four was made very welcome and we had a nice meal The porridge is sensational and the full breakfast excellent value Lovely friendly & efficient staff We ll definitely be back  -

Visited Bluegrass with some other guests from a wedding party food was tasty and moorish probably not the healthiest place in town as I m sure I could feel my arteries complaining The menu was typical American bbq the usual chicken ribs burgers and fries not the best I ve tasted but great for what it is and where it is I would visit again if I was in the area

Five Guys is directly below a gym in Cambridge and after coming out of said gym and finding it bucketing down with rain I thought I may finally try Five Guys for lunch and find out for myself if what I had read was true I can say yes Yes It is pricey - I knew it would be although perhaps was surprised at just how expensive Yes The food thankfully is as good as billed The burger was excellent at 8 it should be  and came wrapped in tin foil - a touch which I liked The fries were superb - I had spicy Cajun which were hot and tasty and even in regular size the portion was more than generous There was an excellent choice of shakes - I went for cherry which was delicious The staff were friendly and polite which was nice too Downside apart from the price - a lack of trays and the tables weren t cleaned much as people left even though it wasn t busy at that time due to the weather  Overall I wouldn t go regularly not just because of the price  15 50 for burger fries and shake but also because it would defeat the purpose of going to the gym But as an occasional experience I definitely will call again

We stopped off here for dinner as we still had a few hours drive ahead of us  The restaurant has been refuted recently and looks very bight and modern  I ordered the haddock and chips which is cooked to order whilst the other half had the lasagne Both portion sizes were enormous and tasty and fresh  As I said   Surprisingly good

We rediscovered The Farmers Boy in late Summer 2010 it is now a fond favourite of ours each time that we visit family nearby in the village The quality of the food is spot on every time and the staff are fantastic a great combination to guarantee future visits

Nice open fronted restaurant with outside and inside seating Food was nicely presented with a good display of cakes and bites Wide choice of food including jacket potatoes and wraps Food was delivered quickly with a good amount of crunchy coleslaw and plenty of prawns Good hot coffe and very tasty flapjacks

Best to book for the restaurant they were very busy but tried hard to fit in all callers Food was very generous- we had lamb shank and steak and ale pie veg was not overcooked as is often the case  Had to share a pudding as feeling very full by that time The pub has good local beer - I liked the option of having 3 different types- each in a third pint pot We called in just for a drink on 3 nights and always felt very comfortable here

My family and I visited a few days ago and as soon as I walked in I found myself pleasantly surprised for the great welcoming atmosphere The service was impeccable and caring and the food very tasty We loved most of all the Thai Calamari and the King Prawns noodles
Love the fact that you bring your own booze The Indian food is good the place isn t exactly the most beautiful but it s fine for a curry night out with mates
Two lunches at this pub the first being a liquid lunch The second lunch on Sunday roast beef With the trimmings at 9 95 was delicious Helpful staff good outside are for the kids

We live in London and booked a table for eight people for a pre-theatre meal and were very impressed with the positive experience On a very warm evening 27c in late Sept there was a cool breeze through the restaurant Service was fast friendly and efficient and the Pre-Theatre Menu at 11 70 for two courses or 13 65 for three courses was extremely good value not least because the food exceeded expectations by a considerable margin Steak and chips was a much better steak than I expected and the chips were excellent Others said chicken and sea bass were also very good and the calimari were excellent Also the menu was pleasantly free of the language that sometimes afflicts this type of brasserie style restaurant ie hand-drizzled virgin oils with balsamic vinegars brewed by carefully selected Tuscan farmers etc

Visited on a regular basis over the years  standard and choice of food seems to have improved since we last visited  Word of caution  Sunday s can be a bit hectic because their carvery is very popular  So expect the service to be understandably a touch slower

Read the good reviews on TripAdvisor and thought this place had to be worth a try The reviews don t lie - tasty breakfast served on the biggest plate I ve ever seen Sausages and bacon were delicious and clearly well sourced everything cooked well and very friendly service

Went with a group of 9 ages fron1 to 85 easy to park and find a table Staff were helpful and sorted out the chairs for the youngsters  Some of us had the carvery which wes good had from the menu that also was very Google these tat has Te afters could not believe the huge portions Not high class food but very nice

We hadn t booked but managed to get squeezed in on what was clearly a busy night despite which the staff were friendly and helpful The atmosphere was very good a great clash of old English pub and bright Indian colours and fabrics and the food was excellent  both my starter and main were fresh tasty and well presented Only minor thing that let it down was my desert which was not very tiramisu-like at all

Jaipur Spice is a very sound choice for a curry  The menu was very broad and featured all the old favourites and many dishes I d not heard of  Food was good Tasty sauce and meat well cooked  I d go back
Enjoyed excellent quality food in this charming cafe The staff were friendly and the service was brisk  We particularly enjoyed the quirky mugs and furniture

This is a small bar with a area for sitting outside It is part of the station so if you want to leave it late before you get on your train or didn t enjoy your journey and need a drink this bar is ideally situated Because of this the bar can be quite busy and you pay a premium for its location  The bar is well stocked and the bar staff seem quite well trained  The decor is quite decadent with dark colours and leathers If you can find a table it is a nice place to spend some time

Whilst on a short break to Lincoln the pub was recommended to us for very good food We were not disappointed The premises were very cosy with an extensive menu and good service This year it was runner up in the taste of excellence competition run by Lincolnshire Life magazine  A visit is recommended if in the area

Arranged to meet up with a friend for a catch up somewhere near us both and we decided on Ashiana Indian Restaurant Having driven past many times but never gone in Lovely restaurant and staff are very welcoming - left us to peruse the menus at our leisure and in no way felt hurried  Restaurant in nicely decorated spacious and laid out nicely Waiters were very helpful polite and courteous Food selection was as expected from an Indian Restaurant however they need to revisit their menu spelling - quite a lot of spelling mistakes on it we employ a copywriter if you want us to sort it out - bit of a sales plug there   Food was very tasty and enjoyable not over spiced - although garlic naan was a shade too dry But that is my taste  Overall  Location = Great Service = Great Food = Great Menu = As Expected - please sort your spellings out   Will be back again in the near future for more of your great food Thanks

Tucked away at the top end of Portobello Road a nice choice for informal eating and drinking The atmosphere is nice and relaxed and they were playing great music when we visited Pizzas seem very authentic Italian-style sides were all good as well although presentation could have been better - not really a big deal though Prices were reasonable for Notting Hill Good for couples with some nice small tables tucked into the window but plenty of space for bigger groups too

Whilst the Dog and Bear is basically a pub with accomodation it doesn t pretend to be anything else It is really annoying going to a pub that thinks it is a top restaurant and charges top restaurant prices without the service to go with Not the case at Dog & Bear Food was beautifully cooked service was excellent ambiance superb Price was very reasonable- less than 25 per head including wine A thoroughly pleasant evening
A nice welcome on a wet day in this traditional pub A good range of beers including a local brewery Although I didn t eat this time the food menu looks good
Good choice of food and beverages Catered well for latecomers from theatre with food being served till 11 45pm in the bar and some room service 24 7 Service little slow when busy

Newly refurbished Chapel in Dunster has been renovated into a light and attractive tea room offering a selection of teas coffee light lunches and cakes as well as selling affordably and reasonably priced art and craft items  The owners make it a friendly and welcoming environment and it offers something different from the other more traditional cafes in the village and i particularly enjoyed many an hour spent eating a brownie alongside with a cup of coffee while taking a sabbatical from work in Dunster I was particularly impressed with their willingness to improve their fayre and accomodate my partner by making gluten and dairy free cakes and bread Has wifi too  I wish Gareth and Jonny well in their new venture

Heard it had been re-branded so called in for a couple of drinks and a meal Not keen on being sat with ankle biters but they have a pleasant small section of tables for 2 Drinks very reasonably priced tried the Tetley Imperial which went down well Wife had the 12 oz Rump which was cooked perfectly to order I had the big Mixed Grill and thoroughly enjoyed it Food ordering point was a bit of a bottleneck only 1 till so the queue was a bit long luckily the front of house guy warned us that there were a few large bookings at the same time as us and advised us to order 10 mins earlier than planned Seemed like a new girl on the till so was a bit slow but hey everyone has to learn Staff were great going back at the weekend

I went for the 27 50 set menu with my family The portions were small-ish as expected and the food was mostly up to the standard All the sides and the starters were really nice I however couldn t finish my fillet steak I opted for as I m not a very big fan of anything else than meat i e connective tissue and other grotty bits  Also I was a bit disappointed with the waiting we had to do between meals and when asking for drinks The waiter forgot to bring us water we asked for so after 30 minutes of waiting we asked for it again as we were not sure if this was part of the normal waiting or just being forgotten about again The Chelsea Steakhouse feels a bit cramped but the decor and overall ambience is nice The service received was nice as well eventually when we got it I d probably not go there again but wouldn t advise against it either

First visit to York and the boys on the counter were friendly and interesting to talk to while we waited for our cod n chips Food was as good as it can get Would absolutely recommend both the food and good company

Great service and selection of dishes You will feel welcome from the very first moment  The food is good and lands in your table within a reasonable amount of time Did I say the service is great Well I mean it

Great for a mini celebration - we opted for a Lobster with salad and Champagne offer which was lovely and very reasonably priced Very popular and could feel a little cramped at times Staff were very attentive without being intrusive and service was just right The price of wine by the glass was rather steep though which meant we didn t stay for drinks and dessert afterwards There is clearly a balance to be struck between the offer and other items on the menus
Accomodated 16 of us on a busy evening Lots of choice and plenty for the kids as well Food and drink excellent but service a bit slow as it was busy and we were a large group
Proper old school pub but with a moderm twist Loved the decor very art deco meets the shining merts titanic  Good choice of drinks and good service

The three of us ate here before seeing Hamlet Excellent and worth seeing  Food was very good and the service was attentive and helpful Only slight issuette we were not given a window seat and were told that these were allocated on a first come first served basis When we arrived there were a number of tables empty but we couldn t have one  I used a booking app to get the table and there was no option for getting the window seat Small thing though otherwise good

Having decided to do a roadtrip into Lincolnshire I decided to base myself at Kirton in Lindsey as it was convenient for the area I would be exploring I also needed a place to stay at and chose The George  I was not disappointed The staff were very helpful and polite The en-suite room which was spotless on arrival was well furnished and very comfortable Although I was out during the day the cooked breakfasts in the mornings were very good as were the evening meals and I never had to wait too long for any of the food Also the fact that I did some late-night socialising with fellow members of a car owners group meant that the fact I could come and go as I pleased was a bonus Overall a very nice B&B and bar  restaurant in a nice village in Lincolnshire that I would certainly consider staying at and eating at again in the future if the chance came my way

Cotto is run and cooked for by Schweitzer the chef who founded the more famous Midsummer House now with two Michelin stars  The food in my view is better than Midsummer House The restaurant opens only for dinner Wednesdays to Saturdays You pay 60 for a three-course set meal  65 on Saturdays  Each course is beautifully imagined and executed for example to begin a pheasant breast served with winter vegetables in a vegetable soup or a herb risotto teamed with scallops in a delicate foamy sauce My main course included two sorts of pork cheek and fillet each perfectly cooked with various accompaniments and a sauce generously flavoured with truffle For the final course one cannot do better than try the chef s chocolates which are several classes above anything else one will ever sample The setting of the restaurant is undemonstrative but pleasant - though a bit stuffy if the evening is hot and the room is full The service when we went two years ago was in my view too laid back but a fortnight ago it was excellent - friendly but efficient and polite Why not five stars then The wine list is the biggest drawback The restaurant seems uninterested in wines and it offers a series of very ordinary bottles at extraordinary prices - 40 for a bottle that would cost you 8 in a supermarket but which if you had sense you wouldn t choose there You would need to pay about 60 - 80 to buy anything decent and even then the bottles on offer which we didn t taste at these prices are too young and not distinguished With one of the cheaper wines and coffee and adding something for service one should expect to pay 80-90 per head So a place for the rich or for very special occasions and when one is willing to concentrate on the food - which is as good as almost anywhere I have eaten even in France - and forget about the wine
We ve been to Esteban several times for family birthdays our two daughters love it We always receive a warm welcome the waiting on staff can t do enough to help
Staying overnight in town I just fancied a curry This was the Nearest to the hotel but absolutely hit the spot Service was friendly and efficient The food was well spiced and tasty

Went on the Saturday before Valantines day As always the staff were very friendly  We had the pressed rabbit and the pate off the specials board as starters  We both wanted something simple so I choose the burger and my wife choose the steak and kidney pie  Slightly disappointed that the pie did not come with potato s which were extra as both meal s were just a little too expensive for what we got  No complaints about the quality though

We stayed in West Lulworth for a week in August 2013 and ate here 4 times It was interesting trying the cider but after about 6 different ciders I realised actually I ve never liked cider so I went back on the beer I think I had 4 different meals and each one was good All the family including two teenagers enjoyed the food and we are all vegetarians The staff were very friendly and could not have done more for us The food took longer that I expected but that gave us a chance to catch up on emails and Facebook with the free wi-if Nice to have dogs welcome but at no time did any of them get in the way
Another good meal at Marco Polo however we would have liked it more if the bread had been free and the limoncello wasn t

Myself and 4 friends visited The Flying Fox on Saturday for a social catch up It s clear to see the pub has recently had a face lift as things looked very different from the last time we came in a positive fashion However the menu was still the same and I m getting rather bored of the same pies and beers on the menu  Our waitress was lovely and very attentive but our favourite waiter seems to have left the pub which we are gutted about Flying fox hold on to the good ones  My friends and I look forward to heading back soon for hopefully another lovely time
Nice country pub with helpful staff in the heart of Witlshire Children and dogs welcomed We ordered food as soon as the restaurant opened but despite this the food was great

Beautifully laid out Really well considered product & produce Lunch it s self was simple great value well presented and tasty The staff were equally as well considered well presented and very welcoming Loved it Will be back

Food was great nice strong taste and for a tapas restaurant the portion sizes were generous Only thing was it was noisy too loud to talk the place had been designed without giving any thought to sound absorption

Had hoped to go to our usual choice but found they had run out of Sunday Roast had been walking past when we noticed the Cat was open for food wow spot on Sunday dinner with full flavour will visit again next time as first choice excellent all round Yet another bonus nice friendly service

Went for lunch last Sunday and by the number of people present thought this a good sign  We plumped for the carvery and were not disappointed A good choice of meats and vegetables I chose the beef and pork both cooked just right my wife the turkey which she said was perfect The vegetables were on the firm side which is much better than being over cooked Altogether a pleasant meal in a friendly busy restaurant

Apologies for the cliched title but this tapas bar cocked down the far end of Columbia Road in Shoreditch really does qualify as a hidden gem So many tapas bars in London churn out the same old microwaved rubbish it isn t true but at Laxeiro the food is freshly cooked on site and seldom do any of the dishes disappoint in terms of quality There s nothing particularly out of the order on the menu and the place itself has the feel of a cafe but the food is what defines it It s excellent and well worth a visit Probably best to avoid when the flower market s open cos it ll be heaving
Fantastic food company service and location The staff were efficient and the beer was good and a very pleasant evening was had by all

We have tried several cafes in Skipton with mixed results This one is the only one we feel inclined to return to again The food was lovely the decor bright and the staff friendly and helpful The menu choice was quite good and the tea plentiful The only reason I haven t given a five out of five is because another smalll group of customers had a very long wait for their food something other reviewers have noted I would definitely recommend a visit for their full English breakfast

We decided to try Kin Dee after another restaurant was full I m very glad we did  We were there quite early in the evening so the restaurant was quite quiet inside The decor was clean and tidy if not spectacular and background music inoffensive Table staff were very welcoming  Our meal consisted of tom kha gai calamari jungle curry and one other i can t remember the name of  they were all delicious chilli and spices were well balanced and definitely had the flavours of Thailand  Its been a while since I ve posted a review but i feel this place deserves some recognition for serving such delicious food which I felt was authentic and good value for money We ll be back

After having recently got back from the Caribbean I was missing the food so chose here during a visit to Bristol I d pre-booked a table as I d heard it was almost essential due to the place being so popular It was certainly packed when we went there This was done by filling in a simple form on their website and they call back to confirm The service was quick friendly and accurate and the food spot on If you want to dine early you also have the advantage of 2 for 1 cocktails between 6pm and 7pm  All in a very enjoyable visit though the bill was more eye-watering than the sauce  Keep an eye on your tally and you ll have a good night

Me and my family came here for my brothers birthday and had a very enjoyable experience  For an all you can eat  the food was very good quality very nice and the staff were also very friendly and nice  Couldn t ask for much more really

Well worth seeking out Authentic fresh and tasty italian food Reasonably priced in a nice atmosphere All pizzas pasta and meat dishes we have tried are top notch Gets regular return visits from many of the locals like us which is always a good sign  If you are in the area and in the mood for italian food then sizzlers is a great choice

Went here Friday and I was very impressed  I normally find buffets tacky rushed and canteeny so I was looking forward to seeing what this place was like As a buffet but order 2 table rather than the usual aroma east kind of places  Its around 15 for as much as you can want to eat the choice for starters was very good the usual prawn toast amazing aromactic duck won tons calamri  BBQ Ribs and seaweed etc we pretty much ordered everything get your moneys worth  There was 7 of us and we had plenty between us we even ordered more   The mains were to pretty decent good choice of chicken duck pork and beef dishes Can easily get bloated here Maybe the mains could do with a few more unique dishes I would say though  The desert was pretty average though just bland vanilla ice cream with NO SYROP  would of preferred a bit of choice on the deserts and some strawberry sauce  Drinks are good usual tiger etc shame not a Chinese beer on tap mind  However only disappoint I would say was they way they served the JAGER  not right and not cheap either  Overall I would definitely recommend this place if want a good choice of Chinese food and a reasonable price staff are nice to

We popped in for lunch on a rainy day Found thus delightful cafe on TripAdvisor Ranked one if the best cafs in Brighton Lived up to the reviews We had delicious wraps   tasty fresh unusual and healthy Couldn t recommend it enough  Lovely staff Good coffee Helpful at every turn You have to go and enjoy
